Reviews.Title: “A Hyatt at the Top of Their Game”
Reviews.Author: cathyd
Reviews.Content: We received a two night reward from Hyatt and chose this property to redeem the nights at. About a week before our check-in date we received a welcoming email from the hotel's concierge desk. They asked if we had any special requests. I took the opportunity to ask for a high floor room with a view toward Disney in order to watch their fireworks. I received a note back stating that we would get a room as requested. Check-in was a breeze with uber-friendly staff and we did indeed get a room on the 10th floor (Room 1061) overlooking the pool area with a great view of EPCOT for the evening fireworks. Yes, they do charge a resort fee, but we got a discount for being Platinum members. The lobby is beautifully decorated with live plants and flowers (as are the gardens surrounding the entire property), waterfalls, and a live parrot. The resort fee covers wi-fi and wired internet service, the pool area, the fitness center, all kinds of non-motorized boats at the lake, a small family-friendly golf area, and self-parking. Our room was absolutely gorgeous with upscale amenities (different than what you get at a Hyatt Place), very comfortable king size bed, a small couch, desk, flat screen tv, coffee service, and a large bathroom with a large glass-enclosed shower with a rainshower head. All the staff throughout the property were friendly and always greeted us. We did not eat at any of the restaurants on the property. Breakfast each morning was at a nearby Dunkin Donuts that was an easy walk (all on sidewalk). Would highly recommend the nearby Joe's Crab Shack for the best crab legs around. Very unique place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Wedding Story”
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: I went here for a family wedding with so many people I didn't even know who half of them were. The rooms were really nice as with the pool. I want to start off with the pool area because it's really amazing to swim in. There is a "hot tub cave" where a hot tub is under the rock ledge tucked in the corner. Also, there is plenty of water falls for the kids to enjoy the pool. There's a bar at the pool, snack shack, and a few other nice amenities. Overall I had a blast the atmosphere was up-scale and effervescent decorations, along with some talking birds, I'm not sure if they still have them. However, the staff was on edge all the time almost acting like they're pissed your asking them a question when they have better things to do. I don't mean to be a hassle it's my first time there no need to be hostile about asking about what to do in town for fun. Anyways, theres a better place called wilderness lodge on disney property. AMAZINGLY AWESOME check out the wilderness lodge and try to find the hidden mickeys!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Reg Grand Cypress, has all there is to have”
Reviews.Author: Zherpesen
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, resort, clean nice room, excellent restaurants, smiling staff, absolutely perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: My husband, I, and our 3 children, (ages 5,3, and 2) just got back from a 10 day stay and we LOVED it! Let me start off by saying their is nothing "sneaky" about the way the hotel charges you. We had some questions about the resort fees etc. and not only did a sales manager email me the breakdown, he also called my to follow up, just ask, they are happy to help! I also had a lot of help from the front desk. I prepaid for our trip back in Feb, and they were very patient while I called my bank to let the transaction go thru. The resort is GORGEOUS! Check in was a breeze, and we got complimentary champagne, as well as buckets and shovels for the kids. We got into our room 2 hrs early. We requested a higher up room, and not only got the 16th floor, but a pool view, which we did not pay the extra for! A couple hours after we arrived I received a gift basket with milk and cookies, coldcuts, and beach goodies, with a lovely card as their "BEST" facebook fan! That's how much they pay attention to their guest! All the staff was so super friendly! Front desk, concierge, housekeeping, bellhops..without being the least bit pushy. The housekeepers even made a pint of arranging my daughters dolls in different spots while we were out. Rooms were immaculate. Beds were comfy. Loved the toiletries! Asked for an extra lotion, and they gave me 3! Pool is the most amazing pool I have ever seen! There are 3 total pools. A quiet pool, a big pool, and a smaller pool. The smallest one is heated, so we used it mostly. There is a small slide that my youngest loved. The big pool has a big slide, and is so much fun! My kids also loved the bridge! There are caverns that you can swim under, and several hot tubs. We had no problem finding chairs, there are hundreds of lounge chairs, I have no idea why people complained about that. The property is so pretty to walk thru! I took tons of pictures of just the palm trees and flowers! The walking trails along the lakes are very nice as well. We did not do any of the water activities because our kids were too young, but they looked like fun! They had planned activites for kids during the day, as well as campfires on certain evenings. Beach is not suitable for swimming, buy my kids loved to play in the sand. There were alot of conferences going on, but I did not think that interfered with our stay at all. The lobby was very loud in the evening, but I did not hear a thing from inside our room. The conference rooms are on the far side of the hotel, the only time in really interferes is when you cross thru that part of the lobby from the parking lot, but you can also use the entrance around the pool. Parking is 11 dollars a night, but even after you factor in the parking fees and resort fees, we still paid 3000 dollars less, then we would of at the Beach club resort at disney, which we had originally looked at. Only thing we ate at hotel was calamari from Palm cafe and it was delicious! Food and drinks are pricey, but so is every restaurant at Disney, and you are minutes away from about 75 places to eat. Only con I had was the shuttle schedule. Departure times did not work at all if you stay open to close at parks, so we drove every park day, but it was off season. Wasn't a big deal. This was the nicest place I have ever stayed! Even beat out our Hawaii resort! I will def stay here again! P.s. We miss you Merlot!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for someone who stays on property during their visit”
Reviews.Author: HorseVMK
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress was nice, but it could use some renovating, especially to the pool area. The staff at the front desk was friendly and knowledgeable. Housekeeping did a great job in my room. Service at the restaurant, Cascade, was attentive. I liked the room decor. The towels should be more luxurious. They were like what a Hyatt Place or basic level hotel chain would offer. The KenetMD toiletries were wonderful. The rooms can be noisy from the sounds coming from other floors which all open to the lobby's atrium. I woke up a few times during the night due to that. The food at breakfast and lunch at Cascade was mediocre. Pricey for the quality. The resort fee should just be included in the cost of the room since it is a mandatory fee. I didn't find the fee justified. Some activities had additional charges. The pool area looked like it had seen better days. The bicycles, climbing wall, boats, and poolside bar didn't "wow" me. There are only two buses that go to WDW and it only goes to the Transportation and Ticket Center in Magic Kingdom. From there you use Disney transportation to all 4 parks. The buses leave the Hyatt at 8:50am and 10am. They return 6pm, 8pm, 9:45pm, and 11:15pm. I found this extremely limited compared to other area hotels. It appeared that the exterior of the hotel was getting painted during my stay, so affected rooms could not access their balconies. Also, the fitness center was closed for remodeling. Overall, my stay was good. The hotel is better than most of the others in the Downtown Disney area. However, I can think of at least two other hotels I would prefer to stay at when visiting WDW, but staying off Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “4 days on a working trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaWilliam
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at a conference in Orlando at the Hyatt where we had booked one of the remote conference rooms on the property. we had the need for 30 wifi user at one time as there was training sessions on some new software.The hotel provided all the connections and was very responsive to any additional request. We also had them provide breakfast and lunch at the conference room and it was probably some of the best food the I have had as it was fresh and hot and I was even able to get it without mangos or papayas(glazes,dry fruit)as I am allergic. I thanked the food services staff as I only had to let them know 1 time that I was allergic and each day they informed me of what contained mangos and papayas and either brought me a different dish or the dish minus the fruit. The Hotel staff were great and provide the little things that you might forget or cannot carry on board your flight(toothpaste, deodorant,etc). even if you don't know what you want to do just ask the valet guys and they can give you a list of things to do places to eat and go. If it was a question on the room the front desk staff cleared it up in a matter of minutes. The cleaning staff kept my room clean and all I had to do was leave a little note for extra coffe and it was there each day. It is a short walk to other food places if you don't want to eat at the hotel but there are about 7 different restaurants inside the hotel. so if you are heading for Orlando and looking for a good place to have a meeting as we did or just visit I would recommend the Hyatt Grand Cypress.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris50Boston
Reviews.Content: This hoptel is exceptional in every way. Great location, everything about the hotel was perfect, the room, the service, the food.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay just as nice”
Reviews.Author: UofMgirl
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress is a beautiful hotel. The lobby is spacious, with flowing water , flowers, and a friendly parrot. On our first trip last year, we were lucky enough to get a room with a view of the pool and Disney fireworks at night. This year not so lucky, just parking lot and tops of stores. The pool is great, complete with small rock grottos perfect for napping to the sound of the waterfalls. Food is expensive-$8 for a hot dog poolside. They now charge for parking nightly in addition to the resort fee. However, bikes, kayaks, and beach area included. The grounds are nice, perfect for an early morning bike ride. Bellman showed us how to log in and get free wi-fi so that was a plus. Location is prime-walking distance to downtown Disney, short drive to many restaurants and attractions, not to mention the Premium Outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Short Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sun03
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - very close to Downtown Disney. So much to do on property, water bikes, kayaks, regular biking, rock wall, chip and putt golf, regular golf, fantastic pool complex. Balcony was not usable. Shower had only a half wall - so the bathroom got wet easily. Breakfast buffet was good but pricey, lot of other options close by - off property

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: ETM06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September and had a great time. It's close to Disney about 5 miles or less away. You can see the fireworks from Epcot at nigtht. Our daughter is 5 and just loved the pools and waterslides. I would recommed getting the buffett breakfast included in your stay if you can-we did for two adults. The restaurants was a bit expensive but the breakfast buffett was really good. Ironcially the poolside food service wasn't as high as you would have thought excep for the bar drinks... those were outrageous. A small "drink of the day" was $14 in a plastic cup but the service around the pool was good and constant. We met many nice families while we stayed the week. We made sure we were poolside every other day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: KymTracey
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property, very close to Disneyworld and all the Orlando parks & entertainment. Lots to do on property whithout the crazyness of a ton of people at Disney properties. Had a great view of the Magic Kingdom Fireworks each night from the widow in the hallway on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Resort Feel, Stylish Remodel, and Good Jumping Off Point for Disney”
Reviews.Author: bugdocsea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort on a non-holiday week and had a wonderful stay. Grounds are amazing with incredible jogging, biking, and walking trials, beautiful landscaping. Nice amenities at the resort (good tennis, golf, recreational activities for the kids, pools, etc.). Rooms were recently remodeled and very stylish and comfortable. Food at hemmingway's very good, palm court good for lunch, cascade restaurant was so so at best. A few downsides - yes, it is expensive, but I found myself less nickled and dimed with paying the resort fee (includes internet, activities for kids, etc.). Staff at pool / activities could have been more enthusiastic. Kids activities planned on the hour, and would start by a staff member yelling in a megaphone over the pool "activity starting now". They did little to round up kids or create enthusiasm, and the activities were without much fanfare and quite short. Overall staff seemed a bit "over it".

Reviews.Title: “Great pools, activities”
Reviews.Author: Sforeman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for spring break, and had a great time. The grounds are beautiful, three pools and three hot tubs plus kayaks, canoes and paddle boats (no sailboats) added up to lots to do! The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The Regency Club is well worth the extra money. Breakfast had plenty of varied choices each day (including pancakes, bagels, cold cereal, oatmeal, croissants, fruit, yogurt), and the "snacks" at night were incredible. Filet mignon, shrimp, crab claws, potstickers . . . we didn't buy dinner one night. Wine, beer and liquor was reasonable, and 12 th floor space with patio was great. Drinks by the pool, however, were ridiculously overpriced. Food was reasonable and good quality in all restaurants property. Shuttles to Sea World/Discovery Cove were not convenient, so be prepared to either cab it or rent a car (Discovery Cove, by the way, was incredible and well worth the money). Housekeeping was an issue, but quickly and cheerfully rectified. Spa pedicure was great.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: nolemomma
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here over spring break/Easter and our stay had several highs but also several lows. On the positive side... the grounds, pools, and facilities are gorgeous. Three pools with one designated "kiddie pool" with a "kiddie slide", another bigger slide (scary even for some grownups), caves, grotto bar, huge lobby, restaurants, lake, biking, golf.... everything you could want. We loved the Easter egg hunt provided by the staff for our two boys. The Magic Kingdom fireworks from our room were great. Short drive to Epcot (probably 10-15 minutes door to door). Clean and attractive room. Our boys loved paddle boating, riding bikes, running along the trails, and the pitch and putt golf. Personal preference on this... the location was "too commercial" for me. I know some people love to be right in the mix so those people would love this location. Lots of restaurants and touristy shops nearby... close to the outlets and Publix (although anticipate TONS of traffic delays). On the negative side: the pool area was TOOO crowded and extremely dirty. I know it was at capacity but I think the staff really should have done a better job with maintenance. One day there was actually feces all over the floor in the boys pool bathroom. Disgusting! My other big complaint is the price gouging. Having stayed at Hyatts on business before I've seen this done.... but this hotel is clearly for families and charging $11 for a yogurt parfait is just wrong. $11 for a small bowl of chips and salsa? Tip: get your towels on a few chairs at 8:00am SHARP if you want a chaise by a pool. So, I had mixed feelings. We really did enjoy our stay but I think we may go elsewhere next time we're in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel...the grounds are wonderful...the people are the best...and the rooms have been redone.....this is one of the best hotels ever...and so close to Disney...you can watch the fireworks out of your window!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise minus the fees! Will be back though”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: I thought the staff, atmosphere, and activities were spectacular!!! We had a beautiful view of the GORGEOUS pool- waterfalls, hot tubs, and water water water, oh my!! Tropical Gardens, beaautiful art, and awesome activities for me and my husband as well as my 10 year old! We watched the Disney Magic Kingdom fireworks from our balcony. We bought a smores pack and enjoyed them at the open pit fire. We rode bikes, took out the kayaks, swam in the enormous pool and the kids loved the rockwall. We had room service, which was very good and the server was excellent. I was not expecting the extra fees at the end of the stay- $22 per day for activities and $11 per day for parking. When I book a hotel I do so beacuse of the amennities....so why wouldn't that be in the price per night. Just show the price as it is ....people will still come. Make me happy and refund the money!

Reviews.Title: “Back Again - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nan5049
Reviews.Content: We've been to this hotel several times during the past 20 years, and have enjoyed our experience. Going during spring break/Easter season meant that the hotel was at capacity and there was a shortage of chairs at the pool, but staff held up well, and delivered services at the level expected. The property is lovely, and we took advantage of the bicycling and kayaks on the grounds. I had not previously done the 1-mile Audubon nature walk, a level boardwalk through a cypress swamp easily accessible by the paved bike trails. The breakfast buffet was wonderful, with lots of delicious selections and freshly squeezed OJ served at the table. We also took advantage of the Disney shuttle, which was efficient getting us to the transportation center. Yes, we were unhappy about paying to self-park on top of the resort fee. Shortly before our arrival, the Sushi operation moved into the White Horse sports bar. The offerings were delicious, but the restaurant needs to establish a clear identity compatible with the ambience. One final comment. Despite the crowds, I never heard noise from hallway or other rooms, and have no idea how they achieved that level of soundproofing. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Service fee, downfall”
Reviews.Author: Roseline B
Reviews.Content: This trip was so much more expensive than I planned for. I booked the trip on Orbitz, and compared to a lot of other booking sites I found this one great because we could book the last day free, if we stayed for 5 or more. So we did that. However, while the rates look great for what you're getting I strongly suggest you look into it. For instance, we booked for 169 a night (during Easter week). I thought this to be excellent, because the grounds are quite beautiful and even though the hotel was packed, there were 3 huge pools and plenty of seating and lounge chairs for everyone. Most other hotels were 10 or 15 dollars more for the same thing, so we went with this one. When we got to the hotel, we were dissappointed to find that the valet parking was 23 dollars a night. We chose to park ourselves in the self-parking lot (which was quite a hike from our room). But, to our dismay, the self parking is charged to your room as well. 11 dollars a day to park at a hotel. This was horrible, to waste 55 dollars for nothing. Also, there is a 22 dollar a day fee for using the hotel amentities. They have row boats, and water activities, and somehow they get away with charging 22 dollars a day for these, without allowing you to deny these services. My kids barely used them, so I feel like it was a waste. If you add that up, you see this hotel really charges 200 dollars a night easily (and this is for the smallest most basic room with 2 very small double beds) I cant imagine upgrading to any other room. Everything else in the hotel is expensive as well. The food by the pool is ridiculously over charged, and 2 drinks by the pool cost my husband nearly 25 dollars, plus tax and tip. We felt like we were broke by day 2. We never used room serivce because of the price. Another mistake we made was going to the Sunday Brunch. We were told on arrival by the bell hop, that the sunday brunch was fantastic and was something that we could not miss. However, it was small and once again extremely over priced. 24 dollars a person for eggs and bacon, mediorcre at best. With tax, once again it was over 100 dollars for my family to eat breakfast. Yes, the grounds were beautiful, and the pools spacious however I feel like this hotel is ripping people off with their booking rates. I am not hard for cash, and normally I would never complain but I want families to know what theyre getting themselves into. If you're looking to save money, this is not the place for you to enjoy. There is a service charge and fee for EVERYTHING. Our bill was so expensive when we checked out, and we barely did anything at the resort itself. We went here because we thought it would be a great deal, however we paid more than double than what we thought we would. I have so many regrets about this place, and feel like I was taken advantage of. No matter how nice the grounds our, these prices are uncalled for.

Reviews.Title: “Business turned pleasure--LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Riley T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the MOST AMAZING I've ever been to! The location is PERFECT, YET YOU FEEL LIKE YOU'RE ON A SECLUDED ISLAND! The service is EXCELLENT & the amenities are awesome. My husband and I are SERIOUSLY looking into seeing if they offer vacation timeshares. We love this place and we'll be back for a family vacation for sure! We stayed on the 15th fl with a gorgeous view of the pool & lake. We watched the Magic Kingdom fireworks show from our balcony every night!! Clearly, I love this place--worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: MBRA538
Reviews.Content: Only got to stay one night but would like to go back for a longer time. Beautiful grounds, pool and hot tubs are incredible. Rooms very nice, great bed, nice showers. First class hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but has its shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: LondonDeeM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week. The good points of the hotel were the amenities it offers - nice pool, lake with paddling boats, canoe, cycling and 9 hole pitch and putt. Although we used the facilities a bit, didn't use them enough to justify the US$22/day resort fee. The primary reason why we chose the hotel was to be close to Disney and as we were spending whole days at the theme parks, there was never enough time to enjoy what the hotel had to offer. The other downside was extremely small double beds - we had taken a room with two double beds - although the size was OK for kids, it was not comfortable for 2 adults to sleep on. The prices at the restaurant are quite steep so we didn't eat at the hotel any of the days. If it is your first trip to Orlando and Disney, would not recommend staying at the hotel as you would be paying for things which you may never end up using, and you can get better value at other hotels. If you are going to be spending a lot of time at the hotel and use it as a resort and don't mind paying the high prices of the food and drinks, would recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hideway and near all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Crookednation
Reviews.Content: I spwnt a week at the Hyatt in orlando recently. One of my decisions to stay at this resort was the golf course and the pool. The golf is $50.00 after 3:30 Pm and the course abd club house is very nice. My son took lessons for a few days and really enjoyed the head instructor. The food and drinks available are real expensive. One mixed drink at the bar inside was $14.00. The sports bar is open in the late afternoon and has some great food choices. A few minor things that I want to bring up. the starbucks coffee is expensive at $4.00 a cup... but you get a free refill which isn't posted anywhwere. I bougth a few cups each morning and the last day I heard the girl working tell a customer you receive a free refill. The pool was nice but you need to get down to the pool early each morning to save yourself a nice spot. there is a sign that states your belonings would be moved if you were not in your spot between a certain time but this was never enforced. Overall this is a nice spot for familys with kids. You are close to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Hotel very secluded near Hotel Alley”
Reviews.Author: TB B
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 Star Hotel! Everything about this hotel is First Class. The hotel lobby is open for 18 floors looking up to skylight and glass enclosed elevators. The property includes 3 pools including one the goes thru a cave into the next pool with waterfalls dumping into the pool from every angle. Property also has a large lake with white sand beached and paddle boats etc for families to borrow. Also there is a nice little 9 hole Pitch & Put course that our kids loved. The gardens are everywhere and meticulously cared for. Location is within 5 miles from everything a family might want to do in the Disney / Universal / Sea World area of Orlando. The rooms are basic, remodelled and clean. Hotel staff supported anything we needed. Not much of a Consierge desk available to guests - only a small area where 2 people we trying to sell tickets to the nearby attractions. Unless you wanted ticket to a park or dinner show, you were on your own. One of the best restaurants we dined at was at this hotel - Cascades. Every meal there was excellent!. And the restaurant staff always went out of there way to make sure everything we needed was done. We booked via expedia at a very good rate for this type hotel but there we some added fees - $11/nt for self parking and $22/day Hotel Service Fee (which covered everything you might need at the hotel - internet, paddleboat rental, pitch n putt, use of tennis courts, use of microwave for reheating food, free filtered water machines and many other features -- overall we felt the fee was worth it since the rest of the time we never felt like hotel was nickel & diming us). Overall this is an excellent resort hotel hidden right in the middle of Disney. We will go back whenever we want to go to the Carribean but don't want to pay for the 3x airfare of flying to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great!! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Rebsar17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 6-8, 2012. We loved the rooms and the grounds. I loved that they had the boats and bikes to use. We used the kayaks, water bikes and paddle boats. We also rode bikes around the property. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The rooms are beautiful! We didn't eat there but loved everything else about it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: barbbel
Reviews.Content: We just got back (April 2012) from 6 days at the Grand Cypress. We got a great deal on the rooms. As we arrived they had champagne for us, which was a nice treat after a long ride....and the kids loved the macaw in the lobby (Merlot) and said hello to him every day! The room was on the small side- but met our needs. We loved the shower in our room and the pool view was great! We especially loved watching the fireworks each night from our room! The heated pool was nice- we wished all the pools were heated as the heated one was closed down due to "cleaning" on 2 of our days. We took advantage of all the resort had to offer....we went bicycling, took out a canoe and paddle boat, went in the hot tub, and laid in the hammocks! My husband even got a massage at the spa! I do have to say getting a pool chair was hard since the hotel was busy- and the food and drinks poolside were expensive! Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Grand Cypress and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Great Staff but Very Noisy & Left Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: buntyt33
Reviews.Content: I know this is a long review but please stuck with it. For a long time I have intended to stay at The Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress ment as I always liked the look, location & The Hyatt brand and so on The 6th of March my family & I fulfilled my wish when we castayed for 15 nights but I am terribly sorry to say we left very disappointed. I am glad to start on a positive note and say that the courtesy & help we received from the front of house staff was excellent; from The Check-In desk & Bell-Hops to The Concierge and Pool/Leisure Club staff. They really seemed to enjoy their work and their smiles showed this! A huge Thank You to them all!! The ground and public areas of the hotel are wonderful and it was great to be able to walk and cycle around the property. Merlot,(The Macaw) was a star and I hope the cockatoo is well soon! After a very welcome glass of bubbly during check-in we were shown to our rooms; I did think it a bit strange that despite being a family group; one member of whom is handicapped and has limited mobility, we were not in adjoining rooms; I did enquire about this and was told there were no rooms available at the time but as soon there were we would be told. We never were but that wasn’t a huge issue just a bit of an inconvenience. My room was a good size with the most fabulous view (Thank You Steve Ballot) across to Downtown Disney & Epcot beyond, but it just seemed a tad unkempt and as if it hadn’t been prepared properly. Sadly my first impressions were correct as not only was I missing towels, toiletries etc. when I went to store items in the safe I found a bag full of condoms (unopened luckily!) Q-Tips and other personal items. On the way for a well-earned beer in The White horse I stopped by the main desk and told them of my find! AMANDA and offered to move me but after 20 hours of travelling and having unpacked I didn’t really relish the prospect. Kindly they offered me breakfast for two of my group the next day which was an appreciated gesture. The feeling of lack of care & standards were also evident in my Mother’s room which not only was missing bedding, towels etc there was no bedside light (The lighting in the room was poor) We later discovered the inner voile on the window was missing; this left you with a choice of having the curtains drawn, with no privacy or complete darkness.The design of the hotel meant you were very overlooked. Sadly the lack of service became apparent during the course of our stay; the rooms never really seemed to be cleaned properly. It was hit or miss if toiletries would be replenished, trash emptied; indeed I had to inform house-keeping that my room had not been vacuumed for 5 days! Who knows how long it would have gone without being done if I hadn’t let them know. When you are staying at what is billed as “a Luxury Resort” & a Hyatt to boot you do expect a certain standard and while we had no problem paying the daily resort fee one would have expected at least a bottle of water in the room to use in the coffee maker – which I have to say was quite useless & leaked everywhere! We did know advance of our stay that there was going to be some repainting of the property however we were shocked at the level of noise form this work, which could be heard everywhere. I understand that most people staying are either out all day at one of the parks or attending conference but it was impossible to have a lie-in (it started at 0830 and included weekends!) or simply relax in your room; I can only describe the constant drilling as being held captive in a dental surgery. I lost count of the number of guests I heard complaining to staff about this issue. Hardly conducive for a relaxing vacation! The "gangs" of chino-clad conventioneers roamed the corridors and public areas at all times so if you have an adversity to lanyards, polo shirts & people shouting at each other maybe best to avoid this place! Having returned from the park one day My Mother was horrified to find the door to her room wide open. It would appear that one of the chambermaids had left this open; we always made it routine to check the doors were closed properly upon leaving. We informed the Front Desk who said security would be up right away. After two hours of waiting no security had appeared and as it was getting near Midnight we checked nothing was missing & went to bed. Security did contact us the next day as we returned to voicemails informing us that the locks had been fixed as there appeared to a problem with them closing properly. The final sorry tale in this whole episode was when dirty towels were left in our bathroom. And when I say dirty towels I do not mean ones that we had used after bathing and were wet. These were from who-knows-where and I really don’t wish to dwell on what marks covered the WHITE bath sheet but we were disgusted. How on earth could this happen? I have never encountered this before – even when staying in the developing world. I wanted to Love The Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, I really did as I said at the start I came away very disappointed. Next time it's back to The Hard Rock or we will try The Hilton Bonnet Creek. I should also mentionThe Radisson nearby was half the price and the standards were better. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Paulaubrey
Reviews.Content: Fantastic ten day stay. Some of the drinks a little pricey and the service charge and parking add up but with the excellent service, food and surroundings you would expect of a Hyatt. Nice and close to Disney, Universal and Seaworld as well as the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of info on the ups and downs for you...”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel twice this year. The first trip was for a short mother/son trip with my 9 year old in late October. The hotel rooms were the perfect size for 1 and 3/4 people. The pool complex was beautiful (waterfalls, hot tubs tucked inside of caves, rope bridges and waterslides) but only one tiny pool was heated to just about 80ish degrees. Burr, but doable. The other pools were not swimmable at all this time of year. I assumed that it would be too costly for the hotel to heat the whole pool complex over this cold, off season and didn’t worry too much about it. Plus, since it was off season, we didn’t have to share the little pool with many people so it was ok. Now, my second trip was not as simple and all the flaws became OBVIOUS. Please read on to see if these issues would play a role in your stay or not. The room: The attractive, 2 dbl bed room type that seemed so nice for just my son and I was now shared with my husband, 5 year old daughter, my son and myself. First, the bathroom is, for lack of a better word, stupid. The shower has ½ a glass shower door with the other half of the shower WIDE open, leaving your rear end fully exposed if anyone dares open the door. There is no curtain or water speckled glass to hide you in all your glory, even a little. The toilet is also in this same space. This is not a big deal if one is traveling with thoughtful people willing to wait until the bathroom is vacant before using the toilet, but kids and husbands are not always that way. Imagine taking a shower and having your 9 year old say he needs to come in and go #2. Super! I hated this bathroom. Also, the bathroom door was a sliding door that slid between the bathroom and the closet. If I were doing something in the closet and someone wanted to go in the bathroom, the door would slide shut in front of the closet, kicking me out. Then, when they come out, the door would slide open to the bathroom again and shut on the closet again. Arg. A mom getting clothes together for herself and 2 kids (my husband is often able to dress himself) might need to be taken out of this room in favor of one with padded walls. Club Level: Total waste of money. I usually stay club level. We love the snacks and perks. Robes in the room, cocktails, treats in the evening. Not here. This hotel has the worst “club level”. No key card access to the floor, only to the “club” itself. The Hard Rock in Orlando (much more family friendly and upscale than other Hard Rock Hotels) has tons of options for breakfast and lots of pleasing sweets for young and old. The Grand Cypress, however, had few choices for breakfast. Snacks were often raw veggies and similar (yuck) and sweets were things like lemon bars and some sort of dark chocolate espresso thing that I can’t imagine anyone under the age of 40 liking. Cocktails were billed to your room – no complimentary (aka: included in the extra cost to get a club level room). Also, Grand Cypress rooms did NOT have bathrobes available to guests. (??) I’m not really understanding what the extra fee was for, maybe it was the very pricey broccoli. Restaurants: Other than the pool service, there were 3 restaurants we explored on property. Hemmingway’s. Very pretty, upscale. Good calamari soaked overnight in buttermilk or something. Steak was ok… not worth the almost 30 smackers. Cascades is the main, quick but still table service restaurant. They serve buffet breakfast in the morning. HOLY COW. Price for 2 adults and 2 kids was about $80/day – FOR BREAKFAST! Not to mention that one day the “chef” making waffles in the back, came out after 20 minutes to bring us our waffle holding it in his bare naked hands and dropped it on my plate. (gross.) One of the managers was so upset by this he kept giving us a little something here and there throughout our stay to make sure we were happy. Moral… Be polite and let them know about problems and this hotel does try very hard to accommodate your concerns. Good customer service here. BUT, too expensive and not great food… it was just alright. The third restaurant was White Horse. It says it is a sports bar and grill, but don’t try to get a burger or nachos here. It is only appetizers and sushi – not a single main course or anything that one could pretend is a main course. Not very sports bar like. If a restaurant could have an identity crisis, it would be this one. I hope one day it seeks out therapy because it looked nice enough to eat in, it just didn’t have much to eat. Pool: Oh, the worst. Yes… it is so pretty. So very, very lovely. But, our second trip was at spring break. Nice weather… hot, even. The hotel was at FULL capacity, but when booking this hotel again, I thought no worries the pool is so big, it will be fine. However, they only heated pool was AGAIN the little tiny pool… for ALL the spring break guests. Only a handful of brave people (probably from Alaska or one of the Poles) dared to swim in the non-heated pools – for a second. This hotel would have only had to heat the pools up a few degrees and with the hotel at full capacity, they should be able to afford it, but they just didn’t. (Cheap or poorly managed? I don’t know.) So, ALL the guests crammed into this one little pool… kids colliding, parents fighting for chairs close enough to watch kids without having to squeeze in themselves… ugh, the humanity. The beautiful pools are ONLY an asset to those traveling peak season when Florida has been scorching long enough to heat the pools naturally. If you are traveling off season or either shoulder season and you want to swim – GO TO ANOTHER HOTEL. Cost: You can get good deals you can get bad deals on rooms anywhere so let’s look at other charges. Room service – crazy. Cascades – reasonable *if you order off the breakfast menu* but the price for the breakfast buffet is pure insanity. Dinner was ok. Hemmingway’s is expensive. Pool service was the best value, but not cheap - but I have no regrets here. Good burgers and watermelon margaritas, too. Also, ALL guests should know that parking is an additional $17/dy unless you valet park, then it is $25/dy. Ouch. PLUS, you are charged about a $20something/dy resort fee on top of your room rate and the room taxes. These prices add up so fast that you can double your bill with all these sneaky, little charge here and there. Even the smores that you can make by the fire pit on weekend nights (This was fun!) cost $18 per kit. Bottom line: This hotel is a pretty hotel. If you get a cheap rate, don’t think you are going to avoid paying through the nose which is fine if you are expecting it. They are going to getcha if you aren’t. The pool is lovely, but only worthwhile when NATURALLY warm over peak season. There are nice amenities like the little beach by the pond and the paddle boats and activities for families like smores, but this hotel, despite its location, is clearly more focused on in and out business folks and convention visitors because they don’t have the family traveler in mind with regard to the design of the hotel, the rooms, the warmth of the pool, the price of the meals and the poolside activities for kids were so poorly executed even my young kids began to try to just tune them out. Final word: Because this hotel was sold out for part of the stay we stayed half of our trip at the Hard Rock. Not my first choice because of the reputation of the other Hard Rock hotels, but with the free express pass for both Universal parks and it’s walk to the park location, we thought we’d give it a try. This was a MUCH better experience and if you are interested in my comparison, please feel free to read my review of that hotel which I plan to write and post next. Wherever you stay in Orlando, enjoy your trip and I hope my review helps you in your planning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, awful traffic”
Reviews.Author: hopktown
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here to attend the wedding of a friend's son elsewhere in the Orlando area. Great resort, very nice amenities, attentive staff. I have no idea where some of the reviewers got their "dirty" comments from. The hours for the different restaurants seemed a little random, and we found it hard to get casual food within the self-contained complex at times. Yes, it takes awhile to walk from the hotel to the $11 a day self park area, but you get used to it. Tennis facilities were excellent and Lynn, the pro, is top notch and very attuned to the needs of a transient participant base. I-4 is a nightmare at all times of the day. Take the Google Maps estimate for what it takes to get anywhere around here, multiply that by two and a half, and you'll be in the ballpark. If we had to come back to the Orlando area, we would likely stay here, but I don't see that happening until we hit the grandparents' phase of life. Not sure why to come here otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, but can get costly”
Reviews.Author: GreatLakeMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Cypress in December, 2011 and January, 2012. I had a wonderful time and will definitely go back, but I'll go back more informed. It really is a gorgeous hotel. The grounds and pool are what make it for me. The grounds are lush, expansive, and have many sculptures that give a Japanese garden look. There are 3 pool areas with one pool being almost bathwater warm. There are also 3 outdoor whirlpools...one with a waterfall. Actually, there are waterfalls all over the pool area which I love. There's a slide and also a swaying bridge that hangs over one of the pools. There are quite a few activities on the premises such as tennis, boating, rock climbing, and raquetball. There is a bar in a rocky grotto which is part of the pool area and also has waterfalls around it. Very nice grounds. My concern is the nickel and diming that occurs here. I will definitely go back to Grand Cypress because I absolutely adore the pools and grounds, but I'm going to be very careful with my money. Breakfast of Crab Cakes Benedict, bacon, juice, and coffee, ran me $38.64 with tax and 15% tip. A simple Pina Colada at the pool bar "On the Rocks" was $15.06 after tax and 18% tip. At the outdoor bar, the 18% tip is automatically added which I didn't know at first. I left an extra $2.00 above and beyond this steep price before I realized there was an automatic tip. The lobby bar doesn't add the tip and I don't know about the other bars. Another surprise is the $22 resort fee cost per night. Since I stayed at the hotel much of the time, I guess it wasn't that big of a deal. For people who are using the hotel just as a place to sleep, it's something to keep in mind. If you want a higher floor, it's an extra $9 and if you want a Disney fireworks (pool) view, it's another $15. With the Triple A rate, there can be some really great deals at this hotel which also include free breakfast. The weekend breakfast buffet is good quality and expansive. The weekday breakfast is also very good and is served in a pretty restaurant called Cascade with 3 sides of the restaurant floor to ceiling windows that look out on lush, tropical foliage. There's also a beautifully designed cascading waterfall that goes from floor to ceiling. I personally wouldn't get breakfast here without the Triple A free breakfast. It is gorgeous and has real good food though. I highly recommend this hotel for vacationers. I'm not a business person, so I can't give good advice in that area. If you have extra time to hang out at the hotel, then the $22 resort fee may be worth it. There is a lot to do and it's a lovely resort. It's very close to Disney, but the shuttles from Grand Cypress don't run often so it may be better to rent a car. Overall, very nice...but be aware of the hidden costs.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great spot with a few issues...”
Reviews.Author: mikeandjen2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days recently and have mostly positive things to say. It was a family of four with two young kids (ages 7 and 4). The resort is gorgeous, the facilities are amazing, the staff is wonderful, and the upkeep was top-notch. I saw other reviews saying that the property was dirty or unkempt and we saw nothing of the sort. We typically stay at high-end properties so we have a point of reference. Our kids loved the stay. In fact, they ranked the stay there second only to Magic Kingdom. They rated the resort ahead of Animal Kingdom and Sea World. That's saying something. The pool is a kids paradise, the beach is awesome, the boat rentals, the bikes, the hiking trails, and the running paths - all was terrific. I don't see how anyone can complain about the modest resort fee ($20 per day) when you get all of that included. if you don't want those activities, then don't stay at this kind of property! I will say, however, that its not inexpensive and not the type of place to be seeking value deals. They will nickel and dime you to death on just about everything and you just have to make the decision going in that's it worth it and that you're happy to pay it. We did, and enjoyed ourselves. Again, if you are budget conscious, there are other places to stay. We only had two gripes about the property that made us give it 4 stars. First was the kids camp. They bill it as this wonderful activity-filled day for the kids and the reality couldn't be further from the truth. Our kids spent a half-day at the camp and while they did do some activities, they spent most of the time indoors in a tiny, cavernous daycare type room watching movies. The room is small, has no windows, and has a few scattered toys. Our 7 year old was bored to tears and our 4 year old tired of it within an hour. We were disappointed, and so were they. Even with this bad experience, our kids still loved this property as indicated above. I just do not recommend Camp Hyatt at this location. The second gripe has to do with the health club. It is small, cramped and lacks decent equipment. For a hotel with over 700 rooms a workout facility of less than 1,000 square feet just wont do. The machines are on top of one another, the weights are inadequate and it is claustrophobic. I went 3 times on 3 different days (6:30am, 8:00 am, and 7:00 pm) and at all times the room was packed. In some instances I saw people show up and walk away because it was so tiny and crowded. The Hyatt touts this "stay fit" program of theirs but that health club really, really missed the mark. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves and even with these issues we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “A bullet dodged!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy-I-1984
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that my wife and I had booked this hotel for April 2012 but have now cancelled and will be staying at the Hilton instead. We are basing this review on our experience before ever even checking in. We booked a 10 nights stay, staying in a double lake view room (we planned on doing the theme parks to the max so no need for anything more). We used a UK company, Dial-A-Flight (very good, used them 3 times now), who found exactly what we wanted after beating 2 major package holiday providers who will for the sake of integrity, stay anonymous ;) We found out after we had paid that there was a 'resort fee' applicable each night, which was a very honest mistake on Dial-A-Flights' part, so I took 10 minutes out at lunch and called the hotel to clarify the negative reviews on Trip Advisor as each one appeared to have experienced the same issues. I spoke with the rep who confirmed that we would have to pay a compulsory "resort fee" for the privilege of using the golf course, swimming pool, free internet access (although the hotel rep did not see the same funny side I did of this one considering you have to pay for free internet!!) and use of bicycles. In summary, I was told that no matter if I wanted to use all of these facilities or not, I would have to pay the resort fee. At this point I did try to speak with a supervisor as I don't see why we should have to pay for services such as golf and bicycles when we would not be using them, only to be confronted with a "that's the rules and so I don't really see why you have a problem with it" attitude. Considering how much we had already paid for the room, this extra 'tax' was unacceptable so we managed to get our booking with this hotel cancelled and we were booked into the Hilton Parc Soleil who informed us with a chuckle that not only is parking free, but that the only charges we would incur would be for extras we CHOOSE to pay for! In short, we are now looking forward to travelling to Orlando again (I will be working on those reviews for you!) and would like to thank all of the reviewers who took the time to write about the rip-off scheme the Hyatt Grand Cypress are enjoying . . . . . We dodged a financial bullet.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Performer”
Reviews.Author: ComfySeeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed a 4/3 with my family. The hotel shows it's age but it is in great shape. The grounds are beautiful and expansive. The pool is very big and has heated and non heated areas as were posted on the attendant tiki hut. I did not take advantage of the facilities as I was mainly at the parks and used the hotel to sleep. The room is a standard room. Updated bathroom and decor in rooms. Carpet and couch seemed dirty and worn. Was not happy with the door situation in the bathroom, I found it cumbersome. The closet door shares duties as the bathroom door. The wifi was adequate. Self parking was quite far and after returning from trekking at the parks its a bit annoying. The staff was friendly enough and no major events took place to their "real colors" shine through. Must mention that our bags were brought up to our rooms VERY fast after calling the bell hop. I would return and I would recommend this hotel but I will first try others in my upcoming visit to Mickey land.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Property just off Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: FritzSFO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night prior to a conference being hosted at a Disney property. I would have stayed here all 4 nights I was in Orlando, but the property was sold out. This is a property very much in line with other Hyatt Regency Properties. It has soaring lobby space and glass elevators looking out on the lobby below. The room was large and well-appointed with a flat screen TV and all the usual Hyatt Regency emenities. I did notice that the size and brand of bath amenities were different at this Hyatt. They seemed to be the same quality and larger sizes (too big to get through the TSA checkpoint as carry-on). The room was very quiet during the night and like most rooms in Florida hotels had a ceiling fan. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. I didn't spend a lot of time by the pool, but the time spent there in the early evening was very pleasant. In the morning I walked the grounds and was quite impressed with the landscaping and layout. Breakfast at the sit-down restaurant in the morning was very good and the service was passable. On a return trip to Orlando, this would be a top choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: loobeloo
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel enough, for its staff and facilities. I went with slight apprehension, as a fellow UK traveller had stayed only a month or so ago, and wrote very negative, but justified comments. Upon reading that review, I was slightly nervous. Yes, there is work going on, on the lake side view, so definitely ask for a pool view at the moment. Also, the higher the floor, the less noise from the open atrium and better views. But the facilities are second to none. Yes, I don't understand why the resort fee isn't just included in the room rate, considering it is mandatory. But for what you get, and if you use them, it is fabulous. The pools alone are like a little waterpark on its own! The pitch & put is in an outstanding setting, and the running trails are what dreams are made of - for a lazy runner like me, it made me want to run just for the scenery! The prices are a little steep, but you do realise that in the first instance when you arrive, so you can get around that if you choose to, eg breakfast outside the complex only minutes away. But if you choose to obtain what the hotel offers, then the quality is excellent. Highly recommend! I spent a couple of years persuading my other half to visit Orlando - he cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve1249
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, good sized rooms, ask for a high floor and pool side provides a view of the fireworks at Disney. The breakfast if included is very good with a good choice of hot and cold items, if paying daily its a bit pricey and there is better value elsewhere. There are a good range of activities at the hotel, cycles, boats and a very good pitch and putt. The pool is huge with 3 pools, one heated, free towels are supplied. All of this is included in the 'resort charge' of $22 dollars a day per room, again not bad for 3/4 days, but it adds up over a longer period. The hotel is also now charging $11 day for parking, this used to be free, over a 10/14 day stay the resort fee and parking could amount to $350+ The hotel is well situated just 4/5 minutes drive from Downtown Disney and well serviced by numerous restaurants just outside the property. The hotel is clean and the staff in the main are polite and helpful, its not cheap, but I am a great believer in you get what you pay for. Highly recommended, but watch the extra charges!

Reviews.Title: “Overall just okay!”
Reviews.Author: padilladora
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for four nights. Overall I wasn't really impressed seems there needs to be some remodeling done to the property. Nothing that really standouts or makes you say I want to stay here again. The room was a little dated - the lounge chair was dirty and with a few stains - not very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience. Will go back!”
Reviews.Author: Van H
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights. Upon arrival, service was excellent, from guys at the front door to getting help with our bags. The rooms were very clean/nicely decorated. We ended up getting a pool view room, when we paid for a cheaper room...and at no extra charge. The grounds were just beautiful/well maintained. The 3 pools were just crazy fun. At least one of the pools was open 24 hours, which was a nice bonus (for those that like a late night swim). I loved the caves theme surrounding the pools. There was also a bar within those caves, which was quite cool. There are lots of activities (biking, golf, kayaks, rock wall, etc), but we ended up just staying poolside and lounging. The only negative about all this is the $22/fee for those activities...but after seeing what they offer, and even just the pool experience and such, I don't mind it so much. Self Parking was $11/day. Some would complain, but I don't mind as this resort is very private/gated, and the lot is very close to the hotel (even though it seems far away as you pull up to it).Valet parking I think was $20+ day. They had several restaurants, but we only went to the so called "sports bar". That was kind of an interesting experience. It's more or less a sushi/tapas placed dressed as an old pub. Talk about mixing it up. Food was actually excellent, but very pricey for what you get (again, it was tapas, so really didn't expect a full meal). The rest of our stay we ended up going outside of the resort for meals, though we did eat lunch poolside one day, and it was excellent. There are many restaurants within a mile of the resort. The hotel does have a nice lounge in the lobby, which is open late, with lots of comfortable seating to relax. Really like liked that. Overall, we had an excellent experience...will go back for sure. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a nice family spot that's close to everything Orlando offers.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for people who like to eavesdrop”
Reviews.Author: OOBonomist
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've ever been in a noisier "upscale" hotel. There was a plastics convention in town, which meant that hordes of middle-aged guys in polo shirts that didn't qutie cover their bellies were roaming the hallways at all hours, this probably being the only time they get to spend away from their wives. Impromptu parties would form in the hallways after midnight and -- no joke -- you could hear every word. The doors to the rooms were simply not soundproof. Nor were the doors to the adjoining rooms, as I could hear the guy next to me snoring. Otherwise, the place is fine. It's delightful to look at, if a bit over the top. The food is adequate. my buffalo-mozarella bruschetta tasted like a cheap pizza but the crabcakes were good. The pool is aesthetically interesting but completely impractical to swim in. The water slide is fine for kids but adults might find the unpadded slides a bit unforgiving -- the newer Lake Buena Vista hotels have padded slides..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds”
Reviews.Author: teach227
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business conference. Nice grounds, 2-3 pools - one heated, one unheated. Pool food/drink service was very pricey and an extra convenience charge was added to the bill. However, it was decent tasting. Within walking distance of several chain restaurants. 5 minutes from Disney entrance/Downtown Disney. Quiet rooms except for outside construction on exterior of building during the day (lake view). If staying 2012, would ask for pool view due to construction. Very friendly gift shop and housekeeping staff. Balconies are for looking out only, not sitting! Beds were very comfortable. A/C was a little noisy when turning on/off.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings. Nice room”
Reviews.Author: teawench
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference so we received a discount on room.We stayed 5 nights and just loved walking around the grounds. The pools are awesome. There is a lake with canoes & paddle boats that were included. Self parking was $ 11 a night but we enjoyed the walk, Great view of the Disney fireworks from the upper floors of the atrium windows.It's also a easy walk or drive to some of the chain restaurants if you don't want to eat on site all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Love Staying Here, Every Time!”
Reviews.Author: destinationZEN
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times, and have always thoroughly enjoyed our stays. However, our stays are usually for business and we have been unable to use the amazing pool. This time we were staying for leisure, to celebrate our son’s best friend’s sixth birthday. We booked two deluxe rooms in advance with a request for them to be connected. Upon arrival, the front desk could not get our rooms connected or even close together. This was the moment when we knew that this hotel is really committed to customer service. Instead of giving the usual speech about how “there is no guarantee” the front desk person knew that this was a special occasion with three young kids who really wanted to be in connected rooms. So, for nearly the same price, she put us in a one bedroom, 2 bathroom suite with a kitchen and amazing living room. The kids were so excited about by how big the room was, and had so much fun spreading out on the three sofas and eating at the large table. The next day we were all able to enjoy the pool. It was absolutely beautiful. The grottos, waterfalls, waterslides, hidden hot tubs and rope bridge made us feel like we were on an exotic, tropical island. There were a few things about the pool to be aware of though. It is a bit far from the room, so be prepared to walk a ways. The water is not heated (or wasn’t when we were there) and was slightly too cold for the kids, especially in the grotto areas. Also, be sure to get to the pool early, as it fills up and finding chairs that are together may be a challenge. Last, the pool bar and grill stop serving drinks and food at 7pm. Other than these few small items, the entire stay was truly special and we want to thank the staff and management of the hotel for taking such good care of us. We will definitely be back and are happy to recommend you to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- beautiful landscaping and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Nfoste
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Saturday- and are still here. We have a three year old and we are really enjoying our stay. Recommend: 1. Stay on high floor POOL view ( we are on the 10th fl) 2. Get a Regency Club room- its well worth it- great breakfast, coffee (they have an awesome latte/expreso machine and also fantastic early evening snacks with optional wine & beer at a reasonable price- you can get beverages all day including coffee. 3. Rooms are clean and elevators are plentyful and run quick. 4. Pools are great, quiet section and heated kids pool section with slide and waterfall! VERY kid friendly here. 5. Very convenient location to parks and lots of affordable restaurants Cons: 1. I ordered me and my hubby frozen drinks- it cost me 30.00 ! won't do that again. Thumbs up on this hotel- for sure.

Reviews.Title: “changes at the Hyatt Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: familyzoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in 2005 and loved it, but the service has changed.The pool area, kayak, and rope climbing areas were awesome! The contemporary redo of the rooms is terrible! The rooms are stylish, but not functional- the glass shower only covers half of the shower, with no way to adjust the shower head. Only one bed has a table or nightstand. The lobby area reminds me of a busy train station, with no warm welcoming staff. I don't think we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey extras”
Reviews.Author: Aussiedogz
Reviews.Content: This was a nice property with a good pool and grounds, but be aware that you will pay top dollar for every service. It is very annoying to be constantly nickel and dimed since you already have to pay a steep resort fee. Also, for what its worth, the hotel is undergoing exterior renovations from 10A-6P. Ironically we requested to specifically be placed in that area as our original room (in the "quiet" area was surrounded by screaming toddlers. If you're not going to be in your room during the day, you may be better off on that side of the hotel. I would return to this property but I would not pay top dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Luxurous Place”
Reviews.Author: klocco1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel: The Hyatt is an amazing hotel and is so beautiful and pristine with gorgeous grounds which go on forever! I can't say enough about how beautiful and tranquil this hotel is. From the moment of check in (we were given Room 1454), where they treat you like royalty and really know what "CUSTOMER SERVICE" is! I did not eat at any of the dining facilities, but I can imagine that the food is a scrumptious as the grounds. The pool area is beautiful and very large, with at least 2 slides that I saw. There is a rope bridge that goes over the pool area which is really nice. They have a lake where you can rent canoes or those boats with 3 large balloon type wheels and you pedal them. I would recommend just walking the grounds to decompress and take in the scenery. The area and transportation to and from Parks. This monstrosity of a hotel is NOT on Disney property, so you don’t have unlimited transportation to and from the parks. The hotel is close to Downtown Disney, but is about a 2 mile walk. The hotel also offers a complimentary shuttle to the Disney Ticket & Transportation Center (this is where they take you to continue your journey on to each park). The only way to get to Magic Kingdom is by Ferry Boat or Monorail. Monorail and/or bus go to Epcot, only a bus goes to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios Park. One drawback was that they are limited to the times they pick up from the hotel and transport back to the hotel. They have 2 pickup times in the morning 8 and 10, and depending on when you visit, 3 times that they pick up from the Disney Ticket and Transportation Center (this is the only place the Hyatt Shuttle takes you). This can be quite limiting in that you can’t always get out of the parks, and back to the Ticket & Transportation Center in time. If you miss the 9:45 shuttle at night back to the hotel, you need to wait for the 11:15 pm bus. If you are visiting Epcot, you will need to give yourself time to get from Epcot to the Ticket & Transportation Center… I found it frustrating and you started watching your time and not enjoying the park. If you miss the shuttle, there is a taxi you can catch, which can cost anywhere from 20.00 to 25.00. We were running for the 9:45 bus and knew we would miss it, but when we got there, the bus driver said he decided to wait because there was no one there. I think the Hyatt should “rethink” the transportation to and from the Ticket & Transportation Center. If you don’t know what the Ticket & Transportation Center is, this is where you can purchase tickets to the parks, and where you catch the buses to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios Park, or the monorail to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. Busses from the Ticket & Transportation center only take you to Animal Kingdom, Downtown Disney, Hollywood Studios, and monorail only runs you to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. I personally like the monorail because you have a bird’s eye view. , you can purchase tickets if you don’t already have them to the parks, and where you can catch the Ferry or Monorail to Magic Kingdom and Epcot, and a bus to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios Park. I found it kind of limiting the times that the hotel provided. If you don’t have a rental car (which I was told can add up, with gas, parking fees, etc) the hotel does provide a limousine service to the Ticket & Transportation Center which will cost you $27.00 each time you use. The hotel also provided shuttle service to the outlet mall that is located nearby. What I liked: 1) Hotel is beautiful 2) Customer Service Impeccable 3) Comfortable & Roomy Rooms 4) Beds are fantastic 5) Private bathroom 6) Shower is wonderful! 7) Free wifi 8) Quiet Rooms 9) I needed a band aid and they asked if I needed medical assistance…. Customer service! 10) Shuttle service provided to the outlet malls 11) Limited shuttle service to Disney Parks What I didn’t care for: 1) The only thing I did not care for is the shuttle bus to and from the parks, Hyatt might want to rethink the times and consider being a little more flexible. If you want more flexibility getting to and from the parks, I would recommend finding a place on Disney Property, other than that, there is nothing NOT TO LIKE and enjoy about the Hyatt Grand Cypress. Don't forget to stop and say Hello to Merlot -- the Green winged Macaw that greets you in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip to Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: paulintampa
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress in Orlando is an amazing resort. All hotel personnel, from front desk to restaurant to recreational staff to housekeeping and more, were fantastic. I almost felt I was at a Disney resort - they were that friendly! The facility itself is very impressive with lush landscaping and many activities to keep you busy. Some may quibble about the mandatory resort fee, but I see that more and more often in my travels so I am getting used to it. On this weekend trip we were able to take advantage of all they had to offer - bikes, kayaks, pitch and putt golf, swimming, and health club. Two minor complaints: the larger of the two pools was too chilly for my comfort (71 degrees), and the health club is smallish and hidden away in the pool complex. A note of caution: I was stunned at the time it took to drive from WDW to the resort at 6:00pm on Saturday evening. It took a full 45 minutes to get from Yacht and Beach Club to the Hyatt. This is certainly not Hyatt's fault, but something you want to keep in mind if you need to get from WDW to the Hyatt at a specific time. Overall, a wonderful and relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovetheSun88NewYork
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at this beautiful property. Before we arrived the manager called to ask me if I wanted an upgrade which I gladly accepted. Little did I know they would be offering me the Presidential Suite. It was amazing! The staff were always friendly and helpful and our housekeeper was by far the best of them all. We opted for Regency Club privileges which I would recommend because the food choices were delicious and included many healthy options. A nice bonus if you are spending the day at the parks which do not have many healthy choices. What I loved best about this hotel is that while you were five minutes away from Disney, you did not feel like you were that close. The grounds, the pitch and putt course, the jogging trails, the tennis courts, the lake and its water activities make you feel like you are at lush private resort. This will be our number one choice hotel anytime we stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pools and gardens”
Reviews.Author: mricker
Reviews.Content: I loved walking along the pathways to get to the pools. The staff was very kind and helpful. The food was really expensive, but good.

Reviews.Title: “One of Orlando's best pools”
Reviews.Author: Floridabluemacau
Reviews.Content: This hotel is resort featuring a wide range of outdoor sports. The pool is one of Orlando's best. Asian art is everywhere and a recent renovation provided an update to all of the rooms. Make sure you keep your parking card because you will not be able to get out of the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Spotty Experience”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: I have never overheard so many guests complaining about so many things- poor service, noisy construction, poor communication, etc. The food options are incredibly expensive- $7.50 for yogurt and $13 for a hamburger at food stands and the restaurants are grossly overpriced as well. The pool area was not particularly clean- used cups and wrappers should not be left laying around. Overall, the hotel was the least enjoyable part of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Building Work Beware !”
Reviews.Author: dvdbrnvns
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of February, and were very annoyed to find that major building works were being carried out that affected our stay - for a high-end hotel, this level of building work while guests are in situ is simply unacceptable and we cannot unsderstand why senior management at the Hyatt group would not shut this hotel..or at the very least ,part of this hotel, while it is being carried out. Furthermore as guests, you would think we would be firstly warned, to allow us to make other arrangements, and if not warned (as we were not even when we checked in), at least compensated. At the Hyatt it appears they do neither ! It appears from other reviews, that this has been going on since last Fall. Not good enough - I would be very annoyed to find this level of work on going at a three star hotel - but from a Hyatt ! Should guests expect workmen to be going past their window on the 7th floor without warning - seriously ? And the grinding noise on the steel / concrete, especially in the dining room at breakfast, was terrible. This has certainly done them no favours - we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: rey_reina
Reviews.Content: Rooms: updated, clean, good size Pools: fabulous! all of them! The layout of the grounds was great. Service: welcomed with a glass of champagne! Fees: we booked this through a third party and received very reasonable rates which we were satisfied with. What we didn't like is the surprise "resort fee" which isn't discretionary. It clearly states that it isn't optional so why not just add it with the hotel rate. It feels like an after thought. Add an extra fee and we can tell them what they are getting for it (parking, wifi, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Expected better service”
Reviews.Author: VA_sundevil01
Reviews.Content: The disappointment started as I arrived. As I pulled up to check in I was told to leave since I wasn't interested in valet parking: "Go to driveway five, find a place to park and find your way back to the desk". Thanks buddy, but can't I take my bag to the room before parking out in the 'north forty'? Next I got to the desk, where my room request was acknowledged. "Lakeside view, quiet spot." I was promptly given a room without a lakeside view, next to the noisy atrium, across from noisy housekeeping, and next to the clattering ice maker. Did I mention that every person on the wing had to pass by my room, with every noise audible through the too-thin door. The amenities and resort fee were explained in a mumbling jumble that I couldn't understand. I agreed. Later on I realized I was cross sold a bunch of stuff I'd never use or need. Twenty bucks a day down the drain. Oh well. Parking is $11 a day, $6 for events. Thought my conference was an event, but guess not, I was charged the eleven dollar rate. The one amenity I did want to use was the fitness room, which was tiny and cramped. Equipment was a few ellipticals, two of those broken. Handful of treadmills, one bench, a seat, five or six weight machines and a handful of dumbells. Did I mention tiny? No room for stretching, ab work, functional training or any type of a decent workout. There were some positives. The room was clean and spacious. The jogging trails were nice. The pool was big and with waterfalls. There was a cute bird in the atrium. Bottom line is that the facility and grounds are nice, but the service experience for a four star resort was seriously lacking. Maybe it's tough to find great employees in Orlando, maybe training is lacking, or maybe Hyatt doesn't have to offer a great experience since Disney is so close. When I make my choice for future lodging, I'll only choose Hyatt if nothing else is available.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever!!”
Reviews.Author: John U
Reviews.Content: First off, I don't make up stuff. This place is annoying and overpriced. The valets nor the concierge did not know where anything was around the area or gave me the wrong directions. $24 for a beer and a rum and coke at the bar! The breakfast buffet was good. The room was OK but there was construction going making a bunch of noise which blew donkeys! I have been to plenty of "fancy" hotels and this is just another overblown tourist trap. Save your money and go to a nice hotel on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Always Excellent....can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: bsembler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property approximately 6 times in the last four years. Each stay has been a pleasure. The property is beautiful, the food is excellent and the service is the BEST. From the valet, to the bellman to the waiters to housekeeping, everyone we came in contact with was a pleasure and there to serve us at a moments notice. Their attention to detail is extremely impressive. They want to make you happy. The pool area is fantastic, the free bikes, kayaks, etc. to use on the property is awesome. I will return again and again. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anita613
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip last week and I decided to accompany him. Am I glad I did. I passed last year and after seeing how nice it is, am sorry I did Check in was smooth and although we were there early, they were able to give us our room right away. I believe it was Raphael who checked us in, very pleasant. From what I understand they were almost at capacity so we were verly lucky. Russell, took our bags to the room and my husband actually remembered him from the year before. He is extremely personable and answered the couple of questions I had concerning transportation to a Cirque de Soleil show I had booked earlier. ( Show was truly amazing and I only wish my husband could have gotten to see it. The cab ride was $ 12.00 each way. Spent day 1 at the pool in designated quiet area, a very nice touch.Ordered a burger. It was cooked to order and delicious. The second day I asked if I could order a fish taco I had seen on Cascade menu. This was not on the poolside menu but they were happy to accomodate me. It was amazing. Fish was fresh and tasty. Bloody Mary was also very tasty and spicy as I requested. The service around the pool area was exceptional. Night one I ordered room service. Chicken tortilla soup and buffalo wings, delish! I then proceeded to lock myself out of my room while putting the tray in the hallway. I was pretty embarassed having had to take the elevator and walk to the lobby barefooted. Security was sent up to let me in a a timely an efficient manor. She also made me feel better by saying people did this all of the time., lol. Toiletries in bathroom were top notch, body lotion, spa soap, shampoo and conditioner. The also included toothpaste! I had a little issue with the handles in the shower trying to figure them out but eventually did.
