This is because there are a couple of different options which are available to use for your comfort,again a plus. Trellises lounge in lobby was very nice. I went there a couple of times in the early evening to have a glass of wine. The bartender Khai was very friendly and made me feel comfortable even though I felt a little awkward sitting at the bar alone. Had dinner in the White Horse Sports bar, night two. They had a special the bartender recommended, salmon tacos. Again, fresh & delicious. I did take advantage of bike riding on the trails both days I was there. There are 3 different trails for jogging/biking based on how far you wish to jog/ride. The grounds are amazing and clean.They did have a nice health club as well but I did not use it, wanting to take advantage instead, of the beautiful outdoors. I requested and obtained a late checkout. My husband had a business meeting in the morning so this actually was a nice perk for me. Also, his meeting ended early so he got to sit by the pool for a couple of hours and relax a bit before leaving. The staff was very accomodating. While checking out I dealt with Sierra who was extremely pleasant and smiling. She also oferred us a glass of champagne. I did express to her, just how wonderful I thought the staff was. I believe the staff here to be exceptional with friendliness and service being key. I would definitely love to return here. It was a nice getaway for a cuple of days. Ionly wish I could have stayed longer! Maybe next time. I cannot rate the value since this was a company paid trip. Noise was not an issue for me as it had been stated by other. Unfortunately, this is sometimes necessary to keep the building in tip, top, shape.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location away from the hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: DJR1250
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property 5 times over the years and I love it the rooms are always updated, the service is top notch and The meeting facilities are wonderful. It is layed out well and the room views of Orlando and Disney are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BDoty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. We were using points and when I originally made the reservation all we could get was a city view double/double. When we checked in we mentioned that we were on our honeymoon and the front desk agent was kind enough to upgrade us to a pool (and Disney fireworks) view King! He also offered us a glass of champagne and spent sometime asking us where we were from, what we were planning on doing while in Orlando, and gave us some great tips about what to see and what not to see. Our room was beautiful, clean and modern. With our view we were able to see the fireworks every night at 9:00pm and 10:00pm. The first night we went down to the sports bar to get some appetizers and a drink. The food & beverage director, Brian, came to our table to ask how our service was (great) and why we were traveling. When we told him for our honeymoon he graciously offered us glasses of champagne. We said thank you, but we've just had champagne at the front desk. He said "no problem, I'll just send a bottle to your room so you can enjoy it later." Two nights later we ate dinner at La Cocina, one of the restaurants on-site, and Brian was at the Host stand. We thanked him again for the champagne and desserts he sent to our room. After dinner when we were presented with our check our waitress congratulated us on our marriage (we hadn't mentioned this to her) and said that Brian had taken care of our drinks for the evening. We can't say enough about how great the staff at this hotel was and that they went above and beyond to make our vacation memorable. Despite the hotel being sold out, we never felt like it was. Rooms were quiet. Pool and golf course were not crowded. The shuttle to the theme parks was always on time and never crowded. I would highly recommend this hotel to both leisure and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gillian W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Cypress for 5 nights in the february school holiday and loved it from the moment we arrived. Our room was a club room on the 12th floor and had fantastic views we could also use a lounge that served free drinks and snacks and you could watch the fireworks from Epcot in the evening. We found the staff very friendly and helpful especially housekeeping and the bar staff in the White Horse Sports bar - who greeted me by name after our first visit! The breakfast was also very good in the Cascade restaurant. My son loved the pool area and amenties and i actually got to relax on the very comfortable sun lounger. The hotel is in a good location for visiting the theme parks but it was nice to spend a day at the hotel as there was so much to do. I noticed from another review that someone said it was very noisy but we didnt have any problems and would love to return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Bailey_Von_Schnauzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Cypress for a 4 day visit to Disney World and were very impressed with the property. From the friendly greeting of Merlot in the lobby to an amazing pool, we were very impressed with the experience. The shuttle to Disney was only available for two departures in the morning, and limiting for us with a toddler. We opted to drive most days, and the parking (with in/out privileges) at Disney was cheaper and faster than a one-way cab home. Traffic off the Interstate into Lake Buena Vista was horrendous, but properly planned, could be avoided. It didn't help that it was President's Week. Didn't get the chance to eat at most restaurants, but quality and value seemed reasonable for a chain hotel. Staff were very accommodating and helpful. Reception even warned that if our toddler naps, that exterior painting may be an issue. It was a minor issue on one day. Excellent value for a Priceline score. Would go back in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Looks first class but doesn't act it”
Reviews.Author: RedCat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and very experienced at conferences. Plus, the staff is very friendly, but the management has made some horrible choices that have ruined our stay and I'm very disappointed. VERY noisy and not relaxing: We have small kids and were looking forward to our time away to catch up on some sleep and R&R and it was impossible here. The construction noise is mind-blowing- loud and so grating that I had to go read in the lobby because i couldn't stand to be in the room. We changed our room (after waiting a day), but I can still hear it, and am having trouble working in the room. Housekeeping told us they had brought the issue up to management but were told that the hotel needed the business so planned to continue booking even the noisiest rooms. CROWDED with LONG WAITS: Also, the crowds here are suffocating. There are several weddings and conferences at a time. The hotel can't seem to manage them so we've had surly bartenders and long waits to eat (no reservations are taken). Plus, my husband made a golf reservation and reserved clubs, but when he arrived, he was told they were out of clubs and he couldn't play. They credited him a game and credited our account due to the noise (which is 7 days a week from 9 to 5 we were told) but we have a hard time getting away and I'm sorry I wasted our chance to relax here. They TAKE ADVANTAGE OF YOU Finally, they nickel and dime you- for example, we asked for a "cab" to go over to Universal Studios, and it turned out they got us a luxury car that charges twice what a regular cab would be. We couldn't believe they would do that to their guests. I felt conned. And other things were not up to standard (walls full of mold in the shower for example) Beautiful place and much of the staff is very nice, but it just does not have a sophisticated approach to guest service. I will be here until Wed, but would not ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the room type you book....”
Reviews.Author: lzzchic
Reviews.Content: I booked something called and "executive king suite", which I think is a myth. The amenities say that This room type comes with private concierge....i don't have that. The buena vista king room I had last night was very nice. You would think that "executive king suite" is nicer than a regular room. Obviously not. I inquired at the front desk and was rudely told that I am here on a group rate (which I am), so they just booked a block of rooms. That's fine with me, but on Hyatt's own website, I was able to select "executive king suite", so I feel they should honor what I selected and had confirmed on their site. If it was a mistake, ok, but thats their mistake, not mine. I booked and confirmed one thing, and received something else. Before changing to this room type, I had a nicer king view selected....I should have kept that instead of being fooled into believing "executive king suite" was an upgrade. And don't get me started on the construction....don't plan on an afternoon nap if you stay here. This is my first stay, and I usually enjoy Hyatt, but not so much this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MJhagroo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set up with a Japanese theme which make the lobby beautiful and serene. It is a HUGE property, so your better off using the valet unless you don't mind a bit of a walk to you room for self parking. No matter what, you get charged either for valet or parking...but you still get charged. The rooms are standard size and the beds are very comfortable. The pool area is really nice, but it was too cold to use it when I was there. The staff was very friendly and once you are out of the property, you are very close to a lot of things, from restaurants to attractions. The only thing is that if you are looking for a late night drink, there isn't one. All the restaurants and hotel bars are closed by midnight. There are many places open late around it, so that makes up for it. All in all, it's a great hotel in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed....”
Reviews.Author: Aggie927
Reviews.Content: I don't have that much to say, just overall not impressed with this place. For what you pay here, you do not get great service. Personnel are not mature or very welcoming. Housekeeping- not good, I stopped tipping them. Pool service was less than desirable and still added an 18% gratuity. I usually love the hyatt but this place definitely put a damper on things. Seems that they put more energy into the conferences they have here than their guests. Will not stay here again. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaD
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently and was pleasantly surprised to be in such a hip Hyatt. Pretty lobby, interesting art sprinkled about, beautiful grounds with pools, beach, lovely small lake with paddle boats and kayaks. We didn't have time to see the golf courses or tennis center but there is tons to do right here. . . along with shuttles to take you to the park. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HRharleyriders
Reviews.Content: The place is very nice. Was there for 4 nights, and it is a first class Hotel. Not so much for little kids, but it is right next door to Disneyworld, so take them there. As for adults the grotto has a very nice pool. World class dining and upscale bars. Expensive, but not as bad as say the Ritz. 3.5 for a bottle of water, 4 to 6 bucks for a beer, and 8 to 10 for a mixed drink. The room was nice, clean and the bathroom was new and modern. Had good soap/shampoo etc and coffee bar in room was good. For all the places in Orlando, for 250.00 per night, you get what you pay for. Enjoy. Not to sound like the Dos Equix guy, but, I don't always go to Orlando, but when I do, I will stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and amenities- Unfortunately cleanliness, tranquility, and staff were not up to par...”
Reviews.Author: chelseanp
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Hyatts far and wide as do many in our company and have had a truly a wonderful time at most, but I must say our experience at this one may change all that for future trips. While the place itself was beautiful there were several significant issues with the cleanliness, tranquility, and staff. As for cleanliness-when we checked into our room my husband found a book on the floor by the bed, we thought nothing of this as any maid could make a mistake and overlook something but later when I found a dirty woman's bra beside the chaise I really was quite disgusted and it made me quite worried about the other things the staff could have missed...eww. Also when we were down by the hot tubs we saw a hanging wet and dirty pair of men's briefs. I alerted a waitress on the staff at once, while she agreed that the display was absolutely distasteful when we walked back by there later that afternoon they were still there! Unless you want your children picking dirty adult under garments or explaining why they would be left there in the first place you may want to find different accommodations. As for tranquility- we were shocked when we were awoken to what sounded like drilling during our 1st morning, when we called the front desk to find out what was going on we were told they would be working from 9-5 every day for the duration of our stay, so much for peace and quiet. As for the staff- when checking in the front desk attendants attendants seemed ignorant of matters they should be aware of- I have a certified service animal for my disability and it has never before a problem at any Hyatt or any other hotel for that matter but the clerk said she would have to charge us a myriad of fees associated with keeping a "pet" at the hotel. I tried to explain it wasn't a pet and extraneous fees violated the Americans with disabilities act per the dogs certification she became huffy and told the other attendant to leave the fees on there until a manager could be consulted. This was obviosly just an honest mistake but I would expect a hotel of this size to better educate its staff especially when I called way in advance to make sure they were aware of my situation. Highpoints were the beautiful grounds, the food, and the wonderful bell captain from Savannah (didn't catch his name) who thought the bra was as gross as I did and called the housekeeping manager.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Extra fees”
Reviews.Author: spankyangel
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the other reviews on Tripadvisor we had a great girls weekend in Orlando. I only wish we had planned more time to enjoy the hotel! With a great rate from Priceline I was happy and prepared to pay the resort & parking fees. Traveling with my daughter, niece and great niece we did a couple of Disney Parks which were a 10 minute drive. We all LOVED the grotto pools, hot tubs, and the sandy beach was a hit with the 5 year old. Us big girls did some biking around the property. The staff was all about service! Upon arriving late in the day we discovered our mini fridge wasn't working and within an hour maintenance had it replaced. Since it was late, we ordered room service which arrived quickly and the food was excellent. The only other meal was a leisurely breakfast in La Coquina, with a beautiful mermaid waterfall dining area. All 4 of us, including the picky 5 year old had food that was delicious beyond our expectations. I hope to get back to the Grand Cypress again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pools with Much To Do!”
Reviews.Author: Kristen1107
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are island junkies so we didn't expect a resort-like experience for a hotel in Orlando..but this place was so beautiful and full of activities that it certainly felt like a carribean getaway! The lake provides free non-motorized water activities which was a ton of fun. The gardens are really beautifully maintained, and the caves within the pools are really amazing. The slide was surprisingly very fast and exciting. My husband got a kick out of the golf course and we also really enjoyed the view. The only downside is that the water is FREEZING. The shaded parts under the caves were untouchable. The other annoying part is that there was a wedding going on in the lobby and the music was unbearable, bc the reception was in an open area and it really disturbed a lot of the hotel guests. But all in all, the hotel was really great and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not for kids”
Reviews.Author: murfyman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with two grandchildren 6 and 3. This is one of many trips we have made to Orlando specifically Disney World. In the past we have always stayed on Disney property but wished for a change this time around. Very disappointing. The hotel is beautiful although I agree with the other reviewer that the open plan walkways are a nightmare with small children. The elevators are spaced in such a way that when they arrive,if you're not quick enough, the doors are closed and they are gone. Try seeing your floor number at night when in the elevator, we took many trips up and down! The rooms are fine , clean and modern. Two double beds instead of the standard two queens was a disappointment but the hotel only offers one king or two doubles. We found no problem with the service personnel all were polite, helpful and professional. The food was expensive and we are used to paying N.Y prices. Adding an automatic 18% gratuity is offensive, poor service does not get rewarded. Now for the pools. Only one is heated and that's the smallest with the shallowest water and it's where everybody gathers. The shallow part is 3ft. 6in. deep way too deep for a pre schooler and there is no kiddie pool. How about that transportation to the parks? We were given the impression before making the reservation that this was fairly frequent. Wrong. Two buses in the morning (miss those take taxi) and three to return in PM 6pm 8pm 10pm (miss those take a taxi) They do not take you to the parks only to the transportation center and from there you take a bus or monorail to the park of your choice. We estimated that we spent $40-50 a day on taxis. This hotel is not "kid friendly" wonderful for adults on a convention, those facilities were grand but for a family this would be a poor choice. My son has stayed at the Orlando Hilton and that was way better and cheaper. Would we stay here again? Definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, And The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: jdybnsn
Reviews.Content: The Good; Great activities range of on site for children. We particularly enjoyed the bike trail around the extensive grounds, and the "big slide" whilst not all that big (its certainly no "Plummet Summit !) did give a better thrill ride than your average pool slide, due to its better than average acceleration rate towards the end.The heated pool is warm and open 24 hours. The only really decent capable member of staff we found at this hotel was Ben from Austraila - very on top of his job; so very kind, friendly and helpful - I hope that The Hyatt will recognise what a superb member of staff they have in this guy. Bad; We did not have a great "first impressions" experience at this hotel - We were suposed to have a 'Lake View' room. First off, without warning they put us in a room at the back of the hotel (an entrance/drive view). When we found this out, on entering the room, we went down to complain and they said they would put us in a 'lake view' room but there would be no access to the balcony. We said fine, we weren't bothered about a balcony, but on entering our 'lake view' room they failed to mention that this section was under major rennovation, complete with builders' gantrys everwhere on this section, their ropes dangling past the windows, and a large "DO NOT ENTER" sticker posted across our window ! So this is why there was no entry to the balcony - nice of them to mention it. Another trip to reception ensued - not what you want when you first arrive at a hotel all tired with kids and waiting to unpack. We complained again as we didn't think we should expect a "building site view" - not for the money the Hyatt is charging. By this time I was dreading speaking to the receptionists - they just have that way of making you feel YOU are the problem, not the hotel ! I spoke to another receptionist - he did a half hearted look through inventory and (rather) quickly concluded there were no other rooms on the "pool view" side. So we were stuck - with nothing more than an apology offered. As we were only staying 2 days we put up with it - if it had been more I'd have booked out there and then, and although we had to contend with workmen going past our window and looking in on us each day (yes really - we are talking about The Hyatt here) we could at least console ourselves with a view of the Disney fireworks each night. Pool side food was stone cold, and the kids breakfast (we had free adult breakfast) was expensive...especially by the time you add the tips. On reflection we should have gone 2 minutes down the road to Sizzlers $4.99 all you can eat breakfast, and still would have been better off paying for 4 breakfasts there ! The Ugly; The $33 daily compulsory resort & self parking fee and 18% automatic gratuity on your food & drinks ! Please don't tell me this is competative Hyatt - we stayed at the Orlando Hilton and your charges are way above those, and the staff & service were way better ! Whilst the lobby area is beautiful, if I had a child under 10 years I would not be staying here - it is a health & safety ticking timebomb. I would love to know what Safety Inspector approved this building's design - it is so easy for an inquisitive/unattended child to climb up & fall over the railings of open plan walkways, which look down from great height into the open lobby below. Right up to the 15th floor, there is one heck of an open drop - it gave me the shudders everytime we walked past this section, even though my kids are 11 and 14 years old ! What madness for a hotel design within such a prime family holiday area ? In conclusion we spent 2 days at the Orlando Hilton at the start of our trip and I was so upset with our treatment and being nickeled & dimed that I wished that I had rebooked to go there instead.We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference location”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress for a conference. The lobby is beautiful and check in was quick. My room was ready when I arrived. The room was of a high standard. Bed was very comfortable. Everything that I needed was there. The pool are is beautiful. Transportation is provided to the theme parks if you don't have a car. There are several restaurants at the hotel and they are all expensive. In the morning the lobby bar serves breakfast, also outrageously expensive - $13 for a yogurt parfait and tea. A rental car would pay for itself when you left the facility to eat! The conference center is very well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Orlando, Improved hotel, but needs a nicer door person”
Reviews.Author: marplalatino
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times. It was recenly upgraded and the rooms look very good and more modern that the previous florida/key west decoration. It has a great restaurant, Hemingways, where you get gourmet food and magnificent service. The property is very nice, it has 3 pools, one heated; it also offers bikes, ping pong table, rock climbing and boats. Breakfast buffet at Cascades is very good, with a wide variety of offerings. The only compaints are that I was not able to sail in the lake, since they did not have a power boat to assist guests. I have been able to sail every time we visited in the past so this was dissappointing. The gym is small and there was a line to use the treadmills, and some family had a child using the exercise equipment, and last but most important, they have a very unpleasant doorman by the name of Dave, who is very rude to guests if you do not let him take care of your suitcases, since he only cares about his tip. Other than these 3 areas, it is the best hotel in Orlando. is right next to Disneyworld and centrally located regarding restaurants, highways and even the premium outlets. I must clarify that I brought up most of my complaints to one of the managers who was extremely nice and professional, and took out the resort charges without us asking. It is unfortunate that I had to deal with the rude doorman after I spoke with the manager, and not before, so I could have mentioned to him. Even worst, I had had the same negative experience with the same doorman a couple of times before during previous stays. Just remember to self-park so you do not have to deal with any staff who is not prepared and willing to be respectful and polite with guests

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Time at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: born2travel1968
Reviews.Content: My wife and son (22 months) just stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for our fourth time this past holiday weekend. As always, we are amazed at the value you get for staying at this hotel compared to some of the comparable Disney hotels (Contemporary, Polynesian, Grand Floridian). The room was really big, clean and they have all been recently updated. The staff always makes you feel welcome (don't forget to have your champagne when you check in) and the grounds are beautiful. They seem to have a lot more property than many of the other resorts, and with multiple pools, bicycles, pitch and putt golf, and many other activities, we ended up staying at the resort for two of the days. The only negatives I can think of - and they aren't so horrible - is the self-parking lot is a hike from the hotel and you need to be careful about when the servers add gratuity to your bill. Even saying that, I will continue to stay here as I find it one of the best deals in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Makes You Want to Miss the Parks and Stay at the Resort”
Reviews.Author: PJGerace
Reviews.Content: I viewed several great reviews of this hotel before staying and was looking forward to the visit. The actual visit exceeded my expectations on every level. As we drove into the resort, we were greeted by attractive and immaculately groomed grounds. Then at check-in the we were met warmly with champagne and lots of information to help us get up to speed quickly at such a large complex. The room was very nice with a couch and desk so you didn't just have a bed or two in the room. The "odd" closet/bathroom door didn't bother me at all. We went to the parks on the free shuttle, which was on time every day, but I would have liked to stay at the hotel to enjoy the lake, pool, golf, hot tubes, boats and more. This facility has it all. It's great for families with multiple activities and pools as well as couples for a special getaway. I can't imagine a nicer facility in Orlando anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tonyvtravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in February. The place was great. The grounds are beautifully kept. The lobby/atrium is large, bright and has great water elements. It is an older resort, however; they have worked hard on bringing it to a modern facility. The rooms were very nice. Great views. The bed, couch, desk, coffee table were all very nice. The bathroom was one of the best I have ever seen in a motel (I travel a lot). The facilities were top notch. The pools are large and they offer both children area and adult only area. The fitness center was average for a facility like this. They offer a free 9 hole par three pitch and putt, bicycles, row boats and paddle boats. There are a couple for resturants - however we did not dine at either. This is an excellent place for couples or families with kids. Plenty to do. Paid $75 via priceline. There is an additional $22 resort fee (very typical for this area). We will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: sbmc53
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this Hyatt as a wonderful place to relax, shop and hit all the nearby parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: BradentonTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for weekend in a Jr Suite, Resort looks great and the pool was nice. It appears that the property was recently renovated and the rooms look very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business or pleasure experience!”
Reviews.Author: shanemmcmanus
Reviews.Content: This hotel really has it all!great staff,food,accomodation,facilities(check out the pools!)and location-central to everything especially disney a stonesthrow away.Mall of millenia the best shopping experience ever is 15 mins up the I-4.Overall its in my oppinion one of the best hotels in the world and ive seen alot of them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway & Best Resort Period!”
Reviews.Author: vanessalinda
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to describe how perfect our overall experience at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress was this past weekend! It was my 5 year anniversary and after a failed trip to Key West we decided to look into heading back up to Orlando, and boy am I glad we did! After some extensive research on hotels in the area I came across the Hyatt Regency. I read a lot of mixed reviews, some people stating customer service issues to high fees, but the good out weighed the bad and we booked our 2 night 3 day stay. For starters I want to debunk the fee issue that keeps popping up in a lot reviews. Its actually pretty clear, yes there are fees associated with the hotel, like most resorts there is a daily fee for amenities. It is a $22 per night fee which includes a fabulous array of on site activities, which include 24/7 access to their stunning pools, kayaking on the lake and other lake activities, gym access, arcade fun for the kids, lake side hammocks, fire pit, put put golf, plus more! Now in regards to the $75 per night fee, this is not a fee they charge you unless you use room service or other hotel services. It is simply a temporary hold that the hotel places on pending status on your balance along with whatever other remaining balance is owed from the nightly rate. If you do not use any other services then the $75 per night is not charged and you will only be charged once checking out your remaining balance. In my case we made a deposit equaling half of our weekend total and actually used the room service and it was credited towards the $75 per night fee. We were charged the remaining amount when we checked out. We were even left a break down of every transaction in a balance sheet under our door the morning of check out. The hotel is not trying hide these fees, if you take the time to call them or read through your itinerary you will know all these things in advance instead of being "surprised" at check in. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by their friendly staff and Merlot, the lobby parrot. We were even given each a glass of champagne to enjoy on our way up to the room! We had booked a king room and it had a lovely view of the property and pool. The room was very clean and I especially loved the modern decor of the whole hotel. After the long drive up from Miami we decided to spend the evening in the hotel and order room service and a movie. The food was very delicious and I loved the fact I was able to see a movie that was currently in theaters with out having to leave the hotel. The best part is that even though we weren't able to finish the movie, the friendly check out girl removed it from our bill! We took a walk around the resort and were very impressed by all the art, gardens and romantic pool side ambiance of waterfalls, fire pit and lake view hammocks. The next morning we headed down to Cascades, just one of their on site restaurants. As a AAA member we were given each free breakfast vouchers for each night we were there at check in, which we could choose from the buffet or a single menu item. We went for the buffet. Which even though we only went up for one round, were very impressed with the selection, like individual spinach, cheese, egg white cups, fresh fruits, pastries, freshly made waffles and pancakes and deli meat and cheese spread. We were headed to Disney for the day and though we didn't use, the hotel concierge can get you tickets so you can skip the lengthy lines in the park and they also offer transportation to and from the hotel since there is a $14 parking fee at the parks. We spent the day in the park and returned to find the room freshly stocked and cleaned with towels, sheets and toiletries. We again ordered room service for dinner since we were so beat from the day in the park and once again were very impressed with the meals. Our server went above and beyond for us and I really wanted to recognize the much appreciated service. After realizing we did not receive vouchers for the next mornings breakfast and being told we had to go down for them at the front desk when I had called in from the park, our server said he would find out for us and he came back up with our vouchers! Again breakfast was wonderful and the floor manager for Cascades came over to our table a second time and made conversation and remembered us from the previous day. These little acts of kindness really place this hotels customer service on the top of my list of things I loved about the stay! Thank you for the wonderful weekend and can't wait to go back again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Place!”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereGoingSoon
Reviews.Content: This place is magical! It is worth every penny!!! From the minute you step out of your car you are transformed into luxury. The staff is pleasant, knowledgeable, helpful and wonderful. The brunch in La Coquina is the best I have ever experienced! It has over 100 items and each is prepared to titulate your taste buds. There is a cheese table that is better than any cheese table I have experienced in Paris! There is a separate room for the desserts which includes every imaginable treat there is! The water features (pools, spas, etc) are the best in Florida. There is so much to do at this resport that you would not want to leave! Weekends are wonderful here and special occasions! This is a Must See, Must Stay, Must do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything!!!!”
Reviews.Author: helaine75
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids, ages 5 & 8 and myself stayed here for two nights. What a fabulous experience( and I am not easy to please)! I prefer to stay at four seasons so my expectations are always high when staying at any hotel. From the minute we arrived the service was exceptional.Obviously this is no Four Seasons but The hotel is very nice. Not over the top but we really enjoyed our stay here. The kids Loved it! From the pools, jacuzzies and plenty of different activities they were busy all day long. Our last stay in Orlando we stayed at the Grand Floridian, and the only thing better at the grand floridian was the location and convience. The entire staff here really gives 110% and it shows. Every staff member had a smile on their face and were all happy to help us in any way possible. The hotel is very clean inside as well as the grounds outside. We would definitely come back and also recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Typical large resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: vlong1
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights for business meeting. Attractive property, wish I had opportunity to use the very impressive pool area. Location convenient to all the Disney attractions. Facilities were attractive and well maintained. Be very careful when booking: I had a lot of trouble with booking the room due to a mixup with my corporate travel service and it took an act of god to get things straightened out due to inflexible hotel staff...had I been an individual traveler I would have been screwed (though also would not have made the same error if I had been booking directly with the hotel instead of having to navigate our corporate site). They also have a "resort fee"...not uncommon but it still irks me and wish they would just build this into the rate instead of pulling this 'bait & switch' game of charging extra fees once you arrive. On top of that, the resort fee was supposed to include wireless internet, but the service crashed almost every time I signed on over 3 days. Don't charge me a resort fee and promise me a service and then have it be unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: Cruisedave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a great stay at the Hyatt although it was almost over before it started. My wife has back problems and had surgery a few years ago. She needs a bed that is firm and the bed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress was not a good fit for her. Not that the beds are bad, they are very comfortable but she can't sleep on a mattress that has the pillow top on it. I informed the front desk and the head housekeeper George got in touch with me right away. To make a long story short, George was able to find an old mattress in the warehouse that was firm and did not have the pillow cover and they set up a whole new bed for my wife. We were both very appreciative. Now I'm concerned when we go back, we might have the same issue and won't be lucky enough for that mattress to appear again. If it wasn't for George, we would have had to check out after the first night. The hotel itself is beautiful and although the weather wasn't great during our stay, my wife and I still had a great time. I used my points to upgrade to the Regency Club and most nights we just ate dinner there. I do not feel it's worth the extra charge for the Regency Club to be honest but if you have points, I would suggest you use them because it was nice to have breakfast and a light dinner there every day. Years ago, before they moved the Regency Club, I feel it was much better. Not that the staff isn't nice, they were great. Just the club itself was more cozy and the drinks were also included which they are not anymore. There is a small fee for alcoholic drinks which is not expensive (soda and coffee drinks are free) but to me charging for drinks kind of cheapens the experience. I do think they need to redesign the lounge because it has a cold feel to it and is nothing like it used to be. They do charge for parking now which has been noted many times on these boards which I wasn't happy about and add that to the $22 resort fee, your bill adds up very fast. I just wish they would take out the resort fee (and I know what it includes) but just put in into the price of the room upfront. The parking plus resort fee added over $132 to my bill at the end which is a lot. It's just easier to budget when it's all included. Regardless, my wife and I did have a great time at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress and hopefully we'll be able to return in the future (if I can work out ahead of time the bed issue due to my wife's back).

Reviews.Title: “A very very pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: CariocaGirl
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at Hyatt hotels much, but attending a conference, it was the hotel of choice as it was also the conference center. I usually do not enjoy big chain corporate hotels, but I was very very pleased with this experience. The facilities were wonderful (design, colors, textures), the staff was extremely personable, professional, friendly, competent. The room was wonderfully comfortable. The bathroom was FABULOUS - lighting, toiletries, rain shower. The gym was fine - seemed a bit small for the size of the hotel. Overall I very much enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGuruLondon
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a conference and some sight seeing. Very good hotel. Not the best I have stayed at but definately up there since recent re-furbish. Lot's to do for kids and adults and good location.

Reviews.Title: “adult refuge in orlando”
Reviews.Author: lulumommy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day business trip to Orlando. Usually stay at the Peabody but booked the Hyatt Grand Cypress this time out due to location of the conference. Not easy finding a hotel that caters to adults in this town but this one fit the bill. The lobby is gorgeous with beautiful fountains and soaring heights. Same for the multiple pool areas which have a lovely grotto design with waterfalls, caves, and private quiet areas for those who just want to sun, relax, and read. Included in the resort fee are the bikes for touring the resort, various types of boats for the "lake", pitch and putt, and internet service. Not bad for those who want to take advantage. In addition there are 3 jogging trails and a beautiful golf course for those who play (I don't). Room was comfortable but could have used additional lighting and perhaps a printer since this is a business hotel. Very nice amenities. Service was very good all around. Only complaint would have to be the restaurants. Never tried the sports bar but did eat at the Cascade Cafe for lunch and dinner. Food was average at best and pricey for what it was. Also, menu was somewhat limited. There was a sushi option but this was also pricey for very average selections. Ate at Hemingways for 2 dinners which was the higher priced restaurant. Food was a step up but menu could also have used a few additional choices. All in all, a very nice stay in Orlando. If you do bring the kids, it's close to Disney and they have a Camp Hyatt to keep them entertained if you should so wish.

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another AMAZING Weekend in Orlando!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyVin
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay: Friday, February 3, 2011 Length of Stay: 1 Night In a nutshell, this is a truly AMAZING Hyatt in Orlando, Florida, just down the road from Walt Disney World and all the other Orlando theme parks -- nothing but the best in customer service, and a truly beautiful property! Now, for my detailed review: First, I must say that this review builds upon prior two review of this property -- for further information and some more details on this property, please see my prior review: -February 2011, entitled: “A truly AMAZING 4th of July Weekend!” (posted July 6, 2010) My wife and I always love staying at this Hyatt property when we are in the Disney area, as it is often less expensive than the Disney Resorts, and it has far better pools and customer service! If you are headed to Disney World, this property is in the perfect location and should not be missed! Upon arrival, check-in was extremely quick and easy. We we met by the valet, who quickly took our car and assisted with our bags. A quick word on parking -- if you have not stayed at this property in a while, be aware that parking is now an additional cost, but, that takes this property in line with all others in the area, so that is to be expected. And, the cost is quite reasonable, with self-parking at $11 per day, or Valet at $23 per day. The Valet Service is so quick and efficient, I highly recommend spending the extra money for the Valet. Upon entry into the beautiful lobby, we were immediately greeted by another staff member by name, and directed to the front desk. This property truly excels at customer service -- from the moment you pull through the front guard gate, you are always greeted by name, as the valet and the front desk staff appears to be radio'ed ahead with your name and to expect you. The main lobby continues to amaze, as the property continues to change the lighting and the current blue lighting scene is absolutely beautiful! At the front desk, we were again greeting by name, and check-in was extremely quick and pleasant. We were greeted by name, and we were each given a glass of excellent champagne. The agent told us that we were in a beautiful Lake View Junior Suite, as we had used a Diamond Upgrade Certificate. Having stayed in basically every room class, I was truly excited to see a Suite -- and, let me tell you, if you are coming in for a longer stay, definitely splurge for a Suite, as the Suites at this property are excellent! After our quick and efficient check-in experience, we hopped onto the elevator and quickly traveled up to our Suite on the 12th Floor. We were in Room 1207, a "Junior Suite" with a Lake View. The room was perfect for us! You walk in and enter into a Parlor area with a half-kitchen area. To the right is the kitchen, with a wet-bar, ample cabinet space for entertaining, and a wine chiller. Then, as you proceed in, you enter the parlor seating area which has an extremely comfortable couch and chair. The parlor also has a large flat-screen HD-television with a DVD player and a surround sound system. On either side of the television unit is a set of sliding doors that lead into the bedroom area. The bedroom is a very nice sized room, with an excellent King Size Hyatt Grand Bed, along with another HD-television. Then, if you continue into the room and to the right, you enter the bathroom area, equipped with excellent upgraded bath amenities and a large shower/tub. Finally, both the parlor and the bedroom have large balconies with truly excellent views of the Lake. All-in-all, a truly wonderful suite -- again, fully worth spending the extra money! Our main goal of the weekend was to have a fun pool day, and this property always allows for that. The pool has recently undergone an extremely pricey renovation, and it looks AMAZING! The pool now has ample plush double loungers, each with a push-button for poolside service. Also, large shade umbrellas have been installed for those who wish to have shade; these new additions provide for ample shade for those who want it, as well as plenty of open spaces to take in the beautiful Florida sun. The pools here are truly amazing, and some of the best in Central Florida -- if you just want a relaxing pool day, this is definitely the property for you! In addition to all of that, do not forget the food -- this property offers truly excellent food! First, for those staying in Regency Club Rooms, this is one of the nicest Hyatt Regency Clubs in the continental United States, offering beautiful views of all of the Disney Theme Parks -- including beautiful fireworks views! And, in addition to the amazing foods, the food offerings are top-notch for a Regency Club. In the morning, there is an ample Continental Selection, with a few hot items -- make sure to try the french toast! In the evening, there are also ample hot foot options. Definitely do not miss the Regency Club at this property. Also, the pool-side food service is wonderful! Extremely quick and efficient service, strong and tasty pool-side drinks, and very well cooked food. I highly recommend the poolside hot dog for a quick and yummy poolside meal! But, the best of the best is at this property when it comes to food -- whatever you do, do not miss Hemingway's! This is, by far, one of the best restaurants in the Disney area -- the food is EXCELLENT, and the service is to die for! I do not think that there is anything on this menu that is not truly tasty -- I highly recommend any of the fish items, as they are always extremely fresh and succulent! All-in-all, the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress is one of the nicest hotels in the Disney area, and I would highly recommend it over any Disney Resort! Make sure to stay at this property your next visit to Walt Disney World, the Orlando theme parks, or for just a relaxing pool day!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite "Home-away-from-Home!"”
Reviews.Author: JetsetterFL
Reviews.Content: We're locals (~50 mi away) and like to spend weekends at the Grand Cypress as it's a nice getaway. We've stayed at least a dozen times over the past couple of years. Once you're on property it's like you're no longer in Orlando! (Which is a good thing if the I-Drive theme is not your thing.) The property is in beautiful shape and undergoes minor refreshing periodically. The rooms are contemporary, clean and fresh-looking. We love the Regency Club and all the amenities that affords. Take an opportunity to go on a bike ride...the grounds are quite expansive and offer plenty to see. One of the drawbacks is that they charge a resort fee. The fee covers things like the bikes, canoes and other things we don't use. Other than an occasional bike ride we don't take advantage of "perks" the resort fee covers. The other negative is the new charge for the parking lot. It used to be free and all the Disney Properties offer free parking. I think this should be included in the resort fee. I stay at a LOT of Hyatts and this is one of my favorites. All-in-all it's a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: gscar35
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently with the family including 2 children. The hotl is set just outside Disney and has a shuttle to the park. Shuttle wasnt great and this was probably the only miss of the stay. We have stayed at this hotel several times. I like the area. As stated it is just outside the area know as Downtown Disney. There are several good restaurants in the immediate area as well as a few fast food places. The food at the hotel is good, but a little expensive for what you get. We usually stay on the concierge level and for us this is a great deal. The breakfast is great and so are the evening offerings. After you pull onto the property and go by the guard, you drive up to a very nice reception area. The lobby has waterfalls and is spacious. It has a wonderful art collection and is very inviting. The rooms are typical Florida colors, but large enough with a very comfortable bed. But for me the best part of this hotel are the grounds and the pool. I cannot say enough about how much my family loves the pool. It has grottos behind waterfalls with a bar. It meanders around and is just so very relaxing. The kids love it and so do the parents. Staff is great from the guard to the cancierge room staff. I cannot fault any of the staff. Just an all around great quick family get away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: white_shoes_white
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here twice and it is the nicest, most impressive, most beautiful resort we've ever stayed. We were blown away the first time and couldn't wait to come back a 2nd time. A couple disappointments may be all the nickel-and-dime fees. First, the resort fee is a hefty $22 a night. Also, it seems as if parking was free on our first stay (Dec 2010), but is now $11/day (Dec 2011). We don't typically stay at such swanky properties, and the feeling that you are getting charged for all sorts of things can be pretty frustrating. For us, we stayed at an extremely discounted group rate associated with a local soccer tournament. So we couldn't complain @ paying half the $125/night group rate and having the resort fee waived. The grounds are beautiful. Greatest pool area ever. Pictures and words don't do it justice. The waterslide in the large pool was much faster than expected! This was a pleasant surprise. Although the slide is connected to the unheated pool, it was actually quite refreshing to hit the 60F water on a warm, mid 70s day. Pitch and putt golf is a lot of fun. A much more substantial activity than the typical putt putt golf. Rock climbing wall was a hit with our kids. One of the 4-seater bikes was apparently undergoing maintenance, so only 1 of them was available on the day we inquired. Great to be able to rent bikes 'free' (included with resort fee). We never made it to the tennis courts or the paddleboats, but there is so much to do here to stay busy or stay relaxed. Love this resort. The rooms are really nice, great modern feel and furnishings. One thing we found odd was the shower. Last stay, we had a king bed room with sleeper sofa. The shower was fine -- if I recall, the marble foundation was a good 18" high, and the glass door started up from there. This stay, we had 2 double (queen?) beds. The shower in our room seemed different: the glass door went all the way to the floor, and large amounts of water leaked/ran/splashed onto the bathroom floor no matter who was using the shower, kid or adult. One of our kids left her camera somewhere during the stay, and the staff was able to return it to us. We appreciated this very much, although we waited close to half an hour in the lobby for the staffer to appear.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing at the end of a long journey!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: So my hubby and I decided to drive straight through from Michigan to Florida to take our four kids to Disney for a week and we decided to spend our first night here to "crash." We should have stayed the whole trip. It was so beautiful and tranquil, the staff was amazing and professional, the rooms were gorgeous, elegant and clean, the pool area was so neat and the overall place was spectacular and the view overlooking the Disney complex was phenomenal; we even saw the fireworks that night. I loved it and would seriously consider staying here again even if there are some serious advantages to Disney resorts which I will outline in my review of other stay: Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Audi_yes_BMW_no
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful resort and great for traveling with children. Big rooms, great views and plenty of activities (although one pays $22 a day for the activities). Everything h has been updated, except for the exterior which is currently being completed. The construction did not disturb us at all. A tip is to use a AAA membership. This saved us more than $600 on our visit!!! Well worth the $65 or so, annual fee. I would return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: ItalyFirstTimer10
Reviews.Content: This is a truly amazing hotel from the remodeled rooms to the pool area to the breakfast area this is a first rate hotel. The staff is friendly and knowledgable about the area. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in a lot of great cities and all in this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: JAYEYEDEE
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a long weekend so booked this resort through Priceline. There were pros and cons to our stay but luckily, the good outweighed the bad. Pros: great location; fairly close to Disney World; can purchase Disney tickets at the concierge desk; tons of amenities that include huge pools, water activities, bicycles and rock climbing wall. Cons: expensive resort fee plus additional fee for self parking; surcharge for Disney tickets; housecleaning okay but not optimal. Overall, we enjoyed our stayed and might consider going back for a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel! Amazing experience, the greatest amenities!”
Reviews.Author: naftalihat
Reviews.Content: Ok people, whoever complained about this hotel, is retarded! This place is gorgeous. The rooms are fully modern and renovated. We checked in with Jorge at the front desk he was a pleasure. We asked for two double beds, He said YES, we asked for a nice room he said YES, we asked for a view to see the fireworks he said YES, everything wasn't a big deal. Jorge was great! And for you complainers who feel that the 22$ resort is too high, where do you get, canoeing, paddle boats, biking, mountain climbing, WI-FI, gorgeous pools with waterfalls and water slides, one of them heated for 22 bucks, come one people!! And whoever said that the trek took forever to the self park, maybe you used the outside trail, but if you go inside through the convention hall, it took me 4 minutes. I am a starwood platinum member and have never stayed at a hyatt, as you can see I was very impressed. Would love to use hyatt for future stays but too many perks to give up as a starwood platinum member. I hope the GM reads this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: cynthia b
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress many times and have never been disappointed. Recently we took our teenage daughter and three of her friends for her Birthday weekend. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The whole resort is a work of art with manicured gardens, two amazing pools with water slides and a beautiful lake. If you get bored with the pool there are numerous other activities including; bicycles, canoes, paddle boats, and a small rock climbing wall. There are several top notch restaurants on the property with my favorite being Hemmingways which serves fresh seafood. If you're looking for something a little more rustic there's the White Horse Saloon. Try their amazing burgers or sample the sushi. Staying at this resort is like staying in paradise. Another plus - the resort is in close proximity to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Not What It Was”
Reviews.Author: Whynotstay
Reviews.Content: First of all - for background I should say we have stayed at the Grand Cypress 20+ times over the years, usually for 2 weeks at a time and during those 20+ years have seen the resort go through a lot of changes. Many reviews have covered the good aspects of this resort - the pool area, the grounds, the activities so I will concentrate on the things that no longer make it great: Whilst this is still a nice higher end 4 start resort hotel it is no longer the best in Orlando and cant be described as 5 star any longer. Despite what the management might want you to think. As many have said, the hotel has recently gone through a major renovation and the rooms are now very modern - but closer to what you would expect from a downtown business hotel than a Florida/Disney area resort. There are some very strange design issues with the layout of the new rooms - not least of which the closet/bathroom door - which is just plain weird and can lead to trapped fingers etc if you come out of the bathrooom without warning. How much did they really save by just having the one door ? The corridors now have a whitewash, breezeblock look which makes you feel like you are heading to a stadium locker room, not a deluxe resort guestroom. The previous magnificent tropical lobby has also been, well - destroyed - in favour of an "environmentally friendly" bamboo and astroturf look. The old oriental works of art are now at odds with the new look. We much preferred the previous Key West style to the rooms and public areas but can understand that many people prefer the modern look of the new guest rooms at least. This is a big resort and the pool and beach areas, along with the many activities are great and provide a welcome respite after a day at Disney. The resort fee is worth it if you use all the facilities - the recently introduced $11 self-parking fee however is nothing more than a pure ripoff plain and simple. Totally unnecessary and unjustified - particularly as the self parking area is someway from reception and the lifts. Also dont go expecting a very personal service - this is a large chain resort. Not once in 20 years has it ever even been acknowledged that we were repeat guests. Whilst some of the employees are great we have noticed a definate decline in many areas. There seem to be a lot more temporary emplyees who dont seem to know what they are doing. Training is obviously not much in evidence. The restaurants are good - but expensive.As a result most guests I imagine eat off property and this, along with the hard economic times has led to a reduction in service. The market/counter service area did offer a slightly cheaper alternative but now seems rarely open and the variety of food on offer has been severely reduced. The redesigned Regency Club floor is now not worth the money. The new lounge is small and crowded. The food and beverage service is a shadow of what it once was and the decision to charge a subsidy for alchoholic drinks is again a rip-off given the premium price you pay to stay on the club floor. Avoid and spend your money on a pool view room instead. The room service menu has gone through another change and seems to be aiming for higher end gourmet rather than the sorts of things guests actually want from room service at a resort hotel in Orlando - again a weird choice. The main problem is, the management of the Grand Cypress are still trying to market the hotel as one of the top end resorts in Orlando but those days are over. The Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes and the Waldorf Astoria both now offer a much better all around product on great properties without the visible cutbacks and penny-pinching the Hyatt has undergone. They offer great service in modern surroundings but without the rough edges the Grand Cypress now has. Its still a good quality hotel close to Disney but they just need to decide what type of guest they are trying to attract and be honest and stick to it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CrispyRice
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building and grounds. The staff was wonderful and friendly. Champagne at check-in was a very nice touch. We upgraded to a room with a view of the pool and the fireworks over the Disney parks, which I thought was totally worth the extra money. The room itself was stylish and nice, including a refrigerator and relatively large safe. There is a resort fee of $22 and self-parking is another $11, so if you're just looking for a place to crash in between spending all day at the parks, this probably wouldn't be worth it. But, if you're looking for a destination in itself, the fee includes several things - canoes, bikes, paddle boats, a small rock climbing wall. The fitness room was a decent size, all the machines were in good shape, and they had a nice selection of free weights, too. The fee includes the internet, too, but it's a bit slow. We also visited the spa and found the services to be very good. On the main strip just outside the hotel are several chain restaurants and also a grocery store. And of course you're not far from Downtown Disney. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless!”
Reviews.Author: Tickytocky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and daughter.We had a wonderful time with brilliant facilities and staff.Could not fault it.Also bellboy serving us was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Very well organized resort”
Reviews.Author: bus_leisure
Reviews.Content: The only issue were the limited restaurant options in low season, otherwise we liked it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Destination Resort for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort property. The rooms are modern, clean and up to date with nice views. Hotel restaurants are excellent-the sunday brunch is an amazing dining experience with tons of excellent, well prepared choices. The brunch is pricey-but worth it. The pool area is very nice and rarely crowded. Gym is extensive and has a sauna to relax in afterwards. The property is located near LBV but you access it from the north so you can avoid having to go thru the main LBV gate and traffic. You go thru separate security to gain access to the hotel grounds so I would consider this the safest hotel in Orlando. Balcony doors open to allow a nice breeze in when the weather cooperates.

Reviews.Title: “upscale”
Reviews.Author: Thadd_969
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, definately geared towards high-end business travelers. It is flashy and expensive, while the places to eat on property are very limited. It is in a very high traffice area, so driving during rush-hour is no fun. My final opinion is that it is nice, but Orlando has other nice places that are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: perfumegirl
Reviews.Content: Well our trip started a little rocky here with our room given away and the front desk advising there were no rooms available. This was after I spoke with the front desk to advise we were severely delayed due to weather and requested they check me in (next time I'm doing on line check in). After I caused a scene at the front desk they miraculously found a room as well as free breakfast coupons for our stay. The rooms here are beautiful very zen and spa like. Beds are luxuriously appointed and all rooms have flat panel tvs and a built in desk with plenty of ports to power up your electronics. The rooms are large (we traveled with our daughter my sister with her 3 kids - she had a corner room with 2 double beds and a crib and there was still room for the kids to play) I paid for the concierge service which was MORE than worth it especially if you're traveling with kids. It includes continental breakfast daily, an afternoon snack, evening hors d'oeuvres (you pay for your own cocktails or can bring your own), dessert coffee and fireworks from Disney later in the evening. You can even hang out up here if you want to join up with other families and order room service to eat together. There's a great outdoor deck area (weather permitting). The pools here are the best I've ever seen. Waterfalls, caves, slides, numerous hot tubs and plenty of seating. There is waiter service poolside as well so you can order food and drinks throughout your day. You can rent floats for the day too. At this resort there is a daily resort feel which includes use of the gym, rock climbing wall, pools, bicycles, small golf cours ( I think 9 holes), and putting green. The restaurants here are a bit pricey unless you want to eat at the cafeteria style place but you're so centrally located you can hop in the car and eat any type of food your heart desires. Transportation to the theme parks is weak so rent or bring your own car.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: NyaVirginia
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is beautiful. Wonderful views with nice landscaping. We took many walks. There are several trails for those who like to run and walk. We liked the waterfall pool. The hotel is not too far from Universal Studios and very close to Disney World. Speaking to the bird named Merlot was fun. He is one of a few exotic birds in the hotel lobby. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and pleasant. The rooms have balconies. The balconies are not that big. You can not fit a chair to sit out on the balcony. It is just enough room to stand and enjoy the view. There is a bar under the waterfall at the pool. That is a nice place to relax. There is a piano in the lobby. If you like to hang out late, you will find that the restaurants and bars do not stay open late. You have to go off site. We enjoyed this hotel and think it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, high charges including resort fees”
Reviews.Author: Ant_bcfc
Reviews.Content: Overall myself and family had a great time at the grand regency cypress... A couple of issues to begin with that the hotel tried to sort out to the best of their ability. Mainly due to virgin selling this hotel as a 5 star when it is actually a 4 star! Therefore expectations were higher... Staff were very friendly , including Dan the food manager... However the star of the show was " JP" who is a waiter in the cascades restaurant - hyatt , if you give awards please give one to this guy! Resort fees are very high and unfortunately smack of penny pinching ... Highlights include the amazing pool , the bikes and "merlot" the parrot...

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that delivers on its 5* Rating!”
Reviews.Author: eaglecreek
Reviews.Content: I have over a 20 year period been coming to Florida and invariably spend some time in Orlando on each visit. This hotel, by a wide margin, is the best that I have stayed at in the area. Check in is was slick, polite and courteous, a trend that is repeated throughout the hotel. The bedrooms have recently had a makeover and were of a very high standard, spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. For a family the grounds offered plenty of activities to keep most entertained, mini golf, swimming pools, tennis, pedlos, rock climbing, cycles......I am sure to have forgotten something. If I was to get picky, the menu at the Sports Bar was way to limited, try the Orlando Ale House just outside the main entrance, and the Hotels much hyped Championsip Golf Course was overpriced at $150 and not nearly as good as Shingle Creek G.C @ $80 a round. All in all though this will be my hotel of choice on my next visit to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - but New Years Traffic INSANE!”
Reviews.Author: dkmc79
Reviews.Content: This is a MEGA hotel with over 800 rooms! It is located very close to the entrance to the Walt Disney World property. The hotel grounds are very picturesque with lots of beautiful tropical plants. There are multiple pools and hot tubs. Only one pool is heated with lots of children playing at midday- the unheated pool is VERY chilly. That could be refreshing in the heat of summer but it is a little too much in early January. It takes some time to learn your way around the outdoor paths but we eventually did find a quite spot with enough lounge chairs for our group. The hot tubs were wonderful after a long day of visiting the local attractions. Nice to have them open 24 hours. Little kids enjoy the fine sand beach but no swimming permitted in the man-made lake due to the potential for alligators - yikes! The hotel lobby is very large and makes good use of all the natural light - but with limited day light in early January I found it a little dark. Being at the Hyatt over New Years Eve - they had a number of fun things going on. These included a DJ, balloon drop and a women is metal contraption serving champagne! Our room was lovely and large - we it had two double beds. I found the beds a little small and glad I was not sharing on this trip. Room was very bright during the day time but I found it a little dark after sunset. In room coffee with paper to-go cups was fast and tasty. Don't forget to ask for a fridge if you planning on keeping any perishable items. We went to the local grocery store Goodlings and to Wal-mart and stocked up on items for a quick budget friendly breakfast. Self-parking is a bit of a trek from the main lobby area and with the hotel being full - we sometimes had to search for an available parking spot. During the days over New Years - it was very difficult to drive the street surrounding the hotel. Traffic was often VERY backed up and we sometimes had to wait a number of light cycles just to make it through an intersection. All-in-all the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress in Orlando is very beautiful, with a very friendly staff. It is very nice to be so close to Disney, the I-4 and a number of different restaurants that will appeal to all appetites and budgets. Be sure to check out the Waffle House for a fun diner experience - plus the waffles were awesome! I am very glad we had the chance to stay here and got such a great deal through the airline for a flight-hotel and car package.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT FOR FAMILIES!”
Reviews.Author: pcinnyc
Reviews.Content: This place is close enough to disney and gives you options of things to do outside of disney on the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, but beware of construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Paula R
Reviews.Content: We've been coming back to this hotel every year for the past fifteen years and the staff are always warm and welcoming and quick to attend to any concern. The grounds are gorgeous, there are plenty of activities for adults and kids (swimming, boating, biking, rock climbing), and the quality of the food is outstanding (especially Hemingway's). Wish they hadn't spent so much on the renovation (the old lobby was a lush tropical heaven and it's now sterile and cold, the redone rooms are attractive and modern with very comfortable beds, but with many impractical features, too, such as inconvenient and limited electrical outlets). The hotel seems to be paying for the expensive redo with all kinds of fees (doubled resort fee, a self-parking fee, a fee to use a printer - except to print boarding passes, which is free). The room service and and Palm Cafe menus have gone more gourmet and are more limited. Except for the pizza, which the kids already had there fill of at the parks, the menus don't work for families. (On non-park days we now get take out from nearby restaurants rather than going to the Palm Cafe.) Clearly, the hotel is trying to appeal to a more high-end, sophisticated customer (i.e., not families like us) than they have in the past. Unfortunately, my son got food poisoning on our last night and our flight home wasn't until the next night. The Hyatt did give us a 5:00 check out (Thank you!), but not until we pointed out that his last meal was in the hotel. On our last day, we had to switch our three connected rooms to two rooms near each other because the Jackhammer noise coming through the ventilation system was so LOUD. The construction was supposed to be going on only M-F from 8-5, but it was also going on on Sunday afternoon, too. I wish I could advise to request a room away from construction, but the front desk admitted that they don't know where the construction will be during any given hour (let alone for a whole day). One more thing, the TV reception in our rooms was poor. We didn't discover this until we put on the Patriots-Denver game that we were eagerly anticipating. Too late to do anything then, although I'm sure the hotel would have fixed it if we'd notified them earlier. Of course, the reception might have had something to do with the construction going on because when we moved to our new rooms the next day, the TVs worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Tech R
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at Hyatt Regency for five nights January 2012. We had a wonderful visit. The shuttles to Disney and Universal are efficient. There are not a lot of variation in the time offerings but there is enough that a family can easily navigate a trip to Disney without problem. The pools and fitness center are great. The hotel offers several activities that are very nice for families (e.g., pitch and put golf, paddle boats, canoes, bicyles, climbing wall, etc...) and included with the resort fee. The location is also ideal. The hotel is located within walking distance (half a mile or so) to several chain restaurants, which include Chili's, Red Lobster, Joe's Crab Shack, Uno's, Olive Garden, Buffalo Wild Wings, Perkin's, Denny's, Dunkin' Donuts, Burger King, McDonald's, Pizza Hut, Shoney's, Black Angus, and Sizzler. Snacks and drinks are within half a mile at Circle K, 7-Eleven, and Walgreen's. Disney downtown is also within walking distance but you have to enjoy walking (e.g., over a mile an probably closer to two miles). The hotel is not within walking distance to the theme parks but, as already mentioned, the shuttle service is efficient. Bottom line, the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress is an affordable alternative to the Disney properties and offers many more activities and options as long as you can walk about half a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Hotel Construction and Bad Location During Peak Season”
Reviews.Author: SkyBoot
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor reviewers really did us wrong on this hotel. First, let me start by saying that I am a Hyatt Gold Passport Platinum member. I stay in Hyatt hotels about 30-45 days per year and have never had a problem with a Hyatt hotel. Until now. My wife and I flew into Orlando after staying at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza in Los Angeles, which was a pleasant experience. Upon arriving at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, we were first given the wrong room. As a platinum member, we are guaranteed the bed of our choice and we requested king. We got two doubles (not even a queen), but this wasn’t really a big deal at that point. We just had the bellman ask the desk for a king room. After speaking with the front desk, the bellman asked if we would mind a room on the pool side with a sliding door that wouldn’t open because they were doing construction. “Wait. What kind of construction,” I asked. “Oh, it’s just painting. No noise. And you get to see the Disney fireworks from that side,” the bellman replied. Sounds good to me. We accepted. Now, where we’re from, no one paints with a jackhammer, but apparently, at the Grand Cypress, they do, because while my wife and I were napping after a 5-hour red-eye flight, we were awakened by jackhammering in the room next door. (And when I say awakened, I mean, jumping so high we almost hit the ceiling.) I immediately called the front desk and asked for a second room change, which they gave us, on the same floor, down the hall. We could still hear the drilling and jackhammering only a little bit fainter. At this point we gave up sleeping and went to the pool. Oh yes, we were told that they’ve been doing the construction since the fall and it’s 9-5 every day. The construction continued throughout our stay. Under no circumstances should a hotel be charging guests $220 per night to stay in a room, or even or a floor or in a wing, where that kind of construction is going on. Another note about the hotel. The location could not be any worse. We are frequent visitors to Disney and have stayed at several Disney properties, the Swan and Dolphin, and the Marriott World Center with no problem at any of those hotels. With the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, if you decided to drive, I would budget 30 minutes JUST TO GET OUT OF THE HOTEL COMPLEX. During peak season, every day, there is a backup on Winter Garden Vineland Road, which is the only road you can access from Grand Cypress Boulevard. It will take you 5-10 minutes to get onto Winter Garden Vineland, and likely another 10-15 minutes to get to Apopka Vineland Road, which is approximately a block or two away. Apopka Vineland itself will be bumper-to-bumper to I-4 AT ALL TIMES OF THE DAY, whether it’s rush hour, or the lunch or dinner crush at the Crossroads shopping complex or Downtown Disney. For instance, it took us 30-45 minutes to get to Downtown Disney, which is around the corner from the hotel. A few other people have mentioned the fees at this hotel. I am generally aware of the resort fee when we visit a Hyatt Grand or Regency, but one fee did irk me. Self-parking, which used to be free at this hotel. You will be charged $11 above and beyond your hotel rate and resort fee for self-parking. Clearly, the hotel felt it was losing money because most guests were choosing self-parking and foregoing the valet, so they instituted an $11 fee for you to park your own car 400-500 yards away and walk yourself to your room. If the hotel is losing money, raise the resort fee (which is clearly described when you book your room online). Don't hide a fee and tell me about it at the front desk after I've already rented a car and driven my sorry self to the hotel. Anyway, bottom line. I love Hyatt. I’ll still stay at Hyatts, because this hotel is not representative of most. I will never stay at the Grand Cypress again. The employees of this hotel were kind and offered the same level of service at any of the other Hyatts I’ve stayed at and enjoyed (except for shifting us down the same hallway where the construction was occurring). However, this hotel is far from meeting up to the Hyatt standard. I fault management for the construction issue. The location can't be helped. You have many options in the Disney area of Orlando, I suggest you choose another.

Reviews.Title: “I Love it....I love it not.”
Reviews.Author: lakomka2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt strtingon 25.12.2011. I was very much looking forward to the experience after reading the reviews. And I must say, some are totally justified. Beautiful pools, beautiful grounds, great activities offeredin the 22$/day resort fee. I love the toiletteries. Big size.
