I could have filled my suitcase going back home (if not for the airlines restrictions!!) as the maid added more every day ! The atrium is stunning. Going to the 18th floor and looki8ng down is an thrill on its own. Bed was very comfortable. Staff very friendly. Loved that glass of champagne on check in! It was great to have the hotel shuttle to the Maingate any time of day. The same shuttle drove us to the Golf Course (5* !) where we were given free clubs tees and balls. Very friendly staff there as well. The 9 hole Pitch and putt course is also awesome. The bikes, the canoes etc.. i wish the weather had been warmer to use everything more extensively. The Art Boutique/gallery is very nice and a nice addition tothe hotel. Very unusual pieces, that i would have loved to purhase! Owner was very informative, not pushy at all. A real art lover. These were the Pro's. Now the Con's IMHO. The pool is great .. probably in July/aug. , but with 15 degrees outside temp. , it was more like a Polar Bear swimm. I put my legs in the water and got cramps from the cold ! This side of the pool stayed pretty empty the whole week... The room: No matter where your room is, the view is always nice. We got eventually a room with view of the front of the hotel, but we also could see the gardens and the ponds etc...no complaint here. :I had phoned in advance to advise of our late check-in so a room - as we ordered with 2 double beds- could be available and ready. On arrival we were offered a king size (which my son refused - he is 10 and does not want to sleep with mama). So we were given a room with 2 double beds. I found the bathroom really weird. No shower stall, no door, no real vanity, not even room to put a cosmetic bag ! It was late so we stayed the night but in the morning taking a shower was no fun at all, and as we were staying the whole week, I requested to be moved. I finally realized why the bathroom was so unpratical: I did not have a wheel chair !!! I think it is great when hotels offer "accessible" rooms (please indicate WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE !! ) but dont give them to guests who do not have a wheel chair and pay a pretty good price to have a nice bathroom, not a shower curtain and a flooded floor after each shower and just enough space to put your tooth brush. Enough whining: we were moved at lunch time to another room, king size bed though -son not happy- :-( but with bigger nicer bathroom, and AWESOME shower stall, with double glass doors. Just loved it. Yes, I did hit my son on the head a few times when he was opening the safe in the closet and I was opening the sliding bathroom door at the same time ...he survived the ordeal though... BTW...A/C was LOUD !! TV: during my last stay in Orlando (the Great Peabody) my son was able to watch kids cartoons at no extra costs (i refuse to rent movies in hotels i Orlando). I do not find it OK to have to pay for the basic TV shows like News and kids cartoons. WIth the 22$ fee per day, you would expect a minimum TV service. Accoustic issues: One night, the room under us was playing music so loud that my son could not fall asleep. There is not much that can be done, but during the extensive renovations, this should have been addressed. I finally phoned the front desk and the music stopped. Restaurants seem very nice, but very expensive...so we ate out most times. Except for the Palm Café, where the food is good and affordable. However I cannot understand that the hotel management allowed a whole group of guests to get their food at Subway, bring it back to the hotel, and take over 2 tables outside, where guests who have purchased their lunch inside shouldbe able to sit. There wasno room for us to sit and eat. Just those 2 tables filled with Subways wrappers. Is there no policy about that!! If you buy your lunch at Subway, then eat it there! Not at the Hyatt. It looked like a public picnic area. Ice machine on the floor was broken. I told themaid several times, but it wasnever repaired. No big deal but I had to go all around to get ice. My fault I guess. I should have told the front desk. Transportation: true that more shuttles shoudl be avaialble - Although this is not a Disney Hotel-. But the fact is that most guests ARE going to need shuttles to go to parks. WHen you have small chidlren, you cannot expect them to last a whole day at the parks, so that a more frequent shuttle service should be available. The expensive Limo service at the front is not an option: we needed a drive to a parking lot nearby to take the FRE shuttle to Bush garden. Price was $20. Drive to TAMPA was free, thank God ! Our transportation budget was way too high. ROOM KEY: we had trouble several times with our room key. We were locked out on 3 occasions. WILL WE COME BACK ? Not sure. We might because the grounds are so beautiful and great for children. The activities are awesome. and the toilettries :-) !!!! and the unusual atrium,,, So....YES we will come back ! So I give it a 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: RMK-Roswell
Reviews.Content: Our family Stayed here in December for 4 days while taking part in a soccer tournament and had a very good time. Be aware that there is a $22 resort fee (which was waived for our team) - There is no breakfast buffet included in the deal (The buffet is quite expensive) - We would take a quick drive out to one of the many choices outside to eat. A Great lobby - net glass-walled elevators - nice rooms - Excellent resort amenities - are all the plus points of this place. Make sure you do the self-parking if you are price conscious too. Overall this is a great place, if you get a good deal to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, expensive resort fees and parking.”
Reviews.Author: robtguy
Reviews.Content: Pro's. On its own resort seperate from Disney, The pool area is very nice, staff is attentive, Regency Club is a great option for dining. Con's. Resort Fee is not all inclusive. They recently added parking fee's to self park, this has been added because local people can drive onto the resort and park to eat at the restaurant or use the pool, there is no real security to stop this. So, they are charging everyone for parking. Room's are adequate, no tubs. If you use a suite upgrade you get two connecting rooms. Room service is average.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Jb098451
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel after reading the Tripadvisor reviews. I was very happy with our choice and would thoroughly recommend the hotel for families. Our room was adequate and well furnished, the bed was comfy and housekeeping made sure it was clean and tidy after we returned each day. It is a large conference hotel but the amenities are first class and I would return in a heartbeat. All of the staff we met were so helpful and polite and Dale who runs the minibus was a perfect gentleman and nothing was too much trouble. The shuttle bus is limited but it's all included and runs on time so no complaints from us!I can also thoroughly recommend the Orlando Alehouse just outside the main gate, it's fun, excellent value and the food is great and covers all the usual steaks, burgers etc. Try the Hyatt it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Grecia F
Reviews.Content: House keeping was not good, they left a dirty cleaning towel on top of the bed head board one day that we found when we arrived one night after the parks. The bathrooms were not stocked properly, had to use our own soap on our last night. Worst of all I had $300 stolen from my room at the beginning of our 1week stay at the hotel. Security worked on the case but it was still work in progress when we left and not fully resolved. The hotel recognized the loss but it left me with a bitter taste and somehow was an upset to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: SUE-ZEE-Q
Reviews.Content: The Grand Cypress is a nice looking hotel when you first enter the lobby. We loved Merlot, the macaw. We usually stay at the Disney Boardwalk Resort but wanted a different experience on this vacation. As others have commented, the property is very large. However, I cannot comment on the facilities as we only used the hotel to sleep before heading out to the parks. As for our room (I am only writing about our room because there are a few different configurations. However, I think many rooms are like ours), it was very SMALL for two double beds. I really don't know what they were thinking. Who did they think would be sleeping there? The beds are MUCH TOO SMALL for two adults so I guess they felt that the each adult would sleep with a child (The last thing we wanted to do!). They should put king-size beds in these rooms and sell them to 2 adults only. The closet door situation is dangerous. If someone is coming out of the bathroom and someone else is by the closet, you could potentially decapitate that person by unwittingly pushing the door into them. There needs to be more room for luggage. We always seemed to be tripping over it. The built-in piece of furniture that runs the length of the wall can be a real pain if you drop anything behind it (You can't move it and it is practically impossible to reach fallen objects). THEREFORE, DO NOT PUT SMALL OBJECTS (E.G. JEWELRY) ON TOP OF IT. I have no idea why they have a "cool box" instead of a refrigerator (You cannot put formula or medicine in it). So, if you want cold soda, go to the 7-11 around the corner and buy it cold and then put it inside. When something cold is placed inside it will stay cold. As I always say, the pillows are mushy foam, so if you hate them as much as I, bring your own. I feel that there were just not enough restaurants on the property. Breakfast at Cascades was fine but a 45 minute wait for dinner was ridiculous! I understand the situation with the shower door. I have the same in my house. The reason for the half-door is if you are taking a bath, it prevents you from feeling closed in. However, since most of us are not bathing, a full door should have been installed. Also, the situation with the resort fee. Every high-end hotel does this. What I don't understand is why cheap hotels can offer free breakfast and wi-fi and the luxury ones charge for everything. I disagree with others who felt that the service was impersonal. I felt that all the staff members were pleasant and helpful. So in conclusion, I would try another hotel. Not that this hotel was terrible but I just feel that there are nicer hotels nearby to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobinRaves
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights over Christmas weekend 2011 and it was fabulous. Great location that is close to all the theme parks. Lots of restaurants and gift shops nearby. Hotel is on the same exit as Downtown Disney. Plus - we could see the Epcot/Disney fireworks from the hotel. We used valet parking and never had to wait on our car. There is a colorful McCaw in the lobby that provides a lot of entertainment to adults and children alike. One night we returned to the hotel and there was a sugar cookie station set up for guests to ice and decorate their own sugar cookies. Bedding was very comfortable and NO BED BUGS! We will be back. This is our permanent Orlando hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. No lines! Did not love the sushi bar.”
Reviews.Author: Pamala H
Reviews.Content: Loved it here! Away from the crowds. Would come here again even though it's a little chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for price paid - be warned about extra charges”
Reviews.Author: reviewguy
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid - under $100 a night - this seemed a great deal. Its a solid 4 star resort with a lot of amenities. But its also your typical large, and i mean REALLY large property with impersonal service (with a few good exceptions.) The room size was adequate. But we missed the luxury of a bathtub to bathe the little kids. What we did not realize till the last day was that the couch was a pull out bed - would have been nice if we had been made aware. What was not expected: An automatic 22% gratuity charged to room service orders over and above a room service charge. Self parking at $12 that was quite far away from the lobby. If you are getting a car, just get used to paying the $23 for valet parking. These guys were great! Then again, we did tip well each time they got the car out. We would have liked if the parking charge was included in the resort fee. Aside from that - no major problems. Good to know: Lots of restaurant options around the corner. From Dunkin Donuts and McDonalds for breakfast to Mexican, Chinese, Steak, Italian... all within two minutes drive of the hotel. While the entrance of WDW is two minutes from the hotel as well, it takes about 25 minutes to drive to Magic Kingdom. Be prepared to shell out $30 for a cab ride if you dont take the sparse offerings of shuttle services. Door to door from hotel to any of the WDW parks is about one hour if you choose the hotel transportation option. Makes us believe we would have been better off at a resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: rphsweet
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here over this Christmas and we just loved staying there! The staff are extra friendly and attentive and always address you by your name:) We enjoyed the pool area with the kids-there are 2 slides there, several hot tubs and a large pool area. The only thing that would make the pool area better would be if the whole area was heated. Although my son quite enjoyed swimming in the chilly one through the cave tunnels. The breakfast buffet is thoroughly delicious and a great way to start the day with a view and listening to a waterfall in the restaurant. The lobby is beautiful and there's a parrot named Merlot the kids enjoyed talking to. We took advantage of some of the activities like biking the trails and paddleboating in the lake:) It was a fun time! The abundance of elevators is great too=very minimal wait times!!! Also there are large windows to view fireworks at Epcot at night although it was very brief the night we went to watch it. They offer some shuttles to Disney and Universal but there are only a few times when they operate-the Universal shuttle was really crammed the day we took it. The disney one wasn't as full at all. If more shuttles were leaving for Universal it wouldn't be that bad. We tried the room service pizza and it was delicious! Great pizza for a hotel and we made it our Christmas dinner. My son thought it was quite fancy when they brought the cart in our room and then it turned out to be so tasty on top of all that:) We would definately stay here again! The price was great too compared to some of the prices I was quoted for this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: UAE455
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hyatt hotel with my family on thanksgiving for 3 nights. They greeted us as if we were regular guests at the hotel , they were so humble to take care of our needs and inquiries. We had trouble finding connecting rooms or suites but the duty manager at the time was so helpful he found us a 1 bedroom suite with a connecting room , this made our trip even much more wonderful. The waiters at the breakfast buffet were so helpful and caring to my children's requests. I think I saw the manager serving there also which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Ling
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in November 2009. The hotel and grounds are really beautiful! The pool area is amazing too, my kids loved it there - cave, waterfalll, multiple hot tubs, waterslide, etc. It was a great experience, I think it sets itself above a lot of other hotels by it's beautiful grounds, pool and lobby area. Everything else is as expected - not too far from Disney, good service, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place”
Reviews.Author: 424Sharbear
Reviews.Content: Great pools, heated, water slide perfect for little ones. Perfect lounge chairs for parents with umbrellas. Food and drinks delivered right to your chair. STAY HERE YOU WONT REGRET IT. Breakfast buffet was the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMS15
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a beautiful hotel. It is very close to Downtown Disney. Pros: - elegant, modern rooms - clean, attractive grounds - close to Magic Kingdom - outdoor activities - beautiful pools, bikes, fire pit for roasting marshmallows, rock climbing wall, canoes, water bikes, 3 jogging trails, nature paths, and golf Cons: - self- parking fee ($11.00 per day) - resort fee ($22.00 per day) I didn't mind the resort fee as much, since there was a lot to do at the hotel. But I feel the parking fee is unnecessary.However, a family could save money by spending a day or two at the resort and enjoying the fabulous amenities. Including taxes, these two fees added up to about $72.00 for two days. - They have a shuttle that will take you to several parks, but the times are very limited. They had two departure times (at around 9:00 and 10:00 am, and either one or two pick up times) - Bathrooms are clean and attractive, but the modern design makes it a little impractical for bathing small children. The glass door covers half of the tub, and the closet and bathroom in our room share a sliding door (hard to describe, but it doesn't really lock, so kids can open it any time) Overall, I really liked the hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: cariandduncan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyat this summer 2011 with our two children for two weeks. On arrival there were long queues for check in( we put this down to the hotels popularity on trip advisor!) the team were fairly friendly but unlike the people next to us we were not offered champagne and had to ask for the free childrens bucket and spade! The room was good we had a lake view 5th floor. The children shared a double sofa bed which was comfortable, our bed also a double was comfortable and the sheets were good quality. The bathrooms were new and very clean. The best part of the hotel was the pool, the children loved the two slides hot tubs and caves. The bike hire was excellent and we went on several bike rides and walks around the hotels grounds.The children begged to stay at the hotel most days rather than the parks! The hotel breakfast was good, although the service was poor (slow and unfriendly). We ate most evenings at the White horse bar and Grill, where the service was excellent, one waitress sent us milk and cookies in our room. They served an excellent steak sandwich and the sushi was really delicious. Access to parks was ok, but because the free buses left later than the opening times we took taxis to beat the rush and then sometimes returned on the buses. However i think the travel was worth it as the hotel felt a lot calmer than the disney hotels we saw and felt like an oasis to return to after the mad rush of the parks. All in all an excellent hotel, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myladyarthur
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Cypress for 2 nights. The hotel and rooms are beautiful. The grounds are magnificent and the pool Is awesome. There are 4 large hot tubs that we enjoyed too. All the food I had at the hotel was great, but I thought it was a bit overpriced. You need a car to get around. There are many things to do near the Grand Cypress. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Jaymaxx
Reviews.Content: Pricey and small rooms. More of a convention hotel than a family place. Will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: kyleirvine123
Reviews.Content: This was a very good Hotel. It's very close to Disney, Sea World, Aquatica, Wet 'n' wild and both the universals. Had running buses which were 3 leaving to go to sea world and universal at 9.15 picking us up at 6. it's a 10 minute walk to Disney. Had a free Bus taking us to the airport. The food was excellent! Every morning we had our breakfast there. Great choice and great food. The service was also very good. My Family are great lover of golf, and it only cost us $49 to play. That included a buggey and hire clubs and access to the driving range. Had some great restruants nearby, I would recommend, olive gardens, red lobster, T-rexx cafe and uno's. The food in the parks is also very good. Never had Lunch or dinner in the hotel food was quite expensive but sure it would of been great food. The rooms were very clean. The beds were very comfy. All staff were very welcoming. Only bad thing was the Taxi service was awful the didn't know how to get anywhere! Anyway a great holiday and i would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “"Fine if you like small spaces"”
Reviews.Author: lovelymommy_10
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were offered a glass of Champagne, and Jessica at check in was very nice. She told me she was going to upgrade me to a lake view room, when I told her I was there for a birthday weekend. When we got to the room, I looked out the window,and no lake. I asked the bellhop, and he said we were in the garden view...so I guess she does not know how the rooms work? These rooms were the SMALLEST I have ever been in at any hotel. They also have double beds-I cannot imagine a family of four being comfortable here-unless you only sleep there and that is all. Any time longer than 30 minutes in that room, and ywe ou would be tripping all over each other. They only had ONE outlet to use for blow drying, phone charging, whatever....we could not believe there was no other outlets anywhere else in the room. I could not call to find one, because the phones in the room did not work. The biggest issue we encountered was that we called the night before to order our room service breakfast. The next morning, it never came. When I called(from my cell phone) they told me that they never received that order. We had a Spa appointment that morning, so could not wait around for the new breakfast they offered to bring. This was very disappointing. The pillows were comfortable, the beds were of average comfort-generally hard. When we were in the bathroom, we could hear the people next door quite easily. Finally, they decorate the room with glass vases and lamps-if you have kids, they could knock these over easily, and they would definitely break. Seemed an odd choice to me. They do charge a 22 dollar daily fee-so if you go, make sure to try and use their pool, and bikes and rock climbing wall that they are charging you for. If you are always going to be at Disney, I am not sure you would want to stay here-those daily fees add up. Yes, it is a pretty hotel-but just remember, I told you-those rooms are SMALL!!!! Oh, and the toilet and one sink are in the same space, so you can only be in the bathroom one at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: MelissaPC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 2 children over the Thanksgiving week, and it was wonderful! The rooms and views are amazing, staff is excellent and the lobby is beautiful. My boys did enjoy meeting "Merlot" upon arrival. The only snag was that the we couldn't check in right away, but that was due to the people staying in the room before us. Apparently they didn't feel "check out" times referred to them! However, the staff accomodated us as best they could by holding our bags, giving us keys to the Regency and Health clubs, so we had somewhere to relax, or change to go to the pool. I can't blame the hotel for inconsiderate guests. Our room was beautiful, very comfy beds, great views and very clean. Personally, I was very happy to see a Keurig one cup coffee maker in our room. That was very nice! The pool area is absolutely gorgeous. There are 3 pools, one of which is designated as a quiet area. They are attached to a beautiful grotto type building with waterfalls, whirlpools, small indoor pools, the health club and a bar. There is plenty of seating inside and out. Also, the poolside service was excellent. In addition there are bike rentals, paddle boats, a rock wall, sandy beach, hammocks, etc by the lake. Absolutely perfect for families; my children loved it! As for location, it is perfect for those visiting Orlando attractions, but don't necessarily want to stay on one of their properties. From our room, we could see that we were right next to the driveway for Disney. We could actually see all of Disney from the hotel. Sea World is only about 10 minutes away, it was great. This is a wonderful spot, fantastic for families with children and we hope to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit could have been better”
Reviews.Author: expedition17
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this hotel was impeccable. The staff at reception was hospitable and welcomed us with a smile. But on our second visit, the staff seemed a little cold (can't remember the name - "Pav..."). Without asking preferences, we were assigned a room and informed that parking fee in addition to the 22$ resort fee will be charged... Couple of other incidents that altered my view of this hotel are - a soda bottle filled with cigarettes in balcony and some one else invoice sent to our room. The hotel staff was proactive to resolve both issue, although I'm not sure if I would like to go back to this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good but bad acoustics in the rooms and questionable attempts at charges”
Reviews.Author: Mr_VanDerTramp
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited to stay here upon arrival as the hotel looks amazing with fantastic grounds. However I had a hint of things to come when the hotel receptionist who checked us in was about as welcoming as an icicle. When we pointed out that breakfast was included in our rate, she acted as though it was the greatest burden to check the system only to find out that of course it was.  There were other issues with the reception which I'll get to later but there are serious sound issues at the hotel. The rooms ate fantastic but the doors to them are seemingly paper thin which means that every conversation that occurs in the corridor is equally audible in your room. We were woken every day by people chatting, walking etc in the corridor. Please note that we have kids aged 2 & 4 so we wake up early anyway so to be woken by other guests is really saying something.  To add insult to injury, we returned back from the theme parks mid one afternoon only to be greeted by incredibly loud drilling noise from the room above. My wife wasn't feeling great and needed to rest. When I phoned reception to complain I was told that it was maintenance work and I'd have to wait nearly 45 min for it to finish. You don't pay to stay in a hotel room to be disturbed by maintenance work. If there is necessary work then the very least the hotel should do is warn you of the potential disturbance or clear adjacent rooms to the work. After numerous calls telling reception that this was an unsatisfactory situation, a very helpful man called Brian asked the work to stop and provided us with $100 credit. This went some way to compensate but still left us with a very bitter taste in our mouths.  The final straw was when we checked out. The reception tried to charge us extra for using the Internet despite the fact that the resort fee that we had paid for was meant to include this. They tried to argue that our resort fee was a reduced rate and therefore didn't include it! This was never explained to us and so having spoken to the manager they waived it. We then looked again at the bill and they had charged us for breakfast and didn't include the $100 credit! This was rectified but was yet another unnecessary hassle.  So- this is a great looking hotel, lovely rooms, facilities and location. However and this is a big however- there are big problems with the acoustics and the reception fee management is undoubtedly questionable.  I think it's possible that our case might have been unusual but I think it's only fair to share our experience. On the basis of this I still would recommend the hotel but would tell them to be wary.

Reviews.Title: “I found my new home in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: JazmineD_11
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic! Everyone was helpful and friendly. Room service was great! We had breakfast at The Cascade Restaurant and our waiter; Angel was terrific! The egg white omelet was delicious. The grounds are well kept. Our room was comfortable. I am definitely coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gloria G
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, great location, yes there is a resort fee but its worth it to pay a resort fee rather than to stay at a bad hotel. The security guard at the gate is a bonus, feels very safe to stay here. Would recommend to anyone. The only negative is having to pay for parking, other than that I loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnn
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service, wonderful attention to detail, courteous and friendly throughout our stay. From the sparkling wine on arrival to our late check out we were made to feel special. Best hotel breakfast we have ever had, very relaxed and no rush. A great hotel One problem was that the only available evening meal was in the Sports Bar. All others were closed at the time of our stay

Reviews.Title: “Loved every mintue”
Reviews.Author: JNK883
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked this hotel for a night but I will definitely be staying there again. It was great to be away from the craziness of what Orlando has to offer for a day. We checked in at 2pm and didn't leave until 6pm the following day. The facilities were top notch and with so much to do there time just flew by. I know people give out about resort fee but I've stayed in other hotels in Orlando where you pay a resort fee and all that was there was a pool. This place had everything. I went back to my youth going down the slide about 100 times, had the paddle boat, the water bike, the 2 seater bike to cycle around the grounds, a bit of pitch and putt and spent a lot of time just relaxing by the pool. It was exactly what I needed after a busy few weeks of being on the go. The room was really nice as well and we had a view to the front of the hotel. I can't wait to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: JS515
Reviews.Content: Planed a business trip at the Grand Cypress and everything went off without a problem. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I did run into a problem while checking in they gave me another person’s room. They were not pleased when I walked into their room. The pool was nice and large. The staff around the pool was very friendly. The food was average at the pool but they did have good onsite restaurants. The lobby was very interesting with birds in it. My room was clean upon arival. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: sadie520
Reviews.Content: Family vacation to Disney...this Hotel is one of the best Hotels I have been in. From the moment we entered, staff was attentive and courteous. We were greeted with champage at check-in. We were given a tour of the spectacular grounds and the room prioir to check in. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: marshtravel
Reviews.Content: Free Amenities! Par 3 golf, rock climbing, paddle boats, biking! So fun our kids ask to go back all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ruthannA2
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Orlando and probably one of the top Hyatt's I have stayed at. It definately rivals anything I've seen in Hawaii. The pool is amazing. I really like all of the activities that are available here. Some of the rooms have views of the fireworks at Disneyworld. Be aware that there is a resort fee which includes parking.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: KimAustin
Reviews.Content: Visited family for Thanksgivings, love the rooms, love the amenities, the kids love the slides at the pool. NOTE: smaller pool is heated during the cold time, and the large one was not. Great stay, great hotel, nice/helpful staff, great location!

Reviews.Title: “GO: THERE'S NOTHING STOPPING YOU!”
Reviews.Author: Wingnut57
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay here in late October 2011 and it was the so relaxing and enjoyable. The room was spacious, the staff treats you like royalty and the surroundings at this place are outstanding. When you check in, they even offer you a glass of champagne! The pool is a place where you could spend practically all of your down time easily, and if you prefer to do so, you don't even have to leave your lounge chair to get food and drinks. Of course, that luxury comes with a price, but if you can afford to splurge, it's worth it. There is a waterfall at the pool and also a heated pool, in addition to conveniently placed whirlpool saunas throughout the pool complex. There is even a swinging bridge over one of the pools! I took a little time to tour the property and it was worth it. There is a golf course, a little western themed areas for kids in the summer, beautiful landscaping, a lake where you can take advantage of all kinds of watersports and even a fire pit to spend sitting by the fire on a cool evening. Good food at the restaurants there, too. The lobby is beautiful and even has two tropical birds to entertain you. We never got there, but if you wanted to go to Disney World, it is only a few miles away. It's close to many of the Orlando attractions. Also, we had a corner room that afforded us the ability to be able to view the fireworks from both the Magic Kingdom and Epcot each night. This hotel truly lives up to the "Grand" part of its name. I would love to go back and would not hestitate.

Reviews.Title: “Our kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in May, with access to the lounge, which was great for a light breakfast with the kids. We thought to split the trip between this hotel and the other Hyatt at the beach, and loved this one so much that we cut the beach part of the vacation short and came back here. The service was great. The ladies at the lounge were very attentive, remembered our kids names and were very helfpul. The pool was great, heated with a small side (section that we frequented). It was a much cheaper place than others we have been to and the level of service and cleanliness of the rooms and public areas were above our expectations. We did go to Disney for the day and took our own car. It felt like a really long day for our little ones, and frankly the rides were no better than Point Pleasant beach! I will skip Disney for a year or two until the kids are old enough for more rides.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent example of hyatt high standards- shame hotel renovation work wad not mentioned up front”
Reviews.Author: Activesgreysyork
Reviews.Content: Pricey therefore good for holiday stay rather than work. Local taxes are high. Parking extra $11 - WHY?

Reviews.Title: “Still a Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: edyrp
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of being a guest at this property numerous times, and I am still amazed at how magnificently maintained the property is. The rooms are large and beautifully renovated in a contemporary fashion. There are plenty of sockets for charging electronics. The air conditioning worked well, and they have added a ceiling fan to the room, which is a nice touch. The bathroom has been completely re-built, with a Toto toilet and large shower with two sprayers. The lighting in the bathroom is excellent. The bed is comfortable and the sheets are high thread-count for extra comfort. There is a large, full-length mirror in the room. The room and common areas of the resort were spotless. There is plenty of room for suitcases, in the closet, and in the drawers. There is also a lot of surface area on the desk and credenza in the room. The toiletries that are provided are generous at two ounces each. There was no outside noise in the peaceful hotel room. Around the grounds, the ponds, lagoons, bridges, nature trail, flowers, and golf course are impeccably groomed. There is some unobtrusive renovation going on outside. The staff was polite and helpful. There were delicious food options at the resort. What more could anyone want?

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: Drounds1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many different hotels and my stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress this past weekend was exceptional. The hotel property was excellent as always, but the staff there this year was excellent. Didn't do Disney so had no reason to go there, but some of the people in our group did and thought the distance wasn't a problem. The golf course was in the best shape I have seen it, probably because the LPGA is playing there this week. Overall it was an excellent experience at this hotel. Drounds

Reviews.Title: “Not practical for Families with Small Children”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grande Cypress is on acres of beautifully manicured grounds with casscading waterfalls, trees and flowers. It is very close to Downtown Disney but because it was built before DTD, there is no conveinent pathway there. You have to go past the front gate onto Apoka and Vineland, walk until you get to Hotel Boulavard. This takes over half an hour to walk. There are no shuttles to DTD and a cab is about $12. For the $22 a day "resort fee" there should be a shuttle that goes there, if only a couple of times a day. The bus that goes to the Disney Ticket and Transportation Centre runs only twice a morning, thats it. It returns twice in the evening only. A cab costs about $25 without tip. The staff is very pleasant and efficent, but you need to ask very direct questions as they are not forthcoming with information. The reason I titled this is because I think the balconies are hazardous for toddlers and small/overactive kids if they're not watched 24/7. The hotel goes very high, 17 stories and the balcony railings (outside the room and inside facing the atrium) are only waist high. This would get very tiring for parents constantly being on alert. If a person is afraid of heights, ask for a groundfloor room or go else where. The "general store" was almost never opened and the nearest sundries/snack store is 7/11 a 5- 10 minute walk from the front gate. If you need milk in the middle of the night or a bag of chips, this is your only option, unless you order very expensive room service. Rooms are a very modern design that has little privacy if you have kids. The shower has only a half glass door, toilet and sink are all in same room. You can't lock the bathroom door!! It has a very strange sliding door that also opens the closet, making it very inconveninent. Everything is a very open, miniumal modern concept that looks great in magazines but really lacks functionality and practicality with kids. The pool is beautiful/huge with a waterslide that is open til about 6pm, but is quite chilly (not heated) so if you have little ones that don't have alot of meat on their bones, its way too cold!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: nopetsal
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Robert and all the staff we had a great time here in Nov. The pool, lake, boats, golf were a great addition to our Orlando vacation. Our rooms were great, love the hot tubs and pool slides. One tip, do NOT pay extra for Regency Club. Offerings not substantial enough for the price. We used the morning shuttles to Disney parks but took taxis home because did not want to wait for shuttles. Taxi only $20 for minivan for our family. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Golf Course”
Reviews.Author: Elio R
Reviews.Content: if you like golf you have play this place. North,South East and the new course are all great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Hotelier
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights for a business trip, and really wish I could have had more time to enjoy the amenities of this hotel!! There is so much to do which is all included in the rate. I will definitely visit this hotel in the future when I have more time to play!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Weird Plumbing”
Reviews.Author: Lamb68116
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It was clean and the staff was supurb. I visited on business so I liked the fact that the business meeting rooms were in close proximity to the elevators. I did not go swimming but the pools were very nice. One wrapped around into a cave-like structure and was really cool-looking. The only thing I didn't care for was the shower. First of all there was only one door which covered half of the tub/shower area so it was very cold. Also, maybe I'm old fashioned but there were so many knobs that I had trouble figuring out how the shower worked. After finally figuring it out, the shower head was one where the water falls straight down (like a rainfall). This was very nice except it didn't protrude very far and I had to stand very close to the wall to rinse off and I kept stepping on the plug so the tub began filling up several times. Other than the weird shower experience, it was a very nice hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kayleeyes
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went to Orlando for a long weekend. We usually stay at a Hilton but wanted to try something else. We loved the Hyatt! The grounds are breathtaking. Hyatt DOES know what customer service means. Everyone was very nice and even housekeeping asked us if we needed anything (while walking in hallway). I did not like the bathroom/closet door. The door doesn't even lock. Overall the room was very nice. The pool is amazing. They had the fire pit burning on Sunday night, made you feel like you were really on vacation! Room service was very good. Ordered from the cafe near the pool, food was okay but expensive. The drinks from the bar (pool area) are very expensive and not good. I returned one drink because it was so nasty I couldn't drink more than one sip. Needless to say, we didn't order any more drinks from that bar. The location of the hotel is in a perfect area. So close to everything. We plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hansenjg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property as part of a convention but was very impressed with the hotels service and amenities. Greeted with champange at check in, very modern and clean room and a hotel full of great restaurants and amenities. Close to downtown Disney and all the other attractions so plenty of fun things to do after a long day of meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KLM297
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 15 minutes to Universal and all the Disney attractions as well as conveniently located to the main highways for getting to Tampa, Space Coast etc. For that alone i think it was worth the cost. The rooms are a good standard and Hemingways restaurant is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: Sandi B
Reviews.Content: I was frankly surprised to see this hotel's overall rating so high, as our group of 25 all had much the same opinion. But upon reading poor reviews, I get there's been a change in the recent past. On the positive side - I like the modern decor. Check in was quick with friendly people, champagne is a nice touch. Concierge, bellhops, valet, room service, wake-up call people all polite, friendly, helpful. The landscaping is beautiful. On the negative side - The shower! There's only half a door. No matter how careful we tried to be, every shower led to the floor and bathmat being soaked and water everywhere. No matter how hot the water, and even if the bathroom door is closed, it's still chilly. It's just a bad design. Also, trying to figure out how the shower works is a challenge. There are no hooks to hang bathrobes, and only one very short towel rack. The bathroom/closet door - it's a sliding door, so either the bathroom is closed or the closet is closed but you can't close (or open) both at the same time. It's an accident waiting to happen, and it's annoying. Despite the fact that the decor is pretty and looks newly done, there's a certain shabbiness to areas that is noticeable. In the open elevator, you can see beams and structures need a good paint job. Overall the pool area is beautiful but it needs more attention with general upkeep. The only restaurant we went to was the Palm Cafe when we first arrived. We walked in and it looked like it was closed. Thinking we'd get service outside, we walked out and were told by a waiter that we ordered inside and they brought it out. So we went back in, ordered and went back out. (We saw this scenario repeated with many people, all wandering by us asking where they were suppose to order.) The only open table had not been cleaned - 3 beer cans and the surface was obviously not wiped. The food came out pretty quickly and while the basic order was right, details were not (toppings, etc.). The waiter was about to walk away without taking the beer cans, so we called him back. The maid service was so-so. I always had to look at the beds to see if they'd come because they never neatened up the dresser area. I know they don't want to touch things but we've been in enough hotels to know what it should look like. I never saw a card to indicate whether we wanted the sheets changed, and they were not changed. I spilled soda on a pillow case and noticed that night that it was not changed. Also, each consecutive night (3) the sheets got more and more loose. THE SPA - If you look forward to a good hotel spa, this isn't it. I only went for a pedicure but talked to others in our group that did massages and facials. The odd thing is we were all very happy with the person who provided whatever service we got. But the spa itself looks just like an old nail place in a strip mall. No decor, no ambiance, badly in need of paint and a new ceiling (water damage), mismatched furniture, general shabbiness and old equipment. A TV was on the whole time, and staff used their cell phones. Definitely not a spa atmosphere! It really looks like an old Walmart nail salon rather than a Hyatt spa. The bottom line is it's a nice hotel but really needs some top-notch management to correct problems. And it either needs to put in a real spa or not advertise that there is a spa. My overall rating is low because we really do expect more from a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mrsooner
Reviews.Content: VERY impressed by this Hyatt. When we checked in, we were treated with the best customer service I have experienced at any Orlando hotel. And the renovated rooms were excellent, and very clean. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the HRGC”
Reviews.Author: murfb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 3 nights on October, and had a wonderful experience. We had already done the whole Disney resort thing, and this trip were seeking a hotel with an awesome pool and central location for Universal, Sea World, Legoland & WDW. We definitely got what we were looking for with the HR. The location was so close to everything we were doing, and the room was very nice. Although room was a tad small for a family of 4 to share 1 room, we weren't in there long enough at a time to really be bothered by it. The kids were blown away by the pool (despite it being fairly chilly for swimming when we were there)....totally on par with the best pools offered at Disney resorts! There were also window-washers there in another part of the hotel while we were there, so it seems they have addressed the dirty windows mentioned by others. We did not notice any uncleanliness. We did not love the parking and resort fee, but the price of our room was so reasonable compared with all the WDW and Universal resorts that we still came out ahead. Overall a great experience, and we would definitely return on a future trip to the area if we do not stay on WDW property.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, awesome surroundings, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_Houston
Reviews.Content: Orlando isn't just WDW and this hotel proves it. BUT they have a WDW free shuttle all day and half the night so you can enjoy both worlds! The renovated rooms are colorful yet relaxing and the CLEAN windows and balconies open up to beautiful vistas showing water and golf and tennis opportunities. The concierge is soooo helpful and the restaurants are VERY good. I love the atrium with all the Japanese touches and the talking bird is a big hit with the kids and parents too. Pool is great too. Close to other restaurants by car or the hotel can take you. Lots of free parking when I was there this summer. I prefer staying here rather than on WDW property so I can enjoy the other things that Orlando has to offer too.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: mckee0322
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a work trip. My conference was at another hotel with the overflow rooms being at the Hyatt. While it was inconvenient to have to travel back and forth each day, coming back to my very well appointed room each evening was a huge plus. The rooms are stylishly decorated and modern. The shower was a welcome retreat after long days of meetings. Room service was fantastic (delicious food and courteous staff). Service in the Palm Cafe and the White Horse Bar left something to be desired, but did not make a bad impression on the overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay”
Reviews.Author: lavisitor106
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt Grand Cypress and we had one of the best experiences. Service is great, food is good and excellent service. My really enjoyed the pool which was open 24/7. There are a lot of fun activites within the property. The property is beautiful and the rooms are very nice and clean. We will definitely stay there next time we go back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: bamafan43
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect from Check in to check out. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay completly perfect. The renovation in the tune of $45 million is now complete and the rooms are top notch..Pool was great. Hemmingways fantastic. Highly recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Studios (DONT GO TO DISNEYWORLD AS ITS FILTHY)”
Reviews.Author: peter_glazier
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel on previous occasions and it just gets better. We were on the Club Floor and the facilities there were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: 1415HenryFive
Reviews.Content: .The hotel is being repainted therefore allot of the doors balconies cannot be opened and the windows where very dirty. The rooms where dusty (may be linked to building work) and interior windows had not been cleaned (could see child’s writing in dirt), giving impression of a degree of neglect. The hotel was built I think in 84 and though it has been refitted feels that it is getting tired in some areas. I had booked in for 7 nights checked out after 1. The quality of the experience did not match what I was paying, if you can get a cheap deal you could consider it but check if building work still going on. The hotel has some very good people but their efforts could not match the challenges. I would personally avoid Hyatt in the future

Reviews.Title: “probably will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee53217
Reviews.Content: Ok, maybe I was over expectant based on reviews. Grounds are pristine and beautiful, but warning, only about 35% of the pool space is heated, there are almost no swimmers in most of the frigid pool area. The bikes are great to have, but horribly maintained, really in terrible condition. There are 3 hot tubs, but only 1 had working jets. There are about 1,500 acres of property at this resort but they still charge $11 per day for parking? Restaurants are expensive, but we booked with resort credit so we ate at the resort daily. There are always parties and conventions booked at this resort, I personally like to be on vacation with vacationers not dripping in the elevator with everyone in business suits. Rooms are very upscale, the balcony areas in the room are only good for standing, not sitting outside. I still give this 4 stars, because it earns it, amenities are plentiful. We probably will not be back, we like the large suites of the Hilton Vacation Club, pools are big and heated, plus we can drink juice on the lanai in the morning read the paper and enjoy the climate.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Cypress moving toward Grand Fees, but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheAviator2
Reviews.Content: Boy, this is a tough one... I LOVE the Grand Cypress, always have. You probably picked up on a little animosity from the title of my review. I'll get the ugly stuff out of the way quickly. The combination of the resort fee AND a parking fee has crossed the line of what I consider good business. Parking should be included in the resort fee. Do a comparison to other hotels in the area... You aren't going to find BOTH fees being leveraged by more than one or two properties. Not even Disney, the KING of capitalism, charges for parking when you are a guest at their hotel. So, why charge it at Grand Cypress?? My recommendation, include the parking charge with the resort fee and even consider making the resort fee an optional add-on. For those guests that are going to use the services it includes, it's actually a really great deal. But, when you levy it without giving your guest a choice, it should just be rolled into the rate--period. OK, enough of the gripes regarding recent changes. If you are looking for an exceptionally pleasant place to hang your hat, Grand Cypress is wonderful for doing so. The staff are really great here and try to make your stay memorable as much as they can. The rooms are comfortable, but not overwhelming. The recent renovation took the hotel from a "Key West" style motif to a more modern look and appeal. Overall, I like what they changed. Love the birds in the lobby atrium--Kula has always been my favorite!! The pool is unique and a great place to spend a day. Plenty of activities to try out and the tennis courts are EXCELLENT here! How many hotels have clay courts you can play on?? (not many!) Playing tennis on clay courts makes the resort fee worth it by itself, but then again, I'm a tennis player and appreciate it. I still think the resort fee should be optional to give guests a choice. Food and beverage at Grand Cypress doesn't disappoint, but I will say that the Regency Club appears to be declining in quality and offerings. Grand Cypress used to be able to even pride themselves as being one of the only properties in the Hyatt system to offer a complimentary cocktail on their Club floor (which should be the standard), but even they have gone the other way and now charge for drinks. Oh well.... I've never used the buses for the parks, but it's nice to have the option if you don't want to drive. For the staff--well done! For the management--reconsider your recent changes in policies and operations. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Alemati
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 9 nights to go to Disney and Universal. The hotel is fantastic and most important to me the staff were extremely friendly with my children. My first choice in Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great night at the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: geekie
Reviews.Content: Booked this place on Priceline and was not disappointed! While I think that the 'resort fee' of $22.00 was a bit steep, it did include a chip and putt golf course, use of bike and boats as well as activities at the pool and wireless internet; for one night the fee was tolerable but it would certainly add up for a longer stay. But enough about that....This place is fantastic!! Friendly service from the valet to the towel hut attendants; rooms clean, comfortable beds and picture perfect grounds. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants as there are plenty in the area. Beautiful pool area with a waterslide though the pool temp was a bit cool, only one pool was heated. The lounge chairs were top of the line, some of the most comfortable I've been in! There was even a 'quiet area' if you wanted to be away from all the kids. Not far from the Disney parks, close to Downtown Disney and transportation offered by shuttle or towncar. I can't say enough good about this place and will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Dare I say, PERFECT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: linda s
Reviews.Content: We just came home from 2 days at the most lovely resort I think I have ever been to! The Grand Cypress was an add on to our short trip to Orlando for my sisters wedding. It was to be our 29th wedding anniversary also that weekend so we thought we would stretch out the weekend with something for us. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty! This was my second Hyatt stay in the past couple of months. (the last in Tampa ) I have to say, Hyatt has customer service down to a science and all the big chains could take more than a few lessons from them. When we mentioned that friends we coming to visit us for the time we were there, but staying somewhere else, they handed me free parking passes for them. It was also mentioned that this was our 29th anniversary and magically, an hour later, champagne and chocolate strawberries appeared in our room! When I called with a question or to thank the desk for our treat , they answered my call , "Hello Mrs Sarine, is there some we can help you with?". Once again, customer service to the top! Robes and slippers were delivered without asking. Very nice! Every, and I mean every, employee we passed in the hallways or lobbies or pool area, always greeted us with a smile and asked if we were having a good time and did we need anything! Unheard of! We had made reservations for their famous Sunday buffet and what a treat that was! We have been on many cruises and none of them equaled the presentation and selection and taste that this experience did! We stayed for 3 1/2 hours sipping champagne and listening to beautiful piano music! All of this included in the price! Upon leaving, our table servers gave us hugs and wished us many more years of happiness! Never has any restaurant done that! All in all, the building , the amenities, the service, the people, the food, ( we also ate the night before at the white horse. Fabulous !!), was over the top! We WILL go back again and we WILL recommend the Grand Cypress to all of our friends and family! Thank you Grand Cypress for a most memorable 29th wedding anniversary!!! Linda and Scott Sarine.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Katznduncs
Reviews.Content: Stayed between 4th and 17 October 2011 and cannot fault the hotel, staff or anything about the hotel. Views spectacular. Can't wait to go back. Thanks Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Esther32
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, currently under construction.Noise all day until 4:30. Wish they had told us beforehand. We are here for a professional meeting but could have stayed elsewhere if we had known. Hotel full of young children and all that comes with. Though a large resort, only two restaurants open for dinner. The fancy one and a sports bar. Make sure you have a rental car. Staff tries hard and is responsive where possible. Long walk to self-parking. Also for Hyatt prices we expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: MJRLdal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt October 2nd to October 6th. This is my 3rd stay at this hotel. Here is a summary of the hotel. Location Hyatt is only a 20 minute ride from the Orlando airport. The location is excellent and very close to Disney and Downtown Disney. You can even see the fireworks at night if your room faces west. Rooms & Service Every employee at this hotel is friendly and willing to assist in any way. From the front desk to the maid cleaning the room everyone is helpful and nice. The attendants at the pool area are excellent as well. They are quick to fetch your drinks or food and can answer just about any question you have regarding the hotel. All rooms have a balcony but ask for the pool or lagoon view they have the best views. From most of the rooms you can see Disney and the fireworks at night. Try to take time and eat at Hemmingway’s. The atmosphere is very quiet and nice. Take time to have a drink at the intimate bar or even sit out on the patio (it is screened so you don’t have to worry about the bugs at night. This is very relaxing and I always find time to have a drink at Hemmingway’s. Checkout very smooth and they have several self kiosk machines to checkout so no need to wait at the front desk. However they always have plenty of staff at the front desk so there is rarely a wait upon check in or check out. Overall great value for the money you will be treated like you are staying at the most expensive hotel in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect escape!”
Reviews.Author: pineGermany
Reviews.Content: I stayed six nights with my three children. Our days were dedicated to amusement parks, but the hotel was a relaxing, calm, beautiful, friendly and delightful oasis in our trip. The staff was friendly, welcoming and helpful. The restaurants were relaxed while still retaining a professional standard. The architecture of the pool is astonishing. The room was not recently renovated, but had a very well-maintained and clean feel to it. The balcony was only about 10 inches deep, but still sufficient for seeing the fireworks after dark. I appreciated the clientele which was internationally mixed, as well as a mix of family and business guests. My only complaint: the WiFi was disappointingly slow, given that I paid $20+ per night for the "free" service. Otherwise, the hotel was good value for the money and I recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress!”
Reviews.Author: hopesicle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt with our 2 year old and we loved it. The lobby is very impressive, with beautiful landscaping complete with a parrot! The room was perfect for us; our toddler slept easily on the couch in the room without us having to even use the pull-out bed. Everything at the resort was clean, comfortable and beautiful. The one negative is that the way the bathroom and closet share a door, so you cannot have the bathroom and the closet open at the same time, we were constantly sliding back and forth but all things considered, this was a minor inconvenience. The most impressive thing about the resort is the pool. The seemingly endless pool that just goes on forever and forever, winds around through "caves" and everything...you just have to see it to believe it. There is a drawbridge and water slide too--amazing. In fact there are lots of outdoor activities at the hotel. However, it was pouring rain the entire time we were there so we weren't able to take advantage of any of them. I would definitely recommend this hotel and we hope to stay there in the future when we are visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: IH8ILUV
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by first saying I am so very particular about hotels and cleanliness so it took me literally like 5 months to choose Hyatt. I researched and researched and looked at practically every review on tripadvisor before finally settling. I still had reservations but this resort was ranked extremely high so I went with it. With that being said: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress is absolutely gorgeous! From the walk through the front door to the room itself. The lobby area is amazing. Upon arrival at 9:30pm we received a glass of champagne and check in was fast. (however the night staff couldn't give much information in regards to transportation besides their shuttle which only left like once a day). When we got to our 10th floor room I was truly stunned at how clean it was. Not amazingly clean, but very clean. I found a stain on one of my pillows that looked like marker (not like body fluid or anything). There was a small stain on the chaisse lounge chair but nothing so bad I couldn't look over it. I absolutely loved that the shower was NOT directly next to the toilet. For some reason that just grosses me out. The toilet was in its own private little space. The tub was cool but only had one door that swung out. LOL! kind of weird. The bathroom door and closet door are one in the same. *Watch your hand when closing it though because I smashed mine :( We had a poolside view along with a view of Epcot so we were able to watch the firework show every night! (You don't have to get a poolside view to see the show though you can just stand in the hallway) We took a tour of the entire resort at night and it was breathtaking. My 4 year old son had a ball going up and down on the glass elevator. There are so many beautiful waterfalls and exotic plants and trees to see. Merlot the bird is gorgeous! The pools are freezing even though they saiy its heated. That was really only the part I didn't care for. The beachfront is so beautiful. We did the paddleboats for about 10 minutes but our legs started hurting so we had to turn around. Transportation: Really does suck as far as the resort goes. They have a shuttle that takes you to Disney at 8:10a and 10a and comes back at 6p and 9:45p and to Seaworld at 9:15p. Thanks to the day crew concierge we were able to figure out that Lynx bus runs right around the corner from the resort every 30-35 minutes on the hour. You just have to know how to to work it. $2 bucks each way and kids ride free. Since the resort was such a long walk to the front we called the Resort shuttle to pick us up from the security desk every night to take us back up to the resort. We did the same thing when we wanted to go out for the day. Food: We only ate the breakfast buffet once and it's good but not the greatest. Not sure it's worth $21. They did have a nice variety though. They were doing construction on the rooms but we didn't notice any noise. The staff were very friendly. Day crew seems a little more informed than night crew.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service”
Reviews.Author: Lori H
Reviews.Content: The facilities are well-described by other reviews. I want to commend the hotel staff for their service. We accidentally left a bag of clothing behind (after a giant trip to Disney and Universal, we had a lot of stuff). Upon returning home, we realized we were missing items so we contacted the 2 hotels we had stayed at in Orlando. One hotel affiliated with a major attraction in the area didn't even bother to look, telling us they had nothing from housekeeping. (Really? Nothing at all? Despite however many rooms you have?) The Hyatt Recency, however, had our items and could tell us our room number and date of checkout. They shipped it to us and even called to check that the items arrived. We will definitely stay here the next time we are in Orlando. [Incidentally, the pool is incredible.]

Reviews.Title: “$33 dollar fees are ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: mattnewyork
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting a good deal , but the extra $33 fees ($22 resort fee and $11 self-parking) ruined the whole trip for me. It is deceitful and ruined my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sara30003
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the UK after a wonderful 2 week stay at this hotel. This was infact our second consecutive vacation there & we have already booked again for next year. All the staff we met were so friendly & helpful, in particular Brandi on reception & Tami, Angel, Abe, Attmane & Gary who helped make a wonderful start to our day at breakfast each morning. The only thing that wasn't so good & worth mentioning was the loud, intrusive music piped around the poolside, even around the designated quiet area. We don't remember this during our last visit & meant we could never fully relax around the pool, hopefully the hotel may have a rethink on this decision by next year. Many people have complained about the resort fee, but this is well advertised when booking & the hotel is so lovely & the facilities excellent so we don't begrudge paying it. We're very much looking forward to our return & hopefully seeing Kula & Merlot again :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Heather934
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 weeks at this hotel, it was wonderful room spacious and great facilities we knew about the fees but thought it was well worth it! Had so much fun staff all very friendly heard no noise do not listen to negative reviews, we will be back just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff, Shame About the Fees !”
Reviews.Author: snourous
Reviews.Content: Stayed 14 nights in Sept / Oct 2011. Booked through Virgin Holidays and got free self parking, room upgrade and free breakfast. Great hotel with very nice rooms. All hotel staff we met were excellent, very polite, helpful and friendly. Can't find a single thing to complain about apart from the extra fees they charge. Yes we knew about this before we went and so it's our fault for choosing a hotel that charges a resort fee ($22 day) when we only spent 2 days of the 14 using the facilities. From next year they'll charge a $11 day self park fee as well. So despite us having a great stay we won't return - there are many other great hotels in vicinity that don't charge these extras.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on one previous occasion and everything was the same as before. We stayed in an Executive suite and had access to an Executive Lounge and the staff in this Lounge were very helpful and friendly. We found it a bit tucked away and the additional fees annoying but on the whole it was a very pleasant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great golf course”
Reviews.Author: rwgrncrd
Reviews.Content: While I generally detest resorts that charge a mandatory "resort" fee I didn't mind getting unlimited range balls at the golf course. The rooms are very modern, updated and in great condition. The hotel is very big but I found the service to be personal and very good. The golf course has 45 holes, 18 of which mimic the old course in St Andrews. The food, drinks and service at the club house were excellent! This is Orlando so It was nice to feel like we were staying somewhere else. There are no real views to speak of except possibly buildings on the Disney property and the Florida trees/swamps. Don't pay extra it's not worth it. I split my time on a business trip and a golf trip with my wife. The conference facitlies were great and the food was good. The pool and the sandy "beach" area next to the lagoon were big enough to handle a packed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Something had changed”
Reviews.Author: Vilix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year and loved it. Now stayed there again but something had changed. I don't know what, where or when but it didn't feel extraordinary any more. Everything was clean, the pool was great but still... Would stay there again thou. During this visit I found that they have self laundry facilities at the game room. It was not mentioned anywhere. It was ok but double the price of Disney hotel. 4$ here, at Disney hotel only 2$. Disney had better machines. Beds are very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Service Saved the Day”
Reviews.Author: Moondogge
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Hyatt Grand Cypress this year, and I still hold true to it being one of the nicest resorts in Orlando. I am very dissapointed that upon my return this month that a self parking fee of $11 had been added in addition to the resort fee of $22. In May, the self parking was included in the $22 resort fee. In addition, I was not informed upon check in that there was a fee for parking. I did not find out until my wife joined me on the last day and they told her. I feel that $22 for a resort fee and $11 to self park is absolutely ridiculous and price gouging. For the extra $33/night I will choose to stay in different resort going forward. It is a shame because the Grand Cypress is a great property. The highlight of the stay was Rafael at the front desk. In my frustration with the parking fee, he kept me calm and really resurrected my stay with his customer service. So in summary, be aware of the double fees now implemented and you might want to weigh other options for your Disney stay and even consider the actual Disney Resort hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time, was hoping for a great time!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingkanes
Reviews.Content: Overall nice experience, but we just kept running into little and annoying issues. At check-in it was obvious that the hotel was not busy, so we asked for a room with a nice view. The front desk person was very nice and gave us our key card and a complimentary glass of champagne. We arrived in our room opened the curtains and found that our view was of the parking lot, back down to the front desk my husband went. Second room did have a much better view. As for the room, we found it comfortable and the bathroom to be nicely updated. I have to agree with another post that commented that the bathroom was not cleaned properly; there was black hair on the floor, totally disgusting. We did have adequate towels and toiletries. We also called for an item we forgot and it was brought to the room quickly. The shower is very nice. Also, the rooms are either paper thin or people have no respect for others. We could hear the family next to us yelling and carrying on at 12am on 2 seperate occasions. We ate at the White horse twice and both times my meal arrived cold, but I fell in love with the waitress Marcella, she was a doll! She was fun and sincere and we just loved her, so we just let the food being cold and taking forever go the first night, by the second visit we were completly annoyed and had to ask for a manager. We arrived before a family of 4 and they had ordered, eaten and left the restraunt before we even received our meal. The issue was addressed by the manager, the servers were the only thing keeping it from being a terrible experience. The grounds and the pool were fantastic! My husband and I enjoyed the paddle boats, the bikes (first time out my bike had a flat tire), played ping pong (they charge .25 for the ball, LOL), and stayed at the pool as much as possible. The pool has a 2 slides and on one of the days there was barely anyone at the pool and we joined some other adults and had a great time on the large slide. The pool service was great! They have a quiet area and as a couple traveling this really appealed to us (just wish those with children would pay attention to the signs). As others have mentioned, forget about the shuttle, totally inconvienent. Leaves 2 times in the morning and comes back 2 times in the evening. We went to the Halloween event at Magic Kingdom and ended up having to take the towncar. It was $25 one way, we then had to take a taxi back at midnight, that was about $18, add the tip in and we paid almost $60 round trip. We still figure that between the car rental fee, disney parking fee and hotel parking fee it, it ended up being about the same. Most of the employees we met and received service from were awesome! Loved JP at Cascades for breakfast and Bob at Palm Cafe for lunch. Overall, we had a nice time, just not a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect Resort Hotel In Orlando”
Reviews.Author: cdinlondon
Reviews.Content: We go to Orlando quite frequently and have stayed at a number of properties, (we have enjoyed almost all of them) The Hyatt Grand Cypress though was one of our favourites. The hotel has recently been renovated, and the rooms include a nice flat screen TV, comfortable beds and linens, and a little balcony where if you are on the back end of the building you can sit out and see the fireworks at Disney. Contrary to what a previous review stated every staff member we encountered was helpful and informative. They even gave us a welcome glass of champagne at check in which I found to be a nice touch. The lobby of the hotel is quite impressive with the soaring atrium which is open all the way up the 18 floors of the hotel. The hotel is located a short walk to literally 50 restaurants and an easy drive to all the sights in Orlando. The best part of the resort however is all the things to do. They have a wonderful pool, with a small slide, and a slightly larger one, and it is open 24 hours, except when lightning is in the area. The hotel is on its own lake, and they have pedal boats, windsurfing etc available (included in the resort fee, which I will discuss later) They also have an extensive jogging trail, a pitch and putt course along the lake, and bikes that you can take all around the property. We did not plan on golfing but they had a fantastic special for $79 for hotel guests which included unlimited golf (we played 27 holes) rental clubs, shoes, 6 golf balls and transportation to the 45 holes of Jack Nicklaus golf at the Grand Cypress Golf club. The reason I said it was almost perfect though is because of the fees. I booked on priceline so I was not aware of the fees before I booked, we did get a terrific rate of $70 per night on priceline, but you do have to pay $22 resort fee, and either $23 for valet parking or $11 for self parking (the lot is easy to find, and unless you are really unlucky should not be more than a 5 minute walk to the elevators). I really hate that so many hotels are now doing this, I for one would never book a hotel directly that had a resort fee. Having said that compared to many hotels that offer very little for the resort fee, you do get bike rentals, paddle boat rentals, free use of the pitch and putt, local calls, wired internet so there is some potential for value, but the vast majority of guests probably dont use those on a daily basis. If you are planning on staying in Orlando to enjoy the beautiful weather then I would highly recommend this property, if however you are going primarily to explore the parks I would save some money and look for a little more cost effective property without the resort or parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “great swimming pool and jacussi”
Reviews.Author: mango34
Reviews.Content: excelent place to stay. it was a pity that Hemingway restaurant was not open yet. White horse restaurant on the other hand was OK. Excelent dinner but had to wait a lot for it. At least we did a lot of talking in the meantime. The man at the valet parking is a kind of character. Very pleased. I will recommed this hotel, and with a very good price indeed (70 USD a night before tax). Beware only that parking is 23 USD a day

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the Hyatt name.”
Reviews.Author: frank3355
Reviews.Content: First I'll list the good: Beautiful propery, great pool, fun boating on the lake, good beds and showers in the rooms, nice TVs, nice gym, great location for Disney. But the bad points are much longer: The first negative was trying to find the parking lot. They had 2 or 3 signs that we passed pointing ahead to 'self parking', but then nothing to actually indicate where it actually was, so we drove by it twice before guessing that it was one of the turns that we had passed because it had a gate further down the road.
