I would think that an actual sign posted at the entrance to the parking lot might be a good idea. Next was dealing with the front desk staff. They were all very young and very clueless. They didn't have our room ready despite reserving a month earlier and calling a week earlier to confirm. Now this wasn't at 1pm, this was at 7pm, and it was, according to a staff member, their slowest week of the year. During this early experience and all subsequent dealings with the front desk staff we fully learned how incompetent they were. The room decor was awful. Before reading that it was actually a recent upgrade, I truly thought it was some really old out of style stuff desperate for an upgrade. Then I read that it actually looked that way intentionally! Now I'm not very stylish, but I'm pretty sure that the Brady Bunch living room look is not the current style. It reminded me of stepping into my aunts 'funky' 1970s living room in her trailer when I was little. I could almost smell the incense burning. The 'Disney Shuttle' is a joke. Despite basically being on Disney property, they only had one or 2 trips to Disney each day. So you either go on their time schedule or you're out of luck. The maid service was also bad. Maybe I'm picky about maid service, but to find 8-inch hairs still in the sink and wet washcloths on the floor of the shower after a cleaning doesn't impress me. One day after having ice in the bucket the night before, we returned after the cleaning to find that the maid had returned the bucket to its spot on the dresser, but still with the melted dirty water from the prior night. And if you like new soap each day forget it. After using the same soap for 4 days I finally threw out the stub that was left and still got no replacement. I had to go grab some from the maid's cart myself. Of course I can't neglect to complain about the fees. Even with our great $116 AAA rate, the $22 resort fee, 12.5% taxes and $12 parking fee took it to over $160/nt. That's almost a 40% tax in my opinion which is absurd. Has anyone seen any other property that charges a resort fee AND a parking fee? In the end, the real downside of this place is the terrible service. I think my girlfriend described this place perfectly at one point when she said that it seemed like the actual staff had taken a vacation and it was now being run by their children. (One of the staff members actually told me she was 17 years old) I just cancelled my next reservation that I had planned here for next month and will be staying somewhere else. If service is impotant to you, you should do the same. But if you only care about a great pool and other fun resort activities, this place might be okay for you.

Reviews.Title: “First class service/top notch Golfing”
Reviews.Author: Luke084
Reviews.Content: Dont let the exterior fool you. Upon arrival, the building itself looks quite dated, I was thinking this was another make shift 1980s FL property that was half updated, that you see so often in Orlando. But the lobby, rooms, grounds, and facilities are very modern and updated. Very nice rooms, beautiful lobby, expansive and beautiful grounds surround this huge property. The pool is the focal point of the property and its tremendous. This a resort, so there are many differant activities to keep both adults and children happy. The focus is clearly on service, and the staff was friendly and attentive, across the board. We were there mainly for the golf - and they have one 18 hole and 3 nine holes that are phenomenal courses. The entire golf facility is top notch, the bar area is very nice, with new tvs and great food. There is a steakhouse there as well which was very good. Overall, a beautiful place, with a lot to offer all types of vacationers and first rate service. Be aware though, this place is not cheap. Maybe more a function of Orlando, but everything at the hotel is expensive. One complaint, limited late night food options - it was pretty much room service or nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great for families”
Reviews.Author: asplashgirl
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Booked through Priceline and had to pay added on convenience fees and parking but well worth it. Service was excellence. Rooms were clean. Pools and lake activities were perfect for families. The only negative is the amount of service personnel...one to remove bags from car, one to park car, one to take bags to room, etc...felt like I had to tip all instead of having one person from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: morrobainn
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything you need. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Whilst I was staying there for business, my family was able to use the excellent facilities, including a really special pool area with aterfalls and slides and excellent sun loungers. There are plenty of restaurants and bars onsite with great food, drink and service, and the hotel is more than close enough to a number of attractions and restaurants when you fancy a change. All in all, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, all about Money”
Reviews.Author: ALISTER2
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the Hyatt, and I will explain why. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and I had contacted the hotel about a month before to advise this and that I would appreciate a nice view. I also pointed out that there seemed to be a mistake on our booking as it had it down as a double and could they please make sure it was a king. We arrived at the hotel after a long drive in very heavy rain and were greeted with a glass of champagne which was very nice, and wished a happy anniversary, so obviously the receptionist could see the notes and my request. We therefore thought everything was ok, however this is where it went down hill. Firstly we were informed of the 18 dollars per night mandatory charge for the hotel services, which I informed the person that we would not use as we were only there for 4 nights and were most of the day and evening at disney and universal, however we were told that we had to pay. IF ITS A MANDATORY CHARGE THEN PUT IT IN YOUR NIGHTLY RATES. It's just a way of the advertising a lower room rate that it actually is. Second. We then arrived at our room to find 2 beds and not a king as requested, to add to this we were given a room on the side of the hotel that was being painted so we had ropes outside our room and were not allowed to open the doors, which meant we could not watch the fireworks. Add to this the noise during the day and having to keep the curtains pulled as the workers could see in. We did complain but were told this was the only room, I am sure what they meant to say is that this was the only room in this level and they would not upgrade. All in all out of all the hotels we stayed at on the east coast tour this was the worst, and although I am a Hyatt member I will never use them again....THANKS FOR RUINING OUR ANNIVERSARY. THANK GOD WE WERE ONLY THERE FOR 4 NIGHTS. The only good point was the location and the gardens the hotel is in.

Reviews.Title: “Flashback to the 80's”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe that the hotel is a Hyatt. One common theme in Orlando is the lack of service everywhere including the hotels; except for a few employees that seemed to be "right on" when it came to service and customer experience. If you want to know anything, or have a question, the best guys to ask are the bell hops. No one else will be able to properly assist you. The hotel has an Asian theme to it with buddha's and other Asian artifacts on display throughout the hotel. A macaw bird is located in the lobby and is quite a fun bird to watch or talk to. The food at the hotel is okay, nothing to write home to, if you know what i mean. Rooms are good. some with a view of the pool area and some with a view of the green trees and flat landscape of Florida. The air conditioning definitely works in the rooms. The bathrooms have been remodeled to a more futuristic modern look but done in a less expensive way, because it shows. The bed is comfy. Because I am a Diamond Member I am granted full access to the Regency Club. This club was my favorite place in the hotel and the food served was excellent. Better than most clubs in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “THE best pool area around!”
Reviews.Author: maxx3442
Reviews.Content: I can only compare this pool & surrounding amenities to that of a Vegas mega resort. It was amazing in that it was segregated enough for kids to enjoy, adults & kids to enjoy and even a specific quiet area. Nice touch. The water on the hot summer day was cold enough to be ultra refreshing and crisp & clean, something that you can't find at the gulf waters in the summer. The service was great, the rooms were Hyatt typical-nice and clean. The ONLY downside (for us) wre the typical tiny feather pillows that Hyatt always provides. Just tough to get used to if you're not a squishy tiny pillow person. Other than that, a beautiful and nice place to visit...with or without the kids. There was also a kayak lake and rock climbing wall that we didn't explore but might the next go around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape with a fantastic friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NewburghNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for a family vacation to WDW and Sea World. Used the Mears Transportation Shuttle from the Orlando Airport (reserve online $34 pp rt) we didn't rent a car since other family members had one. We arrived a few days earlier than family and stayed extra day than other family members, so we were at the hotel without transportation but it wasn't a factor for us. Did notice that the self parking lot got full and people parked on resort road, maybe to avoid the fee. It should be noted that people who are not staying at the hotel (Villa owners) can have a membership to use the services at the Pool , tennis, golf, so parking for them is pay service. Should consider waving the fee for hotel guests. We took advantage of all the services of the hotel. Pool area was lovely. Towel exchange for card setup. There are folks who put out stuff to reserve lounges but after a few hours people start realizing nobody is using them and moving the stuff to one chair, so if you reserve a lounge be there to use it. Lake with beach area great for little ones to play in sand, hammocks, boats, bikes, small golf course. Recreation staff very good. You can purchase pool floats and inner tubes for around $10, but if you bring them deflated from home they will inflate for you. Children (adults too) love the 2 slides, waterfalls and the rickety bridge. Took lessons at the Tennis Acadamy with Lynn, who was wonderful and patient with us. Concerige (Jannelle?) able to get us tickets to parks and answer every question and request. Check in was fast and efficent, offered champagne, Mariann explained everything about the resort fee ($22) and the layout of the resort complex. Took the hotel shuttle to the Golf Clubhouse (lovely place) for dinner at Nine18 (great food at country club prices). Breakfast buffet ($21) at Cascades was popular with great and friendly staff (Greg). Palm Cafe serves some great sandwiches and snacks ($$). Food and drinks are expensive but your on vacation live it up within your budget. If you want you can get the shuttle to and from the guard gate and walk to lots of nearby chain restaurants(Olive Garden, Dennys, Sizzler, Pizza Hut,etc) and a 7-11. We did and saved some on meals like dinner. Most of our other meals were out at the parks or the surrounding restaurants. We did not use the shuttle for WDW. Room - rates were good for the area, we got a special by taking advantage of a Hyatt package. Amy our housekeeper was so helpful as was Hotel Engineering. We had a room AC problem they explained could not be fixed immediately so they quicky moved us to a new room. Where we had a AV problem with the movie ordering service (outside vendor) - again Engineering quicky responded and did their best to explain and tried to fix the problem. To be honest we weren't at the hotel to watch movies so it wasn't a huge thing. The rooms were tastefully decorated in a contemporary style. Nice soft beds (pilllows were to soft/flat for my preference). Coffee and tea making supplies and had a cooler to keep your water chilled. Cooler is not a refigerator but after a few hours warm drinks were cold. The rooms have AV and computer hookups,where you can charge your camera, iphone, nook. WiFi included in resort fee. If you go up to 18th floor of Atrium you can see the fireworks. Unless your going to spend 24/7 in the room I don't think it matters which view you get, Buena Vista, Lake or Pool. The only problem we had with the room style was the closet/bathroom door. Door panel slides to cover one or the other so if someone is at the closet and someone is leaving the bathroom well you end up banging into someone. Staff - I cannot begin to express how friendly, helpful ALL the staff were. Every staff member said "hello" or "good morning/afternoon". After a few days they know your name and greet you by it. Showed genuine interest in how things were with you, hows your vacation?, did you have fun at the parks?, etc. Requests taken care of efficently. Staff was very professional. I will be recommending this hotel to anyone I know going to Orlando. If I ever have to be in Orlando again I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice price”
Reviews.Author: jillycisalreadytaken
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a Florida resident rate they didn't have, however, they did have a Florida govt rate. We paid under 100 for the room. Very nice hotel, a little too fancy for my taste, but no complaints. Complimentary champagne on check in is nice, never had that before. Pool area was beautiful, pool in general was awesome with it's hidden grottos, hot tubs and water falls. One thing I hated was the fact you were not allowed to bring coolers to the pool, so if you wanted a beer uo were forced to buy their expensive drinks. You are allowed to bring water bottles to the pool. Friends ordered a round of drinks and for 2 beers, 2 ' specials' and 1 kid's smoothie for 58.00!! Otherwise beautiful grounds and all around very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “what a property”
Reviews.Author: rasheed_albader
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel and property.we stayed their for 11 days full of enioyment.special thanks to jimmy ( front desk manager) for his understanding of our requirment of the room type. the only thing we didnt like is the fees of the self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to save money on your Orlando vacation”
Reviews.Author: MoreBoatDrinks
Reviews.Content: I say this because the resort itself is awesome. Much better than Carribean Beach or Coronado Springs. We are an active family so we spent a couple days at the resort kayaking, boating, tennis, biking, rock climbing, pitch and putt, etc., all included with the $22/room resort fee. The pool was awesome--800,000 gallon pool with waterfalls, 2 waterslides, and a hidden bar in the middle of the grotto. The drinks made here were very good, although really expensive. We biked to the nature walk--a one mile boardwalk that goes through a conservation area and saw various wildlife. The hammocks on the beach were great to catch up on some reading. Small groups seemed to enjoy the pool volleyball. The gym was great and was near the pool. We stayed the last week of August about 2 years ago at Coronado Springs and they wouldn't even let us use the boats since it was "off season" already. Not the case at the Hyatt. I enjoyed the jogging too--nice trails away from all of the busy roads--a one mile, 3 and 5 mile route too. The lounge chairs were nice cushiony chairs--not too hard to get one this time of year either. We didn't eat at the Hyatt and i heard from other guests that the food was so-so and expensive, but can't comment personally. You are about a block away from a ton of restuarants that kids like better anyway, like Olive Garden, Chevy's, Pizza Hut, etc... We would definitely come back and visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Property”
Reviews.Author: fldavefan
Reviews.Content: this place is wonderful great modern rooms nicely redone bathrooms ....great grounds..yes there is a resort fee but this is actually a place where it is worth it.. you can do golf(pitch and putt)bikes in the 15= miles of trails...you can take a kayak,canoe,sailboat out they have water bikes...the pool is one of the best of any resort ive been too only down fal som how in florida this place found the only cold water, at night they have a camp fire and smores out by the pool ...it was a great family stay for labor day weekend....th.e only draw back was the food and drinks at the hotel are pretty high well really high so plan on going out and bringing a few snacky items and a liquor bottle .

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great for family entertainment!”
Reviews.Author: WazzMommy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has lots of fun for the family. The large pools with the slides are great for the older kids. We love the lake with the beach for the younger kids. The lake also has canoeing and other water fun for everyone. We stayed here when visiting Disney World. There was a shuttle, but we had a rental car, and it is so close, that driving to the parks was a breeze. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone with a family to entertain.

Reviews.Title: “just gets better and better.”
Reviews.Author: hanwellranger
Reviews.Content: just returned from 12 nights and this place justs gets better and better. this is my 5th year in a row with family and friends staying at the hyatt, the staff and hotel are amazing from the moment you arrive at the main gate if you are lucky you will be greeted by the lovely delores and then you make your way up to the hotel itself, and then you are greeted by the superb door staff, the facilities cleanliness and efficiency are just superb. trust me this place is not cheap once your inside but as long as you keep an eye on things its bearable (just). in a previous review i said i had a problem with having to pay for the internet on top of the $22 resort fee this is now included but the wifi is about as quick as dial up, when i mentioned it i was told by the front desk they had changed there internet provider, another thing make sure you check your final bill on checking out in the five years i have been going to this hotel my bill has never been correct im certainly not suggesting this is deliberate but its always on the hyatts side and not mine. please dont let this put you off this otherwise stunning hotel, i travel to florida for 3 weeks every year and i wouldnt even contemplate staying anywhere else (my kids wouldnt let me anyway.) lastly but by no means least i have to give a special mention again to delores on the front gate who is a true asset to the the hyatt please look after her and we will see you all again next year

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzyqtwo
Reviews.Content: For people living around the Orlando area this is a perfect get away without having to go to the parks! There are so many activities for the kids that they want to come back to this hotel for their birthday. The only downfalls are the small beds and expensive drinks at the pool. It is well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holeyshoulder
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks in USA the second week at the Hyatt. Could not fault it. Staff are all so polite, friendly and nothing is too much trouble. It really is like an oasis of calm in the busy downtown Disney area. We ventured out and about but you really could stay in the hotel and grounds for two weeks and not get bored. Pools are the best feature, my kids wouldn't come out and they are open 24 hours so if you've had a long day at one of the parks its great to refresh with a dip in one of the pools late at night, again a big hit with the kids. They even put on a film poolside on a Saturday night, something suitable for all the family. Food is excellent, we had a buffet breakfast every morning and were delighted with the choice and quality on offer, really set us up for the day. The rooms are very modern, beautiful bathrooms, quite large, all with balconies and even the garden views at the front are beautiful. Attention to detail is key in this hotel. Would definitely recommennd.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location and fantastic pools !”
Reviews.Author: J_lt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the Hyatt Regency while visiting Orlando's theme parks : it's conveniently located close to Downtown Disney, Premium outlets and the I-4 (Universal is no more than 15mn away), and there are a lot of restaurants in the area. The lobby is impressive and clear, with a lot of water, trees and even some parrots; the rooms are spacious, comfortable and have great views over the pool area and Disneyworld (you can even see the fireworks at night) or over Orlando area. Their best asset is the refined modern decoration which is a brilliant contrast with the horrible decoration you find in most hotels in the region (heavy tuscany style, american 'pseudo' italian ambiance, etc...), and I tried many ! Everything is in good working conditions and you also find a coffee machine (unluckily not Nespresso !) in the room. Good internet connection. There are several impressive swimming pools surrounded by faux rocks ills, caves, big waterfalls, jungle bridges, etc... Each area is dedicated to a certain style : quietness, young kids, watersports, etc.... The restaurants are OK, but nothing particular; a little bit pricey for what you get, but you're at the Hyatt.... We got what I consider a good price for the quality and service, but be careful because a $22 flat fee is added to the advertised rates for the use of "pools, shuttle, etc....", and this is not very correct from them; I think this should be directly added to the public rate for more honesty; this is the only negative point. Compared to the nearby Convention Center Grand Hilton, the Hyatt has far better prices and delivers much more. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large resort”
Reviews.Author: travelerUSA21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the Labor Day weekend (Sat & Sun nights). I had to attend a wedding on Sunday. I arrived at the front gate and had to be verified as a guest to be allowed in and I then proceeded to the self parking lot ($11 per night or $30.00 for valet) and drove by it. I recommend to the hotel to have a large sign noting it on the main drive. After parking I made the 10 min walk to the main lobby. The hotel was busy on this holiday weekend, but I was checked in and on my way to the room with in 10 min of getting to the front desk with my complimentary glass of champagne. I arrived to my room to find that it had not been cleaned properly. While the bed was made and the room appeared clean, on closer look you could tell the room had not been vacuumed from the past guests. Food, nail clippings, clothes tags and other dirt was on the rug. The surfaces of the dresser, desk & bath marble had not been cleaned either. So I picked up the phone and explained the issues to the front desk and I was quickly assigned a new room with several apologies by the manager and clerks. My new room was fine and clean! The room itself was a nice. It featured a king size bed, desk, plenty of storage and the room was a corner unit offering 2 balconies overlooking the pool and Walt Disney World. The bathroom had a standup rain shower, large sink and vanity and separate toilet space. In addition the room also featured a large screen T.V., refrigerator and safe (which is nice to store valuables). The bed was fine and very comfortable. Noise from the hall and room next to me was loud. There were many families with many kids that get up early :) The best feature of this hotel was its pool area. The pool is huge offering large waterfalls, 2 water slides and many whirlpools. The resort also has several water sports (sailing, paddle boats, canoes, etc) on its lake. There are several other options worth looking into while you are there. The resort does charge a fee of $20.00 per day for this. It clearly is spelled out during booking at the Hyatt site and before you check in. The staff I encountered was extremely friendly and always greeting you in the halls, etc. I did eat a few meals on the property and the quality was fine and they have several eating options, fast casual or fine dining. For a great breakfast check out their buffet. A few issues I do have with the hotel: - The hotel needs a main bar area as a focal point. They have 2 bars as I could tell - one small one in the lobby and a “sports” bar that was out of the way and never busy. - The walk from the self parking is long and can be far depending how full the lot is. I returned late one night only to find the lot was full and I had to park on the main driveway in the bike path with others. The lot is also gated. You need your room key to get in or out. - I could never get an internet connection on my wireless device. I did not say anything as I did not really need to use it, but it is part of the $20.00 resort fee. Overall this is a great place to stay and be your base as you visit the local attractions. You are about 10 min from Downtown Disney and 20 min to the main parks. Universal is also 25 minutes North of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice...but next time I will "downgrade"”
Reviews.Author: nettenico
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel set on beautiful grounds. The staff was friendly, courteous and professional at all times. Lots of activities available for adults as well as children. Food and service in the restaurant was very good. Convenient location - close to Downtown Disney, shops, restaurants and gas stations. I had only a few small complaints... Nice flat screen television - but no free HD programming available (bummer). I forgot to bring my GPS and was very surprised to hear that I could not print a few pages from mapquest without having to charge my credit card. The only free printing is of your boarding pass on a couple of designated workstations in the lobby. The pools are lovely, but it would have been nice if they made a few styrofoam and/or inflatable floating pool toys available for the kids at no additional cost. I have stayed at lower rated establishments that have provided all of these "extras" without tacking on additional fees. One would hope that the $22 per day resort fee would cover a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugg1986
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for a pre-cruise trip to Disney. Location was ideal, we had an amazing view of the magic kingdom and were able to view fireworks each night. Weather was cold, so we did not use the pool facilities but they were expansive and well taken care of. The resort as a whole was in the process of renovation yet the whole place was clean and very modern. We LOVED the parrots in the atrium. The ground and common areas were immaculate. The room was recently refurbished, clean and very modern. Maid service was discreet and attentive and the room was always spotless. We did not dine at the hotel, as we spent most of our time in the theme parks. Disney is a short drive away, and we felt that the resort was much nicer than anything we could have gotten on the grounds. One good thing about when we traveled was that it was right after new years, not a lot of people around disney or the hotel and very few children made for a very pleasant experience. The staff at this resort were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “WOW -- An absolutely perfect resort and a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: fabfamily57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only two nights, and wished it was more. We were going to Universal Orlando and needed a hotel. The price was great (AAA rate) and the facilities were spectacular. We stayed on a high floor, and all rooms have a balcony. I don't know why people complain about the "resort fee." The hotel is very upfront about it and it includes EVERYTHING imaginable -- a par three golf course, pedal boats, kayaks, sail boats, a driving range, a climbing wall, bicycles. The rental fee for any one of these amenities for a family of four would be more than the resort fee. We did just about everything AND saw Harry Potter. The pool is just as great as reported, with waterfalls, slides, and acres of water. Would consider staying here when visiting Disney rather than on site. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice disappointing Spa”
Reviews.Author: Jill A
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Villas and used the pool and spa at the Hyatt. The pool was very nice and the kids had alot of fun at the Hyatt pool. We were disappointed by the spa. The spa was minimal at best and my pedicure was average for the steep price. I was suprised the Hyatt did not have a more desirable looking spa. The villas were spacious and nice with views but a little outdated. Beds were comfortable and room service was excellent. Nice place to go without the kids. They need to have vending machines on the property. We were unable to locate any with snacks and drinks. Pool bar was already closed. Staff was very friendly. Overall I think the Dolphin resort is the nicest spa and hotel for the price. It has a great location on the boardwalk and a wonderful pool. Lots of things to do for the kids. It has a game room as well. The food and restaurant choices are limitless at the Dolphin. Drinks and snacks are always available via machines or gift shops.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Silversonyman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and ultra modern. The staff are just lovely nothing is an issue. The pool is better than the pictures can ever show. We did not eat in the hotel but the restaurants looked extremely nice and the food very good. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: 5boysNmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple days. Large place with lots of things to do. Pool area is very good with slides and hot tubs. Servers bringing drinks, etc. Grotto Bar at pool. (Prices of drinks way too high!!!) Ate at the sports bar and had good food. Did not eat breakfast because of very high prices, but the buffet looked nice. Hundreds of places to eat nearby, especially for breakfast. Mini golf is included, bikes, kayaks, etc. Great for kids to take a break from the parks and adults to hang at pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Lovely spacious hotel - large but well designed so it didn't feel busy. Luxurious feel in lobby, smart modern rooms and fantastic pool area. Lake, kayaks, pitch and putt added bonus. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: stewwwie1
Reviews.Content: This was a gem of a find on priceline. Everything with our stay was perfect. The location can't be beat. We frequent Disney and like trying new properties. The staff was great, the glass of champagne on check in was very nice. Very friendly and professional staff. A simple call to the desk for some extra towels and someone was at our door within minutes. Very quiet room on the 15th floor, graeat view of the surrounding area. Easy access to everything. Highly recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the only WaterPark where you can sleep over!”
Reviews.Author: GoldenHourPhoto
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just completed a major renovation and is gorgeous. There are more interesting places to swim than anywhere I've stayed and everything I ate onsite was wonderful. Appropriate for families and businness travellers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Hotel with Lots to Do (and just a few minor quirks)”
Reviews.Author: jtl10
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress is a large resort hotel just outside the Downtown Disney area. The hotel is part of the 1500 acre Grand Cypress complex, which also includes the Villas at Grand Cypress and several golf courses. The hotel was built in 1984 and was one of the first major "off property" resorts in the Disney World area. Overall, this is a great hotel, with clean, well appointed rooms, wonderful (if expensive) restaurants, a great atrium lobby, a great pool complex, and lots of available activites. The Disney Parks are all about 15-20 away by car, Sea World and Universal are just a bit farther. My first visit to this hotel was over 20 years ago, not long after it open, when I was a kid visiting Disney World (while my Dad was attending a conference at the hotel). I was fortunate enough to end up at this hotel via Priceline about 5 years ago, and once again got the hotel via Priceline on my most recent trip. The are three pools at the hotel. The smaller pool is heated and has a small water slide; the larger pools are connected by a swim through, under the rocks passageway; one has a larger water slide. Durring our stay in late August the pools in general were not that crowded, and the kids were able to go down the slides as often as they liked. There are lots of other activities available at the hotel - including a rock climbing wall, a fitness center, bikes, walking and jogging trails, and even sailboats. They are all included in the resort fee. The hotel is designed as three wings that seperate off the large, full atrium lobby which extends the full height of the hotel. The recent $45 million renovation (completed in 2009) improved one of our few complaints with our last visit - the very dated tropical themed rooms have now been updated with a sleek, contemporary look. If you visit, make sure to check out the hotel's extensive art collection - there are elegant statues and other works of art located throughout the hotel grounds - the large jade sailing ship in the lobby is espcially impressive. The lobby birds (a Macaw and Cockatoo) were also favorites of the kids. Still, there are a few complaints and quirks with the hotel. The renovated rooms are generally very nice but have a few problems - the combination bathroom/closet door is a terrible design - by Dad (who stayed in a seperate room) caught his finger in it, and I got hit by it while looking in the closet as someone else came out of the bathroom. The vanity looks great, but it's a free standing unit so it's easy for small items to fall off the sides (and nearly impossible to retrieve them). Our unit had a bathtub with only a half door - the back half was open to the rest of the bathub without even a curtain - this isn't a great design in a room with kids and a detachable spray nozzle in the tub. The most serious complaint is a near total lack of electrical outlets in the room - there is a high tech looking set of connections to the TV (altough does anyroom really need to plug in an HDMI connection to the hotel room TV) - but nearly no useable outlets in the room. The nightstands were also very small, and there was no table between the two beds in our room. The TV looked nice, but only had standard def channels, but your missing the point if you visit Orlando to watch TV. There are also some issues with the overall layout of the hotel. There's no easy way to get to the pool. You'll need to take the atrium elevators down to the lobby, walk across the lobby along the edge of bar area, and then down a flight of steps to the pool level. Alterantively you can take another elevator, but this requires walking through a restaurant. It's not terrible, but it's not great area, espcially if you kids plan on visiting the pool often. The self-parking lot is also poorly located. I guess the original idea was to have guests park in the main underground lot up front, which has elevators that come directly up to the lobby, but this lot is now valet only (and thus very expensive). For those not on expense acounts the self parking lot is further back, and requires a walk through the conference area of the hotel to get to the lobby. The kids didn't mind the walk much, but I can't imagine the conference attendees really appreciated the regular flow of kids back from Disney World through their events. In addition, the self parking lot was originally free (and open) until recently, the conversion to a pay lot seems haphazard; it now takes even longer to get in and out of, and the card reader system didn't seem to work well (my parents needed a replacement card to get out of the lot, and there were often waits getting in and out of the lot as people needed to repeatedly swip to get the readers to work). It was bad enough that there was often a hotel employee sitting in a card that seemed semi-permanently assigned to the lot just to keep it working, and at other times the exit gate was just left open. And of course, self parking is no longer free - it's $11 per night. Parking fees are becomming more common in the area (although parking is free at the Disney properties), but it's still an added expense you'll needed to factor in. A larger expense is the resort fee - which is $22 per day. It does include a lot of stuff (boat and bike rentals, fitness center, a great pool complex) but all told it's an extra $33 per day beyond the room rate (plus tax) that most guests will need to spend to stay here. Overall, I've enjoyed staying at the Hyatt Grand Cypress and would recommend to guest visitng Disney World - but I'd also consider other options for our next visit. At first glance it seems much cheaper than staying at a comparable Disney resort, when you factor in the fees and parking at the Disney parks ($14 per day, but free if your staying at a Disney property) things get a lot closer. If your paying full price for the Hyatt it might not be worth it, but unlike the Disney resorts there's also deals available for Hyatt (or, if your like us, you'll be able to get it through Priceline, where it's a real bargain). The other major consideration for families is the room layout. The Hyatt is almost entierely traidtionally designed rooms, with either two double beds or a single king. Our kids were young enough that this worked out OK, but for families with older kids (or more than 2 kids) there are many suite properties in this price range that would probably be a better choice (which is probably what we'll chose on our next visit). Still, overall the Hyatt is a great property in a great location, and if it fits your needs (and you can get a good deal on it) it's definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Off Property Disney Location!!”
Reviews.Author: tlhighfield
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip in a year and we love this place! Upon arrival at check in we were offered champagne - what a nice touch! The renovated guestrooms are beautiufl as is the lobby. My daughter loved talking to the Parrots there! The pool area, especially the cave bar, is amazing and food was yummy there and conveinent too. Fun waterslides and winding waterfalls to keep you busy while not at the parks. There are many activities offered for the kids at the pool area and it is walking distance to the Disney Mini Golf via a nearby trail. All in all, this is a first rate choice if you would like to be close enough to all the action, but not actually on Disney property. You'll not be disapointed. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort with outstanding facilities and staff”
Reviews.Author: BeefyWalesUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress at the end of August. The resort is just outstanding with excellent service and efficient staff. It was a most enjoyable stay and I must congratulate the manager on the standard of the resort and the politeness and helpfulness of the staff we encountered. Positives Easy check in with no problems. Offered a complimentary glass of champagne Lovely clean open lobby with fast glass lifts Room was on 8th floor overlooking pool and lake, it was quiet, clean, very comfortable king size bed with a stiting area. Plenty of space with coffee making facilities and a small cooler/fridge for drinks etc. Modern up to date slim line TV on wall. Bathroom was more than adequate with a lovely walk in shower with a soaker shower. Plenty of nice toiletries and towels. Housekeeping staff were friendly , courteous and more than willing to help out with anything you needed. Resort facilities were excellent with outstanding pools and beautiful grounds. The resort fee will cover activities such as bikes, pitch and putt, boats etc. The cleanliness and upkeep of the grounds and the whole resort area was outstanding . Pool service was available and the staff again were excellent particularly Edward, nothing was too much trouble and they were always polite. The restaurants we ate in were again excellent. We had the buffet breakfast which had so muh choice from pancakes, waffles, cereals, fruit, bacon egg sausage, toast, fruit juice tea coffee and more! The White Horse Bar was excellent with the food all fresh and cooked in the open kitchen. Didn't eat in Hemmingways so I can't comment on that restaurant. Check out was effiecient Negatives Only a few minor issues Self Parking is more difficult when a conference is taking place. A few male guests were around the pool area with glass bottles of beer and this could be dangerous so perhaps this could be tightened up especially with young children around The hot water in the Cascade restaurant needs to be much hotter for a cup of tea!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a great deal to go to Disney”
Reviews.Author: mltims
Reviews.Content: Not fare away from disney and the rooms are clean and comfy. The restaurant, the grill is very good. The swimming pool is So Big that you can spend a lot of time playing over there. The kids and the big ones just Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “no regrets”
Reviews.Author: princess_teri
Reviews.Content: we could have afforded to stay on disney property but were spooked by bad reviews.so we took a chance and gave up the onsite amenities.we LOVED this hotel. Beautiful contemporary rooms,great food from room service (best burger we had during the whole trip). The pool - even more fun than it looks in pictures. The grotto is very large inside with twisting turns and waterfalls so you can have a great time splashing around without having to be under that brutal sun.quick drive to the parks. My husband got a ride in from the lot some evenings from a little guy in a cart. The breakfast buffet was fine to very good and the waiters were outstanding. Get the free breakfast deal if you can. We saved 100 a night staying here and had a better experience than if we had stayed onsite. Updated rooms, very clean, 24hr room service with excellent food, great staff, fabulous pool (most disney pools very small no shade), you won't get this from disney.. Hyatt understands world class hospitality, Disney does not.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories at Hyatt Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: MrLuz
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to USA and we had to took one day of our vacation to stay at Hyatt Grand Cypress. This hotel really has the most beautiful gardens and pool area, you can't found a better Resort to compare on that aspect, the pool area is really something spectacular they even have a bridge to cross and a cave to explore. The Lobby in beautiful and you feel very welcome since you step in during our stay the hotel was operating a Group function which didnt cause any trouble. The breakfast buffet was very good and the quality of the items above the average. What really impressed me and my family was the arts spread all over the Resort. I would like to return one day and definetly would not consider another hotel in the Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience...rent a car though...”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Hyatt Grand Cypress and have to say it is a great hotel. Our kids wanted a resort experience in addition to going to Disney and they got what they wanted. The hotel is immaculate and the grounds and gardens are impeccable. The pool was great and we loved the slides and waterfalls. There were plenty of high end lounge chairs and seats so seating at the pool was not a problem. We enjoyed the resort activities when not in Disney including the pitch & putt golf and kayaking/sailing. Everyone was nice and professional and it has a very high end feel. They cater to business travelers as well and you could see the difference vs a family only hotel. The rooms are basic and nothing special but have nice bathrooms. the double beds are small so be prepared to get cozy with your significant other. We have kids so we needed the room with 2 doubles. We asked for a Lake view and were given one even though we paid for a garden view which was nice. We even could see the Disney fireworks at night from the room. The only caveat is the transportation to Disney. There are 2 shuttles, which are actually city buses from an outside company, in the morning. They only take you to the transportation center at Disney and then you have to find your way to the parks. Its OK for Magic Kingdom since its right where the bus drops you off but the other parks require you to get on a Disney bus which we found very crowded at times. There is also no shuttle to Disney in the afternoon from the hotel so you are forced to take the car service used at the hotel. A few days we went back and forth to Disney and paid about $100 in car service and taxi fees. If you don't rent a car, then be prepared to either spend the day in Disney and wait for the return shuttle at 6pm or pay to use a taxi. THE HOTEL REALLY NEEDS TO ADD A SHUTTLE TO DISNEY IN THE AFTERNOON AND AN EARLIER RETURN AT 4PM. If you want to go to Disney at night to see the fireworks you're going to pay for it. Just make sure you rent a car since Magic Kingdom is not really close to the hotel. That was the one mistake we made. Just to add, the food in the hotel is expensive and caters to the high end diner. There really wasn't anything our kids would eat on the menus at the 2 restauarnts we looked at. There is a cafe to order burgers and sandwiches but we couldn't find anyone to help us after 7:30pm. We used room service a few times and it was great and quick. I will add that we had room service breakfast one morning and it was incredible. We ate in the restaurant another morning and the food was not good. The breakfast buffet at $22 was terrible and very low end. It should have been an $11 breakfast not $22. For $22 I should see a crepe station, omelet station and belgian waffle maker. There was a women in this closed in area making pancakes and she looked like she would rather be somewhere else. You can walk to Denny's or Mcdonalds if you have time in the morning but its a bit of a pain crossing the roads to get there. All in all its a great hotel with a great resort experience. Just rent a car and it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to get away for a few days before school started up. I am a hotel snob and spent days researching hotels in the area and settled on the Hyatt Grand Cypress. I found the $22/day resort fee to be acceptable with all the amenities offered but was turned off by the $11/day parking fee. If they need the extra money I feel they should put it in the room rates. The parking lot isn't super close and its on the property. I can understand hotels that are downtown charging this but felt a little frustrated they were. We arrived and I was in awe of the gorgeous hotel. The wait at the desk was only a few minutes and they upgraded my room to lake view for no additional charge. They never disclosed to me that they would be putting a hold on my card for $75 a day for incidentals. I found this to be extremely high and had to wonder how people staying a week or 2 could afford this. We are a credit card free family and therefore I ended up having $225 held out of my bank account for 4 days. We went straight to our room and it was beautiful. My only complaint was the bathroom and lack of privacy it offered. The shower door makes you feel as though you are on display and no others can get ready while you are showering. Now my only SERIOUS issue with the hotel was this.... our bathroom had tons of hair on the floor in the toilet area. It was out in the open and disgusting. Since we arrived at 7pm and it was my sons bedtime I went down to report this but asked them not to come to the room until the next day. I was a little disappointed that the staff didn't even seem concerned that the room wasn't clean. As for the grounds? Gorgeous. There was so much to do and I felt we needed a lot more time. The pool is a lot of fun, our favorite place was hanging out in the caves. The resort fee is worth it when you consider all the activities you get to enjoy. We took out the bikes, a paddle boat, Kayaks, went swimming and went golfing. We didn't eat a the restaurants as I felt all were extremely pricey. I understand that it is inline with 4 star hotels but even the higher end Disney resorts offer lower price options. We did eat chicken by the pool for lunch one day (our family shared 2 chicken tender baskets for $24 after the $3 delivery charge and tip). Overall it was a fantastic experience and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “My New Orland Favorite”
Reviews.Author: evanee
Reviews.Content: Hyatt has done a great job with this hotel. The grounds and the facility are really beautiful and wonderfully maintained. With the view from our balcony you might think you are in Hawaii. The concierge, the front desk staff are all outstanding! From the beverages offered upon our arrival to the big help going to Universal, this is what a family vacation is all about. The rooms are fresh and modern. The restaurants on site were all good. There is a ton of family things to do, paddle boats, and water toys, and the pool at this place was one of the best designs that I have seen. They have a great Adult quiet area and then a huge play area on the other side of the Bar cave for the kids! This Hyatt will be one that we come back for in Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn R
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 14 night stay and are already looking to book for next year! Our room on the 7th floor, was tastefully decorated & furnished and very clean as was the rest of the hotel. Best pools of any hotel we have stayed in with caves, waterfalls and two waterslides! Plenty to do like pitch & putt golf, bikes for hire, kayaking on hotel lakes, tennis,table tennis, climbing wall etc- our children did n't always want to go to the parks! Location good, 15 mins from Magic Kingdom/Epcot transportation centre and 20 mins from Universal. We did n't dine at the hotel except for a buffet breakfast each morning, which was superb (maybe a little pricey at Usd 21.99 a head) Plenty of excellent restaurants nearby all within walking distance , our favourite being the Orlando Ale House just opposite entrance to hotel . One more thing, the hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge and maids- nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, beautiful pool”
Reviews.Author: ginacope
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Pool and grounds are beautiful, so much to do. There is a resort fee of $22/day. We were with a convention, so it was waived along with the parking fee, so that saved some $. The staff was excellent- from the front desk, to the concierge, to the pool staff, to our bell man Eduordo- who explained all the amenities. The food in the White Horse Grill was very good but on expensive side. Everyone was friendly, helpful and polite-room was very clean. Didn't like lighting in room, too dim and the sink was in the bathroom which is a bit inconvienent for our family of 4. Very close to Disney and hotel has a shuttle but we used our rental car. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nice people, good customer service.but...”
Reviews.Author: PatriziaItaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress before but it was 20 years ago. The hotel is always a nice place to stay, the rooms were great and clean, the front office staff was very nice and the concierge were lovely and helpful at pointing out where to go for dinner. This is a great hotel and very close to everything, The resort fee included internet access so it wasnt too bad. Having said all that something needs to be sad when the valet is begging for a tip. Once we arrived the valet parking guy took our bags out of the car and put it in the trolley, and followed us and kept saying outloud...so anyone passing by could hear him...I am just taking you to the front desk and then the bell man will take care of you, he must have repeated that ten times...I was almost tempted not to tip him even though I was planning on it, but then I felt sorry for him...times are tough I guess. BUt for a 5 star hotel and valet parking at 23 dollars per day the valet staff shouldnt be begging. Also I was woken up by the maintenance people drilling a hole in the wall, and the next day they decided to have a housekeeping maintenance meeting outside my room which woke me up again.....I told the maintenance man, and he was gracious enough to give us a free breakfast the next day, which I thought was good customer service, but yet again in a hotel of this caliber maintenance and housekeeping should know better. I hopw these were isolated incidents because I recommend this hotel to everyone for business or pleasure, plus the rates are very good for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marie42472
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed here for a few days for a bit of relaxation after visiting Universal Studios. The family plan with connecting rooms worked perfectly for us, because two bathrooms is always a plus. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The pool area, I was glad to see, had plenty of lounge chairs. I liked the fact that you had to give them cards to collect towels at the pool. To get your card back, you have to turn in the towel. This keeps people from leaving a towel on a chair even after they have left the pool area. The thing I didn't like was $16 poolside drinks. C'mon, even if you can afford it you still feel ripped off. Lower the price and you will sell more drinks. The golfing with the kids was great, too, as was the trails and bike-riding. I did not mind the $22 resort fee, as all the amenities made it well worth the price. I wasn't crazy about the $11 daily parking fee, but at least it was secure parking and there was plenty of space for everyone. I do wish there were more options for family dining on site. I also noticed there was a breakfast buffet for $22 per person. My husband and son would have loved it, but the food looked way to heavy for my taste. So, there was no good place for us to eat breakfast together. However, overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cupcakelady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days while attending a conference in Orlando. The hotel was in a resort location so it is in a secluded setting. It is also gated and you have to show your pass to get through the security guard. The downside of the hotel is the non-valet self parking lot. It gets crowded really fast, apparently there was a confernce going on whenI was there, so it was REALLY crowded at night. Some people had to park on the street. Other than parking, the hotel had a great mix of pools, a water slide, and hot tub (though tiny). The pool area was rather dark at night, and I couldn't find the so called heated pool, but nonetheless I still treaded some water. The hotel's room are very clean plus they have resident parakeets (How cute!?). Overall, the hotel was very comfortable, beds were great, bathroom was modern and sleek, and they had good toiletries that smelled of eucalyptus. Overall, I enjoyed my short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: juliefriesl
Reviews.Content: Great place in Orlando to stay with the family. The resort activities were tons of fun and very handy. We were only staying at the hotel not going to the theme parks as we live here. My kids loved the pools and palying in that area. Staff was very nice, no issues there. We preferred not to eat on property except for lunch one day, there are tons of great places to eat close by. We also enjoyed the calmness of this resort and not so busy as some of the others in the are tend to be.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but watch out for hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: mcinradlett
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and our second time there. Its more of a resort than a typical overnight style hotel. This is great except you have to pay an additional $22 per night plus 12.5% taxes over and above the nightly rate the hotel quote when booking - something to be aware of if you are on a tight budget. Overall, I think this is one of the nicest hotels to stay in when in Orlando and we plan to stay there again the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: maimonidesflorida
Reviews.Content: Very nicely appointe rooms. Excellence service. Good pool, private lake, outdoors activites. Very beautifull terraza with restaurants. The looby is decorated elegantly chinese style with jade scuptures and indoor gardens Wil go back when in orlando.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Orlando outside Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: Hovitez1979
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel since the age of 9 and now 32. Stayed around 15 times. Sometimes for days, sometimes for weeks. Positives: Many many many eateries Pool area amazing Activities endless Scenery, setting, landscape is lush Lake amazing Rooms luxurious Valet Parking and arrival = top class Loads of local restaurants within 2 mins drive Loads of walking on safe resort Negatives Slightly pricey to eat in

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bishal5
Reviews.Content: Went for a 5 day trip in August with my wife and our 1 year old baby. Check-in was a breeze with very helpful deskstaff. Room was a king sized bed with complimentary crib and fridge. There is an extra cooler in the room. Room was nice, big and clean. Bathroom was similar. Nicely done up. Laptop connectivity to the HDTV was quirky. The resort charges 24 buck/day as a resort fee. Includes internet,gym,bike,rock climbing,family photgraph,boat rentals. I felt it was worth it. Steer away from the gift store. Overpriced. You can take a shuttle to the main street outside and pick up supplies from the Walgreen. A bunch of dining experiences out there on the main street as well. Hotel breakfast is nice but overpriced at 25/person for the buffet. Depending on the number of people in your party and your itinerary the breakfast package may turn out cheaper. Hotel has a free shuttle to all the important parks. I didnt feel the need to rent a car. The pool is loads of fun with 2 slides and multiple waterfalls. Not much of swimming to be done. Its a lounge pool. Golf is on the house as is tennis. Was very pleased with experience and would go back if I ever made it back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Beautiful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Planman08850
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review with the word WOW! I guess I will begin at check-in; our room was not ready as we arrived way early but with a combined effort from Anna and Fred they found us a great room and a glass of champagne. This is a huge hotel and the grounds are beautiful, the lobby was wonderful with the birds and all the staff asking if they could help with anything, special thanks to Steve Ballot as we asked him for help on more than several occasions in the lobby. My wife and I had the best crab cake sandwich and Caesar salad in the Palm Café (twice) a little pricy but you’re on vacation. The pool is great for whatever your needs are quit time, kids pool with small slide and this one is heated, and large pool with waterslide and water volleyball. Now our room was great the first night two double beds and plenty of room for the four of us. There was an air conditioner issue with the whole hotel but I must say the staff handled it very well knowing some guest would not be happy. I cannot credit Fred Ditto enough for his great attitude and willingness to try his best to make people happy. Rooms facing the pool can view the fireworks each night but you can take the elevators to any floor above 8 and look at the fireworks through the big glass windows. We would go to the parks in the morning and then be back to the hotel pool and yes lounge chairs are hard to find but not impossible we found 3 or 4 together each of the 6 days we were there. We did take advantage of the Regency Club, a bit crowded but great breakfast, cookies during the day and hors d’oeuvres and drinks at night. I do have two negative comments on this beautiful hotel but by no means would stop me from coming back but I read enough reviews that I feel I must have full discloser. The first is the $11 self-parking fee; the second is the bathroom/closet door design with two teenage daughters this was an issue, we are not a big fan of the design. A great vacation at a beautiful resort! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel w/fun activities but drink prices higher than Disney!”
Reviews.Author: rscima
Reviews.Content: We live in Orlando, only 30 minutes from this resort but it was my birthday & I wanted a weekend here with my family "just for fun". We have a pool and live on a golf course but it was fun to get away for the weekend and "play tourists". I was really looking forward to sitting by the pool and having someone serve me for a change. lol The resort is beautiful as all of the reviews have stated. Our room was great and I love that every room has a balcony...it was tiny but just the fact that you have sliding doors & a little area to step out onto is really nice. There is also what the hotel calls a "cool box" in every room. They won't call it a fridge because I guess they think it doesn't get cold enough so there is a sticker on the inside of it stating that it's for "medicinal" purposes. I put a few cans of soda in ours & it was perfect. Kept them nice & cold and was really convenient being that there are no coke machines around. The resort fee is well worth it, the kids did the rock climbing, we went out on the lake in the paddle boats, and my husband & son did the pitch n putt golf twice. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly. I only have 2 complaints. The pool area is beautiful and of course everyone wants one of the nice cushioned chairs under an umbrella by the pool. Our first day out to the pool, we found a spot easily because we didn't check in until about 3pm so by the time we got down there, lots of people had already gone in for the day...probably to get ready for dinner and such. Well, I didn't realize what a hot commodity these seats were. We didn't get to the pool until around 11am on Saturday & there wasn't a spot to be found. Don't believe the signs that state you can't save chairs and that your "stuff" will be removed from them after an hour of inactivity. I sat in what felt like "steerage" (a chair with vinyl slats-no cushion-no umbrella) all day. I kept an eye on one pair of loungers with 2 fun noodles and towels on them and they weren't touched all day. When I went up at 6pm, they were still there. My husband said that when he went to golf the next morning at 9am, every single lounge chair had a towel or beach bag on it...but very few people on them. It's unfortunate that people are so selfish and rude. As far as I could see, there is no staff enforcing this "rule" so it just perpetuates the problem. Obviously people learn after their first day there to go down & put your stuff on a lounger as soon as you wake up. Even the day we checked in, we only used up 2 loungers, even though the two next to us were open because I don't feel like my kids should use them up. They are pretty much in the pool & on the slides the whole time. My other complaint is the price of drinks. Holy cow! I know this is a resort & I fully expect to pay more than "happy hour" price at my local bar but $13 for a frozen drink & $10 for a simple vodka cranberry? That's pretty excessive in my book. A bottle of water was $4! Even at Disney, the water is only $2.50. There are several water "stations" around the pool outside but the water is room temperature so if you need cold water or a coke ($3) expect to shell out some serious money. Just a heads up that they also add on an 18% gratuity. I actually like this idea so I don't have to do the math or worry that I "shorted" the waitress, but the prices are really out of control in my opinion. Overall, the trip was nice & we would probably go back. On a side note, we went to the Bluezoo restaurant at the Dolphin hotel for my "birthday" dinner. I woke up at 5am with major food poisoning (don't get the fish!) My poor husband had to pack us all up and get us checked out while I spent every second in the bathroom & then hurried through the lobby & out to the car with a plastic bag for the ride home...thank goodness it was only a 30 minute ride!

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate book your Orlando stay at the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: Camber123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt at the end of July with my husband and 2 sons, we all loved the hotel; we've been travelling to the states for the last 5 years and this was one of the best hotels we've stayed at. We had interconnecting rooms overlooking the pool area, the rooms were spacious, exceptionally clean and the decoration was very modern, (which I loved). The bathrooms were luxurious and spacious, the hotel provides nice complimentary toiletries too! We had a wonderful cleaning lady who was very friendly and did a great job. The hotel amenties were great, the pool area was extensive and lush. The boys loved the golf, table tennis and pool slide. The pool furniture was comfortable and clean, pool towels were of a good quality. We ate at the sports bar and whilst the food was good the service was terrible, the server was rude, perhaps he should take some hints from our cleaner who was a real ambassador for the Hyatt brand; however this small issue did not spoil our stay. The hotel is central to all Orlando has to offer and I would recommend it to anyone thinking of staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Confused Hotel”
Reviews.Author: talluta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 10 days with a family of 4. We choose the hotel because of its proximity to the parks and it's pool. The hotel is a beautiful hotel with excellent grounds. It's pool is brilliant and the amenities are fantastic, however, this is not an ideal hotel for a Disney vacation. Parking is a nuisance and comes with an $11 daily charge, restaurants and snacks are ridiculously priced, and although close to the parks, you still need to drive and park there. In other words, it is more worth it to stay in Disney or Universal instead of this hotel. The Hyatt wants to be a business hotel and Family hotel, however, it just doesn't work. Pros: -$22 charge a day for amenities is understandable with such a great pool, excellent amenities including a decent pitch and putt, wifi, gym, etc... -Rooms have modern decor with comfortable beds -proximity to local restaurants and parks Cons: -Service at front desk left much to be desired. Room wasn't ready until 8pm and tried to tell me that they were completely full, only to find another room a couple of floors above. They also suggested this was an upgrade, which was ridiculous. -Room service is on par with most motels. They make your bed and change your towels. Nothing special. -Food is ridiculously priced. Obviously banking on guests claiming their food as a business expense. Everyone else gets ripped off. -$11 for parking in a parking lot that is a nuisance to get to, always full, and with an entrance gate that doesn't always work. -I think there was a kids club and arcade, but I didn't hear about it. Staff didn't go out of their way to cater to children. You basically had to inquire about everything. Although we enjoyed our stay, it was more because we're easygoing and had a great time at the parks. If we do disney again, it would be much more worth it to stay on site. Would not recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Asked For More!”
Reviews.Author: Priu23
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress this past weekend. From start to finish we had a great time! We arrived about 3 hours early for check-in and although they told us at the front desk our room was not ready about 20 mins later we got a call that it was ready and we had been upgraded to a King size room as opposed to 2 double beds. The first afternoon we went and lounged by the pool and ordered lunch from Palms Cafe, there was more than enough lounge chairs and the food was brought to your seat the wait staff was very efficient! The bar was nice however drink prices were $10+.The best time to go to the pool is after 6pm its completely empty and you can get a nice seat under the cave by the bar! There is plenty to do on the resort however we did not make good use of all the amenities as we were only there for 3 nights and ventured out to the Disney Parks. Location wise its close to the Magic Kingdom Main Gates, but about a 20 min cab ride to Universal Studios. Staff is all very friendly and we used the lincoln car service quite a bit and were very impressed with the drivers it was worth paying the little bit of extra money for the luxury Overall we had a great time and were sad to go, next time we visit we will def be staying here and hopefully have more time to enjoy the amenities and restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool & amenities but average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Justabeena
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst doing the Disney parks. Should really have gone for a cheaper option as rarely at the hotel but that's not their fault...lesson learnt! We had a family Lakeview room (amazing views) but as per another reviewer they tried to palm us off with a garden view room first. The room wasn't huge (although we expected this) but the bathroom was fab. We varied breakfast, somedays in the restaurant (Kids loved the man who made pancakes with MIckey ears) and somedays just bought coffee and pastries from Starbucks in the lobby. Good transfers to all major parks (we didn't really need a car because of this). The star of the show were the pools and caves..amazing! I would also highly recommend Hemingways restaurant for an evening meal as a treat...probably the best meal we had during our whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Its a mini park on its own!”
Reviews.Author: rex6
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time while staying at this property. We were in Orlando for Disney world and we felt that this was a lovely centrally located hotel. The hotel is massive and has some amazing amenities! The pool, the restaurants, the golf course and the lake surrounding it are gorgeous. Its a wonderful property to relax in with your kids or just by yourself. You kind of get the best of both! You get a lovely, lively and fun property in downtown disney and you are so centrally located from the parks. The hotel concierge were very helpful and got us an appointment for our swim with the dolphins at discovery cove in a days notice. The staff is warm and friendly. The restaurant staff remembers your preferences and that makes the experience seem nicer and more hospitable. There are also some lovely restaurants located right outside the property. We had a lovely room from the balcony of which we could see the fireworks every night. The only complaint we have with this property was the house keeping. Maybe we have very high standard but the only thing they did was make the bed. They barely tidied up the room. They didn't even wash or keep fresh glasses for us. Everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family”
Reviews.Author: Juliusfad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 11 nights and had a great time with the family. The swimming pool is great location fantastic but the room a little bit small. Stayed with my family of two boys and the swimming pool was a great hit and the pitch and put golf course. Breakfast though a little expensive and not inspiring as we always had to eat out due to lack of variety and the golf course is one of the best i have played anywhere in the world especially the new course with a 45 holes to play there is something for everyone Julius

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RudyLynn
Reviews.Content: Orlando's Hyatt Grand Cypress has been around for a long time so we were surprised at how up-to-date and inviting it is. Our 18th-floor room was spacious with a refreshing, contemporary decor. The pool area was amazing: water slides, grottos, a rock-climbing wall, water sports, pool and sand volleyball, all included in the activity fee. Dinner at Hemingway's was superb, including the chowder, the crab cake and the swordfish.You needn't go to Disney to have a good time in Orlando; simply relax at the Hyatt Grand Cypress.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: holiday_hunny89
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I went to the Hyatt in June 2011. As we went to check into our Lake View room we were unfortunately greeted by a rather rude gentleman who was just not bothered about us. He asked if we would like a glass of champagne, as we replied yes he almost grunted..like it was an effort for him to get us 1!!! He also tried to give us a garden view room..wen we actually booked a lake view room, He said that there were no more lake views...after I said that its not acceptable as they knew we were coming he said oh wait ive just found one...funny that?? Anyway apart from the check in the holiday was amazing. Breakfast every morning was great and the waiters were very friendly and helpful. We made use of the shuttles that went to the theme parks...it was obviosuly slightly annoying that they didnt run very often but that didnt really affect us. We absoloutely loved our stay at the hyatt and would love to return one day. It unfortunatley was the check in and check out which was a little disappointing. On check out the lady checking us out was asking us to pay 3 dollars more per day then the stated resort fee on our papers....i said that we werent going to pay 3 extra dollars a day then what was stated on our booking agreement. She didnt seem very happy and also said this is the new price...and mutttered to her colleague "we need to speak to British Airways and get them to change that." However in the end she did change the resort fee charge. For all those that are going to stay there it is absoloutely fantastic but definitely be wary of the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for all Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: DJA1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out very well for our family. The rooms are very nice and our room was clean upon arrival. The pool is one of the best in the area. My kids loved the caves, waterfalls and slides. The golf is top notch. On our last trip we stayed at the Grand Floridian. The consensus was that aside from looking like a postcard from every angle the only thing the Grand Floridian had over the Hyatt was the transportation to the Disney parks. Our only real complaint was the breakfast buffet at Cascades. It was terrible and it was very expensive at $70 for 2 adults and 2 children. There are at least a dozen restaurants just outside the hotel that serve a far better breakfast for 1/3 the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: marcusI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for two weeks during July. On arrival i had a minor issue with the check in procedure, but this was quickly and fantastically handled by the front desk manager Jimmy Rakowski - he was amazing and identified straight away my issue. During our stay we had dinner in Hemmingway's on a couple of occasions - it was really great, delicious food and exceptional customer service. The hotel is a great base for Disney and many other amenities and restaurants. I also recommend the pool area for some relaxation. I used the gym and running trails a lot and enjoyed this immensely. I really recommend this hotel to anyone, either for family or couples. Its just great. And a special note of appreciate to Jimmy Rawowski - thanks for making our stay special.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for kids ... going back tomorrow for a girls weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: lauren0681
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and our 5 kids. We got 2 connecting rooms. I am a Hyatt Diamond member and used my points to book both rooms...when using pints you don't have to pay the $22 resort fee so that was another perk. I got an email from the hotel to make sure I was set with our reservations (from the Hyatt Concierge) and to see if we needed anything else. They answered my questions via email and called on our check-in day to see if we needed to have connecting rooms or just side by side. The Front Desk Manager (I think it was Jimmy) called to let me know he was changing our rooms since I needed to have connecting rooms since our kids were with us. We arrived at 2pm and our rooms weren't ready yet (check-in is at 4pm so this is understandable). They offered us the champagne at check-in which was gladly taken!! We walked around for an hour until they called me to let me know that one of the rooms was ready. We had access to the Club Lounge which we gladly used. Saved us a boatload of $$ since all 7 of us could eat breakfast in there. They also have snacks & cookies in the afternoon, appetizers and desserts at night. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants since they were pretty pricey. Brought food, snacks, and drinks to keep in the room (made PBJ's for lunch) and we went out to eat offsite at night (Rainforest Cafe, Chilis, and ordered pizza at night). If you order pizza, they call you when its at the front date and you have to drive out there to get it which is kind of a pain, but apparently they had some security issues before so that is why that policy is in place now. I can't say enough about the pools -- was great for kids and adults. They have 3 separate pools and we stuck to the back pool with the bridge since that is where the Big Slide was. They had activities for the kids each day. Brought a cooler bag (from Sam's Club) and stocked it with water, sodas, and beer. I read reviews about how expensive drinks were so this was great for our family and kept us all fed & watered for the day. We went for a few night swims which was tons of fun --- not many hotels have a 24-hour pool! The staff here was really really great -- from housekeeping, to the front desk, to the folks in the Club Lounge. I'm actually returning to the hotel tomorrow for a girls getaway for 2 nights. We live in Tampa so its an hour drive. Downers -- parking costs are high, food costs are high. You can do it smart if you bring snacks and food for breakfast & lunch. Bottom line -- if you want to find things to complain about, you'll find it. Overall this hotel is great and you can stay onsite for a week and not run out of things to do!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sovandara
