Reviews.Content: It was our first trip together for my boyfriend and me, so I had reservered the hotels with best reviews on tripadvisor... And I was very disappointed by Hyatt. First, the reception was really terrible ! Apparently, I have disturbed the receptionist who have said to me wait (unpleasantly), what I have done. When she finally took care of me, she said to me that the room with lake view I had reserved was not available anymore (the check in was at 4pm and I went to the hotel at 1pm, so I don't understand...) but she proposes to me a room with pool view, I have accepted. It was an error ! We had a view on the roof and the trees (the pool only between two branches) Furthermore, stay at this hotel is very expansive ! They charge you $20 per day fee and $11 per day for parking (who are far of the hotel, and you don't enter by the reception but by a second entry reserved for the conference : not smart. When my boyfriend went to swim in the pool, a person asked him to go out (unpleasantly) without explanation (it was 4pm...) It is our worst hotel experience in Orlando ! The days before, we have stayed at Hilton and Animal Kingdom Lodge at Disney, and we keep a wonderful memory of their. Never we came back at Hyatt Regency and I shall not done for them a good publicity...

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids of all ages”
Reviews.Author: TampaInsuranceTravel
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference last week. We really enjoyed our stay. You can play pitch and put or kayak all included. The only complaint is that the bar is expensive $6 for a beer and $13 for a rum and coke. We walked to Ale House where we got a bucket of beer for $7 and food was great. Never ate at the hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before but won't again”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTimJ
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this hotel but it will be our last. My wife and 2 children (aged 13 &12) stayed for 12 nights earlier in July in 2 adjoining rooms. The rooms themselves are nice following the recent refurbishment and the beds are probably the most comfortable you will find in any hotel room anywhere in the world. The staff are still friendly and efficient and the pool and amenities are still the attraction they always were. The reasons we won't be back are (i) the hotel has introduced a parking charge of $11/day plus tax for self-parking since the start of July. This is an addition to the $22/day plus tax mandatory resort fee per room. This means you will be paying at least $33/day on top of your room rate (more if you valet park). I view this as little short of extortion. The resort fee up until now supposedly covered the parking costs so this represents a massive hike in costs for no increase in service. (ii) The bus service to the Disney parks has substantially reduced in terms of frequency and coverage. The old bus service used to drop off/pick up at all the Disney parks. Now the service only drops of/picks up at the Magic Kingdom transportation center. This in itself is not the deal breaker as you can use Disney's excellent transport network within Disney World but there were only 2 drop offs per day (8:50am and 10am) and the first pick up wasn't until 6pm. This meant you had to spend a minimum of 8 hours at a theme park to use this service and if you wanted to go in to the parks later in the day, forget it! Also because there were so few buses, each one was packed solid. Standing room only in most cases. On our previous visits, we used to enjoy going to the parks in the morning and then returning to the hotel for a swim or a bicycle in the afternoon. Now this is impossible with this schedule. We chose to drive and pay the $14/day Disney parking charge rather than be limited by this restrictive schedule. The $22/day resort fee looks even poorer value for money as one of its constituents is this 'bus transport'. To me, it was a service in name only. In summary, I believe this Hyatt has lost its way. It always has had large conferences running and I'm sure they bring its main revenues but the leisure travelers (such as ourselves) were also well served. Now the leisure traveler appears to be nothing more than a hindrance to its main business. They are looking to extract every last cent from the leisure visitor whilst offering the minimum possible by way of service. We stayed at a Hyatt in Anaheim in California last year and they knew who their main customers were - it had shuttles running to the parks every 30 minutes. If you're traveling to Orlando on vacation, there are better (and cheaper) hotels to cater to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junior_Biscuit
Reviews.Content: Arrived after long flight from UK, and found the hotel to look great as we drove up. Check in went well, until we went up to our rooms. We had requested interconnecting double and twin rooms, but received two doubles. There was no availability for that first night but the hotel apologized sincerely and arranged the correct rooms for the second night of our stay. Couldn't complain about anything after that. We had a party of 5, and our deal had breakfast each morning for 4 included, so we only paid for 1 child each day. Buffet breakfast was fantastic, so much so that we forgot to go to IHOP, as the pancakes and waffles at HRGC we fully loaded. Facilities at the rsort are plentiful, and as we were here for a parks holiday, we just didn't get a chance to use all the facilities, but the pool in the late afternoons after a day at the parks was great. There is a $22/day/room resort fee and you pay parking at $11/day, but for the comfort and the breakfasts alone we didn't object to this. We didn't have dinner in the hotel as we were so close to all the favourite restaurants, and didn't really need to travel to Int Dr much at all. Downtown Disney was very close and easy to get to in the evenings from the hotel. Rooms were spacious and well maintained, and everyone in the hotel is friendly and helpful. One plus, was as our return flights were late afternoon, we were able to check out then use the facilities until we departed for the airport, including showering and freshening up in the spa after we had used the pool. We would definately return here again, and would plan to spend more time at the hotel resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel would go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: TracyDLymm
Reviews.Content: stayed here with husband and 2 sons (aged 16 & 6) i had read reviews and was looking forward to the visit. on arrival checkin very quick and staff lovely, room very clean and very modern. we had booked our whole holiday with virgin so we were told at checkin we had 2 free breakfast as part of our deal (which we had no clue about) we used this about 3-4 days as we wanted take our sons to different places to eat while in orlando. as a whole we used the hotel pools etc for about 3 hours a day as we spent most of our time at parks etc, however everytime we went to pool area we always got beds and towels the pool area was very clean and the children loved the slides. we also used the golf (pitch and putt),table tennis and boating lakes which was good fun. i have read many reviews from people talking about the daily charge of about $24 this is correct everyone pays it, as for us we knew it was their as it is stated very clearly with virgin so add this on to your overall cost, we could understand why they do it however maybe just adding it to the daily rate would be better. this hotel for me was good because of all the small things for example i went running of a morning on the running track they have and was given a clean towel and cold bottle of water on return (small touch but very welcomed) also the staff were lovely at all times. my only small problem was parking for 2 reasons, we picked this hotel as part of virgin sales they sell the fact that as part of $24 daliy fee includes free parking (most hotels we looked at had a charge this is why we choose hyatt) ALSO in hotel information pack it states parking in included as part of the daily fee ( in room information pack) however after 1 week we were met by hotel staff on car park entrance to be given a ticket which would then mean to get back out we had to pay! not happy we went to front desk complained to staff explaining about virgin selling free parking as part of daily fee and also hotel information including parking as part of fee, they were very good and told us they agreed and we wouldnt have to pay and took it off our bill, however it did appear again 2 days later which meant another trip to front desk to get it removed! ( which put a small shadow over the hotel for me). i feel as part of the fee this hould be included as it is a lot to pay, also the free parking as part of the daily fee made us choose this hotel we wouldnt have done it if it hadnt been part of it due to total overall cost.second point carpark too small for number of cars if you are out late at parks you will struggle to get a space, depending on what is happening at hotel ( they hold weddings & Conferences) this determines if you get a space. just to finish i would like to say the parking was a very small bad point and i would recomend this hotel to all my friends as we had a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: gjv001
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time with family at this resort. Best resort pool in Orlando. Food and drinks are pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: janeandbuzz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden treasure. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The resort fee is reasonable for what it covers, i.e. chip and putt, bikes, water sports, and beach size towels. The hotel staff can not do enough for you. They are all friendly and courteous. The rooms and facilities are extremely clean. It is minutes from Disney and a wide variety of restaurants; although once I got there I didn't want to go anywhere else. The pool is amazing and there are an ample amount of lounge chairs around the pool or there are hammocks on the beach to relax on. We self-parked and did not find the location of the lot a problem; we've had to walked farther to catch a bus while staying in Disney. We had breakfast included in our room price and had their breakfast buffet which offered a wide variety of delicious items. If we had to think of a "con" for this resort it would be that the drinks are a little pricy. This was one of the most relaxing resorts we have stayed at and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: blsoldfast
Reviews.Content: I love this resort. I visit orlando 2 to 4 times a year and have stayed at some very nice resorts but the hyatt blows the competition away. I stayed in June with my 17 year old daughter for a volleyball tournament at disney. In the past we have stayed at disney resorts, 4 star hotels and highly stayed at condo type resorts. While they were all very nice, they didnt compare in level of service and amenities. The entire team and Their families loved it. My experience with the hotel staff was outstanding. The group sales department is amazing.the front desk, restaurant wait staff,pool attendants and the guys at the dock were so friendly and courteous.I would recommend this resort to anyone. Perfect for any age group......I wish I would have taken my 8 year old twins....the pool is amazing. The 17 yr. Old girls had a blast in the pools and waterslides especially at night. They toasted marshmallows and made smores at the bonfire which the hotel set up for us after hours by request. SO ACCOMODATING!

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt the best hotel in LBV area....”
Reviews.Author: MkMark
Reviews.Content: Been so many times and have never written a review of the Hyatt... Without doubt the best hotel in LBV area.... Hypoallergenic rooms are spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Posh but pathetic!”
Reviews.Author: Bartleby-James
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this place 5 stars, or even 4 stars, but I can’t. The resort had so much promise that fell flat due to mismanagement of staff and lack of interest in making money by providing customers with more than posh surroundings. That said the surroundings are very nice consisting of Quasi-Asian themed grounds with a huge and lovely pool with waterfalls and caverns. Nice hidden hot tubs buried though out the caves. Beach area is quaint and the golf course was fine. All well worth the extra daily $22 resort fee. Additionally, the room was clean and modern with a breathtaking dual balcony view of the pool and beach area as well as EPCOT. Sadly that is where the resort experience ends and the problems start. The place is a disorganized mess of mismanaged staff and hotel services. I hate to say this but the place is pathetic when it comes to providing value or even interest in the guests’ money beyond assorted fees. The parking fee of $11 is spent on a lot that people park anywhere and anyway they please and is not secure. It was the second day of my out and about before the front gate stopped me to complain that I did not have a pass on my dashboard. I informed them that no such item was mentioned on check in but that did little to dissuade the attitude of the Yenta operating the booth. The electronic control gates to the lot were only down once the entire 3 days of my stay so anybody could come and go as they wished. Perhaps that was to facilitate the “child fetishes ball” that was going on but still the lot lacked security for the extra fee. Extra fees are everywhere and you generally stumble upon them by a casual comment from staff or the fine print on a card or computer screen. $9.99 for wireless internet access & $15 for failure to return each pool towel in a timely manner, really? Every hotel I have stayed in during the last 5 years has had free wireless internet as well as paranoia free pool towels. So instead I used the complimentary wired internet as I only wanted to check for entertainment and food services in the area. I did not want to have to look for those things but that is another area the resort falls flat on. The restaurants and bars are open very odd hours and for very short periods. One lower level restaurant was closed for the high tourist summer season!?! There is not any entertainment to speak of in the resort even the piano at the lobby bar was never staffed during my weekend stay. The bar service was a joke and either poorly trained bartenders or management’s policy dictates that your drink should be %90 ice and a thimble of the actual drink itself. That may work for margaritas but Tom Collins and Rummy Cokes should be slightly more drinkable at $10 a pop. The restaurant we did find open during casual hours served and excellent breakfast but we were unable to find anything beyond an over priced snack bar available during most of the day. Apparently, idle food and bar space is the norm and god forbid they should hire any local talent such as singers or DJ’s to utilize the space to generate more food and bar revenue as well as entertain the guests. I have stayed in lowly Holiday and Comfort Inns that have live entertainment and they were cheap resorts! The last issue is the support staff. They are slow, constantly visible, and unsupervised. The maid’s service carts were constantly in the same hallway from dawn to dusk as well as the same dirty dishes. The grounds keepers were in the way all weekend doing little other than blocking the walkways with large pipes and buckets to spread mulch in theory. Mostly the “green card free” all male ground crew just stood around in small groups eyeballing the pool area while holding their groins with both hands. That may be entertainment on Orange Blossom trail but not really that family friendly at a resort next to Disney World! I could go on but I am tired of writing as you are probably tired of reading. I like the resort on looks and features but learned to loath it for its nickel and dime attitude on fees, lack of entertainment, and overall mismanagement of its revenue generating resources. I would still recommend it but only to people with very low expectations of what a resort should be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel1616
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend with my husband and two children (7 & 4). Overall, it was a great little vacation! We live and work in Orlando, so I was looking for an easy getaway to just relax. I typically spend many hours researching hotels prior to booking and this time was no different. I love luxury and especially a good value, so that is what I strive for each time I book. I was considering the Waldorf for this vacation, but opted for the Hyatt because I thought it would be a better option for the kids. I think my choice was spot on. The Hyatt Grand Cypress is the PERFECT choice for young kids. However, it is not what I consider a luxurious hotel. The rooms were conspicuously small and just did not have the feel of a high end resort. That being said, the resort grounds are stunning and the pools are fab!! The amenities that you receive for the resort fee are well worth it. We did everything...kayaking, paddle boating, rock climbing, biking, and kid's activities at the pool. There are two slides (big and small) that the kids loved. My husband (and a lot of other husbands) also loved the big slide! I went down once and that thing is super fast. If I had not almost lost my bathing suit, I would have been on it all day:) I would also say that the service we received was top notch. The server at the pool (Vonda) was friendly and always there when we needed her. The bellman checked all of the drawers and under the bed before we checked out (he found two shoes and a sock! :) We also booked the Regency Club which was lovely and saved us a lot of money for breakfast and snacks throughout the day. So, what I didn't like... I am not a fan of the balconies as they are not very safe for young children (in my opinion) and also not large enough to put a chair on. I also noticed a lack of attention to detail in the hotel and around the pool area. The staff should be more diligent about picking up trash on the ground. And, I really dislike dirty windows. I know that keeping windows free of dirty, sticky little hands is nearly impossible, but please make an attempt. Someone should be cleaning windows 24/7. I was not happy that the even the sliders in my room during check-in were not clean. These two little things could easily be improved upon bringing this resort up a level. Overall great vacation, but next time I'm going to try the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would not return...”
Reviews.Author: 1970sunlover
Reviews.Content: I don't want this to sound like a completely negative review, because the resort does have a LOT of positive things. Upon check in, the woman at the desk advised us she didn't have the room we requested ( mind you, we booked this 3 months prior ). We requested two double beds/pool view. Asked us if a King with a sleeper would be OK. We advised her it would NOT be OK and she basically told us we had no choice, as they were overbooked. Asked for a manager, and after waiting about 10 minutes, she emerged from the back room and said she "found" us a room. Also, we did get complimentary champagne at check-in, which was a nice touch. The grounds of this resort are beautiful. Attention to detail is very evident and one can tell they do take pride in this. The pool area is gorgeous. There are little streams around the pool with ducks and flowers. They just got all new wicker chairs with nice pads around the entire pool area. The pools themselves, are gorgeous. The main pool, which is not heated and some of the 9 people in our party found it to be chilly. After speaking with a returning guest, we did learn that they actually cool this pool. Apparently if they didn't, it would be around 90+ degrees and not refreshing in the 95 degree July weather. For the most part, I did find it to be refreshing, but on the cloudier days, it was chilly. Moving on to the food...we didn't have any dinners at the resort as they were very expensive. Every restaurant you could possibly want is within a five minute drive of the resort, so it wasn't a problem. However, on the days we didn't do the parks, we did grab lunch by the pool and the prices were reasonable. Drinks are definitely on the expensive side. $13 dollars for a Pina Colada/Daquiri and around $6-7 for a 12 oz. can of beer. Bring a soft sided cooler with a beer they sell there, ie: bud light, corona, etc. Much more economical. Now for the rooms....They are small. We had myself, my husband, and our 12 year old daughter, so it was a room with two doubles and it was just small. We only stay at 5 star resorts when we travel and this was very small in comparison to others we have stayed at. There are just two deep drawers to put clothes in, and the closet to hang garments. It is not enough storage for a family to unpack. Our 12 year old decided to live out of her suitcase for the week. Also, yes, the rooms are renovated and clean, however, I personally, was NOT a fan of the decor. Just TOO contemporary/cold for my liking, but to each their own. The bathrooms are nicely equipped. However, the water pressure in the shower is HORRIBLE!! Also, had to call maintenance TWICE during our stay, as the toilet decided it didn't want to flush anymore. Again, I believe this was due to the inadequate water pressure. This went for the sink as well. Brushing your teeth was a five minute ordeal. Housekeeping was fine, but nothing spectacular. Pretty much just made up the beds and gave you fresh towels. Overall, a beautiful property, but in my opinion, not five stars. 3.5-4.0 at the MOST. Also, the $11.00 per day SELF PARK is ridiculous. It is a good 10 minute walk to get your car. Unfortunatley, we didn't get to use many of the onsite amenities, as we were running around to the parks, but they DID have a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Aworkingmommy
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite resorts. Beautiful property with lots to do. Fantastic pool, large enough to have a section for every mood. Active, quiet, family...find the area that's to your liking and enjoy. Don't miss the great slide, which really has a kick to it. This property charges a resort fee, but gives you amenities in return. Bike, paddle boat, canoe, free wi-fi, much more. The buffet brunch is small, but top-notch quality. If you are there on a Sunday, in season, brunch at La Coquina is an event, and not to be missed. Bring your "only-live-once" attitude, as Your wallet will be hit hard. If you stay at this resort, don't just run off to the parks. Spend a day enjoying the property. Staff and service can run hot and cold, so if you are not happy about anything, speak up. On the down-side, two doubles instead of two queens in the rooms is a big strike against this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: erhwil
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orlando and stay at Grand Cypress. Hotel itself is large, clean, with plenty of activites for families. Found all staff we interacted with to be extremely friendly and helpful. Previous reviews are correct in that drinls are very expensive, lot of extra charges, 11$ to self park on top of 22$ resort fee. that being said it was not out of line with other luxury hotels and the food quality, room layout, pool, lake activities lead to a psitive review from me.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daveonholiday
Reviews.Content: Have been stopping at this hotel for 15 years and have enjoyed coming back that was up until this recent trip. Upon arrival they now want to charge you $11 per day for parking your car in the hotel car park on top of the $20 per day fee to use the pool! The pool area is congested and had to wait 15 minutes for towels one day. Attitude of staff is poor - requests a room overlooking the pool and when we were allocated the room it was in a position where another room can see in - we asked to be moved and were placed in another room which we were happy with. We unpacked our bags and noticed there was no sofa bed for our 7 year old son - we called reception and spoke with the manager who said that they were unable to put a roleaway bed in the room as it was policy and we would have to move rooms. When I said we had unpacked and I didn't want to move rooms and asked where should my son sleep the response was we can charge you for another room and he can sleep in there!! Obviously we packed up and had to move rooms - no flexability just bad attitude. Housekeeping is of a low standard - the beds are quickly made up and no vacuuming, no refilling of shampoo etc. The hotel seams to be geared up for business conferences and place holiday guests as a second priority - I would suggest that alongside the $45 million refit they should spend some money of staff training and customer service. They have just lost a long standing customer and I would not recommend this hotel if you aim to visit on holiday - maybe if you are on business! Will stop at the ritz Carlton nect time as that looks great value for money and a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Yolie
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Its very nice and modern. You can ride bikes, rock climbing and it has a great pool. My kids had the time of my life and I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: pixidust926
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a vacation to Orlando and it was an absolutely amazing experience. We booked through a travel agency so naturally we didn't expect to get many perks since the price was significantly lower but upon arrival we were welcomed with a champagne greeting and an upgrade to a king lake view room when the travel agency neglected to specify that we wanted a king and not a double. Hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful and the resort itself is gorgeous. It is clear that there was a lot of effort put into renovations and the many amenities offered provided lots of entertainment after exploring theme parks. Several reviewers seem to think that the $22 resort fee is exorbitant but honestly with the plethora of activities offered, you really can't find a better deal- kayaking, paddle boats, golfing, bicycle rentals, rock climbing wall, water slides, etc. Our only regret was that there was so much to do that we didn't get the chance to use all the facilities! Unfortunately, self parking is no longer included in the $22 fee but overall the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress is a gorgeous hotel equipped to satisfy a wide range of travelers. Will definitely visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Standards have slipped”
Reviews.Author: sooScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again from july 1st for 8 nights. This time we were disappointed with our stay. Hotel was very busy especially over the 4th july weekend. We had a few issues, undercooked chicken at the poolside cafe, complained and they made another one, didn't charge us, least they could do! My husband and 7 year old son went swimming early one morning, (9 ish) my son found a wine glass in the swimming pool. My husband spoke to someone and asked for management to contact him to discuss further, we are still waiting! I went to use the poolside toilets one day and they were disgusting, again I reported this to an employee at the poolside bar and he assured me it would be dealt with. I can only agree with other people that the resort fee should be added into the hotel rate, why do you have to pay extra? Maybe the management team can respond to this. The cleanliness of the bedrooms was very good, so well done to housekeeping, pool cleaners take note! Will I return, no, for a 5 star hotel I think you have to raise your standards to compete with the others out there.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MsRena
Reviews.Content: Im a single mom w/ a 12yo daughter and every year we go on vacation to Orlando and stay at different 3+star hotels. This by far was our greatest trip. My daughter absolutely loved the pools and all the activities they had. You really dont have to leave the resort if you dont want. The value I feel was very fair even w/ the resort fee because it includes so much! The staff from the front desk to the bell hop to cleaning crew everyone was beyond nice. It made the stay even that much greater. I could go on and on about how wonderful our stay was. We will definitely be returning and my daughter can not wait. Thanks Hyatt for great memories and such a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dargil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June with our 2 small grandchildren.This is a yearly thing since they don't live in the same city.When we first arrived we were taken by how lovely this place is.The room was very nice,comfortable and clean.The fridge was the first we have had that really worked.The kids loved the pools and the slides.A daily occurance had to be the kayaks which everyone loved.There is a lot for the kids to do,and we only went off the resort to eat.We didn't eat at the restaurants as I'm sorry to say,we found the prices to be exorbitant,especially since children waste so much.We are hoping to come again later in the year we haven't decided yet,depends if we can get a good deal.Overall we all really did think this place was fantasic.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: mosaictraveller
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after midnight. The front desk staff was very helpful in making sure we check-in quickly. They also explained about the $22/day resort fee and what amenities are included. For example: internet, 9-hole Chip/Put course, bike rental, canoe, Kayak, paddle boat and few others. My kids utilized all of those amenities. The pool was big and had 2 water slides for the kids and adults. The family would definitely come back stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “Like a bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Milangel
Reviews.Content: When we entered the hotel, the first thing my nephew said was, "This is the most beautiful hotel I've ever been to." Get this, he normally stays at Disney's Beach Club with his parents. I was glad that I found something to impress him. The lobby was very nice and relaxing. I loved the lighted pebble pool and the Asian statues sprinkled about. At night it was absolute heaven to go down there and relax while browsing the net. The two birds in the lobby during the day were also a nice touch. I really loved the rooms. They felt fresh, clean, and uncluttered. The decor was modern but not so modern that it seemed cold. The colors are so comforting that I felt like I had checked into a spa. The beds were SO COMFY! You get three pillows on your pillow top bed and the linen is not hard. I believe it is of a higher thread count. I really liked having the chaise lounge by the window and the little fridge that took the place of the minibar. The bathroom was spacious enough and the shower had both a regular shower head and a hand held. The bathtub was deep enough for a soak. The amenities were I believe of a Eucalyptus scent which I didn't care much for but others might. The towels were not very soft. I went to the restaurant Cascades for breakfast. The restaurant is beautiful and clean. The food was very good. It's not cheap, but it is a lovely place to have a meal. I do recommend it. There are also several restaurant choices within close proximity to the hotel as well as a 24hr. supermarket if you want to stock your little fridge with reasonably priced snacks. The grounds are BEAUTIFUL! I felt like I had been transported to Hawaii or Bali. Rock pools, statuary, waterfalls, beautiful vegetation, a sand beach, bridges, volleyball net, boat rental, three pool areas, water slides, a rope bridge over the pool, several hot tubs, poolside refreshments,......WHEW! It was amazing. I made a point of spending time wandering the grounds or just sitting out there to enjoy the scenery. It was so beautiful out there. I can't say enough good things about it. The self-parking is a bit of a problem. There isn't enough room in that lot for a hotel of that size. Several nights I came back to the hotel and couldn't find a parking space so I had to park wherever my vehicle would fit. The hotel security was very understanding and polite about this. The walk from the parking lot is NOT far so I have no complaints there. Most of the hotel staff that I encountered were very pleasant; from the front desk, to the wait staff, and housekeeping. I was very impressed. The other person wasn't worth getting into a snit about or downgrading this property. This will definitely be my hotel of choice in the Orlando area. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great Florida getaway!”
Reviews.Author: sschroeder
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent three days at this all-inclusive resort near DisneyWorld. The grounds and beautiful public areas are amazing. First, the car valet service was very convenient ($23) with check-in fast and efficient. The rooms are great, completely remodeled in 2009. Flat screen TV, balconies, super-comfortable bedding, modern bath. The only complaint is that during remodeling the older style bath tub from the 1980’s was left intact meaning that you have to step high into it. We found house-keeping to above average. We utilized the pool area with pool-side bar. The pool is not heated, the water was pretty cold. We also noticed that being of an older design there is not zero-entry and the deepest part of the pool is over 6 feet deep. As part of the resort fee added to your room rate you have complete access to the pool, water craft, ping-pong, etc. All options were popular with lots of activity. In the morning we enjoyed the Starbucks coffee service in the lobby. We also enjoyed the sports bar for a burger dinner on two of the nights that we stayed. The room rates are extremely competitive and I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and all you need!”
Reviews.Author: Valueskr
Reviews.Content: I just stayedt there for one night. But had a great experience from check in to check out. Gym and spa were great. Not packed but still with enough machines if some others decided to work out. Only used certain services on food area and they were flawless but I did not order anything major. Pool area is great, as are the couple of bars I saw. Rooms are big, comfortable, look and feel fresh with a new design, flat tv and balcony. My only suggestion to staff would be to check on mattresses every now and then. Maybe turn them around or over. Mine on the side which faced directly the tv, seems most guests choose that side, thus it is a bit hollow on that side. No big problem for me as I used the other side. Self parking is a decent walk to rooms, lobby etc...keep in mind this is a big hotel resort style, so make sure you don't forget anything in your room or car, as it could be a few minutes to go and get it. Overall very satisfied with all amenities the hotel has to offer and with the skilled staff they have. Also location of the hotel is close to everything. Plenty of restaurants, late night fun, and close to major highway access.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to be nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: Frthygg
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice, although it does show it's age in different areas - Our experience however was tainted by the incessant nickle and dining that we found at each turn. From the mysterious "hotel fee" to the perpetual included 18% gratuity and the tips expected by all attendants Beware that the hotel rate you are quoted does not even nearly cover all of your hotel costs

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel, lacked a bit of magic”
Reviews.Author: Rach_Clare
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hyatt from a week at Clearwater in an absolutely amazing hotel. This hotel was more expensive and a lot posher. It is a HUGE hotel with 22 floors. The reception is Japanese style and even has a stream and 2 parrots! If you like modern and glitzy this is the place for you. The bell hop who greeted us was very enthusiastic and showed us to our room on the ninth floor. Our room had a stunning view over the pool and lake, and you could see Epcot, Downtown Disney, and the magic kingdom in the distance, meaning we were able to watch the fireworks from our balcony at night. We had breakfast every day - great selection of hot and cold, including a pancake/waffle station where the chef cooked yo your requirements (this was included in the buffet breakfast). The Cascades restaurant where breakfast is held is stunning and even has a waterfall! Our car was parked in the car park (we parked ourselves to save money) and it was a bit of a walk back into the hotel, but you could either walk back through tropical gardens, or walk through an indoor conferencing space. Not much of a hassle. The hotel is in a brilliant location, with the entrance to Disney very close, and across the road is a restaurant complex with TGI Fridays, other restaurants and a super market. Everything is very close actually, you're never short of places to shop or eat, so much choice. Hotel pool is wonderful, although only used it once because we were out the whole time. The lake is lovely with lots of loungers and even hammocks nearby! The room itself was lovely - big comfy bed, and great sofa with footstool, big tv, ipod dock and fridge. Shower is AMAZING! it has a overhead rain shower head as well as another head for washing yourself or creating more power. Shower cubicle huge too. Maid who made up our room every day was lovely - she was very creative with the towels! (i.e making fans and display platforms for the cuddly toys i bought at Disney!). The only thing that brings this hotel down is the $22 resort fee (yes, gone up from $20) - we had planned for it though and saved money to pay it at the end but even more taxes and charges were added on and we ended up with a bill of $170 for 7 nights (just resort tax). This should be added to the price of the room when you book, its ridiculous. Overall this is a very fancy hotel and tickes a lot of boxes but it lacked the warmth and holiday atmosphere of a smaller more friendly hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Top notch destination with something for all ages”
Reviews.Author: Gr8t2bhere
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at this resort for a family vacation with 2 teenagers. This property is adjacent to Disney and offered shuttles to all the parks. We actually chose to go to Disney only once this trip because we were having so much fun enjoying this resort so much doing all the things it offered - biking, golfing, tennis, pools with 2 water slides, paddle boats, sailing, kayaking, hot tubs game room and 24 hour fitness center. Can honestly say, no one was bored! Highly recommend you sign up for the Regency program which enabled you to eat a daily continental breakfast from 7-10 (fresh pineapple, strawberries, cantaloupe, honeydew, yogurt, granola, cold cereals, oatmeal, bagels, croissants, cold cuts, assorted breads, pastries and juices and a hot entree (pancakes or omelets), coffee, cappacino, tea, soda), followed by snacks and beverages from 11-3, then hor'douvres (hot and cold including raw veggies and dip, roasted veggies, bruschettas, cheeses and others that varied by day) followed by 7-9 desserts. This was no ordinary food - delicious, special and beautiful presentation. That's just the food part of it! You eat all of this on the 12th floor overlooking the beautiful Hyatt property as well as Disney's. We actually watched the Disney 4th of July fireworks from up the plus at least 10 other firework shows from all over the area while eating desserts and missing all the crowds - truly special. Lastly, there is a dedicated concierge at your disposal and two computers with printers. Only cons were we wished the beds were Queens instead of doubles although they were comfortable and while the pool chairs were plentiful on the property there was a shortage if you wanted one overlooking the pool so folks were getting up very early in the morning to try to get the pool seats. That said, we heard the property was sold out during the 4th of July weekend so that certainly added to the demand on seating and parking in the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but avoid the 4th July weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jennyapple
Reviews.Content: After a busy few days sightseeing in New York my family flew to Orlando to visit the attractions and relax. The Hyatt was the ideal place to do both. It is right beside the entrance to Disney and very close to I-4 which will take you to the shopping Outlets and Universal. The hotel has so much on offer that you really do want to take a few days enjoying the amenities. We availed of the Family plan which gave us the second connecting room at half price and got the sunshine offer giving us every 4th or 5th night free - be sure to ask. That certainly helped take care of costs. We could have helped ourselves by eating away from the hotel more as it is surrounded by all sorts of both fast and medium quality resturants. I saw many people coming in with Pizza Hut and Perkins boxes . Food prices in the hotel can be quite high and unless you are dining in Hemmingways it wont be that much different from the local eateries so recomend eating out more. There is a cool box in the room which is really a mini fridge without an ice-box - certainly fine for keeping wine/beer and drinks cold. We did not realize until quite late into the trip that there is a self service laundry in the games room but remember to bring your credit card and not room key as I did first time. The pool area is fabulous but I found it a bit too hot to enjoy many of the other activities e.g. golf (which is a car drive away) etc. No need to valet park or upgrade the room unless you really want something extra special - standard rooms are a great size and are beautifully presented. Staff were exceptional throughout and the glass of champagne on arrival really helped kick off the holiday atmosphere. The only sour note was how crowded it became on 4th July weekend - to be expected but not pleasant. Too many adults standing drinking in the swimming pools and impossible to get a sun lounger. The other really busy week is just after Christmas but any other time and it is heaven. Kids loved it but would think slightly older kids would get more from it - no babies paddling pool and would benefit from a free to use playroom where kids could play indoors away from the heat of the afternoon. Camp Hyatt way too pricey when catering for 3 kids. Would defintely consider a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: stevesamaha
Reviews.Content: Has been a few years since I have stayed here, it is one of my favorite places in Orlando, them made a great pool even better. It is now an awesome pool, place is picture perfect

Reviews.Title: “Local to Orlando-We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bpepp22
Reviews.Content: Quick one night trip to the Disney area from our home in Oviedo and we absolutely loved this hotel. We used PriceLine and got a steal. Enjoyed the pools and loved Hemingways.. The service was fantastic. From how we were greated at the Valet Stand, to Bell Hop, to check out.. Really outstanding. We have stayed at the JW, Ritz, Waldorf all in Orlando in the last 12 months and I would put the service against any of them..

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: lluvthesun999
Reviews.Content: like the title says this hotel will always be high on my list, i went here as a child with my parents around 20 years ago and loved it then and now as a parent this was a must for my family as i knew my 2 girls would love it too. As we drove thro the front gates and upto the hotel you drive over a little bridge witch goes over a massive pond and upto the front of the hotel where you are greeted by the always smiling and helpful staff who take your lugage to the reception desk where you are given a glass of champagne to toast the start of your holiday, reception is beautifal with its little indoor ponds and trees and you look straight up to the glass roof and of course i have to mention the 2 parrots kula and merlot who my daughter said morning and nite to everyday. You take a choice of 5 glass lifts to you floor, i recommend a high floor as you can go watch the fireworks, epcot fireworks 9 and magic kingdom at 10 we was on floor 17 and the views are breathtaking, although i did not let my young girls go on our balcony as they could fit throu the bars, the room was of a high standard and the cleaners do a very good job and again always smile and say hello, as a family we had 2 double beds and a cot was supplied for our youngest, plenty of room for us and nicely laid out. all of the staff are good and friendly but i do have to mention one in particular who helped make our stay perfect and that was jp who works down where you have breakfast, my two daughters looked forward to going to breakfast each morning just to see jp who was always happy to help us and always smiling and making my girls laugh and if i owned a hotel i would hire him instantly, the breakfast area was beautifal with its large water feature that kept my 2 girls occupied while we had breakfast, the food was good enjoyed the buffet breakfast. alot of people on here complain about the service charge but i thought it was fair for all that was included we went on bikes/canoes/pedlos there was a climbing wall but did not use it as my girls were to young. Now im trying to think how best to describe the pool apart from perfect let me put it this way my eldest daughter 3 would often say to me about leaving the parks to go back to the pool she luved the slides waterfalls and lucky for me the jacuzzis, the pool area is nicely laid out and never felt to crowded, plenty of sunbeds, there is some hammocks on the beach to which is also good for the kids to play on, the flora is beautifal that surrounds this whole hotel and you can often see a lizard or 2 basking in the sun and down at the docks you can feed the fish. theres plenty to do here to keep a family entertained. location was perfect for us as we chose not to have a car, we would take the free shuttle bus in the morning to magic kingdom/seaworld/epcot and get a taxi back depending what time we left which was about $10-15, you have downtown disney 5 minutes around the corner where you have a choice of shops and restaurants and you had some more shops and resturants just over the road on the right as you come out the front gates and if you go to them just stop of at the front of pizza hut where there is a pond with a family of otters living there, here you can find a great choice for food italian, mcdonalds and many more. so back to this hotel what more can i say than it was perfect for my family great location, beautifal and good staff with an outstanding pool, we certainly will be going back there and i reccommend it to any family,couple etc.... and thanks to all the staff that made our stay

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, staff amazingly friendly. Cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: katy1066
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June for 2 weeks, myself and partner. We absolutely loved it. The staff are the most friendly people ever, the hotel/rooms spotless and facilities brilliant. On arrival we had champagne, given a brief tour of the hotel and shown to our rooms. The hotel itself is breath-taking with its sky high atrium entrance. Car parking is to the side of the hotel, which is just a short walk. It is very secure, which is very reassuring. There were plenty of sun beds around the pool, and even a designated 'quiet area' for those without children. The breakfast is lovely, food was good and waiting staff the again a tribute to the hotel with their friendliness/helpfulness. Breakfast is $21 each for a generous buffet of food inc bagels, ham, cheese, pastries, waffles/pancakes, porridge, bacon, eggs, sausages, omelettes - egg white omelette was great and very healthy. We had this included in our hotel package(book through BA for this) and it was well worth it. My only comment which isnt positive is the cost of drinks around the pool. We paid $15 for two beers and anotherday $8 for a rose wine which was served in a plastic cup(no wine glass). But we ended up in Wal Mart one day and ended up buying a pack of the same beer for $10 and took them down to the pool in a cooler. No one seemed to mind and it made our hotel bill a lot cheaper. Another good tip is to buy a polystryne cooler from Wal Mart which costs just $2-3. We filled this with ice from the ice machines on each floor of the hotel. We would take this out in the car and leave it in the boot so when we finished in the theme parks we could have an ice cold drink. Also good for keeping beer cold around the pool!! We are looking forward to returning here. It is one of the best. *Oh and a special mention to Merlot (a parrot who meows like a cat) and Kula (a cockatiel) who kept us amused from their home in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time's a Charm!”
Reviews.Author: buckeyecruiser09
Reviews.Content: Our family finished our florida vacation here at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. This is our second time here and we love this resort! A tip for my frugal friends: Try to get this on Priceline.com using betterbidding.com as a guide. I got this hotel for 3 nights Sun-Wed for $78 a night + a $20 a night resort fee (includes internet too). No one will know you paid half of what they did. The hotel has the best pools, service, and housekeeping around. You won't want to stay anywhere else in Orlando. It is gated, which means only guest can get in, it is near the Disney and Downtown Disney. Lots of inexpensive restaurants nearby, and its an easy drive up I4 to Universal. Tip: bring your own drinks and snacks. They add a 18% pool service charge even when you go to the bar by the pool. I bought one drink and gave a tip only to realize the bartender already got my tip. Another tip: Do the self parking. You can walk up a path to the front lobby. Think about it, if you go to the parks, your walking anyway, save some money and avoid the valet and burn some calories. They have lots to do here: climbing wall, lake with a beach, paddle boats, bikes, and kids activities. If you can get a great deal, you need to stay here when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: RockyRaleighNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June - two rooms - one kIng and one dual doubles. The hotel has recently been refurbished and is super nice. Rooms are great and very clean. Lobby is dynamite. But the best part about this hotel is the pool, par 3 golf course, lake with kayaks, water bikes, etc, slides, spa, and great grounds, all included in the price. The hotel is about 5 minutes from Downtown disney. I would absolutely stay again and at $169 a night it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “returned to the HRGC and loved it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvorlando
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our return trip to the HRGC and it's been almost 2 years since our last trip so we were very excited to return. We stayed for 11 days and took advantage of the Sunshine on sale rates which were great! always a perk to join Hyatt's Goldpassport program (which is free) and earn points because those points come in handy for upgrades! We upgraded to a 2 room executive suite which our 2 teenage boys loved and we had our own room...very convenient AND we upgraded to the Regency Club level as well (all great perks of gold passport!) with my points earned. Regency Club is amazing and offers breakfast, afternoon beverages and lite snacks, early evening appetizers, cocktails for purchase and desserts and cordials...it really is worth it even if you pay for the upgrade. The service from the concierges in the club is awesome! The rooms are fresh and clean with colors of the ocean. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are tidy. Now for the resort activities: LOTS to do in the daytime and the pool is the BEST! grab a lounge chair, order a cocktail (pool prices though), slather the suntan oil on and just beeeeeeeee........amazing! the kids love it as much as the adults. Tons of daily activities....NOTE: I mean this with the greatest intention.......This is a resort and meant to be treated as such.......that means the property is kept very nice and by paying the daily resort fee of $22.00 per room, they expect their guest to enjoy the activities. It appears that some families come to this property and seem shocked by the resort fee because they got a slamming great rate and they complain a little because of the restaurants and expensive drinks.....this is a resort and therefore you will have some higher fees to expect at the restaurant so don't be shocked or complain. I agree some fees are a bit over exaggerated such as room service especially but again if you know this upfront then you have options and must keep this in mind. Most important about this property is the amazing staff...seriously, the service is the best and simply top notch. The only thing I would love to see this property improve on is some kind of nightly entertainment or evening events of some kind.

Reviews.Title: “You Be The Judge”
Reviews.Author: doloresandjeff
Reviews.Content: I will try to be objective in my review and will let you be the judge. My husband and I have previously stayed here and were very much satisfied way back in 2003. Reservations were made in early May for two rooms (daughter and I are attending a conference). I have severe asthma and had requested hypoallergenic bedding when room was originally booked back in early May (feathers kill me). A week prior to the conference, my daughter called the hotel and requested adjoining rooms. She was assured that they would try to honor our request. On our drive to the hotel my daughter called and spoke with Mike and requested an early check-in if at all possible. When we arrived at the hotel, valets in abundance surrounded the car. After assurance by the front desk that our belongings would be put in a locked area until our room was ready, we allowed the valet to unload the car and gave him a handsome tip. At the front desk we were told "we were completely booked last night". My daughter and I headed off to our conference while our husbands gave credit cards and registered. They left the hotel with the 4 year old in tow giving my son-in-law's cell phone number with the request to call when either one of the rooms were available. At approximately 2 PM my daughter and I visited the front desk and spoke with Jorge. Again, "we were completely booked last night and no rooms are available". Jorge gave my grandson a pail and shovel and coloring book and said he had no crayons but the restaurants might have crayons. What? We can't even get crayons for a 4 year old and others speak of the champagne greeting. We again asked about them calling when one of the rooms became available. Jorge said he didn't have a phone number. What? My daughter and I headed back to our conference and finally my son-in-law received a call at 4 pm that one of the rooms was ready. At 4:30 we met up with our family and learned that the second room was still not available. Our husbands informed us that when they went to get the key at the front desk they saw our luggaage cart sitting in the corner of the lobby completely unattended. What? We were appalled since it contained a laptop, Ipad, etc. It is now 4:45. We head off property. We return at approximately 8:30 and enter the second room. Certainly not my idea of cleanliness. A lid but no ice bucket. Call to guest services - Are you sure there is no ice bucket?. Yes. By this time we are aware water is not draining from sink. Husband manages to get drain stopper up but it falls back down. These seniors are tired by this point. Oh - the bedding - feathered duvet and pillows. No facecloths. I'll deal with this in the morning and attempt sleep just with the sheet and no pillows. Call made at 8 am the next morning - need hyperallergenic bedding as requested on reservation, face cloths, and our sink doesn't drain. Off to the conference. 4 pm - neither room has been serviced. Hubby advises that he received a call at 2:30 regarding non-draining sink. There is a tiny lever behind the faucet that works the stopper - "everyone has this problem". What?? This is not visible even looking in the mirror but we no longer have the problem - ok. It is after 4:15 when I meet up with Ken (a housekeeping manager) who inquires about my stay. I explain that despite my request, hyperallergenic bedding was not supplied, there were no face cloths in either room and both rooms have not been serviced. He follows me to the rooms and tells me he will have the rooms taken care of and he will stay to see it is done. Foam pillows (yuck) are supplied but Hyatt does not have hypoallergenic duvets (these are readily available in most chains including Marriott and Sheraton). A wool blanket which doesn't even cover the top of the bed is used. Staff leaves and I go in the bathrooms - no face cloths. I find staff in the hall and get the damn face cloths. Guess they are now a request only item. Now the kicker, at 8:15 the next morning, housekeeping is banging on both doors asking what time we will be checking out. What? Regarding resort fees, it rained practically the entire time but no hotel has control over the weather. We just wished we could have enjoyed more of the amenities. There are many new, well run establishments In Orlando. The Hyatt was a huge disappointment. I could go on and on regarding the cleanliness of the room and the attitude of some of the front desk personnel, but I think you get the picture. Oh - before I forget. The check out line was huge. We resorted to the self check out kiosk (we were unable to use the TV to check out). Now we find there are billing issues. I'll deal with this another day. Would I stay here again - absolutely not, especially given the number of quality hotels now in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay unless you plan on them charging you almost triple once you go to check in!”
Reviews.Author: TimKatie55
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this hotel is beautiful....and that's about it! Here is my experience with check in/out. This is from an email I later sent to the hotel, so that is why it is written in this format. I will be doing my best to get the word out about this hotel as this is a VERY SHADY thing they are doing. And if you read other reviews and I far from the only one! I would just like to bring to your attention my experience during my recent visit. I was there for a conference with my room rate at 109 a night. I was staying for 3 nights. I had my room reserved with my debit card (which has never been a problem at any other hotel EVER!) Your hotel wanted a credit card from me so they could hold upwards to $800 on it! I was there for conference not for fun, this was most certainly not a figure I was expecting to have to pay upon arrival and I didn't budget for it. Plus all the fees just didn't add up right to me anyway...After going back and forth with the woman (Barbara) and asking her to take out a calculator so I could see what exactly she was charging me for we agreed that my charges would be about $400, plus she added a $75 fee to this that I would get back when I checked out on Sunday. I go to the atm come back 2 minutes later and she is asking me for over $500 , I argued that after going over figures we had JUST agreed on $485, she goes and tells me that was before paying the $75 fee. I insist that she shows me her calculations again and this time it actually came out to be $10 less than the original. I tell her I want to know what is going on because none of this is adding up right, especially when I show up here expecting to pay $109 a night. Her response to me was lets not go tit for tat over $10! I'm thinking...are you kidding me!! This is not up for negotiation, a price is a price, either it costs a certain amount or it doesn't. Anyway I then hand her $500 and she refuses to give me the change I should be getting back (about $15) She says I'm not giving this back to you, you can have it on Sunday. I then demand a printed out receipt because all of this is just not right, she refuses to give me a printed out receipt. I tell her I want to talk to a manager and all of a sudden I get a receipt, and my total is just about $400, right where I thought it should have been in the first place. But she still wouldn't give me the rest of my money back, that I would have to wait to get when I check out. So at this point I give up, I tell her I will be expecting my money back when I check out on Sunday and I have this receipt to prove it. She says, yup won't be a problem. So I go and check out on Sunday and wouldn't you know it's Barbara again..and I can't check out just yet because she says I owe the hotel another $330..where is she getting these figures from?? I have no idea!! I hand over my receipt and explain no way you actually owe me money, she says she not giving me my money back and I have to pay what I owe, she tells me that the receipt I'm holding is only for a one nights stay at your resort. So all of a sudden my $109 night room went to $400??!!! I tell her that is not what we went over on Friday, she then acts like some light bulb just went off in her head and says oh yea I remember you, she then tries to give me $60 back. Now my receipt says I should be getting $100, I ask her where the rest of the money went...she said it was for a resort fee, (which we had already argued about and figured out and added into my bill that friday) So I tell her no, that was already included, it's right here in black and white. I finally tell her that I would like to speak to a manager and all of sudden she says she'll give me my $100 back. I don't know what Barbara is doing here or what she is doing with extra money that she requesting from guests but that isn't being recorded into your system, but it might be something that should be looked into!! I can take responsiblity for showing up to your hotel and not being aware of all the extra fees, but who expects a $75 incidental per person per night fee?? That is very expensive and should be posted very clearly on your website. That is a lot of money to throw people off with when they are not expecting it, and then to have the staff be so rude about it. I showed up there on Friday and was apologizing like crazy that I was not prepared to pay all that money and the attitude was just like oh well...it wasn't until I really had to stand my ground that I able to make some headway. I must say..every other detail of my stay was absolutley amazing. But this whole situation should have never happened. I'm not sure if it is because of hotel policy or if Barbara is just a bad seed. But I would suggest some changes. I was at a conference with over 500 people and I was not the only person that this happened to. I personally talked to 4 other women who dealt with this exact same thing, one of the ladies actually had your front desk lady Sierra THROW a room key at her!! I mean this is crazy!! I hope this situation is dealt with immediately. A price is a price, I can't beging to tell you how many times my rate and fees changed it is ridiculous! I even showed up with my printed online reg for that is showing my rate of 109, I don't think anyone on this planet would assume then that your front desk would then cheerfully ask for almost $800.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Hit-or-Miss Service, Bring Your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: FundraiserGuy
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel several times over the last ten years. After a recent make-over we were hopeful to see a fresh face on an old friend. Yes, the hotel was updated, but what we found was disappointing. Some thoughts about this hotel: 1. Resort Fee. Everyone pays it. As we checked in we learned that the nightly rate we thought we would pay was a fantasy. We were required to pay a resort fee of $22 MORE per night plus taxes on that. Whether you never plan to canoe, rock climb or "pitch and putt" you will pay this fee. Why not just include it in the rate? If a two-bit interstate hotel can offer free wi-fi, why can't this magnificent resort? Or at least honor the rate we thought we were going to get. Admittedly, learning our stay's price would be higher than we planned, set the tone for the stay. 2. The maid staff is a highlight. The hotel is spotless. These saints clean, scrub and polish all day. Bravo and thank you. It shows. 3. The recreation staff, mainly college interns, were great. Since we paid the fee, we changed our plans to try to the recreation a little. These kids are wonderful. 4. After several stays we have always found the front desk staff to be the least helpful of all staff at the hotel. Surprising and immensely disappointing. 5. I have seen other reviewers discuss complimentary champagne and other similar niceties. We saw no champagne. Don't know how they got it and we didn't, but no champagne. Our overall impression of this hotel was that if you don't pay for it, you don't get it, and getting it is universally expensive. 6. One of the other reviews talked about the aggressive bellhops. They are correct! Two approached our car when we pulled up. When they saw I was only dropping my wife off while I parked, they were discernibly upset that they would not have a chance at a tip (no luggage or help needed). 7. The pool. Oh, the pool. It is gorgeous, and a highlight. 8. The upgrade. Anyone familiar with the hotel will want to know about the upgrades. They alone are worth staying away from the property (considering the price you pay for them). Overall, the hotel is going for a new age, asian vibe in a modern, cold setting. Not warm, not welcoming, not comforting. Unusual, yes. "cool?" yes. Hyatt? No. For example. The bathroom and closet now share a sliding door. Slide the door one way, you can get into the closet, but not the bathroom. Vice versa, too. Sounds cool and great until you are getting clothes out of the closet and your son is coming out of the bathroom and slides the door right into your head. This happened twice. For some reason they got rid of the nightstand between the beds. I guess it looks cool, but was annoying. 9. No pride. There was trash everywhere, especially under the bushes. We found something neat in the architecture of the building and asked at least four staff members what it was and how it worked. A couple made up answers, the other two didn't know, but did try hard to figure it out. No one had the pride and knowledge of the property they should. 10. Finally, and this kind of sums up the attitude of many, but not all, at the hotel. The lifeguard was late opening the big slide. When she arrived, she turned the chair to face away from the slide and into the bushes and she started texting, and texting and texting. She was kind of rude, and certainly uncaring. Why? Is this what we should expect at a Hyatt, Resort? for our $22 fee? She was aware of my camera and put her phone down when I took photos of my kids! The hotel is still close to Disney, still magnificent architecture and still has pockets of great caring staff. However, for the price you pay and for the Hyatt name, you expect more. With so many other choices in Orlando, I recommend trying another property until Hyatt cares more about the jewel they have in the Grand Cypress.

Reviews.Title: “How one person can spoil it”
Reviews.Author: Ozzytraveller42
Reviews.Content: After a long international journey it would have been nice to be greeted by a friendly face. I and a few other women who were served by one particular staff member at reception were put off ever staying at this Hotel ever again. She was not only rude but after being vertually tossed my room key I had to ask another staff member which room I was in because she turned her back to me, I felt like an inconvienience. The rest of the staff were very nice and accomodating, but first immpressions are very important and I did not have a good one. I have stayed in Hyatt Hotels many times and this is the first time I have had a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel....Excellent Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: KingsCo
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress is simply amazing. From the moment you enter the hotel you are made to feel special. Greeted with a glass of completely champagne you are taken to your room where the staff explain in great detail what the resort has to offer..from swimming (two amazing pools, cycling, boating etc.). The parrots in the lobby are a great idea and great fun ( not only for children...especially Merlot). The rooms are spotlessly clean and amenities are great. Hemingway, the restaurant at the Hyatt, is an experience of a lifetime. The hotess / manager Lindsey could not make you feel more welcome. We went to this restaurant once last year and they still remember us - by name. That is stunning. We had the pleasure to be served by Michael G. and he was fantastic. Truly a gentleman. He made everyone feel special even when the restaurant was extremely busy. The food is out of this world...especially the creme brûlée. Even if you do not have the pleasure staying at the Hyatt you have to dine at Hemingway. Thank you for an amazing stay and see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this Beautiful hotel and would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ugoEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three weeks before Easter. Our booking included a free room upgrade, we actually preferred the garden view room we had on our last visit, the hotel was very busy but the reception staff accommodated our request with one phone call. The hotel is superbly located within easy walk of various shops and restaurants, although we did tend to use a car rather than the hotel transport if we were going out for a day as the scheduled timings weren't convenient for us. The grounds and the pool were as pleasant as we remembered from our earlier visit, the new pool furniture was a welcome new feature, however on close inspection some of the pieces were broken. The free breakfast included in our package was excellent, the regular greeters were friendly and very good at their job, in general the servers were were also friendly and very hard working, but the the stand out member of that team has to be JP who consistently went above and beyond. At reception we were told that the free breakfast voucher included 15% tip and sales tax so we did not have to tip unless we wanted to as this would be on top of the standard tip already included, this is important as one experience which did effect our enjoyment was the attitude of 1 certain member of staff who was sweetness and light the first morning she served us, we encountered the same server the next day and she was plain rude to the point of ignoring us-all because we did not leave a tip!!Ww saw exactly the same thing happen to a lot of other people during our stay, each time it was the same server. This is not acceptable in any establishment let alone a 5 star hotel! We did leave a substantial tip at the end of our stay as all of the rest of the staff had been great. Other slight niggles - rooms not dusted or vacuumed as often as they could be - we realise this may have been because we we're staying for a long time. At the time of our stay the self parking was free but we heard that there was the possibility of there being a charge for this in the future. If this is true then it is a bit steep given that you already pay a resort fee which is meant to cover all of the site facilities. If they were panning on just charging the many people who come to the conferences then this would be more understandable and acceptable. Like many reviewers I do think that it is a fault of Hyatt in general that they do not provide free Wifi, cheap motels can offer this service, why is a 5star hotel brand not able to offer this facility unless you pay the much higher rate of resort tax? Even if it was just free in the lobby and general areas and you paid for in the room this would be a compromise. Slight criticisms aside if the self parking remained free we would stay at the hyatt grand cypress again like a shot, if there was a charge then we would seriously consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & nice room”
Reviews.Author: PDjani
Reviews.Content: We arrived half an hour past midnight from airport, and the hotel staff are very nice. From check in at the front desk, the bellboy until the room service lady who delivered our food, all polite & helpful, even it was after midnight. We have a standard room, but surprisingly the interior is beautifully modern and simple. I love the bathroom, wich is very clean. They even have an air purifyer in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Hemmingway's was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TCT1964
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Hyatt Grand Cypress a couple of weeks ago I took my family, including a five year old and a two year old to Hemmingway's. From the moment we walked in the door we were made to feel unwanted by the manager/hostess. First she tried to push us outside to a table on the patio in 90 degree humid weather and then was inappropriately rude to my children who were doing nothing other than sitting still watching a DVD at the table with the volume turned down about as low as it could go. The manager was rude enough that not only would I never go to Hemmingway's again, I'm soured on the Hyatt brand in general. There are too many hotel company's fighting for your loyalty to put up with that kind of non-sense. Wouldn't you agree Ms. Taylor?

Reviews.Title: “The best holiday that we've ever had and may ever have”
Reviews.Author: TwittersPVFC
Reviews.Content: 5 stars doesn't do justice to how good this hotel is. From the moment we first saw the hotel as we pulled off the I4 until the moment we sadly departed two weeks later, the Grand Cypress was the setting for the greatest holiday that my wife and I could have ever had. The hotel itself is out of this world. The lobby is stunning and the room is superb. We had a lake view room and had a stunning view of the area. If you can afford it though, upgrade to a pool view room. You will get an incredible view of Disney and the firework displays they have at night. The room themselves are superbly sized with our room having a huge king sized bed, sofa and desk as well as a wide screen TV which I think never left Fox while it was on but there are plenty of channels to choose from! There are plenty of choices for eating in at the hotel. It was slightly expensive but you get what you pay for and the quality is superb. The two meals we did have at the hotel were superb quality. We had room service one night and the way it was served to us felt like we were in the restaurant! It was prompt, warm and the staff were superb! If you don't want to pay a lot there are plenty of cheaper restaurants nearby all within walking distance or a two minute drive if you have a car (or order a taxi). They also do a superb breakfast buffet and I ate that much I never needed any lunch! The pools that the hotel have are stunning, although I have no idea how they could get the water so cold when the temperatures were nearing 100F! There are so many things to do, I wish we'd booked a third week so we could sample it all. We did do Disney/Universal most days and so it was handy that the hotel offered a bus within it's Resort Fee. $22 a day may seem a lot but it was cheap at twice the price considering what you got for it. There are so many good things I could say about the hotel I could be here all year. But I can't fault a single thing. Well, there was one minor disappointment....... There are two birds in the lobby, a cockatoo called Kula and a parrot called Merlot. For nearly all of our stay, Merlot barely said a thing apart from Hello. On the last day however he went into a talking frenzy, saying everything you could think of including "Here Kitty Kitty"! It was one of the funniest things and topped off a superb vacation! Seriously, this hotel has everything. I read all the reviews on here and thought they were too good to be true and that the hotel must have faked some! But seriously the hotel is as good as people say it is, and then some more! I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but the hotel could be more service oriented”
Reviews.Author: expataecl
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop at this trip and this hotel worked well for our needs; lots of activities in the hotel and a short drive away from parks and shopping. We had again booked a Club level room and got an ok room with a nice view to the pools and to the nightly fireworks of Disneys. The room was very average and a bit small for an adult and two pre-teens, but it worked out fine. The bathroom/ closet door combination is though a bit strange and not very practical. The premises are average in style but the pool activities just great for this clientele. It was the climbing wall that won the votes of my sons, but unfortunately with quite destricted opening hours never had a chance to use it. They were not open in the morning and closed before returning from the days activities, pitty. Anyway, the pool slides and grotto, bicycles etc provided some fun for the kids. The service at the pool is almost nonexistent, a big minus. The Club here had nothing to do with my previous hotel in Key Biscayne, and therefore was a quite disappointment. A small club with inconvenient opening hours and very limited servings did not impress. Additionally, the alcoholic drinks had an extra charge. The breakfast was correct for our needs, so that worked out well. Extra plus for a very helpful Club Consierge, who gave us so many tips for the parks and shopping. As said, the hotel is very conveniently located by 15 minute drive from Disney and Universal, two major shoppings, and only 5 minutes away from a Outlet Mall. In the area, there are plenty of restaurants to feed the children for their taste (Subway :-). Last evening we dined at the hotel´s Hemingway restaurant, and it was really worth it. The food was great and the athmosphere quite nice. We had to rush out though, since the children had heard about "smors" session at the "beach" and it was about to end in half an hour. Well, this turned out to be fire made so that you could prepare your marshmellows, but after buying the kit from the bar, we had no glue what to do! Good thing there was one parent who was able to give us the instructions. In general, we had a great stay in Orlando and the hotel worked out well, but as said they could put some more emphasis on their guests. Thanks to a one previous tripadvisor posting, I was alert about the summer package charging, and guess what, they had charged me four nights instead of three. The receptionist though credited me without problems.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSunshine29
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I came to this resort based on the trip advisor reviews. We had champagne upon arrival which was a nice surprise and an unexpected upgrade. We loved the pool and thought the bar in the middle of all three pools was very neat. There was nothing we did not like.
