The concierge was very helpful, we were standing in line and the bellmen noticed we were waiting. He came over and answered our questions so we did not have to wait , which was thoughtful. Upon checkout Anna was very speed and friendly. She was very helpful. Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lots of facilities”
Reviews.Author: Cathy2012UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days over Easter. The hotel was very busy and breakfast in the morning was chaos! Not enough tables and families waiting everywhere. The staff worked hard to clear the backlog but although we had complimentary breakfast, we chose to leave the hotel and eat elsewhere. We were upgraded to an eco room, our room was fine but our children had an adjoining room with a disabled adapted bathroom. This was ok for 2 boys, but not for ladies who have alot of lotions/potions - nowhere to put anything - the sink area was tiny. I don't think people want these rooms. Pool area very busy (it was Easter) and difficult to find sunbeds. Parking also difficult, often had to drive around looking for a space and got tired of the walk from the carpark to the room. It was so hot all the time - the AC worked well in the rooms. Staff great - lots of different facilities for families and it was good not to be in a Disney hotel. We moved to the Hard Rock Hotel for 2 nights and to go to Universal/Islands of Adventure. I must say I missed the Hyatt - the standard is much higher here. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cwjdmom
Reviews.Content: I use tripadvisor often and trust the reviews on this website. So, it's only fair that I tell others about this amazing place to stay. I named my own price at priceline.com and got this hotel for $105.00 per night. The hotel is clean, and beautiful in every area. The pool and beach area is also incredible. My 8 year old didn't even want to leave the place all day. The restaurants are a bit pricey but there is so much within driving and walking distance that you can opt to eat somewhere else. There is a small refrigerator in the room but no microwave. So, if you're staying with small kids that might be a problem. There are some hidden fees like the $22.00 a day activity fee that you have to pay. But, where can you pay $22.00 a day for a basic waterpark and beach with boats...it's really worth the money there. Valet parking is $23.00 a night and is also worth it. Our car was waiting for us everytime we called and told them we wanted to leave. There is free parking but you must walk from the parking lot to the hotel. If you know up front about the fees you just can't be disappointed with this "Grand Cypress"....awesome place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: VacationTested
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at this property and it was outstanding. I'm not sure if some of the other reviewers just had bad experiences or if something else was going on but all three trips to this hotel have been an amazing experience. I would highly recommend. This is by far the best resort in the Disney area that I have seen. We will never stay anywhere else in the Orlando area. We could spend our entire trip at the hotel and never leave and would not be disappointed at all. There are tons of activities for the entire family. The service at the hotel is first rate and the food, while on the expensive side, is outstanding. Definately try Hemmingways! The pools are some of the best resort pools I've seen. The pitch and putt golf and the bike rides around the property and the golf and all outstanding. If you're going to Orlando, don't make the mistake of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great place would recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rapier503
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from this hotel were we stayed for 2 weeks and it was great !! We went as a family (2 adults + 2 childen) had one room with 2 double beds and the room size was fine. We paid $22 resort charge but this included internet and we did not have to pay parking fees!! Lots to do fro the kids (bikes, boats, waterfalls, slides, rock climbing, pitch and putt, hot tubs) Yes the hotel had quiet a few business peole there at times, but this was not problem. The only bad bit was the main pool was not heated so it was a bit cold when you first got it. The hotel is very near one of the disney enterances and very close to the Primium Outlets. We ate out all the time so can't comment on the Restaurant for evening or lunch time food, but for breakfast it was good. Probably expenisive if you havne't got a package. Really nice plush hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous property, spectacular grounds to walk, great pools and restaurants. Rooms very spacious and comfortable, and a nice break from the hysteria of Orlando and disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy About Hidden Fees that Could Have Been Built into Price”
Reviews.Author: SummerTravelers85
Reviews.Content: Why are they charging extra mandatory fees that we cannot opt out of? Its hard to believe they don't you think it is deceptive? Why are they going through all the trouble to disclose it, when it simply could be included in the price! I won't support hotels that trick guests into to paying fees of $22+ per night when it simply could be included in the price. I don't care how great the hotel is, this practice goes against everything our parents taught us and everything we learned in business school ethics class. It's ethically wrong and it is intentionally deceptive. Avoid the fees - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I was so impressed”
Reviews.Author: Momof3_in_Mesa
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room on the 18th floor. We had a great room rate and from the hit or miss reviews I was not expecting everything to be so nice. The staff was so polite, the public areas very clean, the decor in the room cool and modern. It is a 70s hotel but almost everything including the conference center has been recently renovated. The pool areas were amazing. We were there on weekdays and I hear it can get pretty crowded in the nice lounge chairs with umbrellas on weekends but we had no trouble. The kids (6, 8, and 12) chose to skip the theme parks one day to just play at the pool. 800,000 gallons of water, 3 hot tubs, cave/grotto, game room, and free paddleboats and kayaks on the lake and surrey bikes and regular bikes to take all around the property. I was so pleased. Room service and food was expensive but that's to be expected. Our room service guy even sent us a thank you note under the door. Resort fee $22 includes wifi and parking and is mandatory, per day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business, will consider returning for pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: nicstress
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting, but my husband also joined me and we had a couple of nights without our young children for the first time in almost 2 years. The rooms were spacious and well laid out. I had a basic King room overlooking the lagoon/lake. It was very quiet (10th floor) so no complaints there. The room had a 'cooler' refrigerator as there was a warning that medications should not be stored in it. However, our drinks got very cold. A regular refrigerator could be requested. They also had a coffee maker that was located in a cabinet near the floor, which was odd and inconvenient. And save your time, the coffee was terrible. There is a coffee place serving Starbucks in the lobby. My husband and I ate at the hotel's White Horse Bar and Grille located off of the Lobby and everything was very good. Sushi was made to order and reasonably priced for a hotel. We had an escargot appetizer, too, that was very good. The drinks are strong but also pricey! $52 for 4 drinks! The same can be said for the pool bar. Service was pretty slow at the pool bar. We tried to use the chair-side beeper system but a server never came so we had to venture to the bar ourselves. The real draw to this place is the proximity to Disney World, the transporation to the parks and the hotel activities. Included in the resort fee were bicycle rental, surrey bike rental, boat rental, rock climbing, pool-side movies, a 9 hole pitch and putt course, etc. The 3 pools were large and it included a kiddie slide in one that I am sure my 2 year old could navigate and then a larger slide that was designated for older children only at least 44" tall. Kids were having a blast. There was also a suspension bridge over one of the pools that was fun to walk across. The bell staff and concierge staff were also very friendly and accommodating-- probably some of the nicest I have ever encountered and I travel a lot. Car service to the airport was about the same as a metered taxi ($58). They also have a shuttle for $33 RT but it will take a lot longer as it is shared. I used the spa for a pedicure and a massage and both were excellent (prices normal for hotel spas). The spa is small and located out of the way but I was told they are planning to expand soon to a more prominant location off of the lobby, which will be nice. We will definitely consider returning when our kids are older!

Reviews.Title: “Finally! A Resort Fee with Benefits!!!”
Reviews.Author: mommacook4
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress is what I would consider one of Orlando's "best kept resort secrets". We went this past February for a weekend getaway for Valentine's Day. When we first checked in we noticed a slight odor of cigarette smoke (7th floor; if you have allergies to smoke don't let them put you on that floor even if you're in a so-called nonsmoking room)- so we went down to the front desk and they had absolutely NO problem getting us into a different room. That is always a plus when a resort is willing to accommodate their visitors if there is availability to do so. We got settled in our room which has a great contemporary decor! We decided to go down and adventure around the resort a bit as it was obvious from our 14th floor balcony that there were amazing pools and walking trails all around the property. We noticed people riding bikes and truckin' along in surreys. We figured it probably cost to rent the bikes but much to our surprise, everything on property is included in the $22 resort fee - even PARKING!!! At most resorts in Orlando you get a couple bottles of H2O a free newspaper and then you're on your own for parking and any bike rentals, boat rentals. Not at Hyatt Grand Cypress. We played putt-putt, floated around in a paddle boat, road bikes all over the property, took a long walk, swam in the pools, used the very nice fitness center, soaked in all three of the hot tubs during our 2 night 3 day vacation! We plan to go back to this resort with our family as we noted it would be a great place to stay with kids. There are onsite restaurants that seemed nice but with the great selection of places to go eat in that area of Orlando we opted to eat off site. We did have breakfast on Sunday morning at the buffet and it was fine, nothing extravagent but did the job of filling the belly! Overall this stay was amazing and we will DEFINTELY return SOON!

Reviews.Title: “First-class experience”
Reviews.Author: wbru83
Reviews.Content: I just completed a two-night stay for business. This is a very classy place and I have nothing but great things to say about all facets of the hotel. The deco look of the rooms is very striking. But I do have a few minor nits that were frustrating because everything else was so good. The closet door is on sliders and doubles as the bathroom door; very odd and not very private. It takes a PhD to figure out how to turn on the shower and get the right water temp. The half-pane of glass across the bathtub is bizarre and allows lots of cool air in during a shower. The stall area containing the toilet is so narrow that I felt like I was getting an MRI. And why do hotels put in great big widescreen TVs and then deliver only standard-definition channels. The picture for the Stanley Cup hockey game was so bad that it was unwatchable. This hotel nailed the hard things and fumbled the ball on the easy ones.

Reviews.Title: “I am so glad I decided to splurge on this one”
Reviews.Author: lovedisneyfam
Reviews.Content: I had an extra day in Orlando and planned to stay in a "normal" hotel in Orlando. When the weather turned nice, I changed to this resort. The staff is great, the rooms are newly nice, and the property has stunning views. The best part is that I actually relaxed. I even took a nap on one of their hammocks. I have stayed at virtually every hotel near Disney, and this one even beats the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice -- Lots of activities -- But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: dandan14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while in Orlando. Our daughter is not yet old enough to ask for Disney, so we just stayed around the hotel and had plenty of things to keep us busy. We booked by bidding through priceline, and got a really great deal compared to their published rates. We tried to remind ourselves of that when we had to pay other expenses. Their resort fee is $22/day (for your entire party, not per person) which covers all of the activities on the property. The pools are fantastic with 2 slides and multiple waterfalls. The pitch and putt was a nice surprise which my wife and I both enjoyed (smaller than regular golf, much larger than putt-putt). We also very much enjoyed the surrey rentals (4 wheel bikes) and rode several miles back into the "nature" areas. I even got my wife to try the rock climbing wall. The campus of the Hyatt is huge, with plenty of room to explore if you like walks or bike rides. The nature walk is getting pretty dilapidated and has not been maintained and they have an oddly out of place "old west" scene which is now rotting away. We assumed they used to do some sort of "old west" show there at one point years ago. The food is pricey -- but if you are willing to walk, there are plenty of choices right outside of the resort property such as Qdoba mexican grill, Ihop, Orlando Ale House, Subway, Chinese buffet -- and many many more if you don't mind walking further. All in all, we were very pleased considering the discounted rate we received. Had we paid full price + resort fee, we'd have likely felt a little more pinched.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: rxkate
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. Our room smelled fresh and very clean when we walked in. It was well laid out with a couch and a nice comfortable bed. The hotel provided shuttle to the area amusement parks which we really liked. The pool area was incredible and offered 2 hot tubs, a huge pool and a heated pool in the back. We were able to check into our room early when we arrived. We really enjoyed the location because we could walk to area restaurants. The only complaint that we had was the bottom sheet on the bed would not stay in place very and I would wake up laying directly on the mattress. Other than that everything else was great. My husband really liked the toiletries because they were big enough to get more than one use from and smelled like eucalyptus. We will definitely stay here again when we are back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: konsrq
Reviews.Content: stayed during the week with a 4 year old and baby. requested a room "away from folks" so baby wouldn't disturb anyone. They gave us a room on the 14th floor- apparently the higher levels are less populated. If you are afraid of heights, it would be a tough go. The hotel has lots of glass and you can feel the gentle sway of the building... We watched the fireworks at disney from our floor's big glass windows... Chose the hotel fo the pools, and was not disappointed. We rented bikes, paddle boated, and tried to take advantage of all the great amenities. Our room was quiet (hint- always roll up a towel under your door to keep out hall noise). Shower was hot, great water pressure. Restaurants on site were pricey but good- sushi was excellent. ( $4 coffee, $7.5 for yogurt) no restaurants within walking distance, unfortunately. baby and I slept in a hammock... can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sc2303
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK after staying at the Hyatt for 2 weeks. There were a lot of conferences while we were there but they didn't intrude too much, except one wedding which was really noisy. I'd recommend this hotel for families. We have 2 kids (8 & 4) and they loved the pools, slides, kayaks, golf, climbing, etc. Ask for a room overlooking the pools - we did which meant that we also had a view of the Magic Kingdom and Epcot fireworks every night. We also paid extra for access to the Regency club. This is expensive ($2,000) but it's a nice, quiet area with refreshments from 6am to 3pm and 5pm to 9pm, free breakfast to 11:00am and free dessert in the evenings from 8pm. Ian was extremely helpful. The Regency Club closes at 9pm and my only recommendation to the hotel would be to switch this and open it up to ALL guests each night FROM 9pm, with a bar as it's a great spot to watch the fireworks from - they'd make a fortune. The restaurants are pricey, as you'd expect in a hotel, but not unreasonable, and there are many to choose from. All the staff, without exception, were absolutely fantastic. On arrival, Chris, one of the bell staff, took our bags to our room (which is his job, obviously), but also gave us lots of tips for where to go. The hotel is virtually next door to WDW which meant that we could beat the traffic and get to the parks reasonably early. Having seen other hotels, albeit only from the outside, we definately chose the best and would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adventure and relaxation in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Neptune75
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were looking for a bit of sunshine and adventure so we booked our trip on the Saturday night and were on the plane Monday morning. It was a toss up between the Caribbean and Florida. The hotel stood out as it had everything on site from a massive pool to running trails and a water sports lagoon. When we arrived the valets were all smiles and wonderful, Ana on reception was absolutely brilliant and made us feel instantly relaxed - the champagne on arrival was a wonderful touch. Kelley and the team at concierge were so talented and knowledgeable. We hadn't researched any of the parks, recreation or transport and were thrilled with the suggestions from the desk. The pool was amazing and we spent our first day enjoying the Florida weather and skills of the bar keep. Everyone in the hotel was always so friendly and we felt genuinely welcome everywhere we went. The location is brilliant and so central that we easily made it to both the theme park groups. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!!”
Reviews.Author: lilley1
Reviews.Content: What an amazing and beautiful Hotel! We stayed one night because we wanted to do the Chef's Dinner and the Sunday Brunch (separate reviews) and thought it would be the most convenient. Being greeted with a glass of champagne at check-in was very nice. All the Staff were beyond wonderful. When they found out I was in Florida to celebrate my 50th birthday - we were given an upgraded room. She made a quick call before finishing checking us in and when we got to our room, there were treats, a bottle of wine and a card wishing me a happy birthday. Wow, that was service and a wonderful, thoughtful personal touch. The bed was very comfortable and we didn't want to get up to go for Brunch. The room was very very very nice and a great shower as well.... The lobby and the grounds/gardens/lake are gorgeous and so inviting to walk around. The pools were to die for and not quite explainable. I do not normally swim in Hotel pools - however, I could not leave this Hotel without going for a very chilly dip, my husband was amazed. Awesome! Did not have time unfortunately to use any other of the many facilities (check out their website for all that are available), so that was sad. This Hotel is very close to Disney World and would make a great family place to stay. Our main regret, is that we did not book our entire 5 night stay in Orlando here at the Hyatt. The Best Western Hotel we stayed at was horrible and the worst mistake we made. Even though we could walk to Down Town Disney, it was definitely not worth the money (separate review). We had a rental car and could have driven to DTD or taken the shuttle. Lesson learned. You will not regret spending a bit more money and staying at the Hyatt. We would LOVE to return to Orlando some day and will definitely be staying at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Carl24_11
Reviews.Content: Great resort that offers everything! In fact, we "wasted" too much time at Disney World and a full day at Coco Beach. The pool is outstanding and perfect for both adults (with a quiet area) and kids of all ages. Plenty of things for all to do at the resort itself including a 9 nine golf course that kids can play, movies, activities, boating, bike riding, etc. Felt that we really didn't take advantage of all they had to offer. Perfect for all ages and even offers a great Jack Nicklaus signature golf course as well as tennis.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Fabulous, Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine7906
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 12 nights at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress - we had a a great time. Chose this Hotel as wanted to be close to the Disney parks without actually staying in a Disney Hotel. The pools (3) were fantastic, there are 2 water slides which our 7 year old absolutely loved, great bar for drinks/snacks by the pool. The resort is enormous - we cycled around one of the trails around the lake - great fun! We ate Breakfast in Cascades every morning - we mostly had the buffet which had a wide variety of food (pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, omelettes, porridge, cereal, toast, pastries, fruit). We ate in The Palm Cafe twice - it was ok, also ate in The White Horse bar and grill - very nice. The hotel is very close to lots of restaurants so we ate lunch and dinner out most of the time. The staff are great - had a few issues with waiting for a room at check-in but Robert sorted everything out and offered us a better room. Also Jorge was very helpful when we were checking out. A BIG thank you to Tim (bellhop?) who was so very helpful during our entire stay - I hope the Hotel know what an asset they have in him. The only downside of our stay was that we were so busy visiting the parks we didn't spend as much time enjoying the resort as we would have liked - would love to visit again to enjoy all that it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quirky decorated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mohsman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights over the Memorial Day Weekend attending a professional meeting and had a very nice stay. The location, meeting facilities, pool, bar and restaurants were excellent. I was particularly impressed universally with the professionalism, competence and courtesy of the staff. It is also in a great location, near lots of restaurants, outlet malls, and the Disney parks. One nice feature, for us, was the good security at the resort entrance. There is a gate guard monitoring who enters. They have a remarkable pool, reminiscent of the pool complexes at Hawaiian resorts, with slides, caves (with bars), hot tubs, and bridges incorporated. There is also a lake and the required resort fee pays for complementary paddle boats, sail boats, kayaks, etc. We stayed on the Regency Club Floor and liked the food, service, and club very much. They had a very nice business center and a very large balcony – a popular place to watch the nearby evening fireworks from Disney, Epcot and Sea World. My only gripe with the club is that they didn’t have any of the alcoholic beverages they served visible and they had no menu, so you had to place an order with their waiter. Their selection of drinks seemed limited. This is a minor complaint given the quality of the place. The quirky aspect of the resort is its furnishings, décor, and the room layout. I had the chance not only to experience my single room but two of the larger suites. The furniture and color schemes were like Austin Powers “mod” meeting what pseudo 21st century modern – and it didn’t work. The bed was very comfortable as were the linens. The computer desk, TV and dresser were great. There were also some remarkably inconvenient features – that our bellman openly warned us about. The first was the “suicide” bathroom/closet door. The entrance to the bathroom is in line with the adjacent closet. One door slides to close either the closet or bathroom, not both. For two people, if one is looking in the closet while the other tries to leave the BR, the closet viewer can get bashed. Twice I almost smacked my wife as I “opened” the closet as she was leaving the bathroom. The other bizarre feature was the absence of a door lock on the suite’s guest bathroom. If you are on the toilet in this BR, you can only hope no one decides to enter, as there is no lock and you are too far from the door to hold it closed. We found this in two separate suites. All in all we had a great stay and would stay there again. The quality of facilities and people outshined the quirky features.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay and couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: allflgirl
Reviews.Content: Went for a short weekend stay and wished I could have stayed longer. I fell in love with this resort BEFORE the refurbishment and now it is better than ever! Rooms are great size & super clean, grounds are meticulous and the pool is amazing. The service is top notch too. Food was a bit pricey but quality was very good, so didn't feel too bad about paying a little more, especially since I didn't want to leave the resort in the middle of the day searching for bite to eat. We had one small issue with a meal, told the server and she said "she'll take care of it for us". We'll found out that she ended up credited us the entire bill the small inconvenience. Now that's taking care of it! Best tip I can give, if you book this hotel, do plan some time to spend at the resort. So many people come to Orlando and spend their entire time at the area attractions, however, this hotel is certainly an attraction in itself, if you take advantage of all that your resort fee covers.

Reviews.Title: “Would struggle to find a better hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: JohnB09
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Orlando where we stayed 8 nights at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. I'll start with the couple of negatives from our visit. Firstly I am now aware it appears to be a well known fact that most U.S hotels require a cash deposit usually around $600 upon arrival, I found this out on a recent trip to Vegas but to be sure I emailed the Hyatt Group before our arrival and was told that no charge or deposit will be required. You can imagine having travelled nearly 24 hours via Chicago how annoyed we were when asked for $600 as a security deposit despite getting an email saying no such charge is in place at Hyatt Hotels. I was told I would get it back when checking out but my point was this money is our spending money...what good is it to us when we are going home? We came to a compromise and to be fair they only took $300 as the security deposit. Secondly the shuttle bus or lack of is a real problem, I read a previous review about this and the reviewer was told by the hotel that during winter months only one bus is provided daily but would increase during busier months, I thought this was fair enough but was staggered to find out that the end of May wasn't considered a busy enough month to put more shuttle buses on to bring guests to the parks. All the other hotels seem to have regular shuttles but this 5 star resort didn't, it's really beyong belief. Finally I must mention the one bit of poor service we recieved, my girlfriend had a badly swollen ankle and we rang down for some ice to be sent up to the room, we had to ring 3 times and after an hour some ice packs were finally brought up, that was really disappointing. Oh one more thing, ask for yellow cabs instead of the town cars provided by the hotel as they are a rip off. Ok on to the positives, firstly when you arrive at this hotel it certainly has that 'wow' factor, it's an absolutely stunning resort. The outside is very impressive with ponds and waterfalls everywhere and spotless gardens. Despite a couple of hiccups the staff were fantastic to deal with and 99% of the time did everything to help us. The hotel has everything needed for a great holiday, an amazing pool area, games room, bikes and boat rental, tennis courts, pitch and putt, you name it and the hotel has it. The rooms are nice but not huge so maybe ask for some kind of upgrade rather than the standard room we had but the view over the pool and lake was spectacular. The food at the hotel was amazing from the steak in the sports bar to the snacks in the cafe, I couldn't fault it, a little bit pricey but you are in a 5 star resort. Taking everything into account I would highly recommend this hotel, it's got a great location but the lack of shuttles can be a problem but maybe the hotel will address this. The staff is great, the hotel inside and out is breath taking and the parks aren't too far away so all in all I would say make Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress your number 1 choice on your next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “like paradise”
Reviews.Author: rodrig
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. I loved so many things about it: the room, the pool, the service, the people, the views, the breakfast buffet, the conference center, the landscapes, and resort amenities, free shuttle to disney. The only things I didnt like was that the food was really expensive and I wish the pool/bar thing was open later.

Reviews.Title: “I expected so much more”
Reviews.Author: Jeffbuc
Reviews.Content: First, I am not rich. In fact, staying at this hotel was a bit of a splurge for my wife and I for a quick weekend trip from a town about an hour away. We picked the hotel because it looked to have a great pool. A quick breakdown of the hotel follows. Room: The room was spacious, clean and well appointed with flat panel tv, ipod/mp3 dock and an air filter. While the decoration style was not my taste, I did not hate it either. The bathroom is big and the shower has a regular shower head and rain style head. I took 4 showers while there and each time I had period of hot water (the way I like it) and barely warm water. My wife said the water was fine for her. Pool: The pool is where I was the most disappointed. The pool is massive and has 2 small water slides and numerous waterfalls. It looks really cool. However, unless you are down at the pool to reserve your chair by 8am, don't even bother. I prefer to have chairs in the shade and did manage to grab the last 2 (literally), but I saw many people wandering around looking for a place to place their belongings (and this was at 10 am). Also, call me an alcoholic if you want, but I was on vacation and at the pool by 9:30 am. By 10 I was ready for an adult beverage. They don't serve till 11:00 though. Bummer. The worst thing was a lack of music. Our beer maid kept telling us she was going to get the music turned on but it never happened. Several people around us were also lamenting about the lack of tunes. I am no spring breaker, but the pool scene at this hotel is not happening in the least. My tip: Take your mp3 and portable speakers. Considering we chose the place for the pool, we were pretty disappointed. Fees: I actually spent $50 on a breakfast for 2 people. I am still nauseous about this. And it was not great food either. Pretty tasteless buffet fare. The hotel does have a lot to do but we could barely scratch the surface for the $22 daily resort fee. I did use the pitch and put course which was kind of fun. Like most resorts they know they have a captive audience and they do not hesitate to bend you over on prices of things. $6.95 for a croissant? What a joke!!!!! Parks: We did not visit to go to the parks, but it is minutes from Disney and about 10 minutes from Universal. All in all I would not recommend this hotel for weekend travelers looking to have fun by the pool. This place is more suited to the r&r crowd, which is cool, I just wish I knew that ahead of time. Maybe I was expecting too much for my $200 a night plus associated hotel fees.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: allisonw9386
Reviews.Content: We visited in September 2010 and had an amazing time. For the majority of our trip we stayed at the villas then moved over to the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress on our last night. We enjoyed the large swimming pool, excellent poolside cocktails and fantastic food both at the on site restuarants and room service. The chicken tortilla soup is to die for! We will be returning very soon for some rest, relaxation and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience,left me in tears. Read this!”
Reviews.Author: Jesikitty
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks trying to find the perfect hotel for our vacation. This hotel was the worst choice I could have made. Please read this whole thing and dont make the mistake we did. First, most importantly they siphon money constantly. Upon arrival they took almost $700 out of our account ( this was not the expected resort fee). Each day after that, they took $25 to $125 a DAY until we checked our bank account and caught it. They called it an "honest mistake" but did not give the money back, saying we had to call our bank. After two hours of talking to the front desk, they admitted they shouldn't have taken the money in the first place and would "look into it" By the end of a week stay they had taken appx $1100 out of our account in ADDITION to our prepaid rooms and resort fee. Second, the walls of this hotel are very thin. I could hear the man upstairs urinating ( and could tell it was a man). The hotel maid, although polite, shouted loudly every morning in the hallway from about 7 to 9 am. The hallways overall are extremely loud. YOU MUST bring earplugs. Third, our toilet clogged almost everyday. The maintenance man said this was because too many people in the hotel were using toilets at the same time ( what?). Beds are very hard. Fourth- bugs. There were spiders in our room and we were bit by fleas?bedbugs? in our bed during the night. Manager said it was mosquitos but it was only on our feet and ankles and while we slept under the covers. Fifth- there is no balcony. It is only a ledge you can step out on. Cigarette butts were on our "balcony" despite the no smoking policy. Sixth- about a week in, we were locked out of our room one night when we got back around midnight. At this point we were so frustrated with the hotel and were exhausted and hungry. I went downstairs-visibly angry- and told the front desk I was locked out. She called security and said " I had no ID" and "I could wait". After waiting for 15 mins, she began apologizing to the other guests in line because I was tapping my fingers. Frustrated, I went to the other person working and said I needed to talk to a manager. She told him I "could wait because I was being disrespectful" At this point I was in tears and the manager pulled us aside. After we explained everything to him, he said he would reprimand her. He was very surprised at the amount of money that had been taken out of our account. He credited some of it back. I got everyones names and am writing a letter to corporate. Oh also, though the parking lot is not really far away, it is too far to be walking after an exhausting day at Disney. It is also not reasonable for a disabled or elderly person. STAY AWAY from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Luxurious and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rtoloza
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was Great, the pool is very nice and event with all the great things to do in orlando part of you just wants to go back and lounge by the pool. The ambiance is luxurious and the staff was very professional. Definitely worth the extra bucks to stay in orlando in style

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, be prepared for the "Resort Fee"”
Reviews.Author: Bailey77736
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty good hotel. Nice lobby and pool area (24 hour pool). The rooms are pretty much standard hotel rooms, kept clean. The issues I have with the hotel is the nickling and diming. Valet parking was $23 a day for a hotel out past the suburbs, not like parking spaces are at a premium. Tips are add to everything, but they leave a line for tip on your bill and don't tell you about this. Luckily a friend let me know, or I would have been adding 20% on top of the already outrageous prices. Then they hit you with a "resort fee" that is mandatory. Shouldn't this just be put of the room rate if it is mandatory? We were there for a wedding and did not really have an opportunity to utilize the facilities, but still had to pay that "resort fee". A good place to stay if you are visiting Disney and can afford it, but realize that management is unethical in there billing methods.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: emily44881
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hyatt Grand Cypress was amazing, the staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. Our room was wonderful, and the hotel pool was gorgeous. This is an excellent hotel for families, lots of activities and restaurants. Thank you for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RuthGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Honeymoon and loved every minute of it - our only complaint was that we did not have more time to explore the beautiful grounds or to laze by the fantastic pools areas! On returning from a long day at Disney we ordered Room Service which was delivered promptly and was simply delicious - a very nice surprise indeed. We will definitely be returning to this resort as soon as possible. Also, we would like to say a big thank you to Kelley who was extremely helpful in planning our day trips - we were sorry not to see her before we left to thank her personally.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Min070
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at this hotel for the first time and will definitely go back. Due to a mistake from my tour company the hotel had no details of my booking when I arrived but what could have ruined my visit was dealt with very professionally. They dealt with the tour company for us and sorted out moving us to the lakeview room we had booked the following day. The hotel and grounds are beautiful and the staff are very helpful and friendly. If you can book a lakeview room, the opportunity to see the Disney fireworks shouldn't be missed

Reviews.Title: “stunning hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hanwellranger
Reviews.Content: have stayed at this hotel 5 years in a row with my family and friends and have just booked flights to go back in august. this hotel was stunning before the refurb and is even better now. the service/ cleanliness/ amenities are simply superb the pool areas are also stunning. my only complaint is the WiFi charge per day which i think should be included in the resort tax, when you see budget hotels advertising free WiFi it just makes the Hyatt look a bit greedy and money grabbing and i really think they should rethink this as i feel they are shooting themselves in the foot. anyway that is my only complaint for which otherwise is probably one of the best hotels in orlando. did hear a rumour from a staff member on our last visit they were thinking about installing a lazy river dont know how true this is but this would simply be the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MasterMasonldk68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel and we would like to commend the following people to your attention, for their help. Cascade Resteraunt my wife is in a wheelchair and the help that we received from Betty who worked at the Pancake counter and the three girls who worked the desk was over and above what I would have expected, I would also commend the various waiting staff who attended to our needs again excellent work. The Lady who cleaned our room 806 was extremely good at her job and again I would recommend her to you. all the other staff members of the hotel were friendly and helpful we have only two complaints which slightly spoiled part of our stay one was the elevators we were sometime unable to get into the elevators quickly enough with the wheelchair because of being unable to see which elevator had actualy stopped and when we did try for it the doors closed sometimes on the chair and I had to pull my wife back out as the doors never opened again. the second part which raised concerns was entering and leaving our room I was unable to tie back the door to allow me to wheel my wife into the room as she was unable to wheel herself I had to open the door then hold it at arms length then pull my wife far enough into the door frame to allow me to push her,a small wedge or tieback should be standard in a disabled room to avoid any problems. Dont buy any park tickets until you have checked out the hotel the faclities were excellent well worth the $20 resort fee, it cost you $15 to park your car at the parks and nothing at the hotel so stay and save you wont get better for a relaxing holiday We would have no hesitation in coming back to the Grand Cyprus or telling our friends and colleagues just how good it is.

Reviews.Title: “No more cold, icy ultra "modern" touches”
Reviews.Author: stersource
Reviews.Content: This used to be our FAVORITE Hyatt but the remodel left a lot to be desired. Namely, no nightstand between the beds to hold a remote control!, a shower that had transparent and tiny sun and snowflake icons for hot and cold that you could not see even if you don't wear glasses and vertical pipes AWFUL, a tiny bathtub difficult to get in/out of, a clock that you could not see, etc. However, the parrot (Merlot) was cute, a beautiful lobby and champagne greeting were great. Parking staff was excellent,bell service GREAT and timely, and the staff took care of a couple requests we had fast and efficiently. Food has deteriorated in the small Regency club. The decor is such a radical change from what was there before-- used to be a bed and breakfast comforting decor. Now "ultra"modern cold, icy, and harsh. Overall, a GREAT place to stay however, too bad they missed a lot of details when they did the remodel. Manager ignored our comments...just acknowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: brianandgarcia
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 days at this resort and must say it is pretty top notch. Being used to New York hotels I am shocked when I see all the staff from the bell service to securities guards being friendly. The in room dining is very good I must say. If you ask for something special like extra hot sauce they will bring you that extra hot sauce. The pool is gorgeous, and I loved the water slide as well. The free shuttles are pretty decent but we found going to universal from 9am to 6PM was just a bit too long for us, took a taxi home instead. Tips: We ordered take out to be delivered from a local establishment. They wouldn't let the people in to the resort. We had to take a shuttle to the front gate, by then my phone was exploding with calls from the delivery man. Don't take the town car they provide, it will cost you an arm and a leg. I called the yellow cab company and scheduled a pick up. Also, beware when they take you to universal it should be around $22 but the drivers take you the long way which ends up being $36...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with a few quibbles for those with little kids”
Reviews.Author: MFC_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress this past spring break. It is a beautiful, beautifully fun facility. Staff were universally friendly and professional. Rooms were modern, clean and beautiful. Beds dreamy (all of us slept well). Pool is fantastic with waterfall. Walking around the lovely grounds in the evening my older children (7, 9) told me this was their favorite hotel "ever". So the quibbles? No baby pool, no zero entry pool and a pool deck/ landscaping that were a nightmare for a stroller (so many steps up and down we stopped bringing it to the pool). Also, the balconies are not deep enough to fit a chair so forget it if you have thoughts of a quiet glass of wine on the balcony after the kids are asleep. We also have an infant and a three year-old, so this meant we ended up spending less time at the resort than we would otherwise have if the pool were more toddler friendly. Bottom line this is a great choice if your kids are older (7 and up).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience - superb staff”
Reviews.Author: ftbianchi
Reviews.Content: I was super impressed by the quality and kidness if the staff. Everybody gave us 110% and by the way, the hotel is beatifull! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but could do better”
Reviews.Author: May2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in April. Overall it was a pleasant stay. However, the room is a little small for a family. It had two double beds and usually when we travel family rooms have two king size beds. The pool area is very nice and the kids really enjoyed that. I would rate this hotel as more a 4 star than a 5 star by European standards. On the last evening of our stay we had dinner in the buffet restaurant. It was a complete mess. There appeared to be plenty of staff, but they spent more time complaining to us about being under staffed that getting on with the job. We had to wait for at least 15 minutes for our drinks order to be taken and the tables around us were covered in dirty dishes which did not make for a pleasant evening. We couldn't wait to get out of the place. When we complained about it when checking out, the staff member just said "sorry about that" which seemed a bit inadequate in the circumstances. Overall, this hotel is nice. A week in it is probably too long and I would eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Don't like being hustled”
Reviews.Author: annoyed23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress quite a few times and we're frequent travelers, not afraid to spend money while on a vacation. However, we don't like being hustled. Everywhere we went, they were constantly coming over to see if we wanted a drink or a meal. At the pool, they have tables with a button if you want bar service. If we wanted a drink, we would have pushed it. We went to relax, not to constantly be pestered. You can't sit in the lobby without someone coming over to you about drinks. I don't consider that good service; I consider that annoying . There are many others who complained about the nuisances at the pool and lobby. This makes people uncomfortable. There are many other resorts in the area where we would not have encountered this type of nonsense. You can rest assured we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, horrible accounting”
Reviews.Author: flane48
Reviews.Content: The trip itself was great, however we decided to stay a third night and paid with cash. A week later, they charged my credit card the amount we had already paid in cash, as well as the other resort fee, which they told us we didn't have to pay... the manager told us they had no record of the cash being paid, so not only did we get charged twice for the last night, we weren't given a refund... I'm extremely disappointed with the accounting, management and front desk for lack of accountability. Use a credit / debit card for your on safety when staying here. Sad

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: Tearose19
Reviews.Content: After traveling most of the day with a small child, the quick check-in was greatly appreciated. Hyatt went one step further by offering a complimentary glass of champagne. At this point, I was already sold. However, I continued to be impressed for my entire stay. The staff was extremely helpful and always friendly. Our room was always spotless, thanks to Mary in housekeeping. The grounds were beautiful and well-kept. My son loved the pools and slides. He actually requested to leave Disney early enough so that he could have time at the pool!! I absolutely love this resort and the staff is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNCarly
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Hyatt with our 7 year old daughter for a weekend stay. When live in Orlando and just wanted to take her some place where she could relax and have some fun! I researched "great pools for kids" and saw the Hyatt come up. After looking at the website we decided to give it a try. From the moment we pulled up she had a HUGE smile on her face. Everyone we encountered that worked there was super friendly. Upon check in my husband and I received champagne and my daughter a shovel and bucket. When we got to our room it was AMAZING. Very clean, large and over looked the fabulous grounds. Of course we did not spend much time in the room since the pools are open 24 hours a day. The slides are awesome and my daughter had such a good time going down them! We played in the game room, dug in the sand by the "beach" area and before we left she got her hair braided which she said was one of the best parts of the trip!!! We had NO issues and that is a very rare thing when you stay in hotels as often as we do. I would definitely come back and do it all over again!!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: jgagne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, but a bit pricey! The room was awesome and very clean. The pool was great, it had water slides and hot tubs. I think they told us the pool was a million and a half dollar construction. There were many activities available from kayaking to golfing!

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Delbish56
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews in Trip Advisor we had high hopes when we arrived for our 6 night stay but came way feeling a bit disappointed overall. During our 2 week Orlando vacation we spent the first week at the excellent Hilton Grand Vacacations Club on International Drive before transferring to the Hyatt Grand Cypress for the 2nd week. At the HGVC we had a 2 bed suite which was huge and the overall feel of the resort was one of high quality and cleanliness. In contrast the 2 double bedded room we had at the Hyatt was tiny and not really suitable for a family stay. There is barely any storage space which meant we had to keep most of our stuff in the cases which was a bit of an inconvenience. Also, as there is no balcony that you can sit on and have a late night drink together and the 2 double beds are pretty close together you end up going to bed at the same time as your kids (ours are 9 and 6)! The hotel is a huge unappealing 1970's style building, however the rooms have been refurbished recently and are very stylish, but as mentioned more suited to a short break or business trip. Some of the external areas look in need of refurb - for instances the wooden tables outside by the first pool are very tired and shabby looking and not in my opinion in keeping with a top quality hotel. The saving grace for this hotel are the pool areas complete with water slides and waterfalls which the kids loved and the children's pool was heated to a pleasent temperature. Also, the sandy beach by the lake and options of kayaking, canoeing, bike hire and pitch and putt golf are all excellent. However, you do pay a compulsary fee of 22 dollars per room per day to use these facilities. For such a long established hotel that clearly does cater for family holidays (based on the pool and leisure facilities and not the rooms!) there are some surprising oversights. For instance if you want to get an ice cream for your kids you cannot get one around the pool area despite the fact there is a kisok handling pool towels and selling pool inflatables etc.. You would think they would have a small freezer inside this kiosk which would sell ice creams, but no, you have to go into the Palm Cafe inside the hotel where there is a strict policy about putting on your t shirt and shoes! So, when the kids want an ice cream this is a real pain in the backside particularly when you have lotioned up to keep the extremely hot sun at bay! I mentioned this to the lady who was working in the poolside kiosk and she just shrugged her shoulders as if to say that's just the way it is. Message to management - please consider introducing a small freezer for ice creams in the towel kiosk - I can't be the first person who has raised this an an issue? A big positive are the hotel staff who generally were excellent, particularly the folks working in the breakfast restaurant who were very accommodating and friendly. So, to summarise, the Hyatt Grand Cypress is a good but not great hotel with nice, stylish bedrooms that unfortunately for us were impractical for our family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location...terrible housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: beachgal054
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at this resort while visiting in the area. The food was wonderful and the staff at the reception desk and restaurants/pool was terrific. The general overall appearance of the resort however was lacking: overflowing trash bins, filthy glass doors on the way to the pool, broken tiles around the piano in the lobby. The most unbearable part of our stay however was the room and the housekeeping staff. The room was small for 2 people, not enough storage for a week's stay, no couch or love seat (only a desk and a single chair with an ottoman). The room was on the 8th floor overlooking the generator. It was so noisy that you couldn't open the balcony door for fresh area. The balcony is useless anyway. It is too small to stand or sit on. I expected much more from a room at a Hyatt. The door to the shower stall did not close, which lead to constant flooding until we began sealing the door with a washcloth! The worst part of the stay was housekeeping: they never emptied the ice bucket, replaced the drinking glasses or left us new washclothes each day. Even after complaining to the housekeeping staff, the service continued to be horrible. Aso, be very careful closing your door. Once we returned from the pool to find our door open! The door needed to be slammed shut to be sure it was closed. During our spring visit next year, we will try a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, will go again.”
Reviews.Author: Gyurgiiv1
Reviews.Content: The resort was a lot of fun. Everything was perfect. I had an amazing vacation and managed to spend a lot more time at the hotel and less time going to local attractions since the resort offers great entertainment for an adult type of vacation. Just few things to be aware of: there was a service charge of $22 per day per room. It is mentioned on the details when I was booking the trip with travelocity. If you need to go to a place where hotels shuttles don't go, you should call a taxi company. Do not take one of the taxi looking cars standing in front of the hotel because they charge a LOT more. They have no meters and rates are set (town cars). There is a supermarket close by the hotel which you can walk over to and few restaurants as well

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Phillytrav11
Reviews.Content: Check in was perfect and they went over and above in this area. Room was very new and modern. We had 2 adults and 3 kids in standard, a litlle tight. Very clean room. Lobby was nice. Pool area was terrific! So many kids activities, all free by pool. Parking is a little far but not horrible. Downside is the shuttles provided to parks are to limited. You really need a car, while there. Good location with plenty of decent restaurants near by. Exceptionally value for what they offered. Leave a day to just hang and the pool and do the activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelDad
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long stay with my wife and children ages 6 and 3. When travelling to the Orlando area we usually stay at a Disney deluxe resort. Since this was a last minute trip we decided to stay off property. We were very pleased with this hotel. The staff was very good and always helpful. The pool area is great. We never had trouble getting chairs at the pool and the poolside food service was prompt. The food was also good. What we liked the most was that there was more to do with the kids than just go in the pool. The bikes, canoes, beach, activities, slides, etc., gave my kids a really nice vacation. We had our car so we didn't use the shuttle service. Room was clean and new. We were on the 4th floor and slept great every night. Closet/bathroom door is a horrible design and should be changed. With little kids you must be extra careful. The door slides back and forth to either block the closet or block the bathroom doorway. When coming out of the bathroom, you cannot tell if you're going to slam the door into someone by the closet. Balcony is nice but is very narrow. Parking lot is a little bit of a walk but it's not bad. The grounds are beautiful. Overall we were very happy with our stay and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlieC33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for three days this past week. The room was beautiful, 17th floor, with a wonderful view of the area. Very clean, plenty of space, and the staff was wonderful. The only thing that was a bit out of line was the cost of drinks on the property. One of the guys that was in our group ordered a double gray goose on the rocks...$48.00...

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here to relax!”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice, but large resort with limitless amenities. The view of the Disney nighttime fireworks was great (offered in some rooms), the jogging trail and horse trails were a pleasant surprise, as well as other fun fare. But this is not a relaxation spa resort as it might appear. There are lots of people, conventions, children, smack in the middle of the Disney area. So if you are wanting an active resort near Disney, this is a good choice. Hyatt always offers high standards, so we expect a clean room, good service and a hotel that meets or travel needs, This hotel met our basic needs especially the great breakfast buffet. The room was clean but a bit basic for a Hyatt especially with the rates they charge. A little facelift would be a plus.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: JMBZ
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress is a enormous hotel and like a lot of large luxury hotels of its kind it suffers from being very impersonal to the visitor. We were a large family party using 4 rooms and staying at the hotel as a base for 2 weeks at the theme parks . Despite having paid up front for all 4 rooms with a lake view we were split up around various floors upon check in , with 2 of the rooms having a view of the carpark, this took a day to resolve with one of the check in attendants telling my mother she was lucky to have a room at all as they were full and had had to bump people off . As these rooms were paid for in advance there can be no excuse for this attitude. Upon check out there were over 500 USD of incorrect items on my mothers room account that was swiftly removed and 76 usd of incorrect billing on my room. BE AVISED and check your bills, or pay cash . I waited patiently at the desk to get my bill adjusted and when the erroneous check was found i was not even offered an apology. The resort itself is nice with large gardens and grounds , but the only heated pool is small and hence overcrowded as you will struggle to spend a lot of time in the un-heated main pool. Poolside service was on days good and at other times pitiful with it being far faster to walk to the bar under the waterfall to place a drinks order . The poolside tables have a beeper attatched to them that you press, presumably for service, but an attendant told me that is frequently fails to work . Rooms were ok , our room 333 was for some reason a good metre or so slimmer than my relatives rooms down the hall ! The beds are small, storage pitiful for 2 weeks . room service was very speedy and efficenint. The restaurants are not overly expensive and the food is not overly bad. If you are looking for fine dining in Orlando then you have come to the wrong city. The hotel was frequenty over run by Conference guests, who lay claim to bar areas etc and this can be frustrating as they seem to take preference over regular guests . At the white horse for instance we were told we could not reserve a table for 7 pm for 13 people so we duly arrived at 6.30 pm to make sure we would get in . When we then said we would wait at the bar as they readied the table they informed us the bar had been 'reserved' for a group of people attending a conference . Overall not a bad hotel, but not spectacular either.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!”
Reviews.Author: ramcv
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay in this hotel and feel compelled to write my first ever review. We booked through an agency and requested ahead of our trip adjoining/ connecting rooms. On arrival at reception we were told this was not possible, unless we paid $25 per room upgrade fee. (Stayed at Hyatt Bonita Springs at beginning of our holiday and our request was fulfilled without any problem. A fantastic hotel with great customer service!) My husband and I were travelling with my parents and our four year old daughter who just loves popping through to her grandparents room, hence our request. It was suggested that because we had booked third party that was the problem and that no requests had made made by us!! I offered to show e mail copies but not interested. Incidentally we are hyatt gold passport members...not made to feel so here, felt like second class citizens. We were to be given rooms apart with the possibility of moving later in our stay, so had no choice but forced to upgrade. After some haggling we were offered connecting rooms paying only one upgrade fee as the other room was for disabled guests and I quote 'people don't like these rooms' ..what? Then the horror really begins. We arrived in our upgraded rooms , (which are identical to any other room other than looking on pool and have a plug in air purifier ), to find the toilet had been used, urine on seat and floor, yuk! The 2rooms were generally dusty and crumbs over floor but our 4 year old discovered the worst problem in ours by standing on someone's toenail! Clippings everywhere and skin scrapings. There is absolutely no excuse for this in a hotel like this and especially in a so called upgrade. House keeping called twice before the room was cleaned properly. After my husband insisting on seeing a manager, the duty housekeeping manager came up and eventually hoovered herself. She apologised and offered a free breakfast! During the rest of our stay random charges for valet parking and Internet use appeared on our folio and this led to several calls to sort out. Again we were told because we didn't book with hyatt....... which I do not understand, we paid the $18 dollar +tax per day resort fee. The whole experience was spoiled. To end on a positive note, Raphael who checked us out was superb and the first truly helpful person on front desk. He brought through his front desk manager to querie our up grade fee since we had so many problems, but Henry was not interested, he said he would speak to staff? This is a shame as the hotel has nice grounds and leisure facilities but cleanliness and customer service let them down badly. I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: ladyme1
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I debated giving this hotel a 4 or 5 star rating. Decided on a 4 star as there were a few things that do need attention. All in all this place is one of the most beautiful resorts I have stayed at.I am an avid gardener, so, walked into the lobby and just stopped and stared. The lobby is amazingly beautiful. Check in ~there were some issues. I had emailed and called several times after making the reservations requesting a high floor and king bed.(same I requested at booking) Also called the morning of check in and was assured there would be no problem. Checked in and was told we were on the 2nd floor as we had requested a smoking room. Told them we had cancelled that request several times, as recently as that morning and were told we would be on at least the 8th floor. To make a long story short we went round and round..being offered double beds etc. I stood adamant and refused anything less then what we had requested and were promised. Finally we were given the room we booked. Every person (except the front desk personal) we encountered was friendly and kind. Our wish was their command. Can't say enough positive about most of the people working there. Many go above and beyond. The room was beautiful, as was the view. Really glad we hadn't accepted what they originally were going to give us.Agree with other posters about the closet/bathroom door being poor planning. My only concern with the room was the balcony. We always have breakfast on the balcony when travelling. Never book resorts without a balcony for this reason. The balcony here is very narrow. No furniture as there is not enough room. Not sure why they didn't make the balconies a foot wider to accommodate a small table and chairs.This was a huge disappointment for us. Besides the balcony, the room was perfect. House keeping was excellent except for one day. The regular gal knew us on sight, filled our requests and was a very nice person. One day we had a different housekeeper. She took our robes and didn't return clean ones. Did not leave any of the shampoos etc we had used. No face clothes etc.Besides the one day everything was fine. I can not comment on the food as we only had Starbucks(in the lobby) each morning.More great employees there! We did check a couple of the restaurants and found them pretty over priced; so dined off resort every day.We were going to order room service late one evening. Decided against it after seeing there was a $3 charge for using room service and a 21% gratuity automatically added for each order. It is not that we are 'cheap' per se and have stayed at many 5* resorts. But, that's just tacky. You order room service, pay the price of what you order and give the person bringing the food a tip~ that is how it is suppose to be. The grounds and pools are phenomenally beautiful. The gardens and plantings are perfect. As mentioned at the beginning of this review I am an avid gardener; therefore knowledgeable and critical at the same time when it comes to landscaping. This place gets an A++ in my opinion. Their landscapers definitely knew what they were doing.The pools were some of the nicest I have encountered. The only other concern was the parks transportation, or lack there of. If your going to offer transportation then you offer it on a regular basis, not once or twice a day. I do understand this is not a Disney resort, but that should not matter.I have stayed at at least a dozen non Disney hotels and they all offered transportation every couple hours to and from the parks. IMO this is just skimping offering transportation only a couple times a day/evening.I expected a resort of this caliber not to skimp. All in all this is a very beautiful hotel with incredible people working for them.There was a few areas that bothered us. Maybe those things would not bother someone else. This review is just OUR opinion.We enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ponyo69
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for two days at this hotel(from April 9th and 10th, 2011).My review is very subjective and personal so be warned - maybe it just happend to me. First of all, this is my worst-serviced hotel. There were loud teenagers romping aournd the hotel corridors (shouting, screaming, and romancing?) and they did not do anything about them(I believe there was a prom at the ball room and I was quite surprised to see these people, yes, very young-looking men and women -- went straight to the hotel room - call me old-fashioned but this is somewhat shocking to me - I went to my prom in California back then - is this Florida thing?). Maybe the Hyatt was so bad they needed this group to stay-float the operation.... Second, there were some water-pumping noise all night from the celing on my bed side. I went to the front-desk at 2 am to complain - and they did not do anything. Lastly, to over-kill alreayd bad-service I received, at the check-out, they added valet-parking service of $47 to my stay, in which I never used. Moreover, house keeping barged in the morning to ask when I was going to check out - unthinkable and rude service! Plus many more things to complain...illogical elevator service and operations.... Now, I've been world-travller and I never had any problems at Ritz, Four-Seasons, Marriot, etc. and I never recieved such a horrible service - and its making me so agitated to write a complain letter - I am writing letters to the CEO, regional-manger, and so on. So my recommendation - stay away from Hyatt and go someplace else (outdoor pools were not clean - it was bug-filled)

Reviews.Title: “IGNORE PARKING CONCERNS”
Reviews.Author: MCOMike
Reviews.Content: I see a few comments about parking concerns that I would like to address. I have been going to the Grand Cypress every year for at least the last 10 years (love it, love it, love it)and parking has never been an issue. When you arrive, you are not told to valet your car as one review indicated. You can stop, drop your bags (and spouse if you are so inclined) to a bellhop who will keep them inside the door for you. Then if you choose not to valet, take off to the self parking. Its not that far away, come on. A 5 minute walk but mostly all inside the hotel, entering thru the conference center in the lower lobby area. My kids, 9 and 5, love running thru the hotel so I take them with me for the walk. All hotels of this calibur in the area charge too much for valet and self parking is not so convenient so self park, save the money and spend it on a cocktail that you can walk off (to the self park)!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great, spa horrifying”
Reviews.Author: serenityseekerFL
Reviews.Content: This is a HUGE hotel with lots of stuff to do. The rooms were newly decorate and we had a corner room with two sliding glass doors on each side. The rooms were a nice size, well decorated, clean, and comfortable. The shower was nice with a "rain" overhead shower as well as a handheld one. Check in was simple and speedy, but some of that could be because I am a gold passport member. The staff was all very friendly. This hotel has received raves for its pool area...not sure that I understand what all of the fuss is about as the pool is nice, but not spectacular. The kids will love the two parrots in the atrium. Valet service was very quick and good. You should know though...there is no minibar and no vending machine, so if you get back from the parks at midnight, you are out of luck if you want a quick soda. After all of that, why am I giving this hotel such a low rating??? 1) The hotel is difficult to find, but this is fairly minor compared to my second complaint. 2) The Spa is horrifying. I am a spa junkie and can recommend specific providers for specific services all over Orlando. I had never tried the Spa here though as this was my first time staying. I called for a deep tissue massage and was able to get one within 2 hours of calling. It took me forever to find the spa...this is never a good sign because if a spa gets good business, the spa is often a highlight on the map of the hotel. Not here! Once I found the well hidden spa, I realized why. As you exit the elevator, there is the check-in desk and two tiny seats for a waiting area. The you wander though a couple of pedicure, manicure, and hair dressing stations, all looking like that have been taken out of a small town salon that needed a good cleaning. I was led to a two seat waiting area outside of two massage rooms. There was no robe, no tea, no serenity music or atmosphere. This was like going to your local small town "spa", not somewhere that I would pay $100+ for a massage. The masseuse herself was not bad. She seemed well trained and she was very nice, but my massage was far from deep tissue. This is, however, not the spa you would go to for the "Spa Experience". Shame on Hyatt for having such a shoddy operation. They should either shut it down or completely revamp it. Bottom line: We will return to the hotel because of the nice rooms and the tons of extra activities. I will never set foot in that spa again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a few small problems. NO big deal”
Reviews.Author: Wealthylife
Reviews.Content: I tell you the first time when I went to the hyatt regency grand cypress I thought the lobby looked outdated and it looked like as though as everything was bland. But the good thing is I got to my room after checking in @ 3:00 which took an hour to get the rooms ready. but that wasn't the important part. the important part of my stay was the room itself. As soon as I got in the bedroom, I was blown away and surprisedly enough the bed was very comfortable and I had no problems with the room. lets get too the bathroom itself even though it looked like there was no drainage system to the faucet. the part I didn't know about the faucet until the second day of my stay was there is something that turns the faucet on and off and it was in the back of the sink. The service was okay, but nothing to write home about. The concierge for example for the first night didn't know anything about downtown orlando and thought there was bars and that was it. the blond headed chick was nice but she would recommend places that were closer to the hotel. but let me tell you as a person who dose his research, isn't going to go to all the touristy places, so I said let me take the risk going to downtown orlando, But surprisinley enough I was right all alone that Downtown orlando is a nice place and it took me only 20 minutes to get there. Even though the concierge says that going to downtown disney is only 30 minutes away. I didn't belive the second concierge and I knew that with google maps that they were printing that all of the conierges that print out directions are wrong about the exact time to get from one place to the other. The time on the clock was 5 minutes wrong, but lucky for me I brought my ipod with me and I woke myself up with the alarm on the Ipod. Food at white horse bar and grill was mediocre and meaning by that was the server took our order and it took like an our for the server too come out and get our food. as soon as my food arrived my crab cake sandwich was luke warm, but tasty. Would I ever recommend eating at the hotel. probably not. but If your a person who dose the research and doesn't need staff recommending locations. then this is the place for you. Overall even though I wasn't paying for the hotel. I did like the property and I would definitely stay at this hotel again. but like every hotel that I have stayed at with my family, there are always improvements that need to be made and no one is prefect. SO yes I would give this hotel a second chance and I would definitely recommend this hotel for families or who happen to have hyatt points like my father.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great After All These Years”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug88000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the top hotels in Orlando including The Ritz-Carlton (too far removed from everything), Disney's Grand Floridian (paying for the monorail, not the service or rooms), and Walt Disney World Swan (a convention style hotel which is very crowded). I still think the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress is the best hotel in Orlando (I first stayed here about 20 years ago), the atmosphere is relaxed, tropical, and casual. Service is wonderful, every request was met promptly, and the price was reasonable for such a nice room, I think the rate was around $180 a night, which was great compared to the $500 a night at the Grand Floridian and the $300 a night for the Ritz Carlton. The hotel has a "mandatory" resort fee of $22 a day, but it covers the transportation to the parks which makes it worth it. Overall with the rooms renovated last year, and the wonderful pool and golf, this is the best hotel in Orlando in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Bargain Rate”
Reviews.Author: Lflynn1017
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hyatt. I agree with the others that the Lobby Decor is odd. But you are never in the lobby. The rooms are great, brand new everything. Spacious. Comfy beds, great bathroom and amenities. Pool was great. They do need some more chairs as all were taken eventhough it did not feel crowded ., There were so many activiites it was sad that we didnt have enought time to do them all. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Disney Orlando area. Only thing is you need a car.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't need sleep, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: BrendaMurray
Reviews.Content: First impressions were our best time here. Our room wasn't ready (not until 4:30 PM - grrrrrr) so we had 45 minutes to wait. We left our bags on a bellhop cart and went out to see the grotto, pool, and all the resort part of the hotel has to offer. Climbing wall! Paddle boats! Fitness center! Three pools (one heated!) A sandy beach on a lake (that you can't swim in due to alligators. Oh well.) The staff were extra nice. We were in room 503. Its kind of 90s chic - furniture was scratched up and the carpet seemed clean, although it had stains. KUDOS to Maria, the housekeeper, she cleans thoroughly. The bedding was okay, no fitted bottom sheet, so the mattress pad (yuck) was exposed during the nights, and no comforter/duvet covers, only sheets (which I kind of found gross, as we all know that hotels do not wash the duvets/comforters after each guest.) I'd have been a bit more 'okay' if it was enclosed in a true covering. Lighting was poor, but aren't all hotels really bad at that? The clock radio near the bed was 1 hour, 25 minutes off (to the early side, so sadness to anyone who didn't notice and missed a plane!) We had to get online just to figure out how to change the clock (Involved removing the back plate, etc.) The light in the bathroom did not work near the sink/mirror. Called reception, and it was fixed immediately, but I surprised these items are not checked out by housekeeping in the first place. Bathroom toiletries are wonderful!!! The bathroom was nice except for two problems and one suggestion. First, there is no way to stop water from coming out of the shower under the door. Otherwise, the rainshower is great. As for the trendy sink - it doesn't drain down as is is flat-bottomed. All the toothpaste and other gunk just sat there. Not much hot water out of those trendy taps, eh? One suggestion: the ceramic soap holder and ceramic vase - are these breakable items necessary on an already cramped counter/sink? Now for the noise.
