The doors in the hotel are they heavy fire doors of old. Slam! Slam! Slam! Of everyone around - some jerks, some not - as I found our door slammed too when we tried it. Last SLAM! was about 1 AM. First SLAM came at 5:30 AM, and catapulted us out of our sleep. The hallways echo loudly as the rooms near the center of the hotel are close to the openness that extends from the lobby to the tip top of the building. Nothing is free in this hotel. The business center with two PCs and a printer costs to use. (I walked out.) Internet is $10 a day or including with the resort fee, if you have that. The Palm cafe told me that coffee was free in the lobby, but I was charged $3 a cup. Valet parking is $20 a day, but the self park is down the road for free. We had no problem parking at all, even with two conferences going on. The restaurants are pricey, so without a car, you'll be strapped for a place to eat. Orlando Ale House, Dunkin Donuts, Ihop and Walgreens are about a 20 minute walk outside the resort gate. We rented a car, so unsure how much the shuttle from the airport cost. Another nice thing was the mini-fridge in the room. Nice! And it wasn't a mini-bar so no fear to open it! We'll stay elsewhere next time...We weren't SOOO disappointed, as we felt it was value for the price we paid, but its the little things that are so easy to fix - maybe in the next renovation. Additionally, I'm not sure if there are nicer rooms than the basic room we received, so its hard to warn people away...but then again, we do like to sleep after a long journey to get to our lodging, and we did not get very much sleep at all in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort atmosphere, loaded with amenities, you don't need to ever leave”
Reviews.Author: Maripat34238
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress and we wanted a relaxing, pampered weekend. The place was awesome, with its own beach, manicured expansive grounds that we walked each night, huge lagoon pool and smaller heated pool, top notch restaurant - Hemingway's - with some of the best seafood we've ever had, excellent service & romantic atmosphere, paddleboats/canoes/kayaks, multiple spa/whirlpools tucked away in caves & a fire pit. Pools & workout facility are 24 hrs. The rooms have been redone and are lovely. Bathrooms have only one sink. The "balcony" is really only a standup balcony, which was a disappointment. Self parking is available. We stayed on resort grounds the entire weekend except for one visit to downtown Winter Park, which reminded us of downtown Naples - great, trendy restaurants, shopping, pedestrian & pet friendly, wonderful ambiance, good for an afternoon or evening's entertainment. We booked the AAA breakfast package, paid $116/night with $22 resort fee, but were given a free $44 (for 2) breakfast daily - a buffet that is outstandingly delicious & elegant, though would have been pricey at $22pp if we'd had to pay for it, in the Cascades restaurant. Excellent value for the price & we'd definitely go again. The hotel is VERY close to Disney & has a shuttle; we were not interested in theme parks on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very impersonal lounge areas”
Reviews.Author: Mishmunnypenny
Reviews.Content: We had interconnecting rooms here, which were very nice, although the plug sockets were hanging out of the wall and our bath blocked a couple of times! The pool area at this hotel is brilliant. The restaurants within the hotel weren't open every night which seemed crazy as we were there in the Easter holiday season. The large atrium is lovely with incredibly high ceiling up through the floors, but it lacked any cosiness. There was a bar which felt very 'open' in the atrium and the 'sofas' were ghastly hard foam things - not comfortable to sit on at all. It wasn't a nice area to sit after a hard day. If we returned we would go to the Boardwalk Inn, which we went to look at. More relaxed and cosy with big easy chairs in the reception areas, should you still want to be in the hub bub of life with a G&T. glass of plonk in the evening. It had the feel of a big business/conference hotel rather than a 'family hotel'. (I've put in 'May' as the date as the dates didn't go far back enough).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (except for noise), already booked the next stay”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 9 month old son and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress in early March. I had reserved an executive suite. The hotel had been kind enough to contact me (as a member of the Hyatt Gold Passport programme), and in this connection, I chose to do an upgrade into an exectuive suite, so that we would have two rooms - i.e. one for our son to sleep in. The room: We had a corner view with a view over the pool and lake, and not the least the fireworks from Magic Kingdom every night. A nice little touch. I very much like the interior of the room - everything very new and contemporary. Another nice little touch was the note from the maid on the bed asking at what time of the day we would like to have the room serviced for the time of our stay. A good idea. On-site: The hotel has some quite nice restaurants - apart from the cafe (forgot the name) by the pool, which was pretty bad. Lousy service and crappy food. On the other hand, especially Hemingway's was a fantastic dining experience. Their seafood dishes are spectacular. We went there twice, even with a baby (which they went out of their way to please with special orders and kind smiles), it was a relaxed and first and foremost culinary experience. Would recommend it to anybody. The pool area is second to none - a vast area with pools and waterfalls, and a heated pool for the winter and the little ones. Could not have asked for anything more. The negatives: Despite requesting an early check-in, we could not get our room when we arrived at around 1.30 pm. Had to wait until 3.30 pm (I believe) to get the room :( As at least one other reviewer has noted in this forum, we were also there in early March when there was a conference with a band playing by the pool for most of the evening, which was a massive disturbance, as our son needed to go to sleep well before they finished the guitar solos. I complained about it at the front desk but was not offered any kind of compensation, which I thought was not so forthcoming. As a member of the frequent visitor (Gold Passport) programme, all they would have had to offer was a couple of thousand points, and we would have been happy about it. Not the best handling of that situation in my opinion. As others have mentioned, another negative about a hotel as large as this one is that all distances are so vast. Probably took me between 5 and 10 minutes to get from my room to my car. But that is pretty hard to do anything about. All in all, I was very pleased to stay at this resort, and I have already booked my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Stbdtack94
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a huge pool, pitch and putt golf, game room, several hot tubs, exercise facility, boats, tennis, several restaurants, and even horse stables nearby. It would make a great place to honeymoon as it seemed very romantic and you would never have to leave the hotel. The resort states that it has shuttles to Disney, but only two buses leave early in the morning and come back rather late at night. If you desire to return early, you have to take a $25 taxi. We opted to drive each day and pay the parking fees at Disney so we could pack a healthy lunch, take extra clothing (it got really cold at night) and come home when we wanted. Thus, the shuttle ended up being a bust for us. The room overall was clean, but small and the beds were not as comfortable as the ones at Sheraton hotels. This hotel also tacked on a daily parking fee and with hotel taxes, this increased our bill $50 per day.

Reviews.Title: “What life is about!”
Reviews.Author: Snafu77
Reviews.Content: Usually when i travel i like to indulge a little bit! Well this was more than a little bit and i regret having to ever leave, this hotel is heaven on earth! Whatever member of staff i encountered were more than pleasent! There is so much to do, but in the end i settled for the pool, i will defon be back in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff! Loved Merlot, the macaw!”
Reviews.Author: nycladydoc
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I just loved the hotel. The room was modern,clean, comfortable and room service was a delight with good food and great service. We loved the amenities and took advantage of the boating, biking and the s'mores at the firepit. Our weather was great , and my teenage daughter and I took advantage of the pool, slides and eating poolside at On the Rocks. What a treat! We also tried almost every restaurant and felt the food was delicious and worth the cost (less than our usual Manhattan prices). We also bought our Universal Studios and Disney multi-day passes at the hotel; where discounts and shuttle service was included. Just make sure you watch the times on the shuttle returns and get confirmation numbers if needed for private shuttle service (especially for airport service or other events like Arabian Nights dinner show). We stayed for a full week and loved almost every minute of it! We will return and recommend it to all! Ellen J. Ferranti, MD Manhattan, NY

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but maybe you don't need it.”
Reviews.Author: Brazil1703
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, beautiful and well maintained. It offers a resort space with horse riding, lake paddle, hiking, etc, but for this you will need to pay extra (like 20-30 USD per day). My suggestion is, plan well your trip. If you are gonna spend the days in the parks you might not need a fancy hotel as good as that. Be aware, self parking is free, valet service is not. Enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great pool but beware the remote control!”
Reviews.Author: H6714
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel through Hotwire, we got a good deal. Travelling with 2 small children the 2 bed room was OK if on the tight side once the crib was in. Room & bathroom nicely finished, bathroom a little impractical, trendy basins which didnt drain too well and trendy faucets that didn't run very fast on hot. The pool and slides -esp heated pool and little slide - were fantastic, wish we spent the day there instead of the Magic Kingdom, but hindsight is always a good thing! The only real issue we had was with the tv, we managed to block the adult pay channels but could not see a way to block the general pay per view. Our 6 year old had a good talking to about NOT TOUCHING the remote control, but of course, as soon as our backs were turned it took him about 5 seconds to get the control, press the buttons that conveniently lit up to press "BUY" and he had spent 18 dollars on a movie.. We didn't persue it with the hotel but didn't ever watch it either. I did go to reception but it was very busy checking in a large family and so I gave up waiting. Yes, we left the control in his reach, but it was WAY too easy to press the buttons that lit up to buy a movie, no PIN or anything needed. We didn't use the breakfast facility but there was an IHOP round the corner which offered better value than 20 dollars each. The resort fee was covered with the Hotwire booking so that was a saving I guess ! Overall, very nice hotel, small rooms for more than 3 tho, pool was great tho and we wish we had spent the day trying out the paddle boats etc instead of the not so Magic Kingdom .

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel with amazing amenities and service.”
Reviews.Author: Moondogge
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my wife and two children in March and from the very start the level of service we received was above and beyond our expectations. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and guest services delivered with excellence. The pools were great as well as all other amenities. I have seen reviews complaining about the resort fee, but it was nominal and covered parking and all hotel amenities. Overall highly recommended for families and business travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and resort”
Reviews.Author: Katemilne
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Lovely swimming pools. One reserved for a "quiet area". The other with waterslides for families with children. Lake area with canoes, pedal craft etc. You can hire bikes to ride around the grounds. Golf course is impressive too with an excellent pro shop. The hotel has a number of restaurants to cater for all tastes. My only criticism would be the food offering at the pool restaurant "Palms" was pricey and not that great. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. Hotel room very comfortable with all the amenities you would expect. Comfortable bed and great shower! Would recommend this resort and hope to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “HYATT GRAND CYPRESS - HOTEL OF HIDDEN CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: billyboy68
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the British Airways Wesbite as it was highly recommended by them. Compared to the quality of the hotels in Orlando, this would be at the higher end, without question. The rooms are lovely, and the cleanliness of the hotel itself is excellent. Location wise, it's not walking distance to International drive, and is only accessible by taxi or car. This basically means that if you don't hire a car, you will have to depend on the shuttle services provided by the hotel, which not all parks and attractions are provided for free. As a typical example, we had tickets for the Wet & Wild park, but had to pay $38 for two adults to get us there, which only took 15 minutes. The part is actually across the road from Universal Studios, and if we had known, would have ordered the free shuttle service from the hotel instead. So although paying the $25 daily hotel service free, free travel only applied to some of the parks. Another matter which greatly annoyed us is that complimentary breakfast was included in our package, which included tax and 15% gratuity, which we had in writing from the hotel. Despite this, we were on one occasion in the middle of eating, when one of the waiters rudely interruped to mention "I know you have a voucher for the buffet breakfast, which means I get nothing, and indicated that we should leave him a tip". Neadless to say, we refused to sit in his breakfast seating area, and it left quite a bad taste taste in our mouths after that bad experience. We feel strongly that the $25 daily hotel service fee should be part of the hotel cost, which isn't cheap. We feel that a hotel should as policy, let you use their facilities; pool, gym, use their towels etc as this is what the minimum requirement of providing a satisfactory service without having the charge their customers for the previledge. I have stayed in many hotels worldwide, and have never came across this charging policy before. 'Mears' the taxi company the hotel use, were quite aggressive about tips. Although they appear rather overly friendly initially, if you don't tip them, expect quite a nasty reaction! All in all, not a bad hotel. Location isn't perfect, if I was booking again, I would look for a hotel in the north nearer the main theme parks. They also need to rethink the hotel service charge. We walked away with an additional mandatory $250 bill upon checkout just for staying in the hotel, and it does make you think you are being charged just for staying there using facilities you believe you have already paid for when you book your room. So if you are going to stay in the Hyatt, you will need to budget for this additional expense. It's not a hotel that we are likely to return to, to be honest, and I would advise to shop around and use trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: mklsim
Reviews.Content: My daughter liked Merlot (the parrot) but loved Kula even more. The heated kids pool was awesome and she loved the slide. The wait service was a little slow by the pool, but understandable given the number of people that were out there. Rooms were modern, and clean..very nice in my opinion. Reminds me of the rooms @ the Contemporary for some reason. The docking station for media was a very nice touch. I understand some of the concern regarding the shared door for the closet and the bathroom, but it did not bother us at all. Also the half glass partition in the shower was an interesting design feature, but again having the shower head, and a hand held sprayer was a definite plus for us since it made giving our kid a shower much easier. Breakfast @ Cascades was really good. Great pancakes, and the mickey shaped blueberry pancakes for my daughter made her day. Dinner @ WhiteHorse was better than expected. Steak was a little overdone, but still good ,and Swordfish was a little dry. Still enjoyed our meal. Fish Tacos and Pina Coladas by the pool were superb. From the 18th floor we had a nice view of the fireworks, and the location of the hotel is very close to the Premium Outlet Mall as well as the other Disney Parks. I just wanted to express my gratitude to the staff @ the Hyatt Regency. From the moment we checked in we felt that they provided us with special attention, and made sure that we were happy during our stay. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice got to be the best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: globalbagtag_123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my wife and 3 year old daughter who were staying while I was on business elsewhere; I joined them for one night at the end of my stay. From the moment they checked in they loved the place, My daughter loved the parrots in the lobby and the pool was one of the best I have seen but the best of all for a 3 year old was a fantastic beach in the middle of Orlando! They even gave her a bucket and spade. The room was fantastic and we had a good pool view. We were so impressed we checked in again one week later as we had to spend a night in Orlando before our flight back to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shannan722
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days. Beautiful grounds, pool, and lots of fun activites. The room was modern and clean. The service was great and everything we asked for was brought right up to us . My son needed a crib because he would not sleep in the bed-it was at our door before I could hang up the phone. Sunday brunch was pricey but amazing!!!! Also a special thanks to Luis in security. We left a very important bag in our room and Luis made sure it was mailed promptly just as promised. The only negative thing I could say was the girl working at boat rental on Wed March 9th was so rude and miserable. You could tell she really hated her job. Not helpful at all. All in all great hotel and we will definitley return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmanXX
Reviews.Content: This is a grat hotel for a great price. I am not easily pleased with hotels but this was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BlasianGrl
Reviews.Content: Bret [-] from group sales[-] is rude. I would NOT recommend at stay at THIS hotel if HE is a representation of the employees at this hotel. I asked him if there is a military discount seperate from a group rate. He proceeded to tell me if the group meeting is a government sanctioned blah blah blah. I replied and said the meeting is NOT a government sanctioned meeting I would just like to know if there is a SEPERATE miliary rate. His reply? If I stopped cutting him off he'd get to that part. How long does it take to answer YES or NO?! I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. We are taking our group of 500 members (lol thought I only had 10 rooms huh?) and take our MONEY to the Marriot where they know how to answer questions without arrogance, rudeness and ignorance.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST IN ORLANDO”
Reviews.Author: georgiapeache
Reviews.Content: We have taken our kids to Disney and Universal at least five times in the past ten years. We "always" stay at a Disney property. Since we planned this trip last minute during winter break most hotels were sold out. This hotel is BEYOND EXCELLENT in every way. The staff is friendly, helpful and efficient. The lobby is gorgeous. I would recommend the self-park as it's easy and free. The rooms are very large compared to most hotels in the Orlando area AND VERY CLEAN! I hope they keep it this way! The bed was comfortable...again very clean. The room has a small frig, and lots of draw and closet space. Highly recommend asking for a high floor---9 or up. Some of the lower floors have trees that block your view. And, if possible, get a room overlooking the pool/parks. You can watch the fireworks in some rooms. If this is not possible, you can take the elevator to a higher floor and watch the fireworks from the hotels large glass windows (many ppl do this). The property is gorgeous with multiple pools (only one is heated--the middle pool). I found the other two pools to be freezing as if it was filled with ice. One of the three pools is an adult pool. There are several fun slides throughout the pool area. The amenities the hotel includes with a daily fee are absolutely worth the cost. Great little man-made beach, bikes, surrey, canoes, rock climbing wall next to the pool area etc etc. Lots to do on the property. We enjoyed the talking parrots in the lobby...very fun. The only minus was the strange way the hotel designed the door that opens for the closet AND the bathroom. Not well thought out. If someone tries to get into the bathroom at the same time that another person is trying to get into the safe or closet you can get caught/knocked by the door. It can get annoying. however, I would not let this deter you from staying at this hotel. They have a great fitness center in the middle of the pool area, under a cave. The fitness center is not supervised, and since it's under a cave would recommend going when several ppl are in there (was a creeper in there when one of our family members was using it). There are several good restaurants at the corner of this hotel. You could walk, but I would recommend driving. Downtown Disney is close, and the "Disney entrance" is around the corner from the hotel...which is fun for small kids to see as they pass it to get to this hotel. This is an excellent value for the excellent service, beautiful property and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: LeglEagl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Grand Cypress and upgraded to Regency Club using Gold Passport points. We are huge fans of Hyatt and stay in the hotels alot. Overall, a great stay and lots of fun. I will highlight a few negatives that would have made our trip even better, and some issues that potential guests might want to know - but we will definitely be back again. Hotel design: this place is HUGE. Don't leave anything in your room and have to run back up for it - it is not a quick trip, especially from the pool and other recreation areas. Free self-serve parking, but again a little but of a walk. Note that this hotel is not great for those with a fear of heights. It is structured around a huge atrium, and in order to get to your room you have to go up a glass enclosed elevator and then traverse a walkway with glass on both sides - if you have a room on a high floor, or need Regency Club access, this can be an issue. We had to get hotel staff to let us up and down the service elevator constantly - which they did with a smile, noting that it happens all the time - or took the stairs, but it was an inconvenience. They did offer to move our room to a lower floor, which we declined due to RC access on Floor 12. Food: We got food by the pool a few times and did the Sunday brunch at La Cocina - Pool service is very, very slow by two pretty surly and inefficient servers - they need another server or two, and the kitchen needs to pick up the pace. La Cocina was to die for, although definitely a $$$ splurge. You will not walk away hungry (unless you are a 10 year old kid - not tons of kid-friendly options on the buffet). Regency Club: We usually use the RC for breakfast and cocktails/heavy appetizers, which we can often stretch into replacing dinner. Some difference about this RC as opposed to other Hyatts we have been to - a bit smaller on the inside, but a huge and gorgeous deck. It is GREAT in nice weather, but when raining or chilly the seats are at a premium. Surprisingly, drinks during cocktail hour ARE NOT FREE as we have found in other RCs - drinks are $3-5. The food seemed to be recycled buffet food (we noticed several clearly recycled items from the Sunday brunch) and their hot offerings are repeated a bit too often. Again, not alot of kid friendly food - most kids won't eat food like cold crab cakes, asparagus and samosas. Other clubs we have been to have had pasta, meatballs, etc. Also we were not sure why they closed the club from 3-5 pm every day and close at 9 - others we have been to stay open the whole day, and later than 9, and they could (and do) clean at night. I am not sure if we would upgrade again in this hotel or just get a breakfast included option. Room design: recently remodeled in a modern style. Beds were comfortable, sofa did pull out into a double. I would like to see more storage space, but it was just adequate for the 3 of us for 4 days. There is nowhere to put suitcases except on the top of the closet. The closet/bathroom door is a strange frosted glass barndoor style that slides to cover the closet or the bathroom, but not both. This is ok, except that you don't have alot of privacy in the bathroom as there basically is no "door", and the light from the bathroom pours through the frosted glass (which wakes up everyone in the room if you have to use in the night). I also did not see where you could lock the "door," which led to a few embarrassing moments and gave new meaning to the words "knock first before entering". Shower did not have a bathing suit drip line - strange for a FL hotel centered around a pool. Other issues: One main complaint that we had about the hotel is that this is a place that tries to be everyone to everybody with limited success. They bill themselves as a resort with all of the amenities for kids, etc. (including pools, boating, pitch and putt, game room, bikes, etc. - awesome) - BUT this is very much a conference hotel catering to large groups. For example, one day that we were there we woke up to the staff building a HUGE stage, with lights, towering sound system, etc. next to the pool - basically blocking full access to the one heated pool on the property (and it was chilly, so the others were not really useful). They also blocked off half of the pool deck for tables, buffets etc. This culminated in a reception that evening with a band in which took "this one goes to 11" as a challenge. They played from 7-10 p.m. and basically drove us out of our room, because the sound was unbearable - even though the guitarist did a pretty mean Santana impression. There was no warning or apology about this incredibly intrusive event to other guests. (When we lodged a complaint, they immediately took half off our room rate for the night - but had they at least warned us in advance when we checked in or by a note under our door the day before, we could have at least planned to be out for the night.) Another night they shut the pitch and putt down at 5 p.m. for another event. If you are going to restrict acccess to resort amenities (which they really should not do anyway) then at least let guests know in advance. All in all, really a great trip - if hotel management would pay a little more attention to treating their regular resort guests better (as opposed to their conference guests), it would be 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!”
Reviews.Author: dyltrips
Reviews.Content: The grounds and gardens have an oriental flare and are so beautiful. Everything wa perfect.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: MDI1
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a whim as we needed a place for one night before leaving to return home from a week in Florida. I wished that we had found in sooner as it was great. The room, the view, the service, the food were all great. Next time I'm in town this will be the first place that I check availability.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: tventura
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay and we had a great time. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous. The rooms were clean. My son thought the french fries and chicken fingers at the White Horse Grille were awesome. I loved the organized programs at the pool on the weekends for the kids. My only complaint was limited help poolside during the week and limited times for the park shuttles. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: bbgdle
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit at the HRGC resort and it was even better than the first visit. We discovered even more activities. My husband and I took tennis lessons and played in the round robin on Saturday. We met local players who were very nice. The tennis pro LYnn is excellent and so positive...she makes you feel very welcomed. We took the free bikes (included with the activity fee) and pedaled every day around the property. We took advantage of the free driving range, free golf cart and free 9 h ole pitch and putt. The pool food was excellent and the best deal. We had the delicious fish tacos...Mahi-mahi...my husband had them for lunch and dinner one day. Our hotel room was very reasonable with military discount and we had two balconies facing the lake and property. There is a free shuttle that we took on the last visit to Disney but not interested this time.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cvel
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated rooms are great. Pool is awsome and plenty of things to do for kids. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “All great bar the car valet/town car service”
Reviews.Author: visitrequisites
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 rather lovely days at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. Going there for a conference and staying for 10 days, I got the conference rate for the whole time with free internet access thrown in and upgraded to a pool room which was great. The reception staff always knew my name (how do they do that?) and very quick to fix a broken telephone. I could always get a bike or treadmill in the gym and the grounds are great for walking in. It's also quite close to the Vineland shopping outlet. At the end of a great trip I was irritated to need to catch a taxi to the aiport and while standing there with a huge suitcase, carry-on luggage and handbag, was totally ignored by the car valet guy who was chatting to a male guest. When I said "I know you're having a conversation and all but I really need to get to the airport", he just arrogantly waved the town car over and kept talking. I was amazed and rather appalled! Then to cap it off, after the town car driver knew I was flying Delta, he just dropped me off at the first stop at Orlando airport which was for American Airlines. I didn't realise I had to get right across to terminal B to Delta - and there were no suitcase trolleys.Thank goodness I had enough time to struggle over there. An otherwise lovely stay was marred by these issues...

Reviews.Title: “A trip in itself”
Reviews.Author: pursueliving
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. From the moment I walked in the soft jazz and waterfalls and opulent & expansive lobby said, "the vacation has officially begun". Streams, plants and waterfalls everywhere, along with large and expensive statues of Hindu gods, Buddhas and other Eastern religions, welcoming people from around the world and showing a reverance for a source higher/bigger/greater than ourselves. The grounds were lush and fabulous, the rooms contemporary with views of the fireworks and the lake/pools/beach, Epcot, MGM and Disney. Ask to be placed on that side of the hotel. The pools were wonderful with hidden whirlpools, lots of waterfalls. Things for kids to do, things for adults - the lake - sailing, kayaking, paddleboat, etc. There's a $22.50 resort fee/day that you can opt out of if you do not plan on using the pools, 24-foot rock climbing wall, health club, shuttle transportation, 9-hole golf, tennis courts or bikes. Valet is $20 and while self park is free, I believe it's a little distance and challenging to find a spot. Wireless Internet is $9.99 one time but beginning 3/1/11 that will be included. Currently there is hard-wire internet. Refrigerator but no microwave. Also - if you want bubble bath and need a tub, get the double rooms; King rooms only have a shower. Chaise in room for comfortable reading! I really can't say enough about this- oh- Starbucks and Seattle's Best coffee served on site though not full menu. The Sunday brunch at LaCoquina fills up quickly so reserve accordingly. The restaurants, the grounds, the pool, the service and people - all are set up and orchestrated to give you a most relaxing and enjoyable, upscale vacation. Highly recommended. Also, great for a wedding. The only hold back would be that (my) door was not cut all the way to the floor but had about 1" open. At night a *huge* streaming light from the hallway came pouring into the room and lit it quite nicely, actually. Could've been just my room right next to the main hallway. It made it somewhat uncomfortable when people walked by as they sounded like they were right in my room. Thankfully there weren't alot of people passing by. A fabulous stay with excellent amenities, staff, service, restaurants - everything!

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky fees hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LinhH
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I had booked this hotel to stay from February 12-February 15, 2011 to celebrate our anniversary and Valentines Day at Disneyworld and Universal Studios. We chose this hotel due to the beautiful pictures and good reviews we saw online. Here are our pros and cons: Pros: Beautiful scenery, lots of amenities (that we did not use), the lobby was really pretty (there were parrots), and the location was pretty close to everything which was nice. Cons: Valet parking is $20 a night (we'd figure it would be free for hotel guests but apparently it was not). Second is their parking, their parking spot is so small that people are parking on the side of the curb, we had to walk a very long distance to get into the hotel after we parked the car. Amenities fees: We were not informed that there were a $22.50 mandatory fee each night that we stay that should have been stated when we checked in for the Amenities that we did not use. Housekeeping: When we came back the room was cleaned but our clothes were moved into a pile, knocked over my luggage and all my clothes were spilled out and they just left it there. Apparently we had a bag of candy that was open and it was full but when we came back from Disney World it was only a few pieces left. It's not a big deal because it's only candy, it's just the principle of things. Room: Their towels were hard and not soft. They only had a stand in shower and no bathtub, which I was really looking forward to taking a bath. Luckily, everything we did outside of the hotel was very fun that the cons of the hotel did not bother us that much except the fees.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and location. Great service. Lobby renovation still ongoing”
Reviews.Author: Bitboy11
Reviews.Content: When I visited Florida for Xmas break this December, I visited Orlando for 3-4 nights with my wife and 5 y.o. son, to take my son to Orlando resorts. As usual, I sought out a Hyatt near to Disney and settled for the Grand Cypress resort. We always try to book places which offer a separate bedroom for our son at a reasonable price. After poking around on the Internet, I decided to call Hyatt direct and - voila - got the best deal - extra room at half price! Likes: Upon arrival, we got two adjoining rooms arranged quickly, with the lake view. The rooms were very nice, plush, clean, recently remodeled in very good, neutral taste. Very helpful, friendly and efficient staff. Dislikes: 1. Lobby and hotel grounds renovation was in full swing during our stay. All the work stopped in the evening so the nights were blissfully quiet. There was no room noise in the morning but, for some reason, the hotel had to shut off hot water and electricity for a couple of hours every morning, on one occasion without prior warning. This delayed our departure to a resort. To be fair to Hyatt, they gave a me a whopping, further discount off my room rate for the water trouble. 2. The parking lot was part closed, and, once parked, we had to enter the hotel through the side wing and walk past the work crews making terrible noise dismantling the interior of the hotel's business conference rooms. Frankly, we were not too bothered by this as the noise was limited just to that area. 3. My past but admittedly outdated experiences of food service in different Hyatts in the US were [relatively] positive. However, the Grand Cypress breakfast buffet was utterly disappointing - mediocre filtered coffee, horrible fried-to-the-crisp-bacon, tasteless fruit, soggy eggs, etc... I peeked into the a la carte plates of people next to our table but saw nothing encouraging -- sugar glazed cinnamon buns smothered with maple syrup and other abominations. All in, it cost us $60 for the three of us! I allow that Hyatt restaurateurs know well the preferences of their key US clientele and thus don't hold much hope for any improvement in this area. As bad as it was, it's still better than breakfast at any of the resorts (see below on how we coped with this on subsequent nights). 4. WiFi broadband that is offered as part of the $20 daily service charge is way too slow at 768K speed, and the available WiFi speed upgrade was something like $10 per day! Fortunately, I managed to connect at normal speeds via Boingo hotspot that was within range in our room. On the balance, we were very happy with our experience, save for the food, and would recommend it to anyone. Side Note: Orlando generally falls short in quality of food one gets in nice places in large US cities, London or Western Europe (or Eastern Europe or Asia for that matter). We coped by: - having breakfasts at a bagel place in the same mall as a Whole Foods supermarket (Turkey Lane Road); - picking up boxed fresh egg/tuna salads and bread at the same Whole Foods supermarket for having lunch at resorts (where food is beyond awful).

Reviews.Title: “All of the staff are friendly, helpful and very informative.”
Reviews.Author: camran1101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from January 31st to February 5th and found it very relaxing and enjoyable. The lobby is very inviting and so pretty with the indoor gardens and beautiful views of the pool/grotto area and the lake. Loved the "Quiet Area" signs around the one side of the unheated pool. It was sooo relaxing to lay on the lounge and read or snooze. Ordered lunch and a delicious drink from the "Rock Bar." The few parents with kids stayed at the heated pool by the slide. The restaurants are pricey, but great burgers and shrimp cocktail served at the White Horse Grill. Had THE BEST massage by Annette at the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Hemmingways - Best Dinner of the Decade!!!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheSceneAtlanta
Reviews.Content: WOW! Unbelievable food. I had the Shrimp Scampi and my husband couldn't keep his fork off my plate. Although we were in Orlando for 5 nights, I wanted to eat at this restaurant every single night. Do not miss this hidden gem, and if you live in Orlando...you need to drop in and eat the shrimp scampi. I am not lying to you, it is really that good. I can't stop thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Cypress is like new again”
Reviews.Author: UofR64
Reviews.Content: The renovation was a year ago but it is still like new today. We had a four night reservation and extended it to five after arriving. Our 11th floor king room felt clean, sheets looked pressed and the bathroom was larger than normal and a large shower with both handheld and ceiling (rain style) shower heads. The hotel location and gated entrance give an upscale feeling and atmosphere compared to other four or five star hotels. Grand Cypress is one of the preeminent resorts still today around Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGators
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for a long time, and until recently we've had no desire to stay there. However, due to the recent upgrade we gave it a shot, and are glad we did. The rooms have all been remodeled. Take a look at the more recent pictures on this page to get an idea. They are sleek and very comfortable. The bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. The grounds are beautiful. We did not spend much time outside though due to it being an abnormally cold weekend in Central Florida. However we did play a round or two at the pitch and chip course, a smaller version of a par 3 golf course. Staff was very kind and courteous at all points of the trip. I would recommend this hotel to you if you are in the area for Disney if you want a nicer hotel offDisney property or for any other reason you may be in the area (seemed to have very good convention/meeting space as well).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumDE
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend the Hyatt Grand Cypress for any business traveler in Orlando. The location is perfect; next to Disney, near lots of restaurants (most of them chains, but this is Orlando, after all), easy access to the major highway into and out of Orlando, and near great shopping. The hotel itself is beautiful; contemporary styling, comfortable rooms, easy (and free!) internet in the rooms, great restaurants on-site. Also, there is a lovely swimming pool and lake with lots of family activities. Most impressive, though, was the wonderful attitude of ALL the staff, from the reception and concierge to the valet, bell-hops and housekeeper. How refreshing it is to have any queries answered with a smile and enthusiasm. I typically stay at the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando, and for one-fifth the price, my stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress was just as, if not more, pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business - bad for family trips to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Qas123
Reviews.Content: The grand hyatt is an excellent hotel. Newly refurbished rooms which exceed the traditional hotel rooms you get in Florida hyatt's and marriott's. Nice pool and lake. Main downfall is their "shuttle" service to Disney. The shuttle makes 2 trips in the morning and 3 returns at night. All of which are at fairly inconvenient times (8pm return for example). If you miss these shuttles you are doomed to a $25-35 taxi ride or convoluted trip to downtown disney and a $10 cab ride. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families on trips to Disney as the hassle isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, but beware”
Reviews.Author: toddling40
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, forr the most part. The renovation is gorgeous; the rooms are some of the best I have ever stayed in, and I've done almost all the 4- and 4 1/2-star properties and resorts in the area with only the exception of the Ritz-Carlton. I was even upgraded to a nice lake view room on the top (18th) floor. Everything was in perfect working order, and it was a quiet and calm retreat. I got the room on a $60 Priceline bid, and that made it all the sweeter. The one thing I take serious issue with, and the reason I won't recommend it, is the "service fee" of $20. First of all, this is, bar none, the most expensive such fee in Orlando. Even Downtown Disney hotels (actual WDW-owned hotels and resorts don't charge one AT ALL) have "resort fees" that are less than half this, usually $8, and they at least include a shuttle service that goes all day on the hour (for Animal Kingdom and the water parks) or half hour (for all the other parks). Regardless of any possible excuse on the part of management, these fees are highway robbery, and this one is just beyond the pale. If we don't have a choice, then it's a hidden part of the rate. Make the rates reflect it; otherwise, it's dishonest at best.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: GillWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family of 6 adults and two young children 17th to 20th Dec. On arrival at reception there was a lady shouting at staff she said it was noisy ( there was some work going on ) pool was cold etc. and shouted to us not to stay. We were rather worried at what we would find, but were very pleased with everything. Rooms were fine and reception staff did their best to get the three rooms near ( although my son decided he would like a higher floor, again the staff went to the trouble to get it ) The resort it self was wonderful, sand,lakes,boats,golf,bikes,pools,hot tubs etc. There was something for everyone of all ages. Our flight to London was canceled at the last moment due to bad weather. The hotel let us keep the same rooms at the same rate and all the staff were very helpful. I am not sure what that lady wanted ( I did see her still there a few days later so things couldn't have been that bad ) maybe discount ! We had no trouble with noise from workmen infact we had no trouble at all and will certainly go back to hotel when we go to Florida

Reviews.Title: “Good but lacks the truth..”
Reviews.Author: livingproof1984
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this hotel. It is a great hotel in general. It is very beautiful. Although, service is lacking. Every time a question is asked to them around the hotel especially the guest services/reception area, it's like asking for their first born child. Rude and unprofessional. The shuttles at the hotel? Don't even count on it! I have stayed at hotels all around Disney World and the World and I can say this is the worst one for shuttles and service. Twice a day for shuttles? Please! 2 Star hotels around the same area offer shuttles every 30 minutes to the parks. Upon asking guest services on the phone why it was only twice a day I was told "that's just the way it is" It's not like a can have a choice of taking a shuttle in morning and one in the afternoon. No the shuttles are all in the morning and leave before 10am.. I'm left with no option and no choice but to take a cab at this supposed to be or claim to be 4 or 5 star hotel. Why are we paying a $20 service fee at this supposed to be resort when no service is offered? Isn't at least one of those stars rating supposed to accomodate your guests needs? I'm sorry to say this hotel is not even close to the star rating it claims to be. Not to mention? Calling the front desk or guest services at least twice letting the phone ring for over 5 minutes and having our calls unanswered? Then proceeding downstairs to the lobby witnessing nobody at the front desk? This is unacceptable and not to the standard of hotels at this kind of rating. I have honestly gotten better service at 2 or 3 stars hotels. I think it's sad that I have to write this review on here when I was expecting a perfect and magical stay. It is after all the "happiest place on earth", or at least I thought it was until I came here. Never again will spend money here. I'd rather stay at the Bates Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: deztinai
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Grand Cypress from Dec 30, 2010 to Jan 06, 2011. Our stay was wonderful. The hotel is gorgeous. All of the staff was helpful and very friendly. We took advantage of almost all of the extra activities on the property. Loved the fact that they have a man-made beach on the resort. It was a nice alternative to be able to lounge and sun bathe there than around the pools. The pools and hot tubs are nice and are open 24 hours. Which, for us, was great. We would go to the heated pool and hot tubs later in the nights (usually around 12:30-1:00am) so that it would be quieter and more relaxing. The room we stayed in was nice. I had read other reviews complaining about the room's size and the bathroom. We had absolutely no problem with either. The room was plenty big for 2 people and our suitcases were put away behind the desk the whole time and didn't take up space. Our bathroom had a closing door (non-sliding)and although the closet is situated in the bathroom there was no problem with it. The toto rainshower was nice and our shower had an actual door and there was no problem with water going on the floor. Just wished they had an actual towel bar to hang up our wet towels. There is a small one for a face cloth but that was it. Our only little hiccup was check-in. We had arrived from an overnight flight (we arrived at 7:30am) and there were no rooms ready. We had requested an early check-in, but I do understand it was New Year's Eve weekend and they were at full capacity. So we went for breakfast at IHOP and when we came back we only waited around for about another hour or so before a room was ready for us. Barbara (the young lady who checked us in) was very helpful and understanding and gave us a great room looking over the pool and over at Disney. The location is perfect. You can walk from the hotel (10 minutes) to great restaurants, walgreens, grocery store and other amenities. So there are other options for you to dine if you don't always want to eat at the hotel. (FYI : the Orlando Ale House ,which is across the street , is a great place to eat). Overall, we were extremely happy with our stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Could not find fault.. you never have to leave Resort.”
Reviews.Author: xraymott
Reviews.Content: Visited with 2 adults & 2 kids. Got great rate here on Travelrepublic. 4 night stay. 1st night booked using Delta skymiles and next three with TravelRepublic. 4 nights total. Was a bit concerned that both bookings would be treated separately and we would have to move rooms after first night, so e-mailed Hyatt Gold Passport and they assured me by reply that booking would be traeted as 4 night stay. Checked in by v pleasant Cynthia and again I confirmed that booking was for 4 nights. No problem! Glass of champagne given routinely on check-in. Given beautiful room on 14th floor. Public areas and rooms fabulous. We chose to self park. Resort facilities were absolutely magnificent. Well worth the $20 p/night fee. included numerous activities, pool with water slides, newspaper, self parking and much more. You could certainly spend your entire holiday here without ever leaving. Great, reasonable food around pool area (thanks Vonda!) I think that the test of a great hotel is the way that they deal with customer problems.. This hotel excelled in this respect. We has a small "glitch" which involved us being asked to move room after one night despite my pre-stay e-mail and discussion at check-in. Anyway, mistakes can happen and we were so impressed with Mike at Guest Relations who kindly offered us breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience it caused us. It was not expected but much appreciated. Thanks Mike. In summary, this has to be the best hotel in Orlando and I look forward to visiting soon again. Just a small gripe - wish they offered free wi-fi in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort. Regency Club not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler16Ny
Reviews.Content: We just completed a Christmas trip at The Hyatt. We had 2 Regency Club rooms that were very nice. The staff and the grounds were terrific. Our only complaint was the overcrowded Regency Club. As regulars of Hyatt we have stayed at many Regency Clubs. This was the first one we have been to that didn't have a dedicated floor. Our room was located right next to the club and the traffic in and out was unreal. We found out after the fact that the club was open to most of the guests with Diamond Club status and they didn't need to stay on that floor. The noise from the traffic passing our room made it impossible to sleep past 6:30 AM. I would definitely reccomend this resort. I just wouldn't reccomend the additional expense of the Regency Club here. It was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT FUN!!!”
Reviews.Author: momtoo2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Cypress from Dec 30 - Jan 2, 2010 for a soccer tournament. What a great time we had. I didn't encounter any of the negative things that are in some of the past reviews. We pulled up to the gate, told them our name and was directed right through. When we pulled up they have bell hops that are there to help you with your stuff. (you will definitely need one because the self parking is a bit far for dragging luggage). We went in to check in and we didn't encounter any lines, there were lots of staff to accommodate the check in line. We were offered champagne (yes I had a glass) and I even got my room switched from a king to a double/double. Which I didn't think would happen given the time of year and since my travel was booked through the soccer tournament and we had very good discounted rates. We are a U-15 girls soccer team and the girls really enjoyed themselves. They really liked the New Year's Eve party that was at the hotel. No need to go anywhere else. I loved the beds, we had a very good nights sleep. We really took advantage of the grounds amenities. Different people in our group did just about everything that they had to offer and I didn't hear any complaining from anyone. I only ate at the hotel once and it was at the White Horse. Very Good and Good Service. I liked that they gave you a card that you could fill out to get your housekeeping done either in the morning or afternoon. I choose morning since we were gone for soccer games and when we returned in the early afternoon our room was clean. I could say more, but just want to say I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible first experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: willp1985
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Orlando several times a year and plan an extended stay from 7-10 days at a Disney Deluxe resort. This year we decided to try something different. My husband always researches every resort on Trip Advisor first and writes to other reviewers to get the best information. We took a day trip with our kids to Orlando for New Year’s Eve and wanted to check out the Hyatt Grand Cypress property. As we approached the front gate we had a horrible experience with customer service with the security guard Joe. We let him know we were thinking on spending our Anniversary here this year and were looking forward to seeing the property. Before we could even finish the sentence he cut us off and said “No one has time for that today” and started to walk away. I explained again that this was for our potential extended stay, he again cut me off and just picked up the phone in his booth. The whole time he was really arrogant, like we were bothering him and shame on us for even expecting that we were going to get into this property- which by the way we check out each and every property before staying each year and have NEVER been treated like this, never been told we can’t come on property either. Found that really odd. By this time his attitude had made up my mind for me. I told my husband to forget it that I do not want to pay for service like this. He told Joe never mind that I had made up my mind and the exact words that came out of his mouth were “ That’s okay, I’m sure they can live with that.” WOW! Did he just say that? Basically, you can’t come in, I’m not sorry about that, and you aren’t worth my time or the hotels’. He could have easily explained the policies and apologized for any inconvenience due to the busy holiday. Hyatt- you really need to screen your employees better. Maybe Joe is right maybe you don’t care if one family doesn’t book a vacation with you, but you have now bought yourselves one person that will spread the news on how “great” your customer service is before even getting inside the hotel. Oh yes, and to make it even better. When I called the hotel to inform them of their employee’s behavior, I had the pleasure of being on hold ten minutes the first call, then transferred 6 times and never got speak to any managers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around until check out, Be aware the overcharged!”
Reviews.Author: Lun100
Reviews.Content: Very careful with your record if you booked with their promotion offer. I booked the room back on Oct 2010 and the promotion was stay 4 days the last day is free, When check out , the last day supposed to be free but was charged and I talked to the front desk and the staff told me that is not what they have on the record and I have to pay for the last day ! And that individual staff I deal with is not quite professional and helpful, also give me a feeling that she thought I was a cheater. I come to Orland for 2 weeks vacation on Christmas for the past 4 years and stay a lot of 5 stars hotel, nothing even close that give me a bad tastes as this incident. However, back home, call the hotel toll number and the accounting department adjusted after all. Poor record management if it happens to me may happen to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnie1133
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt mid-December during our honeymoon. We got a good rate online and breakfast included as AAA members. We both got the flu on our honeymoon, so we spent more time at the hotel than at the parks. The staff at the Hyatt provided excellent customer service. We were greeted by the doorman immediately and helped promptly by the bellman. Both could tell we were very sick and asked about us. Later that day, they sent us up some wine with a congratulations/get well card. Our room was great, very clean, comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, and quiet. We ordered soup and grilled cheese from room service. The room service attendant delivered it to us in bed and then called a short while later to ask if he could bring us something to make us feel better. He brought us an assortment of cookies and cakes with 'get well soon' written in chocolate on the plate. Really? What did we do to deserve this (besides getting the flu on our honeymoon)? We were pleasantly greeted whenever we went to the lobby. Consierge was helpful with directions. My husband ate breakfast each morning while I was in bed and was very happy with the buffet at Cascades. We got room service several times and each time it was delivered within 30 minutes and nicely prepared. We upgraded to a suite for a reasonable rate so we could have 2 rooms (too much sneezing, coughing, and snoring to sleep in the same room). We went up to the 10th floor, corner room, private balcony on one side and facing the pool on the other. We could see both Epcot and MK fireworks from our room. The grounds were lovely, we walked around the pool and trail area. The resort was decorated nicely for Christmas My husband played some games in the game room. We found the drives to downtown Disney and the parks very easy. Lots of restaurants, fast food, and stores nearby. Also an immediate care and minute clinic very close, which we needed to go to when we were so sick. The only downsides (and they are very tolerable) are the self-parking is far away (but a walkway is provided), there was construction in a bunch of spots (but it's the off season so expected, and didn't prevent us from doing anything at the hotel), and the wired internet is a little slow (WiFi costs $10 a day). We can't wait to go back when we are healthy to really enjoy everything this resort has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Delighted053
Reviews.Content: If I could give the Hyatt 10 stars I would. We stayed 6 nights early Dec. and can not say enough for how well they treated us and how special they made our 35th Anniversary Vacation. I got severe stomach flu, spent day in ER getting fluids. When we returned they sent up toast and gingerale on 2 occasions at no cost to us. The 3 waiters in Cascades (Abe, Gary, Hoss- special guys!) went out of their way to help when they knew I had been sick and had special foods made up for me 2 mornings. The breakfast buffet was amazing! The room was beautiful,immaculate ,and so comfortable. Best shower ever. Had a corner room with awesome views of the fireworks and a lg. balcony. Can not praise this hotel enough. Will definately return. Ignore any complaints- they are not warranted.

Reviews.Title: “We are picky and we enjoyed our stay :)”
Reviews.Author: JetSetOC
Reviews.Content: Overall, we are very happy with our stay for the amount we paid. I found a great winter rate that couldn't be beat. For the price this was really the best find for what we were looking for: hugely discounted rate, clean, shuttle to both parks, and 4 star. Our rate included a discounted base rate, every third night free, and free breakfast which was a huge plus. Not only did it save us money, but also spared us from the low quality food at the parks. Pros: Very clean! Maybe it was due to the recent renovation? I'm very picky about cleanliness and overall I thought the hotel really made this a priority. The maids also did a wonderful job, were very professional, and went out of their way to say hello and ask us if we needed anything every time they saw us. One of the biggest reasons we chose this hotel besides price was that we didn't have to change hotels to go to Universal. This was the only hotel we could find that had a shuttle to both Disney parks and Universal. We didn't want to change hotels or rent a car. 1/2 acre pool. We never got to use it because it was too cold, but it's impressive and there's lots of great comfy looking lounge chairs. They didn't tell us when we booked that 1/2 of the pool was closed for renovation. We could have been annoyed if the weather was warm. The White Horse Restaurant blew us away. The first night we ate there because we had no choice. The next three nights we ate there because we wanted to. The chef(s) are simply amazing. I'm hard to please and I was impressed. They pay attention to every detail and everything is cooked to perfection. Even the salad dressings were spectaular. The ranch has real buttermilk and the italian had bits of soft cheese. The meats and veggies were cooked perfectly. We had the best meals there. I would highly recommend it! Bravo and thank you to three of the most wonderful staff I have ever encountered at a hotel! Please excuse me if I spell your name incorrectly. The staff around Orlando come from all over the world so I've included their country. Attmane (from Morocco) at Cascades restaurant really made our stay a 5 star experience! He is so welcoming, professional, attentive, and a big smile every morning at breakfast. Excellent, superb service! Erwin (from Haiti) at the White Horse restaurant. He went out of his way to make us feel extra welcome and special. He was so excited to welcome us back every night for dinner and wanted to make sure that our bread was super fresh.....straight from the oven. He is a great asset to the hotel. Ricky (from Cuba) is the most professional waiter I have ever seen. He is 100% focused on making your dining experience perfect, but warm and welcoming at the same time. All of you made our experience at the hotel 5 star to say the least. Thank you!!!! Cons: Lots of construction still going on which were not notified about when we booked. There was lots of noise and changes to the shuttle bus pick up and drop off locations. The worst part was when we didn't have water or electricity for a couple hours two days in a row. On the first day we weren't notified about now having water and that almost created a big problem for us. The shuttle times to and from the parks are very limited (not like the disney buses which are constantly going). We tried to get the times before we booked the hotel, but they made excuses and wouldn't release that information. When we got there we found out why. You are bascially stuck at the parks from morning til night if you take their shuttles. Otherwise, you have to pay extra for a cab. It would be nice if they offered additional times. The bathroom door is a sliding door that also doubles as the closet door. It was very difficult to keep it from rolling back open.....all the way open! It would be nice if they added some kind of latch to it so you can have privacy. One thing that really irked me upon arrival was that it was only around 6:30 pm and there wasn't anyone out front to greet us or offer to help with our bags. We arrived in a stretch limo and no one offered us any service. There was lots of other cars with people unloading in front of us and they didn't recieve any service either. That was very dissapointing for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this is the place”
Reviews.Author: mda1701
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in the orlando area and its a close race as to who would finish first but given a choice I would pick this hotel from the staff to the pool and some off the best restarants ! This hotel is truly a destination in itself from rockwall climbing to horseback riding

Reviews.Title: “Lots to do in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: mondrianna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights in November. Everything ran smoothly at the hotel and all the employees are really friendly. I had requested a corner suite on a higher floor and they gave us a room on the 7th floor with a view of the lake. We could still see the fireworks at Disney everynight which was great, but not the epcot fireworks, but one show was enough for us. The corner suites have 2 seperate balconies and it seems that they are a little more private than some of the other rooms. The room itself was big enough for the 2 of us, not a lot of storage space though just two small drawers and the closet. The bed is really comfortable and you can swivel the TV towards the bed or the comfy chair they have in the room. They also have different ports for usb, hdmi and other cables built into the entertainment unit which is great if you're bringing any of your own equipment. We got wifi included in our rate, but it was a little annoying as you had to log in everytime you wanted to use it, but the connection was pretty fast. They have a safe in the room, the battery was dying in ours but the maintenence guy came right away and fixed it for us. The sliding door for the bathroom is a little annoying, but you get used to it. The bathroom was nice and I loved the rainhead shower. There is a lot to do on the property and it's all included in the resort fee. We used the kyaks and the water bike and the lake is really pretty with all sorts of birds and I saw some fish and a turtle too! They have a rock climbing wall, but it's really only for kids as it's not very high and looks pretty easy. The pools are great, but in November the big pool really is too cold which is a shame because it's a much better pool than the smaller one. I went in the bigger pool a couple times because they have the big waterslide going into the big pool, but I couldn't stay in for more that 5 minutes even doing laps because it was sooo chilly. When we were there the small pool was 88F and the big pool was 68F. In the summer I'm sure the bigger pool is a much more tolerable temperature. The hot tubs are also nice, but we would only go in if there was nobody else in them as they are all pretty small. I loved the fact that the pools were open 24 hours. We also had breakfast included in the rate and it was definitely worth it. You could have buffet or a la carte, but pretty much everything on the menu is available in the buffet so we just had that everytime. It was busy everytime we went down, but never had to wait long for a table and the food is always being refilled and was really tasty. Coffee at the restaurant was not good, but they have lots of different teas and juices. They do have shuttles to and from Disney and Universal, but they only run a few times in the morning and a few times at night so we didn't take them at all. We drove to downtown disney and parked for free and then took the shuttle to the disney resort and then from there took the bus to the park. It took a long time and next time I think we'll just pay for the Disney parking. In conclusion, this hotel is beautiful, really clean and bright and lots of great employees. I would highly recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Jennashay
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress is fantastic! We were here 5 years ago and were pleased to see that it only got better with the recent renovation. Fantastic customer service from every department. The grounds/pools are beautiful...great to have a pool available 24/7! Lots to do from canoes & paddleboats to biking & rock climbing. There's even a ping pong table by the pool and a fire pit to roast marshmallows by at night! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to visit again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “As fabulous as ever”
Reviews.Author: touchwoodjudith
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of my favorite hotels in the world. Customer service is their byword. The front dest staff makes everyone feel special. The recent refurb is good, rooms are decorated with colours that are very relaxing. One small critisism is regarding room service, turning the bed down at night means just that not rearanging the cushions on the bed!!!! The most amazing part of this hotel is it`s outside areas they are truly spectacular, you feel like you are in a tropical paradise with several pools and beautiful waterfalls. Thank you Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for once again making our holiday a resounding success.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Amazing Pool, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: redmud
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, and I would definitely stay there again if back in the Orlando area. The customer service at this hotel was absolutely top notch, American's have some of the best customer service and this was certainly evident at this hotel. Everyone, from the bell boy to the cleaning staff to the wait staff by the pool, was extremely friendly, always smiling, and always went out of their way to ask you how you were. It always took me by surprise. The pool area is also fantastic, and reason enough to stay here if you go. The complex is huge, 3 pools, all connected by a Grotto which is very cool to swim through. There are always ample loungechairs to choose from, and tons of activities around the area, from rock climbing, canoeing, and the pitch and putt (all included with the resort fee). The rooms were also great, standard size, comfortable beds, well cleaned, etc. Also a stone's throw from tons of restaurants, Universal, and Disney. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Jemabel474
Reviews.Content: This is my first time reviewing any hotel. My husband and I are avid travelers and we've stayed at many hotels all over the world. Mind you, we are not wealthy, but I've learned that you don't have to be to stay at a place like the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. Everything was great from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. Breakfast at Cascades was delicious. Our reservation gave us the option of complimentary breakfast at Cascades with the option of buffet or menu items. I ordered from both on our 4 night stay, and enjoyed the food from both. The hotel itself is phenomenal. There is so much stuff to do, so many activities that makes the resort fee worth it. All you have to do is actually take part in the activities or amenities the hotel offers and then it won't bother you to have to pay the fee. The pools were a little cold, but still divine and service at the restaurant as well as front desk was exceptional. Everyone says hello and treats you like a million bucks, even if you don't have a million bucks. The only problem we had was with the express check out. I tried checking out using the tv and it didn't work. Then I tried the phone service and it didn't work, then I tried the kiosk by the front desk and it directed me to the front desk, so we just checked out the old fashioned way. No worries though. All in all, my husband and I had a great time and have already recommended this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Class Resort, Friendly Staff, Excellent Facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Doctortraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our teenage kids over the Thanksgiving weekend at the resort. The Hyatt has something for everyone, lots of activities, heated pool, waterfalls, kayaking, boating, golfing, nice restaurants. The friendly staff took the extra step to make our stay comfortable, and we found the facilities well-maintained and attended to. A great place to have re-unions, or just send the kids to the park, while the adults can relax at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gbradley626
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress from 11/19-23 with husband and 12 year old daughter. Could not have asked for a better experience. Wonderful staff, beautiful view, excellent food. Will DEFINITELY be returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: skyblue617
Reviews.Content: Hyatt did a nice job with this resort. The grounds are well maintained and views from the rooms are spectacular. I lived in Orlando for a time and heard the golf is good too. On this visit, I only stayed for a few nights for business event on Disney Property. Got a great rate online at the last minute. I'd highly recommend it for people staying on business or those who want a less "themed" environment on their Orlando trip. I also favor the Marriott Orlando World Center, which is located not far from here.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking in every way; grounds, staff, food; it has it all.”
Reviews.Author: timjohnedgar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of hotels and resorts for both business and pleasure, and in the Orlando area, this resort was surprising in every way. The grounds around the hotel and pool are stunning with both plantings interesting artwork and statuary. The staff was consistently cheerful, always greeted us in passing, and always helpful. We won't stay anywhere else when we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: beach_h20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just had a great weekend in Orlando at the Grand Cypress. The hotel was very clean and modern and very comfortable!! We both had GREAT massages at the spa and their pool area is one of the best I've ever seen! I can confirm with some of the other reviews that the pool was not heated. A few suggestions I'd have are, be patient at the front desk...they were a bit slow. Also, if you are dining here, bring your wallet, it's fairly expensive! Besides an overly expensive buffet breakfast, we utilized the hotel shuttles and some of the nearby local restauants.

Reviews.Title: “Still Top Quality”
Reviews.Author: Scootec
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay (after last year's) and was just as good as the first stay. After the shoddiness of our Virgin flight, the professionalism and friendliness of the staff was such a relief and is still second to none. The facilities are still first class and the place is kept in such good condition we won't ever try another hotel whilst visiting Orlando. Just one point though - I love the casual nature of the pitch and putt course where you can just grab some clubs and stroll on at your leisure, but I think that some kind of supervision (even if by security camera) may be prudent. I had the misfortune of being on the course at the same time as a South American family who had no concept of safety or etiquette whatsoever. They were firing golf balls in all sorts of random directions, ripping the turf to shreds with multiple swings at the ball and even lying on greens and playing with their phones whilst people behind were waiting to play. At one point I happened to look up after having heard what sounded like too poweful a swing to see a golf ball flying at me, that I actually caught (before it hit me). The man who had hit the ball didn't even acknowledge that he'd done anything wrong and just carried on playing as if nothing had happened. He was lucky I didn't shove my pitching wedge down his throat.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Resort with pool and water bikes”
Reviews.Author: lucianaac
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel. You have to pay a resort fee but it is worth since you can enjoy the pool and the pedal boats by the lake. They remodeled the bedrooms and they are beautiful and confortable. The lobby is not as nice but the rest of the hotel is nice. I will recommend this hotel for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: holidaymadScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights as all disney hotels were fully booked during the weekend we wanted to visit Epcot food and wine festival. We had never stayed here before but from the moment we checked in (free glass of champagne) we felt so relaxed and it was the perfect start to our vacation. I cant remember the name of the girl at check in, she was a trainee and her service was excellent and my partner and I rarely say this. Everyone in the hotel was frienfly, the housekeeping staff raised there heads to say hello each time you passed. We ended up disappointed that we did not spend longer in the hotel, the pool and lake looked perfect. What I didnt get was if the resort fee is compulsory then why not just add t to your room rate? $20 per room sound like good value but you did already pay for your room in the hotel why cant you use the facilities in the hotel? We ate in the White Horse, food was excellent and even on a Fri night at 7pm only a 10 min wait for a table. Also ate in Hemingways and that was some of the best seafood I have ever eaten! We had a club room so had breakfast and some soft drinks upstairs. Unless you plan to spend a lot of time in the hotel then I wouldnt pay for a club room again but the view from the balcony was great. The only thing I didnt really like was the spa. It was windowless and cramped, I've been to better. Free parking was also a total bonus

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: dildanjon1
Reviews.Content: This is an oasis among the chaos of Disney... this property is right of I4, minutes from everything. The $20 resort fee includes the Kayaks, gym and all the activities around the hotel (which was plenty). The pools were fantastic and catered to everyone..adults quiet area, heated pool with small slide and another pool with larger slide. The rooms were great size, renovated and great bathroom amenities. Poolview was fantastic, at night you can see the fireworks from Epcot and Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting house keeping services”
Reviews.Author: haarinder
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights. The room was not cleaned on the second stay of stay. On the third day I had to call the duty manager to get the room cleaned. I never such a bad experience in my life. It is such a beautiful property but the staff has a very callous attitude.

Reviews.Title: “A magical stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: cstiner
Reviews.Content: I can't believe anyone could rate this hotel anything less than five stars! I had never stayed here before, but have stayed in Orlando many times. During our stay at the Hyatt, my young daughter and I were treated like queens.
