Every hotel employee we encountered could not have been nicer or gone out of their way to accomodate any request we had. It truly was a delightful and relaxing stay and I will certainly book here again. I got a great value for the price we paid in my opinion. If you are considering it, certainly give this hotel a try. It has the best pool area in Orlando. I will agree it was a little cold (even the heated pool) ....but once you get in it is fine. The slides are on par with any water part slide as well. On top of that, there is ping pong, bike paths and bikes to loan, paddle boats, rock climing wall, hair braiding, and on and on. You truly would never need to leave the hotel. Thanks Hyatt for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Grand... Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: acaruso25
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hyatt based on all the great reviews I read on Tripadivsor but, boy did I strike out with them! We arrived in Orlando at 11am and made it to the resort around 12p (using Mears shuttle-recommended!) and was told no rooms were available. I had requested an early check in and was assured a room would be available shortly. We left our bags and went to Cascades for lunch-fantastic crab cake sandwich and Angus cheeseburger. And kudos to Gary, our waiter, who was awesome! After we walked around the beautiful grounds for a bit and returned to the desk around 1:30p-still no room. We sat outside pratically falling asleep as we had been up at 4am to catch our flight. 2pm came and went, 3pm came and went. Conveniently at 4pm, the front desk called to let me know the room was ready. I am well aware that an early check in is a "request" but you mean to tell me not one room was cleaned in 4 hours?? Finally hecking in and they tried to put me in a lake view room when I had paid for a pool view. At this point I am furious, the man (who's name I forgot) checked again and conveniently a pool view room was available. Why play games? They tried to compensate for the wait by offering us a free breakfast which would have been a nice gesture had I not already had breakfast included in my package. "Oh well," was the response I got. Really? Coming back from Disney the next night we noticed the housekeeper only left us 2 towels. The third night she didn't restock the coffee/sugar/cream and I had to call and wait a half hour for it to be brought up. If I'm paying $300 a night, I shouldn't have to call for towels coffe and cream. Nor have I ever needed to on past vacations. Ridiculous. We had dinner at the White Horse(?), sushi-excellent, filet mignon-ok, mashed potatoes-I've had better from a box, creamed spinach-awful. Overall, the grounds were beautiful, convenient location, lots to do. Shuttle was convenient, even thought it only came 3 times in the AM and 3 times in the PM, it worked for us. But overall, I'm not sure I'd stay here again. Customer service is definitley lacking, and I expected so much more from a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek room decor”
Reviews.Author: LisaMPC
Reviews.Content: They gave us a glass of champagne upon check-in. Great marketing and great way to start our trip. We're here for a convention, so not sure if that would be true for every check-in. Rooms are spacious and aesthetically pleasing which means a lot to me as I'm spending a lot of time in it working. Had a problem getting online which was handled right away; turned out to be a setting on my laptop. I believe the rooms are hard-wired and that is free. Housekeeping so far is great. Had fabulous room service and ate breakfast in the Cascade restaurant this morning. The restaurant staff was sooo nice. Had dinner in Hemingway's last night, had a longer wait than they thought so they gave us a round of drinks on the house. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: samantha788
Reviews.Content: I write this review on behalf of my parents who have just returned from a fantastic two weeks holiday in this marvelous hotel. From the minute they arrived to the minute they left they were treated to a 5 star service throughout. The hotel is beautiful with enough facilities for you to never to have to leave the resort. Restraunts were excellant especially the breakfast in Cascades and the mouthwatering steak served in Hemmingways. All staff were, friendly, helpful and courteous and nothing was to much trouble for anyone. My parents have stayed in various 4 and 5 star hotels in Orlando every year for the past 20yrs and found this hotel, staff, food and facilities second to none. They would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone young or old and to families alike, and look forward to a return visit in 2011 along with my husband and I and two boys. Thank you Hyatt !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for young children.”
Reviews.Author: JanetBasas
Reviews.Content: On check in I was told there were no king beds available. I had booked a lake view king room. She told me she had a nice city view double room. I told her I wanted a lake view room. So she put me in a lake view king. Not sure why she was playing games with me. The hotel pool has a minimum depth of 3'6". Too deep for my 5 yr old. They had no kids pool or kids water area. Very strange for a hotel in Orlando. In addition, the one heated pool was pretty cold. So I'm not sure what the $22.50 resort fee got us. We slept in our room and swam at my sister's hotel. Also, between the nightly fee (not cheap) and the resort fee, you still do not get free wifi. It was another $9.99 a night during my stay. Absurd if you ask me. I did not pay it. Noise is a big problem in the room. We could hear all coversations in the corridor outside of our door. Most of the early morning conversations I heard were between hotel employees. The doors closing near our room were very loud. In addition, the hotel phone in our room rang 2 mornings in a row before 8 am. I finally disconnected them. I did not expect to see mold in the shower of a 4 star hotel. But it was there. That was my only complaint about cleanliness. On the plus side, my son loved the 2 birds in the lobby and still talks about them now. I also thought the bed was comfortable. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel for families with younger kids. Also, the noise was a big irritation in the mornings. There are a lot more hotels to choose from in this price category.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Did not want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: jeniliz1
Reviews.Content: We were semi-nervous about staying outside of Disney, but I have stayed there before and couldn't justify the cost...found this hotel and got a great deal! After reading all the reviews I can understand about the bathroom/closet door. While it's a tad dangerous, my son made a game out of it....like in a restaurant, he yelled "GOING IN" and "COMING OUT" everytime anyone went in or out. I can also understand about the shower...the door does little to keep shower water off the floor....but nothing a towel can't fix. I didn't mid at all that the mini-bar was gone but was slightly annoyed when we found it was not a refridegerator (as many descriptions, including the hotel, stated) but a "cool box"....it said that it was no intended for milk. However, it was big enough for 3 half-gallons, or one and two 2-liters of soda! We just filled a ziplock bag with ice and put it on top. Worked like a charm! We knew about the resort fee and didn't care. Just to have the secure parking was enough. The parking was far away from the main entrance, but you could either go through the ballrooms up through the pool area and go into the back of the lobby, so it wasn't a big deal to us. The room was very clean and we felt very safe. We had a fantastic view of Epcot and Magic Kingdom and saw fireworks every night (if we were back in our rooms!). This hotel rocked and I would definitely stay there again. The only two things I can say was that for our family, after 6pm there was no real casual food. We aren't kobe beef and lobster people and would have loved to have some place for sandwiches or the like. However, we did order room service one night and while the selection wasn't too casual, the prices were reasonable (for Disney/Orlando) and the food was perfect! The one downer of the whole trip was the morning we were to check out we got a knock at the door at 8:30am. It was the cleaning person wanting to know what time we were checking out. We had the privacy key in the door and we had till noon...I know they have a job to do, but really, what if we were sleeping? The woman didn't take too kindly to my answer of "some time before noon" and left it at that....I have till noon....wait till we pull the privacy key or the front desk tells you we checked out. What really bothered me is that we checked out less than a half hour later...if she had just waited! Nothing too tragic, but kinda bugged us right at the end. Overall, this place was great...well worth the money to have some place same and clean to come back to at the end of VERY long days at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “A world away!”
Reviews.Author: 2Hills
Reviews.Content: More than we expected even after reading all the great reviews onTripadvisor. The staff was very professional, nice and helpful. Clean, beautiful, and comfortable room. We loved the shower. There was so much to do on the property that we never felt the need to leave unless we wanted to. It feels a world away yet its so convenient to the Disney theme parks. We rented a car and the self parking was easy and close. Try bike riding along the trails and play the 9 hole pitch and putt! The pools are big and offer something for everyone...including a "designated quiet area" for a little peace and quiet. Spa: highly recommend a relaxing massage with Rick. Plenty of options for eating at the resort, but it can get expensive. Must have a nice dinner at Hemingways. The food and service was possibly the best we've ever had. Other eating options within walking distance: Millers Ale House is across from the entrance to the resort and had great wings, food, and drink specials. Subway and Qdoba are also close enough to walk to. Husband played golf and found all the courses to be beautiful and challenging to play. Don't miss playing the East course. The only thing we found to be awkward was the layout of the rooms. Pool view rooms offer an amazing view of the pool, grounds, and fireworks every night at Epcot and Magic Kingdom. However, they don't offer much privacy as you can see into other guestrooms due to the angle of the layout. We just made sure we pulled our curtains closed when we needed privacy. This would not deter us from returning to this hotel. In fact, we are already looking forward to our next trip. Overall wonderful stay and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I have been to at least 10 different...”
Reviews.Author: m5dream
Reviews.Content: I have been to at least 10 different hotels in orlando area. Cypress is a great value for the area. $20 resort fee covers a lot of activities that other hotels will charge extra despite their resort fees. As others have mentioned, many activities are available. Paddle boats, pools, tennis, game room, beach, rock climbing, bike rides, etc. The one secret: 9 HOLE GOLF PITCH AND PUTT! Bring your wedge and putter or use the resort's. This is also included in the daily $20 fee! Well worth the fee! Also, don't valet park. Self parking is very close.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KaleeRae85
Reviews.Content: Book this through travelocity at an amazing rate. We stayed four nights on our honeymoon at this amazing property. We picked the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress because of the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor. Pros: -Quick/Speedy Check-in -Hotel Smell (it smelled clean, but not like a bleachy clean) -Bed was comfortable -Staff (I can't say enough about their hospitality. We had champagne and chocolate covered strawberries brought up to the room. They greeted you by name whenever you called for anything and delivered your request promptly. They checked us in at the airport while we were checking out to print our boarding pass. The took care of loading/unloading our luggage.) -Modern room. Very simple with unique features. -We had a room on the 15th floor overlooking the lake with a view of Magic Kingdom and Epcot fireworks every night. -Property. What more could you ask for? Walking trails, swimming pools, lake activities, hot tubs, and landscaping. There was atleast 4 conferences going on while we were there and the only time we ever knew it was by the elevators. -Gated property. You have to check in with the attendant to come on the property. -Mears travel in the lobby. It was very convient to by our Disney Tickets. Cons: -Heated pool was still too cold. -No free wifi, only wired with resort fee. -Small Balcony. -Lost hot water for an afternoon. I did not use the lake activities, fitness room, shuttle service, or restaurants. Overall, I would definitely recommend to a friend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort, limited Downtown Disney access”
Reviews.Author: Flvol77
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, excellent service, nice rooms with comfortable beds (that is saying something coming from someone that sleeps on a tempurpedic) The staff went out of their way to help you, and make you feel comfortable. The hotel was a little noisy the weekend we were there because of all of the weddings, A lot of people wanted to get married on 10.10.10 weekend so there was some noise. The Pool area is amazing, it was as impressive as anything you would find at Disney resorts. The food was excellent at the pool, we missed out on the "sushi guy" because of the long wait, but I heard people coming out of sushi bar saying it was outstanding. My only compliant, access to Disney and Downtown Disney is horrible. Yes we drove so it wasn't a huge deal, but if you are going to be hit with such a large resort fee, they should 1) run a bus every 30 mins to Disney and Epcot, from there you can work your way to the other parks, or they could 2) Build a short cut over to Downtown Disney, that way if they didn't want to run a bus people could walk to Downtown Disney, take a bus to a resort then from a Disney resort go to one of the parks. Everyone on the staff that I spoke to about it was embarrassed by their lack of access to Disney. If you want to go to Disney and you aren't going to have a car I would recommend you not staying at the Hyatt. If you have a car you can work around the system and park at Downtown Disney around Planet Hollywood, and take a bus to one of the Hotels on the monorail system and from there you should be good to go, not trying to be cheap but if you are paying the resort fee who wants to pay another $14 per day to park at the parks, all of it starts to add up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing anniversary”
Reviews.Author: lstrempel
Reviews.Content: Sincere thanks to Mike at the front desk and the rest of the talented team who made our anniversary so special. The bubbly on arrival was a lovely touch and much appreciated as well. The property is lovely and impeccably maintained. Our requested room was not available but a substitute was offered, along with breakfast vouchers, which totally satisfied our needs. Thanks to everyone, and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: CAJG
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a lovely pool and many amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Does not fit european five star standards”
Reviews.Author: txlra
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff. Wonderful park around the hotel, esp. in front of the hotel around the drive-up with little ponds and waterfalls. Something about 800 rooms is very difficult to control. Housekeeping is very poor. The bathroom floor is not wiped for two days now. Water from the tap is very thin. It takes 12 seconds to fill a coffee-cup. Maintenance told me after my complaints that it is due to the water conserve program in Florida. Very good that that the program is not used in the restrooms in the lobby ;-) Excellent dining. Breakfast is for europeans strange. Everything low fat but even the yoghurt is sweetened. Typical for the US - but in a five star resort?

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TONJON0908
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently been renovated. The rooms are comfortable and clean (double bed rooms have a tub, king bed rooms have spacious, modern showers). Adequate storage space with iron, ironing board, safe, small refrigerator, internet, standing room only balcony w/ views of Disney fireworks. Access to Disney provided by hotel buses, but do not run very often. However, taxis to Downtown Disney are under $10. Hotel staff are extremely accommodating. Recommend paying for access to the Regency Club-good food and satisfying variety. Free champagne available at the front desk from noon to 11:00PM. Chef's Table at La Coquina restaurant, although pricy, is a wonderful experience. They also have a Sunday brunch, but we couldn't attend. Beautiful pools and fitness center, boating on the lake included, bicycles, ping-pong, miniature gold, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel I ever have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Vilix
Reviews.Content: I decided to visit Florida for the first time of my life, second time in USA. So I started to check Tripadvisors reviews. After a couple of days I found this hotel and as I have a huuuuge fright of spiders and other bugs I wanted to stay in good hotel. And OMG I was not wrong by choosing Grand Cypress!! This hotel is the best hotel ever I have stayed in!! A huge, beautiful lobby and friendly personel to meet you! We were offered champagne as we arrived. And the room... EXCELLENT, very clean! Thank you Rosemene! Next morning I woke up early due to the jetlag and opened the balcony doors and was amazed by the beauty of the premices! I fell in love with Florida that moment <3 Our room was facing the Disney Downtown Resort Hotels but was still beautiful. We were on the 12th floor so there was no noise from anywhere. And the pool, AMAZING!! I must admit I was a little sceptical could these reviews be true here on Tripadvisor but after staying there my scepticism has vanished. This hotel is just as great as everybody here tells so!! And thank you Steven for your help the day we were leaving! It was nice to talk with you and I hope we have the chance to come back one day! And then just a little wish... As everything was so well organized my only hope was that there would have been a few more complimentary rides to the theme parks during the day. Now they left quite early and the return was late. It would have been nice to take the early ride to the theme park and then return to the hotel in the early afternoon and then get back to theme park for another run. And one tip, you can walk to Disney Downtown area. It is about 2 mile (3,2 km) walk but if you are in good shape, you will walk it easily. There is walkway the whole way thru. Thank you everybody in Hyatt Grand Cypress, I hope to be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiliciouslyunreallyawesome Hotel/Resort - WE LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: PritiGirlNJ
Reviews.Content: It was a tough for me to pick a hotel for a short 2 day "NO THEME PARKS" stay with my parents who were visiting me .....I took a chance and went ahead and booked the hotel directly through their site and I was surprised that they price matched infact gave me a considerate discount overall. Once we arrived at the hotel, I was left agasp to see its grandeur/decor/service/rooms you name it. Welcomed with a champagne drink. Got a pool view room fro a price of a standard room.....Room service was awesome. Plenty of activities within the resort like the boat / kayak/health club/ jacuzzi/ mountain climbing/fire pit for marshmellows/biking......."ALL FREE" - HIGHLIGHT ......The Chef was kind enough to make us a surprisingly an off menu breakfast for us vegeterians besides the regualr continental buffet...We got an extended check at 2.30 p.m. out since our flights were delayed and they even told us to continue using the property till we wanted :-) Location from MCO airport is less than 5-6 miles :-) Overall, my parents and I had a very relaxing and wonderful experience. :-) I am so going back there the next time I visit Orlando :-) HYATT ROCKS :-)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelchics
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks in september 10. Check in was very smooth and the room which had been recently renovated suited our needs perfectly. A large sumptious bed, a sofa and large screen tv with a wide range of english speaking channels. The bathroom only had a shower which suited us as we didnt want to waste time soaking in a bath. Clean towels, and wash cloths were left every day and the room was tidied daily. The staff were perfectly polite and very eager to meet your needs. The hotel lobby was very impressive and above all very clean, the lobby bar served excellent cosmopolitans and really any other tipple you might desire. The pool area was also very pleasing with a heated pool and a unheated pool which given the temperture was a welcome relief. The pool area also had a quiet area and no smoking was allowed at the pool side or near the pool decking, being a non smoker i really appreciated this. There is also a lovely lake around the hotel where you can sail or paddle boat around the hotel. The restaurants in the hotel were also very good, the White Horse Sports bar served the best sword fish i have ever tasted and my husband was equally impressed with the steaks. We also went to Hemmingways which is the hotels fish restaurant, the food here was excellent and does serve steak if you dont like fish. Our package also included breakfast in cascades which was great because if we had been paying for this it would have cost $60-$70 daily. There is a wide range of choices for breakfast, after 14 days my husband and I had practically ate all options, and I would recommend everything on the menu. The staff were very nice and our regular waiter Abe was outstanding in the service and attention he provided to us. There are no bad points to this hotel, it is near disney, self parking is free but there is a daily resort fee of $16 which you have to pay even if you do not use the facilities,

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Nails54
Reviews.Content: Staying here for the first time we were very impressed. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary 30 yrs. I let the hotel know we were celebrating they had upgraded our room on arrival. Which was realy nice. You could see Epcot from our room and we were able to watched the fire works after 9:15. The room was very comfortable. The shower was outstanding. Dining in the restaurants is reasonable for the class of the hotel. I took a photo early Sunday morning of the pool. Yes we would stay here again for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! We found a new jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Kimbert27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking to spend a few nights in Orlando after staying in Sarasota with my mom for a few days. We usually stay at the Hard Rock at Universal, but I was looking for something with a little bit of a better price. Upon looking at TripAdvisor, which I always do before going anywhere, I read the reviews for the Hyatt and decided that we should check it out. We got a good rate that included all the activites and shuttle service, so I figured what the heck, it's a Hyatt. When we pulled up to the hotel I was pretty much hanging out the window saying "oh how beautiful!" The grounds are gorgeous! We decided to self-park and forgo the $20/night valet. I've heard the complaints about the proximity of the parking lot to the hotel. There is nothing to complain about there. As we were going up the escalator to the lobby, my husband said "you couldn't find anyrthing cheaper?" (not knowing the rate I got) thinking this would cost him an arm and a leg. I said "just wait, you will love it!" We were greeted by name upon arrival at the front desk and they gave us glasses of chamagne! As the bellman was going to take us to our room, he said he would show us around and tell us a little about the property. That was such a nice extra touch! He told us we would need more than 2 nights and he wasn't kidding. When we got into our gorgeous room, my husband immediately said, "do you want to stay an extra few days?" YES!! Unfortunately, due to his work schedule, he was not able to get a few more days off :( We had some unused Disney passes, so we went to Disney's Hollywood Studios for the afternoon. We came back to the hotel about 8:30 and went swimming and in the hot tubs which are open 24 hours. What a nice way to end the day! We decided to spend our last full day at the resort because there was just too much there that we didn't want to miss. We had a great lunch at the pool with some frosty beverages too! :) Service at the pool was great. We did a lot of walking around the grounds, biking and even got in some kyaking. This property is close to Disney, yet a world away. The grounds are spectacular, the service everywhere was top notch, we fell in love and will be returning as soon as we can! Thank you Hyatt for such a great mini-getaway! Please feel free to contact me iwth any questions. Kim

Reviews.Title: “fantastic rooms with helpful staff. recent renovation”
Reviews.Author: julesjules_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three years ago and went back this year for a 2 week stay. Since we were last here the rooms have been renovated to a high standard and are modern and feel comfortable. staff were always very helpful. large pool with waterfalls and cave. easy to book tennis courts. nice grounds. very conveniently located

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort with modern amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Brandontrip08
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Grand Cypress for a visit to DisneyWorld. We travel quite often and enjoy a nice hotel as part of the trip. The Hyatt was an excellent property from the newly remodeled rooms down to the speedy elevators that promptly got us to the 18th floor. The room was spotless, lobby smelled fresh and was nicely decorated. The rooms were in line with a Four Seasons or newer Westin-type property. Very modern with nice amenities, sliding door, and crisp accent lighting. If you are visiting for Disney, be prepared to take your own car or stay at the park all day. Buses only run in the A.M. and then a couple of runs in the evening. There was no all day service which was a bit of a disappointment since the resort fee includes transportation to the parks. Security is top notch around the property. We tried to visit the day before check-in and were not allowed beyond the security shack upfront . Overall, hotel was very nice and the staff was helpful. Would like to see this hotel in the top ten for the Disney area. Well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort for couples!!”
Reviews.Author: AngelinaSh
Reviews.Content: our stay at the hotel was simply wow.. we loved every part of it.. you can stay there for days and never get bored..the hotel has everything!! great spa, nice staff, two pools, golf course, more than five restaurants...ect.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!”
Reviews.Author: Gratefull2009
Reviews.Content: Great location for adults that is close to Disney yet not overrun with children (sorry kids) - We spent three nights and loved every minute of it! It was 'magical'..... Guard gate announces your arrival so that when you arrive for check-in you are greeted by name. Xavier ( please forgive me if I misspelled your name) is the most pleasant, polite and warm 'greeter' we have had in a while! He was helpful and tactful at all times and in all situations. He showed us around the hotel and pointed out special things we might have otherwise overlooked on the first day. The proximity to Disney was terrific and the lack of "Mickey" stuff was pleasant as there is enough of it to go around everywhere else. We went to a number of parks, used the pool and ate at all the restaurants. PROS:The staff, beautiful hotel renovations, lovely property, gorgeous rooms! Great water slide, excellent poolside service, great pool that was clean, warm and had designated quiet areas. Toto showers with super sweet iridescent glass tiles, spacious bathrooms, well lit vanity and plenty of storage. The White Horse Bar and Grill was our favorite! Sushi, Kobe Burgers, Escargot, Pasta and Salads to enjoy! We ate there several times. They are open late so that was a plus! CONS: You can't be in the safe and open the bathroom door at the same time- found out the hard way...no biggie though! Thank you to the Orlando staff for being so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest place and the nicest folks!”
Reviews.Author: spinny
Reviews.Content: I am going to forget some names here--so I apologize to them in advance.... My two kids (ages 11 and 13) and I stayed three nights at the Hyatt Grand Cypress-- and from the moment we checked in we received service that was second to none. On check-in (and we were early) Jorge at the desk saw was so great --we had a lower floor room and he looked for one with a better fireworks view for us --we were put into a lovely room on the 9th floor overlooking the pool with a great view! Jorge was accompanied by a super nice fellow who was a trainee and a woman whose name escapes me but who was a NY transplant (with a Tennesee accent!) who could not have been sweeter--even if she was a Yankees fan (you know who you are!) At the pool cafe we were waited on by the lovely Vanda who basically found me wherever i was (I was chasing my kids with menus trying to get them out of the pool to order) --what a lovely lady--the pad thai was really good! hanging at the pool another waitress (and i am having a senior moment with names again) but she has long dark hair and a 4 yr old took such great care of us the entire visit as did the barkeeps at the pool bar-. The ladies at the activities area were super and made sure we were well looked after. Dinner that night (after swimming and paddle boating and rock climbing wall) was at the white horse tavern in the hotel--the food was very good and the wait staff really attentive and lovely. that night we made S'mores at the outdoor fire pit--great fun! The beds are super comfortable --the rooms are so quiet--really ! i was sort of shocked-- and we returned each day (exhausted!) to find our room well made up with fresh everything. the fridge in the room allowed us to keep some things in the room which was great. One thing i REALLY appreciated was that I had arranged for my Uncle to join us for an evening in honor of his birthday--I didn't want him to get asked about the bill or anything--and he was not--Jorge made sure to put a note in the file -- I am not sure how it was arranged, but they even managed to put us on the same floor which was great--Dinner at their Hemingway's restaurant was really superb--the seafood was VERY good --equal to any of the really great restaurants here in NY (and nicer since it wasn't in ny--for me at least, since i live and work here!) --our server, Jean arranged a really terrific dessert for my Uncle (and was totally great in explaining the menus and accommodating the kids--) She is a wait persons wait person--truly a pro----and I got a thank you note the next morning from her....Huh? isn't it supposed to be ME thanking HER?? that is the first time that has happened!-- The breakfast buffet at Cascade is really great--the kids loved that they could pick and choose and our server Jose was another stellar example of the thoughtful service at this hotel. The concierge and a young lady at the desk were able to help us decide what water park we should go to ...... Our last night we ordered room service and the room service operator (again , no name ! sorry!!) was great--figuring out a vegetarian option that was terrific--the food arrived nicely presented and hot things were hot and cold things were cold-- (maybe that doesn't sound like rocket science, but they are obviously on their toes). This Hotel has something for all--there are bikes to ride around the grounds (expansive and gorgeous--we didn't have a chance) kayaks, canoes, paddleboats, sailfish are all included with the small resort fee as is a great rock climbing wall-- the pool area is really incredible--Huge, three separate pools and hot tubs-- the bathrooms are spacious and well lit and the toiletries are from portico and lovely. On our last night i had some trouble with the electrical system of our rental car--it was late --I dealt with the rental company but was unsure whether the car would start in the morning (we had to be at the airport at 6:45 am ) I explained my situation to the desk upon checking out (at 6:15 am) and the asst Manager, Rusty escorted us to the car to make sure it started and to trouble shoot in case it didn't -- Thank you Rusty--and everyone at the Hyatt who made our stay SO great! you will certainly see us again (and i hope sooner rather than later!!!) Oh lest i forget the kids had a great time at the arcade!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Resort!”
Reviews.Author: kcglidden
Reviews.Content: I got this resort on Priceline for $80 bucks a night. (mid August is not the high season in Orlando.) I paid another $20 to upgrade to a room with a fireworks view. This was well worth it! The pool was worth the price of admission alone. We were going to Epcot the day we checked in, but the kids just wanted to stay at the Hyatt and swim. The grounds were beautiful, the room was lovely, and I hope to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “No need to go to Disney or Universal! This place has it all!”
Reviews.Author: inspector12
Reviews.Content: Of all the places I’ve stayed this year, this place had the best “WOW!” factor for the kids. Bell staff was great! Greeted us very pleasantly, opened the doors and handled all the bags! Really made us feel special and welcome. After you leave your car, you walk into this fabulous Asian garden inspired atrium with…get this…a huge colorful talking macaw! This was a big hit with the kids! The kids were already sold on the place after seeing that. (BTW, the smaller white cockatoo in the back on the way to the pool is a little less impressive, especially after seeing the macaw. Maybe that’s why he’s out back.) Check-in was wonderful. Great friendly, cheerful staff! Really made us feel welcome! A great way to start off the vacation! Rooms and lobbies have been upgraded. Everything is “comfortable modern”. Bell staff delivered bags to room with another flawless and welcoming performance. We felt like the really wanted us there! Room was great! Again furnished and styled in the “comfortable modern” motif. It works! The breakfast buffet was great! A little busy, but the staff was on top of their game from the greeter to the servers! They have a coloring contest for kids. My daughter entered and was one of the three (3) winners that morning. She won a s’mores kit which we used at the fire pit later that evening! OK. Staff is great. Rooms are great. The macaw is a big hit. What more could be better?! Well the pièce de résistance has to be the pool and recreation area! There is so much to do there we didn’t even leave the hotel for Disney or Universal! There is the pool with the waterfall and grottoes. There is the game room in the pool grotto with video games, air hockey and pinball. There is the small and the large water slide. Great fun! There’s kayaking and sailing. We went kayaking (Only adults can take out the Sunfish sailboats). And there are a couple of other pedal powered water rides. This is truly a resort! No one got bored! Not even my 15 year old. And the place never felt crowded!  We pigged out on cookies and milk delivered to the room and then did another sugar overload making s’mores at the fire pit in the evening. The fire pit was a great touch, we met several other people and families and everybody was sharing the marshmallow and chocolate goodies. This Hyatt property is a big hit with my kids. They are already asking to go back. And I’m making plans. This place definitely has the “wow” factor, the staff, and the stuff to place it on your “we should go back there again, dear” list.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service, first class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: tracyintpa
Reviews.Content: This is by far the nicest, classiest, most comfortable resort in the Orlando area. We had a beautiful room overlooking the pool with a perfect view of the fireworks at EPCOT (personal thank you to Steve who was awesome!). Out bellhop Greg was outstanding, he met us at the car with the electric scooter my friend needed to rent. We were greeted at the front desk with champagne! We ate by the pool twice, and hit Cascades and the Whitehorse bar for meals. All of the food was delicious! We spent 4 glorious days using the pool. What a gorgeous pool. Never feels crowded. This was a relaxing, enjoyable "getaway"! One tiny complaint was that housekeeping missed servicing our room one day, and when the came in while we were at dinner, it obviously was a "rush job" as a lot of things were overlooked. I was surprised that a hotel of this caliber would have carelessness in housekeeping, but it was only once, so no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more”
Reviews.Author: Dogsrme4
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel and resort this past week. We were very impressed and were treated like royalty. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I needed some help with our bed due to a medical condition and after asking at the front desk (Keri) they had it adjusted immediately and I was able to sleep with any concerns. Thank you. We had brought our golf clubs (for the first time) and we are very glad we did. The hotel stored our travel cases for us and the golf club stored, cleaned and had our clubs ready for us every morning. With the shuttle service we never had to carry our bags except when arriving and leaving. The golf club and golf store attendants and personnel were friendly and helpful. The golf courses (we golfed all four) were excellent and challenging. We had a great time. We didn't use the pool or fitness centre but noticed many did. You can't go wrong at the Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Still an excellent choice...”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay here and I we still highly recommend this property. The pool complex is great for children, they have a small waterside, bike riding, wall climbing, boating, beaches, etc. There is plenty to do for everyone. The rooms are spacious, clean, and modern. This hotel was an excellent value for just $104 off there website. I only have just 1 suggestion for the hotel, there pools are always too cold and take some getting use to. We were in 2 other hotels in Orlando this week and were fine. We noticed the same thing in our last stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: phphear
Reviews.Content: We had our children (ages 6, 3, and 1) with us while visiting Disney. The kids LOVED the parrots in the lobby and enjoyed the water slide at the pool. Rooms were clean and well stocked. the staff was extremely friendly. Would highly recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Better than last time”
Reviews.Author: sum1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three years ago and enjoyed it so much we wanted to come back. On arrival we asked if there was any possibility of an FOC upgrade to pool view rooms (2), which they did. We had two inter-connecting rooms on a high floor with a beautiful view of the p0ols and lake, absolutely perfect. After a couple of days we received a call from Reception advising us that they would have to move us to another room due to some urgent maintenance work which was required. Although unhappy about this we agreed. I think the deputy manager was a little surprised by our acceptance of this and we were given a number of vouchers for breakfast in the Cascades restaurant. I have to say the service in the hotel is exceptional and we wlook forward to coming back again. My only one minor criticism is that the newly refurbished rooms, although they look really good are not designed that well. The often commented on dual purpose door is not a good idea and there is a distinct lack of storage space. One really good touch was the free ice cold water available at the poolside. We also stayed at the Hyatt in Bonita Springs which was also very nice but in our opinion the service here was better.

Reviews.Title: “Wow So Much to do So little time”
Reviews.Author: fldavefan
Reviews.Content: ok the only thing you have to worry about here is how are you going to fit everything into your stay..this is one of the only places I have stayed at where you actually feel like you get your money’s worth in paying the resort fee...you can ride bikes, kayak, canoe, jog , park ,swim ,workout ,and you don’t need your wallet. Rooms are great just like most Hyatt’s but the grounds is beautiful, friendly staff, this is a great place to come with children. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Shmee43
Reviews.Content: I had an early arriving flight into Orlando. I got to the Hyatt at 10:30'ish AM and went to see what the room status was. I had booked my reservations online and also read of the 4pm check in times. Upon checking in, I was quite surprised that hotel frontdesk attendant, Stephanie was not only able to upgrade my room to a corner where I had 2 balcony views, but was also able to allow me to head right to it as it was ready. The resort and occupying property is akin to a compound atmosphere. You must check in with a guard at a front gate to access the property so security is well-maintained. I was given a parking pass to put in the front dashboard to allow easier access for my 4nite/5day stay. The lobby is beyond belief. Forget the decor and the live macaws and cockatoo's. When you walk in the front door, just look UP! The hotel itself is architectural genius. The room was gorgeous. I haven't slept so sound in a very longtime and welcomed the pillows and the very high quality mattress that had me zzz'ing off in no time. The shower wasglass enclosed with a combination rain-soaker head and a seperate head where you can work one or both simultaneously. For the $18/day the hotel charges you, you have alot of services to pick from. There is a chip n'putt golf course that is beautiful. The private lake (next to the pool) that surrounds the property is a site for the eyes and the paddle boats, aqua bikes, canoes, kayaks are yet another part of your ammenities. Free bike useage around the property with appropriate trails, nature trails for walkers and more are all very worthwhile. The property is manicured meticulously. The countless fountains, tropical flowering plants and water gardens will have you turning your head to see what's next around the many walkways that lead to the massive pool. The pool is indescribable. Its resemblance to a rainforest/mountain oasis is well done and simply beautiful. The pool stretches around through a rocky cave-like area where you will find the, "On The Rocks" bar and excercise room and gameroom for the kids. There are (2) water slides. One for the kiddies and one for the bigger kids. A freind and I both tried the larger slide and gave it a "thumbs up" for the thrill factor. The pool staff offer some activities that will keep kids on the go. There was a water slide contest for the kids measuring the fastest time to get to the bottom of the slide. I had lunch twice at the hotel. The crabcake sandwiches (one in the Cascades Restaurant and one pool-side) were excellent. I was unable to dine at any of the other 5 restaurants the hotel offers, but I have heard if you are big on breakfast eating, the morning buffet for a $25/pp fee is one that is unreal. I had the misfortune of getting a grease stain on a silk shirt at a meal during the week. The dry cleaning staff was quick, courteous and had my clean shirts waiting on my bed and pressed perfectly the same day that I had them picked up. The hotel staff was very accomodating. I had a surprise of a close friend coming to visit with her family and they were able to give them a room across the hall from mine. Furthermore, on the day of checkout. I realized after accessing the internet with a laptop, the high speed cable was in disrepair and I was unable to disconnect it from my computer. A call was made and they had a computer tech on site that arrived to my room 5minutes after I made the call. He was able to fix the problem and got the broken cable out without charging me a fee. Maid staff was friendly and thorough. There are cheaper hotel deals in orlando and you might save a bundle by choosing others. However, you will not get the service at these places that I received at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. Simply spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “From the moment we arrived at the Hyatt we had the overwhelming feeling that the hotel was going to be the right place f”
Reviews.Author: UgleyBird
Reviews.Content: The welcoming, calm and cool reception of the Hyatt acted as an immediate antidote to the heat, humidity and noise of the theme parks. Our room was always spotlessly clean by midday, with supplies always refilled and endless fluffy white towels. All the staff we interacted with made us feel like we were special, whether that was front of house, housekeeping, or recreation. The informal programme of events for the children was great – we did not want to pack our child off to a kids club for the entire day, but having 3 or 4 things going on throughout the day, broke the monotony for our 9 year old – certainly the ice lollies in the afternoon and the water slides were a great hit! The gym was relatively small but had good facilities. Leisurely bike roads around the resort were a great way to explore and get some exercise, and the same was true of boating on the lake. The location of the hotel was brilliant – a central location but plenty of space around it. We did not have a car, but taxis were relatively inexpensive to get you to parks, malls and restaurants - there were also a couple of good restaurants within walking distance if you wanted to head out on foot. Complimentary buses are provided to the Disney Transportation Centre, from where you can connect to all the Disney attractions, plus one bus daily to Sea World Universal studios. However, the bus return times were often so late, we were forced to use taxis to get back - even on the one occasion when we stayed at Epcot to see the fireworks at 9pm, we were too late for one bus, but had an hour’s wait for the next! In spite of that, I cannot see us ever wanting to stay anywhere else if we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada20
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in June and the hotel was fabulous, the rooms were modern, clean and had great views of the disney area, the mini fridge was useful and the coffee maker had fresh filter coffee which was re-stocked every day. The hotel is in an excellent location being very close to the main disney parks and only a short drive to Universal and Islands of Adventure and has plenty of good restaurants and shops nearby, The staff were always friendly and helpful and the grounds of the hotel were superb especially the numerous swimming pools and waterfalls! The only downside was the $20 per night compulsory service charge which covered the use of mini golf, water sports, wi-fi and bicycles but as we were out and about all day we did not really use these facilities so the extra cost is an added expense. The restaurants and bars in the hotel are good but also very expensive which is not a problem as eating out is such good value. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: BeaSamDad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis within the buzz of Orlando. It's large, in beautiful grounds and has some amazing facilities. You could literally have your holiday and never leave the hotel complex if you wished! The only area that I would like to improve would be that breakfast is very expensive for a family and some less grand dining choices would be good. But on the whole, we loved this hotel and we will return when savings allow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staycation!”
Reviews.Author: paulmguf
Reviews.Content: I am a local who decided to take my family on a mini-staycation for one night and it was fantastic. We were only away one night, but it felt like we had been gone a week. The pool is amazing, and the hotel has tons of things to keep anyone occupied. The staff is fantastic and does everything they can to make your stay enjoyable. Highly recommend to anyone. My kids are 3 and 1 and a good time was had by all. Definitely plan to stay again for a little getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but pity you have to pay resort fee”
Reviews.Author: seajac
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely - reception was vast and airy. Felt air conditioning was a bit too much especially in the evenings. Location was ok offer good bus shuttle if times suit you. Felt you will need a car here as we spent a fortune on taxis. Food was lovely at this hotel - highly recommended. Room was lovely but cleaning could be better as they only change the towels and made the bed only every day. Could have done some hoovering. Pity there was no mini bar available and any lipson tea and milk should be provided in the the room. resort fee was a let down as we didnt use the bikes cos they didnt have breaks and we spent lots ot time at the parks and didnt always use the poo. Also we didnt avial the boats or rock climbing so it was a bad value for us but could be good value for some ! I really dont know if I will return again ????????? But I will recommend if they want to stay at the hotel most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms. Great pools and other activities!”
Reviews.Author: wondermind
Reviews.Content: I definitely would stay at this hotel again. I would say that the best part about this hotel is that it has many activities for both adults and kids to enjoy. I won't list those here and you can always go to the website to read about them. We were checked in by a very nice young lady named Cristen. She treated us kindly, offered each from our party a glass of champagne upon checking in. I had booked two rooms (one for me hand hubby, and one for my brother and his family) and Cristen arranged for our rooms to be adjacent to each other. She even gave us rooms with views of the fireworks upon our request. It was a smooth transaction. Things I like about this hotel: Every room has a balcony. Our rooms were spacious-- the bathrooms are even more spacious than I've seen with other hotels. I loved that! I've stayed in 4* hotels where only one person would fit in the bathroom at a time; so spacious bathrooms are a plus for me. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of what seem to me a very touristy center. You don't have to drive far for supermarkets, restaurants, or gift shops. Walmart is just 3 miles away. Orlando Premium Outlet is about the same distance away. The bad part about being in the middle of everything is that traffic on the stretch of road where this hotel is located was always always bad! I hated all the people who made U turns.. They just slow everybody down. I'm from Seattle, and I'm just not used to the idea, and thank goodness I don't have to get used to it. This hotel has great swimming pools with slides. My 8-year old niece loved the pools and slides-- me too actually! We both spent 7 hrs playing in the pool one day. Free self-parking: This was great. Many hotels charge you at least $10 a day to park, but it was free here. I heard some posters complain about "long walk" to the self-park lot. I couldn't believe it when i saw that the lot was right next to the hotel building. Seriously, does the lot need to be in the lobby for it to be considered close? Even when the lot was full-- and it always was during our stay because of some teen pageant events-- the farthest we had to walk was from one end of the building to the other end-- and that was less than a block! If anything the "long walk" is probably from the room to the lobby because the hotel is very wide. Here are my dislikes: When Cristen told us that our 2 rooms were adjacent and were accessible by doors in the adjoining wall. I was thinking how neat. But in practice, I think this configuration works large families where parents want to keep track of their kids. It is not so great for multiple families or adult couples. This is because the doors are not soundproof like the walls are. When I was near the doors between our room, I could hear almost everything that was said on my brother's side. I also found that my other wall has the same door set that led to another room. I don't know if only specific rooms are configured like mine.. but luckily for us, there were no guests staying in that other room; else it could have been a big annoyance for us (and for them). Then there was the sliding door that multi-tasked as the closet's and bathroom's door. Prior to arriving to the hotel, I had read reviews and was well aware of the complaints against this door and warned my husband about it. We did not run into issues as we worked out a system where we would announce each time we come out of the bathroom and open the door. This is so that whoever was at the closet would be alerted and move out of the door's way. It's pretty odd, I know, but I understand and agree with most posters that complained about this door. I saw for myself how people could be physically hurt by it. And I understand that the purpose was to be efficient and save space, but sometimes ideas aren't so great in practice as they seemed on sketches. Like I mentioned, the doors were no good at soundproofing. This means that you can hear everybody in the hallway as well.. Also, the door closes very loudly; it just bangs against the door frame-- there's no rubber on the door's frame to at least absorb the sound. My room had a refrigerator, but my brother's room had a cooler that looked like a refrigerator instead. I called and requested a refrigerator for him, but they wanted $25 for the switch! That is crazy! I'd never heard of hotels charging $25 for a refrigerator before. Most rooms should come with refrigerators in the first place! Now that i think about it, I think this charge is what I dislike the most. In conclusion, the dislikes I've listed did not interfere with me and my family enjoying our vacation. We all had a great time and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Hyatt Regency Really Made Our Vacation Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: KarynSanCarlos_CA
Reviews.Content: Hopefully our title says it all. We stayed for the first time at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. The moment we checked in (with the wonderful help from Tessa Williams at the front desk), we were treated very well and everyone was very courteous and friendly. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the staff (JP) was great. The pools and facilities were outstanding. We spent 2 1/2 days just hanging around the pool and riding the bikes and using the canoes. There is a shuttle that takes you to the theme parks which is also great and there are restaurants close by that you can walk to if you want to eat outside of the hotel. We will definitely recommend this resort to our friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Central Floridas Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joscco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a visit to Orlando with my wife and five children.The main reason we were there was to visit Disneyworld for the ninth time in ten years,i had previously always stayed at a Disney resort but was intrigued by this hotel as it had been recommended by several people we knew.I finally booked when Disneys quote for seven nights in the Contemporary was more than double what seven nights in the Hyatt was costing. I was not dissapointed. The hotel is very well run and a stones throw from Disney,we had a car but there is a shuttle bus and you could actually walk if you felt like it.The food and service were excellent,the breakfast is one of the best hotel breakfast i have ever had and the food in Hemmingways was superb. My kids all loved the Sushi bar in the lobby and we often had snacks there coming home late from the parks. The pool is one of the nicest i have ever seen,we actually took a day off thrill seeking to spend a day chilling at the pool.This is something we have never done up at Orlando before as we normally go to Naples for the second part of the vacation and it is the pool/beach part but here we couldnt resist. The rooms are large ,well presented and spotless.There is also some excellent golfing! Overall i would strongly reccomend this hotel. I was nervous when i booked as i thought i would miss some of that Disney magic but it was so good i don't think anyone noticed.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jeneris
Reviews.Content: Only spent a weekend at this resort & cannot wait to go back. The rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms are super clean, the flat screen tv's are marvelous and the pool is outstanding. You really do not have to leave the resort for anything, but if you want to...it is close to everything! I will definitely be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but not the price”
Reviews.Author: charal95
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my visit to Orlando and it was 6 nights and I just loved the hotel. Bellow you will find out why and why I didn't like soo much the prices. Check in-Check out Before coming to this hotel I heard that when you do the check in they give you a champagne but it never happened and the day I was doing the check out I saw people with champagne. But I don't know if it was because of the late check in but I didn't get it, still there were some problems. Of course the check in lady was new and first she gave me a normal room and then I remind her I booked a Regency Club and she just changed the cards.... I hoped a higher level. But the check out was totally different plus I got late check out. The young men was super professional and offered me a great service and even gave me two 100 usd coupons for my next stay. Nice touch! I would give a 4 out of 5 but because of the great service of the check out I will give a 4.5 out of 5. Rooms Well of course they had been renovated. They are awesome, with a great design and incredible beds makes the rooms great. My room was in the sixth floor and it had views of the parks although not great but you could still see Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The bathroom was a mid-size one with a nice shower. What I most like about the room was the bed and the flat tv. I think this room was one of the best hotel room I have ever stayed, I really liked it, I just think they should have a mini bar that actually cools things and had food :( I give a 4.8 out of 5 Location The location is just great but not perfect. It's about 10 to 15 minutes to the parks, remember that the shuttle that takes you to the Ticket and Trasnportation Center of Disney takes 25 minutes. It's not too far from Universal and various Shopping Malls including the best one: The Mall at Millenia. I think that the location was just good and it's great for people going to parks and also to some malls and some other attractions. I give a 4.8 out of 5 Regency Club As I had access to this club Im also going to review it. So first the whole Club has space for about 50 people more or less just that half of the club is outside and the other inside, what’s the problem with that? HEAT It’s so warm outside that you can’t have a breakfast or be there more than 15 minutes. In this club there is all kind of foods, I think they start at about 6:30 a.m. with some coffee and then at 7 with the Continental breakfast which each morning we took which consist in 5 types of cereals, fruits, yogurts, bagels with salmon, cheese, etc… 3 types of juices and milks as well coffee and some biscuits. So there is not too much. After the breakfast there is small lunch, then the club is closed and at 3 p.m. is opened again for some snacks and at 5 there are cocktails with some canapés, and until 9 there are some biscuits and coffee. What I also liked a lot it was that they had two computers, one of them a MAC!! And some printers free of charge. There is also a nice terrace and a concierge. So the only complain I have is that it was too cold inside and there should regulate the entrance, I think they give many accesses to more people than they should. Oh and the first day I went there was a WORM IN MY APPLE!!! Still I give a 4.5 out of 5 Restaurants I don’t remember exactly how many restaurants they are but we just had a breakfast once at the Cascade which it was a buffet and it was above my expectations. The food was good and the prices as well. I’ve heard before that there was a place where they made you waffles and put them chocolate inside, well not anymore. Because I just had breakfast only one morning I can’t really say that was excellent 4.7 OUT OF 5 Amenities It was a shame that I couldn’t even enter the swimming pool, probably because the first day I arrived 4 hours later I should, but they were awesome and I heard the same about the bicycles and the boats that they were included in the Resort Fee. The Fee included the rent of bicycles, boat also to use the Rock Climbing Wall, self parking (the first night should be Valet) and transportations to the park so it wasn’t too bad. Im not going to rate this because I didn’t use the pool or the other things but I still think you should stay here because of this. Xtras So the hotel had transportation to the parks, it had 3 different time options in the morning and other 3 in the night to the Ticket and Transportation Center, which you then need to take another bus or monorail. I think there should be 4 at least in High Seasons. There was also a Mears office, which offered us a great service. The lobby is just incredible and the concierge is also great. The internet that is included is via a cable and it’s says that it’s slow but you can pay one that is faster, but I will just stay with the free one is not that bad. The self-parking is also included and it can be good or bad it just depends in your luck. You might get a spot right exactly in front of the entrance or even 100 meters of the entrance. Also as I said before the first night should be Valet, after a long drive or a flight and you have all those bags it’s just better. I give a 4.6 out of 5 Price The rate was about 235 a night which the bad thing is the extra taxes and the resort fee, so I would stay here for a rate smaller than 200 so after the taxes and the fees is just 230. I don’t think the price was perfect but just good. But I think the service was great the only complain was about the club (the worm inside the apple) and the check-in lady. I give a 4.4 out of 5 Overall After counting all votes we have a rate of 4.61 which makes the 5 points. I really recommend this hotel because it’s renovated the location is great and the amenities awesome just try to check a good price. Check my trip at http://my-tripss.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and close to everything Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Tomtam47
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that is worth much more than what we paid. We did get a discount because my husband is a state worker but we would have stayed here anyway. Best pool!! The kids(ages 14 and 15) loved it. Beautiful grounds, especially around the pool. I have read other reviews that said rooms were small. The rooms were exactly what we expected, not smaller than any other room we have stayed in for the four of us. You are between Disney and Universal and close to many restaurants and stores. I would stay here again. The only downside which I'm sure is true of most major hotel chains is the cost of food and drinks on site. For one pina colada and a coke, we paid close to $15 at the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wanna Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: drum757
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived, until the day we left, we were treated with excellent service. Pete (in Registration) paid attention to details and even provided a little beverage "treat" for my wife and I before we had time to unpack in our room! The young lady servicing our room (Najia) was very pleasant and attentive as well. The manager of each area - from housekeeping to grounds maintenance are to be commended for their service. I look forward to a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “look no further”
Reviews.Author: FamMar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and loved every minute. This resort is spacious, beautiful, convenient and service was impeccable. Located between Disney theme parks and Universal/ Seaworld, International Drive area made access to all parks fast and easy. There is a $20 per day "resort fee" which is the best bargain in Orlando. It includes daily parking as well as numerous pool side activities (putt golf, bicycles, etc) and lake water craft. (kayaks, paddle boats, etc). Rather than spend one day at a water park we stayed at the resort and had very relaxing days by the pool and lake. Our kids (12 and 16) spent most of their pool time playing a friendly game of volleyball with other guests or riding the water slides. This resort has gated parking entry for guests only. Although the resort itself offers numerous eateries, within a mile of the property lie dozens of restaurants and shopping centers. Plenty of choices for everyone in your group. The hotel has an asian inspired decor that includes, statues, ponds plants and live birds. Very refreshing. Great rates for military!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service, great for families w/young ones...never have to leave!”
Reviews.Author: vdirani
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting this hotel. We have a 2 year old and 5 year old boy. We were planning on staying 3 days, and ended up staying 5 days. We LOVE this hotel. There is an awesome, gigantic pool with 2 slides (small and big), tons of activities (biking, kayaking, rock climbing, beach volleyball, tetherball) for the family. The decor is beautiful, the staff was wonderful and extremely friendly. The rooms were typical size, would have liked them to be a little larger with the kids....but overall this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Great location and good price. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Just Outside Disney!!”
Reviews.Author: carol5001
Reviews.Content: We were bound for the Universal Portofino for the new Harry Potter park, but since the day before was the 4th of July, we decided on a last minute whim to leave early and spend the first night at a hotel facing the Disney theme parks. I booked late in the day on the fourth of July and the Hyatt still went out of it's way to give our family the best view still available for the fireworks. When I checked in the reservation clerk told me when and where to expect the fireworks. She also provided the adults in our party with a complimentary glass of champagne. Such a nice touch!! We ordered hamburgers from room service and while they were room service priced -- they were DELICIOUS!! Plenty of condiments were provided on the tray and the lady who delivered our meal was super pleasant. (One adviso -- a 20% tip is already included in the room service bill. I missed this although it is stated on the menu. So we tipped twice. Whoops!) The fireworks went off just in the order explained and we had a slim little balcony to view them from. It was exactly what we had in mind for the 4th. The next morning we enjoyed the hot tub and gorgeous lagoon pool. We were able to get breakfast from the lobby coffee shop for around $15-20 -- which I consider reasonable for a resort in Orlando. As opposed to many other hotels in the area, you actually get a ton of amenities for the $20 a night extras fee. Sadly, we only had time for the lagoon pool. The atrium lobby was gorgeous, the staff was very friendly and the rooms had ample space with gorgeous contemporary bathrooms. The *only* warning I would put on this hotel is for people with a fear of heights. It is a high hotel with many of the exterior walls and elevator made of glass. For us it was neat, but if one was afraid of heights, you might want to request a lower floor. We spent the rest of our trip at the Loews Portofino for the Express Pass perks to Universal. Honestly, I think this was a mistake. The Express Pass didn't work on the Harry Potter ride and the Portofino was twice as expensive as the Hyatt. Other than the Universal privileges, these hotels were completely comparable, with the Hyatt being much more affordable and welcoming. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to families headed to Disney. It's just off property and you get a four star hotel without the four star price. I don't know if it is your best jumping off place for Universal as you have about 10 miles of the very congested interstate to navigate. Hyatt does have a Universal property and I suspect it might be as good a deal as the Cypress. I wish I had found out first hand!! We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, watch additional holds on your account”
Reviews.Author: Karin000
Reviews.Content: we were going to blixzzard beach but ended up staying at the hotel the whole time.Great stay. great service. very nice nice and clean. room was standard size and newly renovated. Pool area is GREAT, 3 pools, 2 water slides, waterfalls, caves to swim through. 3 hot tubs, full gym and lots of activities. Poolside service with ok food prices but drinks very expensive. an additional charge of $20/day for amenities( paddle boats,kayaks, bikes, ping pong, gym etc will be charged, but worth it) They held an additional $390 !! on my debit account for incidentals which will be held for 3 business days after check out. which we were not told about at check in ( only $195 was explained to us) Poor accounting practice for such a large chain. I still highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dunkeld10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights with friends and had a great time. You would not know that you are just off a busy freeway and next door to the Disney Parks given the location of this hotel. On check-in we received a lovely, complimentary glass of champagne which was a nice touch after a long day travelling. The reception staff were very attentive and assisted in all our enquiries. The hotel has a lovely swimming pool area with slides, caverns, hottubs, waterfalls and more. We made use of the golf course, canoes, cycle hire, etc so didn't feel too bad when eating the huge food portions in the restaurants!! Even though you have to pay a fee for these services we thought it was worth it on the days that you just want to spend at the hotel and do what you please. We used the complimentary hotel tranportation to the nearby Disney theme parks. A great service but like others, I do wich they had an afternoon pick-up as it would have made things a bit easier. We also made use of the hotel shuttle which will take you from the hotel down to the front gate. This lets you saves time when going to dine in the nearby restaurants/bars and also saves the legs after walking soo much at the Parks!! We were lucky that our room overlooked the lake and later on in the evening we could watch the fireworks from the various theme parks nearby. The rooms were very modern and beautifully decorated - liked the glass panel on the wall which supported the tv!!. Very comfortable beds as mentioned in previous reviews. We were visiting the hotel while a large conference was taking place (well mannered US students) however, the hotel is soo large that you barely noticed the number of guests. Hope to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great destination, close to WDW is a bonus”
Reviews.Author: Merriwind
Reviews.Content: Just back from three enjoyable nights with friends. Two moms and three 13 year olds. We took advantage of lots of amenities/activities at the resort. Wonderful swimming pool area with slide, caves, huge patio area, volleyball net, waterfalls and more. Rock climbing, an assortment of boats, ping pong, bikes, fitness center, pitch and putt golf kept us happy and busy during our resort time. We spent our entire first day, half our 2nd day and all of check out day at the resort. There is so much to do. The resort fee ($22.50 with tax) seems expensive, but it includes all activities, plus internet. It was money well-spent. Rooms are nice. Very modern looking. I was pleasantly surprised with how spotlessly clean everything was. Super comfortable beds. My daughter complained when we got home last night that she was the hotel bed back. I was originally put in a handicap accessible room. These rooms have no drawer space and no vanity, to allow room for a wheelchair. I did wind up moving, as that room was not a good fit for us. The regular room had a countertop with storage underneath in the bathroom and worked much better for us. The closet/bathroom door combo was a little weird and the closet is tiny. The luggage rack kept getting caught on the door. An extra inch would have made a big difference in the usability of that feature. Staff was fantastic, very professional and courteous. Overall, a great choice, especially if you're not planning to spend every minute at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - spent a whole day just enjoying the amenities”
Reviews.Author: wagsvaca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for six nights. The hotel was amazing and the amenities were excellent. There are several restaurants within walking distance and the hotel shuttle will take from the hotel to the front gate (whics is a good mile). The pros: transportaion provided to Disney parks, Universal, and Seaworld, beautiful outise pool area with water slide and fun for the kids, poolside lunch and service was excellent, concierge was excellent help in finding us what we needed. The cons: transportaion to parks is limited to morning drop offs and evening drop offs - so we couldn't go back to our hotel for a short break in the afternoon. Check-in was poor, they had made a mistake and had us checking in a night earlier so it took a half hour to get us a room, then no compensation was offered, maintenance was asked to come fix our balcony door (it would not open) and that was never done. Overal, it was a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A truly AMAZING 4th of July Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyVin
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just finished up a 3-night stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for the 4th of July -- an AMAZING experience! We got a very good rate, as I am a State Government Attorney; with the Government Rate, I was booked in a "Buena Vista Double." However, as a Diamond, I was Upgraded to an absolutely AMAZING corner room on the 8th floor that faced both Sea World and Walt Disney World. Unfortunately, there were not any Suites available, but the front desk clerk actually apologized for that -- there was a BIG wedding during our stay, so I assume all the Suites went to the bridal party. But honestly, with the view that I had been Upgraded to, I did not even care about a Suite! Check-in was extremely smooth and efficient. We left our car with the valet, and as soon as we entered the lobby, we were greeted by name by not only a porter but the front desk as well. It appears that have a system for radioing ahead from the valet, and I truly appreciated the personal touch. At the front desk we were greeted with some wonderful champagne -- even offering a refill upon completion of check-in. The front desk clerk spent the time to go through all of the available rooms to try to Upgrade us to the best possible view ... she definitely succeeded! As for the Diamond check-in amenity, I chose the food/beverage option, selecting a nice Cabernet with a Key Lime Dessert ... both were exquisite! After such a quick and efficient check-in, we took the beautiful interior/exterior glass elevators up to the 8th floor, and quickly found our room ... true to my profile, the room was at the end of the hallway, as far away from the elevator and ice machine as possible. We walked in and were amazed ... the room was so truly beautiful! We had a wall of glass on each side of the room -- due to the corner room, we had 2 sliding doors/balconies. The balcony at the end of the bed overlooked Downtown Disney, and you could see Disney's Hollywood Studios and Epcot from there, as well as Sea World in the distance. The balcony on the other end of the room faced out over the beautiful pool and waterfalls, with an amazing view of the Magic Kingdom and the wooded areas of Lake Buena Vista. Some of the most perfect views that I have ever seen from a hotel room! These views made for such truly amazing fireworks viewing. Each night, we were able to see fireworks from all theme parks in the area. And, on the 4th of July -- WOW! That's all I can say ... some of the best 4th of July fireworks viewing in my entire life! First, at 9p we could see the Magic Kingdom's special holiday fireworks from one balcony. Then, at 930p we got to see Sea World's from the other balcony, followed by the special holiday fireworks from Disney's Hollywood Studios at 945p, Epcot's special holiday version of Illuminations at 10p, and finally, the Downtown Disney fireworks at 1030p. And, in addition to all of that, we could see countless other fireworks in the distance from each balcony as far as the eye could see ... a member of the room service staff told us when he delivered our dinner on Saturday night that we could see fireworks from the coast -- I hadn't believed that until the 4th, but he was definitely correct! The room was a little smaller than I had expected, but it was very nice. The Hyatt bed was extremely comfortable, and all of the furnishings appeared relatively new and well kept. The room also had a fridge, so we were able to go to a local liquor store for fireworks beverages. As for the Regency Club, I would agree with most others on here that it was too small ... at peak breakfast and evening hours, there was barely room to move. And, on the 4th, it was very overcrowded -- but, to the Hyatt's credit, they very quickly opened up an empty guest room across the hall to make for extra room. This seemed par for the course for the Regency Club staff, who were extremely kind and courteous the entire stay, each trying to go above and beyond to assist Regency Club guests. As for the offerings in the Regency Club, the food was pretty good. The breakfast was standard continental breakfast fare, with pastries, cereals, cold meats and cheeses, finished off with coffee and juices. The all-day snack offerings features some nice snack mixes and cookies. The dinner options were always tasty -- but, my only critique is that there never was a hot option ... on the 4th, they had amazing beef skewers, but they were served cold. A hot option would have been nice to have. As for the liquor selections, top notch, and the staff was always very happy to make another drink. My only complaint for this property would be with the food selections, or lack thereof. Although there are four restaurants on property, there just did not seem to be too much of a selection. Two of those restaurants, Cascades and Palm Cafe, had the exact same menu -- I had expected Palm Cafe to be more of a poolside burger place, but it was not.
