Honestly, there was no simple small burger place to eat. The White Horse did look very nice, but it was more fancy than the "sports bar" feel that it was explained to us. It just didn't seem like we had much of a food selection for more than a few nights ... that is the only thing that I would think needs improvement at this property. But, despite my critique of the food selection, as for food quality, what we did have was AMAZING! This property offered some of the best room service that I have ever had at any resort, and the room service staff was extremely pleasant. Also, we splurged for the "fancy" meal at Hemingway's our first night -- some of the most amazing scallops that I had ever tasted! And, while dining, the restaurant manager stopped by to personally check on us, and we even found a hand-written "thank you" note from our server slipped under our room door the next morning. Absolutely superb service! As for the recreation facilities, the pool was fantastic -- or should I say, the pools were fantastic! With the amount of families staying at the resort for the 4th, I had expected the pool to be too packed to enjoy ... but, that was far from the case. The three inter-connected cave/waterfall pools were amazing! We always had plenty of space to enjoy, and it seemed that pool chairs were always available. Additionally, the poolside activities and water sports -- i.e. paddle boats -- were very fun! All in all, this was an extremely excellent stay, and I would highly recommend this resort to anyone! Truly amazing customer service by all, and I will definitely be back soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: There are many pros and cons with this hotel. I would like to start off saying I would stay there again, due to the value received. I am a Hyatt Diamond member and stayed there for the points and amenities I receive as a Diamond member. The hotel appeared to offer many benefits, with a good proximity to Disney, for much less than Disney properties. I will get the negatives out of the way. We were charged for valet and someone else's lunch. So, check your bill carefully. There were problems with the computer system that sometimes had me as a platinum member and sometimes had me properly listed as a diamond. Our room wasn't yet cleaned the first day when we returned at 5pm and had left the room by 8:30am. Towels, washclothes, soaps, etc. were not replenished. Also, the room is an average size, with a large bathroom, but it is the most dysfunctional room I have ever had. There was absolutely no closet space, except for a half rack in the bedroom. Not even a skirt could be hung in the closet. Drawer space was limited to two drawers. The bathroom, while large, had such a tiny sink area, we had to store our things next to the safe or in our suitcases. The tub/shower combo, while modern, should have come with an instruction sheet. I couldn't figure out how to use it. Also, the walls are rather thin. The Regency club, while nice, was too small to accommodate all guests. On a positive note, service levels were pleasant and high. The included breakfast was very nice. Food served in the Regency Club was excellent. The hotel decor is attractive. The room is very pretty. Positives in the room include great views, good lighting, a very large in room safe and a refrigerator. The bed was comfortable and the views were great. The facilities and grounds were truly resort-like and were lovely. The proximity to Disney is very good. If you are prepared for the negatives, the hotel is in no way a bad experience and it is a pretty property with plenty to do and good service levels. I have stayed at the Peabody, the Swan, The Crown Plaza, the Hilton at Disney, the Buena Vista Palace, as well as Disney's Grand Floridian, Carribean Beach Resort and the Yacht and Beach Club. It isn't quite as convenient as the Swan to Disney, but the rooms are more up to date and the resort feel is much better. Of course, the Yacht and Beach Club and Grand Floridian are superior properties, but they are much more money. You do need a car to go back and forth to Disney but you are only about 10 minutes away with average traffic. You are also about an equivalent distance to Sea World. I can recommend this hotel--especially if rates are good. It is a shame, that with the new refurbishments, whoever designed the decor did not take functionality into account. They tack on a $20 per day resort fee, so make sure you take advantage of the facilities and take this into account when pricing your stay. You also have to pay for parking when going to Disney at a hefty $14 per day. Disney hotel guests get the parking for free, so factor that in as well.

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic hotel we have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: DaniellaVandepeer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic 2 week stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. We have a 3 year old son who was recently diagnosed with Hunters Disease, so it was our first big long haul trip. This hotel was so fantastic and accommodating to us and our son it was unreal. They could not do enough for us from impromptu cookies and milk in the afternoon in our room, they organized birthday cakes for both me and my son, and even let my son hitch a ride on the concierge suitcase trolly when he refused to walk any father due to DPT!!! (Disney Park Tiredness)! This hotel has a great selection of reasonably priced restaurants, breakfast was lovely and very fresh. The grounds and the pools are lovely, and the whole hotel is very looked after. Everyone was helpful and friendly. Ideally located for restaurants, Disney Parks, Downtown Disney, Universal and Shopping. Great atmosphere for families, as well as couples. We actually felt that we were on a second honeymoon at this place. Cannot wait to rebook for next year at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Mick028
Reviews.Content: Good base for exploring Disney - about 10 -15 Minutes from Magic Kingdom. Huge resort type hotel. Comfortable although a bit dated - the Hotel is currently being refurbished. Great Pool. A conference hotel. Recommend the club level with its free cocktails in the evening - worth it

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Most Beautiful Grounds of any Hotel/Resort, Beautiful Views, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lovelowery
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 needed a beautiful place to relax while enjoying Sea World, and Discovery Cove. This Hotel was fabulous. Although very close to Sea World and Discovery Cove, we could have just stayed a week at this Resort and had plenty to do. The pool is outstanding and complete with water slides. There is a picturesque Lake on the grounds with canoes and paddle boats. There is golf and hammocks. We didn't have time to enjoy all the resort has to offer, but will definitely stay here again. The room was beautiful, but the only negative was housekeeping did not properly complete their job during our stay. We were left clean towels and made beds and that is it. No additional toilet tissue, trash was not dumped, and nothing cleaned. Other than getting a raw deal on cleaning, the hotel overall was clean and lovely. We loved it immensely!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxation Lots to Do”
Reviews.Author: jrzyshoregirl
Reviews.Content: great location next to Disney parks. you MUST take advantage of everything they have to offer at this resort. Included in resort fee are Bikes/trails, pitch and putt golf, rock wall, one of the best pools I have ever been in with awesome waterslide for the kids, arcade, boats, sailfish, canoes, kayak, trike etc,. Great poolside activities for the kids. rooms are a bit small now that everyone is used to suites.. but they are nicely decorated. All staff were wonderul and accomodating. lobby is gorgeous and fun to talk to Merlot the parrot in the lobby. Many restuarants across the highway outside the resort .. easy walking distance .. you can't wrong! check out 1800hotels for an awesome rate..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisnkim721
Reviews.Content: I will start this off by saying this hotel is gorgeous. The pics I saw b4 arriving didn't do it justice. The lobby atrium is gorgeous and the rooms are great. The staff were all very nice and the complimentary champagne at check in was a nice. We had a view over looking the pool and Disney. It was fantastic. There are tons of activities to do at this hotel. The pool was great with the caves, waterfalls, hidden hot tubs, the kayaks and paddle boats were a lot of fun. I only have a few complaints. First off the walls are paper thin. I can clearly hear the conversations next door and every time a door shuts our door would rattle. The second was getting kicked out of the pool for an "approaching storm" that never came. I understand shutting the pool down during lightning, I get that. But when I am paying a 20 dollar resort fee per day and get told I can't use the pool when there is no sign of a storm is ridiculous. The storm already passed and we watched the radar and it was clear. So we all went swimming and so did other guests. About 30 minutes passed and a security guard said they r shutting it down for an approaching storm. I didn't argue with him b/c i wasn't gonna cause a seen but I was furious. Other guests voiced what I was thinking. Kids were upset and it was just crazy. I would understand if there was thunder in the distance but everything had passed and it was clear. We all went in and checked the weather and the storms had all passed and there was not even threatening clouds in the sky. A storm never came. All in all, I would return to this hotel for sure. The grounds are kept gorgeous and the staff were extra kind. I was just upset that to pay $20 a day and have a pool that is open 24 hours and have it shut down for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort--lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: BacchusBond
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort if you're going to take advantage of it. For the $20 a day resort fee, my husband played golf (a very nice pitch 'n putt), we rode the bikes, used the rock climbing wall, and worked out in the gym. All of this is included in the resort fee and you have unlimited access. We were there 8 days and did the theme parks every other day, allowing us time to relax and enjoy the resort. If you're going to the parks every day and only coming back to shower and sleep, then it's not worth it to stay here. Rooms are very clean and modern, but on the small side. It was 3 of us and we had just enough drawers and closet space. A family of 4 would have a hard time. PACK LIGHTLY. The food is really good and not overly unreasonable for a resort (but we're from NY and used to higher restaurant prices). By our 3rd night going to the White Horse (great sushi and gator tail), the hostess greeted us by name. The staff is very friendly and we had no complaints about anyone. The location is excellent: a block away from Downtown Disney/Pleasure Island; a few minutes by backroad to SeaWorld/Aquatica and the Orlando Outlets. There are a million eating options just outside the resort (we did have a rental car) plus liquor stores, 24 hour pharmacies, coffee places, you name it. You get a glass of champagne upon check in and the kids get a shovel and pail. I'd do it all again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Family activities galore, beautiful artwork, fun ambiance”
Reviews.Author: venessa9
Reviews.Content: We bid online and got a great rate through priceline. Welcomed right away, when checked in they offered us a glass of champagne. The kids got a sand bucket with crayons and different fun activity pages. Our room was extremely clean. They have beautiful Asian art pieces dispersed throughout the lobby. The pool is huge. They have an arcade for the kids. You also have access to bikes, canoes, kayaks which all included in the resort fee. That was the only drawback, the $20 daily resort fee. All of the staff were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Classy!!”
Reviews.Author: JJamesNC
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Everything is very clean and well kept. Thanks for a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: etoile1
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress from June 11-14, 2010 for a family get-away. This hotel was PERFECT. It had everything we wanted. While the Hyatt is very close to Disney, we were looking for a hotel as our entertainment and this one was a perfect fit. Although we have year passes to the Disney water parks, we never left the hotel to have fun. We obtained this property by bidding on Priceline at a great rate. We were given a room with a view of "Buena Vista", but did not mind not getting the prime view as the room was the same. Rooms: The rooms (and hotel) are all newly renovated so have a sleek, modern look. We loved the clean, uncluttered look. The bathrooms are also very modern and well decorated. The shower is a "rain-head" shower which is a nice touch. The beds were very comfortable with nice linens and a down comforter. The pillows were not down, but it is possible that this could be requested. We also had a small refrigerator which was nice for keeping lunch meats and other snacks for the kids. Our room had a king size bed and a full size pull out sofa. Grounds: The hotel is in a gated community with large grounds. This is great for bike rides and jogging, Access is limited so is a bit more secure than other areas. The main areas of the hotel are impeccably kept, very clean and in good repair. The decor is clean and uncluttered. The lobby is impressive, a nice first impression. Pool and Activities: The pool is a spectacular "lagoon style" with waterfalls, caves, water slides, a volley ball net and 3 Jacuzzis. The $20/day resort fee is a bargain as it includes: use of bicycles, kayaks, sunfish, paddle boats, rock climbing wall, in-room wired internet and transport to Disney parks. You would pay much more for these activities at another property. They also have activities throughout the day for children. We found everything we needed to keep entertained. We loved this hotel and could really find nothing to complain about. Each employee we encountered went out of their way to be friendly and accommodating. I would absolutely return to this hotel for another family get-away. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Definetly return again”
Reviews.Author: speedbird99
Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay at the hotel and would recommend it highly. We arrived at the hotel at 10am expecting to just drop the bags off and check in as per the 4pm check in time. Stephanie cheked us in and gave us our room keys straight away.... very nice surprise. The complementray buckets, spades and cameras were a big hit with the kids, as was Merlot the fantastic parrot in reception. We were then shown to the room by one of the bellhops who was brilliant at poiting out all the hotels ameneties. All the staff were very courteous, excellent customer service and most of them used our name which was a very good touch. The staff at Cascasde (breakfast) always greeted us with a genuine warm welcome in the moring particularly Mike, JP and Angel and nothing was every too much trouble. Pools are fantastic, just watch the big slide with the little kids. Even though my son was just tall enough to go on it, it was fast and quite bumpy. The smaller one in the heated pool was brilliant for both of them. Daily activities for the kids, my daughter was delighted to win the treasure hunt. Make sure you use the boats, bikes and golf as they are all included in the daily resort charge. Checking out was also a breeze, we requested a late check out and this was easily met. The bellhop that took our bags to the car was extremely friendly giving my 2 kids a ride on the trolley with the bags. Location is good - only 5 minutes car dirve away from Downtown Disney, and Disney parks 15 minutes away. Few minutes drive from restuarants, recommend Bahama Breeze. The Premium outlets are only a 10 min dirve from here............. parking is busy though. Recommend the Pirate Cove Golf for some evening entertainment with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here, missed the birds!”
Reviews.Author: mcsto
Reviews.Content: The pool and spa were great, great service, beautiful interior. It's rare for us to find time to spend at the hotel, but we did at Hyatt. Close to everything. Very modern, love that rain shower shower head. The view was very very nice too! Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great staycation!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerinFL
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Orlando for many years but had never stayed at this hotel until a recent business meeting was held at the resort. Personalized customer service was the first thing I noticed (from the guard shack attendant to the doorman to the front desk they all used my name without it having been provided to them by me!) My room was on the third floor. While the hotel is built around a large atrium and noise from the atrium and bar/lounge area located there traveled up to the area surrounding the elevators, once in my room, it was quiet. The rooms are nicely updated with blue glass features and dark wood. The bed was outstanding as were the bed linens and pillows. The best feature of the room was being able to see the Disney fireworks from my hotel "balcony" (used lightly as there is no sitting feature available). My room overlooked a great pool area and the hotel has created a park with trails through it. The pool was so inviting that I went and purchased a bathing suit so I can utilize it. The hotel offers shuttle service to the Disney parks, but I would guess that my nephews could spend all day at the pool, saving me the money from the parks for at least two of the days. Great staycation location!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: robinhall44Westerly
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel and the price is no where as steep as the on site disney hotels. This hotel will take your breath away. We loved the two birds, Merlot and Kula. The on site food was fantastic and the breakfast is not to be missed. We had a great breakfast server in Cascades. His name was JP and he made us feel right at home. The pool and grounds here are the best in the United States. It's like a gigantic tropical garden. The health spa located in a grotto/cave next to the pool can't be beat. The service at the pool was A-1. Our only oservations regarding the room was there was no water pressure for cold water and the rooms are only 360 Square feet which was ok for us but for a family? Also the toilets are not private enough from the rest of the bathroom. But to us these were insignificant. All rooms come with awesome views and we were upgraded to a pool/fireworks view at no charge. We stayed for a week and it was the weekend of the Hindu wedding which made all the papers because the groom and wedding party actually arrived on an elephant. We were hearbroken when we had to leave. One note: avoid the California Grill in the Contemporary Hotel at all costs as it will be the biggest disappointment you will have on the trip. Thre are tons of great Disney restaurants which are much better and don't get sucked in by the California Grill view. The food is 2nd rate and the portions are tiny with out of sight prices. You don't need the view when you have a fireworks view at the Hyatt. Russel and all of the people inside the Hyatt lobby were so good with tips for eateries and for avoiding lines. We'll be back next year to our home away from home. Thank You Hyatt Grand Cypress for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: chesnutbwn
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to Disney. This hotel is amazing...We stayed 4 days and each day was an adventure. My 7 yr. old daughter loved the paddle boats and the pools. Upon arrival we requested a Disney view so we could see the fireworks and might I say the staff were very accommodating. We had a great view my daughter was on the balcony every night at 9 pm.. I loved this hotel and everything is 5 to 10 minutes away. The Theme parks and restaurants. I will say the only complaint I had was that there were no microwave in the rooms..and the resort fee is steep $20 a night.....so take advantage of all they have to offer and it's a lot. Oh I can't forget the parrot in the front lobby..It was a must that my daughter saw him each time we left...

Reviews.Title: “An EXCELLENT hotel...I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after checking out of a rat hole known as the Radisson Worldgate Resort, which nearly ruined my 21st birthday getaway. As I was pulling up in the taxi, I couldn't believe my eyes...It was just beautiful! I went in, still in a bad mood because of my horrid experience at the previous hotel. The wonderful front desk person put me right at ease. I was given a glass of champagne (much appreciated) and was told that I had the best room they could find (and yes, they sure weren't lying!) I was given a corner room on the 15th floor with 2 balconies (one overlooking the pool). The view was absolutely stunning! The room even had a fridge, which was a big help. The pool is open 24 hours a day, which I really liked, and their grotto pool has to be one of the best pools I have ever been in! I went swimming at 4am and loved it! I didn't eat at the hotel; I ended up walking quite a distance to restaurants and a grocery store, but it wasn't that bad because I enjoy long walks. I left after one night to go to another hotel (used Priceline so you just don't get a choice), but ended up getting walked from that hotel, and got sent right back here! The second room wasn't quite as nice, but it was still great! Activities are plentiful here, and I sure didn't want to leave when it was time to go! I've also stayed at the nearby Hilton, which is not nearly as good as this place; THIS is the place to be. I'm happy my 21st birthday getaway ended on a happy note, and it was all because of this hotel. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: e36mpower
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is recently renovated. The location is great, only a few minutes from Disney World, Downtown Disney and other Disney theme parks. The pool is one of the best pools you will find at a hotel. There are waterfalls, slides, bridges, cave areas, several hot tubs and plenty of lounge chairs. There is a great beach on the lake with hammocks, sail and paddle boats. There are lots of other activities for kids as well. The staff is ok and it took some time to get our room although we were checking in early. There is free self parking which is kind of far from the hotel lobby. The valet parking is $20 per night. There is an $18 per day resort fee but well worth it for the pool. The food and alcoholic drinks are expensive, $12 for a top shelf margarita, but it was good. We found a deal at $90 per night from 1-800 hotel. This hotel will be our first choice when we come back to visit Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: john77voodoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. it was excellent. we got the room for $ 72 a night on priceline. plus the resort fee of $21 a night. we had a good time. it a short drive to downtown disney. the hotel has a beach & 3 pools.3 whirlpools and are open 24 hr a day. the rooms have balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the Heart of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: AshleyM527
Reviews.Content: By far, the most beautiful, wonderful resort I've stayed at... I've been going there about twice a year since birth, and will continue the tradition til the place falls to the ground! The hotel employees are wonderful, kind, and accomodating. The food is delicious... especially the breakfast buffet at Cascade's. My favorite aspect of this hotel is the grotto. They have 3 hottubs... 2 of them being under a relaxing cave with waterfalls. Such a great place to visit... You even remember you were supposed to go to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: buckyfan4
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference at the hotel and I accompanied him. We stayed Thursday through Sunday. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel and our room were clean and comfortable. We stayed in a kind room with a pool view on the forth floor. The view was great. It was quiet and we were well rested. The hotel is so close to outlet shopping, disney and restaurants that we will definately go back. The pool was very nice. There were lots of families with children, but the quiet area was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and clean. The best hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: rachymo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Hyatt for a leisurely 2 week holiday. I agree that after reading the last few reviews I felt I should say my part and hope it helps with the difficult task of choosing a hotel to stay in when you don't know the area. Location: Secluded and private within it's own gorgeous grounds with a golf course, lake and tennis courts (they even have a nature trail that we went one day with bikes rented free from the hotel). It is 1.8 miles from Downtown Disney and they offer bus shuttles to all Disney parks, Seaworld and Universal. There are a lot of places to eat within a 1-2 mile radius from the hotel, aswell as there being about 4 restaurants within the hotel itself. We walked to dinner almost every night, it's a lovely picturesque walk which doesnt take long. We hired a car for 2 days and it was handy to get around or if you want to eat out further away at night, but it's definately not essential - although it would be cheaper to not rent from the hotel. The hotel: I walked into the lobby and was wow'd by the stunning appearance - little fountains, statues and friendly staff who offer to help at every opportunity. The room itself was immaculate and cleaned everyday. We had a view of the city rather than the pool (which would have been ideal) but it's a great view none the less. If you order breakfast in Cascade try the Bennedict - lovely! The buffet breakfast is only on weekends but there are fresh waffles and pancakes and bacon,eggs, pastries, fruit etc. There were a lot of conferences - true, and you did have to walk past suited people but i saw a lot of other people walking around in their pool wear and no one seemed to mind. Pool and facilities are fantastic with little jacuzzi's everywhere and poolside service. Some days the pool was so quiet we were the only ones around - if you like peace and quiet it's great but if you want more of a nightlife I would go closer to I-Drive. One thing I would say - is double check everyday if you go to the theme parks, the times of the shuttles. One day they didn't mention the 11pm bus wasnt running (luckily we were on the 9pm one). I felt so happy to be staying in this hotel and I know my boyfriend did too, the resort fee does sting you at the end but I would pay it again to stay there, it's definately worth it. Without a doubt in my mind I will be going back there one day.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: graciepop123
Reviews.Content: I have never reported on any hotel before but after reading some of the negative reviews i feel i have to. We have just stayed for 9 nights with our daughter. As you arrive you are greeted by your name, then checked in with very helpful staff. We could only book a room with 2 double beds and i was worried about our daughter in a bed so asked if they had any other rooms. We were upgraded to a king sze with a sofa bed with a view of magic kingdom and epcot fieworks, with no charge. The sofa bed was great as the arms acted as side rails so she couldnt fall out. The hotel is fantastic as it has 3 pools, one which is heated. There is also a beach with large hammocks. The white horse bar was great for food and a drink after a long day at the parks. Also ate in Hemmingways and my husband said the fish was great. The staff were all very freindly. The location is about 15 mins to all parks. You do need a car if you are going out at night as taxis are not that cheap. Would stay here again as we were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Meetings, but not for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Inder22
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hyatt Grand Cypress for a business convention. The hotel was located approximately 40 minutes by shuttle from the airport. Overall the hotel was nice. Check in and check out were smooth. The hotel had everything you would expect, ie. gym, restaurants, and golfing. There was nice selection of food and activities available. Unfortunately, the grounds are huge and it is impossible to walk to any surrounding areas. Having a rental car is a must if you decide to come to this hotel and see the sites. I think the hotel does offer a shuttle to Disneyworld, but if you wish to go anywhere else you will need your own car.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: 2firenze
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress several times in the past. We stayed on the club floor during all of our visits. We enjoy the convenience and relaxation this affords. Regret to say we will not stay there again. My husband and I visit Florida a couple of times per year both on business and for pleasure. During our visit last year we stayed at the Ritz and we had a great stay (also on the club floor). When we were faced with choosing a hotel this time my husband suggested we try the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress again since it had been renovated. What a huge mistake. There was no comparison to the Ritz or the Hyatt's former self. The rooms were OK. They changed the location of the club and it really has gone downhill. This is no longer one the best in Orlando. The offerings at the club have spiraled downhill offering nothing but a few stale cookies for the mid day offerings, uncomfortable seating and they are under staffed. We arrived late afternoon after they had just removed the evening offerings. The interesting part is a couple came in after us and the staff brought them out plates of food that had already been put away yet we were not offered the same courtesy. How rude!!! After a day of travel it would have been nice to have been offered the same as other guests but I guess this did not occur to the staff. Not nice. The offerings in themselves are much more limited. The Ritz is comparable in price and offers much more in service and amenities. I strongly suggest staying away from the Hyatt and trying the Ritz. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a BIG Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sisisisisisi
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel, but personally I'm not a fan of huge hotels and prefer something smaller and more personal. The facilities were great, the staff were excellent, but in my opinion the hotel had an identity crisis and couldn't work out if it was catering for Disney Tourists. Events or the Conference crowd. A good example of this would be that if you went to the pool you then had to return to your room via the walk of shame through the main atrium lobby area where you may find 20 or 30 business people suited and booted having meetings or Conference delegates drinking coffee and waiting around before heading back into their rooms. Not the best experience as you walk past in your trunks and a towel wrapped around you! You also literally had to walk half a mile or more to the car park. Little things like that would make me look at alternatives when we return to this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Sib49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress in Orlando for 7 nights for my honeymoon. I then went on a cruise and returned to the Hyatt Grand Cypress for a further 2 days. The hotel is beautiful, nice views we were upgraded to a room with a view of the disney fireworks and given a bottle of champers as we were on honeymoon which was lovely. Upon check in we were NOT advised that we would have a resort fee on top of what we had already paid for the hotel. The resort fee is 12 dollars plus tax per night however the hotel also added a further 15 dollars per night resort fee onto each night of our stay. Which resulted in our resort fee being 27 dollars per night plus tax. I spoke to the staff at the hotel regarding this they said that this was an error and that the resort fee was 12 dollars per night and that we would not be charged for the additional costs. However upon check out of our first 7 nights we were charged 27 dollars per night plus tax. I again had to speak to staff who again said it was an error however they only said this when I disputed the amount. If this was an error why then was a also charged a further 27 dollars per night for the final 2 nights of our stay after our cruise. Again staff said it must have been an error again this was after I had to dispute the charges, again we were happy to pay the 12 dollars per night fee but no more. Only that we had booked and paid for the hotel I would have changed hotels due to the dishonesty. We ate in the hotel once - for breakfast - it was extremely poor to the extent that we could not eat it and we were charged 45 dollars for both. Due to my bad experience with breakfast we did not eat again in the hotel for any meal. The taxi/shuttle/town car service is also a complete rip off and very expensive. On a journey to International Drive we were charged 50 dollars, on a return journey with a different cab company we were charged 30 dollars. A large amount of the hotel staff were very unfriendly. The hotel is not in a very accessible location - there are no regular bus services so if you do not have a car it is not ideal. We did not want a car and therefore would not choose to stay in Lake Buena Vista again. On our last 2 days st the hotel we had a different room on the 8th floor the shower was black with water stains. Although the hotel is beautiful and lovely to stay in he dishonesty and expense had put us right off.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Resort With Fantastic, Fabulous Staff, Dynamite Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Piqua41
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, and from the moment we stepped in the door, we knew here was a place that truly hires the right people. Steven Ballot in particular plus many other bell staff and front desk staffers were extremely intelligent, aimed to please, and gave great suggestions for restaurants. This is the kind of thing, across the board, that makes a difference choosing one place over another, especially in resort-heavy Orlando. We ate at the White Horse Pub one night, and it was fantastic and atmospheric; the food reminded me of five-star offerings at boutique restaurants in other cities. Other conference attendees said the seafood at Hemingway's was the best in the city. The rooms were huge, beds extremely comfortable, the views from several directions beautiful, and the amenities plentiful. The pool was marvelous, too; I liked the fitness center tucked away under the waterfalls. What more could you ask, except to promote and reward all bell staffers. Everyone in the lobby seemed to genuinely care about your experience. So rare!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Heididisco
Reviews.Content: We had Delta Miles and chose this hotel based on a random guess. We were thrilled! After traveling all day we were greeted by a very pleasant staff who handled our baggage and even gave us glasses of champagne at check-in! They upgraded our room to overlook the pool area as well as the EPCOT ball to watch the fireworks at night! The room was immaculate - very contemporary and very clean. The towels were fluffy and soft. The bed linens were nice too - only complaint is that it was 2 double beds (2 queens would have been nicer!) The pool areas were awesome and our boys spent hours swimming. We went paddleboating, played volleyball and chip/putt golf and borrowed bikes (all included in the $18 per day resort fee but well worth it!) We were a very short drive from the Main Gate at Disney and had great access to restaurants such as Fuddruckers, Friday's and The Olive Garden. EXCELLENT!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel just a shame about most of the staff!”
Reviews.Author: crazychikapea
Reviews.Content: We have only just got back from our stay at the hyatt in Orlando. What a wonderful hotel, just amazing. The only thing that spoilt it for both me and my son was that most of the staff at the front desk espesially were extremley rude! The housekeeping staff and the room service staff and all the restaurant staff were great . However as we were stranded for nearly a week in Orlando due to the volcano irruption in Iceland I found that the front desk staff were very unhelpfull at the best of times. I have stayed at many other Hyatt hotel around the world and with decor of this hotel is at par other than that very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, scary dungeon workout room!”
Reviews.Author: Tarroyo
Reviews.Content: My title is a bit of a joke, the rooms were fantastic, the pool was beautiful, the property well maintained. There was a wedding while we were there and everyone went out on the balcony's and clapped, it was very nice. Finding the workout room was an interesting experience. It was in this cave near the pool, we had not explored and had to have someone show us. It was really a non-issue, just a heads up, look for the cave by the pool if you are searching for the workout room. My only true complaint was no free internet in the room. It's the year 2010, the AP's were present, with a daily resort fee should come free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - Expensive food”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort with a great pool. The restaurants were expensive $16 for a coke and hamburger w/o tip. You can not walk anywhere from the resport so you will need a car or stay at the facility for all your meals. They have Disney transportation - but, I did not use it. My room faced the lake - so there was no special view. I requested a fireworks view and could not get it with my rate. I had a bit of a problem checking in; I am not sure about their reservation system as it was made direct with the hotel. If you are looking for one lcoation to stay and not go around, this would be OK, but, bring lots of money.

Reviews.Title: “When you don't want to go anywhere, loads to do and enjoy here!!”
Reviews.Author: Alakowe
Reviews.Content: My wife had a conference in Orlando and decided to tag along. Some old pictures didn't look all that great but when we got there??? Boy o boy, what a nice place. It's on a resort so has lots of grounds around it, nicely manicured and landscaped. The rooms have been done up and considering we stayed in another hotel close by on a previous trip, this beats it hands down. The room size was good and the window as wide as the room so if you wanted a lot of light, you'd get it. Though there is a resort fee, it includes, parking, swimming pools, bicycle rides, canoeing and boat rides, golf course, game room, 24hr gym fully equipped... I can't remember all the other attractions but they were a lot and made our stay there pleasant. So for the days we were not going to disney (about 10 mins away) or Universal studios (about 12 mins away) there was enough to keep us occupied. We didn't eat the hotel food. Don't normally eat hotel food cos we're mostly out so can't tell about that, but there are quite a number of restaurants in the building. However, I short 2 min drive and you'll find yourself in the midst of several eateries from Macs to Olive garden and the likes so it's proximity to all this was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Property”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2001a
Reviews.Content: This property is just amazing- from the rooms to the restaurants. Service was flawless and the rooms recently renovated and beautiful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and bring the family.

Reviews.Title: “Success at Disney”
Reviews.Author: pennytourslondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything.Quiet location , close to all of Disney World ,resort feeling as it has pools waterslides, bikes, pitch and putt, a climbing wall and sailing boats on its own lake and all this is included in the resort price . If you do not wish to eat in the hotel within walking distance(about 7 mins ) are all the family restaurants and shops you would need. The only criticism I have is that the hotel bus goes to Magic Kingdom in the morning and does not return until 7.30 pm. The staff were very helpful and our 3 rooms were excellent especially the 2 joining for younger children , they had plenty of room. We could all see the fireworks in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “One word: excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Tapie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we just stayed too short. They offer so many services: a very big and ordinary swimming pool, tennis lanes, a golf course and a large lake for sailing or other water activities. They even got jogging parcours at their terrain. And there still is more! Rooms are just excellent: large with a big bed, a couch, a balcony and a superb bathroom. Everything has been well maintained and cleaned good. Service is also of a very high level. Really wanna go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely THE place to stay while in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: WtrSkiChik
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed with this resort while planning a trip to Disney with your family. It is as close as most of the disney resorts and provides excellent service as a complete high quality resort. The pool area is outstanding and includes two water slides for the kids. It has a multitude of chairs to lounge while the kiddies are playing and also includes a beach with its own small lake. There is a bar within the pool area available for food and drinks as well as a restaurant directly off of the pool area. There are also hotel staff who will deliver your food and drink directly to your poolside chairs and charge it to your room! A climbing rock wall, golf, bikes, boats and much much more are all included with the daily 'resort' fee which is completely worth it. The employees were friendly and made sure we were always happy. There is also a starbucks coffee house in the lobby which is an excellent addition to any hotel in my opinion. The breakfast buffet within the hotel was also amazing and the most incredible waiter even had the entire dining room sing happy birthday to my six year old with a personalized plate of goodies (written in a chocolate script). I was more than satisfied with this resort and stay - I was absolutely impressed. I positively know that this would be THE place I would stay if I were lucky enough to return to Orlando. My only complaint is that with Disney so close and only seven days to stay we didn't get enough time to spend at this amazing resort for our vacation! Thank you Hyatt Grand Cypress for making our trip one of the most memorable family vacations I am sure we will ever have.

Reviews.Title: “Going back”
Reviews.Author: MichiganPicturechick
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at numerous resorts and hotels in the Orlando area, and this one won it as one of our favorites. We liken it to one of the Disney Deluxe Resorts, minus the Mice, as my hubby put it, which was just fine with our teenager. There is so much to do here, its a shame to just stay at the parks and not spend a few days here. We spent all of our time in the parks, and wished we had a few extra days just to hang out at the resort. The customer service was wonderful, and I did not find the tipping to be excessive at all. Someone else posted about the walk in from self parking, again we did not find it to be bad. If you want a long haul stay at the Marriott World Center, terrible there. The food at the White Horse was good and the grounds were beautiful, so many pools, so many hottubs, so little time.... We will be back, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “No Pool Service after 6PM? Seriously????”
Reviews.Author: jennsabell
Reviews.Content: I'm going to do my best to give a fair review here. After all the research I did selecting this hotel, I want to help others with this post. Let me first say that while I'm not a seasoned world traveler, I've stayed at some pretty nice hotels in my time (Atlantis, The Breakers, Ritz, Princeville Kaui)--so I know a thing or two about quality service and don't mind spending high $$ when it's worth it. First the good stuff. There are three large beautiful pools with water slides and waterfalls ((great for kids)). There is a beach area by the lake with FREE bike, kayak, and paddle boats to use. Running trails. Pitch and put golf. There is a rock climbing wall (only open 12-3) and various kids activities throughout the day. The service staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean. Grounds are beautiful. As for the bad/ugly: This place is BIG TIME expensive--and I'm not quite sure why! Be prepared to spend 16$ (NOT including "service charge" or tip) for a salad served on a paper plate. I have NO ISSUES DROPPING SOME CASH ON VACATION, but if I'm eating a 20$ salad, it better be amazing--and this was not. If you like to drink by the pool, your gonna spend at least 6 dollars (w/o tip) for a beer 12$ or more for a mixed drink. There is ONE heated pool (82degrees)--the other two are FREEZING (62 degrees). With this said, you better reserve yourself a chair by the heated pool EARLY if you want a spot where you can watch your kids! Some people had their chairs staked out before 7 am! ALL FOOD AND DRINK OUTSIDE/BY THE POOL SHUTS DOWN BY 6PM!!?? If you plan on enjoying an "inexpensive dinner" by the pool ((like the infamous 20$ salad)) you can forget it. There is nothing else casual/inexpensive to choose unless you have a Dominos pizza delivered to the pool area. I don't know about you, but trying to get three tired kids to behave at one of their two upscale resturants after a day at the park would be a nightmare, so make other arrangements if you are back in time for dinner/cocktails. This was the worst part for us, as we love to sit by the pool until late in the evening and watch the kids play while having some drinks and casual dinners. It didn't happen here. There are smokers in the hotel--and you will smell it in the halls. I have read other posts on this site that support this claim. Finally, review every bill--they overcharged us once at the White Horse Resturant, and then overcharged us by TWO DAYS at checkout! Glad my husband recognized the error or we would have overpaid by over 500$$ !!!! Overall--pretty nice place, but we won't be back. If I had to do over, I'd probably try the Ritz/JW Marriott or go back to a Disney Property for the $$ we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: nagirroc
Reviews.Content: I 'won' this hotel through Priceline, and got it for a good price. Sure it's beautiful, and service is great - but everytime you turn around, you feel like you have to tip someone. I really don't mind doing some things for myself! Then, we are a family with 3 small children - the rooms were CRAZY SMALL!! I mean - 2 drawers in the sleeping area?? Come on - there was just no where to put anything. Then the beds are only double beds - b/c nothing bigger would fit! And how about all the glass vases all over the room? Definitely not family friendly. Also - a large glass shower door that only covers half of the shower??? I mean, that was just not working for the kids who want to take a shower - there was water everywhere! Then the sliding door that doubled as a bathroom door and a closet door - so irritating - no lock either. Then - they have this great pool - but there is NO WHERE to hang the wet bathing suits. There is water dripping everywhere - and did I mention that there are no laundry facilities? Oh wait - if you want them to wash a pair of shorts it will cost you $6 - ridiculous. Just another thing that drove me crazy was no free Wi-Fi. I can go to a Travelodge for $50/night and get free Wi-Fi, but not at a Hyatt????? One more thing - parking is out of control - I think it took us almost 10 minutes to walk from the car to the room! We will never go to this hotel again - just not for our family at all.

Reviews.Title: “we love it, just add free wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: gogugigi
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while doing the Disney with brats. We liked the pool, the lake, the mini beach. To pay for all those they will nickel and dime you: 5$ a bottle of water and $14 per day for internet. Sushi was great at White Horse.

Reviews.Title: “Guests were smoking in rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rvetter
Reviews.Content: We wanted to love this resort but the managements repsonse to the guests in the room below us smoking was shocking. We could predict like clock work when they got back to the room and lit up. We called nicely requesng the front desk ask them to smoke on the balcony and not in the room. We were told Hyatt allows smoking in the rooms and just fines the guest for smoking! What good did that do us? Our room smelled like smoke all evening. The next evening was a repeat though this time the assistant manager offered to move us at midnight! We had already been here 5 days, why not have them move? It is terrible that a resort as nice as this cannot live up to the promise that they are a smoke free property. As for the staff other than the manager I cannot say enough good things about the service. Everyone was friendly, efficient and service oriented. We have stayed at this hotel 4 times. The main areas are a bit worn but the rooms are 4 star worthy. Be aware the bathroom door doubles as the closet door and can cause some awkard moments. Hemingways restaurant is lovely and a quiet escape from normal Orlando chaos. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at this tip top hotel”
Reviews.Author: orlando5
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two weeks we have just spent at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress and enjoyed every minute of our stay. Everything about this hotel is perfectly thought out, the wonderful atrium, the restaurants, the amazing swimming pools, golf course and lake. The service is impeccable, the staff are attentive and friendly without being too 'over the top'. The children were treated very well. The view from our 6th floor room was incredible, we could see Epcot, Downtown Disney and Magic Kingdom in the distance and could watch the fireworks from the parks every night. I particuarly loved the Eastern influence with beautiful statues, and artworks at every turn. The location is perfect, right on the edge of Disney property with a fantastic selection of shops and restaurants over the road. For us it was lovely to be able to leave the parks behind at the end of a long day and enjoy the different environment that the hotel offered. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Gran Cypress”
Reviews.Author: hrmomx2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Grand Cypress. Overall, a very pleasant stay and a beautiful property. My kids loved all of the activities including the great pools, paddle boating, mini-golf, and bikes. Loved that all of the resort activities are included in your room fee/daily resort fee, no nickle and diming here. The staff was extremely courteous and accomodating-couldn't have asked for more. We ate breakfast at the hotel each day and had several lunchs and dinners at the hotel also. We enjoyed all of the food. The newly renovated rooms were very nice, however, the two double beds are tight for 2 adults, 2 children. My son slept on the couch by the window (fine for a smaller child) which worked out well, but otherwise the sleeping arragements would have been very difficult and they do not allow rollaways. Also the closet door doubling as a bathroom door is very awkward and a truly odd design. The hotel is very convienent to the parks and to Downtown Disney. We would definitely stay here again if the family can sleep in one room. Booking two rooms for our four person family is out of the question.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be Missed”
Reviews.Author: FSU2000
Reviews.Content: Classy, contemporary hotel, extremely clean. Loved the glass of champagne at check-in. This is the first hotel I’ve visited that had its own art gallery. There’s plenty to do on-site including biking, canoeing, kayaking, sailing, paddle boats and walking/jogging trails. This is a great place to stay for business or pleasure. Kids and adults will equally enjoy, plus it’s close to Downtown Disney and upscale outlet shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: DanielaS44
Reviews.Content: The service was great! tHey had a very nice entrance too!

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt Grand Cypress Rocks”
Reviews.Author: funmomofone
Reviews.Content: We are a family with a 4 year old. This was our first trip to Orlando and Disney. The hotel sits close to Epcot and Magic Kingdom. TONS of outdoor activities to do for a family--bike ride (they even had training wheels for our little one), paddle boats, sand toys for playing on the private beach, hammocks, several large pools and three hot tubs, rock climbing wall, and waterslides. There is a smaller waterslide for our preschooler. The hotel staff was friendly and everytime we called the front desk or room service, they called us by name. Clean, modern rooms. The beds were comfortable and the linens were crisp and fresh. The resort has several restaurants, however, not much for a family with younger children. We used room service a lot. The room service had a great kids menu and tasted good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: TruckCompany2025
Reviews.Content: I was attending a wedding for the weekend and I was really impressed with my overall stay. I had a King Bed overlooking the lake. The room was fresh, up to date and I really liked that I did not have a tub but a shower instead. I cannot recall the last bath I took at a hotel! The front desk staff was very friendly, the valets could have been a bit more coordinated as I had to prompt them for assistance. The pool was excellent and the hammocks on the beach rock. The housekeeper actually said hello and overall I was truly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but someunwelcome changes”
Reviews.Author: Paula R
Reviews.Content: We've been coming back to The Hyatt Grand Cypress once or twice every year for 17 years. Our kids call it our home away from home. Sadly, I have to admit our last trip was disappointing in some ways. After the recent refurbishment, the once lush, gorgeous lobby is now stark and cold. The redecorated rooms are okay (our kids preferred the new design), but the sliding closet/bathroom door idea is ridiculous and the sleek, spartan look isn't particularly practical. Honestly, it's hard to believe they got much "loyal customer" input on the ergonomic aspects of the new design. The biggest negative change is the room service menu. They used to have a varied menu with great selections for the kids and it was open 24/7. After a long day at the parks, we always looked forward to returning to our room and having a relaxing, delicious dinner in our room. Now the room service menu is limited and pricey, especially the children's menu, which now offers mostly junky fried foods. What a disappointment! It's clear they are focusing on guests from the numerous conferences they host simultaneously and no longer catering to families. In fact, the hotel was so crowded with conferences and reunions and weddings that we were never able to park in the guest parking lot, but had to park about 1/2 a mile away and hike back to the hotel each night -- not what you want to do after walking around WDW for 10 hours! Also, I needed to print out something and was directed to the business center. Even though we paid for Internet service for our room, I had to pay for a different, very pricey internet service in the business center in order to use the printer. Even the cheap hotels give you printer access these days - but not the Hyatt! On the plus side, the wait staff in the Cascade Restaurant was as awesome as always! They remember us from visit to visit and even remembered that we usually come on my birthday -- so they surprised me with a cake. Jose in the Cascades is outstanding!!! Also, Hemingway's is the hidden jewel of Orlando restaurants. It's one of the finest meals we've ever had. The folks at the front desk were cordial and helpful as always and the grounds -- especially the pool and slide -- are amazing. Our kids love the many activities -- swimming, boating, rock climbing -- and since most of the hotel guests are attending conferences the pool area is never overcrowded. We will give the Grand Cypress one more try on our next visit, but if it continues to disappoint we'll have to try somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “Grand resort with fantastic waterfall and grotto pool.”
Reviews.Author: kitesurfcaddy
Reviews.Content: A very nice 4 star property. Undergoing and probably close to completion of its multi-million dollar renovation.This resort covers many acres of land. There are activities for the entire family. A rock climbing wall, great gym with sauna/steam, grotto-style jacuzzis and pool, waterslide, kids club, stunning 20 story atrium lobby with glass elevators, champagne served @ check-in, bicycles, non-motorized boats/canoes for lake, lush beautiful surroundings, golf course and tennis, free parking, executive floor offered nice breakfast and cocktails with good service. However, the rooms are fairly "average" and uninteresting. Not sure if they have been updated?? Bedding is OK. Service is OK. Poolside food and casual restaurant is weak! Hemingway's restaurant was nice but overpriced. I have stayed at this hotel 4 times and it has improved overtime. I have always been satisfied with my stay. It is not too "Disney" but still very welcoming of children. I would recommend this resort to ALL types of travelers (very few hotels get this credit) except partygoers. The ambiance of this hotel and its amenities make this hotel a great value!!

Reviews.Title: “I felt welcome from the minute I arrived”
Reviews.Author: Olympiclearview
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and figured there was a reason why it was sooo reasonable...we couldn't have been more mistaken! We were welcomed and made to feel som through the entirety of our stay. The only issue we had was when we decided on dinner in the bar & grill in the hotel - we walked in after a huge rush and you could tell the staff was trying to catch up and recover...the food was ok and you could tell the staff wanted to go home - though I certainly understand why!

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: pvilletraveler
Reviews.Content: Secured this hotel through Priceline which means I was blind to the hotel until after submitting the bid and I would do it again in a heart beat. We stayed overnight on a Saturday a day early before checking into our Baytowers resevation at WDW. For those of you on the fence about whether you should stay here to access Disney or not, do it! The pool and resort amenities are better than disney properties and the rooms are going to be as nice as anything Disney is doing at their top end resorts. Trust me when I say this, the room renovation is top notch. Not really sure what others are having a problem with the sliding door to the bathroonm (which is huge) or the size of the room itself. We easily got a large crib in our room hallway (they have two different sizes of cribs, unique). Our 2 1/2 year had a bed as big as his back home. In comparision Disney has smallish pack in plays for kids. Back to amenities the fridge in the room is great, the heated pool outside wonderful, and the "feel" of the hotel was top notch. The room is very stylish and I think that anyone who likes clean, fresh, and modern will really enjoy this Hyatt. Even the parking is not a big deal and a short walk especially for FREE. You can of course valet. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best that Hyatt has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Skinsfan76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on business. This hotel has some of the best amenities that I've seen in a long time. The pool is amazing. It is geared to both kids and adults. Plenty of deck space, and a slide for the kids. The waterfall is a nice touch and seperates the different pools as well as hides the bar. The outdoor running path is really nice (signage could be better though) and has three different length options. The work out facility is excellent and has individual tvs at all the cardio equipmenbt. The room itself was very nice and plenty of space for a business traveler. A family migh feel a little cramped, but it depends on your expectations. I definately would stay again, and would bring my family next time to enjoy the amenities. You can even go straight into disney off the same road this resort is on w/o getting on the highway. Not the quickest, but it could be depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smoke77
Reviews.Content: My wife, 6 year old daughter, and I just finished staying at the hotel (departed Mar 12) and really enjoyed the stay despite the monsoon rains and cool weather. It was too chilly to use the unheated monster pool but the small heated pool was fine. The amneties really didn't get used much when you are travelling to any of the theme parks. With hot weather you could just stay at the hotel to enjoy the pool. The service at the breakfast restaurant was the best. Watch out for the doors going into the bathroom or you could injure your fingers. The hotel grounds are stunning and so is the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: Danigliano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. They have wonderful grounds, pools, hot tubs and lots to do. The rooms were modern and cleaned well. We had a room facing the pool and could see the fireworks at Disney at night. The shuttle drivers were very accommodation and drove us to the entrance when we wanted to leave the property for meals. We ate in the hotel a few times but was expensive for a family of four. The buses that they have going to the parks could be more frequent but what we saved in room rate it was well worth it to take the occasional taxi. Overall, we really enjoyed this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: CharlottesMommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and overall had a good experience. The front desk people are very efficient and when asked to research a billing error for room service did so pleasantly. The room was on 15th floor corner view of entire Orlando area. Wow! Self parking is a major hike and if something is going on in their conference wing you must walk the long way around outsied in the elements to get to parking. When directed to do so during an apparent Pepsico conference I had to go thru "construction" debris left by the convention set up crew out on this walkway with no apologies from the staff that directed me there. It did not make me feel welcome at All. I had breakfase 2 mornings at their lovely restaurant facing a natural area. The breakfast is nothing to write home about but the service was extremely good. The poached eggs had water in them and the steak was very undercooked. Next day's breakfast from the buffet was cold potatoes and hard bacon. Not good at all. Don't spend the high dollars to eat breakfast here. Dinner my first night was in a sports bar/grill and I ordered a crab cake sandwich. Service was exceedingly poor in fact non existent. The waitress never came to my table after taking my order the entire time. In fact the evening manager took care of me. When she came to ask if I wanted any thing else I refused and left her a tip to indicate my lack of appreciation for her unapologetic bad service. All together though I will say the stay was good and I felt safe there by myself. I would say it is perhaps a bit overpriced if I take in to consideration the entire cost of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great room, gerat property!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roaches02
Reviews.Content: Went onto Priceline the Tuesday evening before Thanksgiving to try and book any Disney-area 5* resort for Thanksgiving Day plus Friday - we got the Grand Cypress, a 5* resort for $65/night - what a steal! Arrived on Thanksgiving Day in the early afternoon for their Thanksgiving brunch - it was unbelievable. Awesome selection, superb presentation, excellent flavors and amazing choices - this alone was as good as it gets. The dining room was fairly full w/families, couples, and even a few single diners, yet the service was spot-on. Everything was great. Our room was excellent - 2 separate set of windows/balconies overlooking both the Mouse House as well as Epcot - we got two firework shows each night, one at 9 @ Magic Kingdom followed by another one at 10 @ Epcot - so cool to be laying in a huge king-size bed and watching fireworks outside while making some fireworks of our own inside. Took advantage of the in-house spa services the next day - just perfect. We heard the rooms were recently renovated - ours had a sort of Japanese style, w/a bathroom door that doubled as our closet door - a little strange, but nothing to quibble about. Our room was spacious; the king-size bed was to-die-for comfortable; the pool area was huge w/several small, intimate in-ground hot tubs scattered around many hidden rock grotto-like areas; the entire property inside and out was immaculate; and did I mention the service was incredible? All in all, an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but...”
Reviews.Author: cvcaudit
Reviews.Content: The grounds & pool areas of this hotel are spectacular. From the outside the hotel building looks a little dated, but step inside to a wonderfully updated, modern & fresh look. Absolutely love the new showers, closets, and clean look of the rooms. Wonderful place, but...I am sitting in my room (1024) at 7:44pm and it has not yet been cleaned. A friendly call to housekeeping one hour ago, "no problem, I just need new towels" still has not resulted in the knock at the door. Bartenders, room service, front desk, convention and restaurant staff have been top notch. The only other bad part was the windows rattle in high winds so last night was a rough nights sleep. After a poor nights sleep I was looking forward to a nice relaxing shower because this hotel feels a lot like a spa. It's a great experience that ended on a sour note. Wait...a knock at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: Steph000
Reviews.Content: I know many reviews found some fault with this hotel like the sparseness of the rooms and the small closet; however, I quite prefer a room that is spacious, well organized (the closet is well organized and there is plenty of drawer space), with plenty of room to move around and this room had it all! A wonderful bed, a great desk/work area, a couch to lounge on, a balcony and a beautiful bathroom with great amenities! The towels are wonderful and thick, but you may want to keep an eye out for the shower water leaking out onto the floor a little, good thing they provide a bathmat to help soak up the water. Some reviewers did comment as well on the door to the bathroom/closet and I would agree, watch your hand! I, myself ,got a finger caught while opening the bathroom door, so be careful. Loved the fact that they are a green hotel as well There is a waste basket in the room for just recyclables and the shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and body wash containers were made from 100% recycled plastic. AWESOME. We also enjoyed that they had a fridge. Personally, we prefer a fridge over a minibar any day so we can stock up on the items we want to use. Also, we loved the decor. Especially the first floor. It has a very cool Asian theme going on and it is quite beautiful and relaxing with the water. We also had a wonderful view. We let the concierge know that we were there on our anniversary and he placed us on the top floor, the 18th, with a view over all of Disney. We watched the fireworks from both MK (8pm) and Epcot (9pm)! It was so cool. Location is perfect! The hotel is close to downtown Disney with several restaurants on location. While they do have several restaurants on location, hubby and I opted for dining out while we were in town as there are ton right around the corner, so I cannot comment on the food of the establishment (sorry) Parking is free, unless you opt for valeting, There is also an $18 resort fee, but that is because they have pools, hot tubs, and bikes for you to use. They also have a beach and sailboat, and I believe paddle boats (BTW, most of the resorts in the WDW area have comparable resort fees). They do have internet access as well for a fee which we did not utilize. All and all it was a beautiful newly redesigned establishment that I could find no fault with. However, if I had one recommendation for the establishment, it would be to include some bathrobes. Great hotel, would stay again and definately advise others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a smell”
Reviews.Author: richpill
Reviews.Content: We went Florida to go the visit Disney world. The hotel was beautiful. Great looking pool but we hit the cold snap where it dipped below freezing so we never got to use it . there is 3 different hot tubs and we visited one and it was nice and relaxing. they have a gym. We were in a nice location. was nice and quiet. the room was plenty big for just the two of us. There is a musty smell to the hotel rooms though. We attributed to there was no bathroom fan so all the steam in the shower lingered. But we turned on the fan and heater on and kept the window open and it got a bit better. The hotel was relatively close to the Disney parks. we rented a car. It will cost quite a lot if you are driving because of parking.. It cost $18 to park at the hotel. then $14 to park at the Disney parks per day. So just put that as part of your budget. We cannot say anything about the resteraunts since we never ate there. People were friendly but we did interact that much. The bed was nice and we slept pleasantly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel, in a relatively quiet part of Orlando. The room, 1750 on the 17th floor, was a reasonable size and newly refurbished, with a comfortable bed and sofa. The views from the balcony were excellent. We had upgraded to a Club room, which gave access to a very smart lounge, with a lovely terrace overlooking the pool area. Breakfast was served in here and comprised a very good selection of cold items and drinks, and complimentary drinks and nibbles are served in the evening as well. Service was very good as well. We only used one restaurant, the White Horse Bar & Grill, which was very busy, resulting in slightly slow service, but the food was good. We loved the pool, which is imaginatively designed and there is also a well equipped gym in the same area. And there is self parking!

Reviews.Title: “So sad :(”
Reviews.Author: wylde595
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel for the last twenty years and when we saw the 'concept' room for the refurb decided to book for this trip. The rooms are very nice, quite sparse and to be honest not much space for your clothes(2 adults one child in room one, 2 adults in room 2, connecting rooms). Everybodies comment about the wardrobe door/bathroom door is true, we all nearly had our hand chopped off on more than one occasion!! So be aware. The Hotel as a building is still beautiful, the pools, the lake, the atrium etc, all fab. However, the Palm Cafe now closes at 5pm - no use at all if you fancy a quick bite when returning from the parks. Room service is no longer 24 hours, it finishes at 1am. Transportation to parks :- This was once one of the biggest draws for us, never driven in the US and don't intend to so the Hyatt Transportation system used to offer more than one drop off and pick up from each of the parks. Now its only MK, Universal and Seaworld with limited times. This meant we spent a fortune on cabs (the weather was lousy too so we 'had' to get home some days). The majority of the staff were disinterested, apathetic almost - especially the concierge women, with the exception of Bob from the Palm and Vonda from poolside who always had time for a chat and a debate! The Hotel itself seems to be concentrating more on the Conference/Wedding packages than the family type of guest and thats fine, one way to pay for the refurb but I feel cheated that they haven't changed their information to reflect this. Overall I am very sad..... we will not return to this Hotel and since it was our Honeymoon Hotel and more over the years its such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk”
Reviews.Author: RyanS12
Reviews.Content: The front desk girl was very helpful,hotel wa sclean and comfey and close to everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “oh dear...”
Reviews.Author: Star1405
Reviews.Content: i would like to start by saying that if you plan to stay here for Disneyland parks like we did then the location is good, however you will have to put up with a multitude of issues like we did. Firstly we found the food in this hotel ghastly, certainly not what we are used to. the restaurant that was open in the evening was crossed between a sushi steakhouse and room service was not much better. We tried to consult conciege to find out where outside the hotel we could go to eat and no joke, she could barely string a sentence together and was no help whatsoever. Whilst out at one of the theme parks we phoned into the hotel to ask them to make us a dinner reservation at the marriott hotel - for some reason unbeknown to us they were unable to do so and unable to phone us back on our english mobile phone. The hotel has been recently re-furbished. The room we stayed in was ultra modern but it felt very business like and sparse. Our mini bar was empty and we were inconvenienced by a bathroom door that doubled up as a cupboard door - very bizarre and you'll see what i mean if you choose to stay here. On the plus side the hotel was clean, although not very comfortable and you could hear alot of noise through the paperthin walls. Disney is a stones through away by car but take into consideration all the other not so great things if you choose to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Two different stays,both good!”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to stay at this property in Jan. and Feb. 2010 and both stays were nice . Property has been upgraded and rooms have high end beding,linens and towels.The location was right next to disney with very nice pool,health club, and extra activities but these come with additional costs. My stay in Feb had a few concerns,NO iron in room had to request one. No chair to sit on. I ask if one could be brought to the room but it NEVER appeared in 4 days.. I returned after being gone for 6 hrs.and room had NOT been serviced.Had a charge for long distance call on my bill that I did not make but it was removed quickly.Front desk,bell staff were super nice and this is a gated property which I liked because I was a woman traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: neo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights then come back for 1 more night at the end of our FL trip. The renovated room are very clean and modern. We enjoyed the resort amenities such as the swimming pools, bicycles, putting golf (all included with the resort fee). The free parking is a good money saving point for the $18+tax resort fee is a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Sashat06
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! The only down side was the parking. We didn't have to walk far but it's little walk to the lobby. We had a room looking over the pool and from the balcony we could watch the disney fireworks. The room we got was the renovated one so it was very nice. Great closet and huge shower. The pools were amazing and it was so nice to relax on the hammocks after a busy day. I thought the location was wonderful. It was right down the road from downtown disney and not much further to the rest of the parks. I'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A total ripoff”
Reviews.Author: touchofeurope
Reviews.Content: Hotel was touted as luxury but I've stayed in 2 star places that were better. Incredible rip-off and nickel and diming going on. The rooms were renovated and TINY. The bed was incredibly uncomfortable, and what was advertised as a Kingsize was in fact much smaller. No storage space in the room and just bad all around, to the point we cut our trip short and moved to the Caribe Royale where we'd stayed before. Restaurants were BAD and over pried. And as a penalty for doing this they charged us an extra night. Lovely way to make customers even unhappier, charge them a penalty for leaving if they do not like your place. Do not plan to stay at any more Hyatts as a result (and I travel 90 or so nights per year!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: SLG1
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at Grand Cypress. We enjoy off of the amenities and the level of service is equal to most 5 star hotels. AAA provides a great package for Florida residents, and we usually take advantage of those offers. The resort was recently remodeld and everything looks great!

Reviews.Title: “Huge property, nice rooms -- but not convenient to Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: PB_travelers
Reviews.Content: First good thing to know is that this resort is not as convenient into the Disney parks as you would think. It is near an entrance to the Disney properties, but you have to jump on the highway to access Magic Kingdom, Epcot, etc. With that said, the resort/hotel was very nice. The rooms, especially, are trendy and comfortable - the shower was especially great and bed/linens to Hyatt-standards. There were several semi-private hot tubs throughout the property's grounds, which were a unique surprise. Restaurants looked nice, but were crazy-expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: davdell0812
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at this hotel the weekend of 1/9. The hotel is very close to all Disney attractions (especially Downtown Disney) and also near a ton of restaurants. The room we had was very nice and exceptionally clean. The lobby and the grounds were beautiful. The pool was very large but we never got to use it due to the very cold weather. Overall I enjoyed the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and property”
Reviews.Author: ac_utumi
Reviews.Content: In general, we enjoyed very much our stay in this Hotel. The hotel is beautiful, the room is very comfortable and probably recently renovated. They just need to invest more in the service, specially the area for the breakfast - because it was a high season (we stayed there from Xmas until New Year) and the hotel was full, we had to wait long to sit, and the service wasn´t so good. Anyway, I noted that people there was trying to do their best to serve as well as possible, but the hotel was really crowded and they need to invest in structure to permit a better service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: ald1122
