Reviews.Content: We thought the Hyatt Grand Cypress was great! The location was close enough to Disney for us, although this was not the main purpose of our trip. It took about a half hour via the complimentary shuttle to get there. The property was beautiful and we hope to go back and enjoy the pool area another time. All of the staff members we encountered were very helpful, friendly and really seemed to enjoy working there. The rooms were great as well. We didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel, but wish we could have! We found the prices reasonable for the most part. My only complaint was my cappucino at the lobby coffee bar was close to $8. If you can live with basic coffee at the breakfast buffett (which was inlcuded in our package and excellent) you'll be fine :)

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Resort Fee's”
Reviews.Author: shaunaNc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress resort 12/28-1/2/2010. The updated room was nice and the grounds/pools were great. The location is very close to the parks and was very convient. Some things to consider... Be prepared before you pull up to have all of your luggage together. The doorman quickly got bent out of shape because we wanted to unload our own luggage. He reached in and grabbed the bags out of the truck and carried them inside in a huff.. We are talking all of five minutes. There was no one behind us.. The resort fee is rediculous. I have never stayed at a hotel or resort that charged for the in room coffee, parking (back lot- not valet), turn down service etc). You have no choice and are billed automatically $19 a day for ordinary services that other hotels provide.. This fee should be quoted up front in the price of the room. The room service charges are over priced as well. In addition to the resort fee, you also have a separate daily fee to use the internet. These were are only complaints. The staff was nice and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better Hyatts”
Reviews.Author: doublebzz
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have indicated, the hotel is a "stone's throw" from the Disney resorts, restaurants and other attractions. The down side of this convenience is the horendous traffic as soon as you exit the hotel. We were socked with a daily undisclosed $20(incl tax) resort fee for our 2 night stay. I wouldn't have minded that much except the weather was frigid over the New Year weekend so we couldn't use any of the facilities. Our room on the 7th floor was nice enough although they couldn't provide a King bed as we requested. Because we didn't want to fight the traffic one night, we opted to dine in the hotel's moderately priced White Horse (billed as a sports bar) Cafe. They serve sushi, burgers and alike. Our steak sandwich and fries was excellent. All in all, the hotel was pleasant at our $70 a night winning bid on Priceline. At a price much above that, I would opt to stay at one of the Disney on site hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: nrg132
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this hotel, and just like ur previous visit, the hotel did not disappoint. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, and modern. The staff is wonderful and the amenities on property are second to none. The pool and hot tub areas are wonderful and activities such as paddle boats in the lake, the excercise room, and pitch and putt golf course are great. If you want a break from the normal hotel experience and want luxury and relaxation, look no further. Our family enjoyed 7 great nights at this hotel and we wish we could have stayed longer! We will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Resort, Recently Renovated, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: PhillyFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: Just wrapping up a 5 night stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress Resort in Orlando. We had been here prior to the remodel and were very happy to see that they had completely upgraded the rooms to more acceptable design. Previously, the rooms were green and hideous. New remodel has a more contemporary, sleek look with flat screen TV and hip art. Now, a few things they definitely did not do right on the remodel: 1. As mentioned in another review, I don't know who designed the new single piece bathroom/closet door -- but whoever did this must not have considered how dangerous this design is. If someone is using the closet area, where the safe is, and if someone is in the bathroom, they can slide the door without notice and seriously injure whoever is at the other end of that door. This is a lawsuit waiting to happen. Twice, my kids slid the bathroom door open and WHAM smacked the safe closed. If someone had their hand there, we'd be at the hospital. Whoever designed this should be barred from designing any further hotel rooms. The next act of stupidity was the new shower design. They have installed a half piece of glass on a hinge that is supposed to look cool -- but results in water ALL OVER THE FLOOR. Stepped out of the shower and nearly landed on my butt. Had I slid into that one piece door -- it would have been a real domino effect. Speaking of which, there's no lock on the bathroom door? WTF? No privacy travelling with kids. Terrible design. A couple other things we didn't like: The tv remote is useless. Doesn't do anything to the volume. They moved the center night stand where the phone should go. If you are on the bed furthest from the phone, you have to get up and walk all the way around. Finally -- let's talk about the food. I'm sorry folks, but the Hyatt has lost their mind with their menu. Where the heck do you get off IN THIS ECONOMY to charge $15.00 for eggs? C'mon. That's $60.00 for (4) people. And if you want it sent to your room, add a $3 service charge and 20%. The whole thing is ludicrous. Should have a $7.95 or $8.95 breakfast and make it reasonable to eat in the hotel. I can WELL AFFORD the $15 -- but refuse to spend it out of principle. It's just absurd. There are 15 other places to eat across the street and I'll spend my money there and get some value. Now, with respect to the location, grounds and room value -- it's excellent. We have stayed on the Disney property in the past and it's not worth it. We will however carefully evaluate the Ritz and new Hilton next visit as it is clear that the Hyatt has lost touch with reality on the other details besides the price of the room. One last comment about the parking. The $20 per night valet is also absurb -- and the self park is not THAT far.. but does fill up. Hotel should cut the valet rate in half and/or just add it to the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch resort”
Reviews.Author: LorenzSingapore
Reviews.Content: The grand cypress is an enclosed resort with its own guardhouse which you should feel very safe. Entrance lobby is a tall atrium where you can look your way up 16 storeys (I think) to the ceiling. Grand. I initially pass my car to valet but the reception told me its $20 a day, so $100 for my stay and asked me to self park instead. The valet happily fetched my car and let me self park. I'm glad to give them a good tip for the trouble. Was offered an upgrade to a 'very nice high floor' suite at $130 a nite but I rejected it. There's also a resort fee of $16 a nite. The normal room (non upgraded) is pretty good and I'm happy I didn't took the suite upgrade. Outside the Grand Cypress gate, there's plenty of good restaurants around. My kid loved the TGIF, cheap and good. Red lobster's ard the corner too. So it Chilis and Sizzler.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel not family resort!”
Reviews.Author: lelizabethg
Reviews.Content: After staying at this hotel with my family over 25 years I am really sad to say I and my family will not be returning. Where do I start, well the re-furbished room decor is a matter of personal taste, personally I loathe beige, it is singuarly boring and uninspiring particularly in a 'tropical' setting, but worse is the design faults in the rooms. A single glass penelled sliding door to cover both the bathroom entrance, then slide it along to cover the warddrobe space, so impractical. When I exited the bathroom one day, pushing the door to the right, I nearly took my husbands arm off as he was trying to put things away in the safe - which is so low down in the wardrobe area you have to get on your knees. The door slammed into the safe door which in turn slammed into my husband's arm. Also in the bedroom there was an armchair and a foot stool. The chair has such high arms to it that when you get in the chair, which then sinks down lower than the adjoining footstool, you can't get out (I jest not!). No phone by the bed either. A tiny amount of full length hanging space in the wardrobe, sufficient if you are there for a few days on a conference but not at all enough if there on a holiday of a week or more. Housekeeping seems very ad-hoc, good when it is done, but sometimes one would wait until late afternoon to get the room serviced. On to the Resturants now. Well La Coquina when it is open, ie Chefs Table on a Saturday night or Sunday Brunch is fabulous and highly recommended. Hemingways has gone severely down. They used to serve wonderful lobsters, with finger bowls, bibs etc. Now all you get are pale imitations of what a lobster should be, ie small, very small and a heated damp towel. All the restaurant seems interested in, judging by the form they give you after the meal, is whether the server addresed you by your name. There is nowhere on the form to comment on the food which has deteriorated markedly. The Palm Cafe which used to have good casual food available is now a former shadow of its past. The grocery section is seriously underwhelming,and the salad bar where you used to get lovely salads is now non-existant. It also closes about 5pm each day. Cascades is only open for breakfast. That too is a hit and miss affair as the breakfast buffet seems to be on and then off the menu at the whim of the chef. We were told several mornings that yes there would be a buffet the following morning only to arrive that morning to find no buffet because there weren't enough guests in the hotel!! We were then told the breakfast buffet was 'guaranteed' at the weekend, like hell it was. No buffet. When we did order from the menu every order came with a mistake no joking, and as for trying to get more than one pat of butter at a time that too was difficult and proptracted. I actually felt sorry for the staff as they were embarassed by the whole set-up. We had some friends who drove down from outside the State to see us.Naturally on arrival we wanted to get them coffee etc. Bearing in mind this is a 5* hotel. The best we could get was a do-it-yourself coffee in paper cups from the Palm Cafe and even then they only had de-caf not regular available. In all that vast reception area there was no-one available to get us and our guests a decent cup of coffee in china, maybe with some biscuits or cakes. It is unbeliable. We ventured over to the Ritzt Carlton, oh my goodness what a difference. We felt really welcome, the resturants there are amazing and open. The rooms (we asked to be shown round) are fabulous. The Regency Club equivalent is to die for, everything there you could possibly want, unlike the re-vamped Regency Club at the Hyatt which I had a sneak preview of. Decor more beige, and for goodness sake don't let your chldren out on to the open terrace whch is a death trap. Railings round and then for good measure lets put some window-type boxes there as well just so the kids can clamber on them to get a better view of everything - you are 12 flights up!! This hotel says it has spent 65m dollars on its renovations, all I can say is 'you were done'. The designers, architects and suppliers must be laughing all the way to the bank, and as for the Management cost-cutting consultants, you have cut so much I for one don't want to return, which probably means you will cut more, but still you want the Conference business not the private individual holiday-maker who look for different things. The end of a 25 year love affair, I will not be returning. It is blatently obvious that the hotel has had in management consultants who have trimmed everything to the absolutely bottom line. Whilst this probably doesn't effect you if you go on a Conference where everything is provided and it is easy for the hotel to budget and cater for, as an idependent guest it is a disaster. What should have been a nice relaxing holiday in lovely suroundings with first rate staff and amenities became quite honestly an uphill struggle the whole visit. It is really sad and I really hope that someone high up in Hyatt, really high up, gets this place back on track.

Reviews.Title: “Simply average; Nothing special at all”
Reviews.Author: Advancepsy
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed three nights for a conference. While the rooms are undergoing a complete renovation, the exterior isn't. The entrance, including the gardens/ponds, are not impressive; just average. While taking a shower, I heard a loud crash in the bathroom; the vanity mirror (in a remodeled room) became unglued and fell to the ground. Another night, the power went out in one section of the hotel. When asked about the outage, the front desk person was a little testy. Both meals I ate at the hotel restaurants were average. The fitness center is quite small and outdated. The best meal was the plated luncheon at the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsin_Rabbit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for 6 nights in November during our honeymoon in Florida. We got a great deal with the stay two nights get one free, which also included a daily breakfast. When we first arrived on property I was very worried our stay was going to be ruined by poor service as the security guard had some very snide remarks because we had pulled in on the wrong side of the driveway to be let through the gates. It was our first time here and we went on the side that was for employees and deliveries instead of guests. We immediately noticed the sign, but had someone else who had pulled in behind us so we couldn’t back out to go into the other entrance. The security guard came out and snarled at us asking if we were employees, we said no we are just checking in. She made a few comments under her breath and proceeded to tell us that she wished people would learn to read! By this time the people behind us had noticed the sign as well and back out to pull in the correct lane (I guess we were not the only ones who couldn’t read) The guard went back in her station and came back out with our parking permit and also with an apology for the way she acted, explaining that she had had a long day. Thank goodness this was the only incident like this and the rest of the stay was great. At check in we were given a room on the 14th floor, although it had a gorgeous view I quickly figured out that I am a bit afraid of heights and this was a little too high for my liking, so we went back down to the desk to request a room on a lower floor and they promptly moved us to a room on the 3rd floor, much better :) Although they were doing construction on the hallways on this floor it didn’t bother us and we never heard a peep from it. We had a refurbished room and it was wonderful, very clean with a super comfy bed. The only minor complaints (so minor I probably wouldn’t even call them complaints) were that the shower, although it looked very nice, leaked huge puddles of water out onto the floor. We just set a towel outside the shower when we used it and that seemed to fix the problem. The other negative was that the balcony was tiny, with no room for chairs so you can’t really sit out there and read a book or enjoy a drink, but once again not a big deal. The property itself was gorgeous and huge; we didn’t even get a chance to explore everything. The only downfall to the property itself I think was that the main pool was not heated, it was very cold. The smaller heated pool was okay though, but still a tad cool for my liking. The poolside bar service was great, although I found it easier to just walk the 30 seconds to the bar and order yourself a drink instead of waiting for the waitresses to bring your drinks which usually took about 10- 15 min to get after ordering, whereas if you go up to the bar yourself it takes about 2 minutes. I think the best part of our stay had to be the breakfast, it was amazing. The service was absolutely outstanding everyday, minus one day when I think they were a bit busier than expected, but even that day it was good, and the food was amazing all 6 mornings we ate there. Although the breakfast was my favorite part I don’t think I would eat there had it not been included with the room as the prices were a bit steep for breakfast. All in all the stay was great; we had a clean comfortable room, great service all around, as well as a delicious breakfast every morning. I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone looking for a higher class feel, but although I loved this property and our stay was amazing I’m not sure I would stay at this resort on future visits if I had to pay full price. I’m not saying it’s not worth full price if you are looking for top notch, but we actually feel a bit more comfortable at a not so fancy place while we are on vacation, but if the price was right we would defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for adults and kids.”
Reviews.Author: jb187
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights after booking through Hotwire. I was prepared by reading reviews for added costs ($20 to valet, $18 resort fee, $10 for internet all each day). You can self park for free but a good 5 minute walk each way. If you are going to spend any time at the hotel to use the amenities it is all worth the additional costs, if you are just using it to sleep after visiting parks all day you may do better at a 3 star with wifi and breakfast included. We stayed all day and used the pool (only smaller pool heated), paddle boats, kayaks, rock climbing wall, and some of the children's activities.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: lynnecam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon after getting married in Key West and absolutely loved it. The grounds were gorgeous. We played pitch and putt and took a pedalo out onto the lake all at no extra charge. We had one of the newly renovated rooms on the 16th floor with views out to Walt Disney World which was lovely. I loved the huge lobby and the choice of eating places. The staff were really good especially when we had to check out two days early when my father in law took ill in Miami. They even gave us bottles of water for our drive to Miami. Would love to come back here again one day.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel We've Ever Stayed at in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Scootec
Reviews.Content: After having read other recent reviews about this hotel, it appears that the concensus is that it has gone downhill in recent years. However, this was the first time we've ever stayed here and it was easily the best hotel we've ever stayed at in Orlando. We wouldn't hesitate to go back there. The pool area is huge and outstanding, with the constant soothing sound of waterfalls. The pitch and putt course is excellent and really sharpens your short game up. The Racquets Club is very good, with about 10 courts, some of which are hard courts, some of which are clay. There's a basketball court, a beach volleyball court, a grass volleyball court, all of which are very good quality. The gym's not bad, but bizarrely, as with most American Hotel gyms, is quite old fashioned. It's perfectly useable for a holiday gym though. The lake is great for kayaking or for using a pedalo, and just soothing for being there. There are also some running trails set up that take you round the hotel's grounds, which are extensive and very well looked after. I'm not sure they've got their measurements right on their running trails though. It felt a lot longer than 4.7 miles. The main reception/atrium area is very impressive, brightened up by the entertaining macaw and cockatoo. It did sometimes spell a bit odd though. We were in a refurbished room on the 18th floor and it was very nicely done and very quiet. Some people have commented on the fact that they think the rooms are too small, but what are you planning to do in your room that requires so much space? The room sizes are fine. Also, people have commented on the fact that the hotel food is expensive, which it is, but why would you eat there when you have a plethora of really nice restaurants just outside of the hotel grounds? There's a Dunkin Donuts (great for breakfast), a Macaroni Grill, a Chilis, an Olive Garden, a Sizzler etc, etc. Also, yes they do quite have a conferences there, but I think it adds to the atmosphere of the hotel, even if most of them are attended by the chinos brigade. Finally, the staff were very helpful, polite and friendly at all times and really added to the enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: cooper12
Reviews.Content: stayed three nights here and had no real complaints. got a great stay two nights get the third free and breakfast every morning. most of the staff was really friendly and helpful. the hotel is being renovated and the work is done during the day. not a problem unless thats when you want to sleep. rooms were updated. i did not like only have a shower with the raindrop type overhead fixture and the water never quite got hot. it was and ok hotel. would not stay for full price.

Reviews.Title: “A sad decline in a once magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KEILEN
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting this hotel for the past twenty years, sometimes twice a year and have sadly seen this hotel go downhill and I am afraid to say we will not be staying there again. Our recent stay was terrible, firstly when we checked in we were hit with the resort fee $18 per night, we asked what this was for and what it included and was told it was for the use of the Gym, Bicycles, Pedalos, Etc. We explained that we would not be using any of these things and therefore would not be paying, after a lengthy discussion with the lady at the reception she agreed to waive the fee, however the fee with a reduced rate appeared on the account review on the T.V. We then spoke to the Manager who agreed to drop the fee, but spoke to me in a very patronising manner. Next we had a garden view room on the eight floor, it overlooked the front of the Hotel, nice gardens but also a view of the car park, but worst of all the huge air con building, the noise it emitted was unbearable!!! My husband went to the reception at 4am. to complain. We chainged rooms the next day to a room on the 14th floor, it was a bit better, the balcony door did not fit properly and had to fill the gaps with newspaperto stop the whisteling sound of air, but we still had to buy ear plugs, the noise was just unbearable. It is the first time we could not wait for the holiday to end. I fully understand that the Hotel has to make money but the constant corporate functions being held in the walkways from the car parks is very intrusive, it`s difficult to get a path through the people at times, could they not hold these functions in the massive rooms set aside for such things! I dont suppose they consider how intimidating it is everytime you return to the Hotel. Also the newly refurbished rooms seem quite tacky and have lost the luxury feel. I have issues with the shower door, the water pours out onto the floor. Also the sliding closet/bathroom door is a stupid idea (somebody will be injured). To sum up, this Hotel is constantly costcutting E.G. you used to get complmentary coffee and orange juice in the mornings on the 9th floor, there used to be a candy dish on the table in your room toped up each day, there was a pianist playing a grand piano in the lobby all day, etc. etc. In fact with all the hidden charges the Hotel has become a rip off. With regret I could not recommend this Hotel any more. I won`t even talk about the lack of reasonably priced places to eat in this hotel. It has an empty feeling, it used to be so vibrant and and enjoyable but not anymore, sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyworld Trip”
Reviews.Author: honeybunnySeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: We went to for a family trip with my parents who had been stationed in Europe for three years. It was three adults ranging from 26-55 and one three year old. We chose this hotel for its many amenities, close to restaurants and its shuttle to Disney world. We arrived and this hotel is absolutely beautiful. It feels so tropical and soothing. They have live parrots in the lobby, which are so beautiful. They have fountains in the lobby. They have so many pools outside. They have pools and hot tubs for adults only, then they have pools for the families which include water slides. We used the pool service to order adult drinks which was great. We loved what the hotel had to offer that we ended up not going to one of the parks that day and just stay at the hotel. We would definetly use this hotel again. At the time our rooms were spacious and clean but very 80's. It reminded me of the house from Golden Girls. Not sure if they have updated the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great place,but pricey !”
Reviews.Author: gogomommd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Hyatt and it was lovely. The newly redecorated rooms are nice ,but small when travleling with a child or two. We had great mealsat the hotel and were great. The breakfast is way too exspensive 100.00 for three adults and one child. The pool was awsome and the staff was very warm and welcoming. We got a great rate when we checked in. All in all a great time was had by all..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandkatv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress in orlando for a 3-night get away for our tenth anniversary. We were thrilled with all there was to do (and not do a.k.a. relax) right at the resort. Whatever we felt like doing, relaxing by the pool, working out, going for a nature walk, golfing, kayaking and surrey bike riding...all right there! The views from our balcony were spectacular! We could see the fireworks at EPCOT and the lights from Downtown Disney at night. They even have a firepit which we enjoyed on a cool night. A perfect way to end a romantic night! Everything was truly wonderful; clean rooms, lovely atrium lobby, tropical grounds, great pool, beautiful lake and in a terrific location, minutes to all the Disney parks and International Drive. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Friendly - Affordable - Disneyworld Option”
Reviews.Author: Stabo66
Reviews.Content: Our family had been staying at the Disneyworld Polynesian at over $400/night and decided we wanted to extend our trip. We were extremely disappointed with the Polynesian and so looked for another option. Having used Priceline extensively, we got online and bid $125 for a 4 star hotel in Priceline's Disneyworld zone and won this hotel. It was an absolutely outstanding experience. The staff was excellent, the room was very nice, the swimming pool was far superior to the one at the Disney resort and the kids just loved the colorful parrots in the beautiful and huge hotel lobby. Add in boat rentals and tons of other things for kids to do, and you've got a fantastic overall package of activities for family members. We were too busy at the Disneyworld parks to take advantage of most of the options the hotel provided (except the pool which we hit just about every day), but we enjoyed every minute we spent at the Hyatt. While there are multiple shuttles taking people to all the local attractions, we rented a car (Priceline $25/day) which provided us with more flexibility. Little kids can be temperamental when they get tired so the inexpensive auto rental and the flexibility it afforded us to skip the Disney trams or Hyatt shuttle bus was well worth the nominal added expense. If I had paid the full retail rate for this hotel I probably would have felt it was still well worth the expense in comparison to what Disney offerings for a similar price, but getting it for a steal on Priceline made it all that much better. Next trip to Orlando (this coming winter) we'll intentionally skip the Disney properties and head here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, fun-filled experience”
Reviews.Author: lallysmommy
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our families to the Hyatt Regency and I wish we could have stayed there longer! The huge pool, with its slides and waterfalls, was amazing - the kids had so much fun! We also rented bikes and went on a paddleboat - just didn't have enough time to do all of the fun activities the hotel offered. The breakfast buffet every morning was delicious! During our trip, we ate lunch once at the hotel - pizza and fries, standard fare. Most days were spent in Disney World but if I had to do the trip again, I would have spent a day or two just lounging around the hotel all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip to Hyatt Grand Cypress (and Orlando in general)”
Reviews.Author: minisann
Reviews.Content: Trip to Orlando & Cruise We started our drive (from Houston to Orlando) on Wednesday evening (later than anticipated due to a late pet-sitter). We were only able to drive for about six hours before exhaustion took over. With shame, we stopped at a Radisson Hotel in Louisiana. It has recently been refurbished / renovated and it was very nice. They offered a nice continental breakfast and then we continued are trip east-bound. Along the way, we saw the deviation towards Destin beach and we couldn’t resist. We veered off the highway and found the most beautiful beach ever! We’ve visited the Caribbean, Hawaii, California & Florida beaches and this one was by far and large, an unexpected surprise. It has all the tourist trappings; but the sand and the water are just amazing. We were hesitant to leave; but leave we did (already four hours behind schedule)! Already making plans to go back and dedicate a trip just to that area! We arrived in Orlando many hours later, tired and exhausted. We had read other postings about trying Priceline.com for discounts at the Hyatt Regency-Grand Cypress Hotel & Resort. Since this is one of our favorite destinations/lodging in Orlando-we decided to give it a try. We were able to get an $80/rate (plus taxes & resort fee) per night! The reason for the discount is likely that they had a lot of construction going on at the hotel; but we did not have any hassles because of it. Our room was one of the renovated rooms and it was very nice. Bummer that we had to pay to have internet access (and not included in the daily resort fee either); but parking was free and the grounds are just fabulous! We decided to spend our first full day at Animal Kingdom. We contacted someone via Craigslist for discount tickets. They met us at the park entrance and while we had to wait, we got into the parks for about $30 per person less than the pricing at the gate (approx. $90 for a family of 3). Animal Kingdom is a park that can be done in about half a day and we enjoyed it. As expected, food at the parks is expensive-so budget that in… Our second day in Orlando, we spent at the local Premium Outlets shops, getting a massage (ladies) and golfing (guys). We had dinner at the Texas de Brazil (kind of like a Fogo de Chao) and it was very nice, tasty and close! Our third day was spent at Magic Kingdom. This is always one of the tried & true places to visit. This park does take ALL day to visit; but we enjoyed it immensely. After a very tired and long day, we went to the Hyatt pools to relax! This trip was a combination of theme parks / 5-day cruise itinerary. So, we headed off to Port Canaveral to board the Monarch of the Seas. While a very nice ship, it is the oldest (?) and much smaller than our previous cruise experiences. It has all the amenities of the newer ships; but scaled down in size. We always purchase an inside cabin-since we don’t spend much time in there anyway… Our first stop was Coco Cay and we were really, really looking forward to the snorkeling. Unfortunately, there was an abundance of jelly fish in the water (way too many to count and EVERYWHERE). While we were constantly “stung”, it was more like an itch and none of us had a bad reaction to them. The water was murky at best and with too jellyfish in the water, we were not inclined to stay at the main beach. After the cruise provided lunch “buffet” which is plentiful, we walked farther to the less populated beach areas. We found one little stretch that did not have hardly any jellyfish, was shallow and just wonderful! My husband enjoyed the shaded lounge chairs while I enjoyed looking for shells with our son (age 10). After that, we spent some time at the huge water slides provided at a charge ($20/pp). Our son had a blast! Finally, another fun and exhausted day had come to an end. Our second and last stop was in Nassau (Bahamas). We got on the ferry to Paradise Island (Atlantis) and regretted it immediately. Not only did it take FOREVER, but it also made a few of our friends very sick (too much rocking!!!). Way too much time is spent cramming every available tourist into the tiny, ill-kept boats. Never again. Once we arrived at Paradise Island, we had to still walk quite a ways towards the Atlantis resort. Yet another reason to take a taxi the next time around! Atlantis is a beautiful property. You can see most of the aquariums without paying for the armband/bracelet. In fact, while we paid for our bracelets (about $75/pp), one of the other families did not and they had no trouble getting in/out of the “paid only” areas… One of the “paid for areas” was a private beach and it was a “WOW” beach, beautiful indeed. They had plenty of lounge chairs, some with shade and they had staff coming around offering beverages. Some locals offered the wave runners / jet skis and for about $75 for 2-3 hours, it was well worth it. This is definitely a place for negotiating the price down aka: the initial charge was $100 for 45 minutes… Be sure to eat early because many of the on-site restaurants close around 2pm! They do however, have a nice sit-down restaurant close to the casino that is reasonably priced. We visited the casino for a little while (evening) and then headed back to the boat by 9pm. We lost all of our “investment” while our friends essentially made back their trip $$ at the slot machines. Go figure! Our day at sea was enjoyable and we pretty much relaxed all day long. My cousin and I enjoyed playing bingo; but never won (we never do) and got to really enjoy the ship. We did our little souvenier shopping while the boys played poker in the casino. Again, donating money to the cruise line’s coffers… We packed our bags and got ready for the next day. While we drove to our relative’s homes in West Palm Beach for a few more days of leisure time, our friends/family flew home. They took the cruise shuttle to the airport without any delays, problems. They did have to get off earlier though… We took the more leisurely route and had breakfast (on the ship) and lounged around until they essentially kicked us off the boat (J/K). Our drive to WPB was uneventful and we had booked our stay at the Hyatt Place (close to CityPlace). It was “new” and very upscale, updated and central to almost everything. Parking and Internet access was included in the rate (one night at $100 and the 2nd at 50% off). We visited the beach, family and had an all around nice time. Too soon, it was time to start the drive back home. A long trip; but very enjoyable. Other than allowing more RELAX time, I wouldn’t change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is a resort hotel.”
Reviews.Author: amd0576
Reviews.Content: This is a seventeen story hotel located just outside Disney property. Upon checking in, guests of legal drinking age receive complimentary champagne before heading up to the room. Self-parking is free (valet parking is about $20/day), but there is a resort fee of $20/day. But this $20 covers a lot of neat stuff - two pools (one of which spanning the length of the entire hotel courtyard!), several jacuzzis, two waterslides, a game room, a fitness room, rock climbing, three jogging trails, bicycle riding (including Surrey bikes!), volleyball, tetherball, canoeing and waterbikes among other things. The rooms themselves offer splendid views of the Disney area (assuming you get a high enough floor) and are set up so one can relax on the bed or work on that big project. Bathrooms are very modern-looking as well. My only complaint was that the shower door only covered half the shower area, allowing water to splash outside. But this is minor. There's so much to do here that you may even forget there are attractions outside the hotel. Huge thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to go”
Reviews.Author: MikeJones007
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Hyatt Grand Cypress in early June. There was an extensive renovation going on but I was already aware of that. And we had a great time. The pool is huge and we had no problems finding a chair to sit at. There was also a small beach with hammocks to sit in and get away from the main pool. We didn't go to the restaurants on the property unfortunately, although I have heard they are good. My advice is if you are looking to have a good time here go when it's not peak season. Or go when the kids are still in school. So don't complain about not having a chair to sit at when it's spring break.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: bookster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 seperate occasions either side of a week in Clearwater, and on both occasions had a fantasic time. The service was superb from start to finish, from check in to restaurants to the valet parking. The rooms were clean, food was good, the pool area was excellent, great for the kids. The location is excellent, close enough to disney (we had a car, but they had shuttles), but of an evening or around the pool you felt a million miles away. The perfect place for relaxation whilst in the midst of hectic disney.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave, ready to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ilovehyatt
Reviews.Content: The grounds are green and lush-just beautiful! The lobby is open and spacious, a great place to relax with a good book. At check in you are presented with a glass of champagne and where you will meet Merlot the macaw and Kula the cockatoo. The hotel is under renovations but the noise was limited and didn't interrupt anything we did on the grounds. Our room was newly renovated and very nice; the small refridge came in handy when bringing in outside food. The closet door slides across to also be used as the bathroom door-took a minute to figure that out. The pool has a wicked waterslide, waterfalls and hot tubs in alcoves. There are lots to do bike riding, pedal boats, rock climbing wall, golf, fitness center, get a wonderful aromatherapy massage in the beauty salon or just relax in a hammock by the lake. In the evenings you can roast smoores and watch a movie poolside. The restaurants are very nice but pricey-there are many restaurants just off the property. Close to all the theme parks, the onsite parking was great-well lit at night and you enter through the lower lobby of the hotel. The staff is very nice and helpful - it was a wonderful trip and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, stay again and again...”
Reviews.Author: carolinecorcoran
Reviews.Content: Loved the bellman with walrus moustache and Diana in coffee bar. Love the pool and facilities Been before and do not agree that the remodelling adversely affects customer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: outpost_road
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful. We took a couple bicycles out (comes with the resort fee) and rode around sightseeing for a couple of hours just on the hotel grounds. The room was immaculately clean. The only thing that was a problem was the lack of free internet access. It seems like if the cheap motel down the road can give me free internet, then the Hyatt where I pay an $18 resort fee should be able to offer it as well. Other than that, we were very happy and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: biggroofy
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is under huge renovation - but you are unlikely to be affected. The staff were some considerate ~ upon check-in, I was served by Dave, a professional and nice gentleman. I requested adjoining rooms, cribs, etc. Everything went smoothly until Dave asked "What is your plan for tomorrow? Are you going to sleep in, or head out early?" Then he explained due to the renovation, I may hear some noise starting 9am. When I explained that the baby may need a morning nap, he assign us into another floor which was quiet and away from the construction. The renovated rooms were great. I really like the shower. Couldn't believe they arrange a super-sized baby crib (Grand Floridian Resort offered a full-size crib, but this is even bigger!). The location was perfect ~ close to good restaurant and it is right next to downtown Disney. It is true that somebody complains the $18 resort fee ~ but what ~ this includes your parking, local calls, and all the amenities in this resort including swimming pool, bike, rock climbing (too bad no free internet). I think it is good value and for sure will come back. Oh yes, parking is a little far away, but not as far as described by others. I don't see any security concern even I parked the car alone at night. It is reasonably safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, staff, food and drink.”
Reviews.Author: jojoyner77
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for our Honeymoon and spent 12 nights there. Overall we had a great time. Check-in was great with a glass of champagne and a guided tour of the hotel by the porter as he took our bags to the room. The room itself had a great view over the pool and lake and you could see the Disney fireworks in the distance from the balcony. It had a great bathroom with a massive shower, loads of wardrobe and drawer space - it just lacked somewhere to store suitcases out of sight. The room was really clean and had a good standard of cleaning throughout the stay - even when we had slept in and they had to come back later. We also took advantage of room service pizza, which was quite expensive but huge - so actually not that bad value for money. The only complaint with the room was there was an ajoining door to the next room, which meant any sound travelled really easily between the two rooms. Also there were some building works going on which were quite noisy during the day time - they also resulted in the fire alarm ringing for about an hour one evening. However, when we complained, the staff were very apologetic about this and gave us a discount on our resort fee at the end of the holiday. Next the facilities. Basically your resort fee covered the use of the pool, fitness rooms, golf, canoes, sailing, bikes, tennis, table tennis, volleyball etc. If you are planning to spend a lot of time in the hotel, there is plenty to do and it is pretty good value. However, as we were out all day, nearly every day, we didn't really get the best value although we did use the bikes once and go out in a canoe. The main pool was a bit cold in April - it suffered from being very large with a lot of it in the shade. It was fine for actually swimming, but if you wanted to just bob about, there was a smaller heated pool and 3 hot tubs that were never very busy. I also made use of the Beauty Salon to have a hair cut. The food and drink was great throughout the hotel. The lobby bar was a great place to have a beer or a cocktail at the end of the day. The service was always great and there was also a guy making sushi to order. As we hadn't really had much sushi before, the staff were really helpful in suggesting what we might enjoy and it was delicious. There was also the White Horse which was a pub-type restaurant. People dressed quite casually and there were TV's showing various sports. We had two great meals there and although quite expensive, you got bread to start with and a main course was enough to satisfy our big appetites. We had steaks one night and burgers another. There was a poolside bar, which served snacks at lunchtime - although these were more like full meals. They also had a waitress service at the sunbeds. The weekend buffet breakfast was great. At $20 it was expensive and yes, there was a Denny's a short walk away which was less than half the price, but the selection in the hotel was great, so we ate there a couple of times when we were having a late start. Pancakes and waffles were made to order, with Mickey Mouse ears for the kids (and for big kids if you asked nicely). There was loads of fresh fruit, cold meats, cheeses, Sausages, bacon, eggs, hash browns, oatmeal, cereals, croissants, bagels, toast, sticky buns, bottomless coffee, tea, orange juice and water served to your table (I don't think our cups were ever empty!) and loads more I can't even remember. Probably our favourite place in the hotel was Hemmingway's - the fish restaurant. It was set overlooking the lake and we ate there three times. The food was superb - really fresh and delicious. On the first two occassions, we just had main courses. Again, you were served bread to start with and this was more than adequate. On our very last night we treated ourselves to a proper 3 course meal, with oysters, cerviche, delicious alaskan king crab and very indulgent puddings. Even though the restaurant was quite quiet, the atmosphere was great and the service was fantastic. The waiter was really knowledgeable about the food and was able to make some great recommendations. We never felt rushed, even though we were the only ones left at the end. The manager even came and spoke to us, who we had seen on our first day and asked us how our honeymoon had been. We made use of the hotel bus to go to Seaworld, but then decided to drive to the rest of the theme parks, so we could come and go as we wanted. The hotel was really handy for Disney, with only a 5 minute drive to Downtown Disney. It was about a half hour drive to get over to Universal and one hour to Busch Gardens and Kennedy Space Centre. It was very handy for getting onto the highway, but despite that, the hotel felt like it was in the middle of nowhere. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel, particularly the standard of service from all the staff we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Slight changes I disliked”
Reviews.Author: daisy91
Reviews.Content: We have visited the Hyatt several times over the years and this year we were surprised at some of the changes that we noticed. First the swimming pool is what has always drawn us to this hotel, we love to swim in a pool that is not waist deep also this pool is open 24 hrs making night swimming very nice. Usually they have the waterfalls all lit up in the pool, it is just beautiful, this time the waterfalls were turned off at night. This is just a small detail but something I looked foward to . Second change that I didn't like is the lobby, it use to be a plant and garden atrium, very pretty to see, now most of the plants are torn out and they have gone with this asian theme, with weird statues, very plain and boring not anywhere near breathtaking like before. Also now the free buses that take you to the parks doesn't take you anymore to the individual parks , they take you to a transportaion center where you get on another bus for the Disney park you want. I also don't care for this added feature. I will probably still return to this hotel just for the swimming pool and I like the location however management should know that sometimes change isn't always better.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag... but we MAY be back!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieBrynMawr_PA
Reviews.Content: The state of the economy prompted us to go to this Hyatt rather than the Ritz-Carlton (a property in Orlando we have never visited but we are return RC Club level visitors in other destinations). Here is our take on Grand Cypress (from which we returned today) Pros: Big facility -- pool complex is impressive, plus water fun like boats, plus bikes and bike paths If you ask, you get great views of the nightly MK fireworks and Epcot fireworks. Personable, welcoming service at the towel hut poolside and in Cascades, the Main Dining Room (went there for b-fast for 2 ams) Super-close to Disney. We were 5 minutes from Downtown Disney and maybe 15 from the Magic Kingdom. Great location. Plentiful fresh squeezed oj.... the best! Cons: They are under construction at the moment. 4-5 floors taken up by this plus rooms on the various other floors. Forget this hotel if you need a nap for you or your children during the construction work day. They are just not good at explaining things. Didn't explain the voucher system (some days you need one for kids, other days not) so we wound up with a billing snafu; sent us a VERY long out of the way to Capital Grill for dinner. Sent us an equally long out of the way to get to Starbucks on the way to airport as we departed. Self-parking is really out of the way. $12 valet at front door. With the construction, on the floors they have guests staying, they should at least wipe down the construction residue from ledges and railings each day... it is THICK with white powder floating up through the huge lobby atrium! It is the downside of having such a massive (and wonderful) pool complex -- but skimming the pool for residue is a must and is being overlooked. Must skim out the floating, dead crickets, yellow jackets, and floating fruit (a pear... dismaying to swim by a pear) even when the pool is open 24 hours. I saw folks power washing lounge chairs, but they also need to be checking on the pool detritis. Finally, poolside bar service is a rare, but wonderful, thing. This hotel would do well to amp its profit margin by shilling for more drinks poolside. There were more than a few thirsty parents, honeymooners and just plain, wonderful people THIRSTY for bar service that was far too infrequent given the expanse of pool. We stayed in a brand-new refurbished room. No desk or desk chair in the room... this is a huge minus... sometimes you need to talk to a restaurant or the concierge for some length of time directly to make a call. Sometimes you need to do work in your room. They are really casting their lot with the family (and not the business) traveler when they don't put a desk and chair in the room. The lobby, with its Asian motif, is grand, but not comfortable. If you are meeting folks for drinks or a meeting you will find it hard to have a warm, comfortable conversation in this lobby. We may be back... because of PRICE! The asset of the pool and its close location to Disney may encourage a return visit. We hope by then some of these Cons are worked on! Happy travels to you!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Dated Hotel With Decent Amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCatLady
Reviews.Content: I spent three days/three nights at the Grand Hyatt and it was a fine experience. The conference I attended was housed within the hotel so it was certainly convenient for my purposes. But it's kind of dated (the lobby and grounds are mishmash of Asian statutary and waterfalls). I think in the 1980s it would have been a gem of a place. The pool looked fun but part of it was closed. Nice hammocks by the lake. The restaurants were all very expensive ($17 cobb salad for lunch; $3.50 for a regular small coffee in the lobby!) so I mostly ate off site. I had a room that has been renovated recently and it was nice - comfy king bed, couch, desk, flat screen tv (with a disappointingly small channel selection). Bathroom has a cool rain showerhead. The walls were very thin, though, and it can be noisy depending on your floormates. But the hotel had lots of hidden fees - internet access in-room was $10/day; business center charged, as well (and only had one computer); daily resort fees, etc. But, on the upside, there was a large lot where you could self park your car if you choose not to valet. It was a fine facility for a conference, but I'm not sure I would stay otherwise. Also, the front desk staff were very helpful, which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Wolf In Sheep's Clothing - Avoid It”
Reviews.Author: RedCamOp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of Hyatts and they all have a fairly modern design, even at the price of comfort. That only bothers me a bit. For instance the door to the closet is a sliding door that is also to the bathroom. The rooms are small. Just poor design. I could hear people in other rooms through the AC vents constantly. The staff tend to be considerate and attentive but impatient. The Grand Cypress also overcharges for EVERYTHING. I had a $20/night resort fee, a parking fee, Internet is $10+/day, etc. I spent more in fees (mandatory) they charged then I spent on the room so be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatts Days are OVER !! Stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: kbcorp
Reviews.Content: Only a shadow of what Hyatt used to be. We booked 1 room for my wife and I and another for my daughters family. We always visit the theme parks before the heat and crowds set in. I had asked specifically for quiet rooms and was told that was not a problem. The evening we checked in there was a huge party/convention at their outside facility with lots of noise and music. I had to move to another wing and my daughters family just decided to endure it till it ended. Obviously this party was planned long ago but we were not told about it. As with the decline of service in all areas of this country "no one knows anything" "no one is responsible for anything" ....and the Hyatt follows that course. In the morning we went down to the cafe in the hotel to get some fresh fruit for breakfast. We found the cafe closed off and empty. But you could get a $20. buffet breakfast of pigfat and all kinds of other unhealthy crap. I asked if the cafe was closed to drive people into the $20 a plate breakfast and was told unashamedly "yes". Such poor construction that any time you spent in the room you had to listen to doors slamming in the hallway outside. The maid staff also hollered to each other and slammed each door as the went in and out. The resturants are a complete overpriced waste of time. My daughters family ate in the Whitehorse or whatever its called. Utter overpriced crap bar food. Incompetent table staff. The manager was about 16 and had not a clue why he was there. There is no security at the hotel and about 3 am slamming doors by roaming teenagers woke us and we decided to leave right then and there. No one was the least bit curious why we were checking out at 3 am...... When I returned home I spoke with one of the assistant managers I could never figure out how many there were and you can not speak with the top level manager at all. He babbled on and on trying to explain everything. I got comped with 2 or 3 free nights but I wont be back to put myself through it. We have been staying in that hotel since the early 80s when they had a grand piano and live entertainment in the hotel. Now the fine restaurants are closed, there is no entertainment and at night children run through the pool area while their parents are drunk in the rooms. This hotel is for the "credit card" class and business flop sweats .....for the money I would go almost anywhere else. This was a fine hotel for "people of quality" back in the day but like some much of America it has declined for a quick buck to entertain low brow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Located Next to Disney”
Reviews.Author: brianbklein
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regnecy Grand Cypress is my favorite resort in Orlando. Everytime I come to Orlando with my family or for business, I stay here. It truly is fabulous from the inside out. The outside gardens and pool complex are spectacular and great for everyone....even the kid inside you. There are a lot of activities and amenities for both parents and kids to indulge in including waterslides, rock climbing wall, incredible golf and a pretty big lake with sandy beach. And best of all, this resort is located minutes from Walt Disney World. They have multiple shuttles to and from the resort daily....so you can't stay any closer to Disney (unless at a disney resort). And the new rooms are fantastic. They are now a nice contemporary style and provide a nice compliment to the resort to bring it up to the standards it always has been recgonized for. I especially love the new bathrooms with the deep soaking tubs. The service is very responsive and always there to meet any request. And the restaurants, especially Hemmingways are always very tasty. I especially love the Scallops and Alaskan Key Lime pie. All in all, you can't go wrong with the Hyatt. Yes they are in the mist of a renovation, but the location and amenities can't be beat..

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for girls weekend!”
Reviews.Author: teamom01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day weekend spent with my mom and 3 sisters at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. Would go back in a heartbeat! We knew there were renovations taking place, but were shocked when we first walked into our rooms on the 4th floor. The jackhammers overhead were so loud we could not hear each other speak! We went down to complain and were told that the renovations were taking place on the 5th floor (no kidding) and the noise would stop at 6pm. We went back up to the rooms and after about 30 seconds realized that we could not tolerate this for another 3 hours. We went back down to the desk and although the hotel were full because of a convention, Maribeth (very helpful!) found 2 rooms for us on the 2nd and 10th floor. We did not mind being separated as it was much quieter! The 2nd floor room was an older room; the 10th floor was a renovated room. The older room had an 80'd decor but was otherwise fine. The pressure in the shower there was fantastic! The 10th floor renovated room was very beautiful--a calm, spa-like decor. The beds were comfortable, but as others have stated, the water pressure was pretty low. Our only complaint was that with a glass door on the shower unless you are very comfortable with your companions, you couldn't have one person getting ready while another showered. Therefore we tried to use the hairdryer in the room itself, but there was no plug anywhere near the mirror. Not a huge deal. The hotel itself was fabulous. The elevators were extremely fast and we never had to wait more than a minute to get one. We did not eat in any of the restaurants as they were rather expensive and since we had a car we were able to go to many wonderful Orlando restaurants. The lobby was lovely although apparently no one sits in the seating there--it is tremendously uncomfortable! The pools were beautiful and we enjoyed pitch and putt, bikes, hydrobikes, bikes and jogging trails. No need to go to Disney! This was the perfect relaxing place for our girl's weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Just Left & Already Planning Our Next Trip Back”
Reviews.Author: etherrea
Reviews.Content: We booked an impromptu vacation from NY to Orlando to see the Shuttle Endeavor take off, obviously we needed the best rates possible leaving a week before. My BF Pricelined a room and the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress was the result. All of the reviews looked very promising. I noted that many folks were displeased with the fact that the hotel charges a "Resort Fee", which is entirely understandable. When you are bidding on a hotel and you believe $XXX is the rate you are getting, you don't want to be surprised with an additional $20 fee on top of your "deal". That being said, it's a small price to pay for the ammenities this hotel has to offer. The grounds are kept impeccably clean, staff is courteous, and the pool is like nothing I've ever seen before as far as hotels are concerned. The hotel is still under renevotion, and it appears it will be for quite sometime. Seems they are working from the top down, so essentially, it doesn't appear that any of the construction should be an eyesore, especially if you are dormed below those floors. Even still, the construction is not intrusive at all. We had the misfortune of having one of the "dated" rooms, as we checked in late on Friday night. All I can say is thank goodness they are renovating, the room are rather, as my friend put it "Golden Girls Esque". I'm sure the ones that are so far completed are lovely. My boyfriend and I took advantage of the bicycles they offer to tool around the grounds on, but because of a hectic schedule, we never got to use the kayaks, the paddle boats or the tennis courts. But the pool was magnificent, with a suspension bridge over a large part of one of the pools and hot tubs scattered throughout the "caves" areas of the pool waterfalls. Dining there apppeared to be pricey ($13 omlette), so I don't know that I would necssarilly suggest eating there unless convenience is a factor. However there are 3 different dining facilities on the premises to choose from, so it's very possible that I looked at the menu for the more expensive restaurant. All in all, a great time was had in the miniscule amount of time we were there. We are planning another trip back in August simply to enjoy the sun and what the resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Further Work Needed”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysHopeful1
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Hyatt and my third review. The two previous reviews I wrote were glowing, but I am sorry to say that my recent stay has left me feeling much less positive about the Hyatt Regency, than before. I have read a number of recent reviews, which are very positive, despite the current renovations, but these do not reflect my experience. Firstly, you should beware - the renovations currently taking place are both extensive and intrusive. I estimate that 60% of the rooms are currently out of use, and are at various stages of renovation. This means that there is a high level of noise during the day, specifically from jackhammers, and there is often a slight haze of dust in the air in common areas, with an accompanying smell. The lobby ornamental water feature is drained, and the lobby gardens have been dug up - although now largely replaced - albeit at the cost of an unpleasant smell of organic manure over a period of a few days! A major issue, is that the elevators which form a central element of the access to the hotel lobby from the self parking lot have been temporarily removed - meaning that access to the lobby is either through the fairly dark and winding garden paths, or by navigating some blind corners to access a small lift, located in a, at night usually deserted area. This is a significant issue - I am a well built male (although that would make no difference against a gun or knife) but felt uneasy accessing and waiting for the lift up to the lobby. I would say that this is a no go area for a lone female, who would have no option really, but to pay for valet parking. On the plus side, the outside garderns remain beautiful and untouched, as do the three large and very pleasanr swiming pools. I have no idea whether there are any plans to change these as part of the renovation. Again on the plus side, the renovated rooms look very good and modern, and are comfortable, with improved, high powered air conditioning, which had absolutely no problem in coping with outside temperatures of up to 39 degrees. On the minus side though, the rooms ore something of a triumph of form over practicality. They look good, but have design shortcomings. There is insufficient drawer and storage space for four people - only two large drawers, and three further very shallow drawers. There are no bedside tables with drawers - just an open shelf arrangement. There are only three (that I could count anyway) additional power points - two of which need you to get on hands and knees to access beneath the bedside shelves, and one of which, is very awkwardly placed behind the main console - which does not provide enough of a gap to use a plug connected to a UK adapter. Another review mentions the showers, and it is true that it is possible to get a lot of water on the floor - but only if you are careless! It is worth mentioning though, that the water pressure in the room is extremely low - I was told as part of a green initiative to use less water. Again, another minor design irritation, is that a space of about two inches has been left between the ends of the dresser and the adjacent walls - just wide enough for things to fall down, but not wide enough to get a hand or arm in to retrieve them! I do wonder why designers do not elect to spend a few days in their creations to test their practicality! My last comment is about the staff, who I have always felt are the most significant strength of ther HYatt. Clearly, given the unavailability of a very significantr number of rooms, staff must have been laid off - which shows at peak times, when for example, managers can be seen clearing dishes and waiting in the restaurant.. We all felt that there was a subtle change in the staff attitude, which is difficult to put a finger on - perhaps a reflection of the changed ambience in the hotel at the moment - there were virtually no conventions during our two week stay, and the huge majority of guests were leisure guests, many of whom had obtained very cheap room rates - this did subtly change the atmosphere, and led the swimming pool area to be busier that on our previous two stays, despitethe greatly reduced room availability. Overall, I have no doubt that the Hyatt will be great to stay in again, once the renovations are completed and the teething problems above have been rectified (assuming they are rectified!). You will have a pleasant enough stay if you go just now, but try to do so on the basis of reduced room costs - I think most people would be unhappy in the extreme to pay the full, normal room rates for a hotel undergoing renovations to the extent that the Hyatt is.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow...”
Reviews.Author: gorgegeorgie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing stay at this hotel. There is renovation work going on but don't let that put you off. Got a great deal through priceline $69 per night. The newly renovated rooms are superb, great beds, flat screen tv, mini fridge, sofa. There is no bath but the walk in shower more than makes up for it. You have to pay a resort fee of $18 per room but its worth it as it includes, bikes, kayaks, pedaloes, pitch and putt, tennis, pool (with great slide) etc. Had a few drinks in the White Horse and had breakfast there once. Great cocktails by Bart in the pool bar - Best Pina Colada i had in florida. Location of the hotel is fantastic. We didn't walk anywhere as it was so hot when we were there but you could if you felt energetic. Sizzler, Joes Crab Shack, Bahama Breeze, Angus Steakhouse - there are loads of restaurants within a 2 minute drive. All the staff were helpful and friendly. All in all, great stay. Would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel that should be even nicer when the rennovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: Wawasayg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress on multiple occasions for business meetings. Extensive renovations were underway during my most recent stay which seemed to result in noticeably reduced hotel occupancy. I stayed in one of the "pre-renovation" rooms that was spacious, comfortable and had a good view of the beautiful pool and hotel grounds. Aside from peeling paint on the bathroom ceiling, it didn't seem that the room needed any freshening-up. The room had wireless Internet service. I was disappointed that endless rainstorms kept me from enjoying the beautiful pool area during this year's stay. The hotel has a nice, but small, fitness center. The equipment is in good shape but the facility is too small to comfortably use some of the strength-training equipment. Also, I couldn't figure out how to get to the fitness center without walking out in the rain at least part-way. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant and on-the-ready to be helpful. Upon check-in, we were welcomed with a complimentary glass of champagne. The only disappointment my colleagues and I had was the food. Very expensive, very poor-quality. The menu selections were very limited and healthy options were essentially non-existent. And the selections that were on the menus were particularly unhealthy. And not good, either. At the suggestion of the doorman, we took the hotel shuttle to the golf club house for lunch. The options and quality were far superior to what was available in the hotel itself. This is a great hotel to stay at for business or for vacations. Just plan on taking meals elsewhere (attention hotel management - you really really need to improve the restaurant service in this place).

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite resort in Orlando !”
Reviews.Author: TheresaNY
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms this trip. One was a King with shower on 10th floor and the other was 2 queen and tub on 15th. I was very disappointed upon check in that I had requested CONNECTING rooms and not only were they not connecting but 5 floors apart !! The gentleman checking us in, though pleasant, did not seem terribly interested that I did not consider a floor difference "connecting". He said it was late (6:30pm?) and the resort was full. OK, whatever. It was a royal pain but for 3 days it was not ruining our stay. The rooms were both refurbed. GORGEOUS! Beds are so comfortable. Room is very well designed - refrig, lighting, flat screen tv, and front av hook ups for tv. HOWEVER, the bathrooms, although beautiful, are a engineering failure in my opinion. The showers cause a flood every single use ! The doors do not prevent water from running right onto floor. The rain shower head as well as hand held head and wonderful but the floor flooding is a danger and I forsee major problems with both safety and mildew ! The other room we had with the bath tub was an equal nightmare. There was a shower door on the tub but it only covered HALF of the tub. When you stand in the shower you have the glass door and then where the door ends there is.......NOTHING !! It is open and all the water sprays right out onto the floor. Again, it is beautiful, but a danger. I even thought that perhaps with all the construction maybe they just "forgot" the other piece of glass that is needed to completely close the tub area but I was told that is the design and they know it gets wet to just use towels. This was told to me by the same guy that gave me rooms 5 floors apart though! The lobby was being replanted so we were very disappointed that the water was not running and all the palm trees had been cut down, but am confident it will be gorgeous. We did not find the construction to be noisy or disruptive. Housekeeping excellent and very kind and accommodating as always. Our Bellman Robert was exceptional - informative and extremely friendly. We kept him talking so long I was afraid we would get him in trouble. All in all it is still a wonderful place and will be gorgeous when completed but the bathroom flooding is extreme. Keep everything that you do not want ruined off the bathroom floor. I had a toiletry bag and hairdryer that got destroyed by the water ! As a side note: for $18 resort fee - they should throw in free internet and a bottle of water or two !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikkeliMika45
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel at week 24/2009. The hotel locates in a very beautiful gardening area. Surroundings are well kept and look close to paradise... :) The service was just perfect to us Europeans. Not pushy but friendly. Room was clean and spacious but balcony very small (only half meter wide!). Free and safe parking was great. One morning we forgot to put "do not disturb" sign to out side of your door and cleaning maid was coming in already 8:30! Only thing of which I was disappointed that they added 18 dollars/day (+ tax making it 20,-/day or 80,- extra for our stay) for so called activity packege. We did not use bikes, etc. Only pool. They should include this to the hotel rate and not charge any extras if people do not use them. Surprises afterwards are not nice. Otherwise perfect hotel and in good location to the amusement parks. They have also free shuttle to Disney, sea World and Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: fairylova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a wedding and this was the location of the reception. The service at the hotel was fantastic. There are several restaurants to choose from and the rooms were a good size. The pool is huge with waterfalls and water slides and pool side service. There are bikes and kayaks to borrow so there is never a reason to be bored here (and since you're paying a hefty resort fee- you shouldn't). The gym had elliptical machines, bikes, a couple of weight machines, free weights, bands and balls. I tried two treadmills and neither of them seems to be in prime working order- but I was able to get a workout in. My only two gripes is that self parking in a good distance away and that the housekeeper did not vacuum before my arrival since there was plastic and a pill on the floor. Otherwise, the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bdr2835
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal on priceline and this hotel was fantastic. The pool area was great for kids and adults and there are plenty of activities. Within walking distance of many restaurants and there is a great bar opposite the entrance to the hotel ($5 pitchers!!!!). Downtown Disney is walkable (about 20 minutes). Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: KMcCorry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 days with wife and two small children. Excellent hotel and great staff. Rooms a little tired and restaurants a little pricey but pool scene and facilitaies excellent. Within walking distance of other restaurants nearby. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Grand Cypress has friendly, top-notch staff, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: famvacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency, Grand Cypress after booking it on Priceline for $90/night. It was a blind bid for a 4-star hotel in Orlando. We were very pleasantly surprised when we drove up to see a beautifully landscaped, gated resort right off International Drive. The front desk gave us a welcome glass of champagne and we rode the glass elevator up to our room. We asked for a pool view room and we could see the Epcot dome in the distance. The pool complex is beautifully landscaped and has one pool that you swim through a cave with waterfalls to get to another pool area. There are a couple of waterslides, one that is high and more like a waterpark. It would be good to allow a day or half day just to enjoy the pool area and the lake on the property. They have free paddleboat, canoe, kayak and sunfish rentals. We used their bikes to ride around the resort paths for an hour one late afternoon. The hotel lobby is tropical and lush. The parrot, Merlot, and the cockatiel bird looked happy and well cared for. In the evening they were taken off their lobby perches and hopefully rested privately. The breakfast buffet in the morning is top-notch, pricey, but worth it to us for a vacation splurge. There are made to order pancakes, and extensive egg, meat pastry, cereal and fruit buffets. The service was friendly and excellent. It was about 20 minutes or so from the Grand Cypress parking lot (we self-parked) to the Epcot parking lot. Overall, the friendly and professional staff are the best thing about the Hyatt Grand Cypress. From the doormen, to bell hops, to housekeeping, restaurant staff, and the front desk, everyone was the most consistently professional I've encountered in a long time. Along with the great staff, the lush, well-kept grounds and pool make it a great Orlando vacation experience for families.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel once the reconstructions will be finished”
Reviews.Author: bianca72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with young children (1 and 4). They did tell us that there were reconstructions going on but I didn't expect that to be jackhammering the whole day!. My son was unable to sleep in the room. Outside the poolarea is great but nog for small children. No kiddies pool. The location is good, close to disney. When checking out I complained about the noise and I didn't have to pay the resortfee, which I thought was a nice gesture. I would like to come back here when the children are bigger and the reconstruction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shpunger
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation through Priceline and did get a good deal, however, you get what you pay for!! We were not aware of the $15.00 a day "resort fee" and were very disappointed that they didn't have a kiddie pool. Since we had a 2 and 3 year old we felt it necessary to go to a water park where we could relax by a pool the kids could use. Room service pizza was about $26.00. Soooo the room was $100- the water park was about $80.00, the resort fee (for two rooms) was $30.00 , the movie in the room was $15.00, the valet parking was $20.00 - so we had nothing left for the Magic Kingdom!! I think this hotel is great for corporate affairs.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Resort !”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkiegirl
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on Priceline booking “Name Your Price.” I got a weekend rate of $89 a night. Not included was the $15 resort fee. For the price I paid it was an amazing deal, but there were some issues…. The hotel is undergoing major renovations. When I checked in they said renovation will be going on Monday to Friday from 9am to 5pm. I was fine with that. But was surprised, that starting exactly at 9 am on Saturday construction noise (very loud) started… There was no construction noise on Sunday. But I just wished the front desk had informed me in advance about Saturday. The hotel was great. The pool was amazing !!! I had lunch at the pool and found the prices to be OK and the food quality very good. Our room had not been renovated yet, but they had pictures in the room of what it will look like in 2010 following the renovation, which looks to be very modern and trendy. I did not mind the current décor, but rooms and the TV’s are definitely dated, but well maintained. I was surprised how small the rooms were, while I got an upgraded pool/late view, the rooms all seemed to be standard size. I had 2 double beds there were desk in the room. The room also had a fridge. There was a small balcony that was too small to even have a chair on it. For couples the room size is fine, but I think for a family of 4 they would be too small. The bathroom was large. There was clearly some water damage in the bathroom, which I assumed they hadn’t fixed since they were about to renovate the rooms. Also sometime the shower water was only luke warm even, even in the off hours. Customer service, check-in and out were easy and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. I was excited that there was a shuttle to Disney until we found out its times. Only 2 drop off times and 2 pick up times. Drop off was either at 8 or 9 am , but pick up was either around 7 pm or 8pm.
