We had to leave the parks by 5pm/6pm as we had dinner plans so the evening pick-up time didn’t work. We ended up driving in ourselves. While the housekeeping staff was very friendly, when I first arrived into my room there were some paper debris on the floor on my room (that you couldn’t miss). Again at a hotel of this level you should not see trash lying on the carpet! As for the resort fee, I just rather it be included in the price, but there were many amenities you got from it. Pros: Free self parking, hotel grounds/pool/lake, recreation, Customer Service, location Cons: Housekeeping, Hotel under renovation, small rooms, poor times for shuttle for Disney, $15 a day resort fee, hot water issues

Reviews.Title: “absolutely outstanding resort in which we can not wait to go back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skubicki
Reviews.Content: The resort was amazing in every way. The staff was extremely eager to please and accomodate us however they could. The hotel offers several great restaraunts on the grounds and we definitely recommend walking over to the Orlando Ale House across the street especially if you are a sports fan. The pool is unbelievable with the water slides, caves and hot tubs. My 8 year old son broke down crying at the airport when we were coming home because he did not get to say goodbye to the Merlot the beautiful amazing parrot that lives in the lobby of the hotel. We have been home for 10 days and he is still talking about Merlot and asking when we can go back. My wife also loved the work out room and said it was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The most comprehensive array of services and amenities I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: barontraveler
Reviews.Content: You can swim in a huge pool, golf major course or chip and put, seperate trails for running and biking, you can even sail a little to name a few. beautiful clay tennis courts lighted at night. Restaurants very good but a little pricey but many popular family restaurants are a 10 min walk from the hotel. Only drawback is that bus to disney leaves at 0900 am and there are 2 pickups 730 pm and 930 pm, all other transportation from and to airport etc is by cab one charged us $58 for 1 way. Suggest renting a car unless you can adhere to the disney schedule. Daytime renovation was barely noticeable (we were right next to it) Service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LittleOlivia
Reviews.Content: I won an all expenses paid trip for 4 to Orlando from Pepsi. The Grand Cypress was the recommendation of the agency that booked all our reservations and WOW were they right! The staff are courteous and attentive and the service was phenominal. They even brought us a refrigerator and replaced the food we had purchased and kept in the broken one. We had adjoining rooms in the renovated section of the hotel overlooking the western village and Sea World off in the distance. There is ongoing construction and we could hear the jackhammers, but the construction vehicles were a bonus for the kids and we weren't there during the day anyway. Valet parking is $20/day if you use it. We used every amenity they offer - boats, big-wheeled paddle bikes, rock wall, game room, hot tubs (way too hot!) and the pools. The heated pool with the small slide was our favorite. It is worth noting that there are quite a few things no longer offered, one being the equestrian center. It is still advertised and is still included in the hotel guidebook but the horses have been gone since 2008. They do need to update their literature. My 9 year old daughter was disappointed. We had a great stay and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new rooms - very outdated old ones”
Reviews.Author: peter424
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress for 4 days, the first night we had one of the old rooms, which was very run down and outdated. Additionally there was very loud construction noise, as they were working with pneumatic hammers a few floors above the whole day. The next 3 nights we moved into one of the new rooms, which was very nice and stylish. They had two pools, one small one which was heated and another big one, which was ice cold!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: llanllan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! From the minute we entered the security gates of the hotel, we felt welcome. Everyone who works here is friendly, even Merlot, the parrot in the lobby that can speak both English and Spanish! Every part of the hotel was immaculately clean. The rooms were slightly outdated, but still clean and comfortable. The hotel is going through renovations, and will be transformed into a modern-looking resort at the end of 2009. My boyfriend and I even got to see a sample room so we could see what the future remodeled rooms would look like. It was gorgeous! For dinner, we splurged and ate at Hemingway's. Although it was pricey, it was a romantic setting and the food was delicious. Service, of course, was spectacular. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is staying in Orlando. You don't even need to leave the resort to have fun. They have a beautiful pool area with waterfalls and slides. They also offer outdoors activities, such as biking, running, horseback riding, kayaking, and campfires. However, if you do want to leave the resort, the location is close to Disneyworld and several outlet malls. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect end to a perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: justfok
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed in at the end of a week long excursion to Florida. It was magnificent. The room's style was a little out of date but it was super clean and very pleasant. (They let us see what the new renovated rooms would look like, and they will be spectacular! They said it would all be done before the end of '09.) We had a corner room with a spectacular view of Walt Disney World and the grounds below. There is a lot to do here on the hotel grounds including, kayaking swimming, volley ball, bike riding, etc. They even had an outdoor fire place to roast marshmallows at night! The staff was amazing - its clear Hyatt puts their people through some kind of customer service training. They made us feel very welcome and generally put us in a good mood with their infectious enthusiasm. The pool with the waterfall was great - the restaurants on the hotel grounds were great - I could go on and on. Stay here for a terrific experience. - ask for one of the newly renovated rooms if you go - some of them should be done by the time of this posting. Thank you Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jim2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 2 children and there was alot to do for the kids. There are bikes, boats, a beach, rock climbing wall, 3 walking trails. The kids loved the pool and the 3 hot tubs. The birds in the lobby were great. The staff was friendly and helpful. Pool view room gets you fireworks from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: MPHAA_Mi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Orlando convention and greatly impressed by OUTSTANDING SERVICE of all employees - most friendly & helpful front desk, housekeeping, doorman, concierge, and Restaurant staff I have encountered at a US Hotel in years. Excellent lunch meals at Cascade. Enjoyable pool area and fitness center - however swimming pool water needs to be warmer. Very convenient bar, coffee, boarding pass computer printer.

Reviews.Title: “Resort area very nice, hotel rooms NOTHING SPECIAL”
Reviews.Author: Kim-and-Chip
Reviews.Content: My fiance was there for an IT conference and I tagged along with my 11-year old daughter. We had a double queen room and it was $230 per night. Service was great, everyone was very nice, rooms were cleaned every day, room service was fast but outrageously expensive. FOOD: First night we got there late and ordered 2 chicken sandwiches and a shrimp cocktail and it was over $50. We ordered breakfast one day - 2 ham and cheese omelettes with one side of bacon and coffee. That was $60. Hamburgers are $15, you get the picture. Poolside mixed drinks: $14; martinis in the bar: $14 Bring a lot of cash because you are going to need it. Even though it is really expensive, the food was very, very good. So at least you get quality for what you are paying. We were going to order pizza one night and they told us they won't even allow pizza delivery guys on the property, which forces you to buy their pizza and pay their prices. The pizza was pretty good though. CAR SERVICE: At this hotel they have town cars ready to take you wherever you want to go. A 10-minute ride to Discovery Cove cost us $40. The driver pretended to not have change and said he couldn't reach it in his pocket and would need to pull over "up there" to find the change. His way of having us tell him to just keep it. We found the local Taxi service to be less, a 10-minute ride being $15. FREE BUS TO SEAWORLD/UNIVERSAL: There was a bus that left in the morning and came to get you late afternoon from either Seaworld or Universal. The driver said that the bus would be in the same spot to pick us up at 6:10 and it was never there. We were forced to get a cab, which cost $17, to bring us back. He told us that they swing by right where they dropped us off. I assumed this meant that they picked us up there. No, didn't mean that... the bus was there because we saw it leave, but it was parked way down where other busses were and NOT by the park benches where the trolleys go... so if you are going to use that bus, keep this in mind! FOOD ALTERNATIVE: On our last day we went for a walk to the Orlando Ale House right outside the hotel ground across the street and wished we'd have found that place our first day. I had a 1.5 pound lobster for $15 (Wednesday only). Beers were a buck... wine was $5. WALKING DISTANCE - WHERE TO GO: We did walk to downtown Disney from the hotel. I think it was maybe 2 miles. Was nice to burn some calories. There is also a little store around the corner off the property called, "SUPER MARKET." We stocked the hotel room fridge with some stuff from here. The water in the hotel room was horrible tasting so we got some water, some wine, and miscellaneous munchies. To buy bottled water there was I think $3 or more each. There was no microwave in the room so all the leftover food kind of went to waste. BEACH: There is a beach at the hotel with cool peddal boats you can take out (all free). We tried a few but didn't spend a lot of time on it because my 11-year old was kind of freaked about the "beware of alligators" signs. There is a cabana where you just sign the waiver and they help you into it and they are there when you get out to pull you up to the pier. Someone is also always there watching with a motorized rescue boat. The lake is very small so it's not like you will get lost and they also said that they haven't seen an alligator there in 8 months. BAR: Already got into how expensive the drinks were but there is a sushi bar right there in the bar and he made the most excellent sushi ever. Cost for 6 spicy tuna rolls was $9.50. POOL: Pools really are nice, with waterfalls and just a very clean, nice setting. There is only one heated pool and everyone was there. WORKOUT ROOM: Very nice workout room with a steam room, a sauna, and nice showers. ONE PROBLEM: There was a $130 salon charge on our bill that we didn't make. They said I had a massage but I didn't. Someone apparently charged something to our room and the hotel would not immediately take it off, they said they had to investigate it. This was a couple days ago now and we still haven't heard from them. Wherever you go you can just charge everything to your room so I guess there are some crooks out there who like to charge their stuff to other people's rooms and that is what apparently what happened to us. They better remove the charge or I'll be back on here to let everyone know they did not.

Reviews.Title: “Been here before and keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Vanderneucker
Reviews.Content: I have been to this Hyatt several times. It is in the midst of a renovation, but you would never know it. I had a breakfast package and the food was great. I also had a room package where I stayed four nights and got one free. The room was clean and comfortable and serviced each day. Every employee greated me with a smile and did everything possible to make my stay a pleasant one. I have always found this Hyatt to be a great value. The workout room has been completely redone and is beautiful. I did not use the pool this time, but it still looks great. If you are looking for an oasis away from the Disney craziness, then this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beatuiful Grounds, Pool, a little Dated, great PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Ilovebostons
Reviews.Content: I needed one night before an early half marathon at Disney. Got this for a great rate, as always stayed on Disney property before. What a beautiful large hotel, pool area, the "resort" activities are all included in the 15 dollar per day resort charge, unlike Disney; such as the surrey bikes, regular bikes, ping pong, gym with cardio and wieght machines, sunfish,. Great poolside lunch service of delicious salad with chicken and bar service. 3 hot tubs that I saw, long and short slides. There is a fire pit on some nights with Smores. There is putt putt and regular golf. Staff is very friendly . Room was a little dusty, and AC was marginal, but all in all makes me glad to stay off property. We rented a car and were in Disney in minutes. Newish Winn Dixie down the road to buy snacks. Valet watched our bags when we told him we were too cheap to use his 19 dollar a day service, and he directed us to self park. Comfortable beds and nice toiletries. Decor is a litttle 80's with big prints and loud florals on the wall, but OK. Quiet with good elevator service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: melandtimgoeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Cypress for 6 nights. We are in our 30's. We came here for a getaway without the kids. I would stay here if you are planning on spending most of the time at the hotel. The bed was nice and comfortable. The rooms were outdated but clean. The maid service was excellent. The grounds were absolutlely amazing. There are many pools and hot tubs that are open 24 hours. Bikes, golf, kayaks, tennis, and hammock use were all included. The doors to get to the pool are located right by the sushi bar so going in and out is awkard when there are people all dressed up eating right in front of you when you return from the pool. The rooms are being renovated right now but didn't impact us at all. The balcony is small (extends about 2 feet). Ask for a pool view and you will be able to see Epcot's and Magic Kingdom's fireworks. There is a macaw in the lobby which I enjoyed seeing everyday. This hotel is in a great location. It's minutes from Disney and many, many restaurants. Staff was wonderful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and amenities - a Resort!”
Reviews.Author: yvrgirlToronto
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this resort while visiting 6 theme parks. We got this for $91 per night on priceline. We thought the $15 daily resort fee was applicable as we made good use of the shuttle (times have been cut to twice pickup times and dropoff times each due to slow season) and the included amenities (use the pitch and putt if you don't want to spend the money for the real golf course; rock wall, pools, 3 hot tubs, fitness club, climbing wall, free shuttle to main gate and Villas etc). I didn't give this a 5 because that's gonna be for after they renovate their rooms... then this place will be absolutely unbeatable. But our room and king bed was very comfortable with free fridge and coffee/tea. And we had a view of the Epcot fireworks (ask for pool view). The food is fantastic at room service (The Works pizza is SOOO delicious after a day at Disney and a hot tub experience; $3 delivery charge and gratuity added) and poolside. We thought the prices were acceptable for the convenience considering the overpriced unhealthy junk at the theme parks. We had the chef's table La Coquina dining experience which was very enjoyable and delectable. Also, I fully recommend you take the free shuttle over to the Villas to the Club Restaurant and have breakfast there (better than the Cascades). Their dinner there was great too. You can also go to the street using that shuttle and go to a whole strip of restaurants (usual American fat food). The service is fantastic. When the shuttle didn't show up (first day of schedule change), they arranged another shuttle to pick us up and waived our resort fee for that day. We used the shuttle to Seaworld to take the I-Ride trolley ($1.25) to get to the Prime shopping outlet stores. But the way back is difficult and we had to get a taxi back ($20). As another reviewed wrote, if you want to come back later or earlier than the last shuttle back from Disney, you have to go to a Disney resort (but that gave us a chance to visit them and check them out) by Disney bus or monorail, then take a Disney bus to Downtown Disney (free - it's all shops and restaurants), then actually if you cross the street and catch a taxi in front of the Hilton, it's only $5 or so (instead of $12-15). Hope the tips help. This is a fantastic resort. And the "warmed" pool was nice for a quick dip although it's cool due to February weather. It got busier at the end of our stay (Presidents Day).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hyatt - Couple of "Gotchas"”
Reviews.Author: Aslan99
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Hyatt. Other reviewers have covered the dated "golden girl" rooms and unheated pool. Here are my experiences plus some "gotchas" to be aware of. 1) Excellent friendly staff. 2) Expensive poolside food, but to be expected for the convenience. 4) Yes, the pool could have been warmer, but it was OK. 5) The multiple saunas were great. 6) A nice resort with enough family activities to keep you busy enough to avoid paying $80/pp at an overcrowded theme park. BUT BEWARE: 1) Golf is $190 for guests + $65 club rental. The course is NOT WORTH THE MONEY! I would peg it as a $50 course. No character, adjacent to ugly freeways and vacant swaths of land, grass off fairways all brown, clueless greenskeepers refuse to clear greens when hitting. I drove by the Disney courses with envy after being ripped off at the Grand Cypress course. 2) The bus to Disney takes off only at 2 times in the morning ~8AM and 9AM, and the first run back in the evening is ~7:30PM. If you aren't planning on a 12+hour theme park day, you have to find your way back to the hotel by taking a disney bus to a resort, then to downtown disney, then a taxi to the Hyatt - about a 45min-1hr affair. 3) Downtown Disney is close, but not walking distance. Taxi is $12-15 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: RLang33
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the hotels in and near downtown Disney and this has been the best! The service was absolutely top notch from check in to check out. The room was well equipped and had a nice bathroom and comfortable bed. The property itself is breathtaking, inside and out. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrackerJack
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress - what a nice hotel!. We booked via Priceline for $102/night plus the $15/night resort fee. I was concerned after reading some reviews about the pool and old decor - do not be concerned. All the pools were open and while the room decor was dated, it did not detract from the beauty of the hotel or the room comfort at all. The hoel is currently undergoing rennovations which we noticed, but it was not in any way a problem. It appeared as though they were starting with the rooms on the opposite side of the hotel where we were staying. Upon check in we requested a king room with a view of Epcot so we could see the fireworks. The staff was very accomodating and gave us one on the 14th floor (1449). My husband and I were there to visit the Disney parks without kids for a change. The hotel is very close to all the parks. There was a wedding and a convention while we were there but neither were a bother or concern. One pool is heated and a few people swam in January. There were several hottubs which we had almost to ourselves for one night. They have tennis courts, golf course, rock climbing wall all included. My only complaint is the resort fee is not really advertised upon check in and it's charged on your card as you check out. I think they should just include this in the nightly rate. I would stay at this hotel again for sure if we were not going to Disney. The staff and the grounds were great. The rooms were very large and comfortable, just a little dated. The view from the balcony is very pretty. My only other comment is for those going to Disney - This was our first time going to Disney without staying at a Disney resort. While the hotel was very close to Disney, it's very hard to beat the convenience of staying at a Disney resort because of all the shuttles and the extra magic hours. This hotel does have a shuttle going to Disney - but the schedule was not very often - so I would not count on it to get you to the parks. If you can swing it stay on Disney property if you are going to Disney - if you can't swing it this hotel is a great alternative but you'll need a rental car and plan to pay for parking at Disney (parking is free at the hotel if you self park). (Which reminds me some people said the parking lot was soooo far. It's not far. You can walk right out to it if you cut through the ballroom.) If you don't plan on going to Disney, then this hotel has everything you could want.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a bit worn & tired”
Reviews.Author: dbcmdc
Reviews.Content: We booked on priceline at $89/nt + $15/nt resort fee. This is an excellent resort hotel that caters to both business and pleasure travelers well. Staff service level was very high from everyone (seriously, everyone) we encountered. The quality of the room however was a bit disappointing (though still worth the $104/nt). The sliding glass door would not close properly and let in lots of air on a particularly cold windy night. The bath fixtures are barely hanging on for life, and the room furnishings have seen better days. According to their announcements, the hotel is currently undergoing a major renovation during 2009, though we saw little evidence of this and heard nothing. It appears one entire wing of the building is sealed off for the current phase of the renovation. The hotel offers a complimentary (included in resort fee) bus service to the major theme parks nearby. We used this service to both Magic Kingdom & Epcot, and found it to be very timely and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “The golf courses are highly overrated.”
Reviews.Author: QuaySmithTravellers
Reviews.Content: The golf courses that go with the hotel are highly overrated, particularly the New course, which is meant to resemble a British links course. I wouldn't pay more than $50 to play if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: swimmerhp
Reviews.Content: This is definatly the best hotel we have ever been to. The many pools were beautiful with 2 water slides for the kids and the golf course was fantastic with excellent grounds! We enjoyed cycling around and exploring the hotel by hiring bikes but my daughter found the climbing wall hard! The parrots were amusing and made us all laugh with "Pretty Polly!" The beds were comfortable and the staff were definatly 1st Class. Will definatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Magical as it's neighbor!”
Reviews.Author: bags23
Reviews.Content: I'm about as big a Disney World fan as you can get. I stay on property everytime we go to the parks, but this time was different. Because of some accumulated hotel points, I stayed at the Grand Cypress. It was fantastic! I would stay here anytime and in the future for Disney trips. We enjoyed the pools, the hottubs, the bike riding, the hammocks, and the scenery. From our room we watched the fireworks at Epcot & Magic Kingdom. Their is even the TV shows from the Disney closed circuit (Top 7 with Stacy). We did not eat at the resort, mainly because of reservations at the parks, but I will say when looking at the menus, the prices are steep. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place....”
Reviews.Author: Poohh66
Reviews.Content: This was our second New Year's Get-Away at Grand Cypress, with our 21 yr. old and our 12 yr. old daughters, and we all enjoyed it.. We stayed here 3 years ago and loved it, this time we stayed at the Regency Club Level where we had access to the concierge private lounge serving breakfast, evening cocktails and hors d'oeuvres, this was great, we really enjoyed it and took advantage of it. The hotel is beautiful, the view out of your balcony is gorgeous, no matter which side you are staying at. We stayed one whole day at the resort, went on bicycle rides in the trails along the lake, took out the kayaks, walked all around the hotel, and my husband played golf, which he really enjoyed. We will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: jaafha
Reviews.Content: Took a last minute vacation & booked the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress via Priceline - a great deal at $105 a night (plus $15 daily resort fee). Following recent reviewer's suggestion, my husband phoned ahead & requested a room with king size bed & poolside view so we could see Epcot's nightly fireworks. Although we didn't take advantage of the paddle boats & bicycles available, we did enjoy walking the paths & relaxing in sunshine by the pool areas. We opted to splurge on daily room service Starbucks coffee to go along with fruits & pastries we had purchased in nearby shopping center. Clean rooms, very comfortable beds & friendly & helpful staff made this stay wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress!”
Reviews.Author: shellyaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last weekend (December 26-28) and am pleased to say that I was very happy with the property. First, there is a security guard/guard shack at the main entrance of the extremely large property. That was a plus. We followed the signs and drove up the hill to the lobby entrance. Very nicely decorated with an Asian/Buddist theme, little statues, ponds, greenery and chairs made it a very relaxing lobby. The gigantic Christmas tree and gingerbread houses didn't really seem to fit the decor. Our check-in was extremely prompt, and the desk agent friendly and warm. A ride up the glass elevator took us to the 3rd floor. The carpeting was in very good condition, the hallway in good repair. My 5 year old daughter, while waiting for her dad to return from parking the car, announced that she hopes our room is beautiful. When she unlocked the door, she yells, "Mommy, our room is beautiful!" And, indeed, it was very comfortable, clean, and relaxing. Although it was in a Martha Stewart, garden theme, it was definitely in my taste. (My sister-in-law on the other hand said it looked like an "old lady" threw up all over it.) The headboard, and curtains were white with a large maroon based flower pattern. 2 large pillows and a bolster sat on each bed. All furnishings, carpeting, and linens were in excellent condition. Minimal sign of wear. The bathroom was oversized and following suit, was in perfect cleanliness. No mold, mildew, dust, or dirt. I could have taken a white glove and not found a speck! A weighing scale sat in the corner of the bathroom, very nice Eucalyptis Portico spa bath products were on the sink, and towels were in abundance. The A/C worked well, and I loved that there was a ceiling fan! The safe fit my laptop, and the fridge was a nice amenity to have! We ordered room service - MISTAKE! $54.00 for 1 pizza, 6 wings, and a piece of cheesecake. Although the above was absolutely delicious, I wouldn't pay it again.... Not to mention, I woke up around 6:00 AM with terrible stomach cramps. 2 things that frustrated me - the parking. On the opposite side of the hotel, it took about 15 minutes to walk to the car from the room. The parking lot is huge, and late at night, hard to find a spot near the entrance. Since we had to pass through the convention area, I peeked in some of the meeting and banquet rooms. This would be a great place to hold a meeting. And, around 10:30 on the day we were checking out, no one answered at the front desk. I tried calling twice with no answer. I also didn't get a chance to check out the grounds, since we really just had time to sleep there. But, I was so impressed, I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: MensaTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Grand Cypress is a beautiful, large resort property with a modern building, a soaring atrium, and nicely maintained tropical landscape. My room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Although my room showed some age, the rooms are gradually undergoing renovation (Nov. 08). Ask for a renovated room if possible. The hotel has numerous but rather expensive restaurants on site. However, there are a wide variety of restaurants in all price ranges within a very short drive (not walking distance). A rental car for errands and some meals may be advisable. This location is very conveniently situated between Disney World and Universal, and the hotel offers a regular shuttle service (at no charge, I believe). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, although the concierge desk was typically so busy during my stay that it wasn't worth the long wait for service. The property offers a relaxing atmosphere without leaving the grounds too --- great family-friendly pool areas with waterfalls and faux rock formations, and for recreation decent gym, tennis, etc. Oddly, they have a lake and small beach too, but alligator warnings are posted.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoResortsFan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Phenomenal resort. Onsite recretion activities are by far the best I've ever experienced at any resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: This was part of a 2 week trip to Florida with 5 hotels booked via Priceline and 1 via the hotels website. They were all 4/5* hotels. This was a close call on being the best. I paid about $80 a night. There was a $15 resort fee which they added on at the hotel. However, this did inclde a lot. They allowed you free use of boats, pitch and putt, bicyles, shuttle bus to and from theme parks. We were given a room on the 22nd floor, overlooking the pool and could see Epcot and the Magic Kingdom fireworks in the distance. Room was a bit dated but not at all tatty. The shower was in the bath tub but was incredibly strong. The pool was unbelievable. I spend a lot of time in Vegas but the pool was very good even by their standards, 3 hot tubs, 2 slides, and a pool that went through a massive grotto. We used the shuttle bus to and from all 4 disney parks. They always ran on time. The outlaws picked us up for dinner from the hotel and while they live nearby they were raving about wanting to stay there for a night. It was an unbelievable hotel. They have started reovating all the rooms, so give it a year and the hotel will be a true 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: lincoln0121
Reviews.Content: Overrated and not many options for evening dining or if you would like to just sit at a bar and have a nice glass of wine or cocktail. Watch out they might ask you for 100.00 a day for incidental chgs'. Unfortuanately I left the credit cards home and went with travelers cks and cash and unaware of this charge I wasn't quite prepared to give up 700.00 of my spending $. I was told I would not be checked in to the hotel without the fee being paid. I am a single mother just wanted to take my 9 yr old on vaca and the start of it was horrible when we got to the hotel they got him very upset he said mom what/where are we going to stay. I told him don't worry were staying right here. I opted to call my boss who so kindly faxed to the hotel his credit card # and info because he is the only one that at the time that had access to a fax machine. I think that it was outragous. The only good thing about this hotel is the pool area and grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: loulou090669
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing stay at the Hyatt. Had a room on 12th floor overlooking lake. Good view, but in my opinion worth upgrading to pool view, so u can watch Epcot and Magic Kingdom fireworks everynight. All staff excellent, especially the Bellmen and the guys outside the front. Shuttle bus to the parks were frequent with approx 3 drops in morn and 3 pickups in eve, very easy to use and the drivers very helpful, especially Chuck. There is quite a walk from hotel entrance to the gates, however they run a shuttle on demand to anywhere within the hotel grounds. I 4t rooms were lovely and in keeping with the area, they were clean and very comfortable although the beds were quite small. We had a tour of the new refurbished rooms, which are completly different to how they are at mo, very up to date, contempary, personally i felt more for the business man but very nice. There is a small fridge in room, which we found most helpful. We bought milk daily from supermarket just down road and little cereal pots, which saved money everyday...and our waistline!! Food in restaurants within hotel expensive, so we went to little collection of restaurants outside gates, the most we ever walked was 7mins but most were 3mins. We found the best ones were Macaroni Grill, Red Lobster and by far the best The Olive Garden. There is a Sizzler, Crab Shack, Black Angus and many more. Worst place we ate was TGI Fridays..food cold, service bad, very salty fries...believe me, dont go there. Pirates Cove golf course behind TGI's brilliant fun. No need to take towels as of course u have the ones in room, and can collect pool ones from kiosk near the pools, by showing room key. The pools are out of this world. All were open but only 1 heated. So many areas to sunbathe especially if u carry on past the heated pool where the other slide is. 3 hot tubs, and god, were they hot...like being in a bath. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, I went with 10yr old daughter and 72yr old Mum and both loved it. Pls contact me if you would like any more info.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good/ Nearly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: docatail
Reviews.Content: Taking our 6 year old, baby wife and my parents ( non adventurers) so the 6 year old could enjoy Disney etc before waiting for the baby to grow a little. Were going to need days off between theme parks for rest in a hotel with enough to do..... This was absolutely the place ....pool had 2 slides the larger was manned, but only open when there were enough wanting to use it....... 2 or more. Most of the pool is not heated so chilly but swimmable, the smaller heated area has the small slide ,and fountains to swim under ....which was just plenty. Very quiet hotel in the english Oct /Nov half term but climbing wall, pedalos, lovely pitch and putt still kept open, despite hardly anyone around which was great. We were told by BA travel agents that the hotel was doing some refurb which would not affect us, which was true, we didnt see anything of it. Only slight problem was the price in the hotel. Even a coffee was fairly expensive. The hotel suggested that it's restaurants were of such distinction that we weren't inclined to go there at all as it seemed a bit indulgent and quite pricey. The staff were very good ( albeit with an open palm) We palked in self parking which was very close and made life more flexible. The guest assistance service was excellent and booked all our tickets and gave us all our directions. There is a multitude of chain restaurants within 2 mins drive . You could walk it in 5 mins. The "Ale House" opposite was the best and despite its Pub like name was very child friendly. All the Disney parks were within 10 to 15 mins drive and easy to get to. On the whole a lovely calm and beautiful hotel away from (but close to ) the theme parks...recommended

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great Hotel and worthy of its 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: ldinelli
Reviews.Content: I booked a week long stay at the Hyatt back in May, 2008. Just came back from a weeks long stay and I can say, I m very glad I didn't listen to several people who posted on this site about this hotel being dated and poor service. I can say that they were completely WRONG..... Even with a massive remodel, they hotel and staff were AWESOME..... We stayed on the 17th floor PH floor in room 1726.... We had awesome views of Downtown Disney, Epcot and Magic Kingdom. Every night, fireworks and we also over looked the pool. Every concern we had, if any, the hotel took care of. Once this hotel is remodeled, I cannot imagine how incredible it will then be... If you are planning a trip to WDW, a must consider.....

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritie
Reviews.Content: Stayed many times over the past 15 years love the high standards of accomodation the people working there try very hard to please their guests.Have not been for a while as the flights are so long ,but will go back one day as this is our favourite holiday destination.The rooms overlooking the pool high floors are the best more expensive but worth it as you can see the Epcot firework displays.The champagne Sunday brunch is superb must be booked in advance as popular with non residents.Russell the Bell Captain made our holiday very special on our last visit, giving good advise on things to do places to eat etc.However from other reviews work is being done in the area of the Hotel at the moment ,cant imagine how they need to improve anything.Maybe we will see the changes in the near future when we return to the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress (hopefully)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and grounds are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: PCBailey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for 1 night on October 9th. When we got there we went directly to the self-parking lot. The hotel has a huge atrium with fine art, Macaw stands and ponds. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. We got an excellent rate through Hotwire for $165 with taxes and fees. We were able to use the kiosk in the front lobby to check-in ourselves. We had a double room on the end of the 3rd floor. It was an easy walk down the stairs to the parking lot. The room was nice but a bit on the small side with 2 small double beds. We faced the front of the hotel and there was a small standing balcony. In the morning I called the front desk and got a late check out at 1 o’clock. We wanted a coffee and a bagel, but the café wasn’t open and we didn’t feel like $12 eggs at the restaurant. We knew about the $15 resort fee, so we tried to take advantage of the activities offered. We canoed and kayaked around the small lake. One of the staff told us to look for the alligator but then said he had only seen 2 in the 22 years that he worked there. We had a swim and checked out the waterslides. The pool area and landscaping was very nice. The pool had grottos and waterfalls but the water was a bit cool. We had a soak in one of the hot tubs. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Rsueh
Reviews.Content: The lobby was amazing and staff were very welcoming with check in. Business amenities were very convenient. Rooms were gorgeous and comfortable. The staff were very helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfy”
Reviews.Author: sevdah
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference for couple of days, pool was opened while I was there. Rooms are large and comfortable and just as in pictures. There was construction around but I was not bothered by it. Very extensive grounds and extremely friendly people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BrentFinch
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days on business and were impressed initially. On the plus side: We had an end room on the second floor which was tastefully decorated but the "view" was onto the concrete roofs of other buildings. We found the bed to be one of the most comfortable we've slept on. We liked that there was a small fridge in the room. The gardens are lovely. Less good: By the end of the stay we were irritated by being nickel and dimed - we opted to eat breakfast at the coffee bar which was way overpriced (but not as expensive as having the breakfast buffet). Why can budget hotels offer free internet but more expensive ones charge? There are four or five restuarants in the complex but their hours often meant that only one was open. We didn't use the pool but to do so would have meant walking through the main lobby. Perhaps it comes down to the fact that we prefer smaller, more intimate places. (The hotel was booked on our behalf).

Reviews.Title: “Come here! you wont regret it!”
Reviews.Author: AndyCoueslant
Reviews.Content: Hi, I'm writing this from the 16th floor of this beautiful hotel using wireless internet access. Balcony doors are open and the kids area about to watch fireworks at MK and Epcot. Will write a full review when we get back to Scotland but if you have any doubts about coming here, forget them. This place is great! It has everything and the staff are fantastic. Great hotel, great location!

Reviews.Title: “4* Grounds with a 2* Room”
Reviews.Author: cdnpacker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress from Oct 3-Oct7, 2008. Upon Checkin we were informed the only room left with a king bed was on the 5th floor - we took it but quickly called the front desk to move as the room was horrible. There was no closet door and the bathroom to quote my wife was "like something you would see in a dorm room". We moved to a room on the 15th floor but it was 2 beds not a king. The view was fantastic we could see both Epcot and MK fireworks from our balcony. Ask for a pool view on the higher floors for this view. The room was very dated and old. The bathroom was ok - but the vent in the bathroom was completely blocked with dust and dirt - had to have maintenance clean it - they "must have missed that one". Overall we were very disappointed with the room but I will say that the service was good when we did call to complain. The grounds are really nice. We rented a bike and rode around the property - wish we had more time to explore but we were too focused on the parks and shopping. In summary if you are using this hotel for a base for the parks/shopping (it is close) but the room will disappoint. If you want to enjoy the grounds you will like this place. I was not too upset though because I paid less than $100 a night (resort fee included) thanks to priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTravelqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in June as a base for a holiday with our 11 year old niece. No criticisms - we loved the hotel. The rooms may be ready for a re-furb as other reviewers have posted - but not enough for it to be an issue. We had a room overlooking the lake and a wonderful view of the fireworks at Magic Kingdom! The staff were great - friendly and attentive. Food great. Pool area - perfect - quiet areas can be found. Would go back at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “Overpaid and Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: sobefoodie1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the Grand Cypress looking for, and expecting, a nice 4-star resort and romantic weekend. The photos of the hotel posted in adverts highlighted the pools, so to echo the previous poster, we were very disappointed to find after we got there that the pools were closed during the entire length of our stay. The hotel did not advertise the closure, neither did the staff inform us. The hotel should not charge resort rates if the resort portion of the hotel is closed. To add insult to injury, there was a $15 per day resort fee levied on our bill upon check out (which was not advertised prior to our nonrefundable online booking and payment). $15.00 per day is not a significant fee, but there should be some value or benefit tied to the added payout. The rooms and decor were severely outdated and tacky. The rooms reminded me of a high end nursing home. The tv was bulky and tiny. The shower did not work properly as the water poured out in one opening (similar to water coming out of hose), as opposed to regular shower heads that separate the water droplets. While the staff was friendly and helpful, Check in was speedy, but there was no champagne or any other perks associated with check-in. The premises were clean, and the grounds are beautiful. I've stayed at many Hyatts and this one doesn't even come close to matching the quality one would expect. The hotel simply does not measure up to its star level or cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - pool closed ;-(”
Reviews.Author: princessartois
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - great price with Expedia Shame about the resort fee added to our bill!! we wernt informed about. $15 a night The large pool was closed for a week of our holiday - which was a shame. Hotel is very nice and clean - although slightly dated decor in the rooms. The restaurants seemed to be closed or empty so we didnt bother eating at the hotel. (we had room service one evening - which was very quick and reasonably priced) There are many local restaurants within walking distance. We did walk to Downtown Disney one day but quite a walk. Bus to the parks is efficient (watch out for Chuck and his little tales) Overall a great holiday and great place to stay x ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with great, attentive staff!”
Reviews.Author: lvetotrvel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful 3 day stay at the Hyatt. We asked to be on the upper floors with some kind of view and they accommodated us. We also got a great deal with full breakfast included because we are AAA members. The pool area is lovely (not too crowded) and the exercise room is more than adequate. The landscaping around the resort is very lush. They had bikes and boats and putting green- all with no fee or extra cost! (Don't know if that is the case during busy season). We used their bikes and rode around the extensive acreage that surrounds the resort. The trails we took were paved and easy to get to. The breakfast were great. We wanted to take some food to my sister who did not come down for breakfast and they included some extra pastry and muffin for free! On our last day, we asked for a late checkout (2pm) and since we were Hyatt Gold Members, they rearranged the rooms so they could accomodate us. What more can I say? We were sad to leave...thanks Hyatt for a wonderful stay! P.S. Since they are on such a lush and extensive piece of property, you do need to watch where you are walking and stay on the paved path provided. We saw a small snake that disappeared in the bushes quickly. Other than that we enjoyed exploring the lovely grounds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service by Staff!”
Reviews.Author: LegoJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Cypress over the weekend from Fri-Sun. My husband had a work conference to attend there, so that was the purpose of our stay. VALET: Perfect. The valet was actually full; however, they were able to accomodate us as an exception. CHECK-IN: Impeccable--this was the easiest check-in we have ever had. They have the check-in kiosks so you swipe your credit card and it's complete (just like the self check-in at the airport). There is someone there to help and also to get you champagne (which was an extra special touch!) ROOMS: We were in Room 920 which overlooked the city. The rooms were pretty outdated in furnishing (green with flowers--kind of early 90s style), but everything was very clean. Beds were very comfortable and had plush pillows and white down comforters. The bathroom was a good size, again clean as well. ROOM SERVICE: Outstanding! We had the late night dinner (tomato & mozzarella salad & club sandwich). This was delivered promptly. We also had the morning breakfast and this was delivered right on time with great service by the staff. POOL: Was beautiful, but we didn't have time to utilize. BANQUET SERVICES: We had a decades dinner on Friday and a finale dinner on Saturday. Both went off without a hitch and again the staff was excellent!! BAR: Bar staff was great, prompt service by the bartenders and the wait staff. RESTAURANTS: Did not get a chance to utilize. OVERALL: Rooms could be updated, hotel grounds are beautiful, service is impeccable and unbeatable in the Orlando area. We will definitely be back!! Please feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Small resort in it's own right”
Reviews.Author: wendykoala
Reviews.Content: This review is a little different to my others on the site only because on this trip I won the holiday. It was a 14 night stay and we packed such a lot into the trip, but the hotel did it's best to relax and refresh us also. When we arrived we were offrered the choice of going straight to our room which looked over the lake and gardens, or having a tour of the hotel. As it is indeed a large hotel we settled for the tour.. and we were glad we did as our host gave us so much helpful information before safely depositing us at our room and all for a small gratuity which we were glad to give. We did use the hotel transportation service to take us along the driveway to the crossroads from where there were several eateries and yes it is perfectly safe to cross the roads there. We also used one of the hotel's taxis to take us to the mall and the driver arranged a time to collect us. In fact the staff could not do enough for us and always made time to ask my daughter where she had been that day. Likewise the hotels bus drivers who take you to all the parks at scheduled times. Just a small tip each journey and they would offer to drop us at a restaurant en-route when we returned from the parks and so cheerful and chatty. We also used the transportation to get to the hotel's equestrian centre do not try and walk there !!!. We went on a western trail ride in the morning through the woods and it was cool and refreshing. The centre is excellent and again friendly and helpful staff.Even if you don't ride you can sit in a rocking chair on the verandah and relax and little ones can have pony rides or lessons. We loved the pool area and always found time for an evening dip. We did eat in the hotel twice and found it to be reasonable as the food was very fresh and room service was very good too especially large portions were delivered to our room when we were just too tired to move after a day swimming with the dolphins. All together a gorgeous hotel with staff who take a pride in their work, some have worked there all their lives and their other family members look forward to working there with them. We would love another visit .

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm amidst madness of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: NettyPoole
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute via Amex. Excellent rates in a lovely room. Early check-in and late check-out. Wine and cheeseboard in the room. After 12 hours a day in the theme parks the Hyatt is a grown up respite from the craziness of WDW and Universal. Excellent restaurants, great staff who were very helpful. Loved the welcome champagne on arrival. Wonderful views of the parks from our room with fireworks in the distance. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are impeccable!!! Great Service”
Reviews.Author: WithoutATrace
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Grand Cypress, after checking out of a condo hotel due to LACK OF SERVICE! Upon arriving at the Hyatt Grand Cypress, we were greeted by an employee, four times before reaching the check in desk. WOW! I was impressed before I checked in. Our room was a typical - two queen beds, and our view was beautiful of EPCOT and the pool, golf course, etc. Room Service was wonderful and so was the food!!!! My son really enjoyed this resort.........and if he is happy...I am happy. They really know how to make you feel like,........they are glad you chose to stay at their resort. It seemed like every employee had a personal interest in making sure we were enjoying ourselves. Great job to the people training the staff. I know several four star resorts that could use some training for their employees. Keep up the good work. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMJJ
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (kids age 12 and 9) just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. It was the first stop of a two week trip continuing in Miami and then cruising the Bahamas. We had a great time. My husband and I stayed there once 16 years ago and the hotel basically looked the same. The rooms have the exact decor of almost two decades ago. Nothing is updated; bathrooms, TV, fixtures etc. The balcony is very small and does not have seating. That being said everything else was marvelous. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and attentive and the grounds beautiful. Golf if you can and try and spend at least one day by the pool. The pool was never crowded because most people were visiting the parks. The atrium in the lobby is a sight to be seen. The views from each floor magnificent. We didn't want to leave. Oh, the breakfast buffet is delicious and worth the money especially if your kids are under 12 and can eat at half price. All and all a fun and memorable time had by everyone. We will be coming back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel All Round - Can't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: Yatesy77
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel for many reasons: Great location, just 5 minutes from Disney World, 15 mins from Seaworld & Universal Studios. The hotel is big but never feels to busy. It is very clean, service is good. There is so much to do here - sailing, kayaking, pitch & putt golf, pools, cycling.......you will not be bored. Rooms - clean, as spacious as they need to be. There is a massive car park so you don't need to worry about parking the car - it takes a couple of minutes to walk there which is only a problem if you are lazy. You can also valet park but this not the cheapest. Service overall was excellent. We never eat on the hotel, but that was because we wanted to eat out as they are so many different restaurants within 2 mins drive. Although you have to go to a shopping mall 20 mins away to find a Cheese Cake Factory - which is not to be missed. Shopping wise, there are 3 malls, the outlet one is 5 mins away, which is ok. The 2 other normal malls are very good. Golf - if you play golf, you have to play either at the hotel's partnered course, which was nice but even better was the Osprey Ridge course at Disney - I wish I could play there every week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lozza2811
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 12 night stay at the Hyatt with my daughter. We loved the Hotel especially being able to nip downstairs for our Starbucks Coffee to start the day!! Staff extremely helpful and friendly however not in your face every minute of the day. I notice that people on this forum have said the hotel is dated - we thought it kitsch - afterall its a hotel, escape from home, something different. We had pool view and could see the fireworks at Epcot and Wishes at MK over to the right of our room. Free shows nightly - fab. Hyatt very clean in all public areas and toilets considering how busy the hotel was. We too experienced the Little Miss Pageant and the pushy mothers but rather than moan about not getting in the lifts (wasn't much room for us and the ballgowns!) we laughed about it. Pool was as good as all the reviews. Location was tops. The only think i would say I can criticise is eh NOTHING. Definately stay here again on next jolly to Florida and will be recommending to all family and friends. It is being fully refurbished this year so it will be even nicer!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: teetime4two
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times and will go back again. The people are very helpful and the rooms which have two balconies are excellent with great views. The prices for meals at the restaurants in the hotel are off the charts. Very expensive so you may want to think about eating off the property. The pool area was super packed because it was a holiday weekend and we found a lot of debris at the bottom of the pool the two days we were there. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellHighlands
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and were not that impressed. The hotel is very nice and big but for me this was a downside, with soo many guests you often had to wait a while to get the lift and the walk from your room to the self car park was quite far. The facilities were great though , the pool was huge with 2 kids slides and compfy pool loungers ,their were paddle boats and kayaks and bikes to use free of charge and also the pitch n putt golf. The restaurants all looked very nice but posh and expensive. We had the breakfast buffet 1 morning which was lovely , a huge choice and nice surroundings but quite expensive too. The rooms were clean and addequate but for the price of this hotel the room decor was a bit dated and the iron and hairdryer which are in the closet were old fashioned . The balcony was very small but enough to stand on. My good point about the rooms was the air conditioning was quiet which in past experiences is not always the case. Overall a nice hotel but not the wow I was expecting for the price of it !

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a pool!”
Reviews.Author: springa2z
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here June 24-July 1. The rooms were nicely furnished and the beds were very comfortable. The decor, particularly in the bathroom was a little dated, but livable. Housekeeping was okay, although I noticed some things they missed during our stay. We stayed during the Little Miss pageant (must be an annual thing, as I read reviews that repeated some of the same problems from last year). There were problems with traffic flow & the elevators, the layout of the hotel is a little awkward during the frequent Florida rainstorms or various closures of the dining facilities for events, as the only way to the pool was through the lobby and several restaurants or a long winding path through the gardens. My daughter did the horseback riding lesson - she loved it - probably the highlight of her trip! The grounds are beautiful and the pool is breathtaking - probably the best we have ever seen. The kids loved it and didn't want to leave. Although the hotel was fully booked, there were always comfortable chairs available under the umbrellas and there was more than ample space in the pool. Waterfalls, grottos, bridges, the gardens...it really was amazing. They also have a beach area with hammocks and chairs. Our room was pool view and we could see all the area fireworks at night. The shuttle service was spotty and somewhat inconvenient. Its best to get a car to get you around if you stay here. The food is expensive. The breakfast buffet is probably the best meal we had at the hotel. Overall, we would stay at this hotel again, if only for the truly spectacular pool!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel but good staff”
Reviews.Author: mgalovic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days for a work conference. The hotel is very nice and has a wonderful atmosphere. But after a rainstorm there were numerous leaks in the lobby. I also had a problem with my room key not working for the better part of the second day. The staff was amazing though, they went out of there way to help you and were always smiling and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Lovely Pool”
Reviews.Author: UKElr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights (30 May to 2 June) with my husband. I had requested a king room with lake view on my reservation, but this was not visible upon check-in, so I asked the receptionist and she 'upgraded' me to a room with a view of epcot (to see the fireworks, which is a nice bonus). Room 803 was nice, a fair size with a king bed. The bed itself wasn't very comfortable as it had far too many (feather) pillows - 6 in total and a duvet sandwiched between two bed sheets, which got very tangled up when sleeping. We had lunch once at the pool, where the the food was good and the service was just ok. The pool is the great part about this hotel. It's huge with a large 'alcove' area, nice temperature, a number of waterfalls / spa tubs and most importantly it was clean. Resort facilities - We only tried the driving range (not enough time), which was good, but would have been much better with some overhead cover (the sun was VERY hot). First Negative : The in-room fridge was locked with no key in sight. We rang down twice for the key, but to no avail. On the first evening upon our return to the hotel we decided to ask reception for the key, which they gave to us straightaway and so we made our way up to our room. Unfortunately, when we returned to our room we realised we had locked our keys in the room, so my husband went down to reception. 20 minutes later, my husband returned, quite furious- reception had asked him for proof of ID (I had booked the hotel in my maiden name). It didn't matter that we had both been to see the same receptionist literally 2 minutes earlier, nor the fact that my husband had left his credit card details at check-in. Even the manager was useless at sorting this out and despite saying they would send someone up to speak to me to confirm who my husband was, no-one actually turned up. Second Negative : The patio window was extremely dirty, especially on the outside. For a 5-star hotel, I find this quite unacceptable. The internal walk from the self-parking lot to reception takes you through all the hotel conference rooms, which isn't ideal when you are not staying at the hotel for a conference. On many occassions we had to 'fight' out way through the crowds of people - morning, day and night. All in all a nice hotel. It's probably only worth the money if you plan on using most of the resort facilities though.

Reviews.Title: “Snakes at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: sighwest
Reviews.Content: Daughter was bitten at the Hyatt Grand Cypress resort as we were walking through the tropical garden area from the parking lot on June 3rd. Occured on the sidewalk withing 20 feet of the back entrance. This was the second snake that I had seen in two days. Spent the last night of vacation at the ER. Parents, be careful. Hotel claims no responsibility for their snake problem. I even had to file the incident on my insurance, because they called it an "act of God". No apologies, or responsibility from manager Leo, or Dave. Other than that experience, the pool is fantastic. Air was stale on the upper floors. The hotel itself is showing its age. Air conditioning was terrible in our small double bed room. Maxed out, it was 76 degrees in there during afternoon hours. We had a pool view, fireworks from Disney were decent, but not the highlight of the trip as previously mentioned. Oh, and DO NOT eat the breakfest buffet at Cascades unless you want to spend major moola. There is a reason why the price isn't listed anywhere. I spent 94 dollars for my family of 4 with one being a 5 year old for a buffet that would come free with a stay at many other hotels. Denny's would be a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: josh28
Reviews.Content: attended a trade show in orlando and this is where we stayed. They nickel and dime you to death...everything was extra and the food prices at the dining establishments were outrageous. Hotel is looking very old but the staff was friendly and the pool area was outstanding. There are so many newer hotels in Orlando so next time through i think we'll choose one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NVZ5BKUQ
Reviews.Content: After reading Trip Advisor we chose this hotel as a base for two weeks of visiting the Disney and Universal Theme Parks. We hired a car and everything is within 20 minutes drive. It is also convenient for Downtown Disney and Kennedy Space Centre is just over an hour away. There is a Premier Designer mall about two miles away that my family said is better for shopping than the larger Florida Mall. A GPS is an excellent idea. The hotel is stunning with a large atrium and five fast lifts. In the atrium there is a bar which tends to close a bit earlier than most European bars would and a sushi chef. The sushi is very good but we did see a cockroach living in the wood bark that is inside the atrium, to be fair we saw cockroaches around other food outlets in Orlando, in Florida they grow quick big so it is difficult to miss them. Food in the hotel is not very special and expensive and outside the hotel is restricted to hamburgers, donuts, waffles, steaks and chips etc. You will need some fruit and vegetables when you get home. Outside it gets better with a swimming pool area, hot tubs and water slides that is a mini-theme park in its own right. The swimming pool and gym are open 24h. There is a large attached conference centre and the hotel is more geared up to conference delegates than holidaymakers trudging back to their rooms with bags of towels. The typical guest is a delegate making deals on his or her mobile 'phone. This means that the pool is always under-used. There are also many other facilities (sailing and pedalo on the small lake etc). After paying for three rooms for two weeks they tried to charge us eighty dollars to keep one of the rooms on for three hours but then changed their minds. Again this would be a formality in a European holidaymakers hotel but this is a conference hotel where they are used to guests charging everything to their companies. The rooms are very good, there are a few niggles though such as knobs coming off taps, fiddly light switches, dripping showers and TVs at funny angles so the remote will not work. They charge five dollars for a warm bottle of water but give you unlimited free coffee! There is an (empty) fridge in the room which you have to ask for the key for. It says you will be charged 45 dollars for personal use but I think this is a hangover from when it was a fully-stocked minibar. Madness. TIP: Not all the rooms are the same! The best rooms on each floor are X23 X24 X47 X48 X71 and X72 where X is the floor number. These are on the ends of the three arms of the hotel and have a double aspect. X26-X48 (even numbers) and X49-X71 (odd numbers) have a view of the fireworks at the Disney parks each night. In general with this hotel the higher, the better. Try not to get a room by an ice machine which is noisy. There is also a big waterfall in the breakfast room which is so noisy it is better to sit away from it. Lastly if you plug your PC into the hotel's Ethernet you will be asked for 12.99 dollars a day for Internet. If you leave it unplugged then T-Mobile's wireless network is 9.99. Although this is technically for a day, providing you do not drop the connection it tends to keep going until (for example) you have to reboot your computer for other reasons. (TIP: Turn off automatic updating which reboots your PC in the middle of the night). The service is good but sometimes you have to repeatedly ask for it for example outside the atrium at night it is very difficult to get served. Europeans sit outside on warm evenings whereas Americans tend to want to sit inside in air-conditioned comfort. Overall this is an excellent hotel which has a bit of a problem integrating the high-powered delegates from all over the US with the few European sunseekers who discover it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: boomeruk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for the second week of a two week holiday recently with my wife and 4 year old daughter. We spent the first week staying at the Hard Rock hotel so it was going to be interesting to see the differences between the two hotels. The first thing to notice is this hotel is massive, i mean massive. The grounds seem to go on forever - all of it seemingly very well maintained. We self parked and went in via a side entrance which takes you past the large conferencing suites, up an escalator and into the main lobby which is a highly impressive atrium that goes up the entire 18 floors of the hotel. The first thing that grabs you attention, beyond the size of the property is how polite all the staff are - i mean all the staff not just the front desk and bell desk. one example is a day or so later we were walking to the car and i was in conversation with my wife and a groundsman ahead who was using a leaf blower noticed us approaching and stopped his machnie whilst we passed, smiled at us and then only turned the machine on once we were out of ear shot. The style of the hotel is a great contrast to the Hard Rock hotel, whereas that hotel goes for a cool, modern look the look of the Hyatt reminds me a bit of some Vegas hotels i have stayed in and can seem a bit 'Golden Girls' in the style of the decor. Not a problem, just an observation. Our room on the Regency Club level was lovely and the maid service was timely and efficient. The Regency Club lounge was rather smaller than i expected but the quality of the staff and food were excellent (I personally prefered this club room to that of the Hard Rock but both are perfectly acceptable). The major difference i noticed between this club room and the hard rock club room was that at the Hyatt they had a 'cordial hour' between 8 - 9 pm which was an adults only affair. Cordials turned out to be a 'beer, wine, spirits and deserts / chocolates hour' ! Wireless internet access was available throughout the room via T-moblie at $10 a day and wired internet access was available in the rooms but seemed pointless given the wireless availability. So far so good so do i have any reservations about the hotel? Well yes. Travelling with a 4 year old i tend to spend alot of time worrying about what mischief my daughter might get up to. My first concern was the hotel atrium. the Atrium is effectively a hub and the hotel has three accomodation wings that connect to the hub. To get to any of the accomodation wings you have to go up the lifts in the atrium and then walk along a walkway that skirts along the atrium. this walkway has a glass walled rail around it that is probably no more that 40 inches in height. I just would have felt more comfortable if that rail had been 50 inches tall as i felt is was just low enough for my daughter to attempt to climb if i didn't keep a watch on her. Given we were on the 11th floor ..... My other concern was the pool area. The pool is massive with three pools (two interconnected), water slides and watefalls etc (again it reminded me of the pool at the Mirage in Vegas) so it is easy to loose sight of an active 4 year old. Given my daughter cannot swim properly then i obviously want her to be able to enjoy the pool safely yet for some reason the pool did not have any life guards. Given the hotel employee so many staff it seems bizzare that they don't have life guards especially as they told me they have mostly families staying at the hotel. In most respects this hotel is amazing, the service is impeccable - the best I've ever experienced in a large hotel, the grounds lovely, the food great etc but I'm still very uncomfortable about the lack of lifeguards and the lack of height of the rails on the skywalk corrider to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: codespewer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. The hotel is very nice and my room was clean and comfortable. Loved the sheets and pillows as there were soft/medium/firm pillows provided. My ratings for a hotel are greatly influenced by the bed and the sheets as I only use the room to sleep in and store my clothes. If the remote is working I am happy. The staff are very friendly and attentive. They have a nice Sushi bar in the hotel but prices kept me away from the other two hotel restaurants. Drinks were pricey also as I heard someone paid $17 dollars for a pool side margarita, no it was not the fish bowl kind. Two pools one heated and one not heated. I did not go in the unheated pool as it was way to cold. The water in the pool is saltwater which I hate but it does cool you off and the kids I saw did not seem to mind. Free use of bikes, sailboats on good sized pond. I would recommend the Olde Ale House (name might not be exact) restaurant across the street from the entrance to the hotel property. Its a sports bar and this one makes my top 5 sport bar list BWW being #1. I ran into a local couple that runs a restaurant in Kissimee and they go there to get away from there place so you know the price is right. I had 10oz prime rib for $12 and it was very good (not great but I was not disappointed) you can get a bucket of 6 beers for under $6. This place was always busy but we never waited more than 5 minutes for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and close to theme parks”
Reviews.Author: DRU2C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday in Naples Florida. We were returning to the UK via Orlando so the night before the flight we drove up from Naples. On checking TA for hotels we decided on the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress and were certainly not disappointed. It is a lovely hotel set in beautiful surroundings. If you can afford the extra it is well worth upgrading to a Regency Club Room where you have access to its own floor with a lounge which was ideal for us. The lounge is on the eleventh floor and as well as having some excellent views also provided tea, coffee, snacks, soft drinks etc. Wine and beer were available later in the evening and also continental breakfast in the morning (all free of charge). This is a hotel that we would stay in again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: pang4ever
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10 pm and managed to get a nice pool view room at no extra charge (more probable if you check in late we heard and it seem to be true). The room was small for the price and dated as others mentioned, but we didn't care since most of our time will be spent outside. We just wanted a pool view for the daily fireworks (Epcot @ 9pm and another @ 10pm). I do want to warn parents of small children, the railing on the balcony is very spaced out so watch your little ones. My oldest is 7 and his head and body can fit right thru them so I kept the balcony door locked at all times since I also had my 2 and 5 year olds with us. It was still scary knowing my 5 and 7 are capable of turning the lock and opening the balcony door themselves. Another thing was the entrance door. It's not seal to the carpet. I would say it's about 1-1.5 inch off the ground so you can hear hallway noises easily. Our floor was quiet, but I felt bad every time my kids left the room. Housekeeping was great and done everyday for the 5 days we were there. The landscaping was beautiful. As mentioned by others, there were plenty to do that was included in the fee: canoeing, sailing, paddle boating, kayaking, biking (free - even had 6 and 4 passenger bike cart, along with bike with toddler seat behind, and helmets for all). The pitch-putt was fun and entertaining for my boys. There are 2 swimming pools and 2 slides. The smaller slide is in the heated smaller (kids) pool. Side note: it said heated to 81 but it felt more like 71. The big pool is BIG and has a BIG slide, but you have to be of a certain height (i like to say 48-54 inches). We were hardly on the big pool cause it was cold. The sign said 71 but it felt more like Lake Michigan, low 60's. The shallowest part of both pools is 3'6, with 10 being the deepest. There are 4 hot tubs, but only 3 working ones when we were there. There's also a beach area with nice sands and provided sand toys for the kids to play, and hammock & shade for me to lay in. We didn't use the arcade, but there's one. The playground is no longer there. :-( The gym was great and I tried the equpments out one late evening (awesome), but never made time to work out. The gym and pool/hot tubs are open 24/7. Security walks thru the area often so you're more than safe. The bike, boating, putt closed at 6. We always went out to eat so I can't comment on the resturants on site. The hotel is a 10 minutes walk (kids' pace) to the main road where all the restaurants are. BTW, there is free parking and I recommend you use it if you want to save $$$. It seems far, but it's not at all since it's located by the pool. We self parked the whole time and enjoyed the nice 5 min stroll thru the pool grounds to the elevator. Parking was not busy when we were there (April 18-23) and the elevators were quick. We never waited more than a minute. They have a bus shuttle that takes you to the theme parks. It leaves at 9 and 11 and picks you up at 7. I think I covered everything. Overall, we had a great time here. My boys loved it and want to return so if we can afford it we'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: myriad
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We were on the 16th floor, great view from the large room. The staff were great, as was the gym and pool - they have 3 running routes, which I used, and a lovely nature walk (bring bug spray!) We ate in their sushi resturant, which was very good indeed. The atruim of the hotel is beautiful, with some parrots flying free in there. All in all, amazing. I would come back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Not just another ‘off property’ hotel !”
Reviews.Author: JohnandJudyFlorida
Reviews.Content: Despite living less than 30 miles from the Grand Cypress we have stayed there for quite ‘get-away’ weekends several times. Essentially a family resort it also offers pleasant walks, an Equestrian Center, several themed cocktail bars, coffee shop and two restaurants. There is also a ‘Chef’s Table’ where you eat in the kitchen while Chefs demonstrate the preparation and cooking of each dish. Recently we returned for a romantic package weekend, champagne, chocolate-dipped strawberries and orchids – impressed my wife and got the weekend off to a nice start. As a long-time Hyatt Gold member, and now a ‘senior’ Hyatt offer amazing discounts on the rack-rates and even, on web prices. Like many of the other reviewers, our experience of excellent staff attitudes started at check-in, greeted with a glass of wine and a smile we were soon ushered up to our pleasant, clean room – with a charming view. Enormous soft mattresses and snowy linen and duvet make the Hyatt beds some of the best in the business. Staff attitudes were tested with a few little problems and only one member failed the test. Asking for afternoon tea in the Cascades Restaurant we were referred to the coffee shop. We explained we meant hot tea, not iced, with sandwiches and pastries, not plastic cups (the coffee shop is poolside). She just shrugged and I asked for the manager. He quickly seated us by the charming fountain and we enjoyed our afternoon tea and a long chat with him.
