Hemmingway’s overlooks the spectacular pool cliffs and caves and is a very good restaurant, well worth visiting even if you are not staying at the hotel. We wandered in to make a reservation before it was actually open, but the staff unlocked the doors and gave us a quick tour. We met the duty Chef and mentioned our young son who was coming up for dinner with his wife was a vegetarian – was there anything he could recommend? He said he would prepare a special vegetarian meal of two courses from some very fresh vegetables that had just been delivered. While we enjoyed our duck appetizer and Lobster Crusted Sea bass we did cast envious eyes at his beautifully prepared veggies!

Reviews.Title: “Bring lots of money!”
Reviews.Author: sg1rob
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this place. The staff was very friendly, but everything costs too much. Internet hook up was $11.99. Bottled water was $4.95. Valet parking was $19 (which the valet doesn't tell you; you have to look for the little sign in the corner). No complementary breakfast. All this for $240 a night. For comparison, I stayed at a nearby Holiday Inn Express the day before for $100 a night. Free parking, free wireless Internet, and free breakfast. The room was almost as nice, the staff just as friendly, and the bathroom towels were better. If you must have luxury and have the cash, you'll like it. But for the everyday traveller, there are better values out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality resort hotel near Disney”
Reviews.Author: Paperclipper
Reviews.Content: Great resort hotel. Helpful and friendly staff. Food great in Hemingway's bar. Not so great at the White Horse. Try and get a deal that includes the buffet breakfast. You'll have to drive/cab anywhere from here if you want to eat out, the driveway from the road is probably further than most would want to walk. Downtown Disney is very near for meals/evenings out with the family. Plenty of activities in the hotel grounds including two pools. Free shuttle bus to Disney, but times not very frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the madness!”
Reviews.Author: nickihof
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a family trip to Florida to celebrate our wedding. We wanted somewhere slightly upmarket to recover from the flight, close enough to Seaworld and shopping, before we hit the madness that is Disney! As you enter the resort it is easy to feel you are slightly away from it all. We received a great welcome as we pulled up in the car, and this continued as we checked in with a glass of champagne and a guided tour to our room. The rooms are spacious enough for a family of four and pretty standard for this grade of hotel. What stands out, apart from the level of service. are the facilities. Great pool area, hot tubs, bikes, walks, horse-riding and golf. It would be easy not to leave the property! What makes you leave might be the cost of eating in but there are many places to eat within a short driving distance. Visiting in October we got a great rate. As we were handed some bottles of cold water as we left for the Yacht Club we agreed this would be worth another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, worn and desperately in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: bocae
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice looking building but, once you are inside, you realize just how long it has been since this property has seen an update. The rooms are average size with fair beds, worn carpet, old fashioned 19"TV, and a floral trellis wallpaper in the bathroom that has to be seen to be believed! Has that damp and musty old Florida scent... Booked this stay through Amex Centurion and cannot believe that this property is part of their program.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay at Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: Sherrib123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children (ages 11 and 14) stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress this past week. We had an excellent stay there. I wouldn't normally comment on check-in, but the woman who assisted us really was exceptional. With the exception of one guy who worked in the gift shop - who was only so-so, everyone at the Hyatt was friendly and helpful beyond what I expected. The man who took our bags to our room offered a brief, interesting tour that gave us our bearings at the hotel. One man doing maintenance, stopped to explain some of the art we were looking at in the halls. The doormen were always there and always friendly, and the restaurant staff were excellent, too. Shortly after arriving we went to the Sports Bar. A man upfront and the hostess apologized for a 30 minute wait, but offered to call Hemingway's (another restaurant on site) so that we could be seated immediately. We took them up on the offer, walked to Hemingway's and were greeted and seated immediately. The grounds are amazing, and reminded us a lot of a past trip to a Playa del Carmen resort. Technically the Hyatt has two pools, but it looks like one. The smaller one was 82 degrees, on the warm side for our taste. The other pool which is enormous, was 71 degrees, a bit on the cold side, but still doable on a 80+ degree day. There is a long cave like area over part of the pool that is beautiful, shaded, and fun to explore. At the lake, we used the walking trails, Hydro bikes, Aqua bikes, and paddle boats at no additional cost. We were in Orlando to perform at a relative's wedding, and had hoped to have some fun, but also be able to relax. As busy as this hotel is, we really did feel like we could relax. It didn't seem to keep the same hectic pace that much of Orlando has. The included hotel shuttle we took was a very comfortable coach bus. The shuttles ran exactly on time and was so much easier than driving and parking at theme parks, as we have done in Orlando in the past. We had a lakeview room with two double beds that were very comfortable. The rooms are decorated in a Florida style and were immaculately kept. Before you go, look for a picture of the bathroom wallpaper, so you aren't surprised when you get there. The bathrooms are good size and clean, but not as nice as the rest of the room. One downside for us was the price of food. We expect to pay more for food on vacation, but it seemed to me the price exceeded the value? The food we paid more for was delicious, but I'm not convinced it was worth the price tag. All of the kid's menu selections at the hotel that our kids chose were reasonable and nicely done. The only major glitch we encountered was that we put our Room Service breakfast card out the last night, so that we could have breakfast in our room before leaving for the airport. When the food didn't come, we called and were told security had never picked up our card. They did apologize and provided our food in just over 30 minutes. Our driver had arrived a bit early. He waited outside the entrance for us while we quickly ate. Our stay wasn't perfect, but I would still consider it to have been Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LuckyDad
Reviews.Content: Visited the Hyatt with my family of 4 the last week of March. From the time we arrived, till we left, the service was outstanding!! On arrival asked for an upgrade and they took the time to show us the different rooms. When there was a housekeeping issue in one of the rooms, they responded by upgrading us to another room. We had to leave early and they couldnt have been nicer, we'll be back just because of how well they treated us! The hotel itself is a beautiful alternative to the Disney properties. The property is a little dated, but still kept in great condition. There are multiple pools and one was heated. Be careful of the large slide... it's made of concrete and if not completely wet will rake your back! Food was outstanding with breakfast buffet the kids loved! All in all an great place to stay! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand”
Reviews.Author: jrks
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the heated pool was nice and the staff were pleasant, and the grounds were beautiful. On the negative side, when we first checked in they put us in a room next to the ice machine. I went back to the check-in desk and complained. The girl at the desk said here is a different room two away from the ice machine on a different floor. We went to the new room, and, guess what, right next to the ice machine. Went down to the front desk again, they apologized, and "upgraded" us to a room that was far away from the ice machine! As far as I could tell, that was the only upgrade. After finally settling in, we realized the only thing you could do here cheaply was swim and breathe. For example, if you wanted to use the minibar to put in your personal items they wanted to charge you $45!!!! The Easter brunch was $55 per person!!! Upon checkout we were charged a $15 per night "Resort Fee". When I asked what this covered they said the outdoor features to be used by guests. Yes, but you have to pay for those anyway! Bottom line, find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Above average & great base for the parks”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay on Orlando and the Hyatt was a good base. The hotel had more than enough facilities to keep us busy for a few sunny days without the theme parks. We enjoyed the pools, hot tubs and gym. The landscaping is all very nice & well-maintained. The welcome was warm & efficient. The service we received from the front desk, concierge and lobby staff was great. The room was clean & spacious. The beds were very comfortable. The style isn't ours, but we had everything we needed & more. We only ate breakfast at the hotel. The buffet was good. The in-room option was average. As this was our first trip to Orlando we were very pleased with how easily accessible all the parks were - Disney & SeaWorld. We also had more day to day amenities close by. You need a car though as the times of the hotel transport didn't work with our schedule as it's limited.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort has everything!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiAloha80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 2007; I didn't know about Trip Advisor then that's why this post is being made in March of 2008. Everything about the resort was above average to excellent. The pools were inviting, spa and fitness center (although a little small) were good. Sometimes finding a chair by the pool was a challenge since we refused to get up at the crack of dawn and run down stairs to reserve one. But we were in the pool more than on the chair anyway. Stayed on the Club floor with a pool view. The club room was nice---gratis breakfast and then late afternoon snacks and drinks. Be warned though that the club does close early to mid afternoon. The view from our room was stunning. We could see fireworks from all the theme parks. The sunsets were wonderful. After being there a few days, we really didn't leave the resort much as it had everything. The only critique I would offer was that the tennis courts (which I used everyday) were quite a distance from the hotel---about a 15 minute walk or a five minute drive. Also used the equestrian facilities---a top notch place which was about a 15 minute drive. The resort is centrally located to all the parks and easy to get too and from; no hassles there at all. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to friends or family or visit again although the only reason we were there was to see the shuttle launch and not to see the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice- even though it rained”
Reviews.Author: swpalm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress with my fiance for just the weekend. I guess just to getaway for a few days. The check-in was quick and they offered me a complimentary glass of champagne upon arrival (nice!). The room was cozy- granted the interior decorating needs improvement, but I heard that will be happening sometime this year. We had dinner at the White Horse and let me tell you- that was DELICIOUS! The portions are huge and you are almost sure to take a doggy-bag up to your room. Afterwords, we just walked around the hotel enjoying the nice evening. On Saturday it was overcast/ raining. We played at their "Pitch & Putt" 9 hold course on property and had a blast. When the sun peaked out we made a run for it to the pool and enjoyed a relaxing few hours eating & drinking poolside. The only thing I would complain about is that there is no music. I like to listen to music while lounging- that was about it. They have several restaurants on property from elegant, to casual, to the pick-as-you-go type of cafeteria off the pool area. Room service took a little while in the evening, but that was to be expected on a rainy night like it was. If you are afraid of heights, ask for a room towards the bottom since all the elevators are glass. I love heights, so it was fun for me. The service was out-of-this-world- no joke, everyone went above and beyond to try to make our stay extra enjoyable since the weather was such a damper. I recommend this property to everyone. It was truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Crestfallen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for a work conference (which was also held in the Hyatts meeting room). Upon arrival, I was greeted with a friendly smile, and helpful staff. One can check in with a touch screen, which makes it so easy to get your room key and be done with the whole check-in process. I was offered champagne upon my check in, which was a very nice touch. The entry way is beautiful, allowing light to enter from above, and the 2 resident maccaws made for some interesting viewing. When I arrived to my room, I was very surprised. For once, a room looked like how it was pictured online. I am a huge germophobe, I must admit, and my room was spotless. I have NEVER said this about my stay anywhere. The bathroom had some of the nicest amenities I have encountered (there were wonderful eucalyptus scented soaps, shampoos, and lotions). The bathroom was also spotless. My meeting accomodations were also very nice. The lunch and dinner that the hotel provided for the meetings was very good, and the dining staff were EXTREMELY attentive, but by no means overbearing. Again, staff everywhere around the premises were friendly, helpful, and always had a smile. I have stayed all over the country in 5 star hotels, but this hotel definitely had the friendliest staff I have ever encountered. One minor suggestion: it is very hot and humid in Orlando, and it would have been nice if the hotel had complimentary water in the hotel room (1 bottle was $5). After a long day, one is parched in these temperatures, and easily available water would have been greatly appreciated. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, as I do not think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bik974
Reviews.Content: The service is great The decor is beautiful The view is exhilarating I recommend for anyone planing to stay in the area

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel, Conference Hall Deficiencies, Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: SunK
Reviews.Content: Stayed two (2) nights for a corporate event. This hotel was the first resort hotel to be built in Orlando (‘84); it is starting to show it’s age even though the rooms underwent renovation in ‘01. The smallish king bedroom needed updating. The Good: the staff was extremely accommodating, from the gate at the resorts front entrance to the front desk, the staff that was fast and efficient. We dined in two hotel restaurant facilities (La Coquina Chef's Table and Hemingway's) were both excellent and the dining service was well above par. The maid (Amy) on the floor (9th) was very helpful, accommodating and efficient. The hot water in the shower was plentiful, albeit the bath tile was showing its age with mildew stains throughout. Valet service was fast and efficient. The Bad: Attended several conference meetings over 2 days. Inside the meeting rooms including the Grand Cypress Ballroom and on the opposite side of the meeting hall area, AT&T’s cellular phone service received no signal in most areas of the conference center at best. Most of the time many of us had to go outside to make calls, retrieve messages, email or vmail. Other attendees with Verizon and Sprint’s service complained about the same issue although management seemed to be oblivious to the issue when asked. With the proliferation and availability of cellular repeaters that are mostly used by businesses that want to boost signal strength inside big office buildings, I find it obnoxious that management has not addressed this problem in the business wing of this ”resort” hotel. In my room, the noise from the hall traffic was noticeable due to the large gap under the door…rolling a towel and stuffing it under the door cured this issue for the second night’s stay. Noise from water running in pipes in adjacent and upstairs rooms was prevalent at all times of the day. A pet peeve of mine is the inability to run the in room A/C fan constantly to drown out these typical noises; this option was not available in my hotel room even though the hotel’s website advertises “Individual air conditioning control”, you can adjust temp only. Room lighting was dim at best, even with all lights on, and the Internet service was $9.99/day unless you are a T-mobile hotspot subscriber, noting the hotel website describing room amenities states” High-speed Internet access” but you must hunt for the Guest Services web page to find that in room internet access is an additional charge. Parking $18/day. As you might surmise, this traveler does not enjoy being nickeled and dimed when staying in a resort hotel, despite the fact that many resorts do levy these additional charges. I may return after the sorely needed updating is scheduled and completed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, would consider again”
Reviews.Author: KnutM
Reviews.Content: Two nights at this hotel was a pleasant experience. From first moment entering into the spacious reception/atrium it gave a good feeling. Great design/atmosphere. Champagne served on arrival after a long journey was a nice welcome. The staff was friendly, helpful, forthcoming and open which added well up to the general feeling of the hotel Room was pleasant, plenty of room for one, great bed have to say. But a bathroom touch-up would not have harmed anyone. One thing that suited me particularly well was a sushi bar down in the lobby/atrium were I enjoyed a couple of very good, real Japanese sushi meals. The restaurants I never got to sample as they were all booked for some private arrangements while there. Breakfast/buffet was very good, sortiment/selection more than adequate. Since staying so short had not time to use the outdoor facilities but on closer scrutiny looked well designed and seemed to offer all one could possibly want. 24/7 pool access, being a Scandinavian I have to say that is something other resorts in Europe absolutely should consider. A downer, well for me anyway, was a fairly expensive and far from adequate internet service. Surprisingly poor performance on the cable in the room and from what I could judge, the hot stops/WLAN service wasn't any better. Such a great hotel should have had free internet service in my opinion. Because of little (day) time no photos. Yes I would recommend this hotel and myself considering to stay here again when/if return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abc100
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. Very close to Disney World. Was able to golf, bike ride & boat on site at no additional fee. Rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: juliebug52
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here and I expected a little more from this place. Unfortunately our check in disappointed us and colored our whole stay. The rooms were ok. Not really that big. You could hear people in the ajoining rooms. Comfortable bed. I was surprised there were no robes in the rooms. We took advantage of the pitch and putt, the bicycles and the water sports, the health club, the pool and hot tubs. The grounds and artwork are gorgeous. You have 1,500 acres and you feel like you are in the country. The big water slide was closed down. We had breakfast one day and had the buffet and ordered off the menu the second day. The food and service was top notch. Bell service and valets were excellent. The hotel was not busy. Sometimes we had the lake to ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Delivers top notch stay once again!”
Reviews.Author: ScottyMac66
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property on a couple of occasions on business at the Orlando Convention Center. It's a little bit of a trip - 10 to 15 minutes to the convention center, but the experience makes it well worth while. Stays at other Orlando locations were well below business travel expectations, and this one delivers! The property is gorgeous with well manicured gardens, a pool with lava rocks and waterfalls, and a number of spots for food and drink. The main entrance area is complete with fuana, wild birds, and Asian art. I highly recommend this as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: Klug
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights (3 whole days) Christmas week 2007. Checkin was flawless and quick - by the time I got back from parking the car my mother, wife, and 3 kids were in the room with all of their luggage. We arrived at 9 AM and our rooms were ready (I think this may have been a benefit of the Amex Fine Hotels program we were booked with). Other posters had complained that parking was too far. It wasnt however - because it was Christmas week there were no conferences or meetings of any kind going on. Had 2 adjoining rooms (north east facing) and view of the lake. Nice rooms, comfy beds, bathrooms were OK. Pools were great. Cold pool was even great (~65 F), hot pool was better (~85F) and the hot tubs (there were several scattered around too) were fantastic. This place was great for kids. They can pretty much go anywhere and do anything on property. There is a beach with some sand toys that is fun for them and the boats around the lake was something different. They could have spent the entire time using the waterslides without ever going to Disney and would have been perfectly happy. The Cascades Dining room breakfast was very kid friendly and the staff were very gracious towards the kids - also very good but crowded. Palm Cafe lunch was not bad and did have a number of good kid choices but probably average considering the number of kids at this place. The fact that the pool and hot tubs are open 24 hours is a plus after a long day at the park (would be nice to have cocktail service out there) but the bartender in the lobby sushi bar was happy to pour us some beers in plastic cups to take outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: MossyFlossy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a very good location ideal for all that Disney has to offer. Stayed for 2 weeks in August 06. Pool view room (9th floor) offered nightly views of Epcot and MK fireworks. Pools and grounds are lovely. Best ever service from the maid, Amy, who made fabulous displays with the children's stuffed animals. Minor negatives are lack of car parking space if a convention is going on (which it nearly always was), quite a high daily resort fee and prices were expensive within the hotel. We only ate in the hotel once for breakfast and again it was good but expensive. Tips: 1) ask for a fridge for the room, to store drinks, snacks etc. 2) go to Millenia Mall for fab shopping and The Cheesecake Factory restaurant 3) If you go to the Disney parks at night to see fireworks, very often you could park for free 4) If buying the Seaworld ticket at the gate, take ID with, as guest services will extend the ticket for as many visits you like over about 5 days (well worth a 5 minute queue) We are coming back to another hotel this month in Lake Buena Vista, because the area is so convenient for all that Orlando has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (even for work)”
Reviews.Author: indianchic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HRGC for three days for a conference. Best service and Best Conference food I have ever had. The room was spacious and even with the garden view was very nice. Ask for a view facing epcot and you can see the fireworks. The bed was very comfortable. The only down side was that 3 of the 5 restaurants were closed and the two that were open were very expensive (but were good) only "casual" place closes at 5, so no dinner. Also, no free shuttles when I wanted to use them to any of the nearby attractions. However,the pools and grounds were lovely although I couldn't use any of the facilities as I was there for work. It was beautifully decorated for christmas and the staff were very helpful. I want to go back when its warmer and to relax (not work).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel; watch the transportation costs”
Reviews.Author: fraudsnoop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt recently and attended a conference at the Marriott World Center. I made 6 trips between the two facilities. Transporatation costs between the two hotels were all over the board. The hotels only have towncars at the entrances and I took them on two occasions. Trip prices were $15 & $17 respectively. I took a metered cab the other four trips and was charged the following: $8.50, $10, $10.75, & $11.75 (last trip via a slightly longer route). Unless you have a fetsih for the towncar, you might want to consider a metered taxi such as Yellow Cab to run short distances. I was told by the towncar drivers that they charge a flat rate, but that apparently varies.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: luxtrvl
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, the facilities were nice, the rooms comfortable though a little outdated. They do have the Hyatt grand beds which are extremely comfortable :) If you are going to Disney it's less than a mile to downtown disney. Ask for a room facing Epcot and you can see the fireworks. This was my second stay there and I can't say anything bad. It's a large hotel so if you want something small and intimate this is not it but it's a great place for people of all ages. They have transportation to the parks which is covered by the resort fee you pay. It's not as regular as I would have liked so I opted to pay for parking and drive to the parks but if you can work with their times it will make things easier on you.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Grand Cypress is Grand”
Reviews.Author: travelingwitha2z
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at the Hyatt Grand Cypress and could not have been happier. Complimentary champagne upon check in was a nice surprise as was the spacious room with an excellent resort view. We thought for sure our room would not be as desirable due to the AAA rate we paid, but we were wrong. The amenities were great. The pool area was beautiful and tranquil. We did manage to get in a round of pitch and putt between the rain drops and the course was kept up nicely. We strolled the grounds and admired the gardens and artwork. We did not take out a sailboat or paddleboat because the "beware of alligators" sign put a chill up my spine, although others did enjoy themselves none the less. There were many more activities included in the $15.00 resort fee but we were off to Disney for most of the trip and time did not permit. The staff was excellent and demonstrated top notch customer service. From front desk, conceirge, servers, housekeeping to the delightful gentleman from bell services/security, they were friendly and accommodating. One negative was parking. The self park was very far from the room and due to many events (convenions/weddings) parking spots were hard to find. The other was the price of food and drinks. Luckily, breakfast was included in our package because $19.95 pp was quite steep. Another shocker was $11.00 for a cup of coffee with Kahlua. I would highly recommend staying at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. and would stay here in the future. The location can't be beat if you want to be near Disney but not immersed in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, but slightly overrated”
Reviews.Author: isles_123
Reviews.Content: Booked a two-night, midweek stay via Priceline for $106 per night, pre-tax, plus the $15 per night Resort fee which includes: Shuttle transportation which makes scheduled daily stops at Walt Disney, Animal Kingdom, MGM Studio, Epcot, Magic Kingdom, Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure, Seaworld & Discovery Cove, bicycle rental, pitch 'n putt, court time at Tennis Club, golf driving range, watersports (canoes, sailboats, paddle boats, and hydro bikes), Health Club admission, Rock Climbing. Upon check-in, I requested a Regency Club level and/or pool view and was shot down...the hotel was, as far as I could tell, legitimately sold out per their website and the front desk clerk. I was given Room 1039 on the 10th floor, with a partial lake view. Overall, the room was merely average and appeared a bit dated, yet clean. My only complaint was the the doors to the small balcony had a terrible seal such that the wind howled through the crack at all hours. Not a 5* room by any means; rather, more like a standard 3* room. But the small balcony with sliding doors is a nice touch. I'd hope for more at the direct prices charged by Hyatt for a standard room such as ours. We took advantage of the paddle boats and bicycle rentals and were glad we did since we got to take in the great surroundings of the Hyatt. I also did a bit of jogging/walking on the trails that border the huge lake. The only reason we did not attempt to do more of the activities that were included in the Resort Fee is that it rained for the better part of our stay there. There are also two pools, side by side; one heated, one not, along with three, or perhaps four hot tubs, and two water slides for the kids. I'd imagine the pools are packed during the summer months as tehy are huge and very beautiful. The elevators on one side offer a great view of the Atrium-style lobby; the elevators on the other side offer a pretty nice view of part of the lake. I do not believe we ever waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator. As far as on-site, sit down dining, we only frequented the Palm Cafe at the pool level. Prices here are reasonable, approximately $7-9 for hot and cold sandwiches. The rest of the restaurants are standard hotel fare with jacked up prices. If you are into a night cap or pre-dinner drink, the lobby bar actually has very reasonable prices for drinks which are on par with a typical restaurant ($5-6 beers; $10-12 drinks). The bar was very busy at all evening hours due to the large convention crowd that this resort draws. In the morning, the lobby bar transforms into Starbucks offering sky high prices for coffee and pastries ($2.75 for a 12 oz coffee; $3 for a pastry). However, a nice touch is that you can get a free refill on your coffee with your receipt provided you return the same morning. If you have a car, I'd recommend the IHOP just around the corner on Vineland/535 for breakfast. If you have a car you may self-park in lot 4 at no charge. This requires a bit of a trek through the convention center, but might be worth it to save the $15 per night valet fee. Parking was plentiful and well-lit. Overall, I would not be disappointed if I won this hotel via Priceline for around $100 again, but I do not believe I would go out of my way to stay here in the future. I simply was not overwhelmed or impressed as I hope to be by its 5* rating. Personally, I'd recommend the Gaylord Palms at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “A weeks stay at the Hyatt with the kids”
Reviews.Author: Beergander
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to repeat the comments of others all I'll say is that we were extremly happy with our weeks stay at the Hyatt. All the areas were clean and luxurious, the staff pleasant and helpful, and the facilities up to standard. The lifts inside and out were a treat in themselves for their views! My only gripe was that the bathroom tiling was a little dated and one of the tiles was cracked. The in house restaurant prices were more than local eateries but still reasonable value, plus the surroundings and food were higher quality. We'd most certainly stay here again although I wouldn't pay the extra for a room view as we were out most of the day and you can always watch the fireworks from the 18th Floor general area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis from the Tourist Crowd”
Reviews.Author: ecarter015
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress ever since they built the property and finally had the chance to do so. First, locating the entrance posed a challenge as I thought it was adjacent to the Disney Village area. However, it has it's own entrance on a side street off of Vineland. After finding the entrance, I learned that the property has security at the entrance and one must be a guest in order to receive a pass. The security guard has a list of guests to check your name. The best thing of this hotel is its staff. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk, and housekeeping are very friendly, interested in you and seeing if you need assistance with anything. I had booked a $199 summer special rate and asked for a room upgrade. For $175 more I was upgraded to a corner suite that had a view overlooking the pool and Disney fireworks. The room itself was very clean. Granted, the decor is quite outdated, and I've never been a fan of flowers on the wall. But the bed was the extremely comfortable bed Hyatt has now with nice threadcount sheets, feather comforter and feather pillows. BEWARE those allergic to feathers - make sure you've made the appropriate arrangements prior to your arrival. The room was clean and saw no issues with housekeeping other than the fact that it is a huge property and it takes time for all of the rooms to be cleaned. Housekeeping was working when I checked in around 4:30pm on my floor. In regards to the Parrots in the lobby. I'm a serious animal lover, but didn't feel too sorry for these guys. They are in a beautiful atrium, well cared for and seem to have adjusted well to their environment. Granted, it would be better that they were free, but they are pretty to look at. I was traveling on the off season, so the property was quite empty with people. They closed La Coquina & The Chefs table for that evening and only Hemmingways was open for dinner. I decided to go to Disney Village for dinner. I was chauffered for $10 by a white town car, and made arrangements for a pick up for my return later in the evening. For those interested, I have been at the Equestrian Center in previous years for riding lessons and the center is beautiful and the instruction was good enough that I would return for another lesson if I lived in the area. One challenge I had was trying to find the business center so that I could check-in for my flight for the next day. After finding it ( I had passed it 3 times) I learned that there is a free computer & printer at the right of the check-in desk that you can use for checking in. I found it and the access to log on was very easy to use. I would recommend the Hyatt for several reasons: 1.) Staff is very customer service oriented 2.) Location away from the buzz of the tourists areas 3.) Great place to hideaway and never leave due to the amenities and 4.) High quality bed & bedding. Finally, this is a very family oriented property and saw many families with children. Not a place for singles hoping to find a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Attentive Staff... Altogether a Fabulous place to stay..!”
Reviews.Author: HazelRW
Reviews.Content: My disabled infant son & l have just spent 11 nights at this lovely hotel.. We were given the highest level of service at every turn & nothing was too much trouble for the welcoming staff.. I had only booked the lowest catagory of room, the "Garden View", but the room was lovely, decorated in cool greens & florals. My balcony looked out over the beautiful lake and grounds.. It was very restfiul to sit on in the mornings while i gave my son breakfast, or with a cool drink whilst he enjoyed a nap.. My kingsize bed was very comfortable & made up each day with lots of pillows & a comforter... There was an in room mini-bar, but I opted to rent a fridge for $25 & got my own drinks & snacks from the local store.. It was a very spacious room & I had a roll-in shower room due to my sons disability, which made life easier for us. Maid service was good, and you get to choose which time of the day you would like to get your room serviced... Extras were not a problem, if we needed anything, tea/coffee, towels etc I just left a note with the tip... I had picked this hotel based on the fact that it had more of a resort feel than most Orlando hotels. I intended to spend quite some time in and around the hotel & wanted somewhere relaxing & with plenty of facilities. We were not disappointed.. The hotel & grounds are very large, with many facilities including Bike/jogging trails; horse riding; canoes & peddle boats; tennis courts; a Spa;a fitness centre & Huge pool area, around which they organise activities.... They even do a "Smores" cookout, Thursday thru Sunday, in the firepit by the pool/lake area, between 7pm & 9 pm.. There is a world class golf course as well, with two 18 hole & one 9 hole courses to choose from...I didn't get to try this, but my husband has made me promise to take him back there soon, so he can go Play! The Pool area is just magnificent, if a little tricky to get around with a wheelchair... In fact that was the only problem that l encountered during my stay.. I mentioned my frustration to one of the staff, as we had been unable to find our way into the bar area to get a cool drink, after our swim... they were most appoligetic, & shortly after I arrived back at my room, a member of staff arrived with a cooler full of drinks, a fruit bowl & a written appoligy for our inconveinience .. We tried several of the restaurants during our stay & l had room service on two occasions.The food quality was very good & the price quite reasonable for a 4 star hotel. They include a $3.00 charge with all "in room" orders which covers your tip. Many services can be accessed through the TV in your room, including e-mails, computer Games & Movies.They charge a small additional fee for these services. If you do not feel like eating in the hotel, just 5 mins walk from the gate of the resort is "crossroads" shopping area, with many places to eat. You are also just a 5 mins drive from Downtown Disney & the many facilities available there. The location of this hotel is second to none.... If you manage to drag yourself away from the many activities available in resort, then you are just 15mins either direction to Walt Disney World, or Universal/ Seaworld... Plus there are many shopping locations close by, for all those bargains..! I have stayed many times in the Orlando area, but never in such a fantastic central location.. In fact I will never stay anywhere else again. You will find it hard to beleive the peace & tranquility of the hotel & its grounds, & yet you can watch the fireworks at WDW, from the large viewing windows, on every floor in the hotel, and be in the hub of activity that is Orlando within just a few minutes of the resort gates. Extra costs to be aware of : As mentioned before, the $3.00 charge for all room service orders & the cost of "in room" tv services.. There is also a $15 per day resort charge per room, to cover Resort facilities, local telephone calls, etc. You have the option when staying here to self park for free, or Valet park for a $20 charge per day including tax. In my opinion it is worth the extra cost to Valet Park if you can afford it, as the "self" car park is quite a walk from the hotel. When you come back tired from the parks & ladden down with bags its nice to just drive up & leave the parking to someone else! All in all.... If you only want a room to lay your head in each night & you are going to out all day in the theme parks, then this would be a waste of your hard earned money !..... But if like me, you want a more luxury holiday choice & will spend time relaxing & enjoying the hotel & its facilities, then I cannot think of a more suitable place to spend your next Orlando vacation than the Grand Cypress... !

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: DKK031
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at the Hyatt, 2 adults and 2 children under 12. We manged to book of under €150 per night. This is more than the average hotel, but this is not an average hotel. The room was very good. Good beds, well cleaned everyday and adequate in size for our party. Restaurants were also very good. We ate breakfast everyday at Cascades, we found the staff here to be extremely friendly and helpful and it helped that the food was excellent too-I would recommend the corned beef hash. We ate a couple of times at the White Horse Bar, which served very good food for both adults and children. We unfortunately ate only once at Hemmingways, but we had a very good dining experience here. We also had room service dinners a couple of times, perfect for a tired family and after being dragged around by the children all day at one of the parks. In all cases, I thought that the prices for meals were resonable. The hotel's amenities are again, excellent. Fantastic pool (open 24hrs). Well equipped small fitness center (again open 24hrs), well marked jogging routes, horse back riding and more. The staff are extremely helpful and service minded. The hotel is well located to the Disney parks, Seaworld & Universal as well as the shopping outlets and certain malls. All in all I would say that our stay was a excellent experience and worth the extra rates. if I return to Orlando I will most certainly stay at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunday Brunch”
Reviews.Author: gatesheadgirlie
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travellers and spend a lot of time searching for good places to eat. We were staying at a 5 bed villa in Emerald Island resort in Kissimmee 15th - 29th sept 07. We normally go to the Renaissance resort near sea world for sunday brunch but found that they no longer operate the brunch. By sheer chance we found the sunday brunch at the Hyatt and what a find it was. We booked the sunday brunch via phone from the UK and requested a round table for 9 as it was a ruby wedding we were celebrating (tables were square). Talk about service, hospitality and quality , this is the place to be. We thought that the Renaissance was good but this was sheer perfection. Our round table had been prepared with beautiful damask fabric on the chairs with green bows and looked spectacular. This is the only restaurant i have been to where you get black napkins if you are wearing dark clothing ( talk about attention to detail ). The smell of the chocolate desserts as you enter La Coquina is divine and they are a pleasure to behold. The food was fabulous with everything from caviar to buffalo to chocolate fountains. Your main course is prepared fresh and you can have as many as you like.Your glass is never empty of their most excellent sparkling wines (without having to ask for refills) and the staff are unobtrusive but there for your every need. The views from the light and airy room are specatcular and the pianist is a pleasure to listen to. All this for $59 dollars. After tax and gratuity with the exchange rate as good as it is we paid less than £40 per head. We were there for 3 hours from 11am and the whole party were just blown away by the experience. The "happy couple" were presented with a fabulous dessert plate with Happy Anniversary written in chocolate with the most fabulous Tiramasiu. Thankyou to our excellent waiting staff and well done the "Hyatt" for one of the most pleasurable experiences of our lives. Everyone in our party said it was the highlight of our holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: FSUalum
Reviews.Content: While at the hotel, it was like a vacation, while on a vacation. The pool/jacuzzi's were just shy of a water park. Even though we did not take advantage of everything the hotel had to offer (time constraints), this seemed like a place where a family could go just to stay at the hotel. It's convenience to attractions and restaurants, yet seclusion from the busy city is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotSP2003
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress is a wonderful hotel. I planned a family reunion there and everyone loved the hotel. The hotel has kayaking, water bikes and more. The pool is huge and nice. I could run on and tell you about how good the hotel is - but you will never understand until you stay there. THis is definately a good choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the daliy service charge !”
Reviews.Author: amandakamal
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hyatt hotel in July 2007 and it was really nice and relaxing. The staff are very nice and welcoming. We stayed on the 'regency club' floor, which is a dedicated floor with better amenties, it also has its own small restaurant only available for the guest on this floor which is free to eat (the breakfasts are really nice - its a fresh buffet, everything from chocolate cakes , toast to starbucks coffee !! - free!! all day long). This hotel is quite far away for Disney land it self, but there is a regular bus shuttle that runs from the hotel to the parks, but it is not a disney hotel. You will need to get a bus timetable from the reception desk each week and it will tell you the times the bus leaves. (Make note not the miss the buses, otherwise you will have to get a taxis back, which could cost quite a bit. Beware of the daily service charge at this hotel, it works out about $15 a day on top of what you have already paid for the room but over 14 days it can add up. One thing that I was concern about was the hotel has parrots on display in there reception, the birds sit on a metal ring for about 8 hours a day !!! just eatting seeds and you can clearly see that they have had there wings clipped so that they cannot fly away. I don't think that this is fair on the birds. The rooms are very clear but are slightly old fashioned, and the baloncy is very small, just enough room for you to stand on it, not for the sunbathers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NYCBushbaby
Reviews.Content: For about $225 a night, including the $15 resort fee, we stayed at one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in in the U.S. Decorated in Thai art, and designed with a zen-like feel, this is a beautiful hotel with 3 pools open 24 hours, 3 pool slides, small boat and bike rentals included, an equestrian center, at least 4 places to eat, a pitch and putt course, hammocks, padded pool chairs, a bar in the pool under a shaded grotto, I could go on and on. It felt like whoever designed it really thought out what would make guests comfortable. There are numerous outdoor places to sit, there is a well-stocked store, the food is very good, there are more pool chairs than anyone could need and many umbrellas. They have a shack next to the pool that rents floating lounges and other flotation devices and sells sunblock. There is sculpture and art work everywhere. I like nice hotels -- when I have a choice -- and I was just so pleased ... Great golf course. Of course, I had just come from Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort (see my review), so the Hyatt could do little wrong. But I can honestly say that the service was as close to a Four Seasons hotel experience as I have had (outside of a Four Seasons). Just stellar. I am an explorer, and rarely stay at the same place twice, but I left wondering why I would stay anywhere else in Orlando and with the desire to return. Cons? if I must. The room is not big. But our "garden view", lowest priced room had panoramic unobstructed views of Orlando. The hotel is showing some wear and tear, but it didn't bother me! This is more of a convention hotel, so you will not have the shear volume of kids and the family feel that other hotels in the area have. But mom and dad were in a much better mood at the Hyatt (than at the Disney hotel)! And at my kids' ages, they didn't notice. There were enough kids in the pool for them. HYATT, READ THIS: As an animal lover, and as a 3 parrot owner, I didn't appreciate the exotic birds on display for 8 hours a day in the lobby on perches eating seeds (should be on a pellet diet) with nothing to do but have kids try to touch them all day. Looked like parrot purgatory. Other than this, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fab the best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: michellejohnston07
Reviews.Content: the hotel was really amazing we were there on our 1st wedding anniversary and the hotel upgraded us for free to one of their luxury suites free of charge. the whole hotel was really fantastic and the food was great, staff were just outstanding and really helpful. Transport links to all parks are great with exception to downtown disney as their is no buses direct to downtown disney that was the only negative everything else was fab and we will definately be going back again soon. Hotel is exceptionally clean and service is great!! definately recommend it. Just to let you know you will have to pay a resort daily fee of $11 per day for use of amenities such as bike hire and pool, towels, water activities etc which must be paid whether you use them or not but its well worth it as a great choice of activities.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: imbusy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the years, always loved it. The hotel is older but so beautifully maintained. The staff is very professional and helpful. The hotel and rooms are very nicely decorated and very clean. My kids love the parrots in the lobby. The grounds are amazing. What we love most about the hotel is the pool. We happily spend days in the huge pool, love the rock formations and the "caverns" where you can shelter from the sun. The kids love the water slides and the waterfalls. We enjoy it just as much at night, especially the hot tubs in the grottos. There are plenty of lounge chairs and many umbrellas, and palm trees for shade. We also enjoy riding the bikes around the resort, the horse back trail rides (book these ahead-they fill up), the boating on the lake, the hammocks over looking the lake, and cooking smores at the camp fire on the weekend nights. There is also a small rock climbing wall now. It is possible to stay here on a budget. Some tips to keep prices down; check the Hyatt specials online, and eat at the pool side cafe called the Palms which is open from breakfast until 9pm. It is nice & air conditioned inside, and you can sit inside or at tables under umbrellas outside. At the Palms fresh fruit is $1 per piece, triple decker grilled cheese sandwiches w/ fries are ~ $5.00, and a large 16" pizza to go is only $13.50- the same pizza from room service cost me $30.00. We usually request a room from which we can see the fireworks at Disney, so that we can watch them from our balcony at 9pm. We really love this hotel, and it is our destination when we go to Orlando- while the theme parks are nearby & there is a shuttle to them, we just love to stay at the hotel and enjoy the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool!”
Reviews.Author: yukon98
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to the reviews I had read prior to our trip. The pool was beautiful and easily entertained our 6 year old and us! The restaurant choices onsite served good food, but were pricey. One dinner for us (2 adults & child) at Whitehorse was $130. So we dined at places within walking distance or a $10 towncar drop off.

Reviews.Title: “As beautiful as ever!”
Reviews.Author: sharinkd
Reviews.Content: I had visited Grand Cypress every year with my parents from the opening until 1993 and this was my first stay in 14 long years. nothing has changed. If anything, things are more beautiful and the staff more incredible. From the moment you pull up and walk in, a feeling of true relaxation and ellegance is present. I really enjoed sharing this experience with my husband and children, Very safe, clean, affordable (many activities included ie, golf, bikes, boats, fitness center, nature trail, tennis ect) excellent food, childcare center, spa.....the list goes on! Thanks Hyatt for another unforgettable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: snicklefrytz
Reviews.Content: We decided to do an impromptu trip down to Orlando and after slicing and dicing through a bunch of reviews on here we settled on the Hyatt Grand Cypress. It was very nice. A few very very minor shows of wear in the rooms, but hardly worth mentioning. I was there at the same time as the previous reviewer, during the Missy Miss Paegent, or whatever it was. As a result the hotel was really busy, so we encountered a few long waits at the elevator. Witnessed a great hissy fit in the lobby. We couldn't decide which was better entertainment, checking out the three live parrots that live there, or watching the beauty queen drama unfolding all around us. Customer Service was excellent. Extremely friendly, very accomodating. We had room service one night and the gentleman that brought up our food returned with complimentary ice cream for my kids, and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries for us to enjoy. It was a nice touch after a long day of hoofing around the Disney parks. Many other instances of over and beyond in this catagory. They treat their guests very nicely. Activities galore, huge pool with a great water slide. We ate in a few of the restaurants. The food was decent, nothing to rave about but it worked for us while we were there. (I will fully admit that I am a bit of a food snob so I set the bar fairly high when I am evaluating the dining experience.) Drinks at the pool were pricy but absolutely worth it when it is 97 degrees and humid and you are lounging under an umbrella with a good book. Shuttle service to the parks was great, and run very well in nice a/c buses. Great hotel, we would absoltuely return if we were looking to stay at a non-Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel - Good for Families too”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress several years ago for a conference I was attending. My preference when staying at WDW would almost always to be on property at WDW (preferably the Yacht Club Resort), however it wasn't really convenient for the conference and I had limited free time any way, certainly not enough to enjoy the Disney Parks. With that very long disclaimer, I can say I loved this hotel. Any place else in the country and this might be my first choice. It just doesn't have the theming and advantages of a Disney hotel. The rooms are bright and comfortable and very well appointed. The lobby is a spectacular atrium and the pool area is one of the nicest I have seen in a resort hotel. I also had a couple of great meals in their in-house restaurants. If you are coming to WDW for business, this is a great choice. It is also a great place for kids and family with all it has to do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sungoddess75
Reviews.Content: Everything about this Hotel was superb. With a fantastic location the Hyatt is the perfect base to visit Florida. The Hotel lobby is beatifull with a massive atrium and glass lift. The rooms are very spacious and clean and the mini bar was great. The pool is beatifull and fresh towels available throughout the day. There are serveral Restaurants to suit all tastes and budgets. The service was impeccable and we had a thouroughly enjoyable holiday. You really will not be dissapointed. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Hotel - Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is almost a cross between a business hotel for convention attendees and a resort for families in Orlando for the theme parks. The grounds are impeccable abd lanscaping is about perfect. The pool is a massive, rambling creation with slides and grottos featuring several seperate hot tubs. Food is fine in the hotel and there are options within a very short drive. The location is close to the parks but in a dangerous part of town. Orlando has had a rash of problems in recent years with violence and even kidnappings and murders that have targeted tourists. To handle these urban problems, the HGC requires your name be on a list to get anywhere near the property. I had the guard turn me away when I first arrived because my name was not on her list. I had to leave the property, call the hotel to get my name on the list just so I could register. For this reason alone, I would recommend visitors to the Convention Center stay closer to the facility and visitors to the parks shouls strongly consider staying on the Disney property. Other quirks are the 1970's wallpaper you will see in candid shots and the vinyl stuffed head boards. Kind of cheesy for a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth it - Better places in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DonFTL
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night in this hotel for business here are my impressions. PRO: - Full service hotel close to Disney with nice grounds and pool, etc. - Room service was very good - Excellent soaps and shampoos in the room. - Valet service was also excellent. (yet about 20 bucks a day to park in what is essentially the suburbs in my opinion) CON: - Poor Service. Front desk was very disappointing. When I arrived (very late on the night of 6/26) several of the gossiping front desk staff scattered when I approached. (Either I smelled bad or they were incredibly lazy or tired) . The one rep that reluctantly approached was "superficially friendly." And failed to help me - with a smile. The one gentleman actually refused a simple request to change the credit card I had used for a depost to my business card. I actually coudln't believe it but I was too tired to argue about it. Additionally, my package included wine and fruit upon arrival - I was asked my preference at check-in but nothing ever arrived. When I asked a question about the included breakfast in my package he rolled his eyes and had to ask someone else. I still am surprised by how bad the front desk experience is there. I saw them try to give free champange to anyone who had a problem (including myself). It was almost a reflex as he repeatedly grabbed the glass - It's as if the answer is always to give the guest a glass of champange - that'll shut them up. It really was unbelievable in what I thought would be a four star hotel. - Dated appearance. The hotel is very clean and very well maintained - there is none of the moldy smell you get in alot of older Orlando properties. Despite this, it has a very old Florida hotel appearance. There are 70's style flourescent lights above the doors to each room - same thing in the closet when you enter and in the dated bathroom. (It's all very clean - just dated). The room was very "Golden Girls" with green (think grass) carpet and floral bedspread. The room did have a beautiful view of the lake and well manicured grounds along with a TINY balcony (they are all tiny from what I can see). The bed was comfortable and had a feather top mattress with a nice selection of pillows. - Lots of hidden charges Parking ($20), Internet Access ($10), Resort Fee ($15 - really a way to hike the room rate before you get there) If you are looking to book here - with the extra charges plan on adding at least 30-40 dollars to whatever rate you are quoted. I personally would look for a room over at the Ritz Carlton or JW Marrott Grande Lakes for either the same price or maybe 20 bucks more - the service and modern facilities/rooms blow this place away. Further, I could have also gotten a room at Disney's Animal Kindom Lodge or the Wilderness Lodge for this price (or even less) and also had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos for the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: DameKane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for five nights which, for us, is long enough to get a good feel for a hotel. Our room on the 14th floor was clean, and spacious with a wonderful, comfortable king-size bed. The linens were spotless and soft, but the pillows were heavenly. The staff at this hotel is above average - everyone is polite, professional as well as friendly. There are a few resident parrots in the hotel lobby that keep the guests amused. I kept an eye on the check-in reception desk throughout my stay, and noticed that all guests were processed quickly, efficiently and courteously. The large pool area is landscaped with lush tropical greenery and bright flowers. Part of this pool complex has a heated pool (83 degrees) and an unheated section (77 degrees). The air temp on those days was about 85-90 degrees. The food prices at the Hyatt were high, but that was no surprise to us because all Hyatt properties have high-priced food ($12 for pancakes). We always plan ahead and eat off premises. There is no charge for self-parking at this property. The air conditioning system worked very well, and there was ample hot water, but it never got "too" hot. I would have preferred to have two sinks in the bathroom - one slows you down a bit. As far as what we experienced, I would certainly stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Michiganmomma
Reviews.Content: While it is true about the internet and no food other than room service after 10 pm, the positives were so much in favor of the hotel than that. Pools and hot tubs 24 hours a day and the food was fantastic. We used meeting rooms and ball rooms with our conference and they were well appointed as was our room. Loved the service of the staff too!! Great job, Hyatt. The golf course was great as well. Fun times at Hyatt. Did anyone say a Mouse was nearby. We didn't care. He hardly bothered us, in fact his fireworks show was viewed by any floor at the Hyatt. Thanks Mickey.

Reviews.Title: “Bad night at the Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: nightsurfer
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing. There is no food available except room service after 10:00 PM. I find that ridiculous. The cost of food and wine is beyond belief. The pool is nice, but don't try to do anything on the property after 10:00. Rooms are slightly above average but should be a palace for the price. No wireless internet, only daily plans, connected to a wire, priced at $10 per day. The only wireless availability is T-mobile with a cell phone WAN card. If you want to spend this much money, stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Hyatt Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: sunshinestateman
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Grand Cypress lived up to my expectations. Good service and great staff! Many activities for the kids (teen & under). Good pools with large water slides. Fabulous landscaping and very clean! Only negatives are food prices (eat out) in the resort and smaller than expected rooms - two double bed room was small - Other than that, I will be back at this Hyatt next year....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: Londonred
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a golf package. Was a great location and a very nice hotel with a great pool area for kids (although water was pretty cool), and well maintained property. The only downside was the cost - rum and coke $13! Dinner for 2 at the White Horse Tavern $250, with the cheapest bottle of wine they had! So we paid a $10 cab ride and ate and drank a couple of nights at the Hilton which was about 5 mins away. Overall it's a great hotel, just a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “not dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerab
Reviews.Content: After reading others reviews, I am surprised at the negative comments . Maybe some people go out of the way to find things wrong. My three daughters and I were treated so well, I would not drive in orlando so depended on shuttles and taxi's. The staff was so helpfull in always getting us the least expensive transportation. Our room was great. Maybe a little normal wear and tear, but to be expected from all the travellers and humidity.Yes one pool is not heated, but not freezing, unless Orlando is having a cool snap. During high season all hotels have minor problems. Also the food is on the high end, but a small fridge helps cut costs , a short trip to the market for snacks and drinks really help. We are going back on our next trip. After staying at the Hyatt for 5 days, we went to a very well know hotel in Nassua, the Hyatt put them to shame.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, refreshing, and planning my next stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: KRISTINEcolorist
Reviews.Content: i highly recommend this resort! my fiance and i enoyed our stay so much, that we're already planning the next one with the inlaws. service was great, hotel resturants were a bit steep, ($3.50 for A cup of coffee), but food and service was good. it is a theme area, what do u expect. it didnt matter cause right outside the resort, there are many resturants and ull save $$. shuttles to theme parks are convient and right on time also included in resort fee. pool is GORGEOUS and RELAXING many grottos to hide and have privacy in. Next time we go, we're not goin to the theme parks, we're going just to stay and relax and enjoy all that the HYATT offers! LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt lived up to the hype!”
Reviews.Author: FlrdaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I met at the Hyatt for a weekend together of rest and relaxation. The property was a perfect for our goals. As others have stated, the grounds were beautiful and the amenities were plentiful. Our fourth-floor room was of average size, and we had a beautiful view of the lake. While we were located near the elevator, hallway noise was minimal and outside noise was nonexistent. The pool area was fabulous and not nearly as crowded at one would expect. Plenty of chairs were available in both the sun and the shade. Saving chairs was not a problem, as the staff was alert to removing towels used for this purpose. Rafts and float toys were available for use with no additional fee. The $15 resort fee includes the workout room, pool, lake recreation (many styles of paddle boats, and sail boats), bikes, tennis and racquet ball courts. This fee was well worth it for the amenities we enjoyed. Due to the hotel restaurant reviews on this site, we tried to avoid eating at the hotel. However, on two occasions, a lunch and a breakfast, we ate at Cascades. We found both meals to be above average. For lunch, I enjoyed a salad topped with a nice piece of salmon. For breakfast, we both ordered off the menu (a breakfast buffet was available), and I had a breakfast burrito with sides of asparagus, potatoes, and tomato. We are already planning a return trip this summer with the kids in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe yes, maybe no...”
Reviews.Author: Jesuisunfamilyman
Reviews.Content: A real hit and miss hotel... 1. From the distance it looks quite run down....miss 2. Close up it has beautiful grounds and looks very smart...hit 3. If you want to save some cash then drive up to the hotel, take your bags out and then drive to the self parking lot rather than using valet parking 4. The check in was smooth and you receive a tour of the hotel and their parrots....hit 5. The room was clean, and about average size. There is not a balcony that you can sit on which was disappointing...miss 6. The staff were really friendly (I like the "I know your name thing")....hit 7. Great buffet breakfast, at a reasonable price....hit 8. Lots to do for the family during the day, including rock climbing, cycling, golf, tennis, horse riding etc....hit 9. Great pools but the large unheated one is freezing and impossible to swim in. Therefore you are left with a smallish heated pool which was still on the cold side....miss 10. Very close to parks, restaurants etc....hit This is not a 2 star as one reader commented, but does have the feel of a 5 star but misses some qualities needed to justify it. My top 10 tips for the family holiday to Orlando: 1. Get 6 25c pieces at the airport if you're hiring a car as you go through two unmanned toll booths between the airport and Orlando. I didn't know this and had to accelerate through the toll which freaked my kids out more than the Tower of Terror 2. It's easy to do the parks (even at the busiest time of year) without queuing for a ride for 2 hours, and that's by getting to the park 30 mins before opening. The parks are quietish until 10.30 3. Whatever you do go to Cirque...I thought that I would hate it but it made our holiday 4. Don't ever pay full price at any restaurant/shopping mall. Google discount vouchers before going. Start at [--] 5. Do your homework, and plan what rides you want to go on. A good start is [--] 6. A park a day is exhausting. Remember that when booking your holiday. If you want to have a quieter time then plan to go every other day 7. Discovery Cove is a haven away from the parks and you get to hug dolphins. Be warned it is pricey 8. Unlike my last trip there seems to be more sherrifs trying to catch you speeding inside WDW. 9. Don't get to the park with the kids at 8 in the morning and expect to still be there for the fireworks at 10. If you do you'll all be tired and grumpy and not appreciate the experience. 10. Book to go to Weight Watchers on your return. Surprisingly a week of burgers and hot dogs plays havoc on your waist!! I will get round to reviewing all the parks on the appropriate sites when I'm free Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: GinaL
Reviews.Content: My family spent Easter week here and we were a bit concerned about over-crowding. It was never a problem. The grounds are so massive with many, many different places to sit, so finding a peaceful place to relax was never an issue. The grounds were beautiful with sculptures, flowers, and fountains at every turn. As an added bonus, we happened upon the Audubon Center which has miles of trails to walk. We truly enjoyed the covered bridges, foliage, and birds. Great place to take pictures! Our room was pretty and the bathroom was very large. Our only complaint (like many of the other reviewers) was the food was very pricey. Instead, we ate at the many restaurants that are nearby. It would have been more pleasurable to be able to eat at the resort restaurants but, except for the Palm Cafe near the pool, it is very expensive. I have no doubt, we will return someday! The hotel is an adventure in itself and we were treated very well by all the staff. Be sure to stop in the lobby and 'talk' to Merlot the parrot. He was a riot!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: maddlibb
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Grand Cypress 4/5-4/8. The front staff and bellman were pleasant and professional. But, the hotel itself needs some sprucing up, it's showing wear and tear. Our room was clean, but 2 lamps did not work. The shower head was moldy and the faucet fixtures were old and difficult to turn on and off. Beware of the balcony...it's really only a strip of cement with a railing outside with a sliding glass door. It's not an area big enough for a chair to enjoy the weather or view. The pool area was over crowded with no available chairs. The restrooms at the pool area were not well kept. The water craft they had available was in disrepair and dirty. The life jackets you are required to wear were old and smelled of body odor. Only a small area of pool is heated (80 degrees), the larger section was not (69 degrees...according the signs at the pool). They also appeared to be under staffed. A can of Corona was $6....not including taxes and tip. I would not classify this property as a 4 or 5 star hotel. It's more of a 2-3. Maybe I went in with high expectations, but it's what the website seemed to indicate. Bottom line, I was disappointed because I thought I had chosen something special and it just turned out to be barely adequate and terribly disappointing for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJPCheers
Reviews.Content: I had reserved 4 rooms over 2 months in advance for my mother's 65th b-day. When we arrived at 4pm to check in they said only 1 of the 4 rooms were ready. When I asked when the rest would be ready they said they don't know. It was 5:30pm before the rooms were ready. Good thing our dinner reservations were not until 7:00pm so that we had time to get ready. The service at the Hemmingway's restaurant was excellent. They had 2 servers for our party of 12. The terrible service was at the pool. Both on Saterday and Sunday we waited over a half hour each time we ordered a drink. The drinks were so watered down you couldn't even taste the alcohal or one drink from another because they all tasted like watered down fruit juice. I don't mind paying $14 for a drink at a place like this, however I do excect it to be good and on time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service ”
Reviews.Author: KLEXXY1
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four. The kids are 4 & 8. We stayed there from 4/4-4/9/07 and the service was great. From the second we checked in the bellman Tim was very nice and gave us a tour. The hotel is beautiful. The pools and waterslides were a hit with the kids. They also liked the gameroom. Everything was very clean. The only thing we didn't like was the food so we didn't eat there again. The location is very close to everything. There is an Olive Garden, IHOP, Uno's, Waffle house,McDonalds right around the corner. The list goes on . There's also a 24 hr. Walgreens which was very helpful 2 blocks away. We'd get to Universal in 15 minutes. If you do the hotair ballon ride with Painted Horizon which we loved they meet at Perkins not even 5 minutes away. Overall we had a great experience with Hyatt and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not get connecting rooms”
Reviews.Author: hotels101
Reviews.Content: Did not enjoy overall stay because hotel could not accomodate request for connecting rooms (which had been made directly with the hotel at the time of the original booking - was told it "would not be a problem"). However, hotel was booked solid when we checked in and the best they could do was two rooms next to one another. We were two families together, planning to have the preteens and teens in one room, connecting to the room of two adults. Did not feel comfortable with kids in room alone so adults split up -- there was lots of going back-and-forth and doors opening and closing because the kids always wanted to be together. Could have been a much more relaxed stay ..... hotel attempted to make-up for problem by offering us coupons for continental breakfast for one day. However, only available breakfast in restaurant was the $18.95 per person buffet -- the coupons had a dollar value, per the waiter, of $11.00 so we ended-up paying for each person anyway. Money wasn't the issue but showed hotel's lack of concern. Based upon the overall inconvenience, would not stay there again; would rather support a hotel that tries harder to accomodate the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress!”
Reviews.Author: Hunter_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency from March 14-20 and loved the hotel. The pool was awesome (HUGE with hot tubs, water slides, and both heated and unheated sections) and the other amenities were great, too. We used the peddleboats and bicycles, and only wish we'd had more time for kayaking, horseback riding and other activities. Runners will appreciate the jogging trails, and the fitness room is very good, too. Our deal through AAA included breakfast, and that was a big treat: Cascades had a big buffet for the first five days of our stay (why they didn't on the sixth, I don't know), so we started our theme park days feeling very full and happy. The room was comfortable, though the housekeeping was only okay. Our balcony overlooked the lake, so we also enjoyed the view (and could keep an eye on the changing Orlando weather). Importantly, the location was perfect: very close to the Disney parks (and practically around the corner from Downtown Disney) as well as lots of restaurants and shopping, but we definitely felt removed from all the whole hectic environment of the parks, etc. when we were at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning facility, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: MIG6336
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to say that this is perhaps the most beautiful property I have stayed at and I have stayed at some beauties. The building and grounds were spotless. The landscaping was tropical, lush, immaculate and adorned with sculpture. The setting, alone on a private lake, was a perfect respite from the congestion of the Disney area. The staff was helpful and very polite. Our room was well decorated, and spotless. The pool area was expansive with a huge free-form pool that included several lounging areas that allowed you many options with respect to sun, action and noise. There were always chaises available and they were extremely comfortable with thick cushions. On the down side: 1)There is a $15 per day activity fee that, while allowing unlimited use of the many activities and "toys", turns out to be pretty steep over a week long stay especially when much time is spent away from the hotel enjoying the many activities of the Orlando area. Also, my teenagers were not allowed to sail because they were under 18 even though they are experienced sailors. That was one activity we were looking forward to. 2) The food and drink prices are WAY too high. For example, $17 for a pina colada and non-alcoholic daiquiri, $5 for a liter of water in the store, $10 for a hot dog by the pool. 3) The restaurants were also quite expensive with the only casual one (not counting the deli) not open for dinner. 4) Last, but certainly not least, the pools were COLD. The hotel boasts about its huge pool, but doesn't tell you it is not heated. The water temp in the big pool was 64 degrees, about 15 degrees colder than comfortable swimming temperature. Needless to say, everyone complained about the water temp. It was odd to be around a resort pool that is full of people sunning (it was 84 and sunny) yet nobody was in the pool. There is a small heated pool, but it too was on the cool side at 76 degrees. Ultimately, what you have here is a gorgeous facility that caters to high-end conference business and offsets it's reasonable room rates with high-margin food, beverage and extras. If you eat off property, self park and take advantage of the activities, like we did, you can have a great trip at a truly world-class facility for a reasonable price. However, it helps if you are a member of the Polar Bear Club ;)

Reviews.Title: “Best waterfall pool in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: deacane
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here multiple times, including one night of our honeymoon. It is just an excellent, excellent resort hotel. I don't understand all of the negativity. We now have a young daughter and she loves the horseback riding at a facility owned by this resort. The waterfall pools are outstanding. There are multiple hottubs if you get cold. The rooms are great. The staff is great. The food is not so great, but I really can't think of a single hotel that I have ever stayed at that had excellent food unless it housed a off-site restaurant (like Benihana's in the Lake Buena Vista Hilton).
