There are so many great restaurants in Orlando, why would you ever eat at your hotel?!? You stay at a resort for the resort and location. This resort is perfect. I'd give it a 6 out of 5 if they'd let me.

Reviews.Title: “FUN hotel”
Reviews.Author: cem430
Reviews.Content: This hotel might of been VERY expensive but it was totally worth it!! you realize this right when you step into the lobby! the gorgeous ponds and waterfalls were lovely! I really enjoyed the 4 parrots there too!! the rooms were very pretty except for the very tacky, busy wallpaper in the bathroom. the balconies were too small to sit out there but it is very nice to stand and look out! the pools were INCREDIBLE!! the waterfalls were really pretty and the slides were FUN!! the big pool was pretty cold but the heated pool was just right! and the 3 hot tubs were so nice after a long day at the parks! my favorite part had to be the lake though!! you can’t swim in it but they offer paddle boats, canoes, kayaks and sailboats! really fun and very relaxing! there is a long, but gorgeous, walking trail around the lake and golf coarse. its really nice and you can even see the horses in their stables! the restaurants were expensive of coarse but the palms café was kind of cheap and had great food plus its very close to the pool so you can eat out there!! Some complaints: I thought it was very strange that you had to walk through a lovely restaurant to get to the pool and I felt that it took forever to get to the parking lot from the room! also the restaurants closed early, around 9. it sounds ok until you get back from the parks and you are starving but everything is closed! I guess that’s how they get you to order room service! Besides those small things this hotel was SO nice and I definitely want to stay there again! *hint* ask for a pool/lake view if you can! you can see the Epcot fireworks from some rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Uduthat
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice but expensive, $350, for a normal average room. The pool was COLD, the pool bar closed at 5:00, which many people out by the pool were complaining. We moved after the first night. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Business Meeting”
Reviews.Author: willimite
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Grand Cypress for a business meeting. Rooms were well laid out and clean. Internet access was fast. Breakfasts, Lunches and Dinners were great and staff paid attention to any requests. Plenty of things to do when business events not in session. Pool was huge, actually more like many pools interconnected together in a way that allowed you to have your own personal space, including hot tubs dispersed at various locations. Pitch and putt for the kids along with a lake for non-motorized boating. Did not play but they had a huge golf course as well.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding as always”
Reviews.Author: jfelizondo
Reviews.Content: The Grand Cypress doe not disappoint; this was our 5th visit in the last four years and the level of quality is always tops. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon still in time to partake in the famous Sunday Brunch which was outstanding. The selection of food was 5-Star and the service outstanding. Our stay was 4 days long and each one of them was enjoyed to the max. Room service was quick; the house cleaning staff was polite and efficient. If this place ever became a time-share, I would by in a heart beat. Can’t wait for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A truely wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Clubworldfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family, 2 adults and 2 children (6 and 7yrs). This was our first time in a hotel near Disney as we usually rent villa accommodation. We were greated warmly by the front desk with a glass of sparkling wine (for the adults!) while the children tried to encourage the macaws to talk back to them. We had booked a Regency Club room which included buffet breakfast and evening snacks and beverages. The room was comfortable and overlooked the pool and further overlooked Disney so we got to see the fireworks every night we were in. The pool is fantastic, the kids loved the slide. There is a small slide which is not manned by hotel staff, or a larger slide in the bigger pool which is carefully manned whilst open. The self parking was free, which was a surprise to us, and the walk through the conference lobby, up the escalator to the main lobby was no bother at all. The elevators were busy and we did have to wait. Its a shame some other nationality guests didnt understand the idea that other people were also waiting and decided to barge in the first elevator regardless of the line formed, but nothing that I could complain about. We were on vacation so no point getting stressed over little matters! There is a "general store" on the lower level near the door to the pool area, it has limited hours so if you want some drinks, buy them during the day and keep them in your room or ice bucket. We didnt need to do this very often as the Regency Club lounge had drinks available all day, so were were well stocked up! The bus transport to the theme parks was good, punctual and comfortable. Nice coaches with the hotel name painted in big letters all over them. The bus driver told people at each park there he would be picking up, some didnt bother to listen and no doubt missed the return but the driver was polite about it all. Our kids took a trial pony riding lesson on the hotel grounds, a short minibus ride around the roadway and we were at the centre, $20 for once around the paddock may seem expensive but the kids have never been on anything other than a donkey at Blackpool which costs in the region of $5 (depends on exchange rate), and they were on holiday too. Our son was ill one night in the room, and we needed to change the bedding. At 2am we called down and within minutes housekeeping had come to the room with a barrow to take the dirty linen, and a whole set of new linen. They even offered to make the bed up for us, but we did it for speed. Could not fault the staff at all, the Regency Club hosts were brilliant, the front of house staff and even door men were all polite and friendly. Needless to say we have booked again for this summer, in the Regency Club for my wifes 40th. Really looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: mlm2126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress for a business meeting in February and had a splendid time. The weather was perfect and the hotel offered an array of things to do: lounge by the pool, go kayaking, jog on the running trails. Just a few negative comments: for such an impressive hotel, why such a small, poorly lit Health Center? Also, I would have appreciated a full-service spa rather than a few dingy treatment rooms in the locker room. As for food, the veggie burger I ordered at the Palm Cafe was as dry as cardboard--I could barely swallow it! Other than those comments, no complaints. Had a great dinner at La Coquina (I highly recommend the paella!), breakfast at Hemingways (nice fresh fruit), breakfast at Cascade (tip, order from the menu--it's tastier than the breakfast buffet). Also ordered a huge pizza, served piping hot from room service. A bit of a wait for my order, but it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, it was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 2LAZY
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is pricey but worth every penny. Luxury all the way. Plenty of pools and hot tubs so you dont feel crowded. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. Get the pool view room its worth the extra few dollars. Oh dont for get your free champagne at the check it desk. Sweet :) Hemmingways was so nice. The food was fantastic. Get something quick for the kids at the food court. Watch those chicken wigs they are HOT! So much to do for fun there. Waterslides, gameroom, gym and spa, boating and spa services. Only stayed one night and wished I coulkd stay all week

Reviews.Title: “Romance at the Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: cumberlandga
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the #1 hotel for romance in Tripadvisor's reviews. The resort is beautiful. We were greeted warmly when we pulled up(not the case at our next hotel.) I expected this from a 5 star hotel and I was not mistaken. The room was nice but the balcony is very small. We had a view of the lake and beach. We would have explored the grounds and recreation areas more but it was cold in Florida that weekend. I was disappointed that we did not get in the pool and hot tub but that has to do with mother nature and not the hotel. The resort was not that crowded so we had no problems with the elevators. We ate at Hemmingway's, delicious food and relaxed atmosphere, made for a very relaxing and romantic evening. The next morning we had breakfast in bed and room service was great. The server that delivered our meal was gracious and made sure we had everything we needed. Service at the resort was excellent, from when we first pulled up to the hotel, to when we left. The valet made sure we had bottles of water for our long journey to the next hotel(5 miles away)!LOL!

Reviews.Title: “I'd do that again!”
Reviews.Author: lunabug
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel at 1.00 am we were pleasantly greeted by the bell staff and security guys who went out of their way to get us oriented and set up with our rooms. That was an excellent first impression. The rooms were very nice - the balcony just enough room for a smoker in a no smoking room to light up - late night room service more than hit the spot. Downsides - The resort fee did not seem to be unreasonable but we did not use the services that are included. - The restaurants are overpriced: We ate at the sports bar and for four people the bill was $300.00. The next night we cancelled our 'Hemingways' reservation and walked across the street to the Orlando Ale House and were adequately nourished for far less money. The grounds are stunning and I wish we would have spent more time enjoying them. One of our party was in a wheelchair and the staff was terrific in going the extra mile to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Hemmingway's Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: WeTVL
Reviews.Content: Hemmingway's restaurant was a little pricey ($147 to be exact for 2) which included 2 glasses of wine. The food was excellent and was served appropriately hot! We had the red snapper which has forever set the standard for us. The key lime pie was a total waste of money as the key lime was basically missing. The service was a little slow as few waiters handle multiple tables which appears to be the norm in Orlando. Our waiter was very pleasant and made the whole experience a good one. We would definitely go again--just plan to enjoy the meal and your good company at a leisurely pace.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: mark133
Reviews.Content: hotel resort first class, rooms good, spacious and clean. staff polite and helpful, swimming pools and grounds fantastic, close to disney, thoroughly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and resort”
Reviews.Author: 68braveheart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business meeting in mid November 2006. Upon arriving staff was friendly and attentive to check in and questions etc. Stayed on the third floor facing the front, so the view was not the best, however the grounds,pools etc were beautiful and well maintained. This resort hotel seems to host many corporate meetings and functions and was large enough to handle them. The resort has multiple pools, a golf course, stables and more. The proximity to Disney,Universal and other attractions makes this a great location for families to stay at a resort hotel that has all you need on site,but is close to restaurants,amusements and more. Business or pleasure, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Resort”
Reviews.Author: agia
Reviews.Content: This resort has well appointed rooms that cater to your comfort. Each room even has a balcony with a full sliding glass door. I was here during a time of cool evenings and no bugs. This meant we could leave the door open for fresh air. While this resort has excellent entertainment and sports facilities, it likes the guests to use them unless they have a convention occuring at the time. This was the case when I was there and most of the venues, including the bar, were shut down or closed early. Probably a great resort if you are with a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: rockclimber3991
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disney World Stay here. Disney is fun and all, but everyone needs to get away from it for a couple of hours a day. It has a complementary shuttle to Disney and you can buy your tickets right at the hotel. It has an amazing atrium lobby with a tropical garden. The rooms are great, very spacious and comfortable. There are a ton of restaurants here, my favorate is Hemmingways, it makes we feel like I am on a tropical island getaway. The grounds are amazing. There is a huge swimming pool with two slides, a golf course, miles and miles of biking and jogging trails, horseback riding , and a lake. I really love renting a bike and riding through the woods, and I rented a really cool water bike. There is so much to do in the Disney area and at the hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “excels in every area, travel agent”
Reviews.Author: travelagent31
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent and just returned from the Hyatt Grand Cypress. I have to say that it excelled in all areas. When I travel, I pay close attention to details. The service was excellant. The rooms were beautiful! I look for stains, dirt, dust, broken things, etc. The beds had white covers and they were immaculate. Not 1 spot! The carpets were clean, the bathroom was clean. The restaurants were a bit pricy, we drove to other restaurants in the area. The resort fee is well worth it. There is alot to do on the property. They have different types of boats, bikes, and golf. Bring your own rafts and balls for the pool, they are very pricy to purchase at the hotel. You also have to rent the innertubes for $5. They have a game room. There is a Walmart and Walgreens down the street if you need to buy beer, treats or soda for the room. If you are a budget traveler, be careful, things cost good amounts here. If it is affordable for you, I highly suggest it. The grounds are beautiful. If your looking for good cheap deals, this may not be the place for you. remember- you get what you pay for. The shuttle to Sea World had only 2 departure times and 1 pick up time at the end of the day. I think they should modify this and have 2 pick up times, 4:30pm and 6:20pm. We were done early and were stuck at the park until 6:35pm. Use the self-parking at the hotel. It is worth it. The resort grounds are very expansive. Be prepared to do some walking. This is a wonderful hotel, they do everything they could to make sure your stay was pleasant. They do have conventions going on often. This is an upper class hotel, and it is beautiful. I hope this gave you a feel for the type of hotel we are talking about here. I can't comment on the Disney shuttle, we didn't use it this time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon in October 2006 and thought this hotel was fantastic. I had read some of the reviews and was a little concerned about staying at the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly from the minute we arrived. We had asked for a quiet room on a low floor and received a perfect room with views out over the pool area from where we could view the fireworks at Epcot every evening. Our room, though decorated very "floral" in decoration was spacious and spotlessly clean. The grounds and fantastic with great pools and activities. The concierge were extremely helpful with directions, restaurants recommendations etc. The hotel was very peaceful and calm, even when they were busy with conferences. The hotel is in a great quiet location in Lake Buena Vista, yet just a short distance from many restaurants at palm parkway. We really could not find fault with this hotel, from the staff, rooms, service, location, food - everything was perfect. We will definitely be returning to this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKHL
Reviews.Content: Well I'm not going to waffle on!! So I will keep it as short as possible. This hotel was fantastic, the facilities and staff are superb. If you don't plan on living & queueing in the parks for your entire holiday and want some hotel entertainment then this is for you. There is so many activities for both adults and kids, you won't be disappointed. Explore the acres of grounds on the bikes, it is well worth it. On the downside, avoid the very expensive, over rated Hemingways restaurant, not worth it, they charge ridiculous amounts for a mouthful of wine!!! Poor service also, nothing to write home about. Also beware of the cave pool bar, they automatically add gratuity to the tab when you order, cheeky!! Drinks are expensive. Would definately recommend this hotel, best we have stayed in so far, we have been to Orlando many times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: moglie33
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. I will have to say, I have stayed in many hotels, both higher end, and middle of the road, and have never experienced such a friendly staff. Everyone from the valet, to the bellhop, to the front desk, to the restaurant workers were so friendly, and welcoming, and it didn't seem forced. It was just a happy place to be. They had horse back riding (had to be 10 to do the trail rides, but younger for pony rides), bike riding, paddle boats, 2 pools, multiple hot tubs, a rickety bridge that crosses over one of the pools, and a large waterslide in one pool and a smaller slide in the other pool. They had really comfy lounge chairs, and great poolside service. They had a game room and great fitness center. they had a beach area and they had a fire pit that from 7 -9 pm they had a fire going and you can make smores. (you can purchase a kit that has 4 sticks, a large pack of marshmellows, choclate bars, and graham crackers for $11 from the main store in there - if they are closed when you are ready to buy, you can go to the front desk and they will have room service deliver it to you out at the fire pit). I had read on here how small the rooms were, but I didn't find them all that small. They were not oversized but a pretty average size. The Cascade restaurant is where we ate breakfast was okay, and reasonably priced for a resort. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend at the HGH”
Reviews.Author: JML345
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a recent weekend at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. The first impression was that the grounds are stunning, beautifully landscaped and, true to the property's name, shaded by large, moss-draped cypress trees. The spacious grounds give you the feeling of being far removed from the hustle and commercialism of the theme parks, a welcome feeling after a day of Universal/IOA. The enormous atrium lobby is filled with beautiful sculpture, tropical foliage, sparkling tile and glass. Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly and presented with complimentary champagne. Unfortunately, and this is my sole complaint about the property, the interior decor of the hotel room was not as impressive. With green and white flowered wallpaper, dark green drapes and carpet, and a generally dated appearance, the decor does not appear to have been updated since the mid-1980s. Oh well. The bathroom was sparkling and the spa-style toiletries were great, and the bed was inviting. Still, the property really shines when you consider its outdoor amenities, the lagoon pools with amazing natural-looking stone grottoes and waterfalls, and the lake with boats available for guests. We really enjoyed a few hours at the pool after a long day of theme parks. I was impressed with the staff, all very helpful and accomodating, especially our favorite bartender - Toue (sp?) , whose great attitude and bartending skills definitely made our Saturday afternoon/evening! Buffet breakfast was on the expensive side, as noted in previous reviews, but tasty (especially the made to order pancakes and waffles with fresh fruit), and the lovely setting is worth the price. In closing, I found the HGH to exceed expectations. This is absolutely one of the most fantastic properties I have visited. In a sea of otherwise mundane commercial hotels in Orlando, the HGH feels secluded and special.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, elegant, attentive - and no surprises”
Reviews.Author: redwolf87
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short since it's been three months and I'd hate to add any outdated detail. We stayed at the Grand Cypress for a night after returning from a Port Canaveral cruise. It is a wonderful facility with great staffing. The Par-3 course (included in the daily activity fee, which at $14 per room with 4 people is a bargain) was well-kept with friendly staff. The cycling was great, and the pool...wow. You really have to see it to do it justice. Grounds were meticulously landscaped and large enough to allow for exploring. Food was expensive, yes. But, it's not like they try to keep that a government secret before you arrive. All in all, the staff was terrific, we discovered nothing that was not as advertised, and found the stay to be luxurious and convenient. We may have been helped by the fact that there were no "major conventions" in the hotel during our stay, but, speaking from a first-person point of view, we are certainly looking to return here on our next trip to Central Florida.

Reviews.Title: “First-Class Resort!”
Reviews.Author: kkinne
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get much better than the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress in Orlando. Our family, including young children, stayed at the Grand Cypress for 5 nights in August. It was terrific!! The property is a true "resort" destination. Everything that you need for a wonderful vacation is right on the premises. Here are some of the highlights: Hotel - the hotel itself is spectacular. The lobby is filled with lush green plants, talking birds, marble floors and a glass ceiling looking up to the sky 18 floors above. Everything sparkled and it was clear that the staff really cared about how everything looked. They kept it perfectly neat and clean. Rooms - The rooms also were neat and clean, though a little small and very "green". Whoever decorated the rooms clearly overloaded on the color green. While the "double" beds were pretty small, they were comfortable. The room worked just fine. I highly recommend asking for a room with a view of the pool so that you have the best view and can see the fireworks at night (9 pm). Staff - Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Eager to please without being over-bearing. The front-desk clerk switched our room to a pool view as soon as I asked and also allowed us to check-in many hours before the normal check-in time. All of the people who worked at the pool were extremely nice and eager to help with towels (including the very welcome relief of the iced towels that they delivered to you as you sat in the sun). Food - We only ate at the Cafe near the pool, but the food was good there. The rest of the restaurants were a little pricey. Pool - By far, the best pool our family has ever seen. The pictures on the website don't truly do it justice. We had a blast swimming through the grottos and under the waterfalls (there are many). You can even swim up to the bar, but it wasn't necessary since the wait staff walked around the pool periodically to take drink orders. The pool was open 24 hours, was the perfect temperature and had a couple of fun water slides. Some people complained about the salty water, but it certainly didn't bother us and wasn't overly salty. Our kids slid on the waterslide for hours at a time and loved it. The whole pool area has the best landscaping and architecture that you could imagine at a hotel. It really is impressive, including a row of hammocks between the pool and the lake beach. Outdoor Activities - For a $13/night "resort" fee, we got unlimited free usage of the pool, health club, poolside towels, driving range at the resort's golf course and the pitch and putt golf course next to the pool. My 10 and 12 year old sons used the free golf clubs and free golf balls that they had in the poolside hut to play pitch and putt golf all day long by themselves (with their bathing suits on). Whenever they wanted to cool off they could walk about 20 steps back from the course to the pool and jump in to the water. No hole was longer than 60 yards and the greens were very slow, but they had a great time. The pool staff also frequently came around to ask the younger children to play games such as duck races, treasure hunts, etc. The winners got tokens for the game room at the pool. Perhaps the best of all was free use of the bicycles to ride around the paths at the resort. We took a ride in a 6 person covered surrey bike on which four people can peddle at the same time. It was great fun. Aside from the above, here are some tips that we learned while we were there and some that we learned on TripAdvisor. First, park in the self-park lot since it is very close to the pool area and saves a lot of money. When you come to the security gate as you first drive in, ask them to direct you to the self-park lot. Second, since the food is expensive in the hotel, explore the nearby area for lunch and dinner options. There are many national chain restaurants in the immediate area (e.g., Olive Garden, Macaroni Grill, Ponderosa, TGIFridays, Pizzeria Uno, Red Lobster, Golden Corral, Quiznos etc.) and best of all is the close proximity to Downtown Disney, where they are many great restaurants, including the Rainforest Cafe. Third, there is a Wal-Mart down the road, where we went to stock up on breakfast snacks, bottled water and other drinks that we kept in the room. We saved a ton of money that way. Hope this helps! Enjoy the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: buckeye45069
Reviews.Content: We spent an absolutely wonderful week at the Hyatt Grand Cypress, and couldn't have been more pleased with the accomodations, food, and level of service. Our 4 year old loved it so much he really didn't care if we went to the theme parks or not! There were so many things to do, the grounds were very clean, and it was just such a joy to sit back, relax, and not be annoyed by poor service! The food was awesome, the work out room top notch, and the pool was fantastic! We loved our visit, and can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “The HRGC is amazing...as usual!”
Reviews.Author: vacajunkie
Reviews.Content: We staryed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for 10 days and loved it with a capital "L". This property has everything so you can lounge around or be completly busy while staying on the property and never leaving..if you want to. The staff is friendly and courteous and the rooms are clean and fresh. The Hyatt has very high expectations for their guests and want to meet your every need...and do. I was very impressed with the amount of staff constantly greeting you and asking if there is anything they can do to make your stay better. I loved the pool area and really enjoyed the ice cold towels that were brought to each guest while sun bathing by the pool....That was great! my son loved the property and never was bored. On the weekends the pool staff lights a camp fire near the lake on the property and has s'mores. Yes, you must purchase a s'mores kit, which I agree is a bit disappointing howver, just go across the street to the local supermarket and buy your own supplies. The restuarants are amazing and yes, like almost everywhere else in Orlando, as far as a resort goes, a bit over priced, but worth it in quality. I did not eat at the breakfast buffet however, because I thought that was a bit extreme. The Regency Club level is awesome and I suggest staying on this level for the extra price. It is the best I have seen at any Hyatt and the staff, again, was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Serious problems”
Reviews.Author: 40fab
Reviews.Content: Every room in the Hyatt GC was filled to capacity with aspiring beauty queens during the Nat'l American Miss pageant the second week of July. Unfortunately (for us) the elevators were unable to sustain the volume. We had to add 20 minutes to already tight schedules to get into an elevator, pretty much every time we went downstairs. The hotel is huge. It takes about 10 minutes to walk from the elevators to the ballrooms for conference events. Hiking to a self-parked car takes, like, 15 minutes. To get to the pool, 10 minutes (not includng the time you wait for an elevator.) The lobby is freezing and you must schlep through the lobby to access the pool. Nothing like freezing in FL in July. The pool water was too cold for me to swim in. Don't even get me started on the food. We called (24 hour) room service to order a simple pizza at 11PM and we were told to expect delivery around 12:30 AM. Forget it !!! Food choices in the hotel are limited, overpriced -- $10.00 for a burger at a poolside walk-up (it's cold when you get to the table) over $20.00 for a simple breakfast buffet offering cold runny eggs and institutional quality (think school cafeteria) breakfast meats. $3.50 for poolside bottle of water. The worst was a fellow pageanteer who was forced to buy stockings in the hotel and paid over $ 20.00. What a nightmare gouging of a captive audience. I locked myself out of the room and asked a housekeeper for assistance. By the time security showed up 30 minutes later, my husband had already arrived and let me into the room. From Hyatt, and at these prices, I would expect much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!!! Extremely Expensive!!!”
Reviews.Author: tdosu
Reviews.Content: This may be lengthy, but here it goes. We stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress the last week of July, so this was our end of the summer trip. What an expensive disappointment!!! We paid $230 a night, plus $13 for activities fee and $25 extra for the refrigerator. We have learned a hard lesson as we usually stay on Disney property where you are treated first class; we will always stay on Disney in the future! You don't always get what you pay for!!! The positive is that the grounds are nicely kept and the inside is very pretty as well. Unfortunately, that is about the only thing that is included in the price and one of the only positives about the stay. The pool, while very large, is absolutely FREEZING and THEY ARE SALTWATER POOLS. It doesn't mention that at all. They posted a sign throughout our stay stating that one pool was 85 and one pool was 87, but I doubt that either pool reached a temperature above 80. The pools were dirty the 3 times that we went and although they said someone would come to clean them, they never did. The slides are very small as well. EVERYTHING IS EXPENSIVE!!! The prices of the food are absolutely ridiculous. The Palm Cafe which is pool side, casual counter service and the "cheaper prices" was extremely slow. It is still very pricy! While waiting in line on our second day, 3 people requested money back stating that they had waited 45 minutes for their lunches. We ended up getting out of line and going to the store to buy food. My husband returned before some of the people got their food. The breakfast buffet, which is very small, was $18.50 a person. They added 25% to my husband's drink order, so 2 dacquiris without alcohol cost $14.00. While there is a lot of restaurants to choose from, the prices are absolutely ridiculous, so we ate at Disney 3 of the 4 nights we stayed there. When we checked in they gave us a list of recreational activities, so my 11 year old was very excited. The first morning he ran down to the Pitch n Putt Hit the Pole. It took about 1 minute to complete the activity and he got a game token for participating. We thought we'd try another activity, so he went to the pool treasure hunt. The girl had the kids turn around, threw about 50 tokens in the pool and told them to dive in to get them. This took the kids about 25 seconds and it was over. We decided not to plan around the other activities listed. Golf was extremely expensive, so my husband and son choose to go to a Disney golf course saving about $100. While it states online that you can request several items ahead of time for your room and they will be waiting there when you arrive, that too is false. We requested extra towels, hangers, pillows and a refrigerator and we received them 1 1/2 hours after we arrived. It took 2 trips to get it right, but after 2 hours of sitting in the room they finally arrived. The final straw was on Friday when we went out to get in my car. Apparently they had put new mulch down during the day and proceeded to blow dirt, bugs and mulch all over my new convertibile. We took it up to show the manager and he did accomodate by saying they would part it free in valet ($18.00 a day) and clean it. When we went to check the car they had washed it, but mulch was still stuck all over the top. We told them it wasn't acceptable and one of the valet guys said, all you have to do is wash it. It appears that we are going to have to take the car into the dealer to get it detailed and send the bill to them. Save yourself money and aggravation and stay somewhere else. This was the biggest disappointment of a vacation that we have ever encountered!!1

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: tpapi
Reviews.Content: We just returned after 5 nights at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. Our overall impression was that this is a legitimate 4 star hotel with an abundance of services and amenities. The grounds our enormous (1,500 acres) with the property situated on Lake Windsong with a nice view of Epcot Center in the distance. The walking trails, bike paths, and tennis courts help create a nice atmosphere and set the stage for a relaxing, family-oriented vacation. The complex itself is so large that it offers a nice alternative for those travelers who don't want to be saturated in the Disney experience. That being said, the Hyatt is only about a 10-15 drive to Sea World and the Walt Disney World resort with easy access to Interstate 4. We found it worthwhile to purchase a two-day pass to each theme park which allowed us to come and go throughout the day. As such we were able to get plenty of rest by the pool. Which, by the way, is beautiful and well-maintained. It is probably one of the nicest we have found in all of our travels throughout North America and the Caribbean. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly throughout the entire tenure of our stay. Some of the previous reviews had mentioned that some are a little "over the top" in looking for a tip. Our thoughts on this subject is that this is how these folks make their living. My wife and I are always looking to receive great service regardless of where we stay. This is part of what you are paying them to do. Our room was clean and well decorated. If you fail call them to clean on a daily basis they will only do so once every three days. While we found this to be a little strange, we called and the room was cleaned regularly. It should also be noted that the HRGC is not an all-inclusive resort. As such, you are going to pay extra for all of their services and amenities such as Horse back riding, Camp Hyatt (for kids), as well as golf and other sports. While we did not sample any of the 4-5 on-site restaurants due to time constraints, we noticed that the prices were high. That being said, this is usually typical of hotel dining. There is an abundance of restaurants no more than five minutes outside the resort on Florida Coastal Route 535. During our stay we dined at TGI Friday's, Olive Garden, Chilis, Sizzler, and IHOP. While this is in no way five-star cuisine, you definitely have more than one option if you don't wish to pay inflated prices at the hotel. All in all, we were pleased with the overall quality of the Hyatt including its cleanliness, services, convenience, and professionalism of the staff. We would definitely consider staying there again on our next visit to Central Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Theft!!! Please Read Before You Go!!!”
Reviews.Author: NJbabe85
Reviews.Content: At first everything at the Hyatt went well. I was a tad put off by the pushy help infront who insisted on taking your bags and then eagerly waiting to be tipped. The rooms were tacky, but served their purpose. The bathroom had little extras, but you would expect them from a resort hotel (cotton swabs, private toilet area, makeup mirror, etc). The bed was similiar to sleeping on the floor. I might have been better off on the floor. Towards the end of my stay I noticed my watch had gone missing. Ironically my husband's watch remained, but mine was nowhere to be found. When I reported it they did a hotel key investigation and insisted I wait until laundry was processed to make sure it wasn't found. Needless to say I HAD TO CALL THEM to find out if anything had been recovered. After requesting to speak to the General Manager, I wasn't called back until the next day. I was told that the hotel wasn't liable and I should file it under my homeowner's insurance. THAT WAS IT! NO REMORSE, NO COMPENSATION, NO NOTHING. Stay away from this hotel if you don't want your trip ruined by their increadily heartless and scummy staff.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: rudimt
Reviews.Content: what a lovely hotel we stayed here for 5 nights in orlando as we were here in orland for our daughters wedding. we could not have chosen a nicer hotel. the grounds were massive you have to go through a security gate to get into the grounds and this is great you really feel that it is very private. the reception is lovely with birds in the area for you to talk to. on arrival we were given a glass of champagne as the bell boy showed us round the hotel on the way to our room . nice touch. room had lovely views over part of the lake and the extensive grounds swans ducks and horses within our sight plus miles into the distance. at night you could see the fireworks from some of the parks. they have bikes, boats, pitch and putt, golf tennis,horse riding, and lovely pools with slides and very comfy sun beds the staff at the pool hut were always very friendly whether it was for towels or bike helmets always smiling. loved the relaxed atmosphere of this place the open spaces the gardens the pools. the restaurants were lovely with snacks near the pool to special dining at night would highly recommend this hotel. is high on my list around the world of special hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Non-Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galileocan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in early July 2006. The hotel is a massive complex in a good location, minutes from the Disney theme parks and I-4. The Hyatt provides complimentary transportation to and from the Disney theme parks. You are first greeted by a security gate check point who directs you to valet parking. Be sure to ask where the self park lot is, should that be your choice. It's a good hike from the parking lot to the check in desk, so this is not a good option for the elderly. The hotel has a wonderful bright atrium lobby and is very inviting. The check in staff are excellent, polite and thorough. You are offered a refreshing glass of champagne at check in. The rooms are standard (perhaps slightly larger than average) and come with many amenities - safe, iron and ironing board, wireless internet (charge) and most have small balconies. Two pieces of advice. Ask for a room with a view of the pool - you will then be able to see the Disney Fireworks at night which is nice. Also, rather than pay the $9.95 daily charge for internet access, buy a T-Mobile Hot Spot Card which can be used at the hotel. This is good especially if you are staying more than a day or two. These prepaid cards can be purchased at T-Mobile or CompUSA. A buffet breakfast was included in my rate and was fine, however, I believe the charge was $18.95 otherwise, which I feel is quite excessive. Bar staff were excellent (as were all the staff). The hotel also offers an hourly shuttle service to and from the airport (charge) for those who have not rented a car and want to save money from using a taxi. I had forgotten my toothpaste and the housekeeping staff delivered a toothbrush and toothpaste within minutes. Service was top notch at this hotel. I never used the pool, but from what I can see it was excellent. Hotel is also on a little lake with paddleboats, however........I was a bit disturbed to hear that there are signs near the paddleboat lake that warns not swim in the lake because of alligators!!! I hope that is a joke. I do reccomend this hotel - it's a big property, but it doesn't lose the service aspect which is nice. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Overrated Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: bordercolliefan1019
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and the pool area lives up to expectations. I agree with another reviewer that you should rent a car so that you can make a more flexible schedule and not have to rely on the restaurants on site. I will say the shuttles are on time but the drivers can really get annoying when they are looking for a tip. The scheudles to and from parks are very limited probably because they use a 52 seat bus . I would suggest a smaller shuttle as a trial for in between times / maybe that would work? The bfast buffet is okay although the multitude of servers tended to stand around our last 2 days , so we waited an excessive period of time to get our juice and coffee. Also , the eggs were cold at times but in all fairness it is hard to regulate eggs / maybe they should be changed more often? The palms cafe is convenient but the food is not that great for the money. The ice cream freezer was not working so the frozen treats were melting all over when we were there. The cooler was empty the next day , so they did address it. Cocktails are very expensive and our first round of "Killer frozen Pina Colatas" by the pool were warm and way too strong and cost $19.00 . There was only 1 waitress on duty to cover the entire pool area and she did redo the drinks (they were not much better). They need more help and the poolside cafe / bar is not close enough to the pool area. All items on sale at the towel hut are way overpriced as are the items found in the hotel gift shops. We ran out of toothpaste and spent $4.50 on a small tube. Also , the American Miss Pageant came into the hotel and there was no attempt at crowd control whatsoever . They overran the place . Shuttle busses could not get in making existing guests wait longer and walk up the driveway in some cases.Although the problem was fixed by the next day. We waited 30 minutes for an elevator on Friday night because the kids were playing on the elevators and pushing all the buttons repeatedly. Just so you know , we did try the stairs but you are not allowed to use them as an exit to the lobby / They should change that. So beware and check for big events before you go. The Whitehorse food is wonderful and our waiter Luis was the nicest guy as are the managers who check on all customers throughout their meal. A+ to Hemingways you must eat there / it is soooo good and the service is fantastic . Concierge service is very good / very attentive. Do arrange a Kennedy Space Center tour through them / it beats Disney! The candy and occasional soda from the mini bar will cost up to $30.00 which is ridiculous. We were confortable but we would probably try another resort in future . This one is overrated in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: srfc6787
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 6/22 thru 6/26 with my wife and 9 year son and 4 year old daughter. Only the prices at the restaurants prevented me from giving a five star rating. Other then that, I could not find a flaw in this hotel. From the friendly staff to the great pool area along with the proximity to all the parks makes this a great place to stay. There is something for everyone at the Hyatt. There were activities for the kids at the pool along with paddelboats, canoes and other watercraft to use on the lake. Golf and pitch n' putt for the adults along with walking/jogging trials and bicycles. One suggestion I would make in visting Orlando is to rent a car. It cost us less to rent a car then it would have in paying for transportation to and from the airport. Plus you have more freedom in making your own schedule. For example, the Hyatt bus to Disney ran at 8 / 8:30AM and another did not leave until 10:30. Quite a gap if you miss the first one. Also, you are not stuck with just the hotel restaurants (and their prices) for you meals. It was the best decision we made. Lastly, it is small things that bring you back to a certain hotel and the Hyatt provides these things. I'm talking about cold towels to cool off with at the pool, a PC at the front desk for printing your return trip boarding pass, ceiling fans in the room, waitress service at the pool etc... All these add up to make your stay much more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Quick WDW weekend at the Hyatt GC”
Reviews.Author: SSE2007
Reviews.Content: My better half and I recently had a very nice stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress during a last-minute weekend getaway to Walt Disney World. Though I would gladly stay at this property again and would definitely rate it above average, just a couple of little details kept it from the 5-star range for us. Check-in was a breeze- self parking is readily available on the side entrance to the property, which allows you to avoid the valet/bellhop situation if you only have a few things or would just rather avoid all that. After strolling through many long hallways, up escalators, and through the lush atrium/lobby area, we were greeted by a very friendly front desk agent who checked us in and gave us each a glass of champagne. The lobby is wide open all the way to the top of the property, and full of foliage of all kinds, Asian-themed art, and colorful live birds. I found the lobby to be very airy, impressive, and atmospheric -- if similar to other Hyatts I have previously stayed at. The elevators are fast enough, but were often crowded. As massive as this sprawling resort is, you are never alone - even in the pool at 4am! Speaking of the pools, they are very impressive. Again, they are crowded, but are also large enough that you can usually avoid the crowds. The waterfalls and grottos are very unique, as is the pool bar, tucked beneath a stone formation/waterfall. They do lightly salt the water in the pools (we spoke to the staff member who performed this task on our late night in the pools), so be aware of that. The location is great, a stone's throw from WDW, essentially overlooking Downtown Disney. That being said, you could really spend a whole day or two just wandering around this property seeing all that the grounds have to offer. Even the bars/lounges scattered around the lobby area general seemed to be bustling. As for the room, it was... .fine. We were told we were given an "upgraded" room location with views of the lake/bridges on the back of the property. While this was fine, the OTHER side of the hotel, which overlooked the pools and WDW itself (providing a clear view of all the WDW fireworks shows), seemed to have the clearly better view -- we had the lake, bridges, and.... IHOP. (???). Ah well, it was still nice, and I enjoyed the very small but nice balcony from our 9-th floor spot. The room is very GREEN, and has some pretty bright floral patterns throughout. Though probably a bit 1980's and not something you'd ever do to your house, the decor is very airy and fun and does enhance your "I'm on vacation" mindset. The room is basic in size and features, and the bathroom is probably slightly larger than average. The toilet is tucked away in a semi-private enclave, which is nice. The rest of the bathroom is essentially basic but functional. The beds themselves are very standard - nothing to write home about, and frankly, smaller than actual kings, IMHO. They are on the firm side and are comfortable enough, but by no means do they stack up to the signature bedding most other major chains have introduced. The TV is small, but gives you a wide variety of choices. Drawer space is adequate. This being said, you don't stay at Grand Cypress for the room - the property itself is in a great location and is a sprawling mega-estate with endless entertainment options and an accomodating staff. Would gladly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “One could stay elsewhere...but why?”
Reviews.Author: MrStenoGuy
Reviews.Content: On the way back to the Orlando airport following our stay, my wife asked me as she does whenever we travel whether I'd stay at this Hyatt again -- reason being it was her turn to select the hotel for this vacation. My response: "In a heartbeat." This place isn't on the Trip Advisor list at #2 by accident. I'll start by noting that all comments and critiques that precede this posting are not puffery, and I'll also try not to sound redundant as we go along, but suffice it to say the Hyatt was all business. Pure and simple. No games, no slacking off, no shoddy treatment of guests. They delivered. From the lush atrium, forcing your eyes skyward to view the greenery, from the live birds greeting all who walk by, from the pools to the slides to the bikes to the golf to the hammocks to the bike and nature trails...there's something to do for everyone -- if you're not out and about taking in all the Orlando attractions, that is. For starters, the Hyatt is a chip shot to the Disney properties, i.e., Downtown Disney, Epcot, Magic Kingdom. One would have to be staying at the Contemporary or other hotels on site in order to be closer. The Hyatt shuttle was convenient to all the theme and water parks; however, we opted to rent a car to avoid having to be tied to a schedule. (This mid-40s couple was travelling with their three-year-old son.) Since it was a $50 cab ride one way from the airport to here, and also considering the taxi rides we'd be paying on our way out to dinner, we felt renting a car was a good bargain. With International Drive and other main thoroughfares nearby, finding a restaurant was effortless. Yes, we ate one night at a restaurant on premises, but $40 filets -- tasty, no doubt -- but more bargains were had off the property. Kept the food bill lower in any event. When making a reservation here, the conventional wisdom is asking for a room facing the pools. This way, at night the fireworks displays at Epcot and the Magic Kingdom will be in full view. One won't be confused in thinking it's the Fourth of July, but there is a decent amount of entertainment value in it. Plus it's free. At the pool, finding a lounge chair was easy. The pools (one heated and one not) were never crowded, clean, and there was bar service too. Afternoons seemed to be the time when the kids got back from the parks, changed into trunks, and jumped in to kill time before dinner. As frightening as that may sound, we never felt overrun. There were families grabbing bikes for a ride, or using a paddleboat on the lake, or taking a canoe ride. I suppose for $13 as a resort fee, it's best to take advantage. With regard to the room, it was comfortable, accommodated a daybed, was nicely appointed, and otherwise just as one would expect from a Hyatt property. The outside balcony, while not large by any stretch of the imagination, as others on this site have mentioned, was better than simply having a window. Anyway, it made for better viewing of the fireworks and helped get fresh air in. The deli/food/drink place on the lower level by the pool offered plenty of noshing choices. There was pizza, sandwiches, salads, soda, wine, bottled water, coffee/tea and other beverages. Surprisingly, the prices were not "stick-em-up" either. Kudos to Hyatt for that. All in all, we feel completely satisfied with this hotel. They offer full concierge service, including rental car arrangements; the shuttle; gated entry from the main road; four restaurants from which to choose; spa and fitness center; and competent, friendly service. If one is on a tight budget, we'd suggest the Motel 6 up near Orlando, but since most Orlando visitors are splurging anyway on Mickey and friends, it's worth the price to come and enjoy all this Hyatt has to offer. Maybe this time next year, they'll be #1.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: bworthjr
Reviews.Content: Take a look behind the curtains and you'll see what's really wrong with this place: service. Upon check-in they did not have the room I requested. The service in the so-called sports bar/restaurant was weak. The food is highly overpriced. The elevators are slow and inefficient for a hotel of this size. The add-on "resort fees" are a rip-off...no matter how they spin this nonsense. The downstairs restaurant has a terrible menu and the cafeteria style store closes hot food service soon after 12 Noon...heaven help you if you want hot food down there during the mid-afternoon (and yes the hotel was SOLD OUT...many people abound.) Oh - and be sure to put plenty of money in your pocket. This place is the KING of all hotels for the home of the extended palm. An army of bellhops mugs you in the lobby just waiting for a tip. If you've ever been sold to by agressive street vendors - you'll see what I mean when you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Virginislandchick23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a short weekend trip to Orlando staying at the Hyatt Grand Cypress Resort. The Resort is located just off of I-4 West, Exit 68 and is close to several restaurants, as well as Downtown Disney. The hotel also offers shuttle service to the various theme parks, in many instances two shuttles a day. The hotel is beautifully manicured and the staff at the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We were fortunate enough to score a 16th floor room and each evening we could watch the fireworks at the various Disney resorts from our floor. The rooms were plenty large enough for the two of us and the bathrooms were quite roomy as well. It was also nice to have a balcony; however, the balcony is probably only about two feet in width so chairs will not fit on it. It is standing room only. The main highlight for us was the resort's ginormous swimming pool! It had waterslides, grottos and spas, as well as a bar! The only complaint we had about the hotel was the quality of the bed. After spending our days running at the parks it would have been nice to come home to an incredibly comfortable bed; however, we just didn't find that here. We had stayed at the Swan on our last trip to Orlando and the bed there was absolutely wonderful. We found the bed at the Hyatt to be very uncomfortable and the pillows were incredibly flat. Overall the resort was wonderful and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply WOW!. Surrey, UK”
Reviews.Author: Ellie09_11
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations regarding our 8 night trip to this hotel and they were exceded in every respect. We'd spent a hectic week at Universal Studios and wanted somewhere to stay and relax that didn't involve a long drive or transfer to another resort ( we prefer not to drive in the USA). After a 15 minute taxi ride from Universal Studois we arrived at the Hyatt which is a secluded haven in beautiful grounds in the lake Buena Vista area. Unlike so many other nearby hotels you don't run the risk of looking out your window and seeing and hearing traffic run up and down the one of the many freeways that feed the area. The Hyatt is beautiful. The grounds are immaculate and pretty and there is so much space. We travelled over Easter and there was always somewhere uncrowded to find with sunbeds available galore (no towel territory marking required here!). The sunbeds were more like beds they were so comfortable. There is plenty to do with the option of bike riding, mini golf and any number of floating devices to use on the lake. The man made beach is gorgeous and you simply wouldn't know you were in the middle of bustling Orlando. The pool is a childs dream with waterfalls, caves, 2 slides and a great suspended bridge. Our inereconnecting rooms were large, fresh and always immaculate. We overlooked the pool and stayed in once to see the Epcot fireworks, i wouldn't however pay to upgrade simply to have the benefit of firework watching, it wasn't that impressive. The lobby is impressive with Charlie and the Choclate Factory glass elevators, the view from floor 18 is great and the ride nearly as good as some in Universal Studios!. We used the main golf resort and equetrian facilities whichl were top notch and total value for money. The hotel run a complimentary shuttle between all their facilties included in the resort fee. We eat mostly outside the hotel in the evening at the huge Crossroads complex 5 minutes walk away. Brakfast in the hotel was plentiful and good value for money by UK terms. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Our only negative is that the pools are cold but when it's 92 in the shade ?? We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. The grounds were simply elegant and well kept. We had a standard room with two double beds for four. The room was spacious and the view out the window was very nice. We were not facing Disney so we could not watch the fireworks from out of the room but we could see the lovely courtyard. Parking in self park is free but can be a hassle if there is a convention going on. Loved the lighted tennis courts. would not recommend going at night , the bugs were bad and the path is not well lighted for the walk back unless you have a flashlight. The food was great. We ordered from room service and my kids especially liked the milkshakes. The pool was nice and big. They also have a heated pool which was very enjoyable. The hot tubs were a nice way to wind down in the evening after a long day at the parks. The weather in Orlando was terrific. Warm 80's in the day and cool at night. Great trip and wonderful hotel. I would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: cw_123
Reviews.Content: I got married in Orlando in July 2003 and stayed in the Hyatt for the night after my wedding and returned for 10 days in August at the end of my honeymoon. The hotel made no attempt to acknowledge our newly wed status, and didn't provide any congratuations even at check in - which I would have expected from such a Top Class Hotel. During the whole month of our travels across the US, each new place made an extra effort to make everything perfect for us on our honeymoon. This is not to say that the hotel was poor - as it wasn't. The rooms and views are superb and the customer service is great, but they just didn't make it "magical". The food was ok but when we made a small complaint about one meal that was poor, the waitress just informed us that they had aquite a few complaints about the particular dish - and nothing else was done. The prices are high for the quality of food provided so we tended to eat elsewhere. Although the free bus service is great to the parks, we found the time structure a little limiting. Beware of the final leaving time from the Magic Kingdom as we were almost left stranded. If you are planning to watch the fireworks you will have a mad rush to get through the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: Richard1612
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress between 1st and 18th April 2006 on our 5th Orlando holiday, having stayed twice at a private house with pool and twice at the Wyndham Palace Resort and Spa (now re-named Buena Vista Palace). Our trip was very much a theme park / attraction based holiday but staying for 18 nights we wanted somewhere that was both close to the parks but also offered a pleasant retreat away from all the theme park mayhem to recover in between - the Hyatt certainly lived up to our expectations. The hotel is magnificent, and the breathtaking atrium an awesome sight with beautiful interior landscaping. We arrived at 3pm on a Saturday and the check-in process was swift, helpful and efficient. We did not have to wait in line for this, I think there were 3 or 4 people behind the front desk. All our requests of a non-smoking quiet room on a high level and away from the atrium and conference facilities were granted, we ended up with a pool view room on the 7th floor with an excellent view of the firework displays of Epcot, Downtown Disney and Magic Kingdom. We had read reports that the atrium can be noisy but this was ceretainly not the case, and had also read that the smartly dressed conference delegates can make casually dressed holiday folk feel uncomfortable, but again I would disagree with this. There were plenty of holiday guests walking around in all sorts of casual clothing from shorts and tee shirts to sarongs and bikini tops and flip-flops and no-one looked out of place. We also hired a fridge for the room and were pleased to receive a full-sized one which fit in the room fine without compromising space. The room decor was colourful and pleasant, and whilst the bathroom wallpaper is a little dated the rooms are kept impeccably clean by a very diligent and respectful housekeeping staff. The room size was adequate and the large marble topped table in the room good for room service meals. Our room had 2 double beds (for two adults and one 13 year old) which were on the firm side but comfortable none the less, with regularly changed linen. There were no technical problems in our room and the air conditioning was fairly quiet and made more effective by the seperately controlled ceiling fan. There are 5 lifts in total and use of these is mandatory as there are no stairs except for emergency evacuation. The lifts were our only frustration during the holiday as there were occasionally long waits for them, notably at certain times of day around 8-9:30 in the mornings, and mid-late afternoon. This was made worse for us as the lifts were undergoing some maintenance during our stay, which meant that sometimes there were one or two out of action. Conference delegates can also cause a bottleneck here at their start and finish times. The pool area is magnificent and although the larger one is not heated and therefore on the chilly side, it was not prohibitively cold and was regulalry used by both adults and children (The weather during our stay was good and daytime temperatures ranged from 80-90 degrees, with nightime lows in the low to mid 60's). The pools and decks were kept clean and there appeared to be staff regularly collecting debris left by guests coming and going. During the peak easter weeks there was a notable demand for well positioned sunbeds around the main pool areas, particulalry the heated pool, and the early morning towel brigade was often out by 8am or earlier reserving beds. However there are so many spread around the large grounds that there was never any danger of not finding ones suitable. The other on-site recreation facilities are very enjoyable and worth taking advantage of. A well maintained and nicely landsacped 9-hole pitch and putt golf course, cycle hire, boating on the lake and a well equipped gym are also included in the daily resort fee of $11 and were never overly busy, even over easter. The hotel restaurants are expensive but excellent and offer a range of dining styles. We enjoyed both Hemingways (for seafood) and the White Horse Bar and Grill (for steaks), and typically if you splashed out on a 3-course meal with drinks and coffe you can easily top $200 plus gratuities for a family of 3. The palm court deli is more cost effective and great for quick meals, a light breakfast, or even to take food back to your room. Service in all of them was impecable. We did not use La Coquina. Having been stung for valet parking charges at the Wyndham Palace in the past, we elected to use self parking and were pleased we did. The self parking lot is only a short walk from the main atrium, with a choice of either an indoor route through the conference level, or a pleasant outdoor route through the gardens, and I would not discourage people from using this. The resort is ideally positioned for Disneyworld, and by using Hotel Plaza boulevard and avoiding the I4 were were able to drive to all of the disney parks and park the car within 5-15 minutes. Even trips to Universal studios took less than 20 minutes. The checkout process was swift and efficient with no room charge errors. All in all we had a fantastic stay, and if you want an upmarket luxury hotel well-deserving of it's 5 stars and are prepared to pay for it, we would unreservedly recommend the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. The only time I could expect anyone to be disillusioned is if you expect all this but at the price of a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the whole Family”
Reviews.Author: sbaig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HYATT from 4/7/06 – 4/14/06. The place is truly outstanding. The grounds are impeccable, very clean and well maintained. The service is excellent, from the main reservation desk to the doorman, bellman, housekeeping and the restaurant staff, everyone is ready to please. After the mayhem at the Disney Parks coming back to this place is like coming home. We spent three full days at the resort itself, just hanging by the pool, going to the health club, taking paddle boats out on the lake and biking. All of this and more is included in the resort fee. The rooms are a bit small and the bathrooms look outdated but everything is kept very clean by housekeeping and this makes up for the shortcomings. The housekeeping is very vigilant, cleans the rooms at every opportunity. The only restaurant we ate was at Cascade for breakfast everyday. Nice buffet selection with lots of fresh fruit and hot items. Took a few quick bites at the Palms Café, this is at best average. Drinks at the pool are expensive; just bring them from your room. They have a complimentary shuttle service to the Disney Parks, this worked very well for us throughout the time. We rented car only for one day to go to the beach. On our way from the airport to the hotel we asked the cab driver to stop by a grocery store so we could pick water and other snacks, he very gladly obliged. Plenty of eating places outside the hotel within walking distance. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle service to drop guests at the main hotel gate since the grounds are massive and walking through them could take good 10-15 minutes. On your way back ask the person at the security checkpoint on main gate to call the shuttle; it came within 3-5 minutes for us. I highly recommend this hotel. My two daughters 14 and 8 could not get enough of the pool and the activities around. They were happier at the resort than at the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever ! !”
Reviews.Author: pbenny1
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from 3 nights and 4 days at the GHCR and is was perfect. We have been to Orlando several times and I have stayed at all the "usual" resorts,(Disenys Beach and Yacht Club,Animal Kingdom Lodge,Disneys All Sports (worse place in America)Marriott Resort Vacations,Hard Rock at Universal) and I will never stay anywhere other than the GHCR again. Even before our arrival, Megan from the 1-800 reservations service was SO helpful in getting us the right room.( young kids,etc. late arrival, etc.) From checkin ( champagne at the front desk to check out, this place is the best. If you are in Orlando, don't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, with some annoyances however”
Reviews.Author: V1a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Cypress in April while I attended a conference in Orlando. This is a great hotel, like other reviewers say, but not perfect. The elevator is often slow and crowded. Every time you want to drive somewhere you have to walk quite a distance to the self-parking area (unless you use valet parking). There is no onsite laundry - they only have valet laundry service. The restaurants are good but expensive and realistically you are going to want to try places offsite. The property is expansive with many trails, side-walks, and service roads to walk/jog on. The problem is that this property is an "oasis" in the middle of a densely developed and commercialized area. Walk/drive off the property and you'll think you're in a major city with loads of tense traffic. I was honked at twice because I didn't move fast enough apparently. That's the kind of area we're talking about here. There are many better, more relaxed places in Florida to spend time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Restaurants were okay”
Reviews.Author: Dalsemer
Reviews.Content: The hotel had excellent service. Bellmen, Doormen, and Housekeeping were all top notch. Always greeted politely and hotel is kept immaculate. Beautiful Lobby, Pool area, and Recreational areas. For $12 resort fee per night, use of bikes (Great Bikes), tennis courts, driving range, pitch and putt, paddle boats, kayaks, canoes, etc are all included. Oh yea, spa area too including steam room, sauna, weight room, etc. Heated pool with slide as well as an additional (unheated) pool with slide. ALL INCLUDED! This is where the hotel outshines others. This place was great. It was a shame when we actually left the hotel to go to the theme parks, that's how much fun the resort itself is. My disappointments were that there is a charge for internet service, even within the business center (most budget hotels provide this access for free. I was surprised that they charged for this even with resort fee. I guess most business travelers just pass the charge on to their company.) Also, the restaurants were very average. We at at the White Horse bar and grill and Hemmingways. Neither were memorable. The breakfast buffet at Cascade's was fair at best. Limited selection and rather pricey (which I expect, but the quality and selection should have been much better). I ordered the eggs benedict off the menu most mornings. The crab benedict was especially good. The Palm Court deli screwed up our order once, so I can't give them a good grade either. However, the Pina Coladas poolside were awesome. Complimentary Pineapple chunks at the pool were a nice touch as well. Overall, our family was glad we picked the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Everyone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am very selective when it comes to determining adequate hotel accommodations during my travels. With that said, the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress hotel in Orlando, FL comes highly recommended by me without any reservations whatsoever. It is an excellent hotel. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about the establishment. Everything was "picture perfect". The courteous, attentive staff; the beautiful landscaping of the property; the ambiance and decor; the fabulous pool and surrounding settings; the thick padded lounge chairs at the pool; the amenities (the bikes, etc. included as a part of the resort fee); the cleanliness of the hotel and room; the Eucalyptus spa toiletries...extremely relaxing (e.g.: body wash, body lotion, soap, etc.); the architecture of the hotel; restaurants; etc. I really enjoyed myself at this hotel and will definitely stay here again if I'm in Orlando. I can't say enough positive things to truly convey the experience we had during our stay there. It was splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Readaloud
Reviews.Content: Unless you are a big partier you will not want to stay here on New Year's Eve. We had a two night stay here before moving onto Disney property for two weeks. We were blessed with very little sleep during that time. Our neighbors across the hall let their children (and even an adult) run up and down the halls all hours of the night both nights slamming their door and yelling over and over again. They even did cartwheels down the hall and were kicking doors. Several neighbors tried yelling at them to no avail. We reported them to management and the best management could do was offer to move our two rooms of eight people. Why not move the offending party and inconvenience them? Beyond the rude people across the hall, every door that closed SLAMMED loudly into our room making us jump. Once we were on Disney property we noticed the doors made a more muffled shutting sound. We slept like rocks during our stay at the Wilderness Lodge. The pools were nice, but a little chilly, at the Hyatt. I could not brave it even though my kids did. (We are talking late December here) Once we switched onto Disney property I was able to step without flinching into the Wilderness Lodge pool. Too big for my tastes and much of a convention hotel, IMO.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property & Service Level”
Reviews.Author: Travleratheart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 8 year old daughter for two nights in March - booked a room at Regency Club level. Found the Check-in staff very efficient & polite. They were happy to locate a room for me at 11:00AM with a pool view. Housekeeping was prompt and kept the rooms very clean. There is a Hertz rental on-site for last minute car rental needs. Pools are well kept and plenty of chairs around. Only one pool with smaller slide is heated. Pitch and Putt is great and it is free to resort guests. They do not offer complimentary trasnportation to/from airport or to nearby restaurants and shops. Free scheduled time transportation is available to Disney, Universal and Sea World. Do note that service to Universal and Seaworld is limited - two drop-offs in the morning and one pick-up around 6:15PM. Plenty of choices on food for all age groups and plenty of bars in the property. Staying again here in mid April.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but didn't quite live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: ejrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in February. The hotel is very impressive and the facilities and grounds great. We were given champagne on arrival and the staff were curteous and gave a tour on the way to the room. The lobby was huge and had a pond, plants and parrots. Our room over looked the lake and this was definately the better view to have. It was large and as it was at the end had dual aspect. The decor was a little overpowering especially in the bathroom, but everything was well maintained and clean. If there is a conference in the hotel, as there was when we stayed, be prepared to wait upto ten minutes for a lift as it gets very busy and there are no stairs available (only in emergencies) which was very frustrating as we were only on the third floor! We ate at Hemminways (the hotels upscale restaurant) one night but were dissapointed with the service, though the food was great. Our meal on the terrace was accompanied by a very loud humming (which we were later told to be the jaccuzzi pumps). The pool area was lovely, though the main pool was not heated (absolutely freezing!!!) and rubbish accumulated around the pool area during the day which was not cleared away. The resort fee included the use of the facilities including bicycles, gym and boating on the lake.

Reviews.Title: “La Coquina even better”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again, (see our previous review June 3 2005) and La Coquina is even better with not only a fabulous, good value, Sunday Brunch but also a superb "Chefs Kitchen" dining experience in the evenings. This is a "do not miss" experience when you stay here. The only feature which in our view has worsened since earlier stays is the lack of "The Girlfriends" a fantastic singing group who used to appear nightly in the "Trellises" lounge in the Atrium which really brought the hotel to life in the evening. Everthing else including the staff and service remains as good as any hotel we stay at in anywhere in the World. As I personally have stayed in Hotels for up to three months a year since the mid-sixties this is a pretty good indication of very high standard this hotel has produced and continues to offer, since its opening.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: baxi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 10 nights in late June and early July 2005. There are far too many positives to say about the Hyatt, I can only summarise it as by far the best Hotel we have ever stayed at and well worth paying a little extra for. We were given free access to the Regency club as a Honeymoon couple, this meant we had access to free breakfast, hot and cold drinks all day, snack food plus beer, wine and spirits in the evening which really was "the icing on the cake" for our trip. The grounds are massive and I only wish we had more time to spend in them rather than visiting all the theme parks. The lake and associated activities are fantastic. The swimming pools and waterfalls amazing, and no the large pool does not need to be heated. Our room was very spacious, immaculate and had a huge bed, plus we had views over the pool out to Epcot and Walt Disney World so we could watch the fireworks each evening (what a sight that was on 4 July!) The public areas of the Hotel are vast and very impressive, we loved the parrots on display each day. Service throughout the Hotel is wonderful, as one fellow guest said to me "nothing is too much trouble for them" We dined at Hemmingways restaurant in the Hotel one night and wow, the service is great not to mention the food. I had heard in advance that it served the best Key Lime Pie in Florida and I would have to agree. We will definately stay at the Hyatt again, and will even pay for the Regency club upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 50th birthday visit!”
Reviews.Author: JackieBlue
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for 2 nights to celebrate his 50th birthday. We were not disappointed in anything. Everything from the common areas to the pool to the room was extremely well kept and beautiful. The service was so friendly - everyone greeted us, offered to help us, and provided the best service we have experienced anywhere - comparable to treatment at high end resorts like the Four Seasons! A fun little extra was the pitch and putt located right there. Even the buffet breakfast was excellent. We cannot say enough good things about this resort and have vowed to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Alex123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome. The service was also fantastic. We travel a lot for pleasure for weekends and longer also, are ~30 y.o. and loved this past weekend The pools were great, especially the heated one. The service by the pools was nice. I stay at nice hotels, ritz, intercontinental etc. and loved everything. You should definetly go.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nanouLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: This hotel really makes a difference. With its huge groungs you can take a 8km run without ever leaving the resort! On the other hand, restaurants and the theme parks are just a short ride away. The pool is lovely and all the staff is very helpful. The only downside is that we only stayed there for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: wtravweler
