Reviews.Content: Stayed the the Hyatt Grand Cypress for 3 night while attending a conference. I have been to many hotels and resorts around the world and this one has to be near the top of the list. The hotel sits on 1500 acres and the grounds are beautiful. The lobby is full of tropical foilage, fountains, and streams. A great place for kids as they have 2 pools, water slides, boat rentals on their lake, horseback riding. Just outside the hotel entrance are the 3 18 hole golf courses that make up the Grand Cypress Golf Club. I got a chance to play one round. Not cheap however, about $180 per round and that is if you are staying at the resort. Otherwise I think it is about $250. The only negative may be that the rooms are a little small, especially the bathrooms. Regardless, I highly recommend this resort. Don't expect budget rates. It is about $200-$300 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Weekend”
Reviews.Author: elondoc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Hyatt for a brief business meeting and would definitely stay again for personal travel. The front desk staff was friendly and greeted my registration with complimentary champagne, a nice touch. Everyone was friendly and took care of any requests within minutes and with a smile. The facility is obviously not brand new, but the cleanliness of the rooms and well-landscaped grounds more than compensate. The pool and fitness facility are superb. Upscale outlet shopping is a short cab ride away, and the concierge recommended the perfect low-key but ecclectic restaurant nearby for a relaxing dinner after a long day of meetings. Conference rooms were abundant and comfortable. Food provided with the meetings was excellent, and included Starbucks coffee. Overall, my only complaint was a charge for the business center's computer use. Overall a great stay, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: skirkpatrick
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four from the south of France. We have just returned from a week at the Grand Cypress which we thoroughly enjoyed. This is a great hotel for children. There is a snack bar where children (12 and 15) can get the kind of meals they like whilst the adults eat at the (wonderful) Hemmingways sea food restuarant. Our kids loved the two outdoor pools (one heated and one not) with slides. There are also bikes, boats and horses. There were plenty of bikes and boats to choose from without the need to book - just walk up and take one whenever you like. I was glad that I didn't book at the theme parks in advance as we ended up alternating between a day out and a day at the hotel - which made for an excellent holiday. The only thing to look out for was the hotel taxis which, although very comfortable, we found to be about twice the cost of a regular cab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic facility”
Reviews.Author: monaco7
Reviews.Content: Having read a lot of positive reports on Trip advisor, we booked to stay for 2 weeks at the Hyatt. This was our seventh 2-week vacation to Orlando and can say confidently this hotel was the best we have stayed in whilst at Disney. As everyone has indicated, the staff really are very helpful and friendly, a glass of champagne upon arrival is a nice touch. The reception staff were very helpful, the concierge likewise and the guided tour of the hotel and it’s facilities was very useful. We stayed at Regency Club level throughout and found this to be a wise decision. If you can, specify a pool view room - not only will you have a great view of the pool, but at 9:00pm every night you can watch the simultaneous fireworks from Universal and Disney from your own private balcony. The balcony is small, but large enough to get your party on for the view. We would finish in the parks; have dinner then a few cocktails in the Club lounge just before we left for the fireworks, this worked out really well. The breakfasts in the lounge are also very good, nice selection of pastries and fresh ham, cheese, eggs, tomatoes, lots of bread and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. My daughter (8) loved the pool, as did we. We ate at Hemmingway’s & the White Horse Sports Bar, Hemmingway’s was outstanding, somewhat expensive but the food was worth every penny. The White Horse was pretty good, but again expensive. Location is good if you don't mind driving. We used their cab service to go to Downtown Disney, at $10.00 we thought it pretty good value. The rest of the time we used our hire car, so cannot comment on their shuttle service. The rooms at the hotel really are nothing out of the ordinary, don't be expecting a large palatial room with every facility. High speed internet access is available (at a charge), plenty of TV channels, air-con, celing fan, a couple of beds and a work-table. Location is good if you like Lake Buena Vista, we prefer International Drive as there is a lot more to do, more choice for restaurants but that’s a personal choice. All of the parks are within a 10 - 15 minute drive from the hotel. Like at any nice hotel, be wary of their telephones (I was over $50.00 for a 10 minute call back to the UK) and their valet parking is somewhat expensive at $15.00 per night + the tip for the driver! The last paragraph is a little negative, but I would say overall we had a wonderful time at the Hyatt and will most likely stay again, we would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “WOW What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richnloz
Reviews.Content: WOW is the word I can use to describe this resort. We stayed here for 14 nights at the end of Sept, beginning of Oct 2005 and from arrival to departure nothing was too much trouble for any member of staff and everyone was really friendly. In the lobby were 4 birds and they were gorgeous. They are there everyday until approx 7.00pm. At check in we ordered a fridge and expected it to be a mini size one but no it was a full size fridge and you only pay $25 for the whole of your stay. If you have not stayed at this hotel before the bellboy shows you around and shows you the best place to see the Disney fireworks, although we had a room (no: 771) which had two balconies and we had a view of both Magic Kingdom and Epcot fireworks every night. We also had an exceptional view of the swimming pool and waterfalls. The rooms are of adequate size although I would say that the bathroom wallpaper does need up-dating as it is very 80's but the rooms and bathroom were exceptionally clean. There is a mini-bar in your room with beer, pepsi and snacks but they were quite expensive. The restaurants were quite pricey. There is an eatery that serves snacks, sandwiches, salads and pizza which is lovely and reasonably priced. The swimming pool was amazing it had waterfalls that were gorgeous. Although the pool was a little cold but in the weather we had it was nice to get into a cool pool. There is a heated pool as well. There is a lake where you can do various watersports (not motorised though)and a sandy beach beside the lake with hammocks to relax upon. The security on this hotel was exceptional, you could not enter this hotel without going past security each time. The location is excellent, you are around the corner from Downtown Disney and no more than 15 min drive from any Disney park, Seaworld, Universal or International Drive. Premium Outlets is just 5 min drive away. The only two downsides I would say is the roadworks that are at the entrance to the hotel but they do not interfere with your stay and also they have a lot of business meetings so the self parking car park can get very busy although if you cut through the side entrance it is really quick.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Time at the Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived last weekend at the hotel for a weekend business conference with little expectations. The Hotel looked tired on the outside and construction on the road leading to the Hotel appeared to be bad omens. We were wrong. Bell staff was very friendly. Hotel staff was great- front desk allowed us to check in early. Hotel artwork is first rate, lobby is bright and cheery, room was clean, and food at the conference was a cut above. We also ate at the Hotel's sports bar, Hemingway restaurant and Sunday brunch downstairs-service at all three outlets were very professional and the food was good (a little pricey-but what Hotel food isnt). We used the pitch and putt golf course one early morning before we headed off to Disney. This course was a real bonus-well groomed, quiet and next to a beautiful lake. We had fun for the hour it took to play the nine holes. Grounds and pool area were very nice-only regret is that we couldnt spend more time at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great facilities, ideal location for Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Great !”
Reviews.Author: jupiter3952
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about coming to the Hyatt in Orlando, I was looking for a non-Disney hotel for a change, and my family and I were very pleased. The pool is one of the best pools I have ever seen. Waterfalls and caves surround this water wonderland. However, the hot tubs were quite small. The staff was great, well trained and very kind. You even get champaigne when you check in. The hotel was built in the 80's so it is a bit dated, but they have made it truly beautiful with their own modern twists. The rooms could be decorated a bit better, and bathrooms do need updating, but really nothing to complain about. I would definatly return when I come to Orlando again. Hyatt lives up to its name here, truly a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing - The Only Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: LPass16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best hotel i've ever stayed at. We stayed at the Regency Level - worth every penny. We had a view over the pool and gorgeous grounds and the room itself was beautiful. Sliding doors to outside really top this hotel about everything else. If your room is on the correct side you can see the Epcot fireworks from your bed. Bed very comfortable and breakfast on the Regency Floor is stunning. The pastries are to die for. The regency club comes with perks such as free drinks (anything including champagne), water bottles, coffee, canopes and other delicious food. The regency club attendants are forever taking food back in and bringing out new food so it is always fresh. The staff are lovely. The staff are so friendly and caring throughout the hotel. The pool is great for adults and children. 2 water slides, descreet jacuzzis and waterfalls. Romantic and fun! The poolside bar serves a delicious melon cocktail - try it! The atrium is beautiful with a coffee bar (and parrotts during the day to keep you entertained). The resteraunts are stunning - Hemmingways and the Sports Bar. Sports Bar was our favourite. The steak is unbelievable. The hotel runs a shuttle service to the parks which is very reliable (not like the Hilton just down the road). It is ontime with a friendly driver. We really can't say enough about the hotel. Not sure if everything is covered - but everything was perfect. If you are considering staying in orlando, stay here. We will again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress- Truly Grand!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned 3 days ago from a 5-day trip to Orlando at this hotel. I will tell you that I have been to Orlando several times staying at the "Hard Rock Hotel", the "Grand Floridian", and the "Dolphin" to name a few, and this trip to the "Hyatt Grand Cypress" by far topped them all!!!!! Everytime we past an employee from bellhops to gardeners, maids or managers, we were greeted with a warm "hello" whether it be morning, noon or night. We arrived at 10am and to our surprise our room was ready and given it immediately! (low booking part of the week). Now it was off to the pool!!!!!! Fantastic!!!!!!!!! Huge and had everything one had to offer (except pool bar). That was no problem beacuse the waitress took our order standing right in the water! My 8 and 11 yr. olds found it quite inviting! They got their exercise climbing up the steps to the water slides for hours!!! Our room was tastefully decorated and was large enough for a "run of the house room". We requested extra towels which were received in less than a minute! Our water pressure was great with PLENTY of hot water! Each night we found a wash cloth folded in a decorative way on our vanity. The grounds looked like "the Botanical Gardens" in every nook and cranny!!! BEAUTIFUL!!! Statues, fountains, flowers and tropical foilage! It was hard to believe this was Orlando and not the Carribbean! All I needed to hear was steel band music which didn't happen. The music by the pool could have been better, but it was ok. The lake was beautiful, where we kayaked, used the paddle boats, a great family time there! My boys bicycled one morning with a fine selection of bikes to chose from (all included in the stay). The family used the "pitch and putt" 9-hole golf course which was beautiful! Overall...it was a WONDERFUL visit. There was construction going on in the lobby as well as poolside (putting new walkways in), but it was only to make it even better...and did not interfere with our visit. I would not hesitate to stay there again and highly recommend this property to my friends!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just finished a five night stay at the Grand Cypress and was very pleased with the hotel, they are obviously very concerned with their guests well being. Whenever we had a question, or were lost, there always seemed to be someone there willing to help us in a friendly manner. In my research of the hotel prior to the visit one post had made the comment that the rooms were outdated, this was not true based on my experience. I had one of the lower level "garden" views which would be considered budget for this hotel and found the room to be quite nicely decorated with new and clean furniture artwork, etc. The bath was pleasently large with a separated toilet enclosure and included a scale, which I almost never find in a hotel. The only complaint with the bath was that the drain was slow and tended to collect water, but I did not report this. The room included a work desk with two chairs, more than adequate for business. The TV had excellent sharpness and there was more than enough storage/closet space for two person's clothing for five days. I usually avoid hotels in favor of B&B's simply for the issues of privacy and solitude. We may have just been lucky, but this was the quietest room that I can remember being in. During six nights, I cannot remember being awaken once with the usual door slaming, loud plumbling, 3AM drunks, etc. I have the feeling that I may have been lucky that there were no major conventions during this time. I will affirm one concern that I had read about, namely food pricing, but with a caveat. Our first meal was a Sunday morning buffet that was $18.00, which is no doubt pricey for most of us. But, the meal included French-pressed coffee, a great smoothy and food that tasted and was prepared with high standards. It was not the same old high priced breakfast buffet, and the service was great. We spent two mornings walking to IHOP and Denny's but came to the conclusion that the Hyatt was a far better value than having to walk in the humidity. One last comment, I found the park tranportation shuttle to be more than adequate for our needs with two exceptions. If you plan to be a park hopper, you may need to reconsider either staying at a Disney resort, or accepting that you will need to take what could amount to an expensive ca b ride. You cannot go from park to park directly on Disney's system, you always need to go to a Disney resort first, and then catch another bus to the new park. If you plan to hop in order to catch a later Hyatt shuttle at a later pick up time, give yourself plently of time, and then some. You should also know the pick up location as the parking areas can be quite large. We went right out of the Tranportation Center (note: this center is NOT the Magic Kingdom as is noted on Hyatt's schedule, the center is a hub between Epcot and the Magic Kingdom) when we should have gone left and ended up five minuets late to pick up the shuttle, this cost us about $25 in cab fees. Also, try to leave the firework show early if you have to get back to a resort, what had been an empty Monorail station turned into a massive exodus of guests a short time after the conclusion of a show. This added an unanticipated 30 - 40 minute delay and another missed shuttle/cab penalty. You can get around this if you simply spend the whole day at one park. Remember that the shuttle's leave exactly on time, there is no grace here. If you think that you have an extra five minutes, be prepared to either accept the cab penalty, or have a fallback plan to catch the shuttle at a later time ...

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Experience at Hyatt Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: Angeltravel
Reviews.Content: My two kids (7) and (10) and I went to Grand Cypress the week of July 8 -July 16. We had a couple of negative experiences, but they were fixed fairly quickly and we ended up having a great time. When we arrived, a beauty pagaent was being held at the hotel and they had given our room away (high floor - swimming pool view) and put us in a room on a low floor with no view and they were out of rollaway beds. I was quite upset about this, but once I asked to speak to a manager - they responded well. They didn't charge us for that night and the next day they moved us to a better room. The next day I took my kids to Hyatt Kids Camp, which is wonderful - especially if you are travelling alone with kids. I went back to the room to sleep, but they were doing construction on the floor and the sound came through the air vents. I called to inquire when this would end and they said it would be done soon and were very apologetic. Later that night, when the kids and I returned from Disney World, there was a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberrys in the room with a note from the manager. The only other issue I had was on the first night when all the teenager beauty queens and their beau's were running around the grounds and jumping off the bridge over the pool - very dangerous. I brought this to the manager's attention and he sent someone out right away. Tips: Kid's room service menu is a great value, the Hyatt Kid's Camp is wonderful and the staff and counselor's are terrific. My kid's had such a good time they asked if they could go back the day we were suppose to go to Animal Kingdom. Please note, the daycare room is quite small - but good for infants and toddlers - however the counselor's take them swimming, bike riding, over to the equestrian center...Pool and slide are great. There is a smaller pool which is heated more for little kids with a smaller slide. Also, ask for a high floor room with a pool view in the left wing as you are facing the hotel. This has the best view of the fireworks at DisneyWorld and Epcot Center at night!!! Downside: Hotel's shuttle service to the Disney World parks don't run very frequently. You end up taking a cab between the hotel and parks a lot. It runs you about $15 - $20 bucks each way. I don't think you can avoid this, unless you stay at a Disney property or don't mind the limited schedule of the shuttles. Extra: We went to Epcot Center the last day and didn't have much time to spend there. I wish we had spent more time there. It was really interesting and the fireworks at night are spectacular. It was really magical with the kids. Also, one of our favorite experiences was at Gatorland. It is old and funky - but what fun for the kids. Alligators everywhere - my son said he like it best of all the places we went.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: phw0923
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress July 21st through the 24th. This was a last minute trip and they had no "regular" rooms available so we booked rooms on their Regency Club level. My husband and I took our daughter and a friend and we got the second adjoining room for half price with their "family plan". As with most hotels, on this level, you receive free continental breakfast and evening cocktails and hors deuvres. The service was unbelievable. Always at least four attendants ready to wait on you (with a smile no less!) and fix whatever you like to drink...from wine to martinis. The food was delicious. One night they had a crab and shrimp pasta salad. We didn't even end up going to dinner! Another night we enjoyed crab claws and spring rolls. Also, later each evening they serve dessert and after dinner drinks. The service from the rest of the staff is exceptional too. The day we checked in, we were without water for a few hours due to construction (which was no big deal since we were going down to the pool anyway). Later that afternoon they sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a note of apology for the inconvenience. Then, when our daugher and her friend (both 16) missed the bus from Disney (due to the fact that it left earlier than scheduled) the manager sent a towncar for them, and allowed us to ride along. The pool is gorgeous and there is alot to do. My husband and I even took a canoe out on their beautiful lake. All the activities are included in a $13 resort fee. Some of the things they offered that we did not have time to take advantage of were horseback riding, golfing, tennis, and paddle boats. The location is great...just around the corner from Downtown Disney. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough! If we find ourselves in Orlando again, we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: atstpier
Reviews.Content: We pricelined a resort in Orlando and landed the Hyatt. We loved it. Our kids had a great time at the pools and slides. We used the boats a bit. We did not eat there. Too pricey!!! ($8 hot dog) There are many restuarants located nearby and all of Disney is within a few miles. You can see the fireworks from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pipercapt
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best stays in orlando, the rooms were clean and the service was great. The pools and amenities were just as we expected. However the food was overpriced and was a disappointment, but there are great franchised resturants very close by. I would highly recommend the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a 2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Cmos
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel. The service is excellent as always. The grounds are awesome. This hotel is also extremely kid friendly. The only complaint I have that the rooms are a little dated, but I am being picky here. Will come again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Romantic choice for our second honeymoon ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just got back from a stay at the Hyatt and it was one of the best experiences we've ever had. The rooms were nice, clean and spacious and our view was great! The grounds are gorgeous. My husband played golf while I went kayaking. Then we both went water biking! It was soo relaxing. You could go to Orlando and spend the whole trip at the hotel and it would be worth it. They have a shuttle to the main attractions like Disney, Universal Studios and even though they weren't very frequent, the drivers were so nice and they were ALWAYS on time. So if you plan out your day you never have to pay for a cab or rent a car. All the staff were extremely friendly as well. The best part was the pool! The grottos and waterfalls were beautiful and the water was cool, but once you jump in it's heaven! Oh, and the private whirlpools are soo romantic, especially at night. We are definately going back there!

Reviews.Title: “Big problems with our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from July 4-11. Our week began great. The hotel has great swimming pool and recreation facilities. The kids really loved the riding stables. Our vacation went bad after three days. The pool area was plaqued with petty crime. six guest had personal items stolen from the pool (cameras, clothes, purse). We witnessed a man trying to do the same to us while we swam. The remainder of the week we had to keep someone at the umbrella to watch. We also returned to our room to find it open. (maybe the maid left it, but still open for anyone to get in). Nothing was taken. We had a horrible time getting an elevator. It sometimes took a 1/2 hour to get one to go down to the lobby. We had to take dark stairways that brought you to the back of the hotel and walk around to the front to get your car from valet. (why am i paying $15 for valet) The hotel blammed in on a local beauty contest that was being held in the ballroom. Many people staying in one room or using the hotel to change. This created a problem at the pool as well. We saw many swimmers leaving to go to their cars in bathing suits (apparently not guest of the hotel) Not what you expect from a 4 star hotel. Although the security gate at the hotel checks all cars as they go in, you can just say you want to go to the restaurant and they let you in. Not a good situation. The rooms were OK, not worth the $$$, but the facilites (golf, horse stables and tennis) were great. It is a shame, but I will never stay at this hotel again. Not worth the frustration and definitely a crime problem that they can't control.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jonref
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Unreal. Great Service, grounds, pool, This is the best hotel in Orlando. Stayed 5 days July 01-05. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent with many first class services. Found all staff and management are helpful and quick in solving any issue. The scenery is great and the atmosphere is pleasant. Also, some shopping stores are close by and a number of excellent restaurants are only walking distance. If any thing, The pools towels need to be changed (bad condition) and only 2 shops in the hotel. In short, I would recommend it to those who enjoy a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: frackit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in June 2005. Overall, this was a very nice hotel. The faciliities are amazing. The pool complex is really the highlight here. Very extensive pool area, lagoons, waterfalls, litlle nooks, pool side bars, jacuzzis, sand, and a gym hidden in the middle of the whole thing. Make sure you get a room facing the pool-side, and not the expanse of mini-malls out front. The other recreation facilities are amazing as well. Both pitch-and-putt and regulations 18 whole golf courses. Impressive equistrian facilities and lots of lovely seculuded trails. The rooms are only average however, but not bad. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “"Wishes Fulfilled"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just retunred from a one week stay with my family which included our two children, ages 14 (boy ) and 12 (girl). We had a terrific time. We we all cooked from a very hectic work, school, blah, blah, blah,... schedule. The hotel was great. Lots of things to do, great location, very large pool, beautiful grounds, exellent service and overall a great experience. This was not a "Disney" vacation for us, because we wanted to relax, as well as be active, and the hotel offered lots of options. We took advantage of some Disney things as well as other attractions in the greter metro Orlando area. A few years ago we stayed in the park and "did Disney" and we think this experience was just as good, if not better. Would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a perfect location. The staff were first class and so friendly throughout. You can even watch the Disney fireworks from your room! The swimming pool has to be seen - its huge! All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautif tropical atmosphere with an awesome pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't go on enough about how wonderful the pool was. There was so much to do here that you could spend a few days just enjoying the ammenities. The rooms were decorated beautifully and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Still love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed here several times. I have even told friends of mine who work at Disney and live in the area about it and when they stayed they were also very impressed. Mainly there is a lot to do. It is in a great location ... close to Downtown, Disney, restaurants and shopping. There is an awsome pool and lots of on-site activities. The rooms are nice, but nothing fancy ... who needs fancy ... you will not need to be in your room that often. *A special feature about some of the rooms is: you can sit on your little balcony and watch the Disney fireworks go off right out side. This hotel is a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning connected to motion sensors!”
Reviews.Author: sfchris
Reviews.Content: What everyone said about the lobby and the pools are true so I will post a few things I didn't see here before I visited: The air conditioning at this Hyatt uses motion sensors. If it doesn't sense any motion after some time it stops cooling the room. This means that the room is blazing hot when you come back after a long day out. I can live with that. But at night, if you like your room to be cool like I do (eg 67 or 68) you are out of luck. It will only turn on when you toss and turn and in my case it never managed to get below 71. However if you complain they will send someone up to disable the sensor. I suggest you do that on the first day if you like to sleep in a cool room. Another oddity: they won't let pizza guys deliver to the hotel. You have to pay a valet to go get the pizza for you at the security gate a quarter mile away. Therefore, most pizza places won't even deliver there due to the hassle. If you complain they say that it is a 9/11 security thing, but the security gate is just a formality for anyone except for the poor pizza guys -- they just wave everyone through. Sounds like a case of them protecting their profits. This wouldn't be a problem for me except their late late night room service menu leaves a lot to be desired. No pizza after 1 am for example. The hot tubs in the caves that run 24 hours are amazing adult entertainment. After reading the reviews here I chuckled at all the people who called them "heated pools". They are elongated jacuzzis that seat 12. VERY nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this outstanding resort....Will definately return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ginano1
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay through Priceline ($105 .... others had gotten it for less) due to a late afternoon arrival and got this resort. What a steal. I wished I had booked several days. I expected a less than perfect experience since I wasn't paying the rack rate. Additionally, with Priceline you are only guaranteed accommodations for 2 adults but I was traveling with my spouse and 2 children. This resort was more than happy to fulfill my request for double beds and even provided a rollaway bed (more like an actual twin bed with double mattress), a room with a view of the pool and the Disney fireworks. The room was clean with a good decor. I was offered a free bottle of champagne (My spouse and I don't drink) and the resort fee was waived when I mentioned I was a Hyatt Gold member (free to join). The staff is personable and genuine. All requests were followed up by a call to make sure everything was alright. The grounds are breathtaking (1500 acres) with so many activities (horseback riding, boating, bike riding, basketball, tennis, massages, man-made beach, swimming, jogging trail, and much more. There are several places to eat on site as well as many places to eat close by. We hated to leave, especially my children. We are already planning a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tworabbitz
Reviews.Content: Had a lot of fun at this hotel. The outdoor area was the biggest highlight. The pool area was fantastic and it's open around the clock!!!!! Big pools with waterslides, smaller warmer pools, waterfalls, hidden jacuzzis in the caves (hot and fantastic). There was a beach, hammocks in the shade, volleyball court, free bike and kayak rentals (there was a sizeable pond beside the pool area.) My favorite part of my stay at this hotel were the several "jogging paths" on the property, namely the short, 1 mile hike that wound around the pond and the small pitch and putt golf course. Plus, there's a 1 mile loop boardwalk that winds through lush and dense forest, maintained by the Audubon Society. The bird song and sense of tranquility was a huge highlight of my quick trip to Orlando. I barely saw a soul on my entire walk that afternoon - very peaceful. The room I stayed in was large, had a nice view of the greenery, and was well appointed. The bathroom was huge and also very well appointed. Downsides: I didn't know the cost for the mini bar items so I was scared to take anything. the ice machine on my floor was not working. I think the walls are pretty thin - I heard a lot of loud voices next door at about 3AM. And the hotel and property was so immense I kept getting lost....so ask for a map when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Hyatt Grand Cypress in Orlando. Out of all the Hotels in the area including the Disney Hotels, this one is at the top of my list! The moment I stepped out of my taxi the wonderful service started. The front desk was very welcoming and took care of my every need, from a very early check in to an outstanding room. The lobby is breathtaking. The scent of the rooms are like stepping into a spring garden. The beds are so cozy and comfortable. The amenities are top notch. Then, you step out to see the pool. Words and pictures cannot even describe it. The caves, waterfalls, slides, and a suspension bridge are unbelievable. There are great hammocks along the beach of the lake that entice you to try it out. There are beautiful trails throughout the property that make you want to take a stroll. The restaurants are Great! The whole complex was extremely spotless! I will definately recommend and stay here again! Only 1 Major downfall. The ice chilling temperature of the pool. It is a shame to not see guests really enjoy the pool. There was only 4 brave souls in the pool over the 2 day period I was there. Only one little section is heated. I surely hope that they consider heating the rest of the pool. When I was there in late April the pool was 61 degrees.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Gold Passport made it possible :)”
Reviews.Author: agness!
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this Hyatt within the past year, so I'm trying to remember different things from our last trip. Since we are Diamond members of the Hyatt's frequent stay program - "Gold Passport", we were able to stay right on the Regency Club level(11th floor). By the way, if you haven't enrolled in Gold Passport and travel quite a bit, think about it...Hyatt always seems to have some great promotions going on for folks to earn free nights or to build up points to use however they like. Anyway, the RC lounge had a hearty continental breakfast in the morning, throughout the day light snacks including brewed Starbucks coffee were offered, then during the evening hours they had hors d'oeuvres plus liquid refreshments. The Regency Club concierges were wonderful, the waitstaff were all nice and every single person that we had contact with, from the valet to the bellhop to the housekeepers were all top-notch. I was very impressed by every Hyatt employee I had contact with. One thing I noticed this time was that the housekeepers were very security conscious. Have you ever noticed at many hotels how some maids leave multiple room doors open at one time? Well, not here...they service one room at a time, with a notice on the door stating that room access is restricted and they are in the room being serviced. We also had turn-down service every night, complete with chocolates and a rose :)...I think this might be because we were staying on the actual Regency Club level this time. We were celebrating an anniversary so our 'special' meal was the Sunday Brunch Buffet at La Coquina...it was great. Pricey(about $55 each?), but included all your coffee, tea, orange juice, soft drinks... and (best of all)unlimited Moet champagne! The food offerings included four kinds of caviar, a cheese table with exotic choices, sushi offerings, fruit (including raspberries, blueberries, strawberries), several superb hot entrees prepared to order, an extensive dessert table(if you like truffles, you'll be in heaven!) plus so many more delicious choices I can't possibly remember... There is only one thing that wasn't perfection...the ongoing road construction on SR535 and on Vista Way(? - I'm not sure of the name, but it's the road that you access the Hyatt from...sorry) is still that...*ongoing*. The wait to turn off of 535 onto "Vista"(?) can be several lights long, plus the road construction outside the Hyatt entrance still has that road torn up. The road construction is not a dealbreaker...just something to keep in mind, especially if you have a rental car. I'm sure that once all the construction is finished that easy access will be restored. Make sure you make the time to tour the grounds. The artworks sprinkled throughout the resort, both indoors and out, are beautiful and the plantings could have come straight off of a magazine cover. If folks like orchids, this is the place to see them - I have never seen so many gorgeous orchids. They have programs for kids, plus the resort fee includes practically *all* the activities - health club with free weights/machines/nice facilities, canoeing, kayaking, paddleboats, bikes, surrey bikes, room coffee service, sailboating, daily newspaper, Executive pitch 'n' putt golf, shuttle bus service...practically the only things the resort fee doesn't include are the championship golf courses(including one that was designed by Jack Nicklaus!) and horseback riding. I can't say enough good things about the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress Orlando. I think it is suitable for almost everybody (with the probable exceptions of folks travelling on tight budgets). Families - with teenagers *or* younger kids, business travellers, couples looking for romantic getaways... We don't normally stay off-site when we visit WDW, but if we do? We'll gladly go back to this resort :).

Reviews.Title: “Family getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a medical conference at the Hilton Walt Disney World but decided to try the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress after reading many reviews from this website. I got a fourth night free special through Expedia which made the per night rate more reasonable. The conference turned into more of a family vacation, which was great! Firstly, the hotel is very close to WDW (literally around the corner from Downtown Disney) which is important because the two kids are 6 and 8 years old. We arrived late at night, but the atrium was grand and very well lit. My daughter asked if we were back at the Hyatt Regency Maui because this atrium reminded her of the one in Hawaii. Check in was simple and quick. The room with two double beds was comfortable for our family of four, not spacious like the Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton, but comfortable enough. Secondly, the grounds are beautifully manicured and vast as they have 1500 acres, so there is some walking involved which we did not mind. Our room view overlooked the pool area, and we could see most of the WDW parks. (The fireworks shows did NOT intrude into the room.) As indicated with most of the other reviews, the larger and more beautiful pool was cold, between 66-70 degrees while we were there, but the smaller pool was a comfortable 85 degrees and had ample room for my two kids. The temperature of the larger pool would probably warm up in the heat and humidity of summertime in central Florida. Use of bicycles and paddle boats were complimentary. Thirdly, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We had toiletries brought to us within minutes of calling. Elevator wait time was not that bad at all considering there was a large conference full of people from GE, but I did not feel that they really intruded upon us. Now for a few negatives... 1. Two room lights were not working upon our arrival (they were not plugged in). 2. The in room internet connection did not work well, but we were too busy spending time as a family anyways. A business traveler might feel differently. 3. I did NOT get a chance to experience any of the Jack Nicklaus golf courses. 4. There was some road construction at the major intersection outside of the resort. 5. Price... if anyone has to complain about the price, then stay at a lesser place. Overall, this was a positive experience, and I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “So-so as a convention center”
Reviews.Author: Xybek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention. Rooms were about $200 per night which seems good for this site. When booking, answers were very confused: Multiple calls to the desk for convention rates ranged from "absolutely no rooms left", "only $300 rooms left", "partial day rooms", to finally - "plenty of rooms at the convention price". Depending on who was reached. I had been about to give up when a co-worker called and said he got the 'good' rate immediately after I'd been told there were absolutely no rooms. We did a conference call back and sure enough this person said there were rooms. "Very Weird". Check-in and out was generally not a good experience compared to other hotels, and was surprising for a five start resort. There was a problem with the corporate billing which could have been easily resolved during the week, but was left until final checkout. The staff seem generally not "customer oriented". No mention of the problem was mentioned during other calls to the desk. I did not note any staff unfriendlyness, but some seem more interested in taking care of big spenders who are willing to pay over $80 per person for a buffet lunch. The hotel obviously expects to dip deeply into corporate pockets when their employees go to conferences here. Convention food catered by the hotel was AWFUL and made eating off site a desired option. The 'White Horse' bar on site was VERY expensive and had low quality food. Eat somewhere else. Grounds, pool, and lake are beautiful as mentioned by everyone. The rooms are average size but clean, complete with noisy air conditioner and smaller televisions compared to other resorts I've stayed. The entire street in front of the resort is completely torn up, making walking anywhere off property a dangerous and exciting traffic dodging event. The latenight fireworks at nearby Disney are a treat, but noisy enough to wake you up late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt is still "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: longbeack
Reviews.Content: Anybody who would give this hotel a bad rating is probably just miserable! I just got back from spending 7 nights at the Grand Cypress and I and my family, 3 small children, couldn't have been happier. The hotel and grounds were beautiful. The pools and slides were awesome and the activities were great. My children said this was the best vacation they ever had. They swam, boated, explored, and rode bikes all day! Our room was spacious and had great view. The hotel staff could not have been friendlier. For instance, when my 8 year old daughter got a splinter in her foot, the security lady was very caring and later that evening she had cookies and milk sent to our room! It is these little thing that I or my wife children will not forget. From the smores roast to the kayak rides everything was perfect. We ate at Hemingways, and it was awesome. If you have children, request the enclosed room at the restaurant. My children talked about the restaurant and the room for the rest of the trip. We at the Palm Cafe and Pappilon and they were very good. As for the pools, the little pool was heated but it was very big. The larger pool was colder but it had an awesome big waterslide. There were also two large hot tubs and a nice game room. Most of all my wife was happy!!! Thank You Grand Hyatt! I would definitely stay at this hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We always like staying at the Hyatt in Orlando. It is close to the Disney Parks, not far off the highway and not far from Universal and Sea World. It has a convenient location, but once on the large property you really think you are in an isolated area. The hotel lobby has an 18 story atrium with parrots and other birds all around, plenty of landscaping inside and neat glass elevators to watch the view as you go up and down. The pluses with this hotel are: - great pool/recreation area - nice restaurants with great settings - friendly staff - nice rooms (although not large) - great location - high class feel to the hotel - plenty of restaurant options close by within walking distance Some of the negatives: - main pool not heated, only small pool is heated. Temperatures were 64 degrees in the main pool and 88 in the small one. - $14 for valet parking (plus tips) - being an an upper floor can make the trip up or down take a long time on the elevator in the mornings when everyone is leaving - deli/snack bar type restaurant closes at 9 PM - doors in hotel slam shut quite loudly which is tough for light sleepers Overall though we really like the hotel and will always be our first choice when visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel over spring break, March 2005, and we thought the hotel & grounds were beautiful. All the staff were friendly, and our three daughters said they'd only ever want to stay here when we come back to Orlando! We stayed at the Polynesian in the past, and we all thought this was a much nicer place to stay. The big pool was cold, but the smaller pool was heated to 87 degrees, so we could swim in it without ever feeling cold. The surroundings are so pretty with waterfalls etc and my youngest played on beach building sandcastles while the older ones went on bikes and water craft as well as going on the slide in the small pool, which they loved. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: Boston-Girl03
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. While I found the rooms to be rather average for the price, they were clean. There is so much to do at this hotel that it is tempting just to stay there all day. It is secluded enough to give that private feeling but close to main road access. There really isn't anything to do there at night but it is very close by to Downtown Disney. To me, this is a good place to stay if you really have time to enjoy the ammenities. Otherwise, it is a little too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I stayed with my wife and 4 year old daughter while we visited The Magic Kingdom. It was a perfect complement to Disney as you could get away to a quieter upscale hotel that was not overrun with children. The location is convenient to MK and good restraunts. Service was excellent, beautiful grounds and pools, and clean nicely maintained rooms. I thought the health club was a little small, but friendly staff to answer questions about some of the equipment. I would consider staying again- curious about Ritz and JW Marriott as well though.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Grand Cypress is spectacluar, however there's lots of points that let it down. The lobby staff aren't overly friendly, the atmosphere is bland and pretentious and the location is in a distinctly dogdy area. The good points are it's pool area and cafe by the pool. However, the staff are very discourteous.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Hyatt resort”
Reviews.Author: Steviek49
Reviews.Content: Took the family on a 7 day Orlando vacation. Spent 2 free nights at the Hawthorn Suites Universal (with Hyatt Gold Points) and spent the last 5 days at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. We are a family of 4 (2 daughters ages 15 and 12) and we liked this resort alot. We booked a Garden View double and was upgraded to a pool/lake view room. The patio door was not air tight (they that happened to alot of patio doors during the hurricanes) and they offered another room or someone can tape it shut and quiet. Because we were already unpacked we chose to stay. The lobby is beautiful complete with parrots , Christmas Tree, Big Monorah, sliding elevators in a beautiful high atrium. The grounds were also quite stunning. The weather was pretty cool this holiday season - mostly in the 60s and low 70s with cool winds so we were not able to use the pools as much as we liked. But the huge pool was unheated so we swam in the heated smaller pool with a smaller slide and used the jucuzzi's as well. The $13pd resort fee covered the pools/newspaper/shuttle service to the parks (universal too) and boats (sail, peddle, kayak, aqua, ) and bikes and family bikes for 4 as well as mini golf-what a deal! Self parking was free. In sum I recommend this beautiful resort if you are staying in the Orlando area but don't want to be on the Disney Properties or the 3 resorts at Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds. Not many families. Expensive. Cold pool.”
Reviews.Author: FunToReview1
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my daughter saved for 3 years to spoil ourselves with a really nice Orlando vacation. We picked this hotel because of the great reviews here and because it had the most awesome pool. We arrived Dec 2 and stayed until the 9th. Our arrival had us with our mouths agape. We walked into the atrium lobby in the evening and it was so unbelievably gorgeous! An 18 story atrium lobby with palm trees, poinsettias, and a huge Christmas tree all lit up. It was magical. Check in was speedy. We had a great bellman who took us to our room and showed my 9 year old daughter the sights you can see from the hall windows including MK. She was mostly excited about the pool which looked totally awesome at night. In the morning, the first thing we noticed was that we seemed to be the only family there on vacation. This hotel is a convention center so there were convention people (mostly men) everywhere and dressed in business casual or suits. We had self parked and the shortest way to the parking lot was through the convention hall. We felt kind of funny dressed in our "ready for a day at Disney" attire which included sneakers, hats and fanny packs. We realized that this place was not as family friendly as we had hoped. We wanted a place that wasn't overloaded with kids and babies, but this place was nearly all adult. Being a Mom, I was surprised to find out that guest laundry meant, give us your first born and we'll wash your undies. Folding is extra! There was no self service laundry which was something I had counted on since we were staying a whole week. Everything in the hotel is expensive. We ate out on the strip every day and night especially since our child is a picky eater and we didn't want to spend a lot on her meal and have her not eat it. The greatest thing about this hotel is that the grounds are simply amazing. From the lobby to the pool, everywhere you look you see the most beautful landscaping and statues. The pool is an attraction all of its own. It has waterfalls and grottos and bubbly hot tubs. Unfortunately the main pool was simply too cold to swim in even when it was 85 degrees out. The pool temp was only 68 and nobody dared go in. There was a smaller heated pool that my daughter got to swim in, but she was really looking forward to the big pool. That was a big disappointment. So I wouldn't recommend the pool after Sept or Oct. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful especially the bellmen, the wait staff and groundspeople. The desk staff were not as warm and fuzzy. The room was very pretty. You have to like green though! Lighting in the bathroom was a bit dim, but it was very clean and well appointed with a close-up mirror, a scale, full size toiletries, hairdryer and fluffy towels. Very nice. The hotel is right near the entrance to DW. MK and DDD are just a few minutes away. The hotel shuttle didn't run at times we needed so we took our car everywhere we went and paid for parking, so I wouldn't count on the shuttles too much. All in all this place is luxurious and truly beautiful. However, if you are a family planning a vacation, I would recommend a luxury Disney Hotel which has similar amenities but a more family friendly atmosphere. We felt that this place is more for adults and conventioners. Great for a wedding or a honeymoon though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just adored the Hyatt Grand Cypress when we stayed there for our Honeymoon (November 2004). The resort is beautifully and elegantly decorated, from it's sprawling atrium complete with its blooming orchids, parrots, and waterfalls, to it's huge "grotto" style swimming pool and jaccuzzis. Our room was very clean and attractive. Almost all of the staff we encountered were friendly and cheerful. Our only minor complaint was that the express check in was not express AT ALL, it actually took the better part of 15 minutes, and the staff member who happened to be checking us in was rather unfriendly (i.e. did not so much as say "Hi" or even smile when we approached the desk). We definitely plan on staying there again; All in all, a lovely vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Thanksgiving at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: holmes49
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 very pleasant nights at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress over Thanksgiving. High points included the professional and polite staff and the variety of activities offered at the resort. It's one of the few hotels I've ever stayed at where the concern and friendliness of the staff actually seemed genuine. The on-site activities we enjoyed included the great pool, kayaking and canoing on the large manmade lake, and bike riding out to the nature area. The low points were the very expensive food (even a light snack resulted in a major bill) and the frustrating shuttle bus to DisneyWorld. The problem with the shuttle bus is that it takes forever to get to your park unless you happen to be going to the first park on the schedule. It's much easier to just drive to the parks. By the way, the rooms are just fine - our two room suite was very comfortable and well maintained. We would definitely stay at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Cypress-----The Best Non Disney Resort----By far”
Reviews.Author: oagras
Reviews.Content: Im an Orlando resident and had a gift certificate to stay at this hotel over Halloween weekend. Im in the travel industry and have to say this is one of the finest hotels in Orlando. For starters parking is free of charge. Atrium is grand and gorgeous. Live parrots in the lobby are a wonderful addition to the tropical feel of the hotel. Check in was a breeze. We asked for a room facing the pool.....which faced Disney property. We ended up getting a corner room 448, we wanted higher, but since we got a much coveted corner room we did not complain. Room was well laid out and had 2 balconies instead of the normal 1. I must admit room decor does need a little bit of updating, but it was no big deal. For those who like the toiletries in the bathrooms, you will love these, they are almost full sized shampoo, conditioner and bath gel. They definately did not skimp......like those annoying tiny bottles found elsewhere. Pools were fantastic. A bit chilly, but who cares when its 90 degrees out and 90% humidity. Reminded me of the ocean temp in Southern California, you eventually get used to it. The pool grottos were also awesome with waterfalls and hidden whirlpools throughout the pool area. I went to the gym everyday and the facilities were top notch, with a wondeful sauna (seperate men and womens) and steam room to wind down in. Also had a great arcade and plenty of free resort activities to take part in. You pay a $13 resort fee, this includes everything: bike rentals (regular bikes and cool 4 person bikes), paddle boats for the lake, canoes, a sand beach on the lake, hammocks, 3 putt golf, regular award winning golf course(for a fee), horse back riding at their equestrian center, miles of trails and paths for jogging and walking, tennis. Im sure there was much more included in the resort fee but there just wasnt enough time to do it all. Lunch at the hotel restaurant is pricey. We checked the menu and no way were we going to pay $10 for a hotel hamburger. One word of advice is to go to Orlando Ale House right down the street from the hotel........a pleasant walk or very short drive. The Ale House has awesome food, great local reputation, good bar and plenty of sports on TV's. Dinner at Hemingways is supposed to be very good. We didnt get to go there. Sunday Brunch at La Coquina in the looby has the reputation of being the best in Orlando------very pricey. Runs around $60. Overall we would recommend this hotel to anybody and everybody. Couples looking for a romantic getaway(nothing more romantic than drinking wine and watching the fireworks over Disney from your balcony), to families on vacation ( the waterslide alone is enough to keep the kids busy for hours........ It kept me busy for hours. Just remember you will get used to the chilly pool water.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: kferg99
Reviews.Content: Great experience recently at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. Everything was excellent from the friendliness of the staff to the outstanding half-acre pool. There is so much to do on-site. I would highly recommend this resort to those who appreciate a full-service resort. It's great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmoshphere”
Reviews.Author: roxian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress Oct. 5-7 2004. We stayed here the night before and after our visit to Discovery Cove and before heading on to St. Pete for 3 nights. Had a great experience, wish we could have stayed here longer. Everything was very nice. I am very picky about hotel rooms, and I was very happy with this one. The rooms seemed newly renovated. We were upgraded to a pool view room. We did see the fireworks at Disney and Seaworld at 9 pm. It would be very nice if the balconies were big enough for a chair, though. The lobby is pretty. The pools are wonderful, although the big pool is too cold to swim in. The hot tubs and cave areas were all really neat. This is probably the 2nd best pool area I've had the pleasure of visiting. (The number 1 being the Hilton Cancun.) The grounds are very nice and well maintained. The resort fee is a nuisance, but we did get to use a some of the "extras" that other places don't have (for free anyway), such as bikes. They have horses on the grounds. When we were there, the place seemed practically empty, partly due to it's enormous size and partly because of the earlier bad weather. We did get the breakfast buffet included in our "package". It was at the Palms Cafe. It wasn't much of a buffet. Not that the food was bad, but I'm not used to eating breakfast with plastic utensils. It was very, very basic. Not what you would think of as a buffet at all. I think there was actually another buffet in the hotel, which was probably more of what we were expecting. And with the price of rooms there, I would have expected more of a buffet. The self parking was easy. We were considering valet, but when we found the self parking, we were actually happy we didn't get valet. So, the only negative was the Palms "buffet". If you get this buffet included in your room, don't expect much (and don't pay extra for it). Other than that, this hotel is great. Great rooms, great pool, and great property. When I go back to Orlando I will stay here if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Service Through Hurricane Jeanne”
Reviews.Author: Ollie
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our vacation the day before Hurricane Jeanne hit. We were confined to our floor by security guards due to atrium roof tiles blowing off the building, and the electricity was out. We had no breakfast and were not allowed to leave the floor. About two o'clock Sunday afternoon they ushered guests down the service stairs to the bottom floor of the hotel and served a hot meal. I was a bit disappointed with the delay in providing services, since this was the second hurricane to hit the hotel in weeks. We were still charged for a rice-krispie treat from the mini-bar, which seemed kind of cheesy. Once the weather cleared we spend the better part of a week at Grand Cypress Golf Course. If you're a golfer, this is the place to go. Forget Disney! In spite of the hurricane the course was in excellent shape. The pro shop employees, starters, etc. were polite and attentive. We ate lunch at the clubhouse and the meal was wonderful, the waiter was good humored and prompt. I loved everything about the golf experience at Grand Cypress. We spent most of our week dining at the clubhouse or at the Hyatt restaurants. My only complaint about the whole week was problems we had with the employees hosting the restaurants. We specifically asked the dining room hostess for a window seat two days in a row and she sat us away from the window both times (both times there were empty tables ) we finally got up and moved and she was quite perturbed. Gave us the look. We also had a bad experience in Hemmingways when a host sat a party of eight at a table for four in right in back of us. Sounds a little petty, but they get all the money for the meals and you expect a little atmosphere. I can't say enough about the bellmen, they are always smiling and ready and willing to help. I would definately recommend this hotel, hopefully management will notice the host and hostess' snubbing the customers and they will be gone before you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was SO!!!!!!! incredible!!!! My mom and dad brought my brother and I here for the summer!!! It was better than what I thought it would be!!!!! The ambiance of the rooms... The spectacular views of the lake, or the beach, just exquisite!!!!! the hotel workers are just so!!!!!!! nice!!!!!! They treat you like royalty!!!!! and the pool!!!!! I couldn't resist my self!!!!!! it is so!!!!! big!!!!!!! 1 acre for a pool!!!!! just a pool!!!!! so many activities going on!!!!!! horse back riding, tennis, swimming, swimming (on the beach) golf!!!!!! so beautiful!!!!!!!! There are much more!!!!!!!!!! All I can say is BEAUTIFUL !!!!!!!! and I am going to make sure no matter what, I will come back!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited from Aug 26-30, 2004. This is perhaps the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at and would highly reccomend it to anyone. Overall I was pleased with no major complaints. Great location, close to Disney. Upon check-in we were offered a complimentary glass of orange juice or wine. Beautiful, tropical, open-aired lobby with glass elevators and Parrots that great you. The pool area was like a huge oasis paradise, and it is open 24 hours which is almost unheard of. The pool is unlike any other I have ever seen, complete with caves, waterfalls, slides, and hidden jacuzzis. The room was clean, with a well stocked mini-bar. We didn't hear any racket from the neighbors and the housekeeping was excellent. High quality soap and shampoo/conditioner in bathroom. TV had a wide selection of pay per view movies. The entire staff was super friendly. CONS: Welcome to Orlando, everything in this super hotel is super expensive, including the valet service (which we did use once before we realized the parking was not that far away). The mini-bar in the room was a bit on the high side, but it was reasonable. What isn't reasonable is the $15 a day resort fee and $2.50 for a bottled water in a hotel cafe. While the hotel was beautiful, and the room was nice, the room was kind of small and average, it would have been nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room (there was none). The balcony was nice, but very small and nowhere or room to sit. Conclusion: This hotel is worth the money if you plan on using the pool or other resort amenities, otherwise I would stay somewhere with a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Radler
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the final four days of our vacation from 16-19 August 2004. Everything about the hotel was fantastic from the complimentary champagne at reception to the magnificent resort grounds and pools. We had a wonderful time and would return anytime. It is clear that you are staying at a top class resort as everything is maintained to a high standard and the staff look after your every need. We would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Superb holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as an alternative to Disney for a 2 week stay during the first two weeks of August 2004. After booking, we looked at the reviews on Tripadvisor and whilst impressed with the overall ratings were very nearly put off by the various comments on the pool temperature as we intended spending time in and around the pool. We decided to go ahead and enjoyed a superb two weeks at the hotel. There was no problem with the pool which was as good as the brochure suggests; the grounds are fantastic and the location excellent. Every member of the staff was very friendly and courteous and went the extra mile to make the stay enjoyable from the very minute we arrived and booked in to checking out. During our stay Hurricane Charley hit Orlando; this was again superbly handled by the hotel and again the staff worked very hard to ensure guests still received the best possible level of servce and friendliness during a very difficult time going on until after midnight. Restaurant prices are expensive but good deli type food is available at reasonable prices in the Palm Cafe. We would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a quality hotel and holiday experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch but spendy!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuf72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family the end of May. The rooms were clean and bright. The grounds were beautiful. The drinks and food are WAY overpriced. $8 for a a drink by the pool. We asked for a fridge in our room and went to the liquor store and bought our own booze! We were going to go to Sunday brunch but the price was $50 per person. No breaks for kids even! No wonder there were Lambrogini's and Ferraris in the parking lot! The small pool was heated but the big pool was not ! No one was in the big pool so the small pool got to be overcrowded and very busy. The kids had a blast on the waterslides. The grotto was neat with hidden hot tubs all around and the exotic birds in the lobby were a nice touch. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hyatt for our honeymoon and it was fantastic! We had chosen the hotel due to many of the excellent reveues we had read on this website and it was just as we had hoped and more... The staff were extremely helpful and any concerns we had were handled in a friendly and prompt manner. The grounds and pool were amazing and very well cared for which made it an excellent escape from the hetic theme parks. The temperature of the pool was perfect and the other facilities such as the hire of the boats and bikes ..ect.. made a welcome change. We dined in Hemingways on my birthday, and although it was on the pricey side, the food was first class and the portions very large! If you love seafood, this is the place! We did not have breakfast at the hotel however because it was extremely expensive with very little choice. Our room was lovely and we had two large windows where we could lie in bed and watch the Disney fireworks on one side and the Seaworld fireworks on the other, great and very romantic! All the parks were very accessible from the hotel and we did manage to walk to Downtown Disney on a couple of occassions but it is quite a trek. All in all we had an amazing time at this immaculate and well run hotel and we will defiantely make a return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “save your money go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I tried talking to management, about my complaints all they did was was offer me a massage or 26 dollars off the 900 I paid. My complaints, no dive in movie on fri or sat., cause the weather was bad, so I really wanted to see one, no they said, not good for employees, no bikes after 7:00 but its not enjoyable til 7:00 cause too hot. No boats of any kind, closed for alliagator problems, no game room, games not fixed til Tuesday and we were leaving early wedsnesday.So we got a driving range my husband used, camp hyatt, for daughter last day, pool wonderful, yet camp hyatt not as fun or good as holiday inn camps no reason to spend the 300 a night all, no suite just regular rooms, I do hope management reads this, though I emailed quality assurance and got not reply, seems to me this hotel is for their employees not for the customers, as they had the nerve to tell me to my face!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My teenage boys requested a "chill day" while in Florida so we stayed here the last day of our vacation. We all loved the expansive pool (pool temperature was fine) and enjoyed the lake recreation. It was nice that the pools were open 24 hours, although the towel hut closes at 8. During the day the towel hut even has sunscreen for you to use! We didn't do Disney but enjoyed watching the fireworks over Epcot and the Magic Kingdom from the hotel (unexpected treat).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on Thursday, July 1, 2004 at 12:15 pm. We booked four nights and paid for three under the Sunshine on Sale Promotion. Our room was ready when we arrived and we were upgraded to a Lake View on the 14th floor. The view was spectacular, we could see all the Disney parks at night and watched the fireworks. The hotel was 5*. The employees were all gracious and friendly, the grounds were immaculate, the food was superb. Will definitely book here again in the future. The location was excellent, close to everything, and the hotel provided shuttles to various points. The resort fee included everything you needed from golf to boats to bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Grounds!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fabulous trip to Orlando! This hotel was amazing... I loved every minute of it. I can't wait to go back. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress June 20-24. Our flight arrived at 5 am and rather than pay an extra day for the hotel... we were allowed to check in at 7:30am. The staff was always very polite and informative. We only spent one day at Disney because this was more of a "stress free" vacation...all four days were basically spent in and around the property. The pool is breath-taking! You will absolutely love it! It goes through a cave and everything.. it's huge!! The rooms here are above average but nothing "wow".. the property and pool are a huge "wow".. so that makes up for it in more ways then one. If you plan on staying at this hotel make sure you plan to spend at least $50 per day/per person. Everything is very expensive... I bought two small latte's and the cost was a wopping $9!! The general store and Palm Cafe are the most resonable places to get food but it gets old after a day or two. Be aware that many of the items in the general store do not have pricing.. find out the price before you rip open that bag of chips! After about 9 or 10 o clock there are no places open to eat...if your really hungry you'll have to eat at Hemmingways or White Horse for about $50/for one meal... or you'll be forced to order room service. Even though there were a few downsides.. this hotel is definitely top notch! I would return in an instant! If your very picky about cleanliness, activities, staff, room service etc... this hotel will indeed meet all of your expectations! I loved feeding the ducks and riding the bikes around the property.. that was so much fun! I would give this hotel 4 1/2 stars out of 5... PS I am extremely picky!! =c)

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hyatt was smack bang in the centre of all the theme parks!! The Grounds and Caves were absolutly beautiful!!! The rooms are spotless and the staff are extremely friendly!! There are buses that take you to your theme park destination and run from early in the morning to the evening!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Grand Cypress, my decision to do so was mostly because of the reviews from this site....... I was not disappointed! Champagne on arrival, the most polite and pleasent staff. The grounds and pools were perfect. It was my partners birthday so I emailed ahead to see what they suggested and we got a free room upgrade and champagne and chocolate strawberries at the delightful Hemmingways Restaurant. If i have a slight critisim it would be that Hemmingways and the White horse are pricey....... But it wouldn't put me off going again and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is top notch. We just stayed there from May 29th to June 2nd. The pool was absolutely gorgeous. I would consider the pool a destination in and of itself. During my stay it was over 100 degrees so we did not feel it was cold. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I played a few rounds of golf and the course I played was well manicured. My wife went horsebackriding and really enjoyed herself. Part of the $13.00 resort fee includes boat rental, mini golf and bike rentals. We enjoyed all of these facilities. The only complaint i have is that the rentals and slides close at 6PM.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the Regency Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel advertised three large pools. However we found that 2 of them were joined together through a series of man made grottos to form 2 huge pools. Unfortunately, neither of these pools were heated, their average temperature during our stay was 65-70F too cold to swim in –not just for us but for everybody else and they were both empty all the time, which left the third and much smaller – but heated pool – crammed with people. Rooms on the Regency Club floor were well decorated. At times the rooms were not made up until about 4pm though. The breakfasts in the Regency Club lounge were not up to standard, consisting of; smoked salmon, boiled egg, onion, tomato, a range of pastries, a couple of types of fruit and a couple of types of cereals. One morning we breakfasted at the Cascades restaurant in the hotel instead, which was much better. In our opinion the Regency Club rooms were not worth the extra money, that we paid for it. Food items provided during the day, were always the same thing; nut selection and cookies and in the evening, a couple of types of Hors D’Ouvres, which should have been better in a 5* hotel. On the good side, everywhere was clean, staff were fairly friendly and helpful, the gardens in the grounds were absolutely beautiful. The views were fantastic – we could see both the Epcot and the Magic Kingdom fireworks, the hotel is in a quiet area, but is perfectly located for visiting the Disney parks and Universal. We would definitely go back again, but we would not have a Regency Club room as we did not think that they were worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel's we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! This really is a beautiful hotel set within beautiful grounds. The pool is amazing, (if a little cold to start with), which is accommpanied by waterfalls, a water slide and three hot tubs. The location could not be better either - near all the major attractions of Orlando and Disney yet you feel that you are as far away from it all when relaxing by the pool at the hotel. It is definitely worth asking for a pool view room on a high floor as the views are breathtaking but be sure to request a room which is not next to conference facilities! This is the only reason for rating the Grand Cypress 4 and not 5 - it would not stop myself and my husband returning though!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just a very beautiful hotel. The lobby is loaded with plants, fountains, and parrots. The pool area is the nicest I have ever seen with a waterfall and lovely landscaping. I agree though with other people that have stayed there. The large pool desperately needs to be heated!!! They have walking/running trails and a large pond with all kinds of birds and fish. The food at Hemmingways is extraordinary!! Expensive but good. The rooms are a bit small as well. The hotel itself is expensive but I loved staying there and plan to again sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is wonderful...Great for kids and adults too. Kids will love the pool with two slides..Bike trails are great..and the horses well who needs Disney with all this..I could go on and on..We have stayed at most all the high end Disney resorts, the Hyatt is our favorite.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress
HotelInfo.Address: One Grand Cypress Boulevard, Orlando, FL 32836
